hebrew_text: שִׁבְעַת יָמִים קוֹדֶם יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מַפְרִישִׁין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מִבֵּיתוֹ לְלִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין. וּמַתְקִינִין לוֹ כֹּהֵן אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו שֶׁמָּא יֶאֱרַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל.
human_translation: Seven days prior to Yom Kippur remove the High Priest, from his house to the Chamber of Parhedrin , And they would designate another priest in his stead lest a disqualification
llm_translation: Seven days before Yom Kippur, they would separate the High Priest from his house to the Chamber of Parhedrin. And they would appoint another priest in his place, lest he become disqualified.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת מַתְקִינִין לוֹ, שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת אִשְׁתּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכִפֶּר בַּעֲדוֹ וּבְעַד בֵּיתוֹ״, ״בֵּיתוֹ״ — זוֹ אִשְׁתּוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: even designate another wife for him lest his wife die, as it is stated “And it will atone for him and for his house” His house, that is his wife. The Rabbis said If so, there is no end to the matter,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even another woman they arrange for him, lest his wife die, as it is stated: "And he shall make atonement for himself and for his household" - "his household" - this is his wife. They said to him: If so, there is no end to the matter.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: שִׁבְעַת יָמִים קוֹדֶם שְׂרֵיפַת הַפָּרָה הָיוּ מַפְרִישִׁין כֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה מִבֵּיתוֹ לַלִּשְׁכָּה שֶׁעַל פְּנֵי הַבִּירָה צָפוֹנָה מִזְרָחָה, וְלִשְׁכַּת בֵּית הָאֶבֶן הָיְתָה נִקְרֵאת. וְלָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָהּ לִשְׁכַּת בֵּית הָאֶבֶן — שֶׁכׇּל מַעֲשֶׂיהָ בִּכְלֵי גְלָלִים, בִּכְלֵי אֲבָנִים, וּבִכְלֵי אֲדָמָה.
human_translation: we learned there, Seven days prior to the burning of the heifer, would remove the priest who burns the heifer from his house to the chamber that was before the bira northeast was called the Chamber of the Stone House. And why was it called the Chamber of the Stone House? because all the actions in dung vessels, stone vessels, and earth vessels,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: We learned there: Seven days before the burning of the cow, the priest who burns the cow would separate from his house to the chamber that is on the north-eastern side of the Temple courtyard, and the chamber of the House of Stone was called. And why was it called by the name "the chamber of the House of Stone"? Because all its utensils were of earthenware, of stone, and of clay. English translation:

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? כֵּיוָן דִּטְבוּל יוֹם כָּשֵׁר בַּפָּרָה, דִּתְנַן: מְטַמְּאִין הָיוּ הַכֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה וּמַטְבִּילִין אוֹתוֹ, לְהוֹצִיא מִלִּבָּן שֶׁל צַדּוּקִין, שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹמְרִים: בִּמְעוֹרְבֵי הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ הָיְתָה נַעֲשֵׂית.
human_translation: What is the reason since immersed that day is fit heifer as we learned They would render the priest who burns the heifer ritually impure and immerse him to remove from the hearts of the Sadducees As would say: Only those for whom the sun set was performed.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Since he immersed during the day, it is valid for the cow, as we learned in a Mishnah: The priests who burn the cow become impure and immerse themselves to remove the influence of the Sadducees, who used to say: "It was done in the twilight of the sun."

hebrew_text: תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ רַבָּנַן: כְּלֵי גְלָלִים, כְּלֵי אֲבָנִים, וּכְלֵי אֲדָמָה — דְּלָא לִיקַבְּלוּ טוּמְאָה, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיזַלְזְלוּ בַּהּ.
human_translation: the Sages instituted dung vessels, stone vessels, and earth vessels, which do not become ritually impure, lest people to treat with contempt
llm_translation: The sages instituted for her: vessels of dung, vessels of stones, and vessels of earth - so that they should not become susceptible to impurity, in order that they should not degrade through them.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא צָפוֹנָה מִזְרָחָה? כֵּיוָן דְּחַטָּאת הִיא, וְחַטָּאת טְעוּנָה צָפוֹנָה. וּכְתִיב בָּהּ: ״אֶל נֹכַח פְּנֵי אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ — תַּקִּינוּ לַהּ רַבָּנַן לִשְׁכָּה צָפוֹנָה מִזְרָחָה, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֶהֱוֵי לַהּ הֶיכֵּירָא.
human_translation: What is different about northeast since it is a sin-offering, a sin-offering north and it is written with regard to before the opening of the Tent of Meeting” the established a chamber in the northeast that will have a distinctive indicator;
llm_translation: What is different about the northern side from the eastern side? Since it is a sin offering, and a sin offering requires the northern side. And it is written about it: "In front of the tent of meeting" — the Sages established for it a chamber on the northern side of the eastern side, so that it would be recognizable to it.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״בִּירָה״? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מָקוֹם הָיָה בְּהַר הַבַּיִת וּ״בִירָה״ שְׁמוֹ. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: כׇּל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ כּוּלּוֹ קָרוּי ״בִּירָה״, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַבִּירָה אֲשֶׁר הֲכִינוֹתִי״.
human_translation: What is bira Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: There was a place on the Temple Mount and its name is bira , And Reish Lakish said: The entire Temple is called bira , as it is stated the bira for which I have made provision”
llm_translation: What is "Bira"? Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: It was a place on the Temple Mount, and its name was "Bira." And Reish Lakish said: The entire Temple is called "Bira," as it is stated: "The Bira that I have prepared."

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב מִנְיוֹמֵי בַּר חִלְקִיָּה אָמַר רַבִּי מַחְסֵיָא בַּר אִידִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה בַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה צִוָּה ה׳ לַעֲשׂוֹת לְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיכֶם״. ״לַעֲשׂוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂי פָרָה, ״לְכַפֵּר״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: From where are these matters Rav Minyomi bar Ḥilkiya said Rabbi Maḥseya bar Idi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said as the verse states: “As has been done this day, so the Lord has commanded to do, to make atonement for you” “To do”; these are the actions the heifer “to make atonement”; these are the actions Yom Kippur,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" Rav said: From the teachings of Bar Chilkiyah. Rabbi Machseya bar Idi said: Rabbi Yochanan said, the verse says: 'As He has done on this day, the Lord has commanded to do to make atonement for you.' 'To do' - these are the actions of the heifer, 'to make atonement' - these are the actions of Yom Kippur."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא, כּוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא בְּפָרָה לֹא מִתּוֹקַם — ״לְכַפֵּר״ כְּתִיב, וּפָרָה לָאו בַּת כַּפָּרָה הִיא. אֶלָּא, אֵימָא כּוּלֵּיהּ קְרָא בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים כְּתִיב!
human_translation: Granted, the entire verse is not established as referring to heifer, “To atone,” is written, and the heifer is not capable of atonement; Rather, say the entire verse is written with regard to Yom Kippur,
llm_translation: In truth, the entire verse regarding the cow is not established - "for atonement" is written, and a cow is not like atonement. Rather, say the entire verse is established on Yom Kippur!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: יָלֵיף ״צִוָּה״ ״צִוָּה״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״צִוָּה ה׳ לַעֲשׂוֹת״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״זֹאת חֻקַּת הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ לֵאמֹר״. מָה לְהַלָּן פָּרָה, אַף כָּאן פָּרָה. וּמָה כָּאן פְּרִישָׁה, אַף לְהַלָּן פְּרִישָׁה.
human_translation: say Derive commanded commanded. It is stated here, “The Lord commanded to do,” and it is stated there, “This is the statute of the Torah that the Lord commanded, saying” Just as there to the heifer, so too here, to the heifer. And just as here, sequestering so too there, sequestering
llm_translation: They said: "Derive 'commanded' from 'commanded.' It is written here: 'The Lord commanded to do,' and it is written there: 'This is the statute of the Torah that the Lord commanded, saying.' Just as there it is a cow, so too here it is a cow. And just as here it is separation, so too there it is separation.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא, ״צִוָּה״ [״צִוָּה״] דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַשׂ כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳ אֶת מֹשֶׁה״? דָּנִין ״צִוָּה״ דְּלִפְנֵי עֲשִׂיָּה מִ״צִּוָּה״ דְּלִפְנֵי עֲשִׂיָּה, וְאֵין דָּנִין ״צִוָּה״ דִּלְאַחַר עֲשִׂיָּה מִ״צִּוָּה״ דְּלִפְנֵי עֲשִׂיָּה.
human_translation: And say commanded commanded of Yom Kippur, as it is written: and he did as the Lord commanded Moses” One derives commanded that is before performance, from commanded that is before performance and one does not derive commanded that is after performance from commanded that is before performance.
llm_translation: And why? "Commanded" commanded the day of Atonement, as it is written: "And he did as the Lord commanded Moses"? We evaluate "commanded" before the action from "commanded" before the action, and we do not evaluate "commanded" after the action from "commanded" before the action.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא ״צִוָּה״ דְּקׇרְבָּנוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּיוֹם צַוֹּתוֹ אֶת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״? דָּנִין ״צִוָּה״ מִ״צִּוָּה״ וְאֵין דָּנִין ״צַוֹּתוֹ״ מִ״צִּוָּה״.
human_translation: And say commanded offerings, as it is written: “On the day that He commanded [ tzavoto ] the children of Israel One derives commanded from commanded, and one does not derive that he commanded [ tzavoto ] from commanded [ tziva ].
llm_translation: And why "commanded" regarding offerings, as it is written: "On the day that He commanded the children of Israel"? We derive "commanded" from "commanded," but we do not derive "His command" from "commanded."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ? וְהָתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״וְשָׁב הַכֹּהֵן״ ״וּבָא הַכֹּהֵן״, זוֹ הִיא ״שִׁיבָה״, זוֹ הִיא ״בִּיאָה״!
human_translation: What is the practical difference Didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach “And the priest shall return [ veshav ]” “And the priest shall come [ uva ]” this is returning, this is coming,
llm_translation: And what is derived from it? And the teaching of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "And the priest shall return" "and the priest shall come," this is "returning," this is "coming"!

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי, הֵיכָא דְּלֵיכָּא דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ. אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ — מִדְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: This applies where there are no that are identical to it; however, where there are terms that are identical to it, we derive from that are identical to it,
llm_translation: These matters, where there is no blood like it. But where there is blood like it - we may infer from the blood.

hebrew_text: ״לְכַפֵּר״ אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. וְאֵימָא כַּפָּרָה דְּקׇרְבָּנוֹת!
human_translation: “to make atonement,” These are the actions Yom Kippur. And say the atonement of offerings
llm_translation: "To atone" - these are the actions of Yom Kippur. But why not say it is the atonement of sacrifices!

hebrew_text: מִי יָדְעִינַן הֵי כֹּהֵן מִתְרְמֵי, דְּבָעֵי לֵיהּ פְּרִישָׁה? אָמְרִי, אַלְּמָה לָא?! נִיבְעֵי לֵיהּ פְּרִישָׁה לְכוּלֵּיהּ מִשְׁמֶרֶת בֵּית אָב! דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁקָּבוּעַ לוֹ זְמַן מִדָּבָר שֶׁקָּבוּעַ לוֹ זְמַן, לְאַפּוֹקֵי קׇרְבָּנוֹת, דְּכׇל יוֹמָא אִיתַנְהוּ.
human_translation: Do we know which priest will happen who require sequestering? say: Why not? We could require sequestering for the entire patrilineal family of the watch We derive a matter that has a fixed time from a matter that has a fixed time, to the exclusion of offerings that are every day.
llm_translation: Who knows if a Kohen from the descendants of Terumah, who requires separation, should we separate him? They said, why not?! We separate him for all the shifts of the Temple service! We judge a matter that has a fixed time against a matter that has a fixed time, to enable the offering of sacrifices, for every day they are brought.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא רְגָלִים! דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁנּוֹהֵג פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה מִדָּבָר הַנּוֹהֵג פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה, לְאַפּוֹקֵי רְגָלִים, דְּלָאו פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And say Festivals, We derive a matter that is performed once a year, from a matter that is performed once a year, to the exclusion of Festivals, which is not once a year;
llm_translation: And why mention feet! We judge a matter that occurs once a year from a matter that occurs once a year, to exclude feet, for they are not considered once a year.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא רֶגֶל אֶחָד! וְכִי תֵּימָא: לָא יָדְעִינַן הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ, אִי חַג הַמַּצּוֹת, הוֹאִיל וּפָתַח בּוֹ הַכָּתוּב תְּחִלָּה, אִי חַג הַסּוּכּוֹת, הוֹאִיל וּמְרוּבָּה מִצְוָתוֹ!
human_translation: And say one Festival And if you say: We do not know which of them Passover, with which the verse opened, or Sukkot , since its mitzva numerous
llm_translation: And why not one foot! And if you will say: we do not know which one, if it is the Festival of Matzot, since the Scripture begins with it first, or if it is the Festival of Sukkot, since its commandments are more numerous!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דָּנִין פְּרִישַׁת שִׁבְעָה לְיוֹם אֶחָד, מִפְּרִישַׁת שִׁבְעָה לְיוֹם אֶחָד. וְאֵין דָּנִין פְּרִישַׁת שִׁבְעָה לְשִׁבְעָה, מִפְּרִישַׁת שִׁבְעָה לְיוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: Rather, One derives sequestering for seven days for one day, from sequestering for seven days for one day, And one does not derive sequestering for seven days for seven from sequestering for seven days for one day,
llm_translation: Rather: one judges the separation of seven for one day, from the separation of seven for one day. And one does not judge the separation of seven for seven, from the separation of seven for one day.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא שְׁמִינִי, דִּפְרִישַׁת שִׁבְעָה לְיוֹם אֶחָד הוּא! דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין קְדוּשָּׁה לְפָנָיו מִדָּבָר שֶׁאֵין קְדוּשָּׁה לְפָנָיו, וְאֵין דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ קְדוּשָּׁה לְפָנָיו מִדָּבָר שֶׁאֵין קְדוּשָּׁה לְפָנָיו.
human_translation: And say Eighth sequestering for seven days for one day. One derives a matter before which there is not sanctity, from a matter before which there is not sanctity, And we do not derive a matter before which there is sanctity, from a matter before which there is not sanctity.
llm_translation: And why not the eighth, for separating seven for one day is it! We judge a matter that has sanctity before it from a matter that does not have sanctity before it, and we do not judge a matter that has sanctity before it from a matter that does not have sanctity before it.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא? הַשְׁתָּא דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין קְדוּשָּׁה לְפָנָיו בָּעֵי פְּרִישָׁה, דָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ קְדוּשָּׁה לְפָנָיו — לָא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן! אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: לָא, ״הַזֶּה״ כְּתִיב: כָּזֶה.
human_translation: And is it not an a fortiori inference? Now, a matter before which there is not sanctity requires sequestering, a matter before which there is sanctity, all the more so not Rav Mesharshiyya said No, this is written like this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is it not a fortiori reasoning? Now, a matter that does not require separation in the presence of holiness, certainly a matter that does require separation in its presence! Rav Mesharshaya said: No, 'this' is written: 'like this.'" English translation: "And is it not a fortiori reasoning? Now, a matter that does not require separation in the presence of holiness, certainly a matter that does require separation in its presence! Rav Mesharshaya said: No, 'this' is written: 'like this.'"

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דְּעִיקַּר רֶגֶל לָא בָּעֵי פְּרִישָׁה, טָפֵל דִּידֵיהּ בָּעֵי פְּרִישָׁה? וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁמִינִי רֶגֶל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ הוּא, הָנֵי מִילֵּי לְעִנְיַן
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: there matter where the primary Festival, does not require sequestering, secondary to it requires sequestering? And even according to the one who said: The Eighth is a Festival in and of itself that applies only to the matter of
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Who has a foot from the essence does not need separation, his own threshold needs separation? And even according to the one who says that the eighth is a separate foot by itself, those words are for the matter.

hebrew_text: פָּזֵ״ר קֶשֶׁ״ב.
human_translation: Peh , zayin , reish , kuf , shin , beit ,
llm_translation: Gold, silver, and copper.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן תַּשְׁלוּמִין, תַּשְׁלוּמִין דְּרִאשׁוֹן הוּא, דְּהָא תְּנַן: מִי שֶׁלֹּא חָג בְּיוֹם טוֹב הָרִאשׁוֹן שֶׁל חַג — חוֹגֵג וְהוֹלֵךְ כָּל הָרֶגֶל כּוּלּוֹ, וְיוֹם טוֹב הָאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁל חַג.
human_translation: However, with regard to compensation it is compensation for first as didn’t we learn One who did not celebrate on the first Festival day celebrate the whole Festival in its entirety, the last Festival day of the festival
llm_translation: But regarding the matter of payments, the payment of the first is, for we learned: One who did not celebrate on the first day of the festival - he may celebrate and observe the entire festival, and the last day of the festival.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא עֲצֶרֶת, דִּפְרִישַׁת שִׁבְעָה לְיוֹם אֶחָד הוּא! אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: דָּנִין פַּר אֶחָד וְאַיִל אֶחָד מִפַּר אֶחָד וְאַיִל אֶחָד, לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֲצֶרֶת דִּשְׁנֵי אֵילִים נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: And say Shavuot , it is sequestering of seven for one day. Rabbi Abba said: one derives one bull and one ram, from one bull and one ram, to the exclusion of Shavuot , they are two rams
llm_translation: And why is Shavuot called "Atzeret"? Because it is the conclusion of seven days in one day! Rabbi Abba said: We judge one ox and one ram from one ox and one ram, to correspond to the Atzeret, which consists of two rams.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אַיִל אֶחָד הוּא, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר שְׁנֵי אֵילִים נִינְהוּ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר! דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אַיִל אֶחָד, הוּא הָאָמוּר כָּאן, הוּא הָאָמוּר בְּחוּמַּשׁ הַפְּקוּדִים. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי אֵילִים הֵם, אֶחָד הָאָמוּר כָּאן, וְאֶחָד הָאָמוּר בְּחוּמַּשׁ הַפְּקוּדִים!
human_translation: This well to the one who said Yom Kippur is one ram; however, to the one who said they are two rams what is there to say? As it was taught Rabbi says: One ram is the one that is mentioned here; it is the one that is mentioned in the book of Numbers: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: They are two rams one mentioned here and one mentioned in the book of Numbers.
llm_translation: The one who says Yom Kippur is one ram, what is there to say to him? Rather, the one who says there are two rams, what is there to say to him! As it was taught: Rabbi says: One ram, that which is stated here, is the same as that which is stated in the Book of Numbers. Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: They are two rams, one that is stated here, and one that is stated in the Book of Numbers!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: הָתָם חַד לְחוֹבַת הַיּוֹם, וְחַד לְמוּסָפִין. לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֲצֶרֶת, דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ חוֹבַת הַיּוֹם נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon, There, one for the obligation of the day, and one additional offerings. to the exclusion of Shavuot , where both are obligations of the day.
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Shimon: There, one for the obligation of the day, and one for the additional offerings. To exclude the Festival of Shavuot, for both of them are considered an obligation of the day.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, דִּפְרִישַׁת שִׁבְעָה לְיוֹם אֶחָד הוּא! אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: דָּנִין פָּר וָאַיִל שֶׁלּוֹ מִפָּר וָאַיִל שֶׁלּוֹ. לְאַפּוֹקֵי עֲצֶרֶת וְרֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה, דְּצִיבּוּר נִינְהוּ. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר ״קַח לְךָ״ — מִשֶּׁלְּךָ,
human_translation: And say Rosh HaShana, as it is sequestering of seven for one day. Rabbi Abbahu said One derives a bull and a ram from his own from a bull and a ram from his own to the exclusion of Shavuot and Rosh HaShana, from community This well to the one who said Take you, from your own
llm_translation: And why is Rosh Hashanah considered the separation of seven days into one day? Rabbi Avahu said: They judge his ox and his ram from his ox and his ram. Regarding the days of assembly and Rosh Hashanah, they are considered communal days. It is left for the one who said, "Take for yourself" — it is considered yours.

hebrew_text: ״עֲשֵׂה לְךָ״ — מִשֶּׁלְּךָ, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Make you, from your own However, to the one who said from communal what is there to say
llm_translation: "Make for yourself" — from yours, rather for whom that said from the community, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״קַח לְךָ״ — מִשֶּׁלְּךָ, וַ״עֲשֵׂה לְךָ״ — מִשֶּׁלְּךָ, ״וְיִקְחוּ אֵלֶיךָ״ — מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: בֵּין ״קַח לְךָ״, בֵּין ״וְיִקְחוּ אֵלֶיךָ״ — מִשֶּׁל צִבּוּר, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״קַח לְךָ״ — כִּבְיָכוֹל מִשֶּׁלְּךָ אֲנִי רוֹצֶה יוֹתֵר מִשֶּׁלָּהֶם.
human_translation: As it was taught Take you, from your own and Make you, from your own And they will bring to you, from community the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya. Rabbi Yonatan says both Take you, and And they will bring to you, from community And what does the verse state: Take you, as it were, I desire from your more than from theirs.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Take for yourself" — from what is yours, and "and make for yourself" — from what is yours, "and they shall take to you" — from what is communal, the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah. Rabbi Yonatan says: Whether "take for yourself" or "and they shall take to you" — it is from what is communal. And what does the Torah mean by saying "take for yourself"? I desire what is yours more than what is theirs.

hebrew_text: אַבָּא חָנָן אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, כָּתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ לְּךָ אֲרוֹן עֵץ״, וְכָתוּב אֶחָד אוֹמֵר: ״וְעָשׂוּ אֲרוֹן עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים״, הָא כֵּיצַד? כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל עוֹשִׂין רְצוֹנוֹ שֶׁל מָקוֹם, כָּאן בִּזְמַן שֶׁאֵין עוֹשִׂין רְצוֹנוֹ שֶׁל מָקוֹם!
human_translation: Abba Ḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Elazar one verse says: “And make you an ark of wood” and one verse says “And they shall make an ark of acacia wood” How this Here, to a time when the Jewish people perform the will of God There, to a time when the Jewish people do not perform the will of God,
llm_translation: Abba Hanan said in the name of Rabbi Elazar, it is written: "And you shall make for yourself an ark of wood," and it is written: "And they shall make an ark of acacia wood." How so? Here, when Israel does the will of the Omnipresent, and here, when they do not do the will of the Omnipresent!

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא בְּקִיחוֹת דְּעָלְמָא וַעֲשִׂיּוֹת דְּעָלְמָא. קִיחוֹת דְּעָלְמָא — ״קַח לְךָ סַמִּים״. עֲשִׂיּוֹת דְּעָלְמָא — ״עֲשֵׂה לְךָ שְׁתֵּי חֲצוֹצְרוֹת כֶּסֶף״. אֲבָל הָנָךְ פָּרוֹשֵׁי קָא מְפָרֵשׁ דְּמִשֶּׁלְּךָ הוּא. בְּמִלּוּאִים מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב: ״וְאֶל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל תְּדַבֵּר לֵאמֹר קְחוּ שְׂעִיר עִזִּים לְחַטָּאת״. ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל אַהֲרֹן קַח לְךָ עֵגֶל בֶּן בָּקָר לְחַטָּאת״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: ״קַח לְךָ״ — מִשֶּׁלְּךָ הוּא.
human_translation: They disagree only with regard to taking in general and making in general: taking in general “Take you spices” making in general “Make you two silver trumpets” However, these the verses explicitly from your own With regard to inauguration, now, since it is written: “And to the children of you will speak, saying: Take a goat kid for a sin-offering “And he said to Aaron: Take you a young calf for a sin-offering” why do I Learn from it Take you, from your own
llm_translation: Until here they do not argue except regarding acquisitions of the world and actions of the world. Acquisitions of the world - "Take for yourself spices." Actions of the world - "Make for yourself two silver trumpets." But here the Pharisees explain that it is a parable for you. With fulfillments as it is written: "And to the children of Israel you shall speak, saying, 'Take a he-goat for a sin offering.'" "And he said to Aaron, 'Take for yourself a calf of the herd for a sin offering.'" Why do I need it? Learn from it: "Take for yourself" - it is yours.

hebrew_text: בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב: ״בְּזֹאת יָבֹא אַהֲרֹן אֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ בְּפַר בֶּן בָּקָר לְחַטָּאת וְגוֹ׳ ... וּמֵאֵת עֲדַת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל יִקַּח שְׁנֵי שְׂעִירֵי עִזִּים לְחַטָּאת״. ״וְהִקְרִיב אֶת פַּר הַחַטָּאת אֲשֶׁר לוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַאי ״לוֹ״ — מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא.
human_translation: with regard to Yom Kippur, now, since it is written: “With this Aaron will come into the Sanctuary, with a young bull for a sin-offering “And from the congregation of the children of Israel he will take two goat kids for a sin-offering and will offer his young bull as a sin-offering” why do I Learn from it this His, is from his own
llm_translation: On the Day of Atonement, as it is written: "With this shall Aaron come into the Holy Place: with a young bullock for a sin offering..." And from the congregation of the children of Israel he shall take two he-goats for a sin offering. "And he shall offer the bullock of the sin offering, which is for himself." Why do I need "for himself"? Learn from it: This "for himself" - it is from his own.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: דָּנִין פַּר לְחַטָּאת וְאַיִל לְעוֹלָה מִפַּר לְחַטָּאת וְאַיִל לְעוֹלָה, לְאַפּוֹקֵי רֹאשׁ הַשָּׁנָה וַעֲצֶרֶת — דְּתַרְוַיְיהוּ עוֹלוֹת נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi stated One derives bull for a sin-offering and ram for a burnt-offering from bull for a sin-offering and ram for a burnt-offering to the exclusion of Rosh HaShana and Shavuot , on which both of them, are burnt-offerings.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: We evaluate a bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering. From a bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, for the purpose of Rosh Hashanah and Shavuot - they are both burnt offerings.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: דָּנִין עֲבוֹדָה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל מֵעֲבוֹדָה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, לְאַפּוֹקֵי כּוּלְּהוּ קוּשְׁיָיתִין — דְּלָאו עֲבוֹדָה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: Ravina stated One derives service by the High Priest, from service by the High Priest, to the exclusion of all the difficulties as they are not service by the High Priest;
llm_translation: Ravinah said: We judge the service of the High Priest against the service of the High Priest, to eliminate all difficulties - for they are not considered service of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי אָמַר רָבִינָא: דָּנִין עֲבוֹדָה תְּחִלָּה מֵעֲבוֹדָה תְּחִלָּה, לְאַפּוֹקֵי הָנֵי — דְּלָאו תְּחִלָּה נִינְהוּ. מַאי תְּחִלָּה? אִילֵּימָא תְּחִלָּה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — הַיְינוּ קַמַּיְיתָא. אֶלָּא, עֲבוֹדָה תְּחִלָּה בַּמָּקוֹם מֵעֲבוֹדָה תְּחִלָּה בַּמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: And some say Ravina said: One derives initial service from an initial service, to the exclusion of all these that are not initial What initial If we say initial means by the High Priest; that is the first Rather, the initial service in the place, from the initial service in the place,
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Ravina said: We judge the beginning of the service from the beginning of the service, to exclude those - for they are not considered the beginning. What is the beginning? If you say the beginning with the High Priest - that is the first. Rather, the service begins in the place of the beginning of the service in the place.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַתְנֵי חֲדָא, [רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי] מַתְנֵי תַּרְתֵּי. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַתְנֵי חֲדָא: ״לַעֲשׂוֹת לְכַפֵּר״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. [וִיהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי] מַתְנֵי תַּרְתֵּי: ״לַעֲשׂוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה פָרָה, ״לְכַפֵּר״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Yoḥanan taught one Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi taught two. Rabbi Yoḥanan taught one: To do, to make atonement; these are the actions Yom Kippur And Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi taught two: To do, these are the actions of the heifer; to atone, these are the actions Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: Rabbi Yochanan teaches one opinion, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi teaches two. Rabbi Yochanan teaches one: "to atone" - these are the actions of Yom Kippur. And Yehoshua ben Levi teaches two: "to do" - these are the actions of the Red Heifer, "to atone" - these are the actions of Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מַתְנֵי חֲדָא? וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן: שִׁבְעַת יָמִים קוֹדֶם יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וְשִׁבְעַת יָמִים קוֹדֶם שְׂרֵיפַת הַפָּרָה! מַעֲלָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan teach one Didn’t we learn Seven days prior to Yom Kippur, Seven days prior to the burning of the heifer, merely a higher standard.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan teaches one opinion? But we have learned: "Seven days before Yom Kippur, and seven days before the burning of the Red Heifer!" This is a general principle.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי מִנְיוֹמֵי בַּר חִלְקִיָּה אָמַר רַבִּי מַחְסֵיָא בַּר אִידֵּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה בַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה צִוָּה ה׳ לַעֲשׂוֹת לְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיכֶם״, ״לַעֲשׂוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה פָרָה, ״לְכַפֵּר״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים! הָהוּא דְּרַבֵּיהּ. דְּכִי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״לַעֲשׂוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה פָרָה, ״לְכַפֵּר״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Minyomi bar Ḥilkiya say Rabbi Maḥseya bar Idi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said “As has been done this day, so the Lord has commanded to do, to make atonement for you” To do, these are the actions of the heifer; to make atonement, these are the actions Yom Kippur? That is of his teacher; As when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: To do, these are the actions of the heifer; to atone, these are the actions Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Rabbi Minyumei Bar Chilkiya said, Rabbi Machseya Bar Iddei said, Rabbi Yochanan said: "As He has done on this day, the Lord has commanded to do to atone for you," "to do" - these are the actions of the heifer, "to atone" - these are the actions of Yom Kippur! That one of his teachers. When Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael: "to do" - these are the actions of the heifer, "to atone" - these are the actions of Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מֵהֵיכָא קָא יָלְפַתְּ לַהּ — מִמִּלּוּאִים, אִי מָה מִלּוּאִים כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן, אַף הָכָא נָמֵי — כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said to Rabbi Yoḥanan: From where did you derive this from inauguration. If so, just as inauguration, all that are written in its invalidates so too here, all that are written in its invalidates
llm_translation: He said to him, Reish Lakish to Rabbi Yochanan: From where do you derive this? — From the "fillings." If the fillings, whatever is written in them, delays in them, so too here — whatever is written in them delays in them.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתְנַן: ״וּמַתְקִינִין לוֹ כֹּהֵן אַחֵר״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״מַפְרִישִׁין״! וְכִי תֵּימָא: מַאי ״מַתְקִינִין״ — ״מַפְרִישִׁין״, לִיתְנֵי אוֹ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי ״מַתְקִינִין״, אוֹ אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי ״מַפְרִישִׁין״.
human_translation: And if you say: Indeed, that didn’t we learn And they would designate another priest in his stead, and it is not taught they remove And if you say What They would designate? They would remove; let teach either this and that They would designate; or this and that They would remove.
llm_translation: And if you will say so, it is stated in the Mishnah: "And they appoint another Kohen for him," and it does not teach "they separate"! And if you will say: What is "appointing" - "separating," let it teach either both "appointing" and "separating," or both "separating."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא מָר מֵהֵיכָא יָלֵיף לַהּ? אָמַר: מִסִּינַי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁכּוֹן כְּבוֹד ה׳ עַל הַר סִינַי וַיְכַסֵּהוּ הֶעָנָן שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, מִכְּדֵי כְּתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״, מַאי ״שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים״? זֶה בָּנָה אָב: שֶׁכׇּל הַנִּכְנָס בְּמַחֲנֵה שְׁכִינָה, טָעוּן פְּרִישַׁת שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: said to Rather, from where do Master, derive said to him: from Sinai, as it is written: “And the glory of the Lord abode upon Mount Sinai and the cloud covered him [ vaykhasehu ] six days, and He called to Moses on the seventh day Now, since it states: “And He called to Moses on the seventh day,” what is six days? These a paradigm, that anyone who enters the camp of the Divine Presence, requires sequestering for six
llm_translation: He said to him: Rather, Master, from where does he derive it? He said: From Sinai, as it is written: "And the glory of the Lord settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days, and He called to Moses on the seventh day." From the fact that it is written: "And He called to Moses on the seventh day," what is the meaning of "six days"? This is to teach that anyone who enters the camp of the Divine Presence requires separation for six days.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אֲנַן שִׁבְעָה תְּנַן! מַתְנִיתִין רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא הִיא, דְּחָיֵישׁ
human_translation: Wasn’t it seven, we learned The mishna is Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira, who is concerned
llm_translation: And here we have seven teachings! This is a Mishnah of Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera, who is concerned.

hebrew_text: לְטוּמְאַת בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: about the ritual impurity of home,
llm_translation: For the impurity of his house.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְדִידִי דְּיָלֵיפְנָא מִמִּלּוּאִים, הַיְינוּ דְּתַנְיָא: זֶה וְזֶה מַזִּין עָלָיו כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִכׇּל חַטָּאוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ שָׁם, דַּהֲוַאי נָמֵי הַזָּאָה בְּמִלּוּאִים. אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ דְּיָלְפַתְּ מִסִּינַי, הַזָּאָה בְּסִינַי מִי הֲוַאי?
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to Reish Lakish: Granted, to my that I derive from inauguration, that which is taught this and that one sprinkles upon him all seven from all sin-offerings that were there that there was also sprinkling during inauguration. However, according to your that you derive it from Sinai, was there sprinkling at Sinai?
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yochanan to Reish Lakish: "Granted according to me who is distinguished in matters of sacrifices, that is what is taught: 'Both this and that atone for him for all seven sins that were there, for he was like a sprinkler in matters of sacrifices.' But according to you who is distinguished in matters of Sinai, who was like a sprinkler in Sinai?"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ מִי נִיחָא? בְּמִלּוּאִים דָּם, הָכָא מַיִם! הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: נִכְנְסוּ מַיִם תַּחַת דָּם. אֶלָּא לְדִידָךְ, הַזָּאָה בְּסִינַי מִי הֲוַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַעֲלָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: said to him: And according to your reasoning, does it well? inauguration, blood; here, water. That is not difficult, as Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Water replaced blood, However, according to your at Sinai, was there sprinkling said to him: merely a higher standard,
llm_translation: He said to him: And according to your reasoning, is it appropriate? In the case of fullers' earth, here it is water! This is not difficult, as Rabbi Chiya taught: Water entered beneath the blood. Rather, according to your opinion, who was fit for the vision at Sinai? He said to him: A clear person in the world.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: ״בְּזֹאת יָבֹא אַהֲרֹן אֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ״, בְּמַה שֶּׁאָמוּר בָּעִנְיָן, מַאי הִיא — בְּעִנְיָן דְּמִלּוּאִים. וּמָה אָמוּר בְּעִנְיָן דְּמִלּוּאִים — אַהֲרֹן פֵּירַשׁ שִׁבְעָה וְשִׁמֵּשׁ יוֹם אֶחָד, וּמֹשֶׁה מָסַר לוֹ כׇּל שִׁבְעָה כְּדֵי לְחַנְּכוֹ בָּעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan and was taught in accordance with Reish Lakish was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: “With this Aaron will come into the Sanctuary, that which is stated in the matter. What is the matter of the inauguration. And what is stated in the matter of inauguration? Aaron withdrew seven and served one day, and Moses transmitted to him all seven in order to train him in the service.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, it was taught in the name of Reish Lakish. It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "With this shall Aaron enter into the holy place." In what context is this said? What is it? - In the context of the fillings. And what is said in the context of the fillings? - Aaron separated seven days and served one day, and Moses handed over to him all seven in order to inaugurate him into the service.

hebrew_text: וְאַף לְדוֹרוֹת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל פּוֹרֵשׁ שִׁבְעָה וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ יוֹם אֶחָד, וּשְׁנֵי תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים מִתַּלְמִידָיו שֶׁל מֹשֶׁה — לְאַפּוֹקֵי צַדּוּקִין, מוֹסְרִין לוֹ כׇּל שִׁבְעָה כְּדֵי לְחַנְּכוֹ בָּעֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: And generations as well, High Priest withdraws seven and serves one day. And two Torah scholars from the students of Moses, to the exclusion of Sadducees, transmit to him all seven in order to train him in the service.
llm_translation: And even for generations, a High Priest who separates for seven days and serves one day, and two disciples of sages from his disciples who are of the students of Moses - to the Sadducees, they hand over to him all seven in order to inaugurate him in the service.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: שִׁבְעַת יָמִים קוֹדֶם יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מַפְרִישִׁין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מִבֵּיתוֹ לְלִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁמַּפְרִישִׁין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, כָּךְ מַפְרִישִׁין כֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה לַלִּשְׁכָּה שֶׁעַל פְּנֵי הַבִּירָה צָפוֹנָה מִזְרָחָה. וְאֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה מַזִּין עָלָיו כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִכׇּל חַטָּאוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ שָׁם.
human_translation: From there said Seven days prior to Yom Kippur remove the High Priest, from his house to the Chamber of Parhedrin ; and just as remove the High Priest, so do they remove the priest who burns the heifer, to the chamber that was before the bira northeast And both this and that one sprinkles upon him, all seven from all the sin-offerings that were there
llm_translation: From here they said: Seven days before the Day of Atonement, they would separate the High Priest from his house to the Chamber of Parhedrin. And just as they would separate the High Priest, so too they would separate the priest who burns the cow to the chamber that is on the north-eastern side of the Temple. And both this one and that one would sprinkle upon him all seven days from all the sins that were there.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תֹּאמַר: בְּמִלּוּאִים דָּם, הָכָא מַיִם, אָמַרְתָּ: נִכְנְסוּ מַיִם תַּחַת דָּם. וְאוֹמֵר ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה בַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה צִוָּה ה׳ לַעֲשׂוֹת לְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיכֶם״. ״לַעֲשׂוֹת״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה פָרָה, ״לְכַפֵּר״ — אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: And if you say inauguration blood, here water, you said: Water replaced blood. And it says “As has been done this day, so the Lord has commanded to do, to make atonement for you” To do, these are the actions of the heifer; to make atonement, these are the actions Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: And if you will say: in the case of fullings it is blood, here it is water, you say: the water entered beneath the blood. And it says, "As He has done on this day, the Lord has commanded to do to make atonement for you." "To do" - these are the actions of the heifer, "to make atonement" - these are the actions of the Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״בְּזֹאת״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ, בְּפַר בֶּן בָּקָר לְחַטָּאת וְאַיִל לְעוֹלָה! אָמְרִי: אִי לְקׇרְבָּן לְחוֹדֵיהּ, לֵימָא קְרָא ״בְּזֶה״ אוֹ ״בְּאֵלֶּה״, מַאי ״בָּזֹאת״ — שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תַּרְתֵּי.
human_translation: But With this [ bezot ], is required for itself; a young bull for a sin-offering and a ram for a burnt-offering. say If only to the offerings, let the verse say: With this [ bezeh ], or: With these [ be’elleh ], What, bezot , Learn from it two
llm_translation: And this "with this" is needed for itself, with a bull of the herd for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering! They said: If for its own offering, let it say "with this" or "with these," what is "with this" - you have heard two from it.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים קַמָּא הוּא דְּבָעֵי פְּרִישָׁה, כִּדְאַשְׁכְּחַן בְּמִלּוּאִים אֲבָל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים דְּעָלְמָא לָא. אִי נָמֵי: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל קַמָּא הוּא דְּבָעֵי פְּרִישָׁה, אֲבָל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּעָלְמָא לָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה וְכוּ׳״.
human_translation: What And it says? And if you say it is the first Yom Kippur that requires sequestering, as we find in inauguration but on Yom Kippur in general, no, alternatively, It is the first High Priest who requires sequestering, but High Priests in general, no, come hear “As has been done
llm_translation: What is "and he shall say"? And if you say: Yom Kippur is the first day that requires separation, as we found in the filling of the hands, but on Yom Kippur itself, it is not so. If you say: It is the High Priest who requires separation, but any High Priest in general does not. Come and hear: "As he did, etc."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מֹשֶׁה עָלָה בֶּעָנָן, וְנִתְכַּסָּה בֶּעָנָן, וְנִתְקַדֵּשׁ בֶּעָנָן, כְּדֵי לְקַבֵּל תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בִּקְדוּשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁכּוֹן כְּבוֹד ה׳ עַל הַר סִינַי״ — זֶה הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה אַחַר עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת, שֶׁהָיוּ תְּחִלָּה לְאַרְבָּעִים יוֹם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Reish Lakish Moses ascended in the cloud, and was covered in the cloud, and was sanctified in the cloud, in order to receive the Torah for the Jewish people in sanctity, as it is stated: “And the glory of the Lord abode upon Mount Sinai This was an incident after the the Ten Commandments were the beginning forty days the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Reish Lakish: Moses ascended in the cloud, and was covered in the cloud, and was sanctified in the cloud, in order to receive the Torah for Israel in holiness, as it is stated: "And the glory of the Lord settled on Mount Sinai" — this was after the giving of the Ten Commandments, which lasted initially for forty days, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיִּשְׁכּוֹן כְּבוֹד ה׳״ — מֵרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: “And the glory of the Lord abode New Moon
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: "And the glory of the Lord shall dwell" - from Rosh Chodesh.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְכַסֵּהוּ הֶעָנָן״, לָהָר. ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה״ — [מֹשֶׁה] וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹמְדִין, וְלֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לַחְלֹק כָּבוֹד לְמֹשֶׁה. רַבִּי נָתָן אוֹמֵר: לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לְמָרֵק אֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה שֶׁבְּמֵעָיו, לְשׂוּמוֹ כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת.
human_translation: “And the cloud covered him,” the mountain, “And He called to Moses”; Moses and all of the Jewish people were standing The verse comes only to accord deference to Moses, Rabbi Natan says: rather, the verse comes only to cleanse the food and drink that was in his intestines, to render him like the ministering angels
llm_translation: "And the cloud covered it," to the mountain. "And He called to Moses" — Moses and all Israel standing, and the verse came only to give honor to Moses. Rabbi Nathan says: The verse came only to facilitate digestion and drinking in his stomach, to make him like the ministering angels.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶּן חָרָשׁ אוֹמֵר: לֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לְאַיֵּים עָלָיו, כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא תּוֹרָה נִיתֶּנֶת בְּאֵימָה, בִּרְתֵת וּבְזִיעַ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עִבְדוּ אֶת ה׳ בְּיִרְאָה וְגִילוּ בִּרְעָדָה״. מַאי ״וְגִילוּ בִּרְעָדָה״? אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר מַתְנָה אָמַר רַב: בִּמְקוֹם גִּילָה שָׁם תְּהֵא רְעָדָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash says: The verse comes only to intimidate so that the Torah would be delivered with reverence, with quaking and with trembling, as it is stated: “Serve the Lord with awe, and rejoice with trembling” What “and rejoice with trembling”? Rav Adda bar Mattana said Rav said: Where there is joy of there will be trembling there.
llm_translation: Rabbi Matya ben Charash says: The Scripture came only to threaten him, so that the Torah should be given with awe, with trembling and with sweat, as it is said: "Serve the Lord with fear and rejoice with trembling." What is meant by "and rejoice with trembling"? Rav Adda bar Matna said in the name of Rav: In the place of rejoicing, there should be trembling.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: בְּשִׁשָּׁה בַּחוֹדֶשׁ נִיתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בּוֹ. מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה: בְּשִׁשָּׁה נִיתְּנָה, וּבְשִׁבְעָה עָלָה (דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״). מַאן דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁבְעָה: בְּשִׁבְעָה נִיתְּנָה, וּבְשִׁבְעָה עָלָה, [דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״].
human_translation: what do Rabbi Yosei HaGelili and Rabbi Akiva disagree? to the dispute between these tanna’im , as it was taught On the sixth of the month the Torah, was given to the Jewish people. Rabbi Yosei says: on the seventh of one who said on the sixth, was given on the sixth, and on the seventh ascended as it is written: “And He called to Moses on the seventh day” one who said on the seventh it was given on the seventh and Moses ascended on the seventh, as it is written: “And he called to Moses on the seventh day.”
llm_translation: In what do Rabbi Yosei the Galilean and Rabbi Akiva disagree? In the dispute of those Tannaim, as it is taught: "On the sixth day of the month the Torah was given to the Israelites," Rabbi Yosei says: "On the seventh day." Whoever says on the sixth: On the sixth it was given, and on the seventh it ascended (as it is written: "And He called to Moses on the seventh day"). Whoever says on the seventh: On the seventh it was given, and on the seventh it ascended (as it is written: "And He called to Moses on the seventh day").

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר לַהּ כְּתַנָּא קַמָּא, דְּאָמַר בְּשִׁשָּׁה בַּחוֹדֶשׁ נִיתְּנָה תּוֹרָה, הִלְכָּךְ זֶה הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה אַחַר עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת. ״וַיִּשְׁכּוֹן כְּבוֹד ה׳ עַל הַר סִינַי וַיְכַסֵּהוּ הֶעָנָן שֵׁשֶׁת יָמִים״ — לְמֹשֶׁה, ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״ — לְקַבּוֹלֵי שְׁאָר תּוֹרָה. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״וַיִּשְׁכּוֹן כְּבוֹד ה׳״ מֵרֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ, ״וַיְכַסֵּהוּ הֶעָנָן לָהָר וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִי״ לְקַבּוֹלֵי עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת, הָא קַבִּילוּ לְהוּ מִשִּׁשָּׁה, וְהָא אִסְתַּלַּק עָנָן מִשִּׁשָּׁה!
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili holds in accordance with the first tanna who said on the sixth that the Torah was given; therefore, this incident occurred after the Ten Commandments. “And the glory of the Lord abode on Mount Sinai and the cloud covered him for six days” Moses, and He called to Moses on the seventh day to receive the rest of the Torah. As, should it enter your mind “And the glory of the Lord abode” from the New Moon “And the cloud covered it,” the mountain; “And He called to Moses on the seventh day,” didn’t they receive on the sixth and the cloud already departed on the sixth
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean holds according to the first Tanna, who said: "On the sixth of the month the Torah was given, therefore this was an event after the Ten Commandments." "And the glory of the Lord settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it for six days" — to Moses. "And He called to Moses on the seventh day" — to receive the rest of the Torah. For if you were to suggest that "the glory of the Lord" came from the beginning of the month, "and the cloud covered it to the mountain and He called to Moses on the seventh day" for the reception of the Ten Commandments, they received them on the sixth, and the cloud departed on the sixth!

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: בְּשִׁבְעָה בַּחֹדֶשׁ נִיתְּנָה תּוֹרָה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הַיְינוּ דְּמַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ בְּשִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר בְּתַמּוּז נִשְׁתַּבְּרוּ הַלּוּחוֹת: עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבְּעָה דְּסִיוָן, וְשִׁיתְּסַר דְּתַמּוּז, מָלוּ לְהוּ אַרְבְּעִין יוֹמִין דַּהֲוָה בָּהָר, וּבְשִׁבְסַר בְּתַמּוּז נְחֵית וַאֲתָא וְתַבְרִינְהוּ לְלוּחוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said that on the seventh of the month Torah was given to the Jewish people. Granted, Rabbi Akiva that that you find: On the seventeenth of Tammuz the tablets were shattered, twenty-four of Sivan and sixteen of Tammuz; they total the forty days that he was on the mountain. On the seventeenth of Tammuz he descended and came and shattered tablets.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva thought to her like Rabbi Yosei, who said: "On the seventh of the month, the Torah was given to the children of Israel." Granted, according to Rabbi Akiva, that is why you forget that on the seventeenth of Tammuz the Tablets were broken: twenty-four of Siwan, and sixteen of Tammuz, forty days that Moses was on the mountain, and on the seventeenth of Tammuz he descended and brought them to the Tablets.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי, דְּאָמַר: שִׁשָּׁה דִפְרִישָׁה וְאַרְבְּעִין דְּהַר, עַד עֶשְׂרִין וּתְלָת בְּתַמּוּז לָא אִתַּבּוּר לוּחוֹת! אָמַר לְךָ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי: אַרְבְּעִין דְּהַר בַּהֲדֵי שִׁשָּׁה דִפְרִישָׁה.
human_translation: However, according to Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, who said: six of sequestering forty that mountain, the tablets were not shattered until the twenty-third of Tammuz, Rabbi Yosei HaGelili said to you: The forty that mountain include the six of sequestering.
llm_translation: Instead, it is attributed to Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, who said: Six hairs of separation and forty hairs of the mountain, until the twenty-third of Tamuz, the Tablets were not broken! Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said to you: Forty hairs of the mountain in conjunction with six hairs of separation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה״ — מֹשֶׁה וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹמְדִין, מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה״ — מֹשֶׁה וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹמְדִין, וְלֹא בָּא הַכָּתוּב אֶלָּא לַחְלֹק לוֹ כָּבוֹד לְמֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: The Master said “And He called to Moses,” Moses and all of the Jewish people were standing supports Rabbi Elazar, as Rabbi Elazar said “And He called to Moses,” Moses and all of the Jewish people were standing and the verse comes only to accord deference to Moses.
llm_translation: Master said: "And He called to Moses" - Moses and all Israel standing, assisting Rabbi Elazar. For Rabbi Elazar said: "And He called to Moses" - Moses and all Israel standing, and the Scripture came only to give honor to Moses.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״קוֹל לוֹ״, ״קוֹל אֵלָיו״ — מֹשֶׁה שָׁמַע וְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל לֹא שָׁמְעוּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בְּסִינַי, הָא — בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — בִּקְרִיאָה, הָא — בְּדִבּוּר.
human_translation: raises an objection: voice to voice unto Moses heard and all of the Jewish people did not hear not difficult. This at Sinai. That at Tent of Meeting. Or if you wish, say not difficult; calling speaking,
llm_translation: Challenger: "His voice," "a voice to him" - Moses heard, but all of Israel did not hear! It is not difficult: here - at Sinai, here - in the Tent of Meeting. And if you wish, I would say, it is not difficult: here - in reading, here - in speaking.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זְרִיקָא רָמֵי קְרָאֵי קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אָמַר רַבִּי זְרִיקָא: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וְלֹא יָכוֹל מֹשֶׁה לָבֹא אֶל אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד כִּי שָׁכַן עָלָיו הֶעָנָן״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיָּבֹא מֹשֶׁה בְּתוֹךְ הֶעָנָן״! מְלַמֵּד שֶׁתְּפָסוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמֹשֶׁה וֶהֱבִיאוֹ בֶּעָנָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Zerika raised a contradiction between verses before Rabbi Elazar, and some say Rabbi Zerika said Rabbi Elazar raised a contradiction: It is written “And Moses was not able to enter into the Tent of Meeting because the cloud dwelt on it” And it is written “And Moses came into the cloud” This teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, grabbed Moses and brought him into the cloud
llm_translation: Rabbi Zerika raised verses before Rabbi Elazar, and some say he said to him: Rabbi Zerika said: Rabbi Elazar raised, as it is written: "And Moses could not enter the Tent of Meeting because the cloud had settled upon it," and it is written: "And Moses entered into the midst of the cloud!" This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, caught hold of Moses and brought him in the cloud.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״בְּתוֹךְ״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״בְּתוֹךְ״ — ״וְיָבוֹאוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּתוֹךְ הַיָּם״. מָה לְהַלָּן שְׁבִיל, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַמַּיִם לָהֶם חוֹמָה״, אַף כָּאן שְׁבִיל.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: It is stated here: into and it is stated below, “And the children of Israel went into the sea Just as below, a path as it is written: “And the water was a wall for them” here too, a path
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Ishmael it was taught: It is stated here "within," and it is stated there "within" — "and the children of Israel shall go into the midst of the sea." Just as there it is a path, as it is written: "and the waters were a wall to them," so too here it is a path.

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּקְרָא אֶל מֹשֶׁה וַיְדַבֵּר״, לָמָּה הִקְדִּים קְרִיאָה לְדִיבּוּר? לִימְּדָה תּוֹרָה דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמַר אָדָם דָּבָר לַחֲבֵירוֹ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן קוֹרֵהוּ. מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לֹא יֹאמַר אָדָם דָּבָר לַחֲבֵירוֹ אֶלָּא אִם כֵּן קוֹרֵהוּ. ״לֵאמֹר״, אָמַר רַבִּי (מוּסְיָא בַּר בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מַסְיָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מוּסְיָא) רַבָּה: מִנַּיִין לָאוֹמֵר דָּבָר לַחֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁהוּא בְּבַל יֹאמַר עַד שֶׁיֹּאמַר לוֹ: לֵךְ אֱמוֹר — שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיְדַבֵּר ה׳ אֵלָיו מֵאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד לֵאמֹר״.
human_translation: “And He called unto Moses, and spoke Why calling before speaking, The Torah is teaching etiquette: A person not say anything to another unless he calls him supports Rabbi Ḥanina, as Rabbi Ḥanina said: A person should not say anything to another unless he calls him “Saying,” Rabbi Musya, grandson of Rabbi Masya, said in the name of Rabbi Musya the Great: From where to one who tells another matter, that not say it until says to him: Go and tell others? As it is stated: “And the Lord spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting, saying [ lemor ].”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And He called to Moses and spoke," why did the calling precede the speaking? The Torah teaches proper conduct, that a person should not say anything to his fellow unless he calls him first. This supports Rabbi Chanina, for Rabbi Chanina said: A person should not say anything to his fellow unless he calls him first. "Saying," Rabbi (Musya son of Rabbi Masia in the name of Rabbi Musya) Rabba said: From where do we derive that one should not say something to his fellow that is not proper until he says to him: "Go, say" - as it is stated: "And Hashem spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting, saying."

hebrew_text: מִכְלָל דְּתַרְוַויְיהוּ סְבִירָא לְהוּ מִלּוּאִים כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן. דְּאִיתְּמַר: מִלּוּאִים, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, חַד אָמַר: כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן, וְחַד אָמַר: דָּבָר הַמְעַכֵּב לְדוֹרוֹת — מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן, שֶׁאֵין מְעַכֵּב לְדוֹרוֹת — אֵין מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן.
human_translation: by inference both maintain inauguration, all that are written in its invalidates As it is stated: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Ḥanina One said: all that are written in its invalidates And one said: A matter that invalidates throughout the generations invalidates a matter that does not invalidate throughout the generations does not invalidate
llm_translation: From the principle that both of them hold, it is reasonable for them that the fillings of all that is written in them are effective in them. For it was stated: "Fillings," Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Chanina. One said: All that is written in them is effective in them, and one said: A matter that is effective for generations - is effective in them, but a matter that is not effective for generations - is not effective in them.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הוּא דְּאָמַר כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן. מִדְּקָאָמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן לָקִישׁ לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אִי מָה מִלּוּאִים כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן, וְלָא קָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ וְלָא מִידֵּי. תִּסְתַּיֵּים.
human_translation: Conclude Rabbi Yoḥanan is the one who said: all that are written in its invalidates from that Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says to Rabbi Yoḥanan: Just as inauguration, all that are written in its invalidates and did not respond not anything, Conclude
llm_translation: The completion of Rabbi Yochanan, he said: "All that is written in them, delays them." From when Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said to Rabbi Yochanan: "If what is written in them delays them, then it does not return to him immediately." It is completed.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ?
human_translation: What is between
llm_translation: What is the difference between them?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: סְמִיכָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן — סְמִיכָה מְעַכְּבָא, לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מְעַכֵּב לְדוֹרוֹת אֵין מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן — סְמִיכָה לָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: between them placing hands to the one who said: all that are written in its invalidates placing hands also invalidates to the one who said: A matter that does not invalidate throughout the generations does not invalidate placing hands does not invalidate
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: There is proximity between them. According to the one who says that anything written in them (the Torah scrolls) delays them, proximity delays them. According to the one who says that a matter that does not delay for generations does not delay them, proximity does not delay them.

hebrew_text: וּלְדוֹרוֹת מְנָא לַן דְּלָא מְעַכְּבָא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְסָמַךְ״ ״וְנִרְצָה״. וְכִי סְמִיכָה מְכַפֶּרֶת? וַהֲלֹא אֵין כַּפָּרָה אֶלָּא בְּדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הַדָּם הוּא בַּנֶּפֶשׁ יְכַפֵּר״!
human_translation: And throughout the generations From where do we derive does not invalidate As it was taught “And he shall place and it shall be accepted Does placing hands atone Isn’t atonement only by the blood, as it is stated: “For it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the life”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for generations we have learned that it does not delay? For it was taught: "And he shall lean" "and it shall be accepted." And does leaning atone? But is not atonement only through blood, as it is said: "For the blood is the atonement for the soul"!

hebrew_text: וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְסָמַךְ״ ״וְנִרְצָה״? שֶׁאִם עֲשָׂאָהּ לִסְמִיכָה שְׁיָרֵי מִצְוָה — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ לֹא כִּפֵּר, וְכִפֵּר!
human_translation: And what does the verse state: “And he shall place…and it shall be accepted”? one deemed placing hands a peripheral aspect of the mitzva the verse ascribes to him as though he did not achieve atonement; and atones
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the Talmud to say "and lean" "and it shall be accepted"? That if one did it for the sake of the leaning, the mitzvah is preferable - the Scripture accounts it to him as if he did not atone, yet he atoned!

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק אָמַר: תְּנוּפָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן — מְעַכְּבָא. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מְעַכֵּב לְדוֹרוֹת אֵין מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן — לָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: waving between to the one who said: all that are written in its invalidates invalidates And to the one who said: A matter that does not invalidate throughout the generations does not invalidate does not invalidate
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: There is a distinction between them. According to the one who says that anything written in them (the documents) invalidates them, it invalidates them. And according to the one who says that something that does not invalidate for generations does not invalidate them - it does not invalidate them.

hebrew_text: וּלְדוֹרוֹת מְנָא לַן דְּלָא מְעַכְּבָא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״לִתְנוּפָה לְכַפֵּר״. וְכִי תְּנוּפָה מְכַפֶּרֶת? וַהֲלֹא אֵין כַּפָּרָה אֶלָּא בְּדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי הַדָּם הוּא בַּנֶּפֶשׁ יְכַפֵּר״! וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״לִתְנוּפָה לְכַפֵּר״? שֶׁאִם עֲשָׂאָהּ לִתְנוּפָה שְׁיָרֵי מִצְוָה — מַעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ לֹא כִּפֵּר, וְכִפֵּר.
human_translation: And throughout the generations, From where do we does not invalidate As it was taught to be waved to make atonement Does waving atone Isn’t atonement only by the blood, as it is stated: “For it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the life” And what does the verse state: To be waved to make atonement? one deemed waving a peripheral aspect of the mitzva the verse ascribes to him as though he did not achieve atonement; and atones
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for generations, how do we know that it does not delay? For it was taught: "For a waving to atone." And does waving atone? But is atonement not only through blood, as it is stated: "For the blood, it is that makes atonement for the soul"! And what is the Talmud coming to say with "for a waving to atone"? That if one performed the waving, the fulfillment of the commandment is superior to him as if he had not atoned, and he atoned.

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: פְּרִישַׁת שִׁבְעָה אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן — מְעַכְּבָא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְעַכֵּב לְדוֹרוֹת אֵינוֹ מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן — לָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: sequestering seven between to the one who said: all that are written in its invalidates invalidates And to the one who said: A matter that does not invalidate throughout the generations does not invalidate does not invalidate
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: There is a separation of seven days between them. According to the one who says that anything written in them the seven days delays them - it delays the counting. According to the one who says that a matter which does not delay for generations does not delay them - it does not delay the counting.

hebrew_text: וּלְדוֹרוֹת מְנָא לַן דְּלָא מְעַכְּבָא? מִדְּקָא תָנֵי ״מַתְקִינִין״, וְלָא קָתָנֵי ״מַפְרִישִׁין״.
human_translation: And throughout the generations, From where do we does not invalidate from the fact that it is taught they designate and it is not taught: remove
llm_translation: And for generations, how do we know that it does not delay? Since it teaches "they fix," and does not teach "they separate."

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: רִיבּוּי שִׁבְעָה וּמְשִׁיחָה שִׁבְעָה, אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן — מְעַכְּבָא. לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מְעַכֵּב לְדוֹרוֹת אֵין מְעַכֵּב בָּהֶן — לָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: Ravina said: multiple seven anointment seven between to the one who said: all that are written in its invalidates invalidates And to the one who said: A matter that does not invalidate throughout the generations does not invalidate does not invalidate
llm_translation: Ravina said: Multiplication of seven and anointing of seven, there is a difference between them. According to the one who says that anything written in them delays them - it delays. According to the one who says that something that does not delay for generations does not delay them - it does not delay.

hebrew_text: וּלְדוֹרוֹת מְנָא לַן דְּלָא מְעַכְּבָא? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְכִפֵּר הַכֹּהֵן אֲשֶׁר יִמְשַׁח אוֹתוֹ וַאֲשֶׁר יְמַלֵּא אֶת יָדוֹ לְכַהֵן תַּחַת אָבִיו״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר?
human_translation: And throughout the generations, From where do we does not invalidate As it was taught what does the verse state: “And the priest who shall be anointed and who shall be consecrated to serve in his father’s stead shall make the atonement”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And for generations, how do we know that it does not delay? For it was taught: "And the priest who is anointed in his place and who is consecrated to serve in place of his father," what is the teaching? English translation:

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים יִלְבָּשָׁם הַכֹּהֵן תַּחְתָּיו מִבָּנָיו״, אֵין לִי אֶלָּא נִתְרַבָּה שִׁבְעָה וְנִמְשַׁח שִׁבְעָה. נִתְרַבָּה שִׁבְעָה וְנִמְשַׁח יוֹם אֶחָד, נִתְרַבָּה יוֹם אֶחָד וְנִמְשַׁח שִׁבְעָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר יִמְשַׁח אוֹתוֹ וַאֲשֶׁר יְמַלֵּא אֶת יָדוֹ״ — מִכׇּל מָקוֹם.
human_translation: Since it is stated: “Seven days shall the son that is priest in his stead don them” I only multiple seven and was anointed seven multiple seven and was anointed one multiple one and was anointed seven from where the verse states: “Who shall be anointed and who shall be consecrated”; in any case
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Since it is stated: 'For seven days the priest shall put on them from his sons,' I might have only said that seven should be multiplied and anointed for seven. Seven should be multiplied and anointed in one day, one should be multiplied in one day and anointed for seven, from where do we derive this? The verse states: 'Whom he shall anoint, and whom he shall consecrate to fill his hand' - in any case."

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן רִיבּוּי שִׁבְעָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה, מְשִׁיחָה שִׁבְעָה לְכַתְּחִלָּה מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: We found multiple seven ab initio ; from where do we anointment seven ab initio ?
llm_translation: We find a repetition of seven at the outset, an anointing of seven at the outset, where do we derive this from?

hebrew_text: אִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא מִדְּאִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְמַעוֹטַהּ. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וּבִגְדֵי הַקֹּדֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר לְאַהֲרֹן יִהְיוּ לְבָנָיו אַחֲרָיו לְמׇשְׁחָה בָהֶם וּלְמַלֵּא בָם אֶת יָדָם״, אִיתַּקַּשׁ מְשִׁיחָה לְרִיבּוּי: מָה רִיבּוּי שִׁבְעָה, אַף מְשִׁיחָה שִׁבְעָה.
human_translation: If you wish, say: from that the verse: is necessary to exclude And if you wish, say that the verse states: “And the sacred garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him, to be anointed in them and to be consecrated in them” Anointment is juxtaposed to multiple Just as multiple for seven so too, anointment for seven
llm_translation: If you will say that a verse is necessary to exclude it, and if you will say that the verse says: "And the holy garments that belong to Aaron shall be for his sons after him, to be anointed in them and to fill their hands," the anointing is connected to the filling: just as the filling is sevenfold, so too the anointing is sevenfold.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר כׇּל הַכָּתוּב בָּהֶן מְעַכֵּב? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר בִּיסְנָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ לְאַהֲרֹן וּלְבָנָיו כָּכָה״. ״כָּכָה״ עִיכּוּבָא הוּא. תִּינַח כֹּל
human_translation: What is the reason of the one who said: all that are written in its invalidates Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Bisna said the verse states: “And so shall you do to Aaron and to his sons So, invalidates well all
llm_translation: What is the reason for one who says that anything written in them is essential? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Bisna said, Scripture says: "And you shall do to Aaron and his sons thus." "Thus" is a prohibition. Let everything be left.

hebrew_text: מִילְּתָא דִּכְתִיבָא בְּהַאי עִנְיָנָא. מִילְּתָא דְּלָא כְּתִיבָא בְּהַאי עִנְיָנָא מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: matters that are written in this topic matters that are not written in that context, from where do we derive
llm_translation: The matter that is written in this subject. The matter that is not written in this subject, from where do we derive it?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: יָלֵיף ״פֶּתַח״ ״פֶּתַח״. רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא אָמַר: ״וּשְׁמַרְתֶּם אֶת מִשְׁמֶרֶת ה׳״ — עִכּוּבָא. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״כִּי כֵן צֻוֵּיתִי״ — עִכּוּבָא.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: derives a opening opening Rav Mesharshiyya said: “And keep the charge of the Lord, invalidates Rav Ashi says: For so I am commanded, invalidate
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "Patach" is derived from "patach." Rav Mesharshaya said: "And you shall guard the charge of the Lord" - a negative command. Rav Ashi said: "For so I have been commanded" - a negative command.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״כִּי כֵן צֻוֵּיתִי״, ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוֵּיתִי״, ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳״. ״כִּי כֵן צֻוֵּיתִי״ — בַּאֲנִינוּת יֹאכְלוּהָ. ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוֵּיתִי״ — בִּשְׁעַת מַעֲשֶׂה אָמַר לָהֶם. ״כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳״ — וְלֹא מֵאֵלַי אֲנִי אוֹמֵר.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “For so I am commanded” “as I commanded” “as God has commanded” “For so I am commanded,” acute mourning, eat “As I commanded,” at the time of the incident “As God commanded,” and not from my I am saying
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "As I have commanded," "As I have commanded," "As the Lord has commanded." "As I have commanded" - they shall eat it in its poor state. "As I have commanded" - at the time of the deed, He said to them. "As the Lord has commanded" - and not from my own accord do I say.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: מִכְנָסַיִם אֵין כְּתוּבִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה, כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְזֶה הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר תַּעֲשֶׂה לָהֶם לְקַדֵּשׁ אֹתָם לְכַהֵן״ — לְהָבִיא הַמִּכְנָסַיִם וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: Trousers are not written in the portion. When says: “And this is the matter that you shall do for them to sanctify them for service” to include trousers and the tenth of an ephah
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: The breeches are not written in the portion, when it says, "And this is the thing that you shall do to them to sanctify them to the priest" — to bring the breeches and the tenth of the ephah.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא מִכְנָסַיִם כְּתִיבִי בְּעִנְיָנָא דִבְגָדִים, אֶלָּא עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה מְנָא לַן? אָתְיָא ״זֶה״ ״זֶה״ מִ״וְּזֶה קׇרְבַּן אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו אֲשֶׁר יַקְרִיבוּ לַה׳ עֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה״.
human_translation: Granted, trousers is written of the matter of garments However, the tenth of an ephah, from where do we derived this this “This is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer to the Lord a tenth of an ephah”
llm_translation: In truth, "miknasayim" is written regarding the matter of garments, but where do we find a tenth of an ephah? It comes from "this" "this" from "and this" the offering of Aharon and his sons that they shall offer to the Lord a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: מִנַּיִין שֶׁאַף מִקְרָא פָּרָשָׁה מְעַכֵּב, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר מֹשֶׁה אֶל הָעֵדָה זֶה הַדָּבָר אֲשֶׁר צִוָּה ה׳״ — אֲפִילּוּ דִּיבּוּר מְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: From where that even read the portion invalidates The verse states: “And Moses said to the assembly: This is the matter [ davar ] that God has commanded even recitation [ dibbur ] invalidates
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: From where do we derive that even a verse delays a section? The Talmud teaches: "And Moses said to the congregation, 'This is the thing that the Lord has commanded'" — even speech delays.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד הִלְבִּישָׁן? כֵּיצַד הִלְבִּישָׁן?! מַאי דַהֲוָה הֲוָה! אֶלָּא: כֵּיצַד מַלְבִּישָׁן לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא? לֶעָתִיד לָבוֹא נָמֵי, לִכְשֶׁיָּבוֹאוּ אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו וּמֹשֶׁה עִמָּהֶם!
human_translation: How, dress In what order did he dress them? what was, was. Rather, How dress in the future, In the future, too, when Aaron and his sons will come and Moses with them,
llm_translation: "How did they dress them? How did they dress them?! What was, was! Rather: How will they dress them in the future? In the future, it is stated, when Aaron and his sons and Moses will come with them!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: כֵּיצַד הִלְבִּישָׁן לְמִיסְבַּר קְרָאֵי. פְּלִיגִי בָּהּ בְּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. חַד אָמַר: אַהֲרֹן וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּנָיו, וְחַד אָמַר: אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו בְּבַת אַחַת.
human_translation: Rather, How dress them? to explain the verses The sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya and Rabbi Yoḥanan disagree with regard to One said: Aaron and afterward his sons; and one said: Aaron and his sons simultaneously,
llm_translation: Rather: How did they dress the priests in the Temple? The sons of Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Yochanan disagree about it. One said: Aaron first, and then his sons. And one said: Aaron and his sons together in one garment.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּכֻתּוֹנֶת וּמִצְנֶפֶת כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּאַהֲרֹן וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּנָיו. דְּבֵין בְּצַוּוֹאָה וּבֵין בַּעֲשִׂיָּה אַהֲרֹן קָדֵים. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּאַבְנֵט. מַאן דְּאָמַר אַהֲרֹן וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּנָיו, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּחְגּוֹר אוֹתוֹ בָּאַבְנֵט״, וַהֲדַר כְּתִיב: ״וַיַּחְגּוֹר אוֹתָם אַבְנֵט״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו בְּבַת אַחַת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְחָגַרְתָּ אוֹתָם״. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַהֲרֹן וּבָנָיו בְּבַת אַחַת, הָכְתִיב: ״וַיַּחְגּוֹר אוֹתוֹ בְּאַבְנֵט״ וַהֲדַר כְּתִיב: ״וַיַּחְגּוֹר אוֹתָם אַבְנֵט״!
human_translation: Abaye said: tunic and mitre everyone agrees that Aaron and afterward his sons, as both in the command and in the implementation, Aaron precedes When they disagree, with regard to the belt. one who said: Aaron and afterward his sons which is written: “And he girded him with the belt” and then it is written: “And he girded them with belts” And one who said: Aaron and his sons, simultaneously which is written: “And gird them And to the one who says: Aaron and his sons simultaneously, isn’t it written: He girded him with the belt, and then it is written: He girded them with belts,
llm_translation: Abaye said: With regard to the tunic and the turban, everyone agrees that Aaron and his sons were not different, as Aaron preceded in both command and action. When they differ, it is regarding the sash. The one who says Aaron and then his sons, as it is written: "And he girded him with the sash," and then it is written: "And he girded them with the sash." And the one who says Aaron and his sons together, as it is written: "And you shall gird them." And for the one who says Aaron and his sons together, it is written: "And he girded him with the sash," and then it is written: "And he girded them with the sash."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָךְ: הַהוּא אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לֹא זֶה הוּא אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: said to you: That the belt of the High Priest is not the belt of the common priest.
llm_translation: He said to you: "That belt of the High Priest, this is not the belt of a regular priest."

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַהֲרֹן וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּנָיו, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְחָגַרְתָּ אוֹתָם אַבְנֵט״! אָמַר לָךְ: הַהוּא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן, אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל זֶהוּ אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: And to the one who said Aaron and then his sons, is it not written: “And you will gird them with belts,” said to you: That teaches us the belt of the High Priest is the belt of the common priest.
llm_translation: And for the one who says, "Aaron and afterwards his sons," and it is written: "And you shall gird them with a sash"! I say to you: that one is informing us, the sash of the high priest, that is the sash of the regular priest.

hebrew_text: ״וַיַּחְגּוֹר אוֹתוֹ אַבְנֵט״ ״וַיַּחְגּוֹר אוֹתָם״ לְמָה לִי? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַהֲרֹן וְאַחַר כָּךְ בָּנָיו. וּבְבַת אַחַת מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּאַקְדֵּים.
human_translation: why do I “And he girded him with a belt,” “And he girded them”? Learn from it Aaron and then his sons. And can you find simultaneously? It is necessary only first
llm_translation: "And he girded him with the girdle" "And he girded them" - Why do I need them? Learn from it that Aaron and then his sons. And in one daughter who forgets her? Not necessary, for it is established."

hebrew_text: מַפְרִישִׁין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְכוּ׳. לָמָּה מַפְרִישִׁין? לָמָּה מַפְרִישִׁין?! כִּדְקָאָמְרִינַן, אִי לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ, אִי לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ כִּדְאִית לֵיהּ!
human_translation: remove the High Priest Why do remove him? Why do remove him? as we stated above: Whether to Rabbi Yoḥanan, as per his or whether it is to Reish Lakish, as per his
llm_translation: We separate the High Priest and so on. Why do we separate? Why do we separate?! As we say, whether for Rabbi Yochanan as it is suitable for him, or for Reish Lakish as it is suitable for him!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִבֵּיתוֹ לָמָּה פֵּירַשׁ? תַּנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתִירָה אוֹמֵר: שֶׁמָּא תִּמָּצֵא אִשְׁתּוֹ סָפֵק נִדָּה וְיָבֹא עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: This is is saying. Why did he withdraw from his house, It was taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: lest his wife be found uncertainty a menstruating woman, and have relations with her
llm_translation: So he said: Why did he separate from his wife? It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: Lest his wife be found in a doubtful state of impurity, and he would have relations with her.

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ בְּרַשִּׁיעֵי עָסְקִינַן? אֶלָּא: שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא עַל אִשְׁתּוֹ וְתִמָּצֵא סָפֵק נִדָּה.
human_translation: Is that to say we are dealing with wicked people? Rather, lest he have relations with his wife and she be found uncertainty a menstruating woman.
llm_translation: We are dealing with the case of wicked men? Rather, lest he come upon his wife and a doubt of menstruation be found.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא: כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּאָמַר: נִדָּה מְטַמְּאָה אֶת בּוֹעֲלָהּ. דְּאִי רַבָּנַן, הָא אָמְרִי: אֵין נִדָּה מְטַמְּאָה אֶת בּוֹעֲלָהּ.
human_translation: The Sages stated before Rav Ḥisda: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who said: A menstruating woman renders the man who had with relations with her impure. As, if the Rabbis, Didn’t they say a menstruating woman does not render the man who had with relations with her impure.
llm_translation: The sages said before Rav Ḥisda: In whose opinion? In the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, who said: A menstruating woman renders impure the man who has intercourse with her. For if it is according to the sages, did they not say: A menstruating woman does not render impure the man who has intercourse with her.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב חִסְדָּא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימְרוּ רַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אֶלָּא בְּאַחַר אַחַר, אֲבָל בְּחַד אַחַר — מוֹדוּ לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to Even if you say Rabbis, the Rabbis disagree with Rabbi Akiva only long afterward, However, afterward, concede to
llm_translation: He said to them, Rav Ḥisda: Even if you were to say, "The Rabbis," up to here the Rabbis do not disagree with the statement of Rabbi Akiva, except in a different case. But in one case, they concede to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בּוֹעֵל נִדָּה אֵינוֹ כְּנִדָּה, וְטוֹבֵל בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Learn from it he had relations with a menstruating woman is unlike a menstruating woman immerse day
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: Hear from it, one who has relations with a menstruating woman is not like a menstruating woman, and he immerses on the same day.
