hebrew_text: דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ בּוֹעֵל נִדָּה כְּנִדָּה, אֵימַת טָבֵיל — בְּלֵילְיָא. לִמְחַר הֵיכִי עָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה? וְהָא בָּעֵי הֶעֱרֵב הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בּוֹעֵל נִדָּה אֵינוֹ כְּנִדָּה.
human_translation: As, if you say that he had relations with a menstruating woman is like a menstruating woman when does he immerse? at night how can he perform service the next day? Isn’t he required sunset Rather, not conclude from it he had relations with a menstruating woman is unlike a menstruating woman
llm_translation: If you say, "One who has relations with a menstruating woman is like one who has relations with a menstruating woman, when is he to immerse?" - at night. How does he perform the service the next day? But he requires the sunset twilight. Rather, do not infer from this that one who has relations with a menstruating woman is not like one who has relations with a menstruating woman.

hebrew_text: רַב שִׁימִי מִנְּהַרְדְּעָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בּוֹעֵל נִדָּה כְּנִדָּה, דְּמַפְרְשִׁינַן לֵיהּ שָׁעָה אַחַת סָמוּךְ לִשְׁקִיעַת הַחַמָּה.
human_translation: Rav Shimi from Neharde’a says: Even you say he had relations with a menstruating woman is like a menstruating woman we sequester him one hour just sunset
llm_translation: Rav Shimi from Nehardea said: Even if you say he has relations with a menstruating woman like a menstruating woman, for we explain to him one hour before sunset.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי טְבִילוֹת טְבִילָתָן בַּיּוֹם, נִדָּה וְיוֹלֶדֶת טְבִילָתָן בַּלַּיְלָה. נִדָּה אִין, בּוֹעֵל נִדָּה לָא!
human_translation: raises an objection all obligated in immersions, their immersion is during the day. a menstruating woman and a woman after childbirth, whose immersion is at night. a menstruating woman, yes, he had relations with a menstruating woman, no,
llm_translation: Challenger: all obligated in immersions, their immersion in the day, a menstruant woman and a woman who has given birth, their immersion at night. A menstruant woman, no, one may not have sexual relations with a menstruant woman!

hebrew_text: נִדָּה וְכׇל דְּאָתֵי מֵרִבּוּיָיא.
human_translation: menstruating woman and everyone whose inclusion is derived
llm_translation: Impurity and all that comes from mixing.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בַּעַל קֶרִי כְּמַגַּע שֶׁרֶץ, בּוֹעֵל נִדָּה כִּטְמֵא מֵת. מַאי לָאו לִטְבִילָה? לֹא, לְטוּמְאָתָן.
human_translation: raises objection: one a seminal emission like contact with a creeping animal, one had relations with a menstruating woman is like impure a corpse. What, not immersion, No, their impurity.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: The question was raised: A man who has a seminal emission is like one who touches a creeping thing; he who has intercourse with a menstruating woman is like one who is defiled by a dead body. What is the reason that they do not require immersion? Not for immersion, but for their impurity.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָתָן?! בְּהֶדְיָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ. הַאי טוּמְאַת שִׁבְעָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ, וְהַאי טוּמְאַת שִׁבְעָה כְּתִיב בֵּיהּ,
human_translation: their impurity? explicitly writes their This, impurity of seven written in his and that, impurity of seven written in his
llm_translation: Their impurity?! In this case, it is written in it. This impurity of seven is written in it, and this impurity of seven is written in it.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, לִטְבִילָתָן!
human_translation: Rather, it not to their immersion,
llm_translation: Rather, no, for their immersion!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם לְטוּמְאָתָן, סֵיפָא אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: אֶלָּא שֶׁחָמוּר מִמֶּנּוּ בּוֹעֵל נִדָּה, שֶׁמְּטַמֵּא מִשְׁכָּב וּמוֹשָׁב בְּטוּמְאָה קַלָּה, לְטַמֵּא אוֹכָלִין וּמַשְׁקִין.
human_translation: No; actually, to their impurity. was necessary for the latter clause However, one had relations with a menstruating woman more severe than transmits impurity through a bed or a chair, with a mild impurity. render foods and liquids impure.
llm_translation: Not, forever, their impurity, conclusion, requires it: rather, that a donkey from it one who has intercourse with a menstruating woman, who renders impure lying and sitting in light impurity, to render impure food and drink.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: הַזָּב וְהַזָּבָה וְהַמְּצוֹרָע וְהַמְצוֹרַעַת וּבוֹעֵל נִדָּה וּטְמֵא מֵת טְבִילָתָן בַּיּוֹם, נִדָּה וְיוֹלֶדֶת טְבִילָתָן בַּלַּיְלָה! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Come hear that Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: the zav and the zava and the leper and the female leper, and one who had relations with a menstruating woman, and one who is ritually impure a corpse, their immersion is during the day. a menstruating woman and a woman after childbirth, their immersion is at night. a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Come and hear, as taught by Rabbi Chiya: A man with a genital discharge, a woman with a genital discharge, a leper, a female leper, one who has had relations with a menstruating woman, and one who is impure due to contact with a dead body - their immersion is during the day. A menstruating woman and a woman who has given birth - their immersion is at night! This is a contradiction.

hebrew_text: וְעַד שֶׁאַתָּה מַפְרִישׁוֹ מִטּוּמְאַת בֵּיתוֹ, הַפְרִישֵׁהוּ מִטּוּמְאַת הַמֵּת! אָמַר רַב תַּחְלִיפָא אֲבוּהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא (בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא) מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא: זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: טוּמְאַת הַמֵּת הוּתְּרָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: And before you remove him from the impurity of his house, remove him from the impurity a corpse. Rav Taḥlifa, father of Rav Huna bar Taḥlifa, said in the name of Rava: That is to say impurity corpse is permitted in the public.
llm_translation: And until you separate it from the impurity of his house, separate it from the impurity of the dead! Rav Tahalifa, the father of Rav Huna (son of Tahalifa), said in the name of Rava: This means: The impurity of the dead is permitted in a community.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא טוּמְאַת הַמֵּת דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִבּוּר. טוּמְאַת הַמֵּת לָא שְׁכִיחָא, טוּמְאַת בֵּיתוֹ שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: Ravina said: Even you say that impurity a corpse is overridden in public Impurity a corpse is uncommon. impurity of his house is common,
llm_translation: Ravina said: Even if you say that the impurity of a corpse is pushed aside in a public domain. The impurity of a corpse is not common, the impurity of his house is common.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, טוּמְאַת הַמֵּת, רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הוּתְּרָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר, וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: It was stated impurity a corpse Rav Naḥman said: It is permitted in the public; And Rav Sheshet said: overridden in the public,
llm_translation: It was stated: regarding the impurity of a corpse, Rav Nachman said: it is permitted in public, and Rav Sheshet said: it is rejected in public.

hebrew_text: הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא טְמֵאִין וּטְהוֹרִין בְּהָהוּא בֵּית אָב — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּטְהוֹרִין עָבְדִי, טְמֵאִין לָא עָבְדִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי לְאַהְדּוֹרֵי וּלְאֵתוֹיֵי טְהוֹרִין מִבֵּית אָב אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: where there are ritually impure and pure that patrilineal family everyone, agrees that the pure serve the impure do not serve. When they disagree, to seek out and bring pure from a different patrilineal family
llm_translation: Here where there are impure and pure in that particular household - everyone agrees that the pure ones did not do ritual impurity, the impure ones did not do ritual impurity. When they argue, it is regarding the future and the past, whether the pure ones can be considered from another household.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: הֶיתֵּר הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר, וְלָא מַהְדְּרִינַן. וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר, וּמַהְדְּרִינַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: is permitted the public, and we do not seek out Rav Sheshet said: is overridden the public, we seek out
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: It is permitted in public, but we do not honor it. And Rav Sheshet said: It is prohibited in public, but we do honor it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֲפִילּוּ הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא טְהוֹרִין וּטְמֵאִין בְּהָהוּא בֵּית אָב פְּלִיג רַב נַחְמָן, וְאָמַר: עָבְדִי נָמֵי טְמֵאִין,
human_translation: Some say Even where there are ritually pure and ritually impure that patrilineal family, Rav Naḥman disagreed and said even impure,
llm_translation: There are those who say: Even in a place where there are both pure and impure items in that house, Rav Nachman disputes and says: The impure items render the pure items impure.

hebrew_text: דְּכֹל טוּמְאַת מֵת בְּצִיבּוּר רַחֲמָנָא שַׁרְיַיהּ.
human_translation: as all of impurity by corpses the public, the Merciful One permits
llm_translation: All impurity of a corpse in the community, the Merciful One permits it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: הָיָה עוֹמֵד וּמַקְרִיב מִנְחַת הָעוֹמֶר וְנִטְמֵאת בְּיָדוֹ, אוֹמֵר וּמְבִיאִין אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ. וְאִם אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא הִיא, אוֹמְרִין לוֹ: הֱוֵי פִּקֵּחַ וּשְׁתוֹק.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say as it was taught was standing and sacrificing the omer meal-offering and it became impure in his hand, says bring another in its stead. And if the only there, the say to him: Be shrewd and keep silent;
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say this to her, as it was taught: If he was standing and offering the Omer meal-offering and it became impure in his hand, he says, "Bring another one in its place." And if there is nothing there except for it, they say to him: "Be open-minded and remain silent."

hebrew_text: קָתָנֵי מִיהַת אוֹמֵר וּמְבִיאִין אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מוֹדֵינָא הֵיכָא דְּאִיכָּא שִׁירַיִים לַאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: In any case, it is teaching that he says bring another in its place. Rav Naḥman said: I concede where there are remnants for eating
llm_translation: The text states: "It was taught in one place, 'And one brings another underneath it!' Rav Nachman said: We agree in a case where there are leftovers for eating."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הָיָה מַקְרִיב מִנְחַת פָּרִים וְאֵילִים וּכְבָשִׂים, וְנִטְמֵאת בְּיָדוֹ, אוֹמֵר וּמְבִיאִין אַחֶרֶת תַּחְתֶּיהָ. וְאִם אֵין שָׁם אֶלָּא הִיא, אוֹמְרִין לוֹ: הֱוֵי פִּקֵּחַ וּשְׁתוֹק.
human_translation: raises an objection was sacrificing the meal-offering bulls, rams, or sheep, and became impure in his hand, says and bring another - in its stead. And if the only there, the say to him: Be shrewd and keep silent;
llm_translation: Challenger: He was offering meal-offerings of bulls, rams, and lambs, and he became impure in his hand, he says, "And they bring another in its place." And if there is nothing there except it, they say to him: "Be open and silent."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, פָּרִים אֵילִים וּכְבָשִׂים דְּחַג!
human_translation: What, is it not bulls, rams, and sheep the festival
llm_translation: What is the reason that bulls, rams, and sheep are brought for the festival?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב נַחְמָן: לָא: פָּרִים — פַּר עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, אַף עַל גַּב דְּצִיבּוּר הוּא, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא קְבִיעַ לֵיהּ זְמַן — מַהְדְּרִינַן. אֵילִים — בְּאֵילוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן, דְּאַף עַל גַּב דִּקְבִיעַ לֵיהּ זְמַן, כֵּיוָן דְּיָחִיד הוּא — מְהַדְּרִינַן. כְּבָשִׂים — בְּכֶבֶשׂ הַבָּא עִם הָעוֹמֶר, דְּאִיכָּא שִׁירַיִים לַאֲכִילָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to you: No, bulls bull idolatry Although communal since it has no time fixed we seek out the rams ram of Aaron Although it has a time fixed since by an individual, we seek out The sheep the sheep that accompanies the omer there are remnants for eating.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said to you: No: "Parim" - a bull for idol worship, even though it is a communal offering, since it does not have a fixed time, we return it. "Eilim" - with the ram of Aharon, even though it has a fixed time, since it is an individual offering, we return it. "Kevasim" - with the lamb that comes with the Omer, as there are leftovers for eating.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: דָּם שֶׁנִּטְמָא וּזְרָקוֹ, בְּשׁוֹגֵג — הוּרְצָה, בְּמֵזִיד — לֹא הוּרְצָה. כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא דְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: raises an objection blood that became impure and sprinkled it unwittingly, accepted. intentionally, not accepted. When that was taught, individual,
llm_translation: Challenger: A blood that became impure and was sprinkled, if it was done unintentionally - it is acceptable, if it was done intentionally - it is not acceptable. For it was taught in that case of an individual.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: עַל מָה הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה, עַל הַדָּם וְעַל הַבָּשָׂר וְעַל הַחֵלֶב שֶׁנִּטְמָא, בֵּין בְּשׁוֹגֵג בֵּין בְּמֵזִיד, בֵּין בְּאוֹנֶס בֵּין בְּרָצוֹן, בֵּין בְּיָחִיד בֵּין בְּצִיבּוּר. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ טוּמְאָה הֶיתֵּר הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר — לְמָה לִי לְרַצּוֹיֵי?
human_translation: Come hear For what does the frontplate effect acceptance? for the blood, for the flesh, and for the fat that became impure whether unwittingly or whether intentionally, whether due to beyond his control or whether willfully, whether in an individual or whether it was in a communal And if it enters your mind impurity is permitted in the public, why do I effect acceptance?
llm_translation: Come and hear: For what does the headdress atone? For the blood, and for the flesh, and for the fat that became impure, whether inadvertently or intentionally, whether by coercion or willingly, whether for an individual or for the community. And if you were to suggest that impurity is permitted for the community - why do I need it for the willing?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב נַחְמָן: כִּי קָתָנֵי ״הַצִּיץ מְרַצֶּה״ אַדְּיָחִיד. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא בְּצִיבּוּר, בְּהָנָךְ דְּלָא קְבִיעַ לָהּ זְמַן.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to you: When teaches the frontplate effects acceptance an individual if you wish, say Even you say communal those lack a fixed time.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said to you: When it is taught "the forehead plate is pleasing," it is speaking of an individual. And if you wish, say: Even if you say in a congregation, in a case where a fixed time is not designated for it.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וְנָשָׂא אַהֲרֹן אֶת עֲוֹן הַקֳּדָשִׁים״, וְכִי אֵיזֶה עָוֹן הוּא נוֹשֵׂא? אִם עֲוֹן פִּיגּוּל — הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״לֹא יֵרָצֶה״, וְאִם עֲוֹן נוֹתָר — הֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״לֹא יֵחָשֵׁב״,
human_translation: raises an objection. “And Aaron will gain forgiveness for the sin committed in the sacred things And for which sin does gain forgiveness? If the sin of piggul , it has already been stated: it shall not be accepted” And if it is the sin of notar , it has already been stated: neither shall it be credited
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: A question was raised: "And Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things." What iniquity does he bear? If it is the iniquity of Pigul, it has already been stated: "It shall not be accepted." And if it is the iniquity of Nosar, it has already been stated: "It shall not be reckoned."

hebrew_text: הָא אֵינוֹ נוֹשֵׂא אֶלָּא עֲוֹן טוּמְאָה שֶׁהוּתְּרָה מִכְּלָלָהּ בְּצִיבּוּר. וְקַשְׁיָא לְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: צִיץ, בֵּין שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ בֵּין שֶׁאֵינוֹ עַל מִצְחוֹ — מְרַצֶּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: gains forgiveness only the sin of impurity, which was exempted from its general in the public. a difficulty to Rav Sheshet, is a dispute between tanna’im , as it was taught The frontplate effects acceptance whether it is on forehead or whether it is not on forehead the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text into English: Talmudic text: This case only carries the liability of impurity that was permitted from its general category in public. And it is difficult for Rav Sheshet! It is a teaching. As it was taught: The forehead-plate, whether it is positioned on the forehead or not on the forehead — it is acceptable, the words of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹדֵהוּ עַל מִצְחוֹ — מְרַצֶּה. אֵין עוֹדֵהוּ עַל מִצְחוֹ — אֵינוֹ מְרַצֶּה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים יוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁאֵין עוֹדֵהוּ עַל מִצְחוֹ, וּמְרַצֶּה!
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: As long as it is on his forehead it effects acceptance; it is no longer on his forehead it does not effect acceptance. Rabbi Shimon said to The High Priest on Yom Kippur prove as no longer on his forehead, and effects acceptance.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: If his forehead is still moist - he is pleased. If his forehead is not moist - he is not pleased. Rabbi Shimon said to him: The High Priest on Yom Kippur shall testify, that if his forehead is not moist, he is pleased!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הַנַּח לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, שֶׁטּוּמְאָה הוּתְּרָה לוֹ בְּצִיבּוּר. מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Leave the High Priest on Yom Kippur, as impurity is permitted in the public. by inference Rabbi Shimon holds that impurity is overridden in the public,
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda: Leave for the High Priest on Yom Kippur, that impurity is permitted to him in public. From the principle of Rabbi Shimon, he holds impurity is pushed aside in public.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּנִשְׁבַּר הַצִּיץ דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא מְרַצֶּה. כִּי פְּלִיגִי דִּתְלֵי בְּסִיכְּתָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: ״עַל מֵצַח ... וְנָשָׂא״,
human_translation: Abaye said: where the frontplate broke, everyone, agrees that no effects acceptance. When they disagree is hanging on a peg. Rabbi Yehuda holds on the forehead and shall gain forgiveness
llm_translation: Abaye said: When the flower of the incense is broken, everyone agrees that it is not acceptable. When do they disagree? When it is placed in the spoon. Rabbi Yehuda holds: "Upon the forehead... and bear."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר ״תָּמִיד לְרָצוֹן לִפְנֵי ה׳״. מַאי ״תָּמִיד״? אִילֵּימָא: תָּמִיד עַל מִצְחוֹ, מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ?! מִי לָא בָּעֵי מֵיעַל לְבֵית הַכִּסֵּא, וּמִי לָא בָּעֵי מֵינַם?! אֶלָּא: תָּמִיד מְרַצֶּה הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon holds be always be accepted before the Lord.” what is always If we say always on forehead, do you find Doesn’t he need to enter the bathroom, doesn’t he need to sleep, Rather, always effects acceptance,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds "Tamid L'ratzon Lifnei Hashem." What is "Tamid"? Perhaps: "Tamid" on his forehead, who would forget her?! Who does not want to ascend to the throne, and who does not want to taste them?! Rather: "Tamid" pleases Him.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי, הָא כְּתִיב ״תָּמִיד״! הָהוּא תָּמִיד שֶׁלֹּא יַסִּיחַ דַּעְתּוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ, כִּדְרַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא: חַיָּיב אָדָם לְמַשְׁמֵשׁ בִּתְפִילָּיו בְּכׇל שָׁעָה וְשָׁעָה, קַל וָחוֹמֶר מִצִּיץ:
human_translation: And to Rabbi Yehuda as well, isn’t it written: “Always”? That “Always,” that he should not be distracted from it. in accordance with of Rabba bar Rav Huna, as Rabba bar Rav Huna said: A person must touch phylacteries his each and every hour, an a fortiori from the frontplate:
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Yehuda also, it is written "Tamid"! That Tamid which does not divert his mind from it, as Rabba bar Rav Huna said. For Rabba bar Rav Huna said: A person is obligated to engage in his prayers at every moment, all the more so than the priestly duty of the incense offering.

hebrew_text: וּמָה צִיץ, שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ אֶלָּא אַזְכָּרָה אַחַת, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: ״עַל מִצְחוֹ תָּמִיד״ — שֶׁלֹּא יַסִּיחַ דַּעְתּוֹ מִמֶּנּוּ. תְּפִילִּין שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהֶן אַזְכָּרוֹת הַרְבֵּה — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: Just as the frontplate, which has only one mention the Torah said: be always upon his forehead,” that he should not be distracted from it, phylacteries, which have numerous mentions all the more so
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And what is the Tzitz, which contains only one mention, the Torah said: "Upon his forehead always" - that his mind should not be diverted from it. Tefillin that have many mentions - how much more so one mention.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן דְּאָמַר תָּמִיד מְרַצֶּה, וְהָא כְּתִיב ״עַל מִצְחוֹ וְנָשָׂא״! הָהוּא לִקְבּוֹעַ לוֹ מָקוֹם הוּא דַּאֲתָא.
human_translation: And to Rabbi Shimon, who says effects acceptance isn’t it written: “On his forehead…and shall gain forgiveness”? That comes to establish the place
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Shimon who says constantly pleased, and this as it is written "on his forehead and bear"! That to establish for him a place he came.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לִקְבּוֹעַ לוֹ מָקוֹם מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵ״עַל מִצְחוֹ״. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן נָמֵי, תִּיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מֵ״עַל מִצְחוֹ״? אִין הָכִי נָמֵי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, from where does he to establish place He derives it “On his forehead.” And Rabbi Shimon, too, let him derive “On his forehead.” Yes, it is indeed so;
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda: "And to establish for him a place, where does he count it?" He derives it from "above his forehead." And Rabbi Shimon also, does he derive it from "above his forehead"? It is not so.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, ״עַל מִצְחוֹ וְנָשָׂא״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? אָמַר לָךְ: רָאוּי לַמֵּצַח מְרַצֶּה, שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לַמֵּצַח אֵינוֹ מְרַצֶּה. לְאַפּוֹקֵי נִשְׁבַּר הַצִּיץ, דְּלֹא מְרַצֶּה.
human_translation: Rather, “On his forehead…and shall gain forgiveness,” what do with said to you: fit for the forehead effects acceptance; which is not fit for the forehead does not effect acceptance. to exclude the frontplate broke, which it does not effect acceptance.
llm_translation: Rather, "on his forehead and bear" what does he do with it? He said to you: suitable for the forehead is pleasing, that which is not suitable for the forehead is not pleasing. To go out the flower broke, as it is not pleasing.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, נִשְׁבַּר הַצִּיץ מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״מֵּצַח״ ״מִצְחוֹ״. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, ״מֵצַח״ ״מִצְחוֹ״ לָא מַשְׁמַע לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And to Rabbi Yehuda, from where does he the frontplate broke He derives it forehead, his forehead, And Rabbi Shimon does not learn forehead his forehead.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehuda, did the forehead plate break off? It emerged to him from "m'tzach" "his forehead." And Rabbi Shimon, "m'tzach" "his forehead" does not sound to him.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: אֶחָד זֶה וְאֶחָד זֶה מַזִּין עָלָיו כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִכׇּל חַטָּאוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ שָׁם — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אֵין מַזִּין עָלָיו אֶלָּא שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי בִּלְבַד. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹמֵר: כֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה מַזִּין עָלָיו כׇּל שִׁבְעָה, כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אֵין מַזִּין עָלָיו אֶלָּא שְׁלִישִׁי וּשְׁבִיעִי.
human_translation: Let us say these tanna’im , is like those tanna’im , as it was taught Both this and that all seven one sprinkles upon him all the sin-offerings that were there the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: One sprinkles upon him only on the third and seventh Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy Priest, says: the priest who burns the heifer, one sprinkles upon him all seven High Priest on Yom Kippur, one sprinkles upon him only on the third and seventh
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Neima hanai tanna'ei kehanei tanna'ei. Detanya: echad zeh ve'echad zeh mazin alav kol shiv'ah mikol chatatot shehayu sham — divrei Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei omer: ein mazin alav ela shelishi ushvi'i bilvad. Rabbi Chanina segan hakohanim omer: kohen hasoref et haparah mazin alav kol shiv'ah, kohen gadol beyom hakippurim ein mazin alav ela shelishi ushvi'i. English translation: Neima, these are the teachings of the teachers, like the teachings of the priests. As it was taught: "One and another, both sprinkle upon it all seven from all the sins that were there" — these are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: "One should only sprinkle upon it the third and seventh day alone." Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, says: "The priest who burns the cow sprinkles upon it all seven, but the high priest on Yom Kippur only sprinkles upon it the third and seventh day."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: טוּמְאָה הֶיתֵּר הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: What, not with regard to this they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds: impurity is overridden the public. And Rabbi Yosei holds: impurity is permitted the public.
llm_translation: What is the reason they are arguing about this? Rabbi Meir holds: It is a severe impurity in the community. And Rabbi Yosei holds: It is a lenient impurity in the community.

hebrew_text: וְתִסְבְּרָא? אִי סָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הֶיתֵּר הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר — הַזָּאָה כְּלָל לְמָה לִי? אֶלָּא דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי סָבְרִי טוּמְאָה דְּחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר.
human_translation: And you understand If Rabbi Yosei holds is permitted in the public, why do I sprinkling at all? Rather, everyone, holds that impurity is overridden in the public,
llm_translation: And was it created? If Rabbi Yosei thinks it is permitted in public - why do I need this? Rather, all the people of the world think that it is impure and prohibited in public.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן טְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ מִצְוָה. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן טְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ מִצְוָה.
human_translation: And here disagree with regard to this Rabbi Meir holds: We say that immersion at its time is a mitzva. And Rabbi Yosei holds: We do not say that immersion at its time is a mitzva,
llm_translation: Here in this case they argue, Rabbi Meir holds: We say immersion in its proper time is a commandment. And Rabbi Yosei holds: We do not say immersion in its proper time is a commandment.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לָא אָמְרִינַן טְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ מִצְוָה? וְהָתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה שֵׁם כָּתוּב עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִרְחַץ וְלֹא יָסוּךְ וְלֹא יַעֲמוֹד בִּמְקוֹם הַטִּנּוֹפֶת. נִזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ טְבִילָה שֶׁל מִצְוָה — כּוֹרֵךְ עָלָיו גֶּמִי וְטוֹבֵל. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יוֹרֵד וְטוֹבֵל כְּדַרְכּוֹ, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְשַׁפְשֵׁף.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei hold we do not say that immersion at its time is a mitzva? Wasn’t it taught one who had a name written on his flesh, he neither bathe, nor smear oil nor stand in a place of filth. If an immersion mitzva happened to him, he wraps a reed over and descends and immerses, Rabbi Yosei says: he descends and immerses in his manner, provided that he does not rub
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei thought, did we not say that immersion at its proper time is a commandment? And it was taught: If one had a written name on his flesh - he should not wash, nor anoint, nor stand in a place of defecation. If an immersion of commandment presented itself to him - he ties a reed upon him and immerses. Rabbi Yosei says: He descends and immerses in his usual manner, only he should not rub.

hebrew_text: וְקַיְימָא לַן דְּבִטְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ מִצְוָה קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר: לָא אָמְרִינַן טְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ מִצְוָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: אָמְרִינַן טְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ מִצְוָה. אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לְהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי אָמְרִינַן טְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ מִצְוָה.
human_translation: And we maintain that it is with regard to immersion at the time a mitzva that they disagree. The first tanna holds: We do not say that immersion at its time is a mitzva. And Rabbi Yosei holds: We say that immersion at its time is a mitzva. Rather, that everyone to these tanna’im we say that immersion at its time is a mitzva.
llm_translation: We hold that immersion at its proper time is a mitzvah, for it was taught in the first Tanna: We do not say that immersion at its proper time is a mitzvah, and Rabbi Yosei holds: We say that immersion at its proper time is a mitzvah. Rather, the entire world agrees with these Tannaim that we say immersion at its proper time is a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָמִיפַּלְגִי, רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: מַקְּשִׁינַן הַזָּאָה לִטְבִילָה, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר: לָא מַקְּשִׁינַן הַזָּאָה לִטְבִילָה.
human_translation: And here they disagree with regard to this Rabbi Meir holds: We equate sprinkling with immersion; And Rabbi Yosei holds: We do not equate sprinkling with immersion;
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: "And here in this case they disagree: Rabbi Meir holds: we make the menstruating woman difficult for immersion, and Rabbi Yosei holds: we do not make the menstruating woman difficult for immersion."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים? אִי מַקֵּישׁ הַזָּאָה לִטְבִילָה — אֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים נָמֵי, אִי לָא מַקֵּישׁ הַזָּאָה לִטְבִילָה — אֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה נָמֵי לָא!
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy Priest, If he equates sprinkling with immersion, even the Priest If he does not equate sprinkling with immersion, even the priest who burns the heifer also not
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests? If he compares the sprinkling of the ashes to immersion — even a priest on Yom Kippur indeed, but if he does not compare the sprinkling of the ashes to immersion — even a priest who burns the cow indeed not!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם לָא מַקֵּישׁ, וְכֹהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה מַעֲלָה בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Actually, Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy Priest, does not equate And priest who burns the heifer, merely a higher standard.
llm_translation: Forever not juxtaposing, and a priest who burns the heifer elevates in the world.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵין בֵּין כֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אֶלָּא

llm_translation: As to where did they go, this is what the Rabbis taught: There is no difference between the priest who burns the cow and the High Priest on Yom Kippur, except

hebrew_text: שֶׁזֶּה פְּרִישָׁתוֹ לִקְדוּשָּׁה וְאֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים נוֹגְעִין בּוֹ, וְזֶה פְּרִישָׁתוֹ לְטׇהֳרָה וְאֵין אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים נוֹגְעִין בּוֹ. כְּמַאן — אוֹ רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי. דְּאִי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים — הָא אִיכָּא נָמֵי הָא.
human_translation: that the sequestering of this for sanctity, His brethren, the priests, touch him, the sequestering of that for purity, and his brethren, the priests, not touch him. In accordance with whose either Rabbi Meir or Rabbi Yosei. As, if Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy Priest, isn’t there also this
llm_translation: This is his separation for holiness, and his priestly brothers may touch him, and this is his separation for purity, and his priestly brothers may not touch him. According to whom? Either Rabbi Meir or Rabbi Yosei. For if Rabbi Chanina is the deputy of the priests, then there is a contradiction here.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא רִאשׁוֹן — שֶׁמָּא שְׁלִישִׁי. שֵׁנִי — שֶׁמָּא שְׁלִישִׁי. שְׁלִישִׁי — שֶׁמָּא שְׁלִישִׁי. חֲמִישִׁי — שֶׁמָּא שְׁבִיעִי. שִׁשִּׁי — שֶׁמָּא שְׁבִיעִי. שְׁבִיעִי — שֶׁמָּא שְׁבִיעִי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, strongly objects to Granted, first perhaps the third second perhaps the third third perhaps the third fifth perhaps the seventh sixth perhaps the seventh seventh perhaps the seventh
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, objects to her: The first — perhaps it is the third. The second — perhaps it is the third. The third — perhaps it is the third. The fifth — perhaps it is the seventh. The sixth — perhaps it is the seventh. The seventh — perhaps it is the seventh.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רְבִיעִי לְמָה לִי הַזָּאָה כְּלָל? לָא בִּשְׁלִישִׁי אִיכָּא לְסַפּוֹקֵי, וְלֹא בִּשְׁבִיעִי אִיכָּא לְסַפּוֹקֵי?
human_translation: However, fourth why do I sprinkling at all? Neither with regard to third is there uncertainty, nor with regard to seventh is there uncertainty,
llm_translation: Rather, why do I need the fourth case of the bright spot at all? There is uncertainty on the third day, and there is no uncertainty on the seventh day?

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, הַזָּאָה כׇּל שִׁבְעָה מִי אִיכָּא? וְהָא קַיְימָא לַן דְּהַזָּאָה שְׁבוּת וְאֵינָהּ דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת! אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר — שִׁבְעָה לְבַר מִשַּׁבָּת, הָכָא נָמֵי — שִׁבְעָה לְבַר מֵרְבִיעִי.
human_translation: And to your reasoning, is there sprinkling all seven Don’t we maintain that sprinkling is rabbinic decree and does not override Shabbat. Rather, what have you to say? seven except for Shabbat. Here too, seven except for fourth
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, is there any sevenfold sprinkling of water? But we hold that the sevenfold sprinkling does not override the Sabbath! Rather, what can you say? — Seven sprinklings apart from the Sabbath, here too — seven sprinklings apart from the fourth day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הִלְכָּךְ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, דְּלָא בְּדִידַן תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא, אֶלָּא בִּקְבִיעָא דְיַרְחָא תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא — בִּתְלָתָא בְּתִשְׁרִי בָּעֵי לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי, וְכׇל אֵימַת דְּמִתְרְמֵי תְּלָתָא בְּתִשְׁרִי מַפְרְשִׁינַן לֵיהּ. אֲבָל כֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה, דִּבְדִידַן תַּלְיָא מִילְּתָא — מַפְרְשִׁינַן לֵיהּ בִּרְבִיעִי בְּשַׁבָּת, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנִיתְרְמֵי רְבִיעִי שֶׁלּוֹ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rava said: Therefore, the High Priest on Yom Kippur, the matter is not dependent on us; rather, the matter is dependent on the determination of the month, required to remove on the third of Tishrei, and whenever the third of Tishrei occurs we remove him However, priest who burns the heifer, the matter is dependent on us, we remove him on the fourth day of the week, so that the fourth day of his will occur on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rava said: Therefore, the High Priest on Yom Kippur, since the matter does not depend on us, but rather on the fixed time of the month, the third of Tishrei falls on a Thursday, and whenever the third of Tishrei falls on a Thursday, we separate him to serve. But the priest who burns the Red Heifer, since the matter depends on us, we separate him on the fourth day of the week, on Shabbat, so that his fourth day falls on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: לְלִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין. תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וְכִי לִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין הָיְתָה? וַהֲלֹא לִשְׁכַּת בָּלְווֹטֵי הָיְתָה!
human_translation: to the Chamber of Parhedrin . It was taught Rabbi Yehuda And was it the Chamber of Parhedrin , Wasn’t it the Chamber of Balvatei ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "To the chamber of Parhedrin." It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Yehuda said, "Was there really a chamber of Parhedrin? Wasn't it the chamber of Balvatei!" English translation: "To the chamber of Parhedrin." It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Yehuda said, "Was there really a chamber of Parhedrin? Wasn't it the chamber of Balvatei!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, בַּתְּחִלָּה הָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתָהּ לִשְׁכַּת בָּלְווֹטֵי. וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁנּוֹתְנִין עָלָיו מָמוֹן לַכְּהוּנָּה, וּמַחֲלִיפִין אוֹתָהּ כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ כְּפַרְהֶדְרִין הַלָּלוּ שֶׁמַּחְלִיפִין אוֹתָם כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חוֹדֶשׁ, לְפִיכָךְ הָיוּ קוֹרְאִין אוֹתָהּ לִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין.
human_translation: Rather, initially, they would call it the Chamber of Balvatei , However, because giving money to the Priesthood, replaced every twelve months like the parhedrin who are replaced every twelve months. Therefore, the chamber was called Parhedrin .
llm_translation: Rather, initially they would read it in the room of the Balvatei. And because they would give money for the priesthood upon it, and they would exchange it every twelve months, these Hallel chambers that they would exchange every twelve months, therefore they would read it in the Parhedrin chamber.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַנַּחְתּוֹמִין — לֹא חִיְּיבוּ אוֹתָן חֲכָמִים לְהַפְרִישׁ אֶלָּא תְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר וְחַלָּה.
human_translation: We learned there the Sages required bakers to separate only teruma of the tithe, ḥalla ,
llm_translation: We learned there: Sealed produce — the sages did not obligate separating them, except for the tithe and the dough-offering.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה לָא, דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: Granted, teruma gedola , not as it was taught
llm_translation: In truth, the great terumah is not, as it was taught:

hebrew_text: לְפִי שֶׁשָּׁלַח בְּכׇל גְּבוּלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְרָאָה שֶׁאֵין מַפְרִישִׁין אֶלָּא תְּרוּמָה גְּדוֹלָה בִּלְבָד.
human_translation: because sent throughout all the borders of Yisrael and saw that were separating only teruma gedola
llm_translation: According to the Talmudic text: Because he sent in all the borders of Israel, and saw that they only separate a large tithe alone.

hebrew_text: מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי נָמֵי לָא, הַמּוֹצִיא מֵחֲבֵירוֹ עָלָיו הָרְאָיָה. אֶלָּא מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, נַפְרְשׁוּ וְנַסְּקוּ וְנֵיכְלוּהּ בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם?
human_translation: first tithe and poor man’s tithe The burden of proof rests upon the claimant. However, second tithe, Let them separate take it up and eat it in Jerusalem,
llm_translation: First tithe and poor tithe are not similar, one who transfers from his fellow upon him the responsibility. Rather, second tithe, they should separate, evaluate, and consume it in Jerusalem?

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁפַּרְהֶדְרִין הַלָּלוּ חוֹבְטִין אוֹתָן כׇּל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ, וְאוֹמְרִים לָהֶן: מִכְרוּ בְּזוֹל! מִכְרוּ בְּזוֹל! לָא אַטְרְחוּנְהוּ רַבָּנַן. מַאי פַּרְהֶדְרִין? פּוּרְסֵי.
human_translation: Ulla said: because these parhedrin , beat entire twelve months and tell them: Sell cheaply, sell cheaply. the Sages did not burden them What parhedrin ? appointees [ pursei ]
llm_translation: Ula said: Because of these Pharhedrin, they beat them every twelve months, and say to them: Sell cheaply! Sell cheaply! The Rabbis did not pay attention to them. What are Pharhedrin? Horses.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״יִרְאַת ה׳ תּוֹסִיף יָמִים וּשְׁנוֹת רְשָׁעִים תִּקְצֹרְנָה״, ״יִרְאַת ה׳ תּוֹסִיף יָמִים״ זֶה מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁעָמַד אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת וְעֶשֶׂר שָׁנִים, וְלֹא שִׁמְּשׁוּ בּוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים,
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is which is written: “The fear of the Lord prolongs days, but the years of the wicked will be shortened” The fear of the Lord prolongs days; that First Temple, which stood four hundred and ten years and in only eighteen High Priests served,
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the meaning of what is written: "The fear of the Lord adds days, but the years of the wicked will be shortened"? "The fear of the Lord adds days" refers to the First Temple that stood for four hundred and ten years, and only eighteen high priests served in it.

hebrew_text: ״וּשְׁנוֹת רְשָׁעִים תִּקְצֹרְנָה״ זֶה מִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, שֶׁעָמַד אַרְבַּע מֵאוֹת וְעֶשְׂרִים שָׁנָה וְשִׁמְּשׁוּ בּוֹ יוֹתֵר מִשְּׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת כֹּהֲנִים. צֵא מֵהֶם אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה שֶׁשִּׁמֵּשׁ שִׁמְעוֹן הַצַּדִּיק, וּשְׁמוֹנִים שֶׁשִּׁמֵּשׁ יוֹחָנָן כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, עֶשֶׂר שֶׁשִּׁמֵּשׁ יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּאָבִי, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה שֶׁשִּׁמֵּשׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן חַרְסוֹם, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ צֵא וַחֲשׁוֹב: כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד לֹא הוֹצִיא שְׁנָתוֹ.
human_translation: But the years of the wicked will be shortened; that Second Temple, which stood four hundred and twenty years and in over three hundred High Priests served. deduct from forty years that Shimon HaTzaddik served, and eighty that Yoḥanan the High Priest served, ten that Yishmael ben Pavi served, and some say eleven that Rabbi Elazar ben Ḥarsum served. go out and calculate from this forward Each and every one did not complete his year
llm_translation: "And the years of the wicked shall be shortened" - this is the Second Temple, which stood for four hundred and twenty years, and more than three hundred priests served in it. Among them, forty years served Shimon the Just, and eighty years served Yochanan the High Priest, ten years served Yishmael ben Piavi, and they say that Rabbi Elazar ben Charsum served for eleven years. From here and onwards, go out and calculate: each and every one did not complete his years.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן תּוֹרְתָּא: מִפְּנֵי מָה חָרְבָה שִׁילֹה — מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיוּ בָּהּ שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים: גִּלּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וּבִזְיוֹן קֳדָשִׁים. גִּלּוּי עֲרָיוֹת דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעֵלִי זָקֵן מְאֹד וְשָׁמַע אֵת כׇּל אֲשֶׁר יַעֲשׂוּן בָּנָיו לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֵת אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁכְּבוּן אֶת הַנָּשִׁים הַצּוֹבְאוֹת פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּאָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הָאוֹמֵר בְּנֵי עֵלִי חָטְאוּ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא טוֹעֶה, מִתּוֹךְ
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Torta said: Due to what was Shiloh destroyed due to that there were two matters in Forbidden sexual relations and degradation consecrated items. forbidden sexual relations, as it is written: “Now Eli was very old and he heard what his sons were doing to all of Israel, how they lay with the women who did service at the opening of the Tent of Meeting” And although Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Anyone who says that the sons of Eli sinned is nothing other than mistaken, due to
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Torta said: Why was Shiloh destroyed? Because there were two things in it: Revealing of forbidden relationships, and disrespect of holy things. Revealing of forbidden relationships, as it is written: "Now Eli was very old, and he heard all that his sons did to all Israel, and how they lay with the women who served at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting." And even though Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Anyone who says that the sons of Eli sinned is only mistaken, from the fact that

hebrew_text: שֶׁשִּׁהוּ אֶת קִינֵּיהֶן, מִיהָא מַעֲלֶה עֲלֵיהֶן הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ שְׁכָבוּם.
human_translation: that they deferred their nevertheless, the verse ascribes to them as if they lay them.
llm_translation: They let their nests rest, nevertheless the Scripture ascribes to them as if they laid them.

hebrew_text: בִּזְיוֹן קֳדָשִׁים, דִּכְתִיב: ״גַּם בְּטֶרֶם יַקְטִרוּן אֶת הַחֵלֶב וּבָא נַעַר הַכֹּהֵן וְאָמַר לָאִישׁ הַזּוֹבֵחַ תְּנָה בָשָׂר לִצְלוֹת לַכֹּהֵן וְלֹא יִקַּח מִמְּךָ בָּשָׂר מְבוּשָּׁל כִּי אִם חָי. וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלָיו הָאִישׁ קַטֵּר יַקְטִירוּן כַּיּוֹם הַחֵלֶב וְקַח לְךָ כַּאֲשֶׁר תְּאַוֶּה נַפְשֶׁךָ וְאָמַר לוֹ כִּי עַתָּה תִתֵּן וְאִם לֹא לָקַחְתִּי בְחׇזְקָה. וַתְּהִי חַטַּאת הַנְּעָרִים גְּדוֹלָה מְאֹד אֶת פְּנֵי ה׳ כִּי נִאֲצוּ הָאֲנָשִׁים אֵת מִנְחַת ה׳״.
human_translation: degradation of consecrated items, as it is written: “Before the fat was made burned, the priest’s servant came and said to the man who sacrificed: Hand over some flesh to roast for the priest, for he will not take cooked flesh from you, but raw. And if the man said to him: Let the fat be burnt first and then take as much as you want, then he would say: No, hand it over right now, or I will take it by force. The sin of the young men against the Lord was very great, for the men treated the Lord’s offerings with contempt”
llm_translation: In the disgrace of the holy things, as it is written: "Even before they burned the fat, the priest's servant would come and say to the man who was sacrificing, 'Give the priest meat to roast, for he will not accept boiled meat from you, only raw.' And if the man said to him, 'Let them burn the fat first as is done today, then take as much as you desire,' he would reply, 'No, you must give it to me now, or I will take it by force.' Thus the sin of the young men was very great in the sight of the Lord, for the men treated the offering of the Lord with contempt."

hebrew_text: מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן מִפְּנֵי מָה חָרַב — מִפְּנֵי שְׁלֹשָׁה דְּבָרִים שֶׁהָיוּ בּוֹ: עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְגִלּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים. עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי קָצַר הַמַּצָּע מֵהִשְׂתָּרֵעַ״.
human_translation: Due to what was First Temple destroyed? due to that there were three matters in Idol worship, forbidden sexual relations, and bloodshed. Idol worship, as it is written: “The bed is too short for stretching [ mehistare’a ],
llm_translation: First Temple, why was it destroyed? - Because of three things that were in it: idolatry, sexual immorality, and bloodshed. Idolatry, as it is written: "For the bed is too short to stretch oneself on."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״קָצַר הַמַּצָּע מֵהִשְׂתָּרֵעַ״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: קָצַר מַצָּע זֶה מֵהִשְׂתָּרֵר עָלָיו שְׁנֵי רֵעִים כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: What is “The bed is too short for stretching?” Rabbi Yonatan said: This bed is too short for two counterparts [ re’im ] to dominate [ mehistarer ].
llm_translation: What is "cutting the mattress from being spread out"? Rabbi Yonatan said: Cutting the mattress means that two friends spread it out together.

hebrew_text: ״וְהַמַּסֵּכָה צָרָה כְּהִתְכַּנֵּס״, אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי: כִּי מָטֵי רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן לְהַאי קְרָא בָּכֵי, אֲמַר: מַאן דִּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ ״כּוֹנֵס כַּנֵּד מֵי הַיָּם״, נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ מַסֵּכָה צָרָה?
human_translation: What And the cover [ vehamasseikha ] is too narrow [ tzara ] for gathering [ kehitkannes ]? Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said when Rabbi Yonatan reached this verse, he wept said: For He about Whom it is written: “He gathers [ kones ] waters of the sea together as a heap” the idol [ masseikha ] became a rival [ tzara ]?
llm_translation: "And the covering is tight as it is gathered," Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: When Rabbi Yonatan came to this verse crying, he said: Who is it written about, 'He gathers the waters of the sea as a heap'? Is a tight covering made for him?"

hebrew_text: גִּלּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ יַעַן כִּי גָבְהוּ בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן וַתֵּלַכְנָה נְטוּיוֹת גָּרוֹן וּמְשַׂקְּרוֹת עֵינָיִם הָלוֹךְ וְטָפוֹף תֵּלַכְנָה וּבְרַגְלֵיהֶן תְּעַכַּסְנָה״. ״יַעַן כִּי גָּבְהוּ בְּנוֹת צִיּוֹן״ — שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכוֹת אֲרוּכָּה בְּצַד קְצָרָה. ״וַתֵּלַכְנָה נְטוּיוֹת גָּרוֹן״ — שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכוֹת בְּקוֹמָה זְקוּפָה. ״וּמְשַׂקְּרוֹת עֵינַיִם״ — דַּהֲווֹ מָלְיָין כּוּחְלָא עֵינֵיהֶן. ״הָלוֹךְ וְטָפוֹף תֵּלַכְנָה״ — שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכוֹת עָקֵב בְּצַד גּוּדָל. ״וּבְרַגְלֵיהֶן תְּעַכַּסְנָה״ — אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שֶׁהָיוּ מְבִיאוֹת מוֹר וַאֲפַרְסְמוֹן וּמַנִּיחוֹת בְּמִנְעֲלֵיהֶן, וּכְשֶׁמַּגִּיעוֹת אֵצֶל בַּחוּרֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל בּוֹעֲטוֹת וּמַתִּיזוֹת עֲלֵיהֶן, וּמַכְנִיסִין בָּהֶן יֵצֶר הָרָע כְּאֶרֶס בְּכָעוּס.
human_translation: forbidden sexual relations, it is written: “The Lord says because the daughters of Zion are haughty and walk with outstretched necks and wanton eyes, walking and mincing as they go and making a tinkling with their feet” Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, tall alongside short And walk with outstretched necks, that they would walk with upright stature And wanton eyes, that they would fill their eyes with blue eye shadow Walking and mincing as they go, that they would walk heel to toe, Making a tinkling [ te’akasna ] with their feet, Rabbi Yitzḥak said: that they would bring myrrh and balsam and place in their shoes And once they approached young Jewish men they would stamp and splash toward them and instill the evil inclination into them like venom of a viper [ ke’eres bikhos ].
llm_translation: Revealing nakedness, as it is written: "And Hashem said, 'Because the daughters of Zion are haughty, and walk with outstretched necks, ogling with their eyes, mincing as they go, tinkling with their feet.'" "Because the daughters of Zion are haughty" — they used to walk with long strides. "And walk with outstretched necks" — they used to walk with an erect posture. "Ogling with their eyes" — they would paint their eyes with antimony. "Mincing as they go" — they used to walk delicately. "Tinkling with their feet" — Rabbi Yitzchak said: they used to bring myrrh and balsam and place it in their shoes, and when they reached the young men of Israel, they would kick and scatter it on them, and thereby arouse the evil inclination like a snake in anger.

hebrew_text: שְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְגַם דָּם נָקִי שָׁפַךְ מְנַשֶּׁה [הַרְבֵּה מְאֹד] עַד אֲשֶׁר מִלֵּא אֶת יְרוּשָׁלִַם פֶּה לָפֶה״.
human_translation: bloodshed it is written: “Moreover, Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, until he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another”
llm_translation: The shedding of blood, as it is written: "Moreover, Manasseh shed very much innocent blood, till he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another" (2 Kings 21:16).

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹסְקִין בְּתוֹרָה וּבְמִצְוֹת וּגְמִילוּת חֲסָדִים, מִפְּנֵי מָה חָרַב? מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהָיְתָה בּוֹ שִׂנְאַת חִנָּם. לְלַמֶּדְךָ שֶׁשְּׁקוּלָה שִׂנְאַת חִנָּם כְּנֶגֶד שָׁלֹשׁ עֲבֵירוֹת: עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, גִּלּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים.
human_translation: However, the Second Temple were engaged in Torah mitzvot, and acts of kindness, why was destroyed? due to that there was wanton hatred to teach you that wanton hatred is equivalent to the three transgressions: Idol worship, forbidden sexual relations and bloodshed.
llm_translation: But the second Temple, where they were engaged in Torah, mitzvot, and acts of loving-kindness, why was it destroyed? Because there was baseless hatred among them. To teach you that baseless hatred is equivalent to three transgressions: idolatry, sexual immorality, and bloodshed.

hebrew_text: רְשָׁעִים הָיוּ, אֶלָּא שֶׁתָּלוּ בִּטְחוֹנָם בְּהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. אֲתָאן לְמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, דִּכְתִיב: ״רָאשֶׁיהָ בְּשׁוֹחַד יִשְׁפּוֹטוּ וְכֹהֲנֶיהָ בִּמְחִיר יוֹרוּ וּנְבִיאֶיהָ בְּכֶסֶף יִקְסוֹמוּ וְעַל ה׳ יִשָּׁעֵנוּ לֵאמֹר הֲלֹא ה׳ בְּקִרְבֵּנוּ לֹא תָבוֹא עָלֵינוּ רָעָה״. לְפִיכָךְ הֵבִיא עֲלֵיהֶן הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שָׁלֹשׁ גְּזֵרוֹת כְּנֶגֶד שָׁלֹשׁ עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבְּיָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן בִּגְלַלְכֶם צִיּוֹן שָׂדֶה תֵחָרֵשׁ וִירוּשָׁלִַים עִיִּין תִּהְיֶה וְהַר הַבַּיִת לְבָמוֹת יָעַר״.
human_translation: They were wicked; however, they put their faith in the Holy One, Blessed be He. we have come to First Temple which it is written: “Her chiefs judge for bribes, her priests give rulings for a fee, and her prophets divine for pay; yet they rely on the Lord, saying: The Lord is in our midst, no tragedy will overtake us” Therefore, the Holy One, Blessed be He, brought upon them three decrees corresponding to their three wicked sins, as it is stated: “Therefore, due to you Zion will be plowed as a field, Jerusalem will become heaps of ruins, and the Temple Mount will be a like a shrine in the woods”
llm_translation: Evil were they, but they relied on their trust in the Holy One, blessed be He. They came to the First Temple, as it is written: "Her leaders judge for a bribe, her priests teach for a price, and her prophets divine for money. Yet they lean upon the Lord, saying, 'Is not the Lord in our midst? No evil shall befall us.'" Therefore, the Holy One, blessed be He, brought upon them three decrees corresponding to three sins in their hands, as it is said: "Therefore, because of you, Zion shall be plowed as a field, Jerusalem shall become heaps of ruins, and the Temple Mount like the high places of a forest."

hebrew_text: וּבְמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן לָא הֲוָה בֵּיהּ שִׂנְאַת חִנָּם? וְהָכְתִיב: ״מְגוּרֵי אֶל חֶרֶב הָיוּ אֶת עַמִּי לָכֵן סְפוֹק אֶל יָרֵךְ״, וְאָמַר רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): אֵלּוּ בְּנֵי אָדָם שֶׁאוֹכְלִין וְשׁוֹתִין זֶה עִם זֶה וְדוֹקְרִין זֶה אֶת זֶה בַּחֲרָבוֹת שֶׁבִּלְשׁוֹנָם.
human_translation: And in the First Temple was there no baseless hatred? Isn’t it written: They will be cast before the sword together with my people, therefore strike the thigh” Rabbi Eliezer said: These are people who eat and drink with each other, and stab each other with verbal barbs.
llm_translation: In the First Temple, was there baseless hatred? And it is written: "They were thrust through by the sword, my people, therefore strike upon your thigh." And Rabbi Eliezer said: These are people who eat and drink together and stab each other with their words.

hebrew_text: הַהִיא בִּנְשִׂיאֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל הֲוַאי, דִּכְתִיב: ״זְעַק וְהֵילֵל בֶּן אָדָם כִּי הִיא הָיְתָה בְעַמִּי״, וְתַנְיָא: ״זְעַק וְהֵילֵל בֶּן אָדָם״, יָכוֹל לַכֹּל? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הִיא בְּכׇל נְשִׂיאֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: That was the princes of Israel, as it is written: “Cry and wail, son of man, for this will befall my people”; and it was taught “Cry and wail, son of man, might to all. the verse states: “This will befall all the princes of Israel.”
llm_translation: That one among the princes of Israel, who is it, as it is written: "Howl and wail, son of man, for it has come upon My people," and it was taught: "Howl and wail, son of man," could it be for everyone? The Talmud teaches: "It is for all the princes of Israel."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַויְיהוּ: רִאשׁוֹנִים שֶׁנִּתְגַּלָּה עֲוֹנָם — נִתְגַּלָּה קִצָּם. אַחֲרוֹנִים שֶׁלֹּא נִתְגַּלָּה עֲוֹנָם — לֹא נִתְגַּלָּה קִצָּם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar who both said: the former, whose sin was exposed end their was exposed, the latter, whose sin was not exposed; end their was not exposed.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar who both said: The earlier ones, whose sin was revealed - their end was revealed. The later ones, whose sin was not revealed - their end was not revealed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: טוֹבָה צִפּוֹרְנָן שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹנִים, מִכְּרֵיסוֹ שֶׁל אַחֲרוֹנִים. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַדְּרַבָּה אַחֲרוֹנִים עֲדִיפִי, אַף עַל גַּב דְּאִיכָּא שִׁעְבּוּד מַלְכִיּוֹת — קָא עָסְקִי בְּתוֹרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: בִּירָה תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁחָזְרָה לָרִאשׁוֹנִים וְלֹא חָזְרָה לָאַחֲרוֹנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The fingernails of the former are preferable to the belly of the latter. Reish Lakish said to him: On the contrary, the latter were superior; even though there is subjugation by the kingdoms, they are engaged in Torah study. said to The Temple will prove as it restored to the former. it not restored to the latter.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: The crown of the early ones is good, more than the wealth of the later ones. Reish Lakish said to him: The later ones are greater, even though there is servitude to kingdoms - he is engaged in Torah. He said to him: The tower shall prove it, for it returned to the early ones and did not return to the later ones.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: רִאשׁוֹנִים גְּדוֹלִים, אוֹ אַחֲרוֹנִים גְּדוֹלִים? אָמַר לָהֶם: תְּנוּ עֵינֵיכֶם בַּבִּירָה. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אָמַר לָהֶם: עֵידֵיכֶם בִּירָה,
human_translation: asked Rabbi Elazar: Are the former greater or are the latter greater? He said to them: Look to the Temple Some say He said to them: The Temple is your witness.
llm_translation: They asked Rabbi Elazar: The earlier generations, are they greater, or the later generations? He said to them: Look at the capital city. Some say, he said to them: Your witnesses are in the capital city.

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוֵי סָחֵי בְּיַרְדְּנָא אֲתָא רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה יְהַב לֵיהּ יְדָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֱלָהָא! סָנֵינָא לְכוּ — דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם חוֹמָה הִיא נִבְנֶה עָלֶיהָ טִירַת כָּסֶף וְאִם דֶּלֶת הִיא נָצוּר עָלֶיהָ לוּחַ אָרֶז״. אִם עֲשִׂיתֶם עַצְמְכֶם כְּחוֹמָה וַעֲלִיתֶם כּוּלְּכֶם בִּימֵי עֶזְרָא — נִמְשַׁלְתֶּם כְּכֶסֶף שֶׁאֵין רָקָב שׁוֹלֵט בּוֹ, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁעֲלִיתֶם כִּדְלָתוֹת — נִמְשַׁלְתֶּם כְּאֶרֶז שֶׁהָרָקָב שׁוֹלֵט בּוֹ.
human_translation: Reish Lakish was swimming in the Jordan River Rabba bar bar Ḥana came and gave him a hand said to him: My God! I hate you as it is written: “If she be a wall we will build a silver turret upon her, if she be a door we will cover her with boards of cedar” Had you rendered yourselves like a wall and all ascended in the days of Ezra, you would have been likened to silver, which rot does not infest, Now that you ascended like doors, you are likened to cedar, which rot infests,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish would converse by the Jordan River. Rabba bar bar Ḥana came and gave him a hand. He said to him: "God! I have taught you — as it is written: 'If it is a wall, we will build upon it a tower of silver, and if it is a door, we will enclose it with cedar planks.' If you made yourselves like a wall and elevated yourselves in the days of Ezra — you were compared to silver that does not decay, but now that you have elevated yourselves like doors — you are compared to cedar in which decay reigns."

hebrew_text: מַאי אֶרֶז? אָמַר עוּלָּא: סַסְמָגוֹר. מַאי סַסְמָגוֹר? אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא: בַּת קוֹל. כִּדְתַנְיָא: מִשֶּׁמֵּתוּ נְבִיאִים הָאַחֲרוֹנִים חַגַּי זְכַרְיָה וּמַלְאָכִי נִסְתַּלְּקָה רוּחַ הַקֹּדֶשׁ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, וַעֲדַיִין הָיוּ מִשְׁתַּמְּשִׁין בְּבַת קוֹל.
human_translation: What cedar? Ulla said: It is sasmagor , What sasmagor Rabbi Abba said: Divine Voice, as it was taught After the last prophets Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi died, the Divine Spirit departed from the Jewish people, and they were still utilizing a Divine Voice,
llm_translation: What is "Erez"? Ula said: Sasmagor. What is Sasmagor? Rabbi Abba said: Bat Kol. As it was taught: After the death of the later prophets, Haggai, Zechariah, and Malachi, the Holy Spirit departed from Israel, yet they still used the Bat Kol.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מִי מִשְׁתַּעֵי בַּהֲדֵי רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה? וּמָה רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר), דְּמָרָא דְּאַרְעָא דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל הֲוָה, וְלָא הֲוָה מִשְׁתַּעֵי רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ בַּהֲדֵיהּ, דְּמַאן דְּמִשְׁתַּעֵי רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ בַּהֲדֵיהּ בְּשׁוּקָא, יָהֲבוּ לֵיהּ עִיסְקָא בְּלָא סָהֲדֵי — בַּהֲדֵי רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה מִשְׁתַּעֵי?!
human_translation: And would Reish Lakish speak with Rabba bar bar Ḥana Just as Rabbi Elazar, who was the master of Eretz Yisrael and Reish Lakish would not speak with him a person to whom Reish Lakish speaking in the marketplace, one would give him do business without witnesses; have spoken with Rabba bar bar Ḥana?
llm_translation: Reish Lakish, who engages with Rabba bar bar Ḥana? And what about Rabbi Eliezer, the master of the Land of Israel, who did not engage with Reish Lakish, for whoever engages with Reish Lakish in the marketplace, they should give him a business without witnesses - does Rabba bar bar Ḥana engage?!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא, שְׁדִי גַּבְרָא בֵּינַיְיהוּ: אוֹ רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ הֲוָה וּזְעֵירִי, אוֹ רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה הֲוָה וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר. כִּי אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָאו הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא, אִי נָמֵי סְלִיקוּ כּוּלְּהוּ בִּימֵי עֶזְרָא לָא הֲוָה שָׁרְיָא שְׁכִינָה בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״יַפְתְּ אֱלֹהִים לְיֶפֶת וְיִשְׁכֹּן בְּאׇהֳלֵי שֵׁם״,
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Cast a man between them, was either Reish Lakish and Ze’iri, or Rabba bar bar Ḥana and Rabbi Elazar when came before Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: That is not the reason; even had they all ascended in the days of Ezra, the Divine Presence would not have rested in the Second Temple, as it is written: “God will enlarge Japheth, and dwell in the tents of Shem”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said, there was a demon between them: either Reish Lakish was small, or Rabbah bar bar Ḥana was with Rabbi Elazar. When he came before Rabbi Yoḥanan, he said to him: Is this not the reason? If not, all of them would have ascended in the days of Ezra, the Divine Presence would not have resided in the Second Temple, as it is written: "God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem."

hebrew_text: אַף עַל גַּב דְּ״יַפְתְּ אֱלֹהִים לְיֶפֶת״ — אֵין הַשְּׁכִינָה שׁוֹרָה אֶלָּא בְּאׇהֳלֵי שֵׁם.
human_translation: Although God will enlarge Japheth, the Divine Presence rests only in the tents of Shem,
llm_translation: Even though "God shall enlarge Japheth" - the Divine Presence only dwells in the tents of Shem.

hebrew_text: וּפָרְסָאֵי מְנָא לַן דְּמִיֶּפֶת קָאָתוּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּנֵי יֶפֶת גּוֹמֶר וּמָגוֹג וּמָדַי וְיָוָן וְתוּבָל וּמֶשֶׁךְ וְתִירָס״. גּוֹמֶר — זֶה גֶּרְמַמְיָא, מָגוֹג — זוֹ קַנְדִּיָּא, מָדַי — זוֹ מַקֵדוֹנְיָא, יָוָן — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ, תּוּבָל — זֶה בֵּית אוּנַיְיקִי, מֶשֶׁךְ — זוֹ מוּסְיָא, תִּירָס, פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי סִימַאי וְרַבָּנַן, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַבִּי סִימוֹן וְרַבָּנַן, חַד אָמַר: זוֹ בֵּית תְּרַיְיקִי, וְחַד אָמַר: זוֹ פָּרַס. תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: תִּירָס — זוֹ פָּרַס.
human_translation: From where do we the Persians descend from Japheth? As it is written: “The sons of Japheth were Gomer and Magog and Madai and Javan and Tuval and Meshech and Tiras” Gomer, that is Germamya; Magog, that is Kandiya; Madai, that is Macedonia; Javan, in accordance with its plain meaning, Tuval, that is Beit Unaiki; Meshech, that is Musya. Tiras, Rabbi Simai and the Rabbis disagree, and some say Rabbi Simon and the Rabbis: One said: That is Beit Teraiki, and one said: That is Persia. Rav Yosef taught: Tiras is Persia.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And the Persians we find are descended from Japheth, as it is written: "The sons of Japheth: Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras." Gomer - this is Germany, Magog - this is Rome, Madai - this is Macedonia, Javan - as its name implies, Tubal - this is the city of Onaikis, Meshech - this is Musia, Tiras. Rabbi Simai and the Rabbis disputed it, and some say Rabbi Simon and the Rabbis, one said: this is the city of Teriaki, and one said: this is Persia. Rav Yosef taught: Tiras - this is Persia.

hebrew_text: ״סַבְתָּה וְרַעְמָה וְסַבְתְּכָא״, תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: סַקִּיסְתָּן גַּוָּיְיתָא וְסַקִּיסְתָּן בָּרַיְיתָא, בֵּין חֲדָא לַחֲדָא מְאָה פַּרְסֵי, וְהֶיקֵּפַהּ אַלְפָּא פַּרְסֵי.
human_translation: Sabtah and Raamah and Sabteca” Rav Yosef taught: the inner Sakistan and the outer Sakistan. Between one and the other one hundred parasangs, and the circumference one thousand parasangs.
llm_translation: "The reason and the cause and the reason of the reason," Rav Yosef taught: The circumference of the outer circle and the circumference of the inner circle, from one to the other a hundred Parsa, and its circumference a thousand Parsa.

hebrew_text: ״וַתְּהִי רֵאשִׁית מַמְלַכְתּוֹ בָּבֶל וְאֶרֶךְ וְאַכַּד וְכַלְנֵה״, בָּבֶל — כְּמַשְׁמְעָה, אֶרֶךְ — זֶה אוֹרִיכוּת, וְאַכַּד — זֶה בַּשְׁכַּר, כַּלְנֵה — זֶה נוּפַר נִינְפִי.
human_translation: “And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, Babel in accordance with its plain meaning, Erech, that is Orikhut; and Accad, that is Baskar; Calneh, that is Nofer Ninefi.
llm_translation: "And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh" - Babel - as its name implies, Erech - this is lengthiness, and Accad - this is reward, Calneh - this is the shaking of wings.

hebrew_text: ״מִן הָאָרֶץ הָהִיא יָצָא אַשּׁוּר״, תָּנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: אַשּׁוּר — זֶה סִילַק. ״וַיִּבֶן אֶת נִינְוֵה וְאֶת רְחוֹבוֹת עִיר וְאֶת כָּלַח״, נִינְוֵה — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ, רְחוֹבוֹת עִיר — זוֹ פְּרָת דְּמֵישָׁן, כָּלַח — זוֹ פְּרָת דְּבוֹרְסִיף. ״וְאֶת רֶסֶן בֵּין נִינְוֵה וּבֵין כָּלַח הִיא הָעִיר הַגְּדוֹלָה״, רֶסֶן — זֶה אַקְטִיסְפוֹן. ״הִיא הָעִיר הַגְּדוֹלָה״ — אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם נִינְוֵה הָעִיר הַגְּדוֹלָה, אִם רֶסֶן הָעִיר הַגְּדוֹלָה. כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְנִינְוֵה הָיְתָה עִיר גְּדוֹלָה לֵאלֹהִים מַהֲלַךְ שְׁלֹשֶׁת יָמִים״, הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: נִינְוֵה הִיא הָעִיר הַגְּדוֹלָה.
human_translation: “Out of that land went forth Asshur” Rav Yosef taught: Asshur, that is Silek, “And built Nineveh and Rehoboth-ir and Calah” Nineveh, in accordance with its plain meaning; Rehovoth-ir, that is Perat of Meishan; Calah, that is Perat of Bursif. “And Resen between Nineveh and Calah, it is the great city” Resen, that is Akteisfon. It is the great city; I do not know whether Nineveh the great city, whether Resen the great city. When it says: “And Nineveh was a great city of God, a three-day journey across” you must say Nineveh is the great city.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "From that land came Ashur," Rav Yosef teaches: Ashur - this is Silak. "And he built Nineveh and its streets, the city and Kallah," Nineveh - as its name implies, its streets - this is the Euphrates of Demeishan, Kallah - this is the Euphrates of Deborcif. "And Resen between Nineveh and Kallah, it is the great city," Resen - this is Actisphon. "It is the great city" - I do not know if Nineveh is the great city, or Resen is the great city. When it says, "And Nineveh was a great city to God, a three-day walk," one must say: Nineveh is the great city.

hebrew_text: ״וְשָׁם אֲחִימַן שֵׁשַׁי וְתַלְמַי יְלִידֵי הָעֲנָק״, תָּנָא: אֲחִימַן — מְיוּמָּן שֶׁבָּאַחִים, שֵׁשַׁי — שֶׁמֵּשִׂים אֶת הָאָרֶץ כִּשְׁחִיתוֹת, תַּלְמַי — שֶׁמֵּשִׂים אֶת הָאָרֶץ תְּלָמִים תְּלָמִים. דָּבָר אַחֵר: אֲחִימַן בָּנָה עֲנָת, שֵׁשַׁי בָּנָה אָלוּשׁ, תַּלְמַי בָּנָה תַּלְבּוּשׁ. ״יְלִידֵי הָעֲנָק״ — שֶׁמַּעֲנִיקִין הַחַמָּה בְּקוֹמָתָן.
human_translation: “And there were Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the children of Anak” It was taught: Ahiman skillful [ meyuman ] of his brothers. Sheshai he renders the ground like pits sheḥitot Talmai he renders the ground furrows [ telamim ] Alternatively: Ahiman built Anat; Sheshai built Alush; Talmai built Talbush. The children of Anak that the sun is a necklace [ shema’anikin ] their height.
llm_translation: "And there Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of the Anak." It was taught: Ahiman - trustworthy in his brothers, Sheshai - who made the land like ruins, Talmai - who made the land full of furrows. Another explanation: Ahiman built Anath, Sheshai built Aalud, Talmai built Talbush. "The descendants of the Anak" - who make the sun stand at their height.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר רַבִּי: עֲתִידָה רוֹמִי שֶׁתִּפּוֹל בְּיַד פָּרַס, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן שִׁמְעוּ עֲצַת ה׳ אֲשֶׁר יָעַץ (עַל) אֱדוֹם וּמַחְשְׁבוֹתָיו אֲשֶׁר חָשַׁב (עַל) יוֹשְׁבֵי תֵימָן אִם לֹא יִסְחָבוּם צְעִירֵי הַצֹּאן אִם לֹא יַשִּׁים עֲלֵיהֶם נְוֵהֶם״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said Rabbi said: Rome is destined to fall into the hands of Persia, as it is stated: “Now hear the plan that the Lord has devised for Edom, and the thoughts He has considered for the residents of Teiman. Surely the youngest of the flock will drag them away, surely their habitation will be appalled due to them”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said in the name of Rabbi: Rome is destined to fall into the hands of Persia, as it is stated: "Therefore hear the counsel of the Lord that He has counseled against Edom, and His thoughts that He has thought against the inhabitants of Teman: Surely the least of the flock shall drag them away, surely their habitation shall be desolate."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״צְעִירֵי הַצֹּאן״ פָּרַס הוּא — דִּכְתִיב: ״הָאַיִל אֲשֶׁר רָאִיתָ בַּעַל הַקְּרָנָיִם (הוּא) מַלְכֵי מָדַי וּפָרָס״. וְאֵימָא יָוָן, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַצָּפִיר הַשָּׂעִיר מֶלֶךְ יָוָן״!
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla strongly objected to this. where inferred that this Youngest of the flock, is Persia? as it is written: “The ram that you saw sporting two horns are the kings of Media and Persia” And say Greece, as it is written: “The goat is the king of Greece”
llm_translation: Rabah bar Ulla objects to him: What is the implication that these "young goats of the flock" are Persia? — As it is written: "The ram which you saw with the two horns, they are the kings of Media and Persia." And why not Greece, as it is written: "And the he-goat is the king of Greece!"

hebrew_text: כִּי סְלֵיק רַב חֲבִיבָא בַּר סוֹרְמַקִי, אַמְרַהּ קַמֵּיהּ דְּהָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאן דְּלָא יָדַע פָּרוֹשֵׁי קְרָאֵי מוֹתֵיב תְּיוּבְתָּא לְרַבִּי?! מַאי ״צְעִירֵי הַצֹּאן״ — זוּטְרָא דַּאֲחוֹהִי. דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: תִּירָס — זֶה פָּרַס.
human_translation: When Rav Ḥaviva bar Surmakei ascended he stated before a certain one of the Sages. said to him: One who does not know how to interpret verses raises an objection to Rabbi What The youngest of the flock? the youngest of the brothers, as Rav Yosef taught: Tiras, that is Persia.
llm_translation: When Rav Ḥaviva bar Sormaqi ascended, she said before those scholars, he said to him: "Whoever does not know the interpretations of the verses, brings a contradiction to the Rabbi?!" What is "young sheep" - this is a small lamb. As Rav Yosef taught: "Tiras" - this is a horse.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרַבִּי אִלְעַאי: עֲתִידָה רוֹמִי שֶׁתִּפּוֹל בְּיַד פָּרַס, קַל וָחוֹמֶר: וּמָה מִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן שֶׁבְּנָאוּהוּ בְּנֵי שֵׁם וְהֶחְרִיבוּהוּ כַּשְׂדִּיִּים — נָפְלוּ כַּשְׂדִּיִּים בְּיַד פָּרְסִיִּים. מִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּנָאוּהוּ פָּרְסִיִּים וְהֶחְרִיבוּהוּ רוֹמִיִּים — אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיִּפְּלוּ רוֹמִיִּים בְּיַד פָּרְסִיִּים?
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Elai: Rome is destined to fall into the hands of Persia. an a fortiori Just as the First Temple, that the descendants of Shem built it and the Chaldeans destroyed it, the Chaldeans, fell to Persians, the Second Temple, that the Persians built it and the Romans destroyed it, is it not right that the Romans will fall into the hands of the Persians?
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan in the name of Rabbi Yehuda son of Rabbi Elai: Rome is destined to fall into the hands of Persia, a fortiori: And if the First Temple, built by the descendants of Shem, was destroyed by the Chaldeans — the Chaldeans fell into the hands of the Persians. And if the Second Temple, built by the Persians, was destroyed by the Romans — is it not logical that the Romans will fall into the hands of the Persians?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: עֲתִידָה פָּרַס שֶׁתִּפּוֹל בְּיַד רוֹמִי. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא וְרַב אַסִּי לְרַב: בָּנוֹיֵי בְּיַד סָתוֹרֵי?! אֲמַר לְהוּ: אִין, גְּזֵירַת מֶלֶךְ הִיא. אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, אֲמַר (לֵיהּ): אִינְהוּ נָמֵי הָא קָא סָתְרִי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא.
human_translation: Rav said: Persia is destined to fall into the hands of Rome. Rav Kahana and Rav Asi, said to Rav: The builders into the hands of the destroyers? He said to them: yes, that is the King’s decree. Some say he said to them: They, too, are destroyers of synagogues,
llm_translation: Rav said: Persia will in the future fall into the hands of Rome. Rav Kahana and Rav Assi said to Rav: Is it possible for builders to build with hidden stones?! He said to them: Yes, it is a decree of the king. Some say, he said to them: They too are hiding in the synagogue.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: עֲתִידָה פָּרַס שֶׁתִּפּוֹל בְּיַד רוֹמִי, חֲדָא — דְּסָתְרִי בֵּי כְנִישְׁתָּא, וְעוֹד: גְּזֵירַת מֶלֶךְ הוּא שֶׁיִּפְּלוּ בּוֹנִין בְּיַד סוֹתְרִין. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: אֵין בֶּן דָּוִד בָּא עַד שֶׁתִּפְשׁוֹט מַלְכוּת רוֹמִי הָרְשָׁעָה בְּכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ תִּשְׁעָה חֳדָשִׁים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לָכֵן יִתְּנֵם עַד עֵת יוֹלֵדָה יָלָדָה וְיֶתֶר אֶחָיו יְשׁוּבוּן עַל בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: That was also taught Persia is destined to fall into the hands of Rome. One they destroyed synagogues. And furthermore, it is the King’s decree that the builders into the hands of the destroyers, as Rav Yehuda said Rav said: The son of David will come only when the wicked kingdom of Rome spreads throughout the world for nine months, as it is stated: “Therefore He will give them up until she who is to bear has borne; then the remnants of his brethren will return with the children of Israel”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: The Persian Empire is destined to fall into the hands of Rome, as it is stated: "One — who hides in the synagogues," and furthermore: It is a decree of the king that buildings will fall into the hands of destroyers. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: The son of David will not come until the wicked Roman rule spreads throughout the entire world for nine months, as it is stated: "Therefore, He will give them up until the time when she who is in labor has given birth; then the rest of His brothers will return to the people of Israel."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כׇּל הַלְּשָׁכוֹת שֶׁהָיוּ בְּמִקְדָּשׁ לֹא הָיוּ לָהֶן מְזוּזָה, חוּץ מִלִּשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין, שֶׁהָיָה בָּהּ בֵּית דִּירָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: The Rabbis taught: None of the chambers in the Temple had a mezuza except for the Chamber of Parhedrin , in which there was a place of residence of the High Priest.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: All the chambers that were in the Temple did not have a mezuzah, except for the Chamber of Parhedrin, which served as a residence for the High Priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: וַהֲלֹא כַּמָּה לְשָׁכוֹת הָיוּ בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֶׁהָיָה לָהֶן בֵּית דִּירָה, וְלֹא הָיָה לָהֶן מְזוּזָה? אֶלָּא לִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין גְּזֵירָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: weren’t there several chambers in the Temple in which there was a place of residence they did not have a mezuza ? Rather, the Chamber of Parhedrin was a decree.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: And indeed, how many chambers were there in the Temple that were considered living quarters, yet did not have a mezuzah? Rather, it was a decree for the Chamber of the Parhedrin.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר (רָבָא): קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: כׇּל בַּיִת שֶׁאֵינוֹ עָשׂוּי לִימוֹת הַחַמָּה וְלִימוֹת הַגְּשָׁמִים — אֵינוֹ בַּיִת. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי, וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְהִכֵּיתִי (אֶת) בֵּית הַחוֹרֶף עַל בֵּית הַקָּיִץ״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: ״בֵּית חוֹרֶף״ וּ״בֵית קַיִץ״ אִיקְּרִי, ״בַּיִת״ סְתָמָא לָא אִיקְּרִי.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda Rava said Rabbi Yehuda holds: any house that is not designated for the summer and for the rainy season is not a house Abaye raised an objection to his Isn’t it written: “I will strike the winter-house with the summer-house” said to him: called the winter-house or the summer-house. It is not called a house unmodified.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda holds: Any house that is not made for the days of the sun and the days of rain - is not considered a house. Abaye raised an objection: But it is written, "And I will smite the winter house with the summer house!" He said to him: "Winter house" and "summer house" are what it is called, but a plain "house" is not what it is called.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: סוּכַּת הֶחָג בֶּחָג, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מְחַיֵּיב בְּעֵירוּב וּבִמְזוּזָה וּבְמַעֲשֵׂר!
human_translation: Abaye raised a objection to the sukka the festival on the festival Rabbi Yehuda obligates and the Rabbis exempt And it was taught concerning Rabbi Yehuda obligates in joining and in mezuza and in tithes
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Regarding the sukkah of the festival on the festival, Rabbi Yehuda obligates, and the Sages exempt. And it was taught in a braita: Rabbi Yehuda obligates in eruv, mezuzah, and tithing!

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא מִדְּרַבָּנַן, בִּשְׁלָמָא עֵירוּב וּמְזוּזָה אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מִדְּרַבָּנַן, אֶלָּא מַעֲשֵׂר, מִי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר מִדְּרַבָּנַן?
human_translation: And if you say by rabbinic law granted, joining and mezuza , it is to say by rabbinic law; however, tithes, is it to say by rabbinic law?
llm_translation: And if you say from the words of the Rabbis, regarding Eruv and Mezuzah it is possible to say from the words of the Rabbis, but regarding Ma'aser, who is it possible to say from the words of the Rabbis?

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא אָתֵי לְאַפְרוֹשֵׁי מִן הַחִיּוּב עַל הַפְּטוּר וּמִן הַפְּטוּר עַל הַחִיּוּב.
human_translation: lest one come to separate from the obligated for the exempt or from the exempt for the obligated
llm_translation: Perhaps one might come to distinguish between the obligation upon the exempt and the exemption upon the obligated.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בְּשִׁבְעָה — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּמִיחַיְּיבָא. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה. רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: גָּזְרִינַן שְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה אַטּוּ שִׁבְעָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: During seven everyone agrees that obligated When they disagree the rest of the days of the year, The Rabbis hold: We issue a decree due to seven and Rabbi Yehuda holds: We do not issue decree,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: In seven — everyone agrees that one is not liable. When do they disagree? In the rest of the days of the year. The Rabbis hold: We decree liability for the rest of the days of the year, then also for seven days, and Rabbi Yehuda holds: We do not decree liability for the rest of the days of the year.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְהָא סוּכַּת הֶחָג בֶּחָג קָתָנֵי?
human_translation: Rava said to him: But isn’t it taught The sukka the festival on the festival
llm_translation: Rava said to him: "But isn't the Sukkah of the festival mentioned during the festival?"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּפְטוּרָה. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּשִׁבְעָה. וְסוּכָּה טַעְמָא לְחוּד, וְלִשְׁכָּה טַעְמָא לְחוּד.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: During the rest of the days of the year, everyone agrees that is exempt When they disagree seven And sukka the reason is discrete, and chamber the reason is discrete.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: In the rest of the days of the year, everyone agrees that one is exempt. They only disagree regarding the seven days of Sukkot. The reason for a Sukkah is distinct, and the reason for a Sukkah is distinct.

hebrew_text: סוּכָּה טַעְמָא לְחוּד — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּאָמַר: סוּכָּה דִּירַת קֶבַע בָּעֵינַן, וּמִיחַיְּיבָא בִּמְזוּזָה. וְרַבָּנַן לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּאָמְרִי: סוּכָּה דִּירַת עֲרַאי בָּעֵינַן, וְלָא מִיחַיְּיבָא בִּמְזוּזָה.
human_translation: sukka , the reason is discrete. Rabbi Yehuda to his reasoning, as he said: sukka , we require a permanent residence. obligated in mezuza . The Rabbis to their reasoning, as they say: sukka , we require a temporary residence, not obligated in mezuza .
llm_translation: Sukkah, the reason is distinct - Rabbi Yehudah according to his reason, as he said: A Sukkah of permanent residence we require, and it obligates a mezuzah. And the Rabbis according to their reasons, as they say: A Sukkah of temporary residence we require, and it does not obligate a mezuzah.

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁכָּה טַעְמָא לְחוּד, רַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: דִּירָה בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: דִּירָה בְּעַל כׇּרְחָהּ לֹא שְׁמָהּ דִּירָה, וּמִדְּרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּתַקִּינוּ לַהּ, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל חָבוּשׁ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: And chamber, the reason is discrete. The Rabbis hold: A residence involuntarily is considered a residence. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: A residence involuntarily is not considered a residence. instituted by rabbinic law so that will not say: The High Priest is imprisoned in jail,
llm_translation: The taste of the chamber is distinct, the Rabbis hold: a dwelling by its own will is called a dwelling. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: a dwelling not by its own will is not called a dwelling, and it is from the Rabbis that they instituted for it, so that they should not say: "The High Priest is bound in the House of the Prisoners."

hebrew_text: מַאן תְּנָא לְהָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן:
human_translation: Who taught As the Sages taught:
llm_translation: Who is the Tanna for this that the Rabbis taught:
