hebrew_text: כׇּל הַשְּׁעָרִים שֶׁהָיוּ שָׁם לֹא הָיָה לָהֶם מְזוּזָה, חוּץ מִשַּׁעַר נִיקָנוֹר, שֶׁלִּפְנִים מִמֶּנּוּ לִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין.
human_translation: All the gates that were there did not have a mezuza except for the Gate of Nicanor, as inside the Chamber of Parhedrin ,
llm_translation: All the gates that were there did not have a mezuzah, except for the gate of Nicanoor, which was inside it leading to the chamber of the Parhedrin.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבָּנַן הִיא וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה? דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הִיא גּוּפַהּ גְּזֵירָה, וַאֲנַן נֵיקוּם וְנִגְזוֹר גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, כּוּלַּהּ חֲדָא גְּזֵירָה הִיא.
human_translation: Let us say the Rabbis and not Rabbi Yehuda, as, if Rabbi Yehuda, itself decree, and will we proceed to issue a decree to decree? Even you say Rabbi Yehuda, entire a single decree.
llm_translation: Let us say, the Rabbis, it is, and not Rabbi Yehuda? For if it were Rabbi Yehuda, it is a decree itself, and shall we rise up and decree a decree upon a decree? Even if you were to say it is Rabbi Yehuda, it is all one decree.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״ — אֶחָד שַׁעֲרֵי בָתִּים וְאֶחָד שַׁעֲרֵי חֲצֵירוֹת וְאֶחָד שַׁעֲרֵי מְדִינוֹת וְאֶחָד שַׁעֲרֵי עֲיָירוֹת יֵשׁ בָּהֶן חוֹבַת מִצְוָה לַמָּקוֹם, מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְתַבְתָּם עַל מְזוּזוֹת בֵּיתֶךָ וּבִשְׁעָרֶיךָ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught upon your gates” the gates of houses, and the gates of courtyards, and the gates of cities, and the gates of towns, all obligated the mitzva place, due to that it is stated: “And you will write them upon the doorposts of your houses and upon your gates.”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "In your gates" — one is the gates of houses, and one is the gates of courtyards, and one is the gates of cities, and one is the gates of towns. In them there is an obligation of a mitzvah to the place, as it is stated: "And you shall write them on the doorposts of your house and on your gates."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב סָפְרָא: הָנֵי אֲבוּלֵּי דְמָחוֹזָא מַאי טַעְמָא לָא עֲבַדוּ לְהוּ רַבָּנַן מְזוּזָה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָנְהוּ חִזּוּק לְאַקְרָא דְכוּבֵי הוּא דַּעֲבִידִי. אָמַר לֵיהּ: וְאַקְרָא דְכוּבֵי גּוּפַהּ תִּבְעֵי מְזוּזָה, דְּהָא אִית בַּהּ דִּירָה לְשׁוֹמֵר בֵּית הָאֲסוּרִין, דְּהָא תַּנְיָא: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ בֵּית דִּירָה לְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת חַיֶּיבֶת בִּמְזוּזָה!
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Safra: those gates [ abbulei ] of Meḥoza, what is the reason the Sages did not affix a mezuza on them? said to him: Those made as reinforcement to the fort [ akra ] of turrets said to him: And shouldn’t the fort of turrets itself require a mezuza , since is a residence for the prison guard in As, wasn’t taught A synagogue in which there is a residence for the synagogue attendant requires a mezuza ?
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye said to Rav Safra: Those doorposts of Mehoza, why did the Rabbis not make for them a mezuzah? He said to him: They are strong for the calligraphy of the scribes to be made. He said to him: But the calligraphy of its body requires a mezuzah, for it has a dwelling for the guard of the prison, as it was taught: A synagogue that has a dwelling for the synagogue attendant requires a mezuzah!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִשּׁוּם סַכָּנָה. דְּתַנְיָא: מְזוּזַת יָחִיד נִבְדֶּקֶת פַּעֲמַיִם בַּשָּׁבוּעַ, וְשֶׁל רַבִּים פַּעֲמַיִם בַּיּוֹבֵל.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: due to danger as it was taught The mezuza an individual is examined twice every seven years the public twice in a Jubilee
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: Because of danger. As it was taught: The mezuzah of an individual is checked twice a week, and that of the public is checked twice in the Jubilee year.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּאַרְטָבִין אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה בּוֹדֵק מְזוּזוֹת בַּשּׁוּק הָעֶלְיוֹן שֶׁל צִפּוֹרִי, וּמְצָאוֹ קַסְדּוֹר אֶחָד וְנָטַל מִמֶּנּוּ אֶלֶף זוּז. וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שְׁלוּחֵי מִצְוָה אֵין נִיזּוֹקִין? הֵיכָא דִּקְבִיעַ הֶיזֵּקָא, שָׁאנֵי. דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁמוּאֵל אֵיךְ אֵלֵךְ וְשָׁמַע שָׁאוּל וַהֲרָגָנִי וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ עֶגְלַת בָּקָר תִּקַּח בְּיָדֶךָ וְאָמַרְתָּ לִזְבּוֹחַ לַה׳ בָּאתִי״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident an examiner [ artavin ], who was examining mezuzot in the upper marketplace of Tzippori and a official [ kasdor ] found him and collected one thousand zuz from him. But didn’t Rabbi Elazar say those on the path to perform a mitzva are not harm where danger is permanent it is different, as it is written “And Samuel said: How will I go, and Saul will hear and kill me; and God said: Take in your hand a calf and say: I have come to offer a sacrifice to God”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said: There was an incident in Artavin of a man who was inspecting mezuzot in the upper market of Tzipori, and he found a purse containing one thousand zuz, and he took it. And Rabbi Elazar said: Are emissaries of a mitzvah not harmed? In a case where the damage is established, it is different. As it is written: "And Samuel said, 'How can I go? If Saul hears, he will kill me.' And the Lord said, 'Take a heifer with you and say, "I have come to sacrifice to the Lord."'"

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב כָּהֲנָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: בֵּית הַתֶּבֶן וּבֵית הַבָּקָר וּבֵית הָעֵצִים וּבֵית הָאוֹצָרוֹת פְּטוּרִים מִן הַמְּזוּזָה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַנָּשִׁים נְאוֹתוֹת בָּהֶן. וּמַאי ״נְאוֹתוֹת״? רוֹחֲצוֹת. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה: טַעְמָא דְּרוֹחֲצוֹת, הָא סְתָמָא — חַיָּיבִין? וְהָתַנְיָא: רֶפֶת בָּקָר פְּטוּרָה מִן הַמְּזוּזָה!
human_translation: Rav Kahana taught before Rav Yehuda: A storehouse for hay, and a cattle barn, and a woodshed, and a storehouse are exempt from mezuza , due to that the women make use of them. And what Make use? bathe Rabbi Yehuda said to him: The reason that bathe that standard are obligated But wasn’t it taught A cattle barn is exempt from mezuza ,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Kahana taught before Rav Yehudah: The house of straw, the house of cattle, the house of wood, and the house of treasures are exempt from the mezuzah, because women are adorned with them. And what does "adorned" mean? They wash. Rav Yehudah said to him: The reason for washing, is it because it is a common practice - are they obligated? But it was taught: The cattle pen is exempt from the mezuzah!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַאי ״נְאוֹתוֹת״ — מִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת. וְהָכִי קָתָנֵי: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהַנָּשִׁים מִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת בָּהֶן, פְּטוּרִין. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב כָּהֲנָא: וְשֶׁהַנָּשִׁים מִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת בָּהֶן פְּטוּרִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: רֶפֶת בָּקָר פְּטוּרָה מִן הַמְּזוּזָה, וְשֶׁהַנָּשִׁים מִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת בָּהּ חַיֶּיבֶת בִּמְזוּזָה!
human_translation: Rather, What Make use? adorn and this is teaching: Although the women adorn themselves in them, they are exempt Rav Kahana said to him: the women adorn themselves are exempt But wasn’t it taught A cattle stable is exempt from mezuza , in which women adorn themselves is obligated in mezuza ?
llm_translation: Rather: What is "נְאוֹתוֹת" - adorned. And thus it was taught: Even though women adorn themselves with them, they are exempt. Rav Kahana said to him: And if women adorn themselves with them, they are exempt, and it was taught: A cow's neck is exempt from the mezuzah, but if women adorn themselves with it, it is obligated in mezuzah!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר, מִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת תַּנָּאֵי הִיא? לְדִידִי נָמֵי סְתָמָא תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״בֵּיתֶךָ״ — בֵּיתְךָ הַמְיוּחָד לָךְ, פְּרָט לְבֵית הַתֶּבֶן וּלְבֵית הַבָּקָר וּלְבֵית הָעֵצִים וּלְבֵית הָאוֹצָרוֹת, שֶׁפְּטוּרִין מִן הַמְּזוּזָה, וְיֵשׁ מְחַיְּיבִין.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say, women adorn themselves is tanna’im ? in my standard is also tanna’im , as it was taught of your house, your house designated to the exclusion of a storehouse for hay, and a cattle barn, and a woodshed, and a storehouse, which are exempt from mezuza , and some obligate
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say? Is it a dispute among the Tannaim? According to my opinion, it is a dispute among anonymous Tannaim. As it was taught: "Your house" - your house that is designated for you, excluding the house of straw, the house of cattle, the house of wood, and the house of treasures, which are exempt from the mezuzah, yet there are those who obligate.

hebrew_text: בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ, בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא וּבֵית הַבּוּרְסְקִי וּבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ וּבֵית הַטְּבִילָה, וְשֶׁהַנָּשִׁים נְאוֹתוֹת בָּהֶן פְּטוּרִים מִן הַמְּזוּזָה. רַב כָּהֲנָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ וְרַב יְהוּדָה מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ.
human_translation: Actually they said: a building a bathroom, and a building a tannery [ burseki ], and a bathhouse, and a building immersion, which women make use are exempt from mezuza . Rav Kahana interprets according to his reasoning, and Rav Yehuda interprets according to his reasoning.
llm_translation: In truth they said, the toilet, the barber shop, the bathhouse, and the ritual bath, and since women adorn themselves with them, they are exempt from the mezuzah. Rav Kahana interprets according to his reasons, and Rav Yehudah interprets according to his reasons.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ: ״בֵּיתֶךָ״ — בֵּיתְךָ הַמְיוּחָד לָךְ, פְּרָט לְבֵית הַתֶּבֶן וּלְבֵית הַבָּקָר וּלְבֵית הָעֵצִים וּלְבֵית הָאוֹצָרוֹת, שֶׁפְּטוּרִים מִן הַמְּזוּזָה בִּסְתָם. וְיֵשׁ שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִים בִּסְתָם. בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ: בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא וּבֵית הַבּוּרְסְקִי וּבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ וּבֵית הַטְּבִילָה וְשֶׁהַנָּשִׁים נְאוֹתוֹת בָּהֶן, וּמַאי ״נְאוֹתוֹת״ — רוֹחֲצוֹת, פְּטוּרִין מִן הַמְּזוּזָה.
human_translation: Rav Kahana interprets according to his reasoning: Your house your house that is designated your to the exclusion of a storehouse for hay, and a cattle barn, and a woodshed, and a storehouse, which are exempt from mezuza in standard And some obligate in standard. In truth they said a bathroom, and a tannery, and a bathhouse, and a immersion, which women make use; and what Make use? bathe are exempt from mezuza .
llm_translation: Rav Kahana interprets according to his reasoning: "Your house" - your specifically designated house, excluding the house of straw, the house of cattle, the house of wood, and the house of treasures, which are exempt from the mezuzah by default. And there are those that are obligated by default. In truth they said: the bathroom, the bathhouse, the latrine, the ritual bath, and where women beautify themselves, and what is "beautify themselves" - they wash, exempt from the mezuzah.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ מֶרְחָץ! אַשְׁמְעִינַן מֶרְחָץ דְּרַבִּים וְאַשְׁמְעִינַן מֶרְחָץ דְּיָחִיד. דְּסָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: מֶרְחָץ דְּרַבִּים דִּנְפִישׁ זוּהֲמֵיהּ, אֲבָל מֶרְחָץ דְּיָחִיד דְּלָא נְפִישׁ זוּהֲמֵיהּ — אֵימָא לִיחַיַּיב בִּמְזוּזָה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If so, this is bathhouse. teaches us the bathhouse of the public, and it teaches us the bathhouse of an individual. As it could enter your mind to say: A bathhouse of the public, whose filth is extensive, however, the bathhouse of an individual, whose filth is not extensive, I say it is obligated in mezuza teaches us
llm_translation: So it is, this is referring to a bathhouse! We hear about a bathhouse of the public and we hear about a bathhouse of an individual. When your mind is at ease, I say: a bathhouse of the public, which is frequented by many, but a bathhouse of an individual, which is not frequented by many — I might say that it should be obligated in a mezuzah, this is what we are learning.

hebrew_text: וְרַב יְהוּדָה מְתָרֵץ לְטַעְמֵיהּ, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: ״בֵּיתֶךָ״ — בֵּיתְךָ הַמְיוּחָד לָךְ, פְּרָט לְבֵית הַתֶּבֶן וּבֵית הַבָּקָר וּבֵית הָעֵצִים וּבֵית הָאוֹצָרוֹת שֶׁפְּטוּרִין מִן הַמְּזוּזָה, אֲפִילּוּ מִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת, וְיֵשׁ מְחַיְּיבִין בְּמִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת, אֲבָל סְתָם דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּטוּר. בֶּאֱמֶת אָמְרוּ: בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא וּבֵית הַבּוּרְסְקִי וּבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ וּבֵית הַטְּבִילָה, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהַנָּשִׁים מִתְקַשְּׁטוֹת בָּהֶן פְּטוּרִין מִן הַמְּזוּזָה, מִשּׁוּם דִּנְפִישׁ זוּהֲמֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda interprets according to his reasoning, and this is teaching: Your house your house that is designated your to the exclusion of a storehouse for hay, and a cattle barn, and a woodshed, and a storehouse, which are exempt from mezuza even adorn themselves there. And some obligate in women adorn themselves However, in standard, agrees are exempt from In truth they said a bathroom, and a tannery, and a bathhouse, and a immersion, even though women adorn themselves are exempt from mezuza , because its filth is extensive.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah resolves according to his reasoning, thus it is taught: "Your house" - your house that is designated for you, excluding the house of straw, the house of cattle, the house of wood, and the house of treasures that are exempt from the mezuzah, even if they are adorned. And there are those that obligate in adornments, but in general, everyone is exempt. In truth they said: the house of the toilet, the house of the tannery, the house of the bathhouse, and the house of immersion, even though women adorn themselves in them, they are exempt from the mezuzah, because they are repulsive.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב יְהוּדָה סְתָמָא דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל פָּטוּר, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״בִּשְׁעָרֶיךָ״ — אֶחָד שַׁעֲרֵי בָתִּים וְאֶחָד שַׁעֲרֵי חֲצֵירוֹת וְאֶחָד שַׁעֲרֵי מְדִינוֹת וְאֶחָד שַׁעֲרֵי עֲיָירוֹת, וְרֶפֶת וְלוּלִין וּמַתְבֵּן וְאוֹצְרוֹת יַיִן וְאוֹצְרוֹת שֶׁמֶן חַיָּיבִין בִּמְזוּזָה. יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה אַף
human_translation: And according to Rav Yehuda, standard, everyone agree is exempt from But wasn’t it taught And upon your gates, the gates of houses, and the gates of courtyards, and the gates of cities, and the gates of towns, and a barn, and chicken coops, and a hay storehouse, and wine storehouses, and oil storehouses, all obligated might that I include even
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehudah, the general principle is that all are exempt, and it was taught: "In your gates" — whether the gates of houses, or the gates of courtyards, or the gates of cities, or the gates of towns, and a threshing floor, and a winepress, and a storehouse of wine, and a storehouse of oil, are obligated in a mezuzah. One might think that I should also include...

hebrew_text: בֵּית שַׁעַר, אַכְסַדְרָה וּמִרְפֶּסֶת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּיִת״, מָה בַּיִת מְיוּחָד לְדִירָה, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין מְיוּחָדִין לְדִירָה.
human_translation: a gatehouse, a portico [ akhsadra ], and a balcony the verse states: House; just as a house is designated for residence exclusion of those that are not designated for residence
llm_translation: House, gate, balcony, and terrace - the Talmud teaches: "House," just as a house is designated for dwelling, these have exited that are not designated for dwelling.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה אַף בֵּית הַכִּסֵּא וּבֵית הַבּוּרְסְקִי וּבֵית הַמֶּרְחָץ וּבֵית הַטְּבִילָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּיִת״, מָה בַּיִת הֶעָשׂוּי לְכָבוֹד — אַף כֹּל הֶעָשׂוּי לְכָבוֹד, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין עֲשׂוּיִין לְכָבוֹד.
human_translation: might that I include even a bathroom, and a tannery, and a bathhouse, and a for immersion. the verse states: House; just as a house that is designed to honor so too, all that are designed to honor excluding those that are not designed to honor.
llm_translation: I might have thought to include even the House of the Chair, and the House of the Butcher, and the House of the Bathhouse, and the House of the Mikveh - the Talmud teaches: "House," just as a house made for honor - so too, anything made for honor, these are excluded which are not made for honor.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה אַף הַר הַבַּיִת וְהַלְּשָׁכוֹת וְהָעֲזָרוֹת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּיִת״, מָה בַּיִת שֶׁהוּא חוֹל — אַף כֹּל שֶׁהוּא חוֹל, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁהֵן קוֹדֶשׁ. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: might that I include even Temple Mount and chambers and courtyards. the verse states: House; just as a house that is non-sacred, so too any that is non-sacred excluding those that are sacred. conclusive refutation
llm_translation: I might have thought to include even the Temple Mount, the chambers, and the courtyards - the Talmud teaches: "House," just as the House that is secular - so too, everything that is secular, these that are holy. This is a logical deduction.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא: שִׁשָּׁה שְׁעָרִים פְּטוּרִין מִן הַמְּזוּזָה: בֵּית הַתֶּבֶן, וּבֵית הַבָּקָר, וּבֵית הָעֵצִים, וּבֵית הָאוֹצָרוֹת, וְשַׁעַר הַמָּדִי, וְשַׁעַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְקוֹרֶה, וְשַׁעַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ גָּבוֹהַּ עֲשָׂרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: פָּתְחַתְּ בְּשִׁשָּׁה, וְסָלְקַתְּ בְּשִׁבְעָה!
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda taught before Rava: Six gates are exempt from mezuza : storehouse for hay, cattle barn, and woodshed, and a storehouse, and Median gate, and an unroofed gate, a gate that is not ten high. said to him: You began with six and you concluded with seven.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Shmuel, son of Yehuda, taught before Rava: Six gates are exempt from having a mezuzah: The gate of the house of straw, the gate of the cattle pen, the gate of the woodshed, the gate of the treasury, the Median gate, and a gate that is not roofed and a gate that is not ten handbreadths high. He said to him: You entered with six and exited with seven!

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שַׁעַר הַמָּדִי תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: כִּיפָּה, רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב בִּמְזוּזָה, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִים. וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאִם יֵשׁ בְּרַגְלָהּ עֲשָׂרָה, שֶׁחַיֶּיבֶת בִּמְזוּזָה. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה וְאֵין בְּרַגְלָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה — וְלָאו כְּלוּם הִיא. אִי נָמֵי, יֵשׁ בְּרַגְלָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה וְאֵינָהּ גְּבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה — וְלָאו כְּלוּם הִיא.
human_translation: said to him: Median gate is tanna’im , as it was taught a dome, Rabbi Meir obligates in mezuza , and the Rabbis exempt And they agree that if, at the foot there are ten obligated in mezuza Abaye said: everyone agrees ten high and at the foot there are not three it is nothing. Alternatively, at the foot there are three is not ten high, it is nothing,
llm_translation: He said to him: "The gate of Midian is a teaching." As it was taught: "A basket, Rabbi Meir obligates in a mezuzah, and the Sages exempt. And they are equal that if it has ten handbreadths in its height, it is obligated in a mezuzah." Abaye said: "In the whole world, if it is ten handbreadths high and it does not have three handbreadths in its width — it is nothing. If you say, it has three handbreadths in its width and it is not ten handbreadths high — it is nothing."

hebrew_text: לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בִּגְבוֹהָה עֲשָׂרָה וְיֵשׁ בְּרַגְלָהּ שְׁלֹשָׁה וְאֵין בְּרׇחְבָּהּ אַרְבָּעָה, וְיֵשׁ בָּהּ לָחוֹק לְהַשְׁלִימָהּ לְאַרְבָּעָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: חוֹקְקִין לְהַשְׁלִים. וְרַבָּנַן סָבְרִי: אֵין חוֹקְקִין לְהַשְׁלִים.
human_translation: They disagree only ten and at the foot there are three but no the width four is enough to carve out complete four Rabbi Meir holds one carves out to complete And the Rabbis hold: One does not carve out to complete
llm_translation: They did not disagree except regarding its height, ten cubits, and it has three cubits in its width, and it does not have four cubits in its breadth, and it has a law to complete it to four cubits. Rabbi Meir holds: We carve to complete it. And the Rabbis hold: We do not carve to complete it.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת וּבֵית הָאִשָּׁה וּבֵית הַשּׁוּתָּפִין חַיֶּיבֶת בִּמְזוּזָה. פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״בֵּיתֶךָ״ — וְלֹא בֵּיתָהּ, ״בֵּיתֶךָ״ — וְלֹא בָּתֵּיהֶם, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: The Sages taught A synagogue, a woman’s house, a house partners obligated in mezuza . obvious; Lest you say “Your house,” and not her house; “Your house,” and not their house, teaches us
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A synagogue, a woman's home, and a partnership house are obligated in a mezuzah. Is it not obvious? Lest you say: "Your house" — and not her house, "Your house" — and not their houses, the verse teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי? אָמַר קְרָא: ״לְמַעַן יִרְבּוּ יְמֵיכֶם וִימֵי בְנֵיכֶם״, הָנֵי בָּעוּ חַיֵּי וְהָנֵי לָא בָּעוּ חַיֵּי?!
human_translation: And say indeed so the verse states: “So that your days be numerous, as well as the days of your sons” these require life, and these, do not require life?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And why not say so? The verse says: "So that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children." Some live long lives, while others do not live long lives?! English translation: And why not say so? The verse says: "So that your days may be multiplied, and the days of your children." Some have long lives, while others do not have long lives?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, ״בֵּיתֶךָ״ לְמָה לִי? כִּדְרָבָא, דְּאָמַר רָבָא: דֶּרֶךְ בִּיאָתְךָ, וְכִי עָקַר אִינִישׁ — כַּרְעֵיהּ דְּיַמִּינָא עָקַר בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: Rather, why do I Your house, in accordance with of Rava, as Rava said: the way that you enter And when a person lifts he lifts his right foot first.
llm_translation: Rather, "your house" - what is it to me? Like Rava, for Rava said: The way you enter, and when a person uproots - the right foot is uprooted first.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת וּבֵית הַשּׁוּתָּפִין וּבֵית הָאִשָּׁה מִטַּמְּאִין בִּנְגָעִים. פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״וּבָא אֲשֶׁר לוֹ הַבַּיִת״, ״לוֹ״ — וְלֹא לָהּ, ״לוֹ״ — וְלֹא לָהֶן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: It was taught another A synagogue, a house partners, and a woman’s house become impure with leprosy obvious; Lest you say “And the one whom the house is his will come” His and not hers; his and not theirs, it teaches us
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in another Baraita: A synagogue, a partnership house, and a woman's house are susceptible to impurity from skin afflictions. Is it necessary to state this? What might you have thought? "And the house that the plague is in," "the house" - for him and not for her, "the house" - and not for them, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי! אָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּבֵית אֶרֶץ אֲחוּזַּתְכֶם״. אֶלָּא ״לוֹ״ לְמָה לִי? מִי שֶׁמְּיַיחֵד בֵּיתוֹ לוֹ, שֶׁאֵינוֹ רוֹצֶה לְהַשְׁאִיל כֵּלָיו וְאוֹמֵר שֶׁאֵין לוֹ, הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְפַרְסְמוֹ כְּשֶׁמְּפַנֶּה אֶת בֵּיתוֹ. פְּרָט לְמַשְׁאִיל כֵּלָיו לַאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: And say indeed so the verse states: “In a house of the land of your possession” Rather, why do I His, one who dedicates his house to himself who refuses to lend his vessels and says that he does not have The Holy One, Blessed be He, publicizes his when empty his house This excludes who lends his vessels to others;
llm_translation: And why not say it like this! The verse says: "In your own land." But why "to him"? What do I need it for? One who dedicates his house to him, who does not want to lend his utensils and says he has none, the Holy One, blessed be He, publicizes him as one who withholds when he presents his house. This excludes lending his utensils to others.

hebrew_text: וּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת מִי מִטַּמֵּא בִּנְגָעִים? וְהָתַנְיָא: יָכוֹל יִהְיוּ בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת מִטַּמְּאִין בִּנְגָעִים, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבָא אֲשֶׁר לוֹ הַבַּיִת״ — מִי שֶׁמְיוּחָד לוֹ, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין מְיוּחָדִין לוֹ!
human_translation: And synagogue, does it become impure with leprosy? But wasn’t it taught might that synagogues and study halls become impure with leprosy. the verse states: And the one whom the house is his will come; that is designated for him, excluding those that are not designated for him
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And who is the one who renders a synagogue susceptible to impurity through skin afflictions? And it was taught: Can it be that synagogues and study halls render susceptible to impurity through skin afflictions? The verse teaches: "And the one to whom the house belongs" — those that are designated for him, these are excluded, those that are not designated for him!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — רַבִּי מֵאִיר, הָא — רַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא: בֵּית הַכְּנֶסֶת שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ בֵּית דִּירָה לְחַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת — חַיָּיב בִּמְזוּזָה, וְשֶׁאֵין בָּהּ בֵּית דִּירָה — רַבִּי מֵאִיר מְחַיֵּיב, וַחֲכָמִים פּוֹטְרִין.
human_translation: not difficult, This Rabbi Meir; that the Rabbis, as it was taught A synagogue in which there is a residence for the synagogue attendant is obligated in mezuza , a synagogue in which there is no residence, Rabbi Meir obligates and the Rabbis exempt
llm_translation: Not difficult: this - Rabbi Meir, this - Sages. As it was taught: A synagogue that has a residence for the synagogue attendant - obligated in a mezuzah. And if it does not have a residence - Rabbi Meir obligates, and the Sages exempt.

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא רַבָּנַן, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא — דְּאִית בַּהּ בֵּית דִּירָה, הָא — דְּלֵית בַּהּ בֵּית דִּירָה.
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that the Rabbis, and not difficult. This in which there is a place of residence; that in which there is not a place of residence.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this are both scholars, and it is not difficult: this one — that has a house, this one — that does not have a house.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: הָא וְהָא דְּלֵית בָּהּ בֵּית דִּירָה,
human_translation: And if you wish, say this and that in which there is not a place of residence,
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: This and this, which does not have a dwelling place,

hebrew_text: וְהָא — דִּכְרַכִּים, וְהָא — דִּכְפָרִים.
human_translation: and this in cities. And that in villages,
llm_translation: And this — of Karkim, and this — of Kfarim.

hebrew_text: וְדִכְרַכִּים אֵין מִטַּמֵּא בִּנְגָעִים? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״אֲחוּזַּתְכֶם״, אֲחוּזַּתְכֶם מִטַּמְּאָה בִּנְגָעִים, וְאֵין יְרוּשָׁלָיִם מִטַּמְּאָה בִּנְגָעִים. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲנִי לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי אֶלָּא מְקוֹם מִקְדָּשׁ בִּלְבַד. הָא בָּתֵּי כְנֵסִיּוֹת וּבָתֵּי מִדְרָשׁוֹת מִטַּמְּאִין בִּנְגָעִים, וְאַף עַל גַּב דִּכְרָכִים נִינְהוּ! אֵימָא: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֲנִי לֹא שָׁמַעְתִּי אֶלָּא מְקוֹם מְקוּדָּשׁ בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And do in cities not become ritually impure of leprosy? Wasn’t it taught your possession” your possession becomes ritually impure of leprosy, and Jerusalem does not become ritually impure of leprosy, Rabbi Yehuda said: I heard only the site of the Temple [ mikdash ] alone that synagogues and study halls become ritually impure of leprosy, and even though they in cities. say Rabbi Yehuda said: I heard only a sacred [ mekudash ] site alone.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And courtyards do not become impure with skin afflictions? And it was taught: 'Your possession,' your possession becomes impure with skin afflictions, but Jerusalem does not become impure with skin afflictions. Rabbi Yehuda said: I only heard this regarding the Temple alone. But synagogues and study halls do become impure with skin afflictions, even though they are like courtyards! Say: Rabbi Yehuda said: I only heard this regarding the holy place alone." English translation: "And courtyards do not become impure with skin afflictions? And it was taught: 'Your possession,' your possession becomes impure with skin afflictions, but Jerusalem does not become impure with skin afflictions. Rabbi Yehuda said: I only heard this regarding the Temple alone. But synagogues and study halls do become impure with skin afflictions, even though they are like courtyards! Say: Rabbi Yehuda said: I only heard this regarding the holy place alone."

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? תַּנָּא קַמָּא סָבַר יְרוּשָׁלַיִם לֹא נִתְחַלְּקָה לִשְׁבָטִים, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר יְרוּשָׁלַיִם נִתְחַלְּקָה לִשְׁבָטִים.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? The first tanna holds: Jerusalem was not divided among the tribes Rabbi Yehuda holds: Jerusalem was divided between the tribes
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? It was taught: The first Tanna holds that Jerusalem was not divided among the tribes, and Rabbi Yehuda holds that Jerusalem was divided among the tribes.

hebrew_text: וּבִפְלוּגְתָּא דְּהָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: מֶה הָיָה בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל יְהוּדָה — הַר הַבַּיִת, הַלְּשָׁכוֹת וְהָעֲזָרוֹת. וּמֶה הָיָה בְּחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל בִּנְיָמִין — אוּלָם וְהֵיכָל וּבֵית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, וּרְצוּעָה הָיְתָה יוֹצְאָה מֵחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל יְהוּדָה וְנִכְנֶסֶת לְחֶלְקוֹ שֶׁל בִּנְיָמִין, וּבָהּ הָיָה מִזְבֵּחַ בָּנוּי, וּבִנְיָמִין הַצַּדִּיק הָיָה מִצְטַעֵר עָלֶיהָ לְבׇלְעָהּ בְּכׇל יוֹם,
human_translation: And to the dispute these tanna’im , as it was taught What was in the portion of Judah? the Temple Mount, the chambers, and the courtyards. And what was in the portion of Benjamin? the Entrance Hall and the Sanctuary, and the Holy of Holies. And a strip emerges the portion of Judah and enters the portion of Benjamin on which the altar is built. And Benjamin the righteous would suffer to engulf it every day.
llm_translation: In the dispute of those Tannaim. As it was taught: What was in the portion of Judah? — The Temple Mount, the chambers, and the courtyards. And what was in the portion of Benjamin? — The Hall, the Sanctuary, and the Holy of Holies, and a strip protruded from the portion of Judah and entered the portion of Benjamin, and on it was built an altar. And Benjamin the righteous would grieve over it to swallow it every day.

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״חוֹפֵף עָלָיו כׇּל הַיּוֹם״. לְפִיכָךְ זָכָה בִּנְיָמִין הַצַּדִּיק וְנַעֲשָׂה אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָן לִגְבוּרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבֵין כְּתֵפָיו שָׁכֵן״.
human_translation: that is stated “Ever does he protect him Therefore, Benjamin the righteous was privileged to serve as host [ ushpizekhan ] to the Almighty, as it is stated: “And he rests between his shoulders,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: As it is stated: "He hovers over him all day long." Therefore, Benjamin the Righteous merited and became a dwelling place for valor, as it is stated: "And he dwells between his shoulders." English translation:

hebrew_text: וְהָאִי תַּנָּא סָבַר יְרוּשָׁלַיִם לֹא נִתְחַלְּקָה לִשְׁבָטִים, דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מַשְׂכִּירִין בָּתִּים בִּירוּשָׁלַיִם לְפִי שֶׁאֵינָהּ שֶׁלָּהֶן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בַּר (צָדוֹק) אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא מִטּוֹת. לְפִיכָךְ, עוֹרוֹת קָדָשִׁים — בַּעֲלֵי אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָנִין נוֹטְלִין אוֹתָן בִּזְרוֹעַ. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמִישְׁבַּק אִינִישׁ גּוּלְפָּא וּמַשְׁכָּא לְאוּשְׁפִּיזֵיהּ.
human_translation: And this tanna holds: Jerusalem was not divided among the tribes as it was taught not let houses in Jerusalem because were not theirs. Rabbi Elazar bar Tzadok says: Even beds not Therefore, hides of consecrated animals the hosts take them by force. Abaye said: Learn from it that it is customary for a guest to leave jug and hides to his host.
llm_translation: The Tanna holds that Jerusalem was not divided among the tribes, as it is taught: One may not rent houses in Jerusalem because it does not belong to them. Rabbi Elazar bar (Tzadok) says: Not even beds. Therefore, the hides of holy sacrifices - those who are wealthy take them with their arm. Abaye said: Learn from this, a person should be careful to return a ball and a cushion to its owner.

hebrew_text: וְדִכְפָרִים מִי מִטַּמֵּא בִּנְגָעִים? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״לַאֲחוּזָּה״, עַד שֶׁיִּכְבְּשׁוּ אוֹתָהּ. כָּבְשׁוּ אוֹתָהּ וְלֹא חִלְּקוּהָ לִשְׁבָטִים, חִלְּקוּ לִשְׁבָטִים וְלֹא חִלְּקוּ לְבֵית אָבוֹת, חִלְּקוּ לְבֵית אָבוֹת וְאֵין כׇּל אֶחָד מַכִּיר אֶת שֶׁלּוֹ, מִנַּיִין?
human_translation: And do in villages become impure of leprosy? Wasn’t it taught for a possession, until you conquer it they conquered it but did not divide it among the tribes, they divided among the tribes but did not distribute to the patrilineal families; they distributed to the patrilineal families, but every one does not recognize his from where
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Who is responsible for purifying the cities of refuge from leprosy? And it was taught: "For a possession," until they conquer it. They conquered it and did not divide it among the tribes, they divided it among the tribes and did not divide it among the ancestral houses, they divided it among the ancestral houses and no one recognizes his own, from where? English translation:

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּבָא אֲשֶׁר לוֹ הַבַּיִת״, מִי שֶׁמְיוּחָד לוֹ, יָצָא אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין מְיוּחָדִין לוֹ. אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִּדְשַׁנִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: The verse states: “And the one whom the house is his will come” whom is designated for him excluding those which are not designated for him. Rather, it is clear as we responded initially
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And the one to whom the house belongs," one who is designated for it, these are those who are not designated for it. Rather, like a needle in a haystack.

hebrew_text: וּמַתְקִינִין לוֹ כֹּהֵן אַחֵר. פְּשִׁיטָא אֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל קוֹדֶם תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר — מְחַנְּכִין אוֹתוֹ בְּתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר. אֶלָּא אֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל אַחַר תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, בַּמֶּה מְחַנְּכִין אוֹתוֹ?
human_translation: And they would designate another priest obvious disqualification befell prior to the daily morning offering one initiates with the daily morning offering, However, disqualification befell after the daily morning offering, how does one initiate
llm_translation: And they appoint for him another kohen. It is obvious, if a disqualification occurred in him before the morning daily offering - they inaugurate him with the morning daily offering. Rather, if a disqualification occurred in him after the morning daily offering, with what do they inaugurate him?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה: בְּאַבְנֵט. הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, זֶה הוּא אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לֹא זֶהוּ אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: by belt. This well to the one who said: the belt of the High Priest, is the belt of the common priest, However, according to the one who said: The belt of the High Priest is not the belt of the common priest, what can be said?
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: with a belt. It is left for the one who says that the belt is of the High Priest, this is the belt of the ordinary priest. But for the one who says that the belt is of the High Priest, this is not the belt of the ordinary priest, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לוֹבֵשׁ שְׁמוֹנָה, וּמְהַפֵּךְ בְּצִינּוֹרָא, וְכִדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא: זָר שֶׁהִפֵּךְ בְּצִינּוֹרָא — חַיָּיב מִיתָה. וְרַב פָּפָּא אָמַר:
human_translation: Abaye said: donning eight and turning over with a fork, And in accordance with of Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: A non-priest who turns over with a fork is liable death And Rav Pappa said:
llm_translation: Abaye said: One who wears eight garments, and turns them in a tube, like Rav Huna. For Rav Huna said: A non-Jew who turns garments in a tube - is liable to death. And Rav Papa said:

hebrew_text: עֲבוֹדָתוֹ מְחַנַּכְתּוֹ. מִי לָא תַּנְיָא כׇּל הַכֵּלִים שֶׁעָשָׂה מֹשֶׁה — מְשִׁיחָתָן מְקַדַּשְׁתָּן, מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ — עֲבוֹדָתָן מְחַנַּכְתָּן. הָכָא נָמֵי — עֲבוֹדָתוֹ מְחַנַּכְתּוֹ.
human_translation: his service initiates him. Wasn’t it taught all the vessels that Moses made, their anointment consecrates them. From that forward, their service initiates them Here, too, his service initiates him.
llm_translation: His service is inaugurating him. Who does not teach? All the vessels that Moses made - their anointing sanctifies them. From here on - their service is inaugurating them. Here too - his service is inaugurating him.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, רַבִּי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, חַד אָמַר: שֶׁל כִּלְאַיִם, וְחַד אָמַר: שֶׁל בּוּץ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: the belt of the common priest, Rabbi and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. One said: of diverse kinds And one said: fine linen,
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: The belt of an ordinary priest, Rabbi and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, one said: of linen, and one said: of wool.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי הוּא דְּאָמַר שֶׁל כִּלְאַיִם. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין בֵּין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט אֶלָּא אַבְנֵט, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אַף לֹא אַבְנֵט. אֵימַת? אִי נֵימָא בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה — טוּבָא אִיכָּא: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בִּשְׁמוֹנָה וְהֶדְיוֹט בְּאַרְבָּעָה!
human_translation: Conclude that it is Rabbi who said of diverse kinds, as it was taught The only between a High Priest and a common priest is belt; the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Not even belt when If we say the rest of the days of the year, there are many the High Priest serves eight garments and the common four
llm_translation: The completion of Rabbi Hua who said of Kil'ayim. As it was taught: There is no difference between the High Priest and an ordinary priest except for the belt, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Not even the belt. When? If we say during the rest of the days of the year — there is plenty: the High Priest serves with eight attendants and the ordinary priest with four!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Rather, not Yom Kippur?
llm_translation: Rather no, on the day of atonements.

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי: לָא, לְעוֹלָם בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, וּבְהָנָךְ דְּשָׁוִין.
human_translation: say: No, actually, during the rest of the days of the year. those common
llm_translation: They said: No, forever in the rest of the days of the year, and in the pleasure of dwelling.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר: אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל שֶׁל בּוּץ. בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל שֶׁל כִּלְאַיִם. לֹא נֶחְלְקוּ אֶלָּא בְּאַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט בֵּין בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, בֵּין בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. שֶׁרַבִּי אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל כִּלְאַיִם, וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שֶׁל בּוּץ.
human_translation: When Ravin came he stated the belt of the High Priest on Yom Kippur, everyone agrees of fine linen, the belt of the High Priest during the rest of the days of the year, everyone agrees of diverse kinds. They disagreed only with regard to the belt of the common priest both during the rest of the days of the year and on Yom Kippur, as Rabbi of diverse kinds, and Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says of linen.
llm_translation: When Rabbin came, he said: The belt of the High Priest on Yom Kippur - everyone agrees it is made of linen. On other days of the year - everyone agrees it is made of mixed fibers. They only disagreed regarding the belt of a regular priest, whether on other days of the year or on Yom Kippur. Rabbi says it is of mixed fibers, and Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says it is of linen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: ״עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יִלְבַּשׁ״? לְהָבִיא מִצְנֶפֶת וְאַבְנֵט לַהֲרָמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: We, too, have learned upon his flesh” what does the verse state: “Shall he put upon,” Rabbi Yehuda says: to include mitre belt for the removal of the ashes, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman son of Yitzchak said: We also learned: "Upon his flesh," what is the teaching to say "he shall put on"? To bring a turban and a sash for lifting the ashes, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: לְהָבִיא בִּגְדֵי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, שֶׁהֵן כְּשֵׁרִין לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: שְׁתֵּי תְשׁוּבוֹת בַּדָּבָר. חֲדָא: דְּאַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים לֹא זֶה הוּא אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says to include the garments of the High Priest on Yom Kippur are fit for a common priest. Rabbi says: There are two responses to statement One: The belt of the High Priest on Yom Kippur is not the belt of the common priest
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: to bring the garments of the High Priest on Yom Kippur, which are valid for a regular priest. Rabbi says: there are two opinions on the matter. One: the belt of the High Priest on Yom Kippur is not the same as the belt of a regular priest.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: בְּגָדִים שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמַּשְׁתָּה בָּהֶן קְדוּשָּׁה חֲמוּרָה, תְּשַׁמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן קְדוּשָּׁה קַלָּה? אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יִלְבַּשׁ״? לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשְּׁחָקִין.
human_translation: And furthermore, garments that were used extreme sanctity, will use them minor sanctity? Rather, what does the verse state Shall put on? to include threadbare
llm_translation: And furthermore: with garments that were used for a stringent sanctity, can one use them for a lighter sanctity? Rather, what is the teaching of the verse "he shall put on"? To include the skies.

hebrew_text: וְאַזְדָּא רַבִּי דּוֹסָא לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהִנִּיחָם שָׁם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁטְּעוּנִין גְּנִיזָה. רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אַחֵר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Dosa follows his reasoning, as it was taught and shall leave them there” teaches require interment Rabbi Dosa says: may not use them Yom Kippur a different
llm_translation: And Rabbi Dosa would then go according to his reasoning, as it was taught: "And he shall leave them there," teaches that they require genizah. Rabbi Dosa says: One should not make use of them on the day after Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל וּמִינּוּ אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו, רִאשׁוֹן — חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ, שֵׁנִי — כׇּל מִצְוֹת כְּהוּנָּה גְּדוֹלָה עָלָיו, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: The Sages taught a disqualification befalls and they appointed another in his stead, original returns to his service. second, all the mitzvot of the High Priesthood are upon him. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The sages taught: If a blemish occurred in it and another species in its place, the first one - returns to its service, the second - all the great priestly commandments apply to him, the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: רִאשׁוֹן — חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ, שֵׁנִי — אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לֹא לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְלֹא לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט,
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: original returns to his service, second is fit neither as High Priest nor as a common priest
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: The first — he returns to his service, the second — he is not fitting neither for the High Priest nor for a regular priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּיוֹסֵף בֶּן אִלֵּם בְּצִיפּוֹרִי שֶׁאֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל וּמִינּוּהוּ תַּחְתָּיו, וְאָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: רִאשׁוֹן — חוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ, שֵׁנִי — אֵינוֹ רָאוּי לֹא לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְלֹא לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל — מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה. כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מִשּׁוּם מַעֲלִין בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said an incident involving Yosef ben Elem of Tzippori, disqualification befell a High Priest, appointed him in his stead. the Sages said: original returns to his service, second is fit neither as High Priest nor as a common priest. High Priest, due to hatred, common priest, because One elevates in sanctity and one does not downgrade.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident involving Yosef ben Illem in Tzipori, where a blemish was found in him that disqualified him from serving as a High Priest, and his appointment was given to someone beneath him. The sages said: The first one - he returns to his service, the second one - he is not fit for either the High Priesthood or the regular priesthood. A High Priest - due to enmity. A regular priest, due to elevating in holiness and not lowering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said:
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan:

hebrew_text: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי שֶׁאִם עָבַר וְעָבַד — עֲבוֹדָתוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וּמוֹדֶה רַבִּי יוֹסֵי שֶׁאִם מֵת רִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁחוֹזֵר לַעֲבוֹדָתוֹ.
human_translation: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei And Rabbi Yosei concedes that if violated and served his service is valid. Rav Yehuda said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Yosei conceded that if original dies, returns to his service
llm_translation: Halakha like Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Yosei admits that if one transgressed and performed - his service is valid. Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: Halakha like Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Yosei admits that if the first one died, he returns to his service.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, הָוְיָא לֵיהּ צָרָה מֵחַיִּים. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: obvious. Lest you say would be for him rival wife in lifetime; teaches us
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Peshita! Mahu d'teima, havaya leih tzara mecha'yim. Ka mashma lan." English translation: "It is obvious! What is the reasoning, let there be a distress from life. It is implied to us."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת מַתְקִינִין לוֹ. וְרַבָּנַן נָמֵי, הָא חָיְישִׁי לְשֶׁמָּא? אָמְרִי לָךְ רַבָּנַן: טוּמְאָה שְׁכִיחָא, מִיתָה לָא שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: even designate another wife for the Rabbis: Aren’t they concerned lest the Rabbis said to you: Impurity is common, Death is not common,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even another woman they arrange for him. And the Rabbis also, are they concerned lest? Say to you, the Rabbis: Impurity is common, death is not common.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִם כֵּן, אֵין לַדָּבָר סוֹף. שַׁפִּיר קָא אָמְרִי לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה! וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — אָמַר לָךְ: לְמִיתָה דַחֲדָא — חָיְישִׁינַן. לְמִיתָה דְתַרְתֵּי — לָא חָיְישִׁינַן. וְרַבָּנַן? אִי אִיכָּא לְמֵיחַשׁ — אֲפִילּוּ לְמִיתָה דִּתְרֵין חָיְישִׁינַן.
human_translation: the Rabbis said to If so, there is no end to the matter. spoke well to Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yehuda said to you: For death of one we are concerned; for death of two we are not concerned, And the Rabbis If there is to be concerned even for death of two we are concerned.
llm_translation: They said to him: If so, there is no end to the matter. It is well what they said to Rabbi Yehuda! And Rabbi Yehuda said to you: For a single death penalty - we are concerned. For two death penalties - we are not concerned. And the Rabbis? If there is room for concern - even for two death penalties we are concerned.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, נֵימְרוּ אִינְהוּ לְנַפְשַׁיְיהוּ! אָמְרִי לָךְ רַבָּנַן: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל זָרִיז הוּא. אִי זָרִיז הוּא, לָמָּה מַתְקִינִין כֹּהֵן אַחֵר? כֵּיוָן דְּעָבְדִינַן לֵיהּ צָרָה, כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן דְּמִזְדָּרַז טְפֵי.
human_translation: the Rabbis let them say to their own the Rabbis said to you: The High Priest is vigilant If he is vigilant why do designate another priest once we establish rival, all the more so be more vigilant
llm_translation: The Sages said: They said it for themselves! The Sages said to you: A High Priest is diligent. If he is diligent, why appoint another priest? Since we are causing him distress, all the more so should we appoint a diligent one.

hebrew_text: וּמִי סַגִּי לֵיהּ בְּתַקַּנְתָּא? ״בֵּיתוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָךְ לָאו בֵּיתוֹ הִיא! דִּמְקַדֵּשׁ לַהּ. וְהָא כַּמָּה דְּלָא כָּנֵיס לַהּ — לָאו בֵּיתוֹ הִיא! דְּכָנֵיס לָהּ. אִם כֵּן, הָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים, וְרַחֲמָנָא אָמַר: ״וְכִפֶּר בַּעֲדוֹ וּבְעַד בֵּיתוֹ״, וְלֹא בְּעַד שְׁנֵי בָתִּים!
human_translation: And is designation sufficient for him? The Merciful One stated his house” and this is not his wife He betroths her But As long as he has not married her, she is not his house, that he marries her. If so, has two houses, and the Merciful One said: “And he shall make atonement for himself and for his house” and not for two houses.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who is fitting for her in marriage? 'His house,' the Merciful One said, and this is not his house! For he sanctifies her. And how much more so if he does not enter her — it is not his house! For if he enters her. If so, he would have two houses, and the Merciful One said: 'And he shall make atonement for himself and for his house,' and not for two houses!"

hebrew_text: דַּהֲדַר מְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ. אִי מְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ, הָדְרָא קוּשְׁיַין לְדוּכְתָּא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּמְגָרֵשׁ לַהּ עַל תְּנַאי. דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת [שֶׁתָּמוּתִי. וְדִילְמָא לָא מָיְיתָא, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים!
human_translation: that he then divorces her. If he divorces her, our difficulty is restored to its place. No, necessary where divorces her provisionally, as he says to her: This is your bill of divorce on condition that you die And perhaps neither will die, and has two houses
llm_translation: He shall return her divorce. If he returns her divorce, he will ask for the dowry! It is not necessary, for he returns her divorce conditionally. For he said to her: "Here is your divorce on the condition that I die." And perhaps he will not die, and he will have two houses!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת] שֶׁלֹּא תָּמוּתִי. אִי לָא מָיְתָה — מִיגָּרְשָׁא לַהּ. וְאִי מָיְתָה הָא — קָיְימָא הָךְ. וְדִילְמָא הִיא לָא מָיְתָה, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא דְּהַאי גִּיטָּא, וּמָיְיתָא חֲבֶרְתַּהּ, וְקָם לֵיהּ בְּלֹא בַּיִת!
human_translation: Rather, where said to her, This is your bill of divorce on condition that you will not die If not die, she is divorced if she dies, isn’t that alive And perhaps the not die and her bill of divorce will be bill of divorce, her counterpart leaving without a wife
llm_translation: Rather, he said to her: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that I do not die. If I do not die - it is a divorce for her. And if he dies - it stands as it is. And perhaps she did not die, and he gave her this bill of divorce, and her companion died, and he remains without a home!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּאָמַר לַהּ: עַל מְנָת שֶׁתָּמוּת [אַחַת מִכֶּם]. מָיְתָה הָא — קָיְימָא הָךְ, מָיְתָה הָךְ — הָא קָיְימָא הָא. וְדִילְמָא לָא מָיְיתָא וְלָא חֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ שְׁנֵי בָתִּים?
human_translation: Rather, where said to her: This is your bill of divorce on condition that one of you dies. this dies, that is alive, that dies, isn’t this alive? And perhaps neither one of them die, and he will have two houses.
llm_translation: Rather, he said to her: "In order that one of you may die." If she dies here - this one is fulfilled, if she dies there - that one is fulfilled. And perhaps neither will die and there will be two houses for him?

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד: כִּי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי הָוֵי גִּיטָּא? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: ״הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תִּשְׁתִּי יַיִן כׇּל יְמֵי חַיַּי וְחַיַּיְכִי״ — אֵין זֶה כְּרִיתוּת.
human_translation: And furthermore, Is of that sort bill of divorce? But didn’t Rava say: This is your bill of divorce on condition that you will not drink wine all the days of my life and your life, that is not severance.
llm_translation: And furthermore: for this condition, who will be the giver? And Rava said: "Behold, this is your bill of divorce on the condition that you do not drink wine all the days of your life and your life" - this is not a divorce.

hebrew_text: כׇּל יְמֵי חַיַּי פְּלוֹנִי — הֲרֵי זֶה כְּרִיתוּת!
human_translation: all the days of the life of so-and-so; that is severance.
llm_translation: All the days of my life Ploni - behold, this is excommunication!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תָּמוּת חֲבֶרְתִּיךְ. אִי לָא מָיְתָה חֲבֶרְתַּהּ — מִיגָּרְשָׁא, וְאִי מָיְתָה הָא — הָא קָיְימָא הָא. וְדִילְמָא מָיְיתָא חֲבֶרְתַּהּ בְּפַלְגָא דַעֲבוֹדָה, וְאִיגַּלַּי מִלְּתָא
human_translation: Rather, where said to This is your bill of divorce on condition that your counterpart, will not die. If her counterpart, does not die, is divorced; and if dies, isn’t alive And perhaps her counterpart will die in the middle of the service, and it will become clear
llm_translation: Rather, he said to her: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that your friend does not die." If her friend does not die - she is divorced, and if her friend dies - this bill of divorce is nullified. Perhaps her friend died during the time of the betrothal, and the matter was revealed.

hebrew_text: לְמַפְרֵעַ דְּגִיטָּא דְּהָא לָאו גִּיטָּא הוּא, וְעָבֵיד לֵיהּ עֲבוֹדָה בִּשְׁנֵי בָתִּים! אֶלָּא, דְּאָמַר לַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁתָּמוּת חֲבֶרְתִּיךְ. וְדִילְמָא מָיְיתָא חֲבֶרְתַּהּ, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא דְּהָא גִּיטָּא, וְקָם לֵיהּ בְּלֹא בַּיִת!
human_translation: retroactively that the bill of divorce of this is not a bill of divorce, he performed the service with two houses, Rather, where said to This is your bill of divorce on condition that your counterpart dies. perhaps her counterpart die and the bill of divorce of this is bill of divorce, and remain without a house
llm_translation: Regarding the annulment of a bill of divorce, for this is not a bill of divorce, and he performs labor for her in two houses! Rather, he said to her: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that your friend dies." Perhaps her friend dies, and it becomes a bill of divorce, and he is left without a house!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, דִּמְגָרֵשׁ לְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ. לַחֲדָא אָמַר לַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תָּמוּת חֲבֶרְתִּיךְ, וְלַחֲדָא אָמַר לַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תִּכָּנְסִי לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. וְדִילְמָא לָא מָיְיתָא חֲבֶרְתַּהּ, וְלָא עָיְילָא הִיא לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְהָוֵה לֵיהּ גִּיטָּא דְתַרְוַיְיהוּ גִּיטָּא, וְקָם לֵיהּ בְּלֹא בַּיִת!
human_translation: Rather, he divorces both of them To one, he says: This is your bill of divorce on condition that your counterpart will not die. And to one, he says: This is your bill of divorce on condition that you will not enter the synagogue And perhaps her counterpart not die, and she will not enter the synagogue, the bill of divorce of both is a bill of divorce and he remains without a wife.
llm_translation: Rather, he divorced her to satisfy both of them. To one he said: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you do not die in the company of your friends," and to the other he said: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that you do not enter the synagogue." Perhaps her friend did not die, and she did not go to the synagogue, so the bill of divorce of both of them is valid, and he is left without a wife!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, לַחֲדָא אָמַר לַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁלֹּא תָּמוּת חֲבֶרְתִּיךְ. וְלַחֲדָא אָמַר לַהּ: הֲרֵי זֶה גִּיטֵּיךְ עַל מְנָת שֶׁאֶכָּנֵס אֲנִי לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת. דְּאִי מָיְיתָא הָא — קָיְימָא הָא, וְאִי מָיְיתָא הָא — קָיְימָא הָא. מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? דִּילְמָא מָיְיתָא חֲבֶרְתַּהּ בְּפַלְגָא דַעֲבוֹדָה, וְעָבֵד לֵיהּ עֲבוֹדָה לְמַפְרֵעַ בִּשְׁנֵי בָתִּים? אִי חָזֵי לַהּ דְּקָא בָּעֲיָא לְמֵימַת — קָדֵים אִיהוּ וְעָיֵיל לְבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, וּמְשַׁוֵּי לְגִיטָּא דְּהָא גִּיטָּא לְמַפְרֵעַ.
human_translation: Rather, to one says: This is your bill of divorce on condition that your counterpart does not die. And to one he says: This is your bill of divorce on condition that I will enter the synagogue. If this dies, that one is alive; and if that dies, this is alive. What is there to say Perhaps her counterpart will die in the middle of the service, he performed the service with two houses, If he sees that she seeks, to die, he preemptively enter the synagogue, rendering the bill of divorce of a bill of divorce retroactively.
llm_translation: Rather, one said to her: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that your companions do not die." And another said to her: "Here is your bill of divorce on the condition that I enter the synagogue." If this one dies - this one is upheld, and if this one dies - this one is upheld. What is there to say? Perhaps her companion will die in the middle of work, and he will perform work to evade the condition in two houses? If he sees that she is about to die - he should precede her and go to the synagogue, and he should exchange the bill of divorce of this one for the bill of divorce of that one.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַסִּי, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב עַוִּירָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, שְׁתֵּי יְבָמוֹת הַבָּאוֹת מִבַּיִת אֶחָד, לֹא יִתְיַיבְּמוּ! ״יְבִמְתּוֹ״ ״יְבִמְתּוֹ״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: Rav Asi, and some say Rav Avira, strongly objects to However, if so, two widows of a brother who died without a child [ yevamot ] who come from one house, not be to levirate marriage. his yevama his yevama include
llm_translation: The text reads: "Matkeif la Rav Assi, ve'itema Rav Avira: ela me'atah, shtei yevamot haba'ot mibayit echad, lo yityabemu! 'Yevimto' 'Yevimto' ribah."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב שֵׁרֵבְיָה: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה אֲרוּסָה לֹא תִּתְיַיבֵּם? ״הַחוּצָה״, לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הָאֲרוּסָה.
human_translation: Ravina, and some say Rav Sherevya, strongly objects to this: However, if so, a betrothed not be to levirate marriage, outside to include the betrothed woman.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Ravina raised an objection to this, and Rav She'revya supported it: Rather, from now on, should an engaged woman not be secluded? "Outside," to include the engaged woman.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מַקְרִיב אוֹנֵן, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַיּוֹם. מַאי ״כׇּל הַיּוֹם״? אָמַר רָבָא: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לַהֲבִיאוֹ מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: A High Priest sacrifices acute mourner, does not eat Rabbi Yehuda says: The entire day. What The entire day? is necessary only to bring him from his house.
llm_translation: The sages taught: A high priest may offer the sacrifice even if he is an onen (mourner), but he may not eat it. Rabbi Yehuda says: The entire day. What is meant by "the entire day"? Rava said: It is only necessary to bring it from his house.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: הַשְׁתָּא לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַפּוֹקֵי מַפְּקִינַן לֵיהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: הָיָה עוֹמֵד וּמַקְרִיב עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְשָׁמַע שֶׁמֵּת לוֹ מֵת, מַנִּיחַ עֲבוֹדָתוֹ וְיוֹצֵא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יִגְמוֹר. וְאַתְּ אָמְרַתְּ מַיְיתִינַן לֵיהּ מִתּוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ?
human_translation: Abaye said to him: Now, to Rabbi Yehuda, we remove as it was taught was standing and sacrificing on top of the altar and heard that of his died, he leaves his service and exits the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: He completes and you say we bring from his house
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: This year, for Rabbi Yehuda, we provide him with a substitute, as it is taught: If one was standing and offering a sacrifice on the altar and heard that a relative had died, he leaves his service and departs, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: Let him finish. And you say we bring him from his house?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: מַאי ״כׇּל הַיּוֹם״ —
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: What The entire day?
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: What is "the entire day" —

hebrew_text: לוֹמַר שֶׁאֵינוֹ עוֹבֵד כׇּל הַיּוֹם, גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאכַל. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה לְרָבָא: וּמִי גָּזַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאכַל? וְהָתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף אִשָּׁה אַחֶרֶת מַתְקִינִין לוֹ, שֶׁמָּא תָּמוּת אִשְׁתּוֹ. וְאִי מָיְיתָא אִשְׁתּוֹ עָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה, וְלָא גָּזַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאכַל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם, כֵּיוָן דְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים הוּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא קָא אָכְלִי, הוּא נָמֵי לָא אָתֵי לְמֵיכַל, הָכָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אָכְלִי — הוּא נָמֵי אָתֵי לְמֵיכַל.
human_translation: to say that does not serve for the entire day decree lest eat Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: And did Rabbi Yehuda issue a decree lest he eat? But didn’t we learn Rabbi Yehuda says: even designate another wife for him lest his wife die? And if his wife dies, performs service, and Rabbi Yehuda did not issue a decree lest he eat. said to him: How can be compared? There, since it is Yom Kippur, when everyone does not eat, he too not come to eat. here, when everyone eats, he too come to eat.
llm_translation: To say that he does not work all day, it is a decree lest he eat. Rav Adda bar Ahava said to Rava: Did Rabbi Yehuda decree lest he eat? But we learned: Rabbi Yehuda says: Even another woman may be appointed for him, lest his wife die. And if his wife dies, he will engage in work, and Rabbi Yehuda did not decree lest he eat! He said to him: Is it so now?! There, since it is Yom Kippur, when everyone does not eat, he also does not come to eat. Here, since everyone eats, he also comes to eat.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי חָיְילָא עֲלֵיהּ אֲנִינוּת? וְהָא מִיגָּרְשָׁא! נְהִי דַּאֲנִינוּת לָא חָיְילָא עֲלֵיהּ, אִטְּרוֹדֵי מִי לָא מִיטְּרִיד?
human_translation: And like this, acute mourning take effect on him, she is divorced? Although acute mourning does not take effect on him, is he not troubled
llm_translation: "And this quality, who is responsible for it? Is it not from the winepress! Granted that the quality is not responsible for it, are the clusters not responsible?"

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל שִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים הוּא זוֹרֵק אֶת הַדָּם, וּמַקְטִיר אֶת הַקְּטוֹרֶת, וּמֵיטִיב אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת, וּמַקְרִיב אֶת הָרֹאשׁ וְאֶת הָרֶגֶל. וּשְׁאָר כׇּל הַיָּמִים אִם רָצָה לְהַקְרִיב — מַקְרִיב, שֶׁכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מַקְרִיב חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ, וְנוֹטֵל חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ.
human_translation: all seven days he sprinkles the blood and he burns the incense, and he removes the lamps and he sacrifices the head and the leg On all the other days if wishes to sacrifice he sacrifices them, as the High Priest sacrifices portion first and takes portion first.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "Throughout the seven days, he sprinkles the blood, burns the incense, arranges the lamps, and offers the head and the leg. For the rest of the days, if he wishes to offer, he may offer, as the High Priest offers a portion on the head and takes a portion on the head."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא, דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. דְּאִי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, הָא אָמַר: טָהוֹר שֶׁנָּפְלָה עָלָיו הַזָּאָה טִמְּאַתּוּ, הֵיכִי עָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה!
human_translation: Who taught Rav Ḥisda said: not in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, as if Rabbi Akiva, Didn’t say: ritually pure upon whom a sprinkling fell, it renders him impure? how perform the service?
llm_translation: Gemara: Who is the Tanna? Rav Ḥisda said, not like Rabbi Akiva. For if it were Rabbi Akiva, did he not say: "If a pure object falls on a person, it becomes impure; how can he perform the service?"

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהִזָּה הַטָּהוֹר עַל הַטָּמֵא״. עַל הַטָּמֵא — טָהוֹר, וְעַל הַטָּהוֹר — טָמֵא, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין הַדְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ אֲמוּרִין אֶלָּא בִּדְבָרִים הַמְקַבְּלִים טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: As it was taught “And the pure person will sprinkle it upon the impure person” on the ritually impure pure; but on the pure ritually impure. the statement of Rabbi Akiva. And the Rabbis say: These matters are stated only on items susceptible to impurity,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught: "And he shall sprinkle the clean upon the unclean." Upon the unclean - clean, and upon the clean - unclean, the words of Rabbi Akiva. And the Sages say: These matters are only said regarding matters that can become impure.

hebrew_text: מַאי הִיא — כְּדִתְנַן: נִתְכַּוֵּון לְהַזּוֹת עַל הַבְּהֵמָה וְהִזָּה עַל הָאָדָם, אִם יֵשׁ בָּאֵזוֹב — יִשְׁנֶה. נִתְכַּוֵּון לְהַזּוֹת עַל הָאָדָם וְהִזָּה עַל הַבְּהֵמָה, אִם יֵשׁ בָּאֵזוֹב — לֹא יִשְׁנֶה.
human_translation: What is as we learned intended to sprinkle on an animal, but sprinkle upon person, if on the hyssop he repeat intended to sprinkle on a person but sprinkle upon an animal, if on the hyssop, he not repeat
llm_translation: What is it? - As we learned: If one intends to sprinkle on the animal and instead sprinkles on the person, if there is hyssop - it is valid. If one intends to sprinkle on the person and instead sprinkles on the animal, if there is hyssop - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְהִזָּה הַטָּהוֹר עָלָיו״, מַאי ״עַל הַטָּמֵא״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עַל הַטָּמֵא — טָהוֹר, וְעַל הַטָּהוֹר — טָמֵא. וְרַבָּנַן: הַאי לִדְבָרִים הַמְּקַבְּלִין טוּמְאָה הוּא דַּאֲתָא. אֲבָל הָכָא, קַל וָחוֹמֶר הוּא: אִם עַל הַטָּמֵא — טָהוֹר, עַל הַטָּהוֹר — לֹא כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן!
human_translation: What is the reason for of Rabbi Akiva? let the Merciful One write And the pure person will sprinkle it upon him, What Upon the impure person? Learn from it on the impure pure; but on the pure impure. And the Rabbis that It comes on items susceptible to impurity. However, here, a fortiori If on the impure pure; the pure all the more so not
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Akiva's opinion? It is written: "And he shall sprinkle it upon the clean." What is meant by "upon the unclean"? Understand from it: upon the unclean - clean, and upon the clean - unclean. And the Sages say: This is for matters that accept impurity that it comes. But here, it is a fortiori reasoning: if upon the unclean - clean, then upon the clean - all the more so!

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? הַיְינוּ דְּקָאָמַר שְׁלֹמֹה ״אָמַרְתִּי אֶחְכָּמָה וְהִיא רְחוֹקָה מִמֶּנִּי״. וְרַבָּנַן? הַהוּא לַמַּזֶּה וְלַמַּזִּין עָלָיו — טָהוֹר, וְנוֹגֵעַ בָּהֶן — טָמֵא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva That is what Solomon said: “I said I would become wise, but it eludes me” And the Rabbis The one who sprinkles and the one upon whom one sprinkles pure; but one who touches impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva? That is what it means when Solomon said, "I said, 'I will acquire wisdom,' but it was far from me." And the Rabbis? Regarding that liquid for sprinkling and for sprinkling upon it - it is pure, and one who touches them - is impure.

hebrew_text: וּמַזֶּה טָהוֹר? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וּמַזֵּה מֵי הַנִּדָּה יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו״. מַאי ״מַזֶּה״ — נוֹגֵעַ. וְהָכְתִיב ״מַזֶּה״, וְהָא כְּתִיב ״נוֹגֵעַ״? וְעוֹד: מַזֶּה בָּעֵי כִּיבּוּס בְּגָדִים, נוֹגֵעַ לָא בָּעֵי כִּבּוּס בְּגָדִים!
human_translation: Is one who sprinkles pure? Isn’t it written: “He who sprinkles the purification waters will wash his clothes, What He who sprinkles? He who touches. But isn’t it written: He who sprinkles? And isn’t it written he who touches? And furthermore, one who sprinkles requires washing clothes, one who touches does not require washing clothes.
llm_translation: "And what is considered pure? And it is written: 'And he who touches the water of impurity shall wash his clothes.' What is 'considered'? — Touching. And it is written 'considered,' but isn't it written 'touches'? Furthermore, 'considered' requires laundering clothes, 'touches' does not require laundering clothes!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַאי ״מַזֶּה״ — נוֹשֵׂא. וְנִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״נוֹשֵׂא״, מַאי טַעְמָא כְּתִיב ״מַזֶּה״? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּבָעֵינַן שִׁיעוּר הַזָּאָה.
human_translation: Rather, What He who sprinkles? one who carries But let the Merciful One write: One who carries; what is the reason he who sprinkles is written This teaches us must measure sprinkling.
llm_translation: Rather: What is "mazeh" - it carries. And it is written by the Merciful One "carries," what is the reason it is written "mazeh"? This teaches us that we require the measure of the olive's volume.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הַזָּאָה צְרִיכָה שִׁיעוּר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר: הַזָּאָה אֵין צְרִיכָה שִׁיעוּר, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר! אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הַזָּאָה אֵין צְרִיכָא שִׁיעוּר, הָנֵי מִילֵּי אַגַּבָּא דְגַבְרָא, אֲבָל בְּמָנָא — צְרִיכָה שִׁיעוּר. דִּתְנַן: כַּמָּה יְהֵא בָּהֶן וִיהֵא כְּדֵי הַזָּאָה — כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּטְבּוֹל
human_translation: This well to the one who said sprinkling requires a measure However, to the one who said sprinkling does not require a measure what can be said? Even to the one who said sprinkling does not require a measure that applies the back of the man; However, in the vessel measure is required, as we learned How much be in will be equivalent sprinkling? equivalent to dip
llm_translation: The one who says: a "zavah" requires a measure. Rather, the one who says: a "zavah" does not require a measure, what can be said? Even according to the one who says a "zavah" does not require a measure, these matters are regarding a man's body, but with a utensil — a measure is required. As we learned: How much water should there be in them to be enough for immersion — enough for the "zavah" to immerse.

hebrew_text: רָאשֵׁי גִבְעוֹלִין וְיַזֶּה. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, דְּעָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא, וּלְפַנְיָא מַדּוּ עֲלֵיהּ, וְטָבֵיל וְעָבֵיד הֶעֱרֵב הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ.
human_translation: the tops of the stems and sprinkle it. Abaye said: Even you say Rabbi Akiva, performs the service the entire day and toward the evening sprinkle upon him. immerses and observes until sunset,
llm_translation: Heads of stalks and grain. Abaye said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Akiva, who performed all the work every day, and before him it was piled up, and he immersed and performed the evening service before sunset.

hebrew_text: וּמַקְטִיר אֶת הַקְּטוֹרֶת וּמֵטִיב אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת. אַלְמָא קְטוֹרֶת בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר נֵרוֹת. וּרְמִינְהוּ: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בְּדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי, וּמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בַּמְּנוֹרָה, וּמִי שֶׁזָּכָה בַּקְּטוֹרֶת!
human_translation: burns the incense and removes the lamps. Apparently, incense first, and then the lamps And raises a contradiction who was privileged removal of the ashes from the inner altar, the one who was privileged the candelabrum, the one who is privileged the incense.
llm_translation: He offers the incense and arranges the lamps. This implies that the incense comes first and then the lamps. And we raise a dilemma: Who merits the arrangement of the inner altar, and who merits the arrangement of the menorah, and who merits the offering of the incense!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאן תָּנָא תָּמִיד, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִישׁ הַמִּצְפָּה הוּא. וְהָא אִיפְּכָא שָׁמְעִינַן לֵיהּ, דִּתְנַן: בָּא לוֹ לְקֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית — נוֹתֵן מִזְרָחָה צָפוֹנָה, מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית — נוֹתֵן מַעֲרָבָה דָּרוֹמָה.
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Who is taught Tamid ? It is Rabbi Shimon Ish HaMitzpa, But didn’t we learn the opposite, as we learned He comes to the northeast corner sprinkles northeast southwest corner sprinkles southwest
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Who is the Tanna of the Talmud? Rabbi Shimon is the man of Mizpeh. And the contradiction we heard about him, for we learned: If one comes to the corner of the northeast, he should place it in the northeast, if it is the southwest corner, he should place it in the southwest.

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִישׁ הַמִּצְפָּה מְשַׁנֶּה בַּתָּמִיד: מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית — נוֹתֵן מִזְרָחָה צָפוֹנָה. מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית — נוֹתֵן מַעֲרָבָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹתֵן דָּרוֹמָה.
human_translation: And it was taught concerning Rabbi Shimon Ish HaMitzpa changes the daily offering northeast sprinkles northeast southwest he sprinkles west and then sprinkles south
llm_translation: He teaches about it, Rabbi Shimon, man of the watchtower, expounds in the Tamid: From the east to the north - one places from the east to the north. From the west to the south - one places from the west, and afterwards places from the south.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאן תְּנָא סֵדֶר יוֹמָא — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִישׁ הַמִּצְפָּה הוּא.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Who taught tractate Yoma ? It is Rabbi Shimon Ish HaMitzpa,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: Who is the Tanna who arranged the order of the day? It is Rabbi Shimon Ish HaMitzpah.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִי סֵדֶר יוֹמָא אַסֵּדֶר יוֹמָא, דִּתְנַן: פַּיִיס הַשֵּׁנִי — מִי שׁוֹחֵט, מִי זוֹרֵק, מִי מְדַשֵּׁן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי, וּמִי מְדַשֵּׁן אֶת הַמְנוֹרָה, וּמִי מַעֲלֶה אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ. פַּיִיס הַשְּׁלִישִׁי — חֲדָשִׁים לַקְּטוֹרֶת בּוֹאוּ וְהָפִיסוּ!
human_translation: raises a contradiction tractate Yoma against tractate Yoma , as we learned The second lottery Who slaughters who sprinkles who removes the ashes the inner altar; and who removes the ashes the candelabrum; and who takes the limbs up to the ramp the third lottery. new to the incense participate in the lottery
llm_translation: And Rami will arrange a day, I will arrange a day, as we learned: The second group - who slaughters, who sprinkles, who cleanses the inner altar, who cleanses the menorah, and who brings limbs to the ramp. The third group - fresh ingredients for the incense, come and arrange them!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בַּהֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת, כָּאן בַּהֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת.
human_translation: Abaye said: not difficult. Here, the removal two lamps, there, the removal five lamps,
llm_translation: Abaye said, it is not difficult: here in the case of extinguishing two lamps, here in the case of extinguishing five lamps.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּבִקְטוֹרֶת מַפְסֵיק לְהוּ? וְהָא אַבָּיֵי מְסַדֵּר מַעֲרָכָה מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דִּגְמָרָא, בְּדַם הַתָּמִיד מַפְסֵיק לְהוּ! אָמְרִי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָהִיא לְאַבָּא שָׁאוּל, הָא לְרַבָּנַן. דְּתַנְיָא: לֹא יֵיטִיב אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת וְאַחַר כָּךְ יַקְטִיר, אֶלָּא יַקְטִיר וְאַחַר כָּךְ יֵיטִיב. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: מֵטִיב, וְאַחַר כָּךְ מַקְטִיר.
human_translation: Is that to say that the incense interposes But Abaye related the order of the priestly functions in the name of tradition, didn’t the blood of the daily offering that interposed between say not difficult. That Abba Shaul, this the Rabbis, as it was taught One not remove the lamps and then burn rather one should burn and then remove Abba Shaul says: One removes and then burns
llm_translation: In the matter of the incense, does it interrupt for them? But Abaye arranges the order of the service in the name of tradition, with the blood of the daily offering it interrupts for them! They said, it is not difficult: that is for Abba Shaul, this is for the Rabbis. As it was taught: One should not trim the lamps and then burn the incense, rather one should burn the incense and then trim the lamps. Abba Shaul says: Trim, and then burn.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל? דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר בְּהֵיטִיבוֹ אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת״, וַהֲדַר ״יַקְטִירֶנָּה״. וְרַבָּנַן? מַאי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא:
human_translation: What is the rationale Abba Shaul? as it is written: “Every morning when he removes the ashes from the lamps, and then “He shall burn it” And the Rabbis, What is the Merciful One saying?
llm_translation: What is the reason for Abba Saul? As it is written: "In the morning, in the morning, when he sets up the lamps," and then, "And he shall burn it." And the Rabbis? What is the Merciful One saying?

hebrew_text: בְּעִידָּן הֲטָבָה תְּהֵא מִקְּטַר קְטוֹרֶת. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבְהַעֲלוֹת אַהֲרֹן אֶת הַנֵּרֹת בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם יַקְטִירֶנָּה״, הָכִי נָמֵי דִּבְרֵישָׁא מַדְלִיק נֵרוֹת וַהֲדַר מַקְטִיר קְטוֹרֶת שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם?! וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״מֵעֶרֶב עַד בֹּקֶר״,
human_translation: At the time of removal you shall burn the incense, As, if you do not say so afternoon which it is written: “And when Aaron lights the lamps in the afternoon he shall burn it” this too, initially lights the lamps and then burns the afternoon incense? And if you say indeed, so, wasn’t taught from evening until morning
llm_translation: In the time of goodness, the incense should be offered. For if you do not say so, between the evenings, as it is written: "And when Aaron kindles the lamps between the evenings, he shall burn it," so too in the beginning, he lights the lamps and then offers the incense of between the evenings?! And if you say so, it was taught: "From evening until morning."

hebrew_text: תֵּן לָהּ מִדָּתָהּ, שֶׁתְּהֵא דּוֹלֶקֶת וְהוֹלֶכֶת כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה מֵעֶרֶב וְעַד בֹּקֶר. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״מֵעֶרֶב עַד בֹּקֶר״, אֵין לְךָ עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁכְּשֵׁרָה מֵעֶרֶב עַד בֹּקֶר אֶלָּא זוֹ בִּלְבַד. אֶלָּא מַאי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא — בְּעִידָּן הַדְלָקָה תְּהֵא מִקְּטַר קְטוֹרֶת, הָכָא נָמֵי: בְּעִידָּן הֲטָבָה תְּהֵא מִקְּטַר קְטוֹרֶת.
human_translation: Give its measure it will continue to burn all night from evening until morning. Alternatively, From evening to morning, you have only this service that is valid from evening to morning Rather, what is the Merciful One saying at the time of lighting you shall burn the incense, here too, at the time of removal you shall burn the incense,
llm_translation: Give to her her measure, that she may burn and walk all night from evening until morning. Another explanation: "from evening until morning," you have no service that is valid from evening until morning except this alone. Rather, what is the Merciful One saying? During the time of lighting, she should offer the incense, here too: during the time of blessing, she should offer the incense.

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּא שָׁאוּל אָמַר לָךְ: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דִּכְתִיב: ״אוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: And Abba Shaul said to you It is different there, as it is written: it oto
llm_translation: And Abba Saul said to you: The difference there is as it is written: "it."

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָא — רַבָּנַן, הָא — אַבָּא שָׁאוּל. בְּמַאי אוֹקֵימְתָּא לְמַתְנִיתִין דְּהָכָא — כְּרַבָּנַן, פַּיִיס — כְּאַבָּא שָׁאוּל,
human_translation: Rav Pappa said not difficult, This the Rabbis; that Abba Shaul. which is the mishna here established? in accordance with the Rabbis. lottery Abba Shaul.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Not difficult, here - the Rabbis, here - Abba Saul. With what do you establish the Mishnah here - like the Rabbis, you reconcile - like Abba Saul.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא סֵיפָא: הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ אֶת הַתָּמִיד, קְרָצוֹ וּמֵרַק אַחֵר שְׁחִיטָה עַל יָדוֹ, נִכְנַס לְהַקְטִיר אֶת הַקְּטוֹרֶת וּלְהֵיטִיב אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת — אֲתָאן לְרַבָּנַן. רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן, וּמְצִיעֲתָא אַבָּא שָׁאוּל! אָמַר לְךָ רַב פָּפָּא: אִין, רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן, וּמְצִיעֲתָא אַבָּא שָׁאוּל.
human_translation: Say the latter clause They brought him the the daily offering that he slaughtered And different completed slaughter on his behalf. he entered to burn the incense and to remove the lamps we have arrived at the Rabbis first clause and last clause the Rabbis, middle clause Abba Shaul. Rav Pappa said to you: Indeed, first clause and last clause the Rabbis, middle clause Abba Shaul.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Eima seifa: hevi'u lo et ha'tamid, k'ratzo u'merak acher shechitah al yado, nichnas le'haktir et ha'ketoret u'leheitiv et ha'nerot - atan l'rabbana. Reisha ve'seifa rabbana, u'metzi'ata Abba Sha'ul! Amar lecha Rav Papa: ein, reisha ve'seifa rabbana, u'metzi'ata Abba Sha'ul." English translation: "Say the latter part: they brought him the daily offering, he would skin and clean it after slaughtering it himself, then he would enter to burn the incense and arrange the lamps - they came to the sages. The beginning and the end are the sages, and the intermediary is Abba Sha'ul! Rav Papa said to you: no, the beginning and the end are the sages, and the intermediary is Abba Sha'ul."
