hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא אַבָּיֵי לָא אָמַר כְּרַב פָּפָּא, רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא רַבָּנַן וּמְצִיעֲתָא אַבָּא שָׁאוּל לָא מוֹקֵים לַהּ. אֶלָּא רַב פָּפָּא, מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אָמַר כְּאַבַּיֵּי? אָמַר לָךְ: תְּנָא בְּרֵישָׁא הֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת, וַהֲדַר הֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת?
human_translation: Granted, Abaye does not say in accordance with Rav Pappa, not establish first clause and last clause the Rabbis middle clause Abba Shaul. However, Rav Pappa, what is the reason he did not say Abaye said to you in the first clause taught removal two lamps, and then removal five lamps,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Indeed, Abaye did not say like Rav Papa, the beginning and the end are of the Rabbis, and the conclusion is not established for him. Rather, Rav Papa, what is the reason he did not say like Abaye? I will tell you: It was taught in the beginning, "He improved two lamps," and then he improved five lamps? English translation:

hebrew_text: וְאַבָּיֵי אָמַר לָךְ: אוֹרוֹיֵי בְּעָלְמָא הוּא דְּקָא מוֹרֵי, וְסִדְרָא הָא הֲדַר תָּנֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And Abaye said to you a general directive And the sequence, the then teaches
llm_translation: And Abbaye said to you: It is the light of the world that they teach, and the order, this, repeat to him.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא: בָּא לוֹ לְקֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית — נוֹתֵן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית — נוֹתֵן מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִישׁ הַמִּצְפָּה מְשַׁנֶּה בַּתָּמִיד, בָּא לוֹ לְקֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית — נוֹתֵן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית — נוֹתֵן מַעֲרָבָה וְאַחַר כָּךְ נוֹתֵן דָּרוֹמָה. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אִישׁ הַמִּצְפָּה?
human_translation: the matter itself: comes to the northeast corner sprinkles northeast southwest corner sprinkles southwest And it was taught concerning Rabbi Shimon Ish HaMitzpa changes the daily offering northeast sprinkles northeast southwest he sprinkles west and then sprinkles south What is the rationale Rabbi Shimon Ish HaMitzpa,
llm_translation: Body: If one comes to the corner of the northeast — he places the northeast, if it is the southwest — he places the southwest. And it was taught about this: Rabbi Shimon, the man from the watchtower, repeated regarding the continual offering, if one comes to the corner of the northeast — he places the northeast, if it is the southwest — he places the southwest, and afterwards he places the south. What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon, the man from the watchtower?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם חַד דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּשְׂעִיר עִזִּים אֶחָד לְחַטָּאת לַה׳ עַל עוֹלַת הַתָּמִיד יֵעָשֶׂה וְנִסְכּוֹ״, עוֹלָה הִיא, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: עֲבֵיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֵׂה חַטָּאת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of one of the school of Rabbi Yannai the verse states: “And one goat as a sin-offering to the Lord; it shall be offered aside from the daily burnt-offering and its libation” a burnt-offering the Merciful One said: Perform with it the procedure of a sin-offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of the school of Rabbi Yannai, a verse states: "And one male goat for a sin offering to the Lord shall be offered in addition to the regular burnt offering with its drink offering." It is a burnt offering, and the Merciful One said: "Let it serve as a sin offering."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? נוֹתֵן אַחַת שֶׁהִיא שְׁתַּיִם כְּמַעֲשֵׂה עוֹלָה, שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן שְׁתַּיִם כְּמַעֲשֵׂה חַטָּאת. וְלִיתֵּן שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע כְּמַעֲשֵׂה עוֹלָה, וְאַרְבַּע שֶׁהֵן אַרְבַּע כְּמַעֲשֵׂה חַטָּאת!
human_translation: how this sprinkles one that is two, in accordance with the procedure of a burnt-offering. he sprinkles two that are two, in accordance with the procedure of a sin-offering. And let him sprinkle two that are four in accordance with the procedure of a burnt-offering, and four that are four in accordance with the procedure of a sin-offering.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: How so? One should give one, which is two, like the act of an elevation offering, two which are two, like the act of a sin offering. And to give two which are four, like the act of an elevation offering, and four which are four, like the act of a sin offering!

hebrew_text: לֹא מָצִינוּ דָּמִים שֶׁמְּכַפְּרִין וְחוֹזְרִין וּמְכַפְּרִין. וְכִי מָצִינוּ דָּמִים שֶׁחֶצְיָין חַטָּאת וְחֶצְיָין עוֹלָה? אֶלָּא עַל כׇּרְחָן הַקִּישָׁן הַכָּתוּב. הָכָא נָמֵי: בְּעַל כׇּרְחָן הַקִּישָׁן הַכָּתוּב.
human_translation: We did not find blood that atones and again atones. And did we find blood half of which a sin-offering and half of which a burnt-offering? Rather, perforce, the verse juxtaposes them Here too, perforce, the verse juxtaposes them
llm_translation: We have not found blood that atones and returns and atones. And have we found blood that is half sin offering and half burnt offering? Rather, the Scripture has decreed it so. Here it is stated: "By force the Scripture has decreed it so."

hebrew_text: הָתָם פִּיסּוּק מַתָּנוֹת בְּעָלְמָא הִיא. וְנִיתֵּיב אַחַת שֶׁהִיא שְׁתַּיִם לְמַטָּה, כְּמַעֲשֵׂה עוֹלָה, שְׁתַּיִם שֶׁהֵן שְׁתַּיִם לְמַעְלָה, כְּמַעֲשֵׂה חַטָּאת!
human_translation: There, it is merely dividing the sprinklings. And Let us sprinkle one that is two below in accordance with the procedure of a burnt-offering, two sprinklings that are two above in accordance with the procedure of a sin-offering
llm_translation: There, the conclusion is a general principle. And he established one, which is two below, like the case of an olah offering, two which are two above, like the case of a chatat offering!

hebrew_text: לֹא מָצִינוּ דָּמִים שֶׁחֶצְיָין לְמַעְלָה וְחֶצְיָין לְמַטָּה. וְלָא? וְהָתְנַן: הִזָּה מִמֶּנּוּ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה.
human_translation: We did not find blood half of which above and half of which below And no Didn’t we learn and sprinkled from one upward and seven downward?
llm_translation: We did not find blood that is half above and half below. And is it not so? But we learned: He sprinkled from it one above and seven below.

hebrew_text: כְּמַצְלִיף. מַאי ״כְּמַצְלִיף״ — מַחְוֵי רַב יְהוּדָה, כִּמְנַגְּדָנָא.
human_translation: like a matzlif ; What like a matzlif ? Rav Yehuda demonstrated like one who whips.
llm_translation: As a Talmud scholar, I will now provide the English translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Kematzlif. Mai 'kematzlif' - machvei Rav Yehudah, kimnagdanah." English translation: "Like a smelter. What is 'like a smelter'? - It is the statement of Rav Yehudah, as opposed to our Mishnah."

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתְנַן: הִזָּה מִמֶּנּוּ עַל טׇהֳרוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים. מַאי לָאו, אַפַּלְגֵיהּ דְּמִזְבֵּחַ, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: טְהַר טִיהֲרָא הוּא פַּלְגָא דְּיוֹמָא!
human_translation: And no Didn’t we learn He sprinkled seven times from on tohoro of the altar. What, is it not middle of the altar, as people say: Clear noon [ tihara ], is the middle of the day?
llm_translation: And not? And we learned in a Mishnah: He sprinkles from it on the purity of the altar seven times. What is the reason? To exclude the altar itself, as people say: "He shall be pure, he shall be pure, a half of the day!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שֵׁילָא: לָא,
human_translation: Rabba bar Sheila said: No
llm_translation: Rabba bar Sheilah said: No.

hebrew_text: אַגּוּפֵיהּ דְּמִזְבֵּחַ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּכְעֶצֶם הַשָּׁמַיִם לָטֹהַר״.
human_translation: on the altar itself, as it is written: “Like the very sky for purity [ latohar ]”
llm_translation: Its body of the altar, as it is written: "And like the appearance of the sky for purity."

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּיָהֵיב עוֹלָה בְּרֵישָׁא וַהֲדַר יָהֵיב דְּחַטָּאת? נִיתֵּיב בְּרֵישָׁא דְּחַטָּאת, וַהֲדַר נִיתֵּיב דְּעוֹלָה! כֵּיוָן דְּעוֹלָה הִיא, הִיא קָדְמָה בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: What is different that sprinkle burnt-offering first and then sprinkle that sin-offering? Let us first sprinkle that sin-offering and then let us sprinkle that burnt-offering. Since is a burnt-offering, takes precedence,
llm_translation: What is different about one who brings a burnt offering first and then brings a sin offering? It was taught: If one brings a sin offering first, and then brings a burnt offering, and if one brings a burnt offering first, and then brings a sin offering! Since the burnt offering is primary, it takes precedence at the outset.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא דְּיָהֵיב מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, וּמַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית, נִיתֵּיב דְּרוֹמִית מִזְרָחִית, וַהֲדַר צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית! אָמְרִי: עוֹלָה טְעוּנָה יְסוֹד, וְקֶרֶן דְּרוֹמִית מִזְרָחִית לָא הֲוָה לֵיהּ יְסוֹד.
human_translation: What is different that sprinkle northeast and southwest Let him sprinkle southeast and then northwest say: burnt-offering requires a base, and the southeast corner did not have a base.
llm_translation: And what is the difference if one gives from the eastern north, and from the western south, he should give from the southern west to the eastern north, and then return the northern east to the southern west! They said: An obligatory burnt offering requires a foundation, and the southern horn does not have a foundation from the eastern north.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּיָהֵיב בְּרֵישָׁא מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית וַהֲדַר מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית? נִיתֵּיב בְּרֵישָׁא מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית וַהֲדַר מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית! כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר כׇּל פִּינּוֹת שֶׁאַתָּה פּוֹנֶה — לֹא יְהוּ אֶלָּא דֶּרֶךְ יָמִין לַמִּזְרָח, בְּרֵישָׁא בְּהָהוּא פָּגַע.
human_translation: What is different that sprinkle northeast and southwest Let him sprinkle southwest and then northeast since the Master said: All turns that you turn should be only to the right. to the east, first he encounters
llm_translation: What is different about one who gives at first from the east, north, and then returns from the west, south? Let him give at first from the west, south, and then return from the east, north! Since the Master said, "All corners that you turn to should only be to the right," at first, he encountered in that direction.

hebrew_text: וּמִמַּאי דִּבְעוֹלָה הוּא דְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא עֲבֵיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֵׂה חַטָּאת, וְדִילְמָא: בְּחַטָּאת הוּא דְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא עֲבֵיד בַּהּ מַעֲשֵׂה עוֹלָה! לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״עַל עוֹלַת הַתָּמִיד יֵעָשֶׂה וְנִסְכּוֹ״, מַאי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: מִידֵּי דְּחַטָּאת שְׁדִי אַעוֹלָה.
human_translation: And from where the Merciful One says with regard to a burnt-offering to perform it the procedure of a sin-offering? Perhaps it is with regard to a sin-offering that the Merciful One says to perform it the procedure of a burnt-offering. not enter your mind, as it is written: “It shall be offered aside from the daily burnt-offering and its libation” What is the Merciful One saying? Cast a matter of the sin-offering upon the burnt-offering,
llm_translation: From where is it derived that with regard to a trespass offering, the Merciful One performs the act of a sin offering? Perhaps it is with regard to a sin offering that the Merciful One performs the act of a burnt offering! Your thought is not correct, as it is written: "Upon the burnt offering of the continual burnt offering, he shall prepare it every morning" (Exodus 29:42). What is the Merciful One saying? From the leftover of the sin offering, I will establish a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: אָמַר לָהֶם הַמְמוּנֶּה צְאוּ וְהָבִיאוּ טָלֶה מִלִּשְׁכַּת בֵּית הַטְּלָאִים. וַהֲלֹא, לִשְׁכַּת הַטְּלָאִים הָיְתָה בְּמִקְצוֹעַ צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית. וְאַרְבַּע לְשָׁכוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם, אַחַת לִשְׁכַּת הַטְּלָאִים, וְאַחַת לִשְׁכַּת הַחוֹתָמוֹת, וְאַחַת לִשְׁכַּת בֵּית הַמּוֹקֵד, וְאַחַת לִשְׁכָּה שֶׁעוֹשִׂין בָּהּ לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים.
human_translation: We learned there: The appointee, said to Go out and bring a lamb from the Chamber of the Lambs, The Chamber of the Lambs was in the northwest corner And there were four chambers there One the Chamber of the Lambs, and one the Chamber of the Seals. And one the Chamber of the Hall of the Hearth, and one the chamber where the shewbread was prepared.
llm_translation: We learned there: The appointed one said to them, "Go and bring a lamb from the chamber of the Temple treasury." But wasn't the chamber of the Temple treasury situated in the northwestern corner? And there were four chambers there: one for the chamber of the Temple treasury, one for the chamber of the seals, one for the chamber of the hearth, and one for the chamber where the showbread was made.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: אַרְבַּע לְשָׁכוֹת הָיוּ לְבֵית הַמּוֹקֵד, כְּקִטּוֹנִיּוֹת הַפְּתוּחוֹת לַטְּרַקְלִין, שְׁתַּיִם בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ, וּשְׁתַּיִם בַּחוֹל, וְרָאשֵׁי פְּסֵפָסִין מַבְדִּילִין בֵּין קוֹדֶשׁ לַחוֹל. וּמָה הָיוּ מְשַׁמְּשׁוֹת? מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית — הִיא הָיְתָה לִשְׁכַּת טְלֵי קׇרְבָּן.
human_translation: And raises a contradiction Four chambers were into the Hall of the Hearth like small rooms [ kitoniyyot ] that open into a hall [ teraklin ]. Two sacred and two were in the non-sacred And the tops of stakes [ pispasin ] divided between the sacred non-sacred And what serve? southwest was the Chamber of the Sacrificial Lambs;
llm_translation: And they asked: There were four chambers in the Beit Hamoked, like small openings to the Traklin, two in the Holy and two in the secular, and the heads of the wicks distinguished between the Holy and the secular. And what were they serving? The southern-western chamber was the chamber of the slaughterhouse.

hebrew_text: דְּרוֹמִית מִזְרָחִית הִיא לִשְׁכָּה שֶׁהָיוּ עוֹשִׂין בָּהּ לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים. מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית — בָּהּ גָּנְזוּ בֵּית חַשְׁמוֹנַאי אַבְנֵי מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁשִּׁקְּצוּם מַלְכֵי גוֹיִם. צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית — בָּהּ יוֹרְדִין לְבֵית הַטְּבִילָה. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: מַאן תָּנָא מִדּוֹת — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא.
human_translation: southeast was the chamber in which the shewbread was prepared. northeast in which the Hasmoneans sequestered the altar stones that were desecrated by the gentile kings northwest in which descended to the Hall of Immersion. Rav Huna said: Who taught Middot Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov,
llm_translation: Southern Eastern is the chamber that they used to make the showbread. Eastern Northern - in it the Hasmonean house hid the altar stones that the kings of the nations defiled. Northern Western - in it they descend to the ritual bath. Rav Huna said: Who is the Tanna of this teaching? Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov it is.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: עֶזְרַת נָשִׁים הָיְתָה אוֹרֶךְ מֵאָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וְחָמֵשׁ עַל רוֹחַב מֵאָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וְחָמֵשׁ, וְאַרְבַּע לְשָׁכוֹת הָיוּ בְּאַרְבַּע מִקְצוֹעוֹתֶיהָ, וּמֶה הָיוּ מְשַׁמְּשׁוֹת? דְּרוֹמִית מִזְרָחִית — הִיא הָיְתָה לִשְׁכַּת הַנְּזִירִים, שֶׁשָּׁם נְזִירִים מְבַשְּׁלִים אֶת שַׁלְמֵיהֶן וּמְגַלְּחִין שְׂעָרָן וּמְשַׁלְּחִין תַּחַת הַדּוּד. מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית — הִיא הָיְתָה לִשְׁכַּת דִּיר הָעֵצִים, שֶׁשָּׁם כֹּהֲנִים בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין עוֹמְדִין וּמַתְלִיעִין בְּעֵצִים, שֶׁכׇּל עֵץ שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ תּוֹלַעַת פָּסוּל לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: As we learned women’s courtyard were a length of 135 by a width of 135 and there were four chambers in its four corners. And what serve? southeast was the Chamber of the Nazirites, as there the nazirites cook their peace-offerings and shave their hair and cast beneath the pot northeast was the Chamber of the Woodshed, where blemished priests, stand and examine the logs by worms, as any log in which there are worms is disqualified for on the altar.
llm_translation: We learned: The women's courtyard was one hundred and thirty-five cubits long by one hundred and thirty-five cubits wide, and it had four chambers in its four corners. What were they used for? The southeastern chamber was for the Nazirites, where Nazirites would cook their peace offerings, shave their hair, and place it under the pot. The northeastern chamber was for the wood chamber, where priests with blemishes would stand and inspect the wood, for any wood that had a worm was invalid for the altar.

hebrew_text: צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית — הִיא הָיְתָה לִשְׁכַּת הַמְצוֹרָעִין. מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: שָׁכַחְתִּי מֶה הָיְתָה מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: בָּהּ הָיוּ נוֹתְנִין יַיִן וָשֶׁמֶן, וְהִיא הָיְתָה נִקְרֵאת ״לִשְׁכַּת בֵּית שְׁמָנַיָּא״.
human_translation: northwest was the Chamber of the Lepers, southwest Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov said: I forgot what would serve. Abba Shaul says: They would place wine and oil there and it was called the Chamber of the House of Oils.
llm_translation: Northern chamber was western — it was the chamber of the lepers. Western was southern, Rabbi Eliezer ben Jacob said: I forgot what it was serving. Abba Saul says: In it they used to place wine and oil, and it was called "the chamber of the house of oils."

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא, דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הַכְּתָלִים שֶׁהָיוּ שָׁם הָיוּ גְּבוֹהִין, חוּץ מִכּוֹתֶל מִזְרָחִי, שֶׁהַכֹּהֵן הַשּׂוֹרֵף אֶת הַפָּרָה עוֹמֵד בְּהַר הַמִּשְׁחָה וּמְכַוֵּון וְרוֹאֶה כְּנֶגֶד פִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל בִּשְׁעַת הַזָּאַת הַדָּם.
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as we learned All the walls that were there were high except for the Eastern Wall, as the priest who burns the heifer stands on the Mount of Olives, and directs and looks toward the entrance of the Sanctuary when sprinkles the blood.
llm_translation: So it was stated: It is fitting that Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov be considered thus, as we learned in a Mishnah: All the walls that were there were tall, except for the eastern wall, where the priest who burns the cow stands on the Mount of Anointing, and he is facing and looking directly at the entrance of the Sanctuary at the time when the blood is being sprinkled.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן: כׇּל הַפְּתָחִים שֶׁהָיוּ שָׁם גּוֹבְהָן עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה וְרוֹחְבָּן עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת. וּתְנַן: לִפְנִים מִמֶּנּוּ סוֹרֵג. וּתְנַן: לִפְנִים מִמֶּנּוּ הַחֵיל עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת, וּשְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם, רוּם מַעֲלָה חֲצִי אַמָּה וְשִׁילְחָהּ חֲצִי אַמָּה.
human_translation: And we learned All the entrances that were there twenty cubits high and ten cubits wide. And we learned Inside a latticed gate. And we learned Inside the rampart, ten cubits there were twelve stairs; stair half a cubit high and half a cubit deep,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: All the doorways that were there had a height of twenty cubits and a width of ten cubits. And we learned: In front of it was a ledge. And we learned: In front of it was a hall of ten cubits, and there were twelve steps there, the height of each step being half a cubit and its tread half a cubit.

hebrew_text: חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת עוֹלוֹת מִתּוֹכָהּ, הַיּוֹרְדוֹת מֵעֶזְרַת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְעֶזְרַת נָשִׁים, רוּם מַעֲלָה חֲצִי אַמָּה וְשִׁילְחָהּ חֲצִי אַמָּה. וּתְנַן: בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם אַמָּה, וּשְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה מַעֲלוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם, רוּם מַעֲלָה חֲצִי אַמָּה וְשִׁילְחָהּ חֲצִי אַמָּה.
human_translation: fifteen stairs ascend from within descend from the Israelite courtyard to the women’s courtyard. stair half a cubit high and half a cubit deep, And we learned between the Entrance Hall and the altar twenty-two cubits and there were twelve stairs stair half a cubit high and half a cubit deep,
llm_translation: Fifteen steps, their ascent from within, those descending from the Israelites' Court to the Women's Court, the height of each step being half an amah and its tread a half amah. And we learned: Between the hall and the altar there were twenty-two amot, and there were twelve steps there, the height of each step being half an amah and its tread a half amah.

hebrew_text: וּתְנַן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: מַעֲלָה הָיְתָה שָׁם וּגְבוֹהָ אַמָּה, וְדוּכָן נָתוּן עָלֶיהָ, וּבוֹ שָׁלֹשׁ מַעֲלוֹת שֶׁל חֲצִי חֲצִי אַמָּה.
human_translation: And we learned Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: There was stair there one cubit high, and the platform was placed upon it and on it three stairs, each half a cubit,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: There was a ramp there, and its height was one cubit, and a platform was placed on it, and on it were three half-cubit steps.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא — הַיְינוּ דְּאִיכַּסִּי לֵיהּ פִּיתְחָא.
human_translation: Granted, if you say Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, that is the entrance was concealed.
llm_translation: If you say that it is according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov - that is, that he entered the house.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ רַבָּנַן, הָא אִיכָּא פַּלְגָא דְאַמְּתָא דְּמִתְחֲזֵי לֵיהּ פִּיתְחָא בְּגַוֵּויהּ!
human_translation: However, if you say the Rabbis, isn’t there half a cubit through which the entrance can be seen?
llm_translation: Rather, if you say, the Sages, behold, there is a half of a cubit of truth that appears to him through a hole in his cheek!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא. רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה אָמַר: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: הַמִּזְבֵּחַ מְמוּצָּע וְעוֹמֵד בְּאֶמְצַע עֲזָרָה, וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם אַמּוֹת הָיוּ לוֹ,
human_translation: Rather, not conclude from it Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Rather, whose is that It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: The altar is centered and stands in the middle of courtyard, it was thirty-two cubits
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a valid deduction, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: This is a dispute — it is Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says: The altar was in the middle and stood in the center of the courtyard, and it was thirty-two cubits.

hebrew_text: עֶשֶׂר אַמּוֹת כְּנֶגֶד פִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל, אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה לַצָּפוֹן, וְאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה לַדָּרוֹם, נִמְצָא מִזְבֵּחַ מְכֻוּוֹן כְּנֶגֶד הֵיכָל וּכְותָלָיו.
human_translation: Ten cubits opposite the entrance to Sanctuary. Eleven cubits to the north and eleven cubits to the south It follows altar aligned opposite Sanctuary and its walls.
llm_translation: Ten cubits opposite the entrance of the sanctuary, one cubit to the north, and one cubit to the south, the altar is found aligned with the sanctuary and its walls.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ מִדּוֹת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, מִזְבֵּחַ בְּאֶמְצַע עֲזָרָה מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ? וְהָתְנַן: כׇּל הָעֲזָרָה הָיְתָה אוֹרֶךְ מֵאָה וּשְׁמוֹנִים וָשֶׁבַע עַל רוֹחַב מֵאָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וְחָמֵשׁ. מִן הַמִּזְרָח לַמַּעֲרָב — מֵאָה וּשְׁמוֹנִים וָשֶׁבַע; מְקוֹם דְּרִיסַת רַגְלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל — אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה; מְקוֹם דְּרִיסַת רַגְלֵי הַכֹּהֲנִים אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה; מִזְבֵּחַ — שְׁלֹשִׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם; בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ — עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁתַּיִם; וְהַהֵיכָל — מֵאָה אַמָּה; וְאַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה אֲחוֹרֵי בֵּית הַכַּפּוֹרֶת.
human_translation: And if it enters your mind Middot Rabbi Yehuda, do you find altar in the middle of courtyard But didn’t we learn The of the entire courtyard were a length of 187 by a width of 135 from east to west 187 The area of access Israelites, eleven cubits The area of access the priests to walk eleven cubits altar thirty-two twenty-two between the Entrance Hall and the altar, and the Sanctuary one hundred cubits And eleven cubits behind the Hall of the Ark Cover,
llm_translation: And if it were according to your opinion, the measurements of Rabbi Yehuda, the altar in the middle of the courtyard, who would forget it? And we learned: The entire courtyard was one hundred and eighty-seven cubits in length and one hundred and thirty-five cubits in width. From east to west - one hundred and eighty-seven cubits; the place of the standing of the feet of Israel - eleven cubits; the place of the standing of the feet of the priests - eleven cubits; the altar - thirty-two cubits; between the hall and the altar - twenty-two cubits; and the sanctuary - one hundred cubits; and eleven cubits behind the Holy of Holies.

hebrew_text: מִן הַדָּרוֹם לַצָּפוֹן — מֵאָה וּשְׁלֹשִׁים וְחָמֵשׁ; הַכֶּבֶשׁ וְהַמִּזְבֵּחַ — שִׁשִּׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם; מִן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְלַטַּבָּעוֹת — שְׁמוֹנֶה אַמּוֹת; מְקוֹם הַטַּבָּעוֹת — עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבַּע; מִן הַטַּבָּעוֹת לַשֻּׁלְחָנוֹת — אַרְבַּע; מִן הַשֻּׁלְחָנוֹת לַנַּנָּסִין — אַרְבַּע; מִן הַנַּנָּסִין לְכוֹתֶל עֲזָרָה — שְׁמוֹנֶה אַמּוֹת; וְהַמּוֹתָר, בֵּין הַכֶּבֶשׁ וְלַכּוֹתֶל, וּמְקוֹם הַנַּנָּסִין.
human_translation: from south to north, 135 The ramp and the altar sixty-two eight cubits from the altar to the rings The area of the rings twenty-four from the rings to the tables four From the tables to the pillars four From the pillars to the courtyard wall eight cubits. And the balance between the ramp and the wall, area the pillars
llm_translation: From the south to the north — one hundred and thirty-five; the ramp and the altar — sixty-two; from the altar to the rings — eight cubits; the place of the rings — twenty-four; from the rings to the tables — four; from the tables to the pillars — four; from the pillars to the wall of the Azarah — eight cubits; and the remainder, between the ramp and the wall, and the place of the pillars.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּיךְ מִדּוֹת רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא — מִזְבֵּחַ בְּאֶמְצַע עֲזָרָה מִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לֵיהּ? הָא רוּבָּא דְמִזְבֵּחַ בְּדָרוֹם קָאֵי!
human_translation: And if it enters your mind Middot Rabbi Yehuda, do you find the altar in the middle of courtyard? Most altar stands in the southern
llm_translation: "And if it enters your mind that the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda is the correct one - the altar in the middle of the Temple courtyard, who forgets it? The majority of the altar is situated in the south!"

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, not conclude from it Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov? conclude from it
llm_translation: Rather, it is not a valid deduction. It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. A valid deduction.

hebrew_text: רַב אַדָּא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יִצְחָק אָמַר: הַאי לִשְׁכָּה אַקְצוֹיֵי מַקְצְיָא, וּדְאָתֵי מִצָּפוֹן מִתְחַזְיָא לֵיהּ בְּדָרוֹם, וּדְאָתֵי מִדָּרוֹם מִתְחַזְיָא לֵיהּ בְּצָפוֹן.
human_translation: Rav Adda, son of Rav Yitzḥak, said: This chamber was removed And who comes from the north, appears to him south and who comes from the south, appears to him north
llm_translation: Rav Adda, son of Rav Yitzchak, said: This chamber is situated in the northwest, and one who comes from the north sees it in the south, and one who comes from the south sees it in the north.

hebrew_text: וּמִסְתַּבְּרָא דִּבְמַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית הֲוַאי. מִמַּאי — מִדְּרָמֵינַן לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים אַלֶּחֶם הַפָּנִים,
human_translation: it is reasonable was southwest From where From that we raise a contradiction shewbread shewbread
llm_translation: And it is clear that in the west, in the southern region, it is so. From where? - From the fact that we learn "lechem hapanim" as "al lechem hapanim."

hebrew_text: וּמְשַׁנֵּינַן, אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: מָר קָא חָשֵׁיב דֶּרֶךְ יָמִין, וּמָר קָא חָשֵׁיב דֶּרֶךְ שְׂמֹאל.
human_translation: And we resolve Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: The Master envisions via right, the Master envisions via left,
llm_translation: We learn: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: The master considers the right path, and the master considers the left path.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא בְּמַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית הֲוַאי, הַיְינוּ דִּמְתָרֵץ לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים אַלֶּחֶם הַפָּנִים. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית הֲוַאי, סוֹף סוֹף מַאי תֵּירוּצָא דְּלֶחֶם הַפָּנִים! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ, בְּמַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית הֲוַאי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Granted, if you say was southwest resolves the shewbread the shewbread. However, if you say was northwest ultimately, what is the resolution shewbread? Rather, not conclude from it was in the southwest? conclude from it
llm_translation: If you say it is in the southwestern direction, that is why it explains "bread of the face" as "bread of the face." Rather, if you say it is in the northwestern direction, ultimately what will be the resolution of "bread of the face"! But it is not so; it is in the southwestern direction. That is the resolution.

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר מָר: כׇּל פִּינּוֹת שֶׁאַתָּה פּוֹנֶה לֹא יִהְיוּ אֶלָּא דֶּרֶךְ יָמִין לַמִּזְרָח? הָנֵי מִילֵּי בַּעֲבוֹדָה. אֲבָל הָכָא — חוּשְׁבָּנָא בְּעָלְמָא הוּא.
human_translation: But didn’t the Master say: All turns that you turn should be only to the right, to the east? This applies only in the service; however, here, it is a mere reckoning,
llm_translation: The Master said: "All corners that you turn should only be towards the right, towards the east." These are matters of the Temple service. But here - it is merely a common courtesy.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מַקְרִיב חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ וְנוֹטֵל חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מַקְרִיב חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ? אוֹמֵר: עוֹלָה זוֹ אֲנִי מַקְרִיב, מִנְחָה זוֹ אֲנִי מַקְרִיב.
human_translation: As the High Priest sacrifices portion first and takes portion first. The Sages taught How does sacrifice portion first? he says: This burnt-offering, I am sacrificing, This meal-offering, I am sacrificing.
llm_translation: The High Priest offers a portion on the head and takes a portion on the head. The Sages taught: How does he offer a portion on the head? He says: "This is the burnt offering I am offering, this is the meal offering I am offering."

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד נוֹטֵל חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ? אוֹמֵר: חַטָּאת זוֹ אֲנִי אוֹכֵל, אָשָׁם זֶה אֲנִי אוֹכֵל. וְנוֹטֵל חַלָּה מִשְׁתֵּי חַלּוֹת, אַרְבַּע אוֹ חָמֵשׁ מִמַּעֲשֵׂה לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם חָמֵשׁ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהָיְתָה לְאַהֲרֹן וּלְבָנָיו״ — מֶחֱצָה לְאַהֲרֹן וּמֶחֱצָה לְבָנָיו.
human_translation: How does take portion first? says: This sin-offering, I am eating, This guilt-offering, I am eating. And he take loaf two loaves four or five shewbread loaves Rabbi says: always five as it is stated: “It shall be for Aaron and his sons half to Aaron, and half to his sons.
llm_translation: How does one take a portion at the head? He says: "This sin-offering I am eating, this guilt-offering I am eating." And he takes challah from two loaves, four or five from the showbread. Rabbi says: Always five, as it is stated: "And it shall be for Aaron and his sons" — half for Aaron and half for his sons.

hebrew_text: הָא גּוּפַהּ קַשְׁיָא: אָמְרַתְּ נוֹטֵל חַלָּה אַחַת מִשְׁתֵּי חַלּוֹת, מַנִּי — רַבִּי הִיא, דְּאָמַר פַּלְגָא שָׁקֵיל. אֵימָא מְצִיעֲתָא: אַרְבַּע אוֹ חָמֵשׁ מִמַּעֲשֵׂה לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים, אֲתָאן לְרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: לָא שָׁקֵיל פַּלְגָא. אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם חָמֵשׁ. רֵישָׁא וְסֵיפָא רַבִּי, וּמְצִיעֲתָא רַבָּנַן?
human_translation: This is itself difficult, you said: He takes loaf two loaves Whose It is Rabbi who said takes half. Say the middle clause four or five shewbread loaves; we have come to the Rabbis, who say does not take half Say the last clause Rabbi says always five. the first clause and the last clause Rabbi and the middle the Rabbis?
llm_translation: The body of the text is difficult: You said, "Taking one loaf from two loaves," count - it is Rabbi Hiya, for he said, "A half is taken." Say a rebuttal: "Four or five from the showbread offering," come to the Rabbis, for they say: "A half is not taken." Say the conclusion, Rabbi says: "Always five." The beginning and the end are Rabbi's, and the rebuttal is the Rabbis'?

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: רֵישָׁא וּמְצִיעֲתָא רַבָּנַן — וּמוֹדוּ רַבָּנַן בִּפְרוּסָה, דְּלָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא לְמִיתְּבַהּ לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Abaye said: The first clause and the middle clause the Rabbis, the Rabbis concede with regard to a piece that it is inappropriate to give it to the High Priest.
llm_translation: Abaye said: The beginning and the middle, the Rabbis - and the Rabbis agree in the case of a breach, that they do not pave a way for the High Priest to sit.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי אַרְבַּע אוֹ חָמֵשׁ? לְרַבָּנַן דְּאָמְרִי נִכְנָס נוֹטֵל שֵׁשׁ, וְיוֹצֵא נוֹטֵל שֵׁשׁ, וּשְׂכַר הַגָּפַת דְּלָתוֹת לָא, מִשְׁתֵּים עֶשְׂרֵה בָּעֵי מִיפְלַג. בַּצֵּיר חֲדָא מִפַּלְגָא, חָמֵשׁ שָׁקֵיל.
human_translation: And what four or five; to the Rabbis, who say: incoming takes six and outgoing takes six, and no payment for closing the doors, from twelve must divide half less one, he takes five.
llm_translation: And what is the case of four or five? According to the Rabbis who say: One enters and takes six, and exits and takes six, and the reward for the handle of the door is not included, requiring twelve for a division. In the narrow part, one from a division, he takes five.

hebrew_text: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: נִכְנָס נוֹטֵל שֶׁבַע, שְׁתַּיִם בִּשְׂכַר הַגָּפַת דְּלָתוֹת, וְיוֹצֵא נוֹטֵל חָמֵשׁ, מֵעֶשֶׂר בָּעֵי מִיפְלַג. בַּצֵּיר חֲדָא מִפַּלְגָא, וְשָׁקֵיל אַרְבַּע.
human_translation: to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: incoming takes seven two are payment for closing the doors; outgoing takes five from ten he must divide Subtract one from half And takes four.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehuda, who said: One enters and takes seven, two as payment for the hinges of the doors, and upon exiting, one takes five, from the ten needed for a partition. On the hinge, one takes one from half, and removes four.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כּוּלָּהּ רַבִּי הִיא, וְסָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. וְאֶלָּא מַאי אַרְבַּע? הָא חָמֵשׁ בָּעֵי לְמִשְׁקַל!
human_translation: Rava said entire is Rabbi and he holds Rabbi Yehuda Rather, what four doesn’t he need to take five?
llm_translation: Rava said: The entire matter is according to Rabbi, and he holds like Rabbi Yehuda. But what then? Why four? It requires five for a weight!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּאִיכָּא מִשְׁמָר הַמִּתְעַכֵּב, הָא דְּלֵיכָּא מִשְׁמָר הַמִּתְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: not difficult. This where there is a watch that is detained. That where there is not a watch that is detained,
llm_translation: Not difficult: this that there is a guard that delays, this that there is no guard that delays.

hebrew_text: אִי אִיכָּא מִשְׁמָר הַמִּתְעַכֵּב — מִשְּׁמֹנֶה בָּעֵי לְמִפְלַג, וְשָׁקֵיל אַרְבַּע. אִי לֵיכָּא מִשְׁמָר הַמִּתְעַכֵּב — מֵעֶשֶׂר בָּעֵי לְמִפְלַג, וְשָׁקֵיל חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: If there is a watch that is detained, from eight must divide takes four. If there is not a watch that is detained, from ten he must divide takes five.
llm_translation: If there is a watch that is delayed - from eight gates for a division, and takes four. If there is no watch that is delayed - from ten gates for a division, and takes five.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, מַאי רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם חָמֵשׁ? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: If so, what Rabbi says: always five difficult
llm_translation: If so, what does Rabbi say: Always five? Difficult.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מָסְרוּ לוֹ זְקֵנִים מִזִּקְנֵי בֵּית דִּין, וְקוֹרִין לְפָנָיו בְּסֵדֶר הַיּוֹם, וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל! קְרָא אַתָּה בְּפִיךְ, שֶׁמָּא שָׁכַחְתָּ אוֹ שֶׁמָּא לֹא לָמַדְתָּ. עֶרֶב יוֹם כִּפּוּרִים שַׁחֲרִית מַעֲמִידִין אוֹתוֹ בְּשַׁעַר מִזְרָח, וּמַעֲבִירִין לְפָנָיו פָּרִים וְאֵילִים וּכְבָשִׂים כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא מַכִּיר וְרָגִיל בַּעֲבוֹדָה. כׇּל שִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים לֹא הָיוּ מוֹנְעִין מִמֶּנּוּ מַאֲכָל וּמִשְׁתֶּה, עֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה לֹא הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין אוֹתוֹ לֶאֱכוֹל הַרְבֵּה, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַמַּאֲכָל מֵבִיא אֶת הַשֵּׁינָה.
human_translation: provided with Elders from the Elders of the court, and they read before him the order of the day And they say to him: My Master, High Priest. Read with your own mouth, perhaps you forgot or perhaps you did not learn On Yom Kippur eve morning, stand him at eastern gate and pass before him bulls and rams and sheep so that he will be familiar and accustomed to the service, all the seven days they would not withhold from him food or drink on Yom Kippur eve at nightfall, they would not allow him to eat a great deal because food induces sleep
llm_translation: They taught: Elders from the elders of the court handed him over, and they read before him in the order of the day, and they say to him: "My master, High Priest! You are to read with your mouth, perhaps you have forgotten or perhaps you have not learned." On the eve of Yom Kippur, in the morning, they stand him at the eastern gate, and they pass before him calves, rams, and sheep so that he may recognize and become accustomed to the service. Throughout the seven days, they did not withhold from him food and drink. On the eve of Yom Kippur, with nightfall, they did not allow him to eat much, because food induces sleep.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בִּשְׁלָמָא שֶׁמָּא שָׁכַח — לְחַיֵּי. אֶלָּא שֶׁמָּא לֹא לָמַד — מִי מוֹקְמִינַן כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא?
human_translation: Granted, perhaps he forgot, fine, However, perhaps did not learn Do we appoint of that sort
llm_translation: Gemara: "Perhaps he forgot - to live. Rather, perhaps he did not learn - who establishes this quality?"

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְהַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדוֹל מֵאֶחָיו״, שֶׁיְּהֵא גָּדוֹל מֵאֶחָיו בְּכֹחַ, בְּנוֹי, בְּחָכְמָה, וּבְעוֹשֶׁר. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: מִנַּיִן שֶׁאִם אֵין לוֹ, שֶׁאֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים מְגַדְּלִין אוֹתוֹ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַכֹּהֵן הַגָּדוֹל מֵאֶחָיו״ — גַּדְּלֵהוּ מִשֶּׁל אֶחָיו.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught “And the priest who is greater than his brethren” that he be greater than his brethren in strength, in beauty, in wisdom, and in wealth. Aḥerim say: from where that if he does not have that his brethren the priests elevate him The verse states: “And the priest who is greater [ haggadol ] than his brethren”; elevate him [ gaddelehu ] from of his brethren.
llm_translation: The text states: "And the high priest from among his brothers," that he should be greater than his brothers in strength, in appearance, in wisdom, and in wealth. Others say: From where do we derive that if he does not have these qualities, his priestly brothers should elevate him? It is derived from the verse: "And the high priest from among his brothers" - elevate him from among his brothers.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא קַשְׁיָא, כָּאן בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, כָּאן בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי. דְּאָמַר רַב אַסִּי: תַּרְקַבָּא דְּדִינָרֵי עַיִּילָא לֵיהּ מָרְתָּא בַּת בַּיְיתּוֹס לְיַנַּאי מַלְכָּא עַל דְּאוֹקְמֵיהּ לִיהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן גַּמְלָא בְּכָהֲנֵי רַבְרְבֵי.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: not difficult. There, the First Temple, Here, the Second Temple, As Rav Asi said: Marta, daughter of Baitos, brought a half- se’a of dinars in to King Yannai for that he appointed Yehoshua ben Gamla as High Priest.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Not difficult, here in the First Temple, here in the Second Temple. As Rav Assi said: A purse of dinars was brought to Marthabas, the daughter of Bayitos, to King Yanai, upon which Yehoshua ben Gamla, of the Rabbinic court, stood up.

hebrew_text: עֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שַׁחֲרִית וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: אַף הַשְּׂעִירִים. וְתַנָּא דִּידַן מַאי טַעְמָא לָא תְּנָא שְׂעִירִים? כֵּיוָן דְּעַל חֵטְא קָא אָתוּ — חָלְשָׁא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: On Yom Kippur eve morning, taught Even goats And the tanna our what is the reason he did not teach goats Since come for sins, become distraught.
llm_translation: On the eve of Yom Kippur, the morning prayer, etc. It was taught: Also the he-goats. And our Mishna, what is the reason it did not teach "he-goats"? Since they come for a sin offering - his mind becomes weak.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, פַּר נָמֵי עַל חֵטְא הוּא דְּאָתֵי! פַּר, כֵּיוָן דְּעָלָיו וְעַל אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים הוּא דְּאָתֵי, בְּאֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים, אִי אִיכָּא אִינִישׁ דְּאִית בֵּיהּ מִילְּתָא — מִידָּע יָדַע לֵיהּ וּמַהְדַּר לֵיהּ בִּתְשׁוּבָה. בְּכוּלְּהוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל — לָא יָדַע.
human_translation: If so, a bull as it too comes for sin. a bull, since for his and for his brethren the priests that it comes; among his brethren the priests, if there is a person who has a matter, would know and him back to through repentance. with regard to the entire Jewish people, he does not know
llm_translation: If so, a bull is a sin offering that comes! A bull, since it comes upon him and upon his priestly brothers, it is that which comes, upon his priestly brothers, if there is anyone in whom there is a matter — immediately he knows it and he rectifies it through repentance. In all of Israel — he does not know.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: אִי בַּר אֲחָתָיךְ דַּיָּילָא הָוֵי חֲזִי, בְּשׁוּקָא קַמֵּיהּ לָא תַּחְלֵיף.
human_translation: Ravina said this that people say: If son of your sister becomes a policeman [ dayyala ], see in the marketplace you do not pass before him.
llm_translation: Ravina said, this is what people say: If your brother-in-law is a barber, do not stand in front of him in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: כׇּל שִׁבְעַת הַיָּמִים לָא הָיוּ מוֹנְעִין וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן נָקוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ סְלָתוֹת וּבֵיצִים כְּדֵי לְמַסְמְסוֹ. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁאַתָּה מְבִיאוֹ לִידֵי חִימּוּם.
human_translation: all the seven days they would not withhold It was taught Rabbi Yehuda ben Nekosa says: they feed him fine flour and eggs in order to loosen his They said to all the more so that you bring him to a state of arousal.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "All seven days not were preventing etc." It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda ben Nakhosai says: They feed him fine flour and eggs in order to soften him. They said to him: All the more so that you are bringing him to the point of being heated up.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא סוֹמְכוֹס אָמַר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֵין מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ לֹא ״אב״י״, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: לֹא ״אבב״י״, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף לֹא יַיִן לָבָן. לֹא ״אב״י״ — לֹא אֶתְרוֹג, וְלֹא בֵּיצִים, וְלֹא יַיִן יָשָׁן. וְאָמְרִי לַהּ לֹא ״אבב״י״ — לֹא אֶתְרוֹג, וְלֹא בֵּיצִים, וְלֹא בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן, וְלֹא יַיִן יָשָׁן. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: אַף לֹא יַיִן לָבָן, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהַיַּיִן לָבָן מֵבִיא אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי טוּמְאָה.
human_translation: It was taught Sumakhos said in the name of Rabbi Meir: One does not feed him Alef , beit , yod ; and some say not Alef , beit , beit , yod ; and some say neither white wine. Not alef , beit , yod neither etrog , nor eggs [ beitzim ], nor old wine [ yayin ]. And some say: Not alef , beit , beit , yod neither etrog , nor eggs [ beitzim ], nor fatty meat [ basar ], nor old wine [ yayin ]. And some say neither white wine because white wine brings man to impurity
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Somchos said in the name of Rabbi Meir: One does not feed him neither "Avi," and some say: not "Avvi," and some say: also not white wine. Not "Avi" - not an etrog, not eggs, not old wine. And some say not "Avvi" - not an etrog, not eggs, not fatty meat, not old wine. And some say: also not white wine, because white wine leads a person to impurity.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: זָב תּוֹלִין לוֹ בְּמַאֲכָל, וְכׇל מִינֵי מַאֲכָל. אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פִּנְחָס אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא: אֵין מַאֲכִילִין אוֹתוֹ לֹא ״חגב״י״ וְלֹא ״גב״ם״, וְלֹא כׇּל דְּבָרִים הַמְּבִיאִין לִידֵי טוּמְאָה. לֹא ״חגב״י״ — לֹא חָלָב, וְלֹא גְּבִינָה, וְלֹא בֵּיצָה, וְלֹא יַיִן. וְלֹא ״גב״ם״ — מֵי גְרִיסִין שֶׁל פּוֹל, וּבָשָׂר שָׁמֵן, וּמֻרְיָיס.
human_translation: the Sages taught: a zav , one attributes to food, or to all kinds of food, Elazar ben Pineḥas says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira: one feeds him neither Ḥet , gimmel , beit , yod , nor Gimmel , beit , mem , nor any items that bring him to impurity Not ḥet , gimmel , beit , yod neither milk [ ḥalav ], nor cheese [ gevina ], nor egg [ beitza ], nor wine [ yayin ]. And not gimmel , beit , mem neither soup of pounded beans [ mei gerisin ], nor fatty meat [ basar ], nor fish in brine [ muryas ].
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A Zav may immerse in water for him in food, and all kinds of food. Elazar ben Pinchas says in the name of Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira: One does not feed him neither "grasshoppers" nor "locusts," nor anything that leads to impurity. Not "grasshoppers" - not milk, not cheese, not eggs, not wine. Not "locusts" - water from boiled beans, fatty meat, and fish brine.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא כׇּל דְּבָרִים הַמְּבִיאִין לִידֵי טוּמְאָה, לְאֵתוֹיֵי מַאי? לְאֵתוֹיֵי הָא דְּתָנוּ רַבָּנַן: חֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים מְבִיאִים אֶת הָאָדָם לִידֵי טוּמְאָה, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: הַשּׁוּם
human_translation: Nor any items that bring him to impurity; what does it to include? It to include that which the Sages taught: Five items bring man to impurity And these are: Garlic,
llm_translation: "And not all things that bring about impurity, for what? To bring about what? To bring about what the Rabbis taught: Five things bring a person to impurity, and these are they: garlic."

hebrew_text: וְהַשַּׁחֲלַיִם וַחֲלֹגְלוֹגוֹת וְהַבֵּיצִים וְהַגַּרְגִּיר. ״וַיֵּצֵא אֶחָד אֶל הַשָּׂדֶה לְלַקֵּט אוֹרוֹת״, תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר: זֶה גַּרְגִּיר. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָן ״אוֹרוֹת״ — שֶׁמְּאִירוֹת אֶת הָעֵינַיִם. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: הַמּוֹצֵיא גַּרְגִּיר, אִם יָכוֹל לְאׇכְלוֹ אוֹכְלוֹ, וְאִם לָאו — מַעֲבִירוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי עֵינָיו. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּגַרְגִּירָא מַצְרָנְאָה.
human_translation: cress, purslane, eggs, and arugula. “And one of them went out into the fields to collect orot ” taught in the name of Rabbi Meir This is arugula. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Why are called orot ? they enlighten [ me’irot ] the eyes. Rav Huna said: one who finds arugula, if he can eat it, he eats it, and if not, he passes it over his eyes, Rav Pappa said: Arugula on the border
llm_translation: The shachaliyim, chaloglogot, beitzim, and gargeir. "And one went out into the field to gather herbs," it was taught in the name of Rabbi Meir: This is gargeir. Rabbi Yochanan said: Why is it called "herbs" - because it illuminates the eyes. Rav Huna said: One who removes a gargeir, if he can eat it, he eats it, and if not - he passes it over his eyes. Rav Papa said: With gargeir there is difficulty.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר רַב: אַכְסְנַאי לֹא יֹאכַל בֵּיצִים, וְלֹא יִישַׁן בְּטַלִּיתוֹ שֶׁל בַּעַל הַבַּיִת. רַב כִּי מִקְּלַע לְדַרְשִׁישׁ, מַכְרֵיז: מַאן הָוְיָא לְיוֹמָא. רַב נַחְמָן כַּד מִקְּלַע לְשַׁכְנְצִיב, מַכְרֵיז: מַאן הָוְיָא לְיוֹמָא.
human_translation: Rav Giddel said Rav said: A guest neither eat eggs, nor sleep in a garment belonging to the homeowner, When Rav would happen to Darshish he would declare: Who will be for the day when Rav Naḥman would come to Shekhantziv he would declare: Who will be for the day
llm_translation: Rav Gidel said in the name of Rav: A guest should not eat eggs, and should not sleep in the host's garment. Rav, when he would enter the study hall, would announce: Who will be for the day? Rav Nachman, when he would enter the marketplace, would announce: Who will be for the day?

hebrew_text: וְהַתַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: לֹא יִשָּׂא אָדָם אִשָּׁה בִּמְדִינָה זוֹ, וְיֵלֵךְ וְיִשָּׂא אִשָּׁה בִּמְדִינָה אַחֶרֶת, שֶׁמָּא יִזְדַּוְּוגוּ זֶה אֵצֶל זֶה וְנִמְצָא אָח נוֹשֵׂא אֲחוֹתוֹ (וְאָב נוֹשֵׂא בִּתּוֹ), וּמְמַלֵּא כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ מַמְזֵרוּת, וְעַל זֶה נֶאֱמַר: ״וּמָלְאָה הָאָרֶץ זִמָּה״. אָמְרִי: רַבָּנַן — קָלָא אִית לְהוּ.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: A man should not marry a woman in one state and go and marry woman in a different state, lest match be arranged this with that lead to a brother marrying his sister a father marrying his daughter, filling the whole world in its entirety with mamzerim . And concerning this it is stated: “And the land became filled with lewdness” say The Sages generate publicity.
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: A man should not marry a woman in this country, but should go and marry a woman in another country, lest they intermarry with one another and it is found that a brother marries his sister (and a father marries his daughter), and fills the entire world with mamzerut, and regarding this it is said: 'And the land is filled with immorality.' The Sages said: They have a light matter."

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: תְּבָעוּהָ לְהִנָּשֵׂא, וְנִתְפַּיְּיסָה — צְרִיכָה לֵישֵׁב שִׁבְעָה נְקִיִּים? רַבָּנַן אוֹדוֹעֵי הֲווֹ מוֹדְעוּ לְהוּ, מִקְדָּם הֲווֹ קָדְמִי וּמְשַׁדְּרִי שְׁלוּחָא.
human_translation: But didn’t Rava say: one who proposed marriage to and she agreed, is required to sit seven clean days, The Sages would inform them by sending messengers before
llm_translation: And Rava said: If she demanded to be married and was appeased - does she need to sit seven clean days? The Rabbis who were familiar with them, were familiar with them beforehand and would send a messenger.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא יַחוֹדֵי הֲווֹ מְיַחֲדִי לְהוּ, לְפִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ לְמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ.
human_translation: And if you wish, say be in seclusion with There is no similarity between one who has bread in his basket and one who does not have bread in his basket.
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Let the exclusive ones be exclusive to them, because one who has bread in his basket is not comparable to one who does not have bread in his basket.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מְסָרוּהוּ זִקְנֵי בֵית דִּין לְזִקְנֵי כְהוּנָּה וְהֶעֱלוּהוּ בֵּית אַבְטִינָס, וְהִשְׁבִּיעוּהוּ, וְנִפְטְרוּ וְהָלְכוּ לָהֶם. וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ: אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל! אָנוּ שְׁלוּחֵי בֵּית דִּין, וְאַתָּה שְׁלוּחֵנוּ וּשְׁלִיחַ בֵּית דִּין. מַשְׁבִּיעִין אָנוּ עָלֶיךָ בְּמִי שֶׁשִּׁכֵּן שְׁמוֹ בַּבַּיִת הַזֶּה שֶׁלֹּא תְּשַׁנֶּה דָּבָר מִכׇּל מַה שֶּׁאָמַרְנוּ לָךְ. הוּא פּוֹרֵשׁ וּבוֹכֶה, וְהֵן פּוֹרְשִׁין וּבוֹכִין.
human_translation: The Elders of the court passed him to the Elders of the priesthood, and they took him up to the House of Avtinas. And they administered him an oath and took leave and went on their way. they said to him: My Master, High Priest. We are agents of the court, and you are our agent and the agent of the court. We administer an oath to you in Him who housed His name in this House, that you will not change matter from all that we have said to you he would leave and cry, and they would leave and cry
llm_translation: The elders of the court handed him over to the elders of the priesthood, and they brought him to the chamber of Avtinas, and they adjured him, and they dismissed him, and they went their way. And they said to him: "Our master, High Priest! We are messengers of the court, and you are our messenger and the messenger of the court. We adjure you by the One whose name dwells in this house, that you do not change anything of all that we have told you." He separated and wept, and they separated and wept.

hebrew_text: אִם (הוּא) הָיָה חָכָם — דּוֹרֵשׁ, וְאִם לָאו — תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים דּוֹרְשִׁים לְפָנָיו. וְאִם רָגִיל לִקְרוֹת — קוֹרֵא, וְאִם לָאו — קוֹרִין לְפָנָיו. וּבַמֶּה קוֹרִין לְפָנָיו: בְּאִיּוֹב וּבְעֶזְרָא וּבְדִבְרֵי הַיָּמִים. זְכַרְיָה בֶּן קְבוּטָל אוֹמֵר: פְּעָמִים הַרְבֵּה קָרִיתִי לְפָנָיו בְּדָנִיֵּאל.
human_translation: If he was a scholar, he teach If not Torah scholars teach before him. And if accustomed to read he read; and if not, they read before him. And what they read before him from Job, and from Ezra, and from Chronicles. Zekharya, son of Kevutal, says: Many times I read before him from Daniel.
llm_translation: If he was wise - he expounds, and if not - the disciples of sages expound before him. And if he is accustomed to read - he reads, and if not - they read before him. And with what do they read before him: in Job, in Ezra, and in the Chronicles. Zechariah ben Kevutal says: Many times I have read before him in Daniel.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: לְלַמְּדוֹ חֲפִינָה. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: שְׁתֵּי לְשָׁכוֹת הָיוּ לוֹ לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, אַחַת לִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין וְאַחַת לִשְׁכַּת בֵּית אַבְטִינָס. אַחַת בַּצָּפוֹן וְאַחַת בַּדָּרוֹם. אַחַת בַּצָּפוֹן, דִּתְנַן: שֵׁשׁ לְשָׁכוֹת הָיוּ בָּעֲזָרָה, שָׁלֹשׁ בַּצָּפוֹן וְשָׁלֹשׁ בַּדָּרוֹם,
human_translation: taught: to teach him taking handfuls Rav Pappa said: The High Priest had two chambers. One the Parhedrin chamber and one the Chamber of the House of Avtinas. One in the north and one in the south. One the north, as we learned There were six chambers in the courtyard, three in the north and three in the south.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A certain Tanna taught: To teach him the arrangement. Rav Papa said: The high priest had two chambers, one the chamber of Parhedrin and one the chamber of Beit Avtinas. One in the north and one in the south. One in the north, as we learned: There were six chambers in the Temple courtyard, three in the north and three in the south.

hebrew_text: שֶׁבַּדָּרוֹם: לִשְׁכַּת הַמֶּלַח, לִשְׁכַּת הַפַּרְוָה, לִשְׁכַּת הַמְּדִיחִין. לִשְׁכַּת הַמֶּלַח — שֶׁשָּׁם הָיוּ נוֹתְנִין מֶלַח לַקׇּרְבָּן, לִשְׁכַּת הַפַּרְוָה — שֶׁשָּׁם הָיוּ מוֹלְחִין עוֹרוֹת קָדָשִׁים. וְעַל גַּגָּהּ הָיְתָה בֵּית טְבִילָה לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. לִשְׁכַּת הַמְּדִיחִין — שָׁם הָיוּ מְדִיחִין קִרְבֵי קָדָשִׁים. וּמִשָּׁם מְסִיבָּה עוֹלֶה לְגַג בֵּית הַפַּרְוָה.
human_translation: in the south the Chamber of the Salt, the Chamber of the Parva , the Chamber of the Rinsers. The Chamber of the Salt where would place the salt for the offering The Chamber of the Parva , where they salted the consecrated hides And on the roof was the Hall of Immersion for the High Priest for Yom Kippur. The Chamber of the Rinsers where they would rinse the innards of consecrated From there a circular staircase ascended to the roof of the Chamber of the Parva .
llm_translation: In the south: Chamber of Salt, Chamber of the Parwah, Chamber of the Washers. Chamber of Salt - where they would place salt for the offerings. Chamber of the Parwah - where they would salt the hides of the holy animals. And on its roof was a mikveh for the High Priest on Yom Kippur. Chamber of the Washers - where they would wash the sacrificial innards. And from there a staircase ascended to the roof of the Chamber of the Parwah.

hebrew_text: שָׁלֹשׁ שֶׁבַּצָּפוֹן: לִשְׁכַּת הָעֵץ, לִשְׁכַּת הַגּוֹלָה, לִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית. לִשְׁכַּת הָעֵץ, אָמַר רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: שָׁכַחְתִּי מֶה הָיְתָה מְשַׁמֶּשֶׁת. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: לִשְׁכַּת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל הָיְתָה אֲחוֹרֵי שְׁתֵּיהֶן, וְגַג שְׁלׇשְׁתָּן שָׁוֶה.
human_translation: three in the north the Chamber of the Wood, the Chamber of the Exile, the Chamber of Hewn Stone. the Chamber of the Wood, Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, said: I forgot what would serve. Abba Shaul says: The High Priest’s chamber was behind the two and the roofs of three of them were level.
llm_translation: Three in the north: the Chamber of Wood, the Chamber of Exile, the Chamber of Gazit. The Chamber of Wood, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov said: I forgot what it was used for. Abba Shaul says: The Chamber of the High Priest was behind both of them, and the roof of all three was equal.

hebrew_text: לִשְׁכַּת הַגּוֹלָה — שָׁם הָיָה בּוֹר הַגּוֹלָה, וְהַגַּלְגַּל נָתוּן עָלָיו, וּמִשָּׁם מַסְפִּיקִין מַיִם לְכׇל הָעֲזָרָה. לִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית — שָׁם הָיְתָה סַנְהֶדְרִין שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל יוֹשֶׁבֶת וְדָנָה אֶת הַכֹּהֲנִים, וּמִי שֶׁנִּמְצָא בּוֹ פְּסוּל, הָיָה לוֹבֵשׁ שְׁחוֹרִים וּמִתְעַטֵּף שְׁחוֹרִים וְיָצָא וְהָלַךְ לוֹ. וְשֶׁלֹּא נִמְצָא בּוֹ פְּסוּל, הָיָה לוֹבֵשׁ לְבָנִים וּמִתְעַטֵּף לְבָנִים וְנִכְנָס וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ עִם אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: the Chamber of the Exile there was the well exile, and the wheel was positioned over it. And from there, supply water for in the entire courtyard the Chamber of Hewn Stone, there Sanhedrin of Israel convened and judged the priests in whom a disqualification was detected would wear black and would wrap himself in black and would emerge and go his way, And in whom a disqualification was not found would wear white and wrap himself in white and would enter and serve with his fellow priests.
llm_translation: Chamber of Exile - there was the pit of exile, and the wheel was placed on it, and from there they would draw water for the entire Temple courtyard. Chamber of Hewn Stone - there the Sanhedrin of Israel would sit and judge the priests, and if one was found disqualified, he would wear black garments, wrap himself in black, and go out and leave. And if one was not found disqualified, he would wear white garments, wrap himself in white, and enter and serve with his fellow priests.

hebrew_text: אַחַת בַּדָּרוֹם, דִּתְנַן: שִׁבְעָה שְׁעָרִים הָיוּ בָּעֲזָרָה, שָׁלֹשׁ בַּצָּפוֹן וְשָׁלֹשׁ בַּדָּרוֹם וְאֶחָד בַּמִּזְרָח. שֶׁבַּדָּרוֹם: שַׁעַר הַדְלָקָה, שֵׁנִי לוֹ — שַׁעַר הַקָּרְבָּן, שְׁלִישִׁי לוֹ — שַׁעַר הַמַּיִם. שֶׁבַּמִּזְרָח: שַׁעַר נִקָּנוֹר, וּשְׁתֵּי לְשָׁכוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם אַחַת בִּימִינוֹ וְאַחַת בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ, אַחַת לִשְׁכַּת פִּנְחָס הַמַּלְבִּישׁ, וְאַחַת לִשְׁכַּת עוֹשֵׂי חֲבִיתִּין.
human_translation: one in the south as we learned Seven gates were in the courtyard, three in the north and three in the south and one in the east. in the south the Gate of Fire; second to it the Gate of the Offering; third to it the Gate of the Water. that was in the east Gate of Nicanor, and two chambers were there one to its right and one to its left. One the Chamber of Pineḥas the Dresser, and one the Chamber of the Preparers of the Griddle-Cake Offering,
llm_translation: One in the south, as we learned: There were seven gates in the Azarah, three in the north, three in the south, and one in the east. Those in the south: the Gate of Kindling, its second - the Gate of Offering, its third - the Gate of Water. That in the east: the Gate of Nicanor, and there were two chambers there, one to his right and one to his left, one the chamber of Phinehas the clothier, and one the chamber of those who made the wicks.

hebrew_text: שֶׁבַּצָּפוֹן: שַׁעַר נִיצוֹץ, בִּנְיַן אַכְסַדְרָה הָיָה, וַעֲלִיָּיה בְּנוּיָה לוֹ עַל גַּבָּיו, וְשָׁם כֹּהֲנִים שׁוֹמְרִים מִלְמַעְלָה, וּלְוִיִּם מִלְּמַטָּה. וְשֶׁלִּפְנִים הֵימֶנּוּ הַחֵיל. שֵׁנִי לוֹ — שַׁעַר הַקָּרְבָּן, שְׁלִישִׁי לוֹ — שַׁעַר בֵּית הַמּוֹקֵד.
human_translation: that were in the north: the Gate of the Spark, a portico building, And a second story built atop it, and there the priests guarding from above Levites from below. Inside of the rampart, Second to the Gate of the Offering; third to it was the Gate of the Hall of the Hearth.
llm_translation: In the north: the Gate of Nitzotz, a building of Akhsadra was there, and upon it a structure built for him on its back, and there the priests were stationed above, and the Levites below. And in front of it was the camp. A second one for him — the Gate of Offering, a third one for him — the Gate of the Altar House.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא: חָמֵשׁ טְבִילוֹת וַעֲשָׂרָה קִדּוּשִׁין טוֹבֵל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וּמְקַדֵּשׁ בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם, וְכוּלָּן בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ, [עַל גַּג] בֵּית הַפַּרְוָה. חוּץ מִזּוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה בַּחוֹל, עַל גַּבֵּי שַׁעַר הַמַּיִם, וּבְצַד לִשְׁכָּתוֹ הָיְתָה.
human_translation: And it was taught The High Priest would five immersions and ten sanctifications on that day, And each of these in the sacred on the roof of the Hall of the Parva , except for this which was in the non-sacred on the roof of the Gate of the Water, was alongside his chamber.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Five immersions and ten sanctifications, the High Priest immerses and sanctifies in it on the same day, and all of them are in the Holy place, on the roof of the Chamber of Parwah. Except for this one that was in the weekday, on top of the Water Gate, and it was beside his chamber.

hebrew_text: וְלָא יָדַעְנָא אִי לִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין בַּצָּפוֹן וְלִשְׁכַּת בֵּית אַבְטִינָס בַּדָּרוֹם, אוֹ לִשְׁכַּת בֵּית אַבְטִינָס בַּצָּפוֹן וְלִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין בַּדָּרוֹם. וּמִסְתַּבְּרָא דְּלִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין בַּדָּרוֹם הֲוַאי.
human_translation: but we do not know whether the Parhedrin chamber was in the north and the Chamber of the House of Avtinas was in the south, or the Chamber of the House of Avtinas was in the north and the Parhedrin chamber was in the south. And, it is reasonable the Parhedrin chamber was in the south
llm_translation: We do not know whether the Chamber of Parhedrin was in the north and the Chamber of Beit Avtinas in the south, or whether the Chamber of Beit Avtinas was in the north and the Chamber of Parhedrin in the south. And it is reasonable that the Chamber of Parhedrin was in the south.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? מַקְדֵּים קָאֵי וּמֵיסֵךְ אֶת רַגְלָיו וְטָבֵיל, וְאָזֵיל לַצָּפוֹן וְגָמַר חֲפִינָה וְאָתֵי לְבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְעָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה כּוּלֵּי יוֹמָא. לְבַהֲדֵי פַּנְיָא מַדּוּ עֲלֵיהּ, וַהֲדַר אָזֵיל לַדָּרוֹם וְטָבֵיל וְנָיַיח.
human_translation: What is the reason arises early and he covers his legs, and immerses And walks to the north and learns the taking handfuls. And he comes to the Temple and performs the service for the entire day. Toward the evening they sprinkle upon him, and he then walks to the south and immerses and rests
llm_translation: What is the reason? He stands facing east, immerses his feet, and immerses himself, then goes to the north, completes his covering, goes to the Temple, and performs the entire service of the day. Afterward, he turns his face towards it, then goes to the south, immerses and rests.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ לִשְׁכַּת פַּרְהֶדְרִין בַּצָּפוֹן. מַקְדֵּים קָאֵי וּמֵיסֵךְ רַגְלָיו, וְאָזֵיל לַדָּרוֹם וְטָבֵיל וְגָמַר חֲפִינָה וְאָתֵי לְבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וְעָבֵיד עֲבוֹדָה כּוּלֵּיהּ יוֹמָא, לַהֲדֵי פַּנְיָא מַדּוּ עֲלֵיהּ, וַהֲדַר אָזֵיל לַדָּרוֹם וְטָבֵיל, וּבָעֵי מֶהְדַּר וּמֵיזַל לַצָּפוֹן וּמֵינַח — וּמִי (טָרַח) מַטְרְחִינַן לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּי הַאי?
human_translation: As, if you say Chamber of Parhedrin in the north, he arises early, and he covers his legs. he walks to the south and immerses. And he learns taking handfuls. And he comes to the Temple and performs the service for the entire day. Toward the evening they sprinkle upon him, and he then walks to the south and immerses, and he needs to walk back to the north and rest. Do we impose him to that extent?
llm_translation: If you say, "The chamber of the Parhedrin is in the north," he faces east and places his feet, then goes to the south, immerses, completes his purification, comes to the Temple, and performs the entire service all day, to turn his face away from it, then goes back to the south, immerses, and requires to purify himself and return to the north and rest - do we trouble him with all this?

hebrew_text: אַלְּמָה לָא? מַטְרְחִינַן לֵיהּ טְפֵי, דְּאִי צַדּוּקִי הוּא לִיפְרוֹשׁ.
human_translation: Why not we impose upon him more, that if he is a Sadducee, he will retire.
llm_translation: Why not? We trouble him with drops, for if he is a Sadducee, let him separate.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי, שֶׁלֹּא תָּזוּחַ דַּעְתּוֹ עָלָיו. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, נַעְבְּדִינְהוּ לְתַרְוַיְיהוּ בַּהֲדֵי הֲדָדֵי, אִי נָמֵי תִּסְגֵּי לֵיהּ בַּחֲדָא.
human_translation: Or, alternatively, that he will not become haughty As, if you do not say let us establish both of next to one another; or, alternatively, one sufficient for him.
llm_translation: If so, that his mind will not be troubled by it. For if you do not say so, we would serve them both at the same time, if so, it will be enough for him at once.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרוּ לוֹ אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וְכוּ׳. לֵימָא תִּהְוֵי תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּרַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הָנֵי כָּהֲנֵי — שְׁלוּחֵי דְרַחֲמָנָא נִינְהוּ, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ שְׁלוּחֵי דִידַן נִינְהוּ
human_translation: said to him: My Master, High Priest. Let us say that this is a conclusive refutation of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, as Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: These priests are the agents of the Merciful One. As, if you say they are our agents,
llm_translation: And they said to him, "My husband, the High Priest, etc." Let us say it is the merit of Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, for Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said: "These priests are messengers of the Merciful One, for if you say they are our messengers..."

hebrew_text: מִי אִיכָּא מִידֵּי דַּאֲנַן לָא מָצֵינַן לְמֶעְבַּד, וּשְׁלוּחֵי דִידַן מָצוּ עָבְדִי? הָכִי קָאָמְרִי לֵיהּ: מַשְׁבִּיעִין אָנוּ עָלֶיךָ עַל דַּעְתֵּינוּ וְעַל דַּעַת בֵּית דִּין.
human_translation: is there any matter that we are unable to perform and our agents are able to perform? This is what they say to him: We administer an oath to you according to our understanding and the understanding of the court,
llm_translation: Who is there from whom we cannot collect, yet our emissaries have collected from him? This is what they say to him: "We adjure you by the Lord, to tell us according to our understanding and according to the understanding of the court."

hebrew_text: הוּא פּוֹרֵשׁ וּבוֹכֶה וְהֵן פּוֹרְשִׁין וּבוֹכִין וְכוּ׳. הוּא פּוֹרֵשׁ וּבוֹכֶה — שֶׁחֲשָׁדוּהוּ צַדּוּקִי, וְהֵם פּוֹרְשִׁין וּבוֹכִין — דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: כׇּל הַחוֹשֵׁד בִּכְשֵׁרִים לוֹקֶה בְּגוּפוֹ.
human_translation: he would leave and cry and they would leave and cry. He turned aside and cried that they suspected him a Sadducee; and they turned aside and cried, as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who suspects the innocent is afflicted in his body.
llm_translation: He separates and cries, and they separate and cry, etc. He separates and cries - because the Sadducees suspected him, and they separate and cry - for Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Anyone who suspects others of being unfit is punished in his own body.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה? שֶׁלֹּא יְתַקֵּן מִבַּחוּץ וְיַכְנִיס, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁהַצַּדּוּקִין עוֹשִׂין.
human_translation: And why so he would not prepare outside and bring into in the manner the Sadducees did.
llm_translation: And all this, why? So that he should not fix from outside and bring in, as the Sadducees do.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּצַדּוּקִי אֶחָד שֶׁהִתְקִין מִבַּחוּץ וְהִכְנִיס. בִּיצִיאָתוֹ הָיָה שָׂמֵחַ שִׂמְחָה גְּדוֹלָה. פָּגַע בּוֹ אָבִיו, אָמַר לוֹ: בְּנִי, אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁצַּדּוּקִין אָנוּ, מִתְיָרְאִין אָנוּ מִן הַפְּרוּשִׁים. אָמַר לוֹ: כׇּל יָמַי הָיִיתִי מִצְטַעֵר עַל הַמִּקְרָא הַזֶּה: ״כִּי בֶּעָנָן אֵרָאֶה עַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״, אָמַרְתִּי: מָתַי יָבוֹא לְיָדִי וַאֲקַיְּימֶנּוּ, עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁבָּא לְיָדִי — לֹא אֲקַיְּימֶנּוּ?!
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident involving a Sadducee who prepared the incense outside brought Upon his emergence he was overjoyed The father of met him and said to him: My son, although we are Sadducees we fear the Pharisees said to his All my days I have been troubled over this verse: “For I will appear in the cloud above the Ark cover” I said: When will become available to me, and I will fulfill it Now that has become available to me, I not fulfill it?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident with a certain Sadducee who arranged the service from the outside and entered. Upon his exit, he was exceedingly happy. His father met him, and said to him: My son, even though we are Sadducees, we are afraid of the Pharisees. He said to him: All my days I have been distressed about this verse: "For in a cloud I will appear upon the cover." I said: When will it come to my hand that I may fulfill it? Now that it has come to my hand, shall I not fulfill it?!

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: לֹא הָיוּ יָמִים מוּעָטִין עַד שֶׁמֵּת וְהוּטַל בָּאַשְׁפָּה, וְהָיוּ תּוֹלָעִין יוֹצְאִין מֵחוֹטְמוֹ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: בִּיצִיאָתוֹ נִיגַּף, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: כְּמִין קוֹל נִשְׁמַע בַּעֲזָרָה שֶׁבָּא מַלְאָךְ וַחֲבָטוֹ עַל פָּנָיו. וְנִכְנְסוּ אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים וּמָצְאוּ כְּכַף רֶגֶל עֵגֶל בֵּין כְּתֵפָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְרַגְלֵיהֶם רֶגֶל יְשָׁרָה וְכַף רַגְלֵיהֶם כְּכַף רֶגֶל עֵגֶל״.
human_translation: said: Not a few days until he died and was laid out in the garbage and worms were coming out of his nose And some say he was struck as he emerged as Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: A type of sound was heard in the courtyard, as an angel came and struck him in the face. And his fellow priests came in and they found the likeness of a footprint of a calf between his shoulders. as it is stated “And their feet were straight feet, and the sole of their feet was like the sole of a calf’s foot”
llm_translation: They said: "There were not few days until he died and was thrown into the ash heap, and worms were coming out of his nostrils." And some say: "At his going out he was struck," as Rabbi Chiya teaches: "A voice like a kind was heard in the Temple courtyard, that an angel came and struck him on his face." And his brothers, the priests, entered and found a calf's foot between his shoulders, as it is said: "And their feet were straight feet, and the sole of their feet was like the sole of a calf's foot."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי זְכַרְיָה בֶּן קְבוּטָל וְכוּ׳. מַתְנֵי לֵיהּ רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא לְחִיָּיא בַּר רַב קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב ״אָמַר רַבִּי זְכַרְיָה בֶּן קְפוּטָל״, וּמַחְוֵי לֵיהּ רַב בִּידֵיהּ ״קְבוּטָל״. וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ מֵימָר! קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע הֲוָה קָרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Zekharya ben Kevutal Rav Ḥanan bar Rava taught this to Ḥiyya bar Rav before Rav Rabbi Zekharya bar Kefutal said, and Rav demonstrated with his hand Kevutal. Let him say it. was reciting Shema
llm_translation: Rabbi Zechariah ben Kevutal said, etc. Rav Hanan bar Rava taught it to Hiyya bar Rav before Rav, "Rabbi Zechariah ben Kevutal said," and Rav held "Kevutal" in his hand. And it is said to him, "Memar!" The recitation of the Shema was being read.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר מָרְתָּא: הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת שְׁמַע לֹא יִרְמוֹז בְּעֵינָיו, וְלֹא יִקְרוֹץ בְּשִׂפְתוֹתָיו, וְלֹא יוֹרֶה בְּאֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו. וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר חַסָּמָא אוֹמֵר: הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת שְׁמַע וּמְרַמֵּז בְּעֵינָיו, וּמְקָרֵץ בְּשִׂפְתוֹתָיו, וּמַרְאֶה בְּאֶצְבָּעוֹ — עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וְלֹא אוֹתִי קָרָאתָ יַעֲקֹב״!
human_translation: And is of that sort, permitted Didn’t Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta say: One who is reciting Shema should neither make allusions with his eyes, nor open and close with his lips nor gesture with his fingers? And it was taught Rabbi Elazar Ḥisma says: Concerning one who recites Shema and makes allusions with his eyes, or opens and closes with his lips, or gestures with his fingers, the verse says: “And you did not call out to Me, O Jacob”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And is this conduct proper? But Rabbi Yitzchak son of Shmuel son of Marta said: One who recites the Shema should not wink with his eyes, nor should he cluck with his lips, nor should he point with his fingers. And it was taught: Rabbi Elazar Hasma says: One who recites the Shema and winks with his eyes, and clucks with his lips, and points with his finger — concerning him the verse says: 'You have not called to Me, Jacob!'"

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּפֶרֶק רִאשׁוֹן, הָא בְּפֶרֶק שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: not difficult. This in first paragraph that in second paragraph
llm_translation: Not difficult: This in the first chapter, this in the second chapter.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְדִבַּרְתָּ בָּם״, בָּם — וְלֹא בִּתְפִלָּה. ״וְדִבַּרְתָּ בָּם״, בָּם יֵשׁ לְךָ רְשׁוּת לְדַבֵּר, וְלֹא בִּדְבָרִים אֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: the Sages taught: and you shall talk of them of them, but not of prayer, And you shall talk of them it is permitted to speak these matters other matters
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And you shall speak of them," of them - and not in prayer. "And you shall speak of them," in them you have permission to speak, and not in other matters.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אַחָא אוֹמֵר: ״וְדִבַּרְתָּ בָּם״, עֲשֵׂה אוֹתָן קֶבַע וְאַל תַּעֲשֵׂם עֲרַאי. אָמַר רָבָא: הַשָּׂח שִׂיחַת חוּלִּין — עוֹבֵר בַּעֲשֵׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְדִבַּרְתָּ בָּם״, בָּם — וְלֹא בִּדְבָרִים אֲחֵרִים. רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: עוֹבֵר בְּלָאו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל הַדְּבָרִים יְגֵעִים לֹא יוּכַל אִישׁ לְדַבֵּר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Aḥa says: Talk of them render them, a permanent and not render them a temporary Rava said: One who engages in idle chatter violates positive as it is stated: And you shall talk of them; of them and not of other matters. Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: one violates a negative as it is stated: “All these matters are wearisome; no man can ever state them”
llm_translation: Rabbi Ahah says: "And you shall speak of them," make them permanent and do not make them temporary. Rava said: One who engages in idle chatter transgresses a positive commandment, as it is stated: "And you shall speak of them," of them - and not of other matters. Rav Ahah bar Yaakov said: One transgresses a negative commandment, as it is stated: "All the words are wearying; no one can speak."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בִּקֵּשׁ לְהִתְנַמְנֵם, פִּרְחֵי כְהוּנָּה מַכִּין לְפָנָיו בְּאֶצְבַּע צְרָדָא, וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל! עֲמוֹד וְהָפֵג אַחַת עַל הָרִצְפָּה. וּמַעֲסִיקִין אוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ זְמַן הַשְּׁחִיטָה.
human_translation: sought to sleep the young priests snap the middle [ tzerada ] finger before him, and they say to him My Master, High Priest. Stand and chill once on the floor And they engage him until the time would arrive to slaughter the
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one sought to join the ranks of the priests, they would bring the flower buds of the priesthood before him on a finger plate, and they would say to him: "My master, the High Priest! Stand and take one step forward on the floor." And they would keep him occupied until the time of the slaughter.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי צְרָדָא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: צָרָתַהּ דְּדָא, מַאי הִיא — גּוּדָל. מַחְוֵי רַב הוּנָא וְאָזֵל קָלָא בְּכוּלֵּי בֵּי רַב.
human_translation: What tzerada Rav Yehuda said: It is the rival [ tzara ] of that [ da ] is it? the thumb; Rav Huna demonstrated the sound traveled throughout Rav’s study hall.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "tzrada"? Rav Yehuda said: Its bark is called "gudal." Rav Huna brought a basket and went to the entire household of Rav.

hebrew_text: וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל הָפֵג אַחַת עַל הָרִצְפָּה וְכוּ׳. אָמַר רַב יִצְחָק: עַל חֲדַת. מַאי הִיא? אָמְרִי לֵיהּ: אַחְוִי קִידָּה.
human_translation: they said to him: My Master, High Priest. chill once on the floor Rav Yitzḥak said Introduce something new. What is it They say to him: Demonstrate bowing kidda ].
llm_translation: And they say to him, "My husband, the High Priest, stumbled once on the floor, etc." Rav Yitzchak said: "On a new floor." What is it? They said to him: "It is a new pitch."

hebrew_text: וּמַעֲסִיקִין אוֹתוֹ עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ זְמַן שְׁחִיטָה (וְכוּ׳). תָּנָא: לֹא הָיוּ מַעֲסִיקִין אוֹתוֹ לֹא בְּנֵבֶל וְלֹא בְּכִנּוֹר, אֶלָּא בַּפֶּה. וּמָה הָיוּ אוֹמְרִין — ״אִם ה׳ לֹא יִבְנֶה בַיִת שָׁוְא עָמְלוּ בוֹנָיו בּוֹ״.
human_translation: And they engage him until the time to slaughter the would arrive. taught: They would not occupy him with a harp or a lyre, but with mouths. And what would they say? “Unless the Lord builds the house, its builders labor in vain on it;
llm_translation: And they keep him until the time of slaughter, etc. It was taught: They would not keep him neither with a carcass nor with a lyre, but with the mouth. And what would they say? "If the Lord does not build the house, in vain do its builders labor on it."

hebrew_text: מִיַּקִּירֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם לֹא הָיוּ יְשֵׁנִין כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּשְׁמַע כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל קוֹל הֲבָרָה וְלֹא תְּהֵא שֵׁינָה חוֹטַפְתּוֹ. תַּנְיָא, אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אָמַר: אַף בִּגְבוּלִין הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין כֵּן זֵכֶר לַמִּקְדָּשׁ, אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיוּ חוֹטְאִין.
human_translation: the prominent of Jerusalem would not sleep the entire night so that High Priest would hear sound of noise and sleep would not overcome him It was taught Abba Shaul said: They would do so even in the outlying areas in acknowledgment of the Temple; however, that they would sin,
llm_translation: From the dignitaries of Jerusalem they would not sleep all night, so that the High Priest would hear the crowing of the rooster and not have his sleep interrupted. It was taught: Abba Saul said: Even in the border towns they would do so as a remembrance for the Temple, but they would sin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: תַּרְגּוּמָא, נְהַרְדְּעָא. דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ אֵלִיָּהוּ לְרַב יְהוּדָה אֲחוּהּ דְּרַב סַלָּא חֲסִידָא, אָמְרִיתוּ: ״אַמַּאי לָא אָתֵי מָשִׁיחַ״? וְהָא הָאִידָּנָא יוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי הוּא וְאִבְּעוּל כַּמָּה בְּתוּלָתָא בִּנְהַרְדְּעָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַאי אָמַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Abaye said, and some say Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak Interpret Neharde’a, as Elijah said to Rav Yehuda, brother Rav Salla Ḥasida: You have said Why has the Messiah not come? Isn’t today Yom Kippur, and relations were had with several virgins in Neharde’a, said to him: What did the Holy One, Blessed be He, say He said:
llm_translation: Abbaye said, and some say it was Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: Translation, Nehardea. For Elijah said to Rav Yehuda the brother of Rav Sala the pious, "Why has the Messiah not come?" And this is the day of Atonement, and a young girl is being violated in Nehardea. He said to him, "What did the Holy One, blessed be He, say?" He said to him:

hebrew_text: ״לַפֶּתַח חַטָּאת רוֹבֵץ״. וְשָׂטָן מַאי אֲמַר? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׂטָן בְּיוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי — לֵית לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא לְאַסְטוֹנֵי. מִמַּאי? אָמַר רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: ״הַשָּׂטָן״ בְּגִמַטְרִיָּא תְּלָת מְאָה וְשִׁיתִּין וְאַרְבְּעָה הָוֵי. תְּלָת מְאָה וְשִׁיתִּין וְאַרְבְּעָה יוֹמֵי — אִית לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא לְאַסְטוֹנֵי. בְּיוֹמָא דְכִיפּוּרֵי — לֵית לֵיהּ רְשׁוּתָא לְאַסְטוֹנֵי.
human_translation: “Sin lies in waiting at the door” And what did Satan say said to him: Satan, on Yom Kippur, has no license to prosecute. From where Rami bar Ḥama said: The numerological value HaSatan is three hundred and sixty four: Three hundred and sixty-four days has license to prosecute. Yom Kippur, he has no license to prosecute.
llm_translation: "At the entrance, the sin offering crouches." And what does the Satan say? He says to him: Satan on the Day of Atonement - he has no permission to accuse. From where? Ramei bar Hama said: "The Satan" in numerology is three hundred sixty-four. For three hundred sixty-four days - he has permission to accuse. On the Day of Atonement - he has no permission to accuse.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בְּכׇל יוֹם תּוֹרְמִין אֶת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ בִּקְרִיאַת הַגֶּבֶר אוֹ סָמוּךְ לוֹ, בֵּין לְפָנָיו בֵּין לְאַחֲרָיו, וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מֵחֲצוֹת, וּבָרְגָלִים מֵאַשְׁמוּרָה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה. וְלֹא הָיְתָה קְרִיאַת הַגֶּבֶר מַגַּעַת עַד שֶׁהָיְתָה עֲזָרָה מְלֵאָה מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Every day would remove from the altar at the crow of the rooster or adjacent to it, whether before it or after it, And on Yom Kippur from midnight And on the Festivals, the first watch. And the call of the rooster would not arrive until the courtyard was full with the Jewish people
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Every day they would raise up the altar upon the calling of the man or one adjacent to him, whether in front of him or behind him. And on Yom Kippur from midnight, and on the festivals from the first watch. The calling of the man would not touch until the Temple courtyard was filled with Israelites.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תְּנַן הָתָם: אֵבָרִים שֶׁפָּקְעוּ מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, קוֹדֶם חֲצוֹת — יַחְזִיר, וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן, לְאַחַר חֲצוֹת — לֹא יַחְזִיר, וְאֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: We learned there, limbs that were forced off the altar before midnight, should return misuse of consecrated property from them. after midnight, should not return not misuse of consecrated property from them;
