human_translation: what is different about these “his linen garment,” “his garment” [ middo ], to his size [ middato ] “linen trousers,” that which was taught From where that no should precede the trousers? As it is stated: “And his linen trousers shall he put on his flesh,”
llm_translation: And what is the difference between these? "Midu bad," from its measure. "Miknasei bad," as it was taught: From where do we derive that a matter should not precede the miknasei? As it is stated: "And miknasei bad shall be worn upon his flesh."

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ? מִדּוֹ כְּמִדָּתוֹ — מִדְּאַפְּקֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא בִּלְשׁוֹן ״מִדּוֹ״. שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר קוֹדֶם לַמִּכְנָסַיִם — מֵ״עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ״ נָפְקָא.
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, his garment, according to his size the Merciful One uses the expression “his garment,” that no should precede the trousers derived “on his flesh.”
llm_translation: Reish Lakish? From his measure — from where the Merciful One took it out in the language of "from him." That a matter should not precede the entrails — it is derived from "from upon his flesh."

hebrew_text: נֵימָא כְּתַנָּאֵי: ״עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יִלְבַּשׁ״? לְהָבִיא מִצְנֶפֶת וְאַבְנֵט לַהֲרָמָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: Let us say parallel to tanna’im . on his flesh.” What the verse states: “Shall he put on”? to include mitre and belt, the removal Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Neima k'tanaei: 'al besaro', mah talmud lomar 'yilbash'? Lehaavi mitznefet v'avnet la'arama, divrei Rabbi Yehuda." English translation: "It was stated in a Baraita: 'On his flesh,' what does the Talmud mean to say 'he shall wear'? To bring a turban and a sash for lifting, the words of Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: לְרַבּוֹת בִּגְדֵי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, שֶׁכְּשֵׁירִין לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: to include the High Priest’s clothes on Yom Kippur, they are acceptable common priests
llm_translation: Rabbi Dosa says: to include the garments of the High Priest on Yom Kippur, for they are fitting for a regular priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי: שְׁתֵּי תְשׁוּבוֹת בְּדָבָר, חֲדָא: דְּאַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לֹא זֶה הוּא אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. וְעוֹד: בְּגָדִים שֶׁנִּשְׁתַּמַּשְׁתָּ בָּהֶן קְדוּשָּׁה חֲמוּרָה, תִּשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן קְדוּשָּׁה קַלָּה?! אֶלָּא, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יִלְבַּשׁ״ —
human_translation: Rabbi says: There are two refutations One the belt of High Priest is not the belt of common priest, And furthermore, garments that you used the most severe sanctity, you will use them services of lesser sanctity Instead What, the verse states “shall he put on”?
llm_translation: Rabbi said: Two responses in the matter, one: that the belt of the High Priest is not the same as the belt of a regular priest. And furthermore: garments that were used for a stringent sanctity, should they be used for a lighter sanctity?! Rather, what does the Scripture mean by saying "he shall wear" —

hebrew_text: לְרַבּוֹת אֶת הַשְּׁחָקִים.
human_translation: to include worn out
llm_translation: To include the skies.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִנִּיחָם שָׁם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁטְּעוּנִין גְּנִיזָה. רַבִּי דּוֹסָא אוֹמֵר: רְאוּיִן הֵן לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״וְהִנִּיחָם שָׁם״ — שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁתַּמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אַחֵר.
human_translation: and shall leave them there” teaches that require storing away, Rabbi Dosa says: they are acceptable for a common priest. And what, the verse states: “And shall leave them there,” that may not use them subsequent Yom Kippur
llm_translation: "And he shall leave them there," teaches that they require genizah. Rabbi Dosa says: They are fit for a lay priest, and what is the Talmud saying, "And he shall leave them there" — that he should not make use of them on the day after Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, דְּמָר סָבַר: עֲבוֹדָה הִיא, וּמָר סָבַר: לָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: What, is it not with regard to this that disagree: One Sage, holds is a service; and one Sage, holds it is not a service,
llm_translation: What is the reason they do not argue about this? For Mar holds: it is a form of labor, and Mar holds: it is not a form of labor.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא עֲבוֹדָה הִיא, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: צְרִיכָא קְרָא לְרַבּוֹיֵי, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא צְרִיכָא קְרָא לְרַבּוֹיֵי.
human_translation: not everyone is service and here they disagree about this: One Sage, holds a verse is necessary include And one Sage, holds that a verse is not necessary.
llm_translation: Not, for all the world, service it is, and here in this one it is divided, Master holds: Scripture needed for abundance, and Master holds: not Scripture needed for abundance.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי אָבִין: תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן בְּכַמָּה? מִתְּרוּמַת מַעֲשֵׂר יָלְפִינַן לַהּ, אוֹ מִתְּרוּמַת מִדְיָן יָלְפִינַן לַהּ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״וְהֵרִים״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״וְהֵרִים״. מָה לְהַלָּן — בְּקוּמְצוֹ, אַף כָּאן — בְּקוּמְצוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Avin raised a dilemma: How much removal of the ashes? Do we derive it from the teruma of the tithe, or do we derive it from the donations Midian, where Come hear As Rabbi Ḥiyya taught it is stated here: “And he shall take up and it is said elsewhere, “And he shall take up Just as there, a handful so too, here, a handful
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Avin: The heave offering of the ashes, in how much? From the heave offering of the tithe we learn for it, or from the heave offering of Midian we learn for it? Come and hear, as Rabbi Chiya taught: It is stated here "and he shall lift up," and it is stated there "and he shall lift up." Just as there it is with a handful, so too here it is with a handful.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: אַרְבַּע עֲבוֹדוֹת זָר חַיָּיב עֲלֵיהֶן מִיתָה: זְרִיקָה, וְהַקְטָרָה, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַמַּיִם, וְנִיסּוּךְ הַיַּיִן. וְלֵוִי אָמַר: אַף תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן. וְכֵן תָּנֵי לֵוִי בְּמַתְנִיתֵיהּ: אַף תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן.
human_translation: Rav said: there are four services a non-priest is liable to death Sprinkling and burning and the water libation and the wine libation And Levi said: also the removal of the ashes. And similarly, Levi taught in his baraitot : The removal of ashes also
llm_translation: Rav said: Four foreign services one is liable for death: Zerikah, and Haktarah, and Nisuch hamayim, and Nisuch hayayin. And Levi said: Also the Terumat hadeshen. And so Levi taught in his Mishnah: Also the Terumat hadeshen.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְרַב — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ אִתְּךָ תִּשְׁמְרוּ אֶת כְּהוּנַּתְכֶם לְכׇל דְּבַר הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּלְמִבֵּית לַפָּרוֹכֶת וַעֲבַדְתֶּם עֲבוֹדַת מַתָּנָה אֶתֵּן אֶת כְּהוּנַּתְכֶם וְהַזָּר הַקָּרֵב יוּמָת״. ״עֲבוֹדַת מַתָּנָה״ — וְלֹא עֲבוֹדַת סִילּוּק, ״וַעֲבַדְתֶּם״ — עֲבוֹדָה תַּמָּה, וְלֹא עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ עֲבוֹדָה.
human_translation: What is the reason for Rav’s As it is written: “And you and your sons with you shall keep your priesthood in everything pertaining to the altar and to that within the veil; and you shall serve; I give you the priesthood as a service of gift; and the common man that draws near shall be put to death” “A service of gift” and not a service removal “And you shall serve [ va’avadtem ]” a service that is complete [ avoda tamma ] and not a service that has another service after it
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rav's opinion? For it is written: "But you and your sons with you shall keep your priesthood for everything of the altar and inside the veil, and you shall serve. I give your priesthood as a gift, and any outsider who approaches shall be put to death." "Service of a gift" - not service of removal. "And you shall serve" - it is a complete service, not a service that leads to another service.

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי — רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״לְכׇל דְּבַר הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. וְרַב — הַהוּא לְאֵתוֹיֵי שֶׁבַע הַזָּאוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים וְשֶׁבִּמְצוֹרָע.
human_translation: And Levi? the Merciful One includes “in everything pertaining to the altar,” And Rav that to include the seven sprinklings that are inside and of the leper,
llm_translation: Levi - Rabbi Rachamana "for every matter of the altar." And Rav - that is to include the seven sprinklings inside and the one for the leper.

hebrew_text: וְלֵוִי — נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״דְּבַר״ וְ״כׇל דְּבַר״. וְרַב — ״דְּבַר״ וְ״כׇל דְּבַר״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: And Levi He derives from “pertaining “everything pertaining” And Rav not derive “pertaining “everything pertaining
llm_translation: Levi - he derived from "davar" and "kol davar." And Rav - "davar" and "kol davar" he did not expound.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: ״לְכׇל דְּבַר הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ — כָּלַל, ״עֲבוֹדַת מַתָּנָה״ — פָּרַט, כְּלָל וּפְרָט. אֵין בַּכְּלָל אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁבַּפְּרָט: עֲבוֹדַת מַתָּנָה — אִין, עֲבוֹדַת סִילּוּק — לָא! אָמַר קְרָא:
human_translation: But say “In everything pertaining” generalization, “a service of gift” specification, a generalization a specification. the generalization includes only what in the specification. A service of giving, yes, a service of removal not the verse states:
llm_translation: "And why? 'Regarding every matter of the altar' - this is a general principle, 'the service of a gift' - this is a specification, general and specific. In the general, there is only that which is in the specific: 'the service of a gift' - yes, 'the service of removal' - no! The verse says:"

hebrew_text: ״וּלְמִבֵּית לַפָּרוֹכֶת וַעֲבַדְתֶּם״, ״אֶל מִבֵּית לַפָּרוֹכֶת״ הוּא דַּעֲבוֹדַת מַתָּנָה וְלֹא עֲבוֹדַת סִילּוּק. הָא בַּחוּץ — אֲפִילּוּ עֲבוֹדַת סִילּוּק.
human_translation: “To that within the veil; and you shall serve; within the veil, that there is services of giving but not services of removing This outside even a service of removal,
llm_translation: "And from the house to the Parokhet, and you shall serve," "From the house to the Parokhet" - this is the service of preparation and not the service of removal. That is in the outer area - even the service of removal.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, ״וַעֲבַדְתֶּם״ נָמֵי, ״אֶל מִבֵּית לַפָּרוֹכֶת״ הוּא דַּעֲבוֹדָה תַּמָּה וְלֹא עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ עֲבוֹדָה. הָא בַּחוּץ — אֲפִילּוּ עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ עֲבוֹדָה!
human_translation: If so And you shall serve [ va’avadtem ],” also to what is within the veil. a complete service and not a service that has another service after it But outside even a service that has a service after it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, "and you shall serve" also, "from the house to the curtain" is service complete and not service that has another service after it. This is outside - even service that has another service after it!

hebrew_text: ״וַעֲבַדְתֶּם״ הֲדַר עָרְבֵיהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: And you shall serve [ va’avadtem ],” the verse goes back and combines
llm_translation: "And you shall serve" - then he mixed it with wine.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רָבָא: עֲבוֹדַת סִילּוּק בַּהֵיכָל, מַהוּ? לִפְנִים מְדַמֵּינַן לֵיהּ, אוֹ לְחוּץ מְדַמֵּינַן לֵיהּ?
human_translation: Rava raised a dilemma What a service of removal in the Sanctuary we compare to inside or we compare to the outer
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rava: Avodat Siluk ba'heichal, mah? Lifnim medameinan lei, o lechutz medameinan lei? Rava asked: Regarding the service of removal in the sanctuary, what is the law? Do we compare it to inside or do we compare it to outside?

hebrew_text: הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ: ״מִבֵּית״, ״וּלְמִבֵּית״.
human_translation: went back and resolved Within And to what is within
llm_translation: The glory has been spread: "from the house," "and from the house."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, זָר שֶׁסִּידֵּר אֶת הַשֻּׁלְחָן לִיחַיַּיב! אִיכָּא סִידּוּר בָּזִיכִין. סִידֵּר בָּזִיכִין לִיחַיַּיב! אִיכָּא סִילּוּק וְהַקְטָרָה.
human_translation: However, if so a non-priest who arranges the table should be liable. there is arranging of the vessels a non-priest who arranges the vessels should be liable. there is removal and the burning
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, a non-priest who arranges the table is liable! There is an arrangement with dishes. If he arranged the dishes, he is liable! There is removal and incense.

hebrew_text: זָר שֶׁסִּידֵּר אֶת הַמְנוֹרָה לִיחַיַּיב! אִיכָּא נְתִינַת פְּתִילָה. נָתַן פְּתִילָה לִיחַיַּיב! אִיכָּא נְתִינַת שֶׁמֶן.
human_translation: a non-priest who arranges the candelabrum should be liable. There is placing of the wicks placed a wick should be liable. there is placing the oil.
llm_translation: Stranger who arranged the menorah - liable! There is a placing of wick. Placed wick - liable! There is a placing of oil.

hebrew_text: נָתַן שֶׁמֶן לִיחַיַּיב! אִיכָּא הַדְלָקָה. הִדְלִיק לִיחַיַּיב! הַדְלָקָה לָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: placed the oil should be liable. there is lighting who lit should be liable. Lighting is not service,
llm_translation: He gave oil to someone - liable! There is kindling. He kindled - liable! Kindling is not considered labor.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״וְנָתְנוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן אֵשׁ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְעָרְכוּ עֵצִים עַל הָאֵשׁ״, לִימֵּד עַל הַצָּתַת אֲלִיתָא שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא בְּכֹהֵן כָּשֵׁר וּבִכְלִי שָׁרֵת! הַצָּתַת אֲלִיתָא — עֲבוֹדָה הִיא, הַדְלָקָה — לָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: And is not But wasn’t it taught “And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar and lay out wood in order upon the fire” teaches that the kindling of chips [ alita ] be performed only by a proper priest and the priestly garments? Kindling chips is a service, lighting not service.
llm_translation: And not? And it was taught: "And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar and arrange wood upon the fire," this teaches regarding the higher kindling that it should only be done by a qualified priest and with sacred vessels! The higher kindling - it is a form of service, kindling - it is not a form of service.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה, זָר שֶׁסִּידֵּר אֶת הַמַּעֲרָכָה לִיחַיַּיב! אִיכָּא סִידּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים. סִידֵּר שְׁנֵי גְזִירִין לִיחַיַּיב! אִיכָּא סִידּוּר אֵבָרִים.
human_translation: However, if so a non-priest who set up the arrangement should be liable, There is the arrangement of two logs arranged the two logs should be liable. There is the arrangement of limbs
llm_translation: Rather, from now on, a non-priest who arranges the woodpile is liable! If there is an arrangement of two pieces of wood, arranging two pieces makes one liable! If there is an arrangement of limbs.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אָמַר רַב אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זָר שֶׁסִּידֵּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים חַיָּיב! בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי, מָר סָבַר: עֲבוֹדָה תַּמָּה הִיא, וּמָר סָבַר: לָאו עֲבוֹדָה תַּמָּה הִיא.
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Asi say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A non-priest who arranged the two pieces of wood is liable? disagree on this One Sage, holds is a service that is complete and one Sage, holds is not a service that is complete
llm_translation: And this, Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A non-Jew who arranges two pieces of wood is liable! In this they dispute: one Master holds it is a complete action, and one Master holds it is not a complete action.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי. תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב: עֲבוֹדוֹת שֶׁזָּר חַיָּיב עֲלֵיהֶם מִיתָה: זְרִיקַת דָּם בֵּין לְפָנִים בֵּין לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, וְהַמַּזֶּה בְּחַטַּאת הָעוֹף, וְהַמְמַצֶּה, וְהַמַּקְטִיר בְּעוֹלַת הָעוֹף, וְהַמְנַסֵּךְ שְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין מַיִם, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה לוּגִּין יַיִן.
human_translation: It was taught in accordance with Rav, it was taught in accordance with Levi. It was taught in accordance with Rav: services for which a non-priest is liable to death the sprinkling of blood, whether inside or inside the innermost and one who sprinkles bird sin-offering; and one who squeezes a bird burnt-offering or burns and one who pours out three log of water or three log of wine
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rav, it was taught in the school of Levi. It was taught in the school of Rav: For the forbidden labor, one is liable to death: Sprinkling the blood, whether inside or outside, and the one who sprinkles the sin offering of a bird, and the one who prepares the matzah, and the one who offers the burnt offering of a bird, and the one who pours three log of water, and three log of wine.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּלֵוִי: עֲבוֹדוֹת שֶׁזָּר חַיָּיב עֲלֵיהֶן מִיתָה: הַמֵּרִים אֶת הַדֶּשֶׁן, וְשֶׁבַע הַזָּאוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים, וְשֶׁבִּמְצוֹרָע, וְהַמַּעֲלֶה עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ בֵּין דָּבָר כָּשֵׁר בֵּין דָּבָר פָּסוּל.
human_translation: It was taught in accordance with Levi: services for which a non-priest is liable to death One who removes the ashes the seven sprinklings that are inside or of the leper; and one who raises up onto the altar, whether it is proper or disqualified
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Levi: One is liable to receive the death penalty for the following acts of unauthorized service in the Temple: one who removes the ashes, the seven lamps inside, the leper's offering, and one who places something on the altar, whether it is valid or invalid.

hebrew_text: לָמָּה מְפַיְּסִין? לָמָּה מְפַיְּסִין?! כְּדַאֲמַרַן! אֶלָּא: לָמָּה מְפַיְּסִין וְחוֹזְרִין וּמְפַיְּסִין!
human_translation: Why did hold lotteries? Why did they hold lotteries? as we said Rather, Why did they hold a lottery, and once again hold another lottery,
llm_translation: Why do they appease? Why do they appease?! As we said! Rather, why do they appease and then retract and appease again!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּדֵי לְהַרְגִּישׁ כׇּל הָעֲזָרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר יַחְדָּיו נַמְתִּיק סוֹד בְּבֵית אֱלֹהִים נְהַלֵּךְ בְּרָגֶשׁ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: in order to create a commotion throughout courtyard, as it is stated: “We took sweet counsel together, in the House of God we walked with the throng”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: In order to feel all the help, as it is stated: "With him I will sweeten a secret in the house of God, we will walk with feeling."

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה מְפַיְּסִין? רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בְּבִגְדֵי חוֹל, וְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: בְּבִגְדֵי קֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: With what they held the lottery? Rav Naḥman said: non-sacred garments. And Rav Sheshet said: sacred garments.
llm_translation: In what do we appease? Rav Nachman said: with weekday garments, and Rav Sheshet said: with holy garments.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: בְּבִגְדֵי חוֹל, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּבִגְדֵי קֹדֶשׁ, אִיכָּא בַּעֲלֵי זְרוֹעוֹת דְּחָמְסִי וְעָבְדִי. רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: בְּבִגְדֵי קֹדֶשׁ, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ בְּבִגְדֵי חוֹל, אַגַּב חַבִּיבוּתֵיהּ מִיקְּרוּ וְעָבְדִי.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: non-sacred garments, because if you say sacred garments, there are armed men who might act with force and perform the service Rav Sheshet said: sacred garments, as, if you say non-sacred garments, due to beloved it may happen they would perform the service
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: In ordinary garments, for if you say in holy garments, there are those who are violent and act deceitfully. Rav Sheshet said: In holy garments, for if you say in ordinary garments, due to its preciousness they will tear it and act deceitfully.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דִּתְנַן: מְסָרוּן לַחַזָּנִין וְהָיוּ מַפְשִׁיטִין אוֹתָן אֶת בִּגְדֵיהֶן, וְלֹא הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶלָּא מִכְנָסַיִם בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: From where do I state As we learned they gave over to the attendants, and they would take their clothes off them and they would leave only trousers on them.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: From where do I say this to her, as we learned: They would hand over to the priests and they would take off their garments, and they would only put on them undergarments alone.

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו, בְּאוֹתָן שֶׁזָּכוּ לַפַּיִיס. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא, בְּאוֹתָן שֶׁלֹּא זָכוּ לַפַּיִיס.
human_translation: What, is not about those who won the lottery, Rav Huna bar Yehuda said Rav Sheshet said, No, about those who did not win the lottery.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "not"? In those who were not able to appease. Rav Huna son of Yehuda said in the name of Rav Sheshet: No, in those who were not able to appease.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּאוֹתָן שֶׁזָּכוּ לַפַּיִיס, ״לֹא הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶלָּא מִכְנָסַיִם בִּלְבַד״? וְהָתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִין שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר קוֹדֶם לַמִּכְנָסַיִם — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וּמִכְנְסֵי בַד יִהְיוּ עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ״!
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable As, if it were to enter your mind with those who won the lottery They would leave only their trousers on them? But wasn’t it taught From where that nothing should precede the trousers The verse states: “And he shall have linen trousers upon his flesh”
llm_translation: Thus it was explained: For if it were to enter your mind regarding those who were deemed worthy of appeasement, "They would not leave upon them anything except their undergarments alone"? And it was taught: From where do we derive that a matter should not precede the undergarments? The Torah teaches: "And his undergarments shall be upon his flesh"!

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, הָכִי קָתָנֵי: עַד שֶׁעוֹדָן עֲלֵיהֶן בִּגְדֵי חוֹל מַלְבִּישִׁין אוֹתָן מִכְנְסֵי קֹדֶשׁ, וְהָיוּ מַפְשִׁיטִין אוֹתָן בִּגְדֵי חוֹל וְלֹא הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין אֶלָּא מִכְנָסַיִם בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And the other one, this is not difficult, this is what is teaching: While the non-sacred garments are still on them they put the sacred trousers on them, and they remove the non-sacred clothes, and they left only the trousers.
llm_translation: And the other one? This is not difficult, as it is taught: Until they still have on them weekday garments, they dress them in holy pants, and they would remove the weekday garments and only put on the pants alone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, מְנָא אָמֵינָא לַהּ, דְּתַנְיָא: לִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית כְּמִין בָּסִילְקֵי גְּדוֹלָה הָיְתָה, פַּיִיס בְּמִזְרָחָהּ, וְזָקֵן יוֹשֵׁב בְּמַעֲרָבָהּ. וְהַכֹּהֲנִים מוּקָּפִין וְעוֹמְדִין כְּמִין (בְּ)כּוּלְיָאר, וְהַמְמוּנֶּה בָּא וְנוֹטֵל מִצְנֶפֶת מֵרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן, וְיוֹדְעִין שֶׁמִּמֶּנּוּ פַּיִיס מַתְחִיל. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ בְּבִגְדֵי חוֹל — מִצְנֶפֶת בְּבִגְדֵי חוֹל מִי אִיכָּא.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say As it was taught The Chamber of Hewn Stone was in the style of a large basilica [ basileki ]; the lottery in the east and an Elder sits in its west And the priests stand in a circle in the shape of a bracelet [ bekholyar ], and the appointed comes and removes the mitre from the head of one of them, and knew that the count began from him. And if it were to enter your mind non-sacred garments is there a mitre among non-sacred garments?
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, "From where do I know this? Because it was taught: The Chamber of Hewn Stone was like a large basilica, its entrance was in the east, and an elder sat in its west. The priests would encircle and stand like a colonnade, and the appointed one would come and take a head covering from one of them, and they would know that from him reconciliation begins. And if you think about it, in the case of ordinary garments - if there is a head covering among ordinary garments, who is there?"

hebrew_text: אִין — כִּדְתָנֵי רַב יְהוּדָה וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: כֹּהֵן שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ כְּתוֹנֶת, עוֹבֵד בָּהּ עֲבוֹדַת יָחִיד.
human_translation: Yes, as Rav Yehuda, and some say Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda, taught: A priest whose mother made a tunic for him, may perform an individual service with it on,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein" - kid'tanei Rav Yehudah ve'iteima Rav Shmuel bar Yehudah: Kohen she'asah lo imo ketonet, oved bah avodat yachid. English translation: "There is no" - as it was taught by Rav Yehudah, and some say by Rav Shmuel son of Yehudah: A priest who made for himself a tunic by his mother, performs with it individual service.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ לִשְׁכַּת הַגָּזִית חֶצְיָהּ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ וְחֶצְיָהּ בַּחוֹל, וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ שְׁנֵי פְתָחִים הָיוּ לָהּ, אֶחָד פָּתוּחַ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ, וְאֶחָד פָּתוּחַ בַּחוֹל. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כּוּלָּהּ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ — זָקֵן יוֹשֵׁב בְּמַעֲרָבָהּ? וְהָאָמַר מָר: אֵין יְשִׁיבָה בַּעֲזָרָה אֶלָּא לְמַלְכֵי בֵית דָּוִד בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Abaye said: Conclude from this the Chamber of Hewn Stone half in the sacred and half in the non-sacred And conclude from it had two doorways, one opened to the sacred and one opened to the non-sacred As, were it to enter your mind entirely in the sacred an Elder sat in its west? Didn’t the Master say: There is no sitting in the courtyard except for kings of the house of David alone?
llm_translation: Abaye said: Understand from it that the chamber of hewn stone was half in the Holy Temple and half in the secular area, and understand from it that it had two entrances, one open to the Holy Temple and one open to the secular area. For if your entire intention was in the Holy Temple, would an elder sit in its western part? But didn't Mar say: "Sitting is only in the Azarah for the kings of the House of David alone."

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כּוּלָּהּ בַּחוֹל — פַּיִיס בְּמִזְרָחָהּ? וְהָא בָּעֵינַן ״בְּבֵית אֱלֹהִים נְהַלֵּךְ בְּרָגֶשׁ״, וְלֵיכָּא. אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: חֶצְיָהּ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ וְחֶצְיָהּ בַּחוֹל.
human_translation: And if it were to enter your mind entirely in the non-sacred the lottery in the east? Aren’t we required “In the House of God we walked with the throng” there not be Rather, conclude from this half in the sacred and half in the non-sacred
llm_translation: And if your entire intention is in the weekday - pay her in her east? But don't we require "we will walk in the house of God with feeling," and it is not so. Rather, learn from it: half of it in the holy and half of it in the weekday.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ פֶּתַח אֶחָד יֵשׁ לָהּ וּפָתוּחַ לַקּוֹדֶשׁ — זָקֵן יוֹשֵׁב בְּמַעֲרָבָהּ? וְהָתְנַן: הַלְּשָׁכוֹת הַבְּנוּיוֹת בַּחוֹל וּפְתוּחוֹת לַקֹּדֶשׁ — תּוֹכָן קוֹדֶשׁ. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ פָּתוּחַ לַחוֹל — פַּיִיס בְּמִזְרָחָהּ? וְהָתְנַן: בְּנוּיוֹת בַּקֹּדֶשׁ וּפְתוּחוֹת לַחוֹל — תּוֹכָן חוֹל. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: שְׁנֵי פְתָחִים הָיוּ לָהּ, אֶחָד פָּתוּחַ בַּקֹּדֶשׁ וְאֶחָד פָּתוּחַ לַחוֹל.
human_translation: And were it to enter your mind had one doorway, which opened to the sacred Elder sit in its west? Didn’t we learn Chambers that are built in the non-sacred open up into the sacred their interior is sacred, And if, it were to enter your mind which opened to the non-sacred lottery in its east? Didn’t we learn built in the sacred open up into the non-sacred within them is non-sacred, Rather, isn’t it conclude from this had two doorways, one that opened up into the sacred and one that opened into the non-sacred
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And if your intention is that it has one entrance open to the Holy Temple - an elder sitting in its west? And we learned: If the doorways are constructed in the secular area and open to the Holy area - its interior is holy. And if your intention is that it is open to the secular area - it faces east? And we learned: If the doorways are constructed in the Holy area and open to the secular area - its interior is secular. Rather, it is not to be heard from it: It had two entrances, one open to the Holy area and one open to the secular area."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפַּיִיס הַשֵּׁנִי: מִי שׁוֹחֵט, מִי זוֹרֵק, מִי מְדַשֵּׁן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי, וּמִי מְדַשֵּׁן אֶת הַמְּנוֹרָה, וּמִי מַעֲלֶה אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ.
human_translation: The second lottery Who slaughters who sprinkles who removes the ashes the inner altar, and who removes the ashes the candelabrum, and who takes the limbs up to the ramp
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The second group of priests: who slaughters, who sprinkles, who cleanses the inner altar, who cleanses the menorah, and who brings limbs to the ramp.

hebrew_text: הָרֹאשׁ וְהָרֶגֶל, וּשְׁתֵּי הַיָּדַיִם, הָעוֹקֶץ וְהָרֶגֶל, וְהֶחָזֶה וְהַגֵּרָה, וּשְׁתֵּי הַדְּפָנוֹת, וְהַקְּרָבַיִם. וְהַסֹּלֶת, וְהַחֲבִיתִּין, וְהַיַּיִן. שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר כֹּהֲנִים זָכוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: The head and the leg and the two forelegs The tail, and the leg And the breast and the throat And the two flanks and the intestines And the fine flour And the griddle-cake offering and the wine thirteen priests prevailed in this
llm_translation: The head and the leg, and the two hands, the thigh and the leg, and the breast and the shoulder, and the two flanks, and the intestines. And the fine flour, and the loaves, and the wine. Thirteen priests benefited from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר בֶּן עַזַּאי לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: דֶּרֶךְ הִלּוּכוֹ הָיָה קָרֵב.
human_translation: Ben Azzai said before Rabbi Akiva in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: it was sacrificed the way it walks
llm_translation: Ben Azzai said before Rabbi Akiva in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua: His way of walking was close.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: כְּשֶׁהֵן מְפַיְּיסִין — לַעֲבוֹדָה אַחַת מְפַיְּיסִין, אוֹ דִילְמָא — לְכׇל עֲבוֹדָה וַעֲבוֹדָה הֵן מְפַיְּיסִין? תָּא שְׁמַע: אַרְבַּע פְּיָיסוֹת הָיוּ שָׁם. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ לְכׇל עֲבוֹדָה הֵן מְפַיְּיסִין — טוּבָא הֲווֹ! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אַרְבַּע פְּעָמִים נִכְנָסִין לְהָפִיס, וּלְכׇל חֲדָא וַחֲדָא הָיוּ בַּהּ טוּבָא פְּיָיסוֹת.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before When the priests performed the lottery, did they perform a lottery for one service, or perhaps they performed a lottery for each and every service Come hear There were four lotteries there. And if it were to enter your mind they performed a lottery each and every service there would be many Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: this is what is saying: gathered four times for a lottery, but each many lotteries
llm_translation: The Gemara raises a question: When they reconcile - do they reconcile for one service, or perhaps - do they reconcile for each and every service? Come and hear: There were four reconciliations there. And if it were to your mind that they reconcile for each and every service - it would be good! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, this is what it means: They entered to reconcile four times, and for each and every one of them there were good reconciliations.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה פַּיִיס לַמַּחְתָּה, אֶלָּא כֹּהֵן שֶׁזָּכָה בִּקְטֹרֶת אוֹמֵר לָזֶה שֶׁעִמּוֹ ״זְכֵה עִמִּי בַּמַּחְתָּה״.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says: there was no lottery the coal pan, Rather, the priest who won of the incense said to the one who was next to him: Be privileged along with me with the coal pan.
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Yehuda says: The firepan was not appeased, except the priest who merited the incense would say to his colleague, "May you merit with me in the firepan."

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי מַחְתָּה וּקְטֹרֶת, דַּחֲדָא עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: The coal pan and incense are different, because they are a single service,
llm_translation: The translation of the Talmudic text is as follows: "The difference between the incense and the meal-offering is that they are two distinct types of service."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: דַּוְקָא מַחְתָּה וּקְטֹרֶת דַּחֲדָא עֲבוֹדָה הִיא, אֲבָל שְׁאָר עֲבוֹדוֹת בָּעֵי פַּיִיס!
human_translation: There are who say specifically the coal pan and the incense, which are one service, However, other services, require a lottery
llm_translation: There are those who say: specifically the incense offering and the ketoret are one type of service, but other services require payment!

hebrew_text: מַחְתָּה אִצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הוֹאִיל וְלָא שְׁכִיחָא, וּמְעַתְּרָא, נַתְקֵין לַהּ פַּיִיס בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ. קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: it was necessary for him have entered your mind to say that since is infrequent, and it brings about wealth we should institute a lottery for itself, teaches us
llm_translation: The mortar is needed for it, as your mind thought, since it is not common, and he prayed, they established for it a place by itself. This is implied to us.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: לֹא לְכׇל עֲבוֹדָה וַעֲבוֹדָה מְפַיְּיסִין, אֶלָּא כֹּהֵן שֶׁזָּכָה בְּתָמִיד, שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים נִמְשָׁכִין עִמּוֹ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Ḥiyya taught A lottery is not held for each individual service; rather, priest who won the lottery of the daily offering, twelve of his fellow priests, are drawn in along with him Learn from this
llm_translation: Come and hear, as Rabbi Chiya teaches: Not for every service do they appease, but only a Kohen who merited the daily offering, twelve of his priestly brethren are drawn along with him. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: פַּיִיס הַשֵּׁנִי וְכוּ׳. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מִי מְקַבֵּל? שׁוֹחֵט מְקַבֵּל, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ זוֹרֵק מְקַבֵּל — אַגַּב חַבִּיבוּתֵיהּ, לָא מְקַבֵּל לֵיהּ לְכוּלֵּיהּ דָּם.
human_translation: The second lottery A dilemma was raised before Who collects slaughters collects that if you say sprinkles collects due to his love not collect all the blood
llm_translation: The second pais and onwards. It was asked of them: Who receives? The slaughterer receives, for if you say the one who throws receives - due to its preciousness, he does not receive it for all its blood.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא: זוֹרֵק מְקַבֵּל, דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ שׁוֹחֵט מְקַבֵּל — זִימְנִין דְּשָׁחֵיט זָר.
human_translation: Or perhaps sprinkles collects as, if you say slaughters collects, sometimes a non-priest slaughters
llm_translation: Or perhaps: one who throws receives, for if you say slaughtering receives - sometimes a non-Jew slaughters.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בֶּן קָטִין עָשָׂה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר דַּד לַכִּיּוֹר, כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים הָעֲסוּקִין בַּתָּמִיד מְקַדְּשִׁין יְדֵיהֶן וְרַגְלֵיהֶן בְּבַת אַחַת.
human_translation: Come hear Ben Katin made twelve spigots for the laver so that his twelve fellow priests who were engaged in the daily offering could sanctify their hands and feet at one time.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Ben Katīn made twelve breastplates for the censer, so that his twelve priestly brothers who are engaged in the continual offering may sanctify their hands and feet at once.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ שׁוֹחֵט מְקַבֵּל, תְּלֵיסַר הָוֵי! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: זוֹרֵק מְקַבֵּל. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And if it should enter your mind slaughters collects there are thirteen Rather, isn’t it conclude from this sprinkles, collects Conclude from this
llm_translation: If your intention is to slaughter and you receive, it is considered thirteen! Rather, it is not the case: one who throws receives. Consider this.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: שָׁחַט הַשּׁוֹחֵט, וְקִבֵּל הַמְקַבֵּל, וּבָא לוֹ לִזְרוֹק. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: We too have learned The slaughterer slaughtered, the collector collected, and he comes to sprinkle Conclude from this
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi, "We also learned: 'The one who slaughters, the one who receives, and he comes to sprinkle.' Learn from it."

hebrew_text: אָמַר בֶּן עַזַּאי לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד דֶּרֶךְ הִלּוּכוֹ? הָרֹאשׁ וְהָרֶגֶל, הֶחָזֶה וְהַגֵּרָה, וּשְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם, וּשְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת, הָעוֹקֶץ וְהָרֶגֶל. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: דֶּרֶךְ הֶפְשֵׁטוֹ הָיָה קָרֵב. כֵּיצַד דֶּרֶךְ הֶפְשֵׁטוֹ? הָרֹאשׁ וְהָרֶגֶל, הָעוֹקֶץ וְהָרֶגֶל, וּשְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת, וּשְׁתֵּי הַיָּדַיִם, הֶחָזֶה וְהַגֵּרָה.
human_translation: ben Azzai said before Rabbi Akiva The Sages taught In what manner the way it walks? The head and the leg The breast and the neck, and the two forelegs, and the two flanks, the tail and the leg. Rabbi Yosei says: It was sacrificed the way it was skinned. In what manner the way it was skinned? The head and the leg the tail and the leg two flanks, and the two forelegs, the breast and the neck.
llm_translation: Ben Azzai said before Rabbi Akiva, etc. The Sages taught: What is the way of his walking? The head and the leg, the chest and the back, and two hands, and two sides, the heel and the leg. Rabbi Yosei says: His way was close. What is the way of his being close? The head and the leg, the heel and the leg, and two sides, and two hands, the chest and the back.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: דֶּרֶךְ נִיתּוּחוֹ הָיָה קָרֵב. כֵּיצַד דֶּרֶךְ נִיתּוּחוֹ? הָרֹאשׁ וְהָרֶגֶל, וּשְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם, הֶחָזֶה וְהַגֵּרָה, וּשְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת, וְהָעוֹקֶץ וְהָרֶגֶל. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: דֶּרֶךְ עִילּוּיוֹ הָיָה קָרֵב. כֵּיצַד דֶּרֶךְ עִילּוּיוֹ? הָרֹאשׁ וְהָרֶגֶל, הֶחָזֶה וְהַגֵּרָה, וּשְׁתֵּי הַדְּפָנוֹת, וְהָעוֹקֶץ וְהָרֶגֶל, וּשְׁתֵּי הַיָּדַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It was sacrificed the way it was cut up In what manner the way it was cut up? The head and the leg and the two forelegs, the breast and the neck, and the two flanks, and the tail and the leg. Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: It was sacrificed according to quality In what manner the quality The head and the leg, the breast and the neck, and the two flanks, the tail and the leg, and two forelegs.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The way of the carving was close. How was the way of the carving? The head and the leg, and both hands, the chest and the back, and both sides, and the thorn and the leg. Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: The way of the elevation was close. How was the way of the elevation? The head and the leg, the chest and the back, and both sides, and the thorn and the leg, and both hands.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״כׇּל נֵתַח טוֹב יָרֵךְ וְכָתֵף״? הָהִיא בִּכְחוּשָׁה.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “Every good piece, the thigh and the shoulder” That lean
llm_translation: And it is written: "Every good piece has thigh and shoulder"? That is in the case of a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: בֵּין תַּנָּא דִּידַן וּבֵין רַבִּי יוֹסֵי — בָּתַר עִילּוּיָא דְבִשְׂרָא אָזְלִינַן. מָר אָזֵיל בָּתַר אִיבְרָא דְבִישְׂרָא, וּמָר אָזֵיל בָּתַר שֻׁמְנָא דְבִישְׂרָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Both the tanna our and Rabbi Yosei we follow the quality of the meat Sage, follows the limb, of the meat; Sage, follows the fattiness of the meat.
llm_translation: Rava said: Between our Mishna and Rabbi Yosei - we follow the elevation of the meat. Master goes after the liver of the meat, and Master goes after the fat of the meat.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא סָלְקָא רֶגֶל בַּהֲדֵי רֵישָׁא? מִשּׁוּם דְּרֵישָׁא נְפִישִׁי בֵּיהּ עֲצָמוֹת, קָרְבָא רֶגֶל בַּהֲדֵיהּ.
human_translation: what is the reason that leg goes up together with the head? Because the head has much bone in it, the leg is offered with it.
llm_translation: What is the reason that the foot emerges first from the head? Because the bones are more prominent in it, the foot precedes.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת רֹאשׁ קָרֵב בְּרֵישָׁא, מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִין לְרֹאשׁ וּפֶדֶר שֶׁקּוֹדְמִין לְכׇל הָאֵבָרִים — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ וְאֶת פִּדְרוֹ וְעָרַךְ״. וְאִידַּךְ: ״פָּדֶר״ אַחֲרִינָא.
human_translation: at any rate everyone agrees head is sacrificed first. From where do we As it was taught From where that the head and the fat precede all the limbs? The verse states: and its head and its fat, and shall arrange And the other fat
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "All the limbs of the body are dependent on the head; where do we derive this from? For it was taught: From where do we derive that the head and the leg precede all the other limbs? The Talmud teaches: 'His head and his leg shall be valued.' And the other limbs are valued after 'peder'."

hebrew_text: לְמַאי אֲתָא? לְכִדְתַנְיָא: כֵּיצַד הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה? נוֹתֵן אֶת הַפֶּדֶר אַבֵּית הַשְּׁחִיטָה וּמַעֲלֵהוּ, וְזֶה הוּא דֶּרֶךְ כָּבוֹד שֶׁל מַעְלָה.
human_translation: what does come As it was taught In what manner would do He place the fat over the place of slaughter, and bring it up and that is the respectful way toward the Most High,
llm_translation: For what purpose does he come? As it was taught: How would he do it? He would place the neck of the slaughtered animal on the block and raise it, and this is the way of honor of the upper world.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַפַּיִיס הַשְּׁלִישִׁי: חֲדָשִׁים לִקְטֹרֶת בֹּאוּ וְהָפִיסוּ. וְהָרְבִיעִי: חֲדָשִׁים עִם יְשָׁנִים — מִי מַעֲלֶה אֵבָרִים מִן הַכֶּבֶשׁ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: the third lottery, new to the incense participate in the lottery The fourth new with old who take the limbs up from the ramp, to the altar.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The third supervisor of the incense offering: "Bring new coals for the incense." And the fourth supervisor: "New coals with old coals - who brings limbs from the ramp to the altar."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא שָׁנָה אָדָם בָּהּ. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁמַּעֲשֶׁרֶת.
human_translation: taught No person ever performed twice, What is the reason Rabbi Ḥanina said: because it brings wealth
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A certain Tanna taught: A person should never change it. What is the reason? Rabbi Chanina said: Because of the tithe.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״יָשִׂימוּ קְטוֹרָה בְּאַפֶּךָ״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״בָּרֵךְ ה׳ חֵילוֹ״, אִי הָכִי עוֹלָה נָמֵי, הָכְתִיב: ״וְכָלִיל עַל מִזְבְּחֶךָ״!
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: What is the reason If we say it is because it is written: “They shall put incense before You and it is written after that: “Bless, O Lord, his substance” if so, also a burnt-offering, since it is written “And whole burnt-offerings on Your altar.”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: What is the reason? If you will say because it is written: "They shall put incense in Your nostrils," and it is written afterwards: "Blessed be the Lord, His strength," if so, let it be an Olah offering, as it is written: "And the whole burnt offering upon Your altar!"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָא שְׁכִיחָא וְהָא לָא שְׁכִיחָא.
human_translation: said to him: This, is frequent, and that, is infrequent.
llm_translation: He said to him: this is common and this is not common.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ צוּרְבָּא מֵרַבָּנַן דְּמוֹרֵי אֶלָּא דְּאָתֵי מִשֵּׁבֶט לֵוִי אוֹ מִשֵּׁבֶט יִשָּׂשכָר. לֵוִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״יוֹרוּ מִשְׁפָּטֶיךָ לְיַעֲקֹב״. יִשָּׂשכָר, דִּכְתִיב: ״(וּבְנֵי) יִשָּׂשכָר יוֹדְעֵי בִינָה לַעִתִּים לָדַעַת מַה יַּעֲשֶׂה יִשְׂרָאֵל״. וְאֵימָא יְהוּדָה נָמֵי, דִּכְתִיב: ״יְהוּדָה מְחוֹקְקִי״! אַסּוֹקֵי שְׁמַעְתָּא אַלִּיבָּא דְהִילְכְתָא קָאָמֵינָא.
human_translation: Rava said: You do not find a young Torah scholar who gives instruction unless he comes from the tribe of Levi or from the tribe of Issachar. Levi as it is written: “They shall teach Jacob Your ordinances Issachar as it is written: “And of the children of Issachar, men that had understanding of the times, to know what Israel should do” And say Judah also, as it is written: “Judah is my lawgiver” I was speaking of those who draw conclusions according to the halakha .
llm_translation: Rava said: The reason why the Sages did not establish the leap year except from the tribe of Levi or from the tribe of Issachar is because it is written about Levi, "They shall teach Your ordinances to Jacob" (Deuteronomy 33:10). And about Issachar, it is written, "(And of the sons of) Issachar, men who understood the times, with knowledge of what Israel should do" (1 Chronicles 12:33). And why not from Judah? Because it is written, "Judah, you are he whom your brothers shall praise" (Genesis 49:8)! I am occupied with the study of the Torah, and my mind is not free to engage in other matters.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין מְפַיְּיסִין עַל תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם, אֶלָּא כֹּהֵן שֶׁזָּכָה בּוֹ בְּשַׁחֲרִית זוֹכֶה בּוֹ עַרְבִית, מֵיתִיבִי: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּפַיְּיסִין שַׁחֲרִית כָּךְ מְפַיְּיסִין בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם! כִּי תַּנְיָא הָהִיא — בִּקְטוֹרֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They did not hold lottery daily afternoon offering. Rather, priest who won the morning wins evening, afternoon raises an objection Just as they hold a lottery in the morning, so too, they hold a lottery in the afternoon. When that was taught, to the incense,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One does not reconcile regarding the continual offering between the evenings, except a priest who merited it in the morning offering merits it in the evening offering. It was raised: Just as they reconcile the morning offering, so too they reconcile between the evenings! For it was taught in a Baraita — regarding the incense offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּפַיְּיסִין לוֹ שַׁחֲרִית כָּךְ מְפַיְּיסִין לוֹ עַרְבִית! אֵימָא ״לָהּ״.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught Just as they hold a lottery for it [ lo ] in the morning, so too, they hold a lottery for it [ lo ] in the afternoon. say: Lah ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: Just as they appease Him with the morning prayer, so too they appease Him with the evening prayer! Perhaps we should say "to her."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמְּפַיְּיסִין לוֹ שַׁחֲרִית כָּךְ מְפַיְּיסִין לוֹ עַרְבִית, וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁמְּפַיְּיסִין לָהּ שַׁחֲרִית כָּךְ מְפַיְּיסִין לָהּ עַרְבִית!
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught Just as they hold a lottery for it [ lo ] the morning, so too, they hold a lottery for it [ lo ] in the afternoon; and just as they hold a lottery for it [ lah ] in the morning, so too, they hold a lottery for it [ lah ] in the afternoon.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it was taught: Just as they appease Him with the morning prayer, so too they appease Him with the evening prayer, and just as they appease her with the morning prayer, so too they appease her with the evening prayer!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יִצְחָק: הָכָא בְּשַׁבָּת עָסְקִינַן, הוֹאִיל וּמִשְׁמָרוֹת מִתְחַדְּשׁוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak said: Here, we are dealing with Shabbat, since the priestly rotations are renewed
llm_translation: Said Rav Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak: Here we are dealing with Shabbat, since the watches are renewed.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא, נְפִישִׁי לְהוּ פְּיָיסוֹת! מַיְיתֵי כּוּלְּהוּ מִצַּפְרָא אָתוּ, דְּזָכֵי בֵּיהּ שַׁחֲרִית — זָכֵי, דְּזָכֵי בְּעַרְבִית — זָכֵי.
human_translation: And to what we thought initially, there would be many lotteries, all would come in the morning, who would win the morning would win who would win the afternoon would win
llm_translation: And for what does one merit to have knowledge from the outset, it is preferable for them to have peace! He brings all of them from the morning star, if one merits in it - he merits, if one merits in the evening - he merits.

hebrew_text: הָרְבִיעִי חֲדָשִׁים עִם יְשָׁנִים וְכוּ׳. מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: הַמַּעֲלֶה אֵיבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ, הוּא מַעֲלֶה אוֹתָן לַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: The fourth new with old The mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. As we learned Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: who takes the limbs up to the ramp is the one who takes them up to the altar.
llm_translation: The fourth offering is new grain with old grain, etc. The Mishnah teaches not like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. For we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: One who brings limbs to the sheep, he brings them to the altar.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: ״בְּרׇב עָם הַדְרַת מֶלֶךְ״, וּמָר סָבַר: מְקוֹם שְׁכִינָה לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? One Sage, holds “In the multitude of people is the king’s glory” And one Sage, holds not proper conduct the place of the Divine Presence
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? One Master holds: "In the multitude of people is the king's glory," and the other Master holds: The place of the Divine Presence is not a traveler's path.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְלָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אִית לֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. דְּאִם כֵּן, בָּצְרוּ לְהוּ פְּיָיסוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, is not of Rabbi Yehuda, And Rabbi Yehuda is not of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. if it would be so there would be too few lotteries;
llm_translation: Rava said: "Not Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov has to Rabbi Yehuda, and not Rabbi Yehuda has to Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. For if so, they would have needed to make peace."

hebrew_text: וְאִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ תַּנָּא דְּתָנֵי חָמֵשׁ —
human_translation: And if you find a tanna who teaches five
llm_translation: And if you find a Tanna who teaches five—

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב וּדְלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: that in accordance with neither Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov nor Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: That one who is not like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov and not like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ תָּמִיד קָרֵב בְּתִשְׁעָה, בַּעֲשָׂרָה, בְּאַחַד עָשָׂר, בִּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר. לֹא פָּחוֹת וְלֹא יוֹתֵר. כֵּיצַד? עַצְמוֹ בְּתִשְׁעָה. בֶּחָג, בְּיַד אֶחָד צְלוֹחִית שֶׁל מַיִם — הֲרֵי כָּאן עֲשָׂרָה.
human_translation: daily offering is sacrificed by nine by ten by eleven, by twelve no fewer and no more How so? itself by nine On the festival in hand a jug of water there are ten
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The daily offering is brought with nine, with ten, with eleven, and with twelve. Not less and not more. How so? By itself with nine. On a festival, with one handbreadth of water — here we have ten.

hebrew_text: בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם בְּאַחַד עָשָׂר: הוּא עַצְמוֹ בְּתִשְׁעָה, וּשְׁנַיִם בְּיָדָם שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים. בַּשַּׁבָּת בְּאַחַד עָשָׂר: הוּא עַצְמוֹ בְּתִשְׁעָה, וּשְׁנַיִם בְּיָדָם שְׁנֵי בְּזִיכֵי לְבוֹנָה שֶׁל לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים. וּבְשַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הַחַג בְּיַד אֶחָד צְלוֹחִית שֶׁל מַיִם.
human_translation: In the afternoon eleven itself by nine, and two in whose hands two logs On Shabbat, eleven itself by nine, and two in whose hands two vessels of frankincense the shewbread. And on Shabbat that within the festival in whose hand jug of water
llm_translation: Between the two evenings on the eleventh: it is a bone in nine, and two in his hands two beams of wood. On Shabbat on the eleventh: it is a bone in nine, and two in his hands two halves of the showbread. And on Shabbat during the festival in one hand a jug of water.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא וְאִיתֵּימָא רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין מְנַסְּכִין מַיִם בֶּחָג אֶלָּא בְּתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר. מִמַּאי? מִדְּקָתָנֵי: וּבְשַׁבָּת שֶׁבְּתוֹךְ הֶחָג בְּיַד אֶחָד צְלוֹחִית שֶׁל מַיִם. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ בְּתָמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם מְנַסְּכִין, בַּחוֹל נָמֵי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba, and some say Rami bar Ḥama, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan, said: On the festival they pour the water libation only the daily morning offering From where from that it is taught And on Shabbat that within the festival in whose hand jug of water, And if it should enter your mind they pour during the daily afternoon offering so, you find a weekday as well,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Abba said, and some say it was Ramei Bar Ḥama, and some say it was Rabbi Yoḥanan: One does not pour water on the festival except with the morning daily offering. From where? Because it is taught: And on Shabbat that falls during the festival, one pours a jug of water with one hand. And if you were to say that with the morning daily offering between the evenings one pours, on a weekday one would also forget it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי, אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: וְלַמְנַסֵּךְ אוֹמֵר לוֹ ״הַגְבַּהּ יָדֶיךָ״, שֶׁפַּעַם אַחַת נִסֵּךְ עַל גַּבֵּי רַגְלָיו, וּרְגָמוּהוּ כׇּל הָעָם בְּאֶתְרוֹגֵיהֶן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: We too have learned And they would say to the pourer: Raise your hand because one time poured onto his feet, all the people pelted him with their etrogim learn from this
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said, "We also learned: Regarding the one who pours the water (on the altar), he says to him, 'Raise your hands high,' because once someone poured (the water) on his feet, and all the people stoned him with their etrogim. Learn from this."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין לְתָמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם שֶׁטָּעוּן שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים בִּשְׁנֵי כֹהֲנִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְעָרְכוּ עֵצִים״, אִם אֵינוֹ עִנְיָן לְתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבִעֵר עָלֶיהָ הַכֹּהֵן עֵצִים בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר וְעָרַךְ עָלֶיהָ״, תְּנֵיהוּ עִנְיָן לְתָמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: From where that the daily afternoon offering requires two logs by two priests? As it is stated and lay out wood etzim If this is not applicable to the daily morning offering, as it is written about “And the priest shall burn wood on it every morning, and arrange on it” apply it to the daily afternoon offering.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: From where do we derive the daily offering that is between the evenings, which is prepared with two logs of wood by two priests, as it is stated: "And they shall arrange the wood"? If it is not a matter of the daily offering of the morning, as it is written: "And the priest shall burn wood upon it every morning, and he shall arrange the burnt offering upon it," both of them are a matter of the daily offering that is between the evenings.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי בְּתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, וְאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: עֲבֵיד וַהֲדַר עֲבֵיד! אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא ״וּבִעֵר״ ״וּבִעֵר״.
human_translation: But say this and this, the daily morning offering, and the Merciful One states Perform and then return and perform If so, should say: “And he shall burn “And he shall burn
llm_translation: And why not both with the morning daily offering, and the Merciful One said: Do and then do again! If so, let us say the verse "and burn" "and burn."

hebrew_text: אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וּבִעֵר״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא חַד — אִין, תְּרֵי — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּנַעְבֵּיד חַד וְנַעְבֵּיד תְּרֵי!
human_translation: If the Merciful One had written “And he shall burn I would have said one not two. it teaches us one should perform and two should perform
llm_translation: If the Merciful One wrote "and he shall burn," I would have said one - no, two - no, it implies to us that it applies to one and applies to two!

hebrew_text: אִם כֵּן, נֵימָא קְרָא: ״וּבִעֵר״ ״וּבִעֲרוּ״, אִי נָמֵי: ״וְעָרַךְ״ ״וְעָרְכוּ״, מַאי ״וּבִעֵר״ ״וְעָרְכוּ״? שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כִּדְקָא אָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: If so, the verse should say: “And he shall burn And they shall burn Or, alternatively, And he shall lay out “And they shall lay out What “And he shall burn and then: “And they shall lay out Learn from this as we have said,
llm_translation: If so, let us say the verse: "and he shall burn" "and they shall burn," if not, "and he shall set in order" "and they shall set in order," what is "and he shall burn" "and they shall set in order"? Learn from it as we say.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַבִּי חִיָּיא: פַּיִיס פְּעָמִים שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר, פְּעָמִים אַרְבָּעָה עָשָׂר, פְּעָמִים חֲמִשָּׁה עָשָׂר, פְּעָמִים שִׁשָּׁה עָשָׂר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya taught: Sometimes thirteen sometimes fourteen sometimes fifteen sometimes sixteen
llm_translation: The text states: Rabbi Chiya taught: Pay thirteen times, fourteen times, fifteen times, sixteen times.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא שִׁבְעָה עָשָׂר!
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught seventeen
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Seventeen!"

hebrew_text: הָהִיא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב, אֶלָּא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: That not in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov but is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: That one, not like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, rather like Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אַיִל קָרֵב בְּאַחַד עָשָׂר: הַבָּשָׂר בַּחֲמִשָּׁה, הַקְּרָבַיִים וְהַסּוֹלֶת וְהַיַּיִן בִּשְׁנַיִם שְׁנַיִם. פַּר קָרֵב בְּעֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה: הָרֹאשׁ וְהָרֶגֶל, הָרֹאשׁ בְּאֶחָד וְהָרֶגֶל בִּשְׁנַיִם. הָעוֹקֶץ וְהָרֶגֶל, הָעוֹקֶץ בִּשְׁנַיִם וְהָרֶגֶל בִּשְׁנַיִם. הֶחָזֶה וְהַגֵּרָה, הֶחָזֶה בְּאֶחָד וְהַגֵּרָה בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה. שְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם בִּשְׁנַיִם, וּשְׁתֵּי דְפָנוֹת בִּשְׁנַיִם, הַקְּרָבַיִים וְהַסּוֹלֶת וְהַיַּיִן בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה שְׁלֹשָׁה.
human_translation: A ram is sacrificed by eleven The flesh by five The intestines, and the fine flour and the wine two each, A bull sacrificed by twenty-four The head and the leg the head by one and the leg by two. The tail and the leg The tail by two and the leg by two. The breast and the neck The breast by one and the neck by three two forelegs by two and the two flanks by two. The intestines and the fine flour and the wine by three each,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: An adult male sheep is offered on the eleventh day of the month of Nisan. The meat is divided among five priests, the innards, the flour offering, and the wine among two priests each. A young bull is offered on the twenty-fourth day of Nisan. The head and the leg, the head is given to one priest and the leg to two priests. The crop and the leg, the crop is given to two priests and the leg to two priests. The chest and the thigh, the chest is given to one priest and the thigh to three priests. Two hands are given to two priests, and two cheeks are given to two priests, the innards, the flour offering, and the wine are given to three priests each.

hebrew_text: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בְּקׇרְבְּנוֹת צִיבּוּר. אֲבָל בְּקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, אִם רָצָה לְהַקְרִיב — מַקְרִיב. הֶפְשֵׁיטָן וְנִיתּוּחָן שֶׁל אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ שָׁוִין.
human_translation: In what is this statement said, in communal offerings. However, in an individual offering if wishes to sacrifice he sacrifice the flaying and the cutting of these, those, they are equal,
llm_translation: In what matters are these words spoken? - In communal sacrifices. But in the case of an individual sacrifice, if one wishes to offer it - he may offer it. The simplicity and complexity of these and those are equal.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנָא: הֶפְשֵׁיטָן וְנִיתּוּחָן שָׁוִין בְּזָר.
human_translation: taught equal their flaying and cutting, by a non-priest.
llm_translation: Gemara: Tanah: hefshetan v'nituchan shavin b'zar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר חִזְקִיָּה: מִנַּיִין לְהֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ שֶׁשָּׁוֶה בְּזָר? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנָתְנוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן אֵשׁ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, נְתִינַת אֵשׁ בָּעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה, הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ לָא בָּעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Ḥizkiya said: From where equal their flaying and cutting? by a non-priest? it is stated: “The sons of Aaron the priest shall place fire on the altar” placing fire requires priesthood, flaying and cutting do not require priesthood.
llm_translation: Hezekiah said: From where do we derive to spread out and arrange that which is equal in a foreign language? As it is stated: "And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar." The placing of fire requires priesthood, spreading out and arranging does not require priesthood.

hebrew_text: הַאי מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ! אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: אַשְׁכַּחְתֵּיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי דַּהֲוָה מַסְבַּר לֵיהּ לִבְרֵיהּ: ״וְשָׁחַט״ — שְׁחִיטָה בְּזָר כְּשֵׁירָה. וְכִי מֵאַיִן בָּאתָ? מִכְּלָל שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאַתָּה וּבָנֶיךָ אִתְּךָ תִּשְׁמְרוּ אֶת כְּהוּנַּתְכֶם״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אֲפִילּוּ שְׁחִיטָה,
human_translation: that is needed for its own sake, Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: I found Abaye explaining to his son “And he shall slaughter slaughter by a non-priest is acceptable. Now, from where would you come From the fact that it is stated: “And you and your sons with you shall keep your priesthood” I derive even slaughtering.
llm_translation: This one requires for itself! Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: I found it in the teachings of Abbaye, who was of the opinion for his son: "And he shall slaughter" - ritual slaughter by a non-Jew is valid. And from where do you come? From the general principle, as it is stated: "But you and your sons with you shall guard your priesthood," I infer that even slaughter,

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְשָׁחַט אֶת בֶּן הַבָּקָר לִפְנֵי ה׳ וְהִקְרִיבוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֲנִים אֶת הַדָּם״, מִקַּבָּלָה וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת כְּהוּנָּה. ״וְסָמַךְ יָדוֹ וְשָׁחַט״, לִימֵּד עַל הַשְּׁחִיטָה שֶׁכְּשֵׁירָה בְּזָר.
human_translation: the verse states: “And he shall slaughter the bull before the Lord, and the sons of Aaron…shall sacrifice the blood” from the collection and onward is a mitzva of priesthood. “And he shall place his hands and he shall slaughter taught the slaughter is acceptable by a non-priest.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall slaughter the bull before the Lord, and Aaron's sons, the priests, shall present the blood." From here and onwards is the commandment of priesthood. "And he shall lay his hand and slaughter," teaches about proper slaughter when done by a non-priest.

hebrew_text: מִכְּדֵי מִקַּבָּלָה וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת כְּהוּנָּה, ״וְנָתְנוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״ לְמָה לִי? לְמַעוֹטֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ.
human_translation: Since, from the collection and onward is a mitzva of priesthood, why do I “The sons of Aaron shall put to the exclusion of flaying and cutting up
llm_translation: From the aspect of receiving the tradition, and onwards the commandments of the priesthood, "And the sons of Aaron" - why do I need them? To exclude the simple and the nuanced.

hebrew_text: וְאַכַּתִּי אִיצְטְרִיךְ: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו עֲבוֹדָה דִּמְעַכְּבָא כַּפָּרָה הִיא — לָא תִּיבְעֵי כְּהוּנָּה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּבָעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה!
human_translation: But still, is necessary it might have entered your mind to say since not a service that is indispensable atonement, not be required priests. teaches us priesthood is required.
llm_translation: And once, it was necessary: the reasoning of your opinion I say, since if not the service that delays the atonement is not — it does not require priesthood, it is heard to us that it requires priesthood!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: ״וְעָרְכוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֲנִים אֵת הַנְּתָחִים אֶת הָרֹאשׁ וְאֶת הַפָּדֶר״, מִכְּדֵי, מִקַּבָּלָה וְאֵילָךְ מִצְוַת כְּהוּנָּה, ״וְעָרְכוּ״ לְמָה לִי? לְמַעוֹטֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ.
human_translation: Rather, from here: “And Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall lay out the pieces, the head and the fat” Since, from the collection and onward is a mitzva of priesthood, why do I “And shall lay out to exclude flaying and cutting up
llm_translation: Rather, from here: "And the sons of Aaron the priests shall arrange the pieces, the head, and the fat," - as it is necessary, from tradition and onwards, the commandment of the priesthood, "and they shall arrange," why do I need it? To exclude the simple and the intricate.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא לְמַעוֹטֵי סִידּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים! מִסְתַּבְּרָא דִּיבְחָא דִּכְוָתֵיהּ מְמַעֵט.
human_translation: but say to exclude the arrangement of the two logs, It is reasonable exclude a service similar to itself,
llm_translation: And why not to exclude the arrangement of the two beams! It makes sense that the one who cuts them reduces.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, סִדּוּר דִּכְוָתֵיהּ מְמַעֵט!
human_translation: On the contrary, it excludes arrangement, which is similar
llm_translation: AdRabba, sidur dikhvateih mema'et!

hebrew_text: לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּאָמַר מָר: ״וְהִקְרִיב הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הַכֹּל הַמִּזְבֵּחָה״, זוֹ הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ. הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ הוּא דְּבָעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה, הוֹלָכַת עֵצִים לָא בָּעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה. הָא סִידּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים — בָּעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה!
human_translation: It cannot enter your mind as the Master said: “And the priest shall bring all of it near and burn it on the altar” carrying the limbs to the ramp. it is carrying the limbs to the ramp that requires priesthood, carrying wood does not require priesthood. This, the arrangement of the two logs, does require priesthood.
llm_translation: Your request is to translate the following Talmudic text into English word-for-word, maintaining the original style and format of Talmudic discourse. Here is the translation: Talmudic text: "לָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ, דְּאָמַר מָר: ״וְהִקְרִיב הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הַכֹּל הַמִּזְבֵּחָה״, זוֹ הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ. הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ הוּא דְּבָעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה, הוֹלָכַת עֵצִים לָא בָּעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה. הָא סִידּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים — בָּעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה!" English translation: "It did not enter your mind, as the Master said: 'And the priest shall offer all of it on the altar,' this refers to the bringing of limbs to the altar. Bringing limbs to the altar requires intent, bringing wood does not require intent. The arrangement of two wood beams - requires intent!"

hebrew_text: ״וְעָרְכוּ״ לְמָה לִי? לְמַעוֹטֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ. וְאֵימָא הָכִי נָמֵי לְגוּפֵיהּ!
human_translation: Why do I “and shall lay out to exclude flaying and cutting up But say that this too is for its own sake,
llm_translation: "And they shall set up" - Why do I need it? To exclude the obvious and the inferred. And say it is also necessary for itself!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: ״וְהִקְטִיר הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הַכֹּל״ לְמַאי אֲתָא? לְמַעוֹטֵי הֶפְשֵׁט וְנִיתּוּחַ.
human_translation: Rather, “And the priest shall burn all of it on the altar” for what come? to exclude flaying and cutting up
llm_translation: Rather: "And the priest shall burn all of it." For what does this come to exclude? To exclude those that are spread out and separated.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִקְרִיב הַכֹּהֵן אֶת הַכֹּל הַמִּזְבֵּחָה״ — זוֹ הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ. הוֹלָכַת אֵבָרִים לַכֶּבֶשׁ הוּא דְּבָעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה, הוֹלָכַת עֵצִים — לָא בָּעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה, הָא סִדּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים — בָּעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה. ״וְנָתְנוּ״ לְגוּפֵיהּ.
human_translation: “The priest shall bring all of it near…the altar” this carrying the limbs to the ramp, carrying the limbs to the ramp requires priesthood, carrying wood does not require priesthood. Therefore, arrangement of the two logs does require priesthood, shall put for its own sake,
llm_translation: "And the kohen shall bring near all of it to the altar" — this refers to the bringing of limbs to the sheep. The bringing of limbs to the sheep is necessary for priesthood, the bringing of wood — is not necessary for priesthood, but the arrangement of two rows of wood — is necessary for priesthood. "And they shall place" it on its body.

hebrew_text: ״וְעָרְכוּ״, שְׁנַיִם. ״בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״, שְׁנַיִם. ״הַכֹּהֲנִים״, שְׁנַיִם. לָמַדְנוּ לְטָלֶה שֶׁטָּעוּן שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: “And they shall lay out,” two “The sons of Aaron,” two; “the priests,” two We learn that lamb requires six
llm_translation: "and they shall set up," two. "sons of Aaron," two. "the priests," two. We learned to include that which is planted six.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב הַמְנוּנָא, קַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַאי בְּבֶן הַבָּקָר כְּתִיב, וּבֶן הַבָּקָר עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה בָּעֵי! וְנִיחָא לֵיהּ: ״עַל הָעֵצִים אֲשֶׁר עַל הָאֵשׁ אֲשֶׁר עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, אֵיזֶהוּ דָּבָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ עֵצִים אֵשׁ וּמִזְבֵּחַ —
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said Rabbi Elazar posed a difficulty: This is written bull requires twenty-four he resolved “On the wood that is on the fire upon the altar” what is an item about which it is stated that wood and fire altar
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said, it is difficult for Rabbi Elazar: this in a calf is written, and a calf twenty-four years old requires! And it is fitting for him: "on the wood that is on the fire that is on the altar," what is the matter that is said about it wood, fire, and altar —

hebrew_text: הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה טָלֶה.
human_translation: You must say this is the lamb
llm_translation: Be it said: This is a lamb.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זָר שֶׁסִּידֵּר אֶת הַמַּעֲרָכָה חַיָּיב. כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה — פּוֹרְקָהּ וְחוֹזֵר וְסוֹדְרָהּ. מַאי אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ? אֶלָּא: פּוֹרְקָהּ זָר, וְסוֹדְרָהּ כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A non-priest who set up the arrangement of wood is liable What should he do He dismantle it and then rearrange it. What good would this do for Rather, non-priest dismantle and a priest rearranges it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A non-priest who arranges the showbread is liable. How does he do it? He removes it and then arranges it. What benefit does he derive from it? Rather, he removes it, and a priest arranges it.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: וְכִי יֵשׁ לְךָ עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁכְּשֵׁירָה בַּלַּיְלָה וּפְסוּלָה בְּזָר?
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira strongly objects And do you have any service that is valid if performed at night and is invalid by a non-priest?
llm_translation: Rebbe Zeira objects to him: "Do you have any service that is valid at night and invalid during the day?"

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וַהֲרֵי אֵבָרִים וּפְדָרִים? סוֹף עֲבוֹדָה דִימָמָא הִיא.
human_translation: And no Isn’t there of the limbs and the fats the end of the daytime service,
llm_translation: And not? But behold, limbs and tendons? The end of the service is blood.

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן! תְּחִלַּת עֲבוֹדָה דִּימָמָא הִיא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קִידֵּשׁ יָדָיו לִתְרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן, לְמָחָר אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְקַדֵּשׁ, שֶׁכְּבָר קִידֵּשׁ מִתְּחִלַּת עֲבוֹדָה. וְאֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: But isn’t there the removal of the ashes the start of the daytime service. that Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: sanctified his hands for the removal of the ashes, the next day, he need not sanctify as he already sanctified at the start of the service. If so, difficult.
llm_translation: And behold, the offering of the ashes! It is the beginning of the service of the day. For Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: He sanctified his hands for the offering of the ashes, and for the next day he does not need to sanctify, for he already sanctified from the beginning of the service. But this is a difficulty!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, כִּי אִיתְּמַר הָכִי אִיתְּמַר: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זָר שֶׁסִּידֵּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים חַיָּיב, הוֹאִיל וַעֲבוֹדַת יוֹם הִיא. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה תִּיבְּעֵי פַּיִיס! אִשְׁתְּמִיטְתֵּיהּ הָא דְּתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בִּתְרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן, זָכָה בְּסִדּוּר מַעֲרָכָה וּבְסִדּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים.
human_translation: Rather, when it was stated, this is how it was stated. Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A non-priest who arranges the two logs is liable since it is a daytime service. Rava strongly objects to this: But if so, should require a lottery; it must have escaped that which is taught who was privileged to removal of the ashes was privileged with setting up the arrangement of wood two logs.
llm_translation: Rather, when it was stated thus, it was stated thus: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A non-priest who arranges two woodpiles is liable, since it is a form of labor for the day. Rava objected to him: Instead, let him bring a proof! He rejected this, as it was taught: One who merits the portion of the ashes, merits the arrangement of the altar and the arrangement of the two woodpiles.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דַּעֲבוֹדַת יוֹם בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס עֲבוֹדַת לַיְלָה לָא בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס? וַהֲרֵי אֵבָרִים וּפְדָרִים! סוֹף עֲבוֹדָה דִימָמָא הִיא. וַהֲרֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן! מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: Is that to say that a daytime service requires a lottery a nighttime service does not require a lottery? Isn’t there the limbs and the fats is the end of the daytime service, But isn’t there the removal of the ashes due to the incident that occurred,
llm_translation: In the matter of the day's service, it requires payment; the night's service does not require payment? But behold the limbs and the tendons! The end of the service is with blood. But behold the removal of the ashes! Due to an incident that occurred.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דַּעֲבוֹדַת יוֹם וְשֶׁזָּר חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִיתָה בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס, אֵין זָר חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִיתָה לָא בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס? וַהֲרֵי שְׁחִיטָה! שָׁאנֵי שְׁחִיטָה דִּתְחִלַּת עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: Is that to say that daytime service and a non-priest liable the death penalty requires a lottery, a non-priest not liable the death penalty does not require a lottery? But isn’t there slaughtering Slaughtering is different, it is the beginning of the service
llm_translation: In the matter of the service of the day, and a non-priest who performs it is liable to death, if a foreigner is not liable to death for it, is a payment required? But isn't a foreigner liable to death for slaughter? The difference is that slaughter is the beginning of the service.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אָשֵׁי, וְהָא אֲנַן לָא תְּנַן הָכִי: אָמַר לָהֶם הַמְמוּנֶּה צְאוּ וּרְאוּ אִם הִגִּיעַ זְמַן הַשְּׁחִיטָה. וְאִילּוּ ״זְמַן שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים״ לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Mar Zutra, and some say Rav Ashi, said: But didn’t we learn it is not so The appointed said to them: Go out and see if the time for slaughtering has arrived. does not teach the time for the two logs
llm_translation: Master Zutra said, and some say it was Rav Ashi, but we did not teach it thus: The appointed one said to them, "Go out and see if the time for slaughter has arrived." And if it were "the time of the second decree of wood," it was not taught.

hebrew_text: הָךְ דְּלֵית לַהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא — קָתָנֵי, הָךְ דְּאִית לַהּ תַּקַּנְתָּא — לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: teach that which has no rectification It does not teach something that has rectification
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: "Hak de'leit lah takanta - katanai, hak de'it lah takanta - la katanai." English translation: "Here where there is no remedy - it is taught, here where there is a remedy - it is not taught."

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: וְכִי יֵשׁ לְךָ עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ עֲבוֹדָה וּפְסוּלָה בְּזָר?
human_translation: And some say Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to And do you have any service that is followed by a different service, and invalid by a non-priest?
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rabbi Zeira objects to him: Do you have a service that has another service after it, and it is disqualified by a non-priest?

hebrew_text: וַהֲרֵי אֵבָרִים וּפְדָרִים! סוֹף עֲבוֹדָה דִימָמָא הִיא. וַהֲרֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן! תְּחִילַּת עֲבוֹדָה דִימָמָא הִיא, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: קִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו לִתְרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן, לְמָחָר אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ לְקַדֵּשׁ, שֶׁכְּבָר קִדֵּשׁ מִתְּחִלַּת עֲבוֹדָה. אֶלָּא קַשְׁיָא!
human_translation: But isn’t there the limbs and the fats? is the end of the daytime service. But isn’t there the removal of the ashes? the start of the daytime service, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: sanctified his hands for the removal of the ashes, the next day, he need not sanctify as he already sanctified at the start of the service. If so, difficult.
llm_translation: And behold, limbs and fats! The end of the service is blood. And behold, the heave-offering of the ashes! The beginning of the service is blood, as Rabbi Yochanan said: He sanctified his hands for the heave-offering of the ashes, for the next day he does not need to sanctify, for he already sanctified from the beginning of the service. Rather, it is a difficulty!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אִי אִתְּמַר, הָכִי אִתְּמַר: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זָר שֶׁסִּידֵּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים — חַיָּיב, הוֹאִיל וַעֲבוֹדָה תַּמָּה הִיא.
human_translation: Rather, when it was stated, this is how it was stated: Rabbi Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A non-priest who arranges the two logs is liable since it is a service that is complete,
llm_translation: Rather: if it is stated, it is stated thus: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A non-Jew who arranges two pieces of wood is liable, since it is a completed act of labor.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה תִּבְעֵי פַּיִיס! וְלָא בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס? וְהָתַנְיָא: מִי שֶׁזָּכָה בִּתְרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן — יִזְכֶּה בְּסִידּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים!
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this: However, if so, should require a lottery. And doesn’t it require a lottery? Wasn’t it taught Whoever was privileged removal of the ashes also privileged arrangement of the two logs?
llm_translation: Rava objects to this: Rather, from now on she requires appeasement! And does she not require appeasement? But it was taught: One who merited the offering of the ashes — will merit the arrangement of the two logs!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: יְפַיְּיסוּ לָהּ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ! כִּדְאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: this is what said: they hold a lottery for it by itself. as we said
llm_translation: Thus he said: They should appease her in her own presence! As we say.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דַּעֲבוֹדָה תַּמָּה וְזָר חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִיתָה — בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס, אֵין זָר חַיָּיב עָלֶיהָ מִיתָה — לָא בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס? וַהֲרֵי שְׁחִיטָה! שָׁאנֵי שְׁחִיטָה, דִּתְחִילַּת עֲבוֹדָה דִימָמָא הִיא.
human_translation: Is that to say that a complete service and a non-priest liable the death penalty requires a lottery, a non-priest not liable the death penalty it would not require a lottery? But isn’t there slaughtering, Slaughtering is different, it is the beginning of the daytime service,
llm_translation: In the matter of Avodah, a Tamah and a Zar are liable to death - if it requires payment, a Zar is not liable to death - does it not require payment? But there is Shechitah! Shechitah is different, as it is the beginning of the Avodah of blood.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דַּעֲבוֹדָה תַּמָּה — בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס, עֲבוֹדָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ אַחֲרֶיהָ עֲבוֹדָה — לָא בָּעֲיָא פַּיִיס? וַהֲרֵי אֵבָרִים וּפְדָרִים! סוֹף עֲבוֹדָה דִימָמָא הִיא. הֲרֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן? מִשּׁוּם מַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁהָיָה.
human_translation: Is that to say that a service that is complete requires a lottery, a service which is followed by a service does not require a lottery? But isn’t there the limbs and the fats? is the end of the daytime service. Isn’t there the removal of the ashes? due to the incident that occurred
llm_translation: In the matter of the service of the Temple, it is a wonder - it requires payment, but the service that follows it does not require payment? Yet there are limbs and fats! The end of the service is blood. What about the offering of the ashes? Because of an incident that occurred.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב אָשֵׁי: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: אָמַר לָהֶם הַמְמוּנֶּה צְאוּ וּרְאוּ אִם הִגִּיעַ זְמַן הַשְּׁחִיטָה. וְאִילּוּ ״זְמַן סִידּוּר גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים״ לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: Mar Zutra, and some say Rav Ashi, said: We too have learned The appointed said to them: Go out and see if the time for slaughtering has arrived, whereas did not teach: the time for arranging the two logs
