human_translation: Abaye arranged the sequence based on tradition and in accordance with of Abba Shaul: large arrangement precedes second arrangement incense. second arrangement for incense precedes setting up two logs of wood And setting up of two logs of wood precedes the removal of ashes the inner altar. And the removal of ashes the inner altar precedes the removal of ashes from five lamps
llm_translation: Abbaye arranges the order of the service from the name of the Gemara, and according to the view of Abba Saul: The first service is the incense, the second service of incense precedes the arrangement of the two wood piles, and the arrangement of the two wood piles precedes the cleaning of the inner altar, and the cleaning of the inner altar precedes the kindling of the five lamps.

hebrew_text: וַהֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת קוֹדֵם לְדַם הַתָּמִיד, וְדַם הַתָּמִיד קוֹדֵם לַהֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת, וַהֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת קוֹדֵם לִקְטוֹרֶת, וּקְטוֹרֶת קוֹדֵם לְאֵבָרִים, וְאֵבָרִים לְמִנְחָה, וּמִנְחָה לַחֲבִיתִּין, וַחֲבִיתִּין לִנְסָכִין,
human_translation: And removal of ashes from five lamps precedes blood of the daily offering. blood of the daily offering precedes the removal of ashes from two lamps And the removal of ashes from two lamps precedes incense. incense precedes limbs limbs meal-offering meal-offering griddle-cake And the griddle-cake libations
llm_translation: The goodness of the five lamps precedes the blood of the continual offering, and the blood of the continual offering precedes the goodness of the two lamps, and the goodness of the two lamps precedes the incense, and the incense precedes the limbs, and the limbs precede the meal offering, and the meal offering precedes the wine libations.

hebrew_text: וּנְסָכִין לְמוּסָפִין, וּמוּסָפִין לְבָזִיכִין, וּבָזִיכִין לְתָמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִקְטִיר עָלֶיהָ חֶלְבֵי הַשְּׁלָמִים״, ״עָלֶיהָ״ הַשְׁלֵם כׇּל הַקָּרְבָּנוֹת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: And libations additional offerings And additional offerings vessels And vessels daily afternoon offering, as it is stated: and burn on it the fat parts of peace-offerings” on it, complete all other offerings,
llm_translation: And libations for additional offerings, and additional offerings for libations, and libations for the continual offering between the evenings, as it is stated: "And he shall offer upon it the fat of the peace offerings," upon it - complete all the offerings altogether.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה קוֹדֶמֶת לְמַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת. מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״הִיא הָעוֹלָה עַל מוֹקְדָה עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה״ — זוֹ מַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה. ״וְאֵשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ תּוּקַד בּוֹ״ — זוֹ מַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת.
human_translation: The Master said: the large arrangement precedes the second arrangement for incense. From where we As it was taught itself shall go up on its bonfire upon the altar all night” this is large arrangement “And the fire of the altar shall be kept burning on it” this is second arrangement incense.
llm_translation: Master said: a large arrangement precedes a secondary arrangement of incense. From where do we derive this? As it was taught: "It is the burnt offering that is upon the hearth upon the altar all night" — this is the large arrangement. "And the fire of the altar shall be kept burning on it" — this is the secondary arrangement of incense.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיפוֹךְ אֲנָא! מִסְתַּבְּרָא מַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן כַּפָּרָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה.
human_translation: And I should reverse reasonable large arrangement precedence, as atonement it is extensive.
llm_translation: And the opposite! A great dispute arises, for its atonement is abundant.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, מַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה עֲדִיפָא, שֶׁכֵּן מַכְנִיסִין מִמֶּנָּה לִפְנִים! אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי, כַּפָּרָתָהּ מְרוּבָּה עֲדִיפָא. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִי לָא מַשְׁכַּח עֵצִים לְמַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה, מִי לָא מְעַיֵּיל מִמַּעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה?!
human_translation: On the contrary, second arrangement precedence, as from it are taken inside Even so, atonement it is extensive precedence. And if you wish, say If one does not find wood for the second arrangement, wouldn’t he take from the large arrangement into
llm_translation: The great Rabbi, a second arrangement is preferable, for thus they bring from it inside! Even so, its atonement is greater. And if you will say: If one does not remember to bring wood for the second arrangement, who will bring from the large arrangement?!

hebrew_text: מַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת קוֹדֶמֶת לְסִידּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים. מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וּבִעֵר עָלֶיהָ הַכֹּהֵן עֵצִים בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״. ״עָלֶיהָ״, וְלֹא עַל חֲבֶרְתָּהּ. מִכְּלָל דְּאִיתָא לַחֲבֶרְתַּהּ.
human_translation: second arrangement for incense precedes the setting up of the two logs. From where we As it is written: “And the priest shall burn wood upon it in the morning, in the morning” upon it and not on the other by inference is another
llm_translation: Talmudic text: A second arrangement of incense precedes the arrangement of the two logs of wood. How do we know? As it is written: "And the priest shall burn wood upon it in the morning, morning by morning." "Upon it," and not upon its fellow. From which it can be inferred to its fellow.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי ״עָלֶיהָ״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ! תְּרֵי ״עָלֶיהָ״ כְּתִיבִי.
human_translation: But this Upon it, is needed for its own sake, Upon it, is written twice
llm_translation: And this "upon it" is needed for itself! Two "upon it" are written.

hebrew_text: סִידּוּר שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים קוֹדֵם לְדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי. אַף עַל גַּב דְּהָכָא כְּתִיב ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״, וְהָכָא כְּתִיב ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״, אֲפִילּוּ הָכִי מַכְשִׁיר עָדִיף. מַכְשִׁיר מַאי נִיהוּ — שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים, וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ שְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים לְמַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה אָזְלִי!
human_translation: The setting up of the two logs precedes the removal of ashes the inner altar. Although here, it is written: In the morning, in the morning, and here, it is written: “In the morning, in the morning” even so, facilitates precedence. What facilitates? two logs. But didn’t you say the two logs go to the large arrangement
llm_translation: Ordering two rows of wood precedes the cleaning of the inner altar. Even though it is written here "in the morning, in the morning," and here it is written "in the morning, in the morning," nevertheless, it is more preferable. What is the reason it is preferable? - Two rows of wood. And you said, "Two rows of wood for a large arrangement!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: שׁוּם עֵצִים. רָבִינָא אָמַר: הוֹאִיל וְהִתְחִיל בַּמַּעֲרָכָה, גּוֹמֵר. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אִי לָא מַשְׁכַּח עֵצִים לְמַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה מִי לָא מְעַיֵּיל מִמַּעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה?!
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: category of wood. Ravina said Since he began arrangement, he completes it Rav Ashi said: If one does not find wood for the second arrangement, won’t he take from the large arrangement into
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: "Place wood." Ravina said: "Since he began with the arrangement, he finishes." Rav Ashi said: "If one forgets wood for the arrangement, who will bring from the large arrangement?!"

hebrew_text: וְדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי קוֹדֵם לַהֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: גְּמָרָא גְּמִירְנָא, סְבָרָא — לָא יָדַעְנָא. וְרָבָא אָמַר: כְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הַמִּצְוֹת,
human_translation: And removal of ashes the inner altar precedes the removal of ashes from five lamps What is the reason Abaye said: I learned through tradition; I do not know the rationale And Rava said: in accordance with Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish said: One may not forego of the mitzvot
llm_translation: Discussion of the inner altar precedes the kindling of the five lamps. What is the reason? Abaye said: We have learned by tradition, we have not reasoned it out. And Rava said: Like Reish Lakish, for Reish Lakish said: We do not pass over the commandments.

hebrew_text: וְכִי עָיֵיל לְהֵיכָל — בְּמִזְבֵּחַ פָּגַע בְּרֵישָׁא. דְּתַנְיָא: שֻׁלְחָן בַּצָּפוֹן מָשׁוּךְ מִן הַכּוֹתֶל שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת וּמֶחֱצָה, וּמְנוֹרָה בַּדָּרוֹם מְשׁוּכָה מִן הַכּוֹתֶל שְׁתֵּי אַמּוֹת וּמֶחֱצָה. מִזְבֵּחַ מְמוּצָּע וְעוֹמֵד בְּאֶמְצַע וּמָשׁוּךְ כְּלַפֵּי חוּץ קִימְעָא. וְנוֹקְמֵיהּ, לַהֲדַיְיהוּ? כֵּיוָן דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת הַמְּנוֹרָה נֹכַח הַשֻּׁלְחָן״, בָּעֵינַן דְּחָזוּ אַהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: And when enters the Sanctuary the altar he encounters first, as it was taught table in the north removed two and a half cubits from the wall. And candelabrum in the south removed two and a half cubits from the wall. The altar was centered and standing in the middle removed a bit outward. And let us stand alongside because it is written: “And the candelabrum opposite the table” we require that they are visible to each other.
llm_translation: "And when he entered the sanctuary - he encountered the altar first. For it was taught: The table in the north is drawn back from the wall by two and a half cubits, and the menorah in the south is drawn back from the wall by two and a half cubits. The altar is in the middle and stands in the center, and is drawn back opposite the outside wall. And its revenge, to suffice for them? Since it is written: 'And the menorah opposite the table,' we require that they should see each other."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ מִדְּרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, עַבּוֹרֵי דְּרָעָא אַטּוֹטֶפְתָּא אָסוּר. הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? מִדְּרָעָא לְטוֹטֶפְתָּא.
human_translation: Rava said: Conclude from of Reish Lakish prohibited to forego of the arm phylacteries How does he conduct from of the arm phylacteries
llm_translation: Rava said: Learn from it as Reish Lakish expounded, the ferryboats of Dura are forbidden. How does he do it? From Dura to Totefta.

hebrew_text: וַהֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת קוֹדֵם לְדַם הַתָּמִיד, וְדַם הַתָּמִיד קוֹדֵם לַהֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָהוּא ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״ דִּשְׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים דְּלָא צְרִיכִי, שְׁדִינְהוּ לְהָכָא. חַד שִׁדְיֵיהּ לַהֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת — דְּלִיקְדְּמֵיהּ לְדַם הַתָּמִיד, וְחַד שִׁדְיֵיהּ לְדַם הַתָּמִיד — דְּנִקְדְּמֵיהּ לַהֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת.
human_translation: And removal of ashes from five lamps precedes blood the daily offering. the blood of the daily offering precedes the removal of ashes from two lamps What is the reason Abaye said: that In the morning, in the morning, the two logs, which is unnecessary cast to here, Cast one to removal of ashes from five lamps that it precede the blood of the daily offering. And cast one to the blood of the daily offering, that it precede the removal of ashes from two lamps.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And the lighting of the five lamps precedes the offering of the daily burnt offering, and the blood of the daily burnt offering precedes the lighting of the two lamps. What is the reason? Abaye said: Because of that 'in the morning, in the morning' (Exodus 30:7), two pieces of wood were designated that were not necessary, they were evaluated for here. One piece of wood for the lighting of the five lamps - that it should precede the blood of the daily burnt offering, and one piece of wood for the blood of the daily burnt offering - that it should precede the lighting of the two lamps."

hebrew_text: חַד שִׁדְיֵיהּ לַהֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת, דְּלִיקְדְּמֵיהּ לְדַם הַתָּמִיד — דְּהָכָא תְּלָתָא וְהָכָא תְּרֵי.
human_translation: Cast one to removal of ashes from five lamps that it precede the blood of the daily offering, as here, three And here, two
llm_translation: One demon for the benefit of five candles, since it preceded the daily offering blood - here three and here two.

hebrew_text: וְחַד שִׁדְיֵיהּ לְדַם הַתָּמִיד — דְּנִקְדְּמֵיהּ לַהֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת. אַף עַל גַּב דְּהָכָא תְּרֵי וְהָכָא תְּרֵי — מְכַפֵּר עָדִיף.
human_translation: And cast one to the blood of the daily offering that it precede the removal of ashes from two lamps. Although here, two and here, two effects atonement, precedence.
llm_translation: And one demon for the blood of the daily offering — that precedes for the benefit of its two lamps. Even though here two and here two — it atones is preferable.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי, וְאֵימָא: חַד שִׁדְיֵיהּ לְדִישּׁוּן מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי, דְּנִקְדְּמֵיהּ לְדַם הַתָּמִיד — דְּהָכָא תְּלָתָא וְהָכָא תְּרֵי. וְחַד שִׁדְיֵיהּ לְדַם הַתָּמִיד, דְּנִקְדּוֹם לַהֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת — דְּאַף עַל גַּב דְּהָכָא תְּרֵי וְהָכָא תְּרֵי, מְכַפֵּר עָדִיף! אִם כֵּן אַפְסוֹקֵי בְּמַאי מַפְסְקַתְּ לְהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: And say cast one to removal of ashes the inner altar, that it precede the blood of the daily offering, as here three and there two. And cast one to the blood of the daily offering that it precede the removal of ashes from five lamps, although here two and here two effects atonement, precedence. If with what will you demarcate
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye, and say: One kidney for the arrangement of the inner altar, which precedes the blood of the daily offering - here three and here two. And one kidney for the blood of the daily offering, which is offered before the kindling of the five lamps - for even though here are two and here are two, it is more preferable! If so, what is the conclusion as to what it is interrupting for them?

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, דְּאָמַר: לָמָּה מְטִיבִין וְחוֹזְרִים וּמְטִיבִין — כְּדֵי לְהַרְגִּישׁ כׇּל הָעֲזָרָה כּוּלָּהּ, שַׁפִּיר.
human_translation: That well Reish Lakish, said: Why does remove the ashes from and return and remove the ashes from in order to enliven entire courtyard, well
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hanicha le'Reish Lakish, de'amar: Lamah metivin ve'chozerim u'metivin - kedei le'hargish kol ha'azarah kullah, shapir." Translation: "It is preferable according to Reish Lakish, who said: Why do we give and take back and give again - in order to make all the help complete, it is good."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר: ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״ — חַלְּקֵהוּ לִשְׁנֵי בְקָרִים, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: However, Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said in the morning, in the morning, divide into two mornings, what can be said?
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yochanan, who said: "In the morning, in the morning" — he divided it into two mornings, what is there to say?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְרַב אָשֵׁי: הַאי ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״ דְּעֵצִים, מִי מְיַיתַּר? הָא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְגוּפֵיהּ, דְּקָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא — נִקְדְּמוּ לְמַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְלָאו מִי אוֹקֵימְנָא ״עָלֶיהָ״ וְלֹא עַל חֲבֶרְתָּהּ, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיתַהּ לַחֲבֶרְתַּהּ.
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi Is this In the morning, in the morning, logs superfluous Isn’t it necessary its own as the Merciful One states Have it precede the second arrangement for the incense? said to him: And did we not establish Upon it, and not on the other by inference is another
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: This "morning by morning" of the wood, who is superior? He wanted to answer for himself, for the Merciful One said - they preceded to the second arrangement of incense! He said to him: But did we not establish "upon it" and not upon its companion, implying that it belongs to its companion.

hebrew_text: מַאי שְׁנָא דְּעָבֵיד הֲטָבַת חָמֵשׁ נֵרוֹת בְּרֵישָׁא? נֶעְבֵּיד הֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת בְּרֵישָׁא! כֵּיוָן דְּאַתְחֵיל בְּהוּ — עָבֵיד רוּבָּא. וְנֶעְבֵּיד שֵׁית! אָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּהֵיטִיבוֹ אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת יַקְטִירֶנָּה״, וְאֵין נֵרוֹת פְּחוּתוֹת מִשְּׁתַּיִם.
human_translation: What is different that he performs the removal of ashes from five lamps first? Let us perform the removal of ashes from two lamps first. Since he begins with them, he performs a majority of the let him perform six the verse states: “When he removes the ashes from the lamps, he shall burn it” and lamps is no fewer than two.
llm_translation: What is different about lighting five candles at the beginning? One should light two candles at the beginning! Once one starts with them, he should light the majority. And he should light six! The verse says: "When he sets up the lamps, he shall light them," and the candles should not be less than two.

hebrew_text: וַהֲטָבַת שְׁתֵּי נֵרוֹת קוֹדֶמֶת לִקְטוֹרֶת, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״בְּהֵיטִיבוֹ אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת״, וַהֲדַר ״יַקְטִירֶנָּה״.
human_translation: And the removal of ashes from two lamps precedes incense, as the verse states: “When he removes the ashes from the lamps,” and then “He shall burn it.”
llm_translation: And the arranging of the two lamps was prior to the incense, as the verse states: "When he set up the lamps." And afterwards, "he shall burn it."

hebrew_text: וּקְטוֹרֶת לְאֵבָרִים, דְּתַנְיָא: יוּקְדַּם דָּבָר שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״, לְדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ אֶלָּא ״בֹּקֶר״ אֶחָד בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And incense precedes limbs as it was taught Let the matter with regard to which it is stated: In the morning, in the morning, precede the matter with regard to which only one: In the morning, is stated,
llm_translation: "And incense for the limbs," as it was taught: A matter that is mentioned with 'in the morning, in the morning,' for a matter that is not mentioned with it except 'morning' alone.

hebrew_text: וְאֵבָרִים לְמִנְחָה, דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִין שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר קוֹדֵם לְתָמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר?
human_translation: the limbs meal-offering as it was taught From where that there be no item prior to the daily morning offering?
llm_translation: "And limbs for a meal-offering, as it was taught: From where do we derive that nothing should precede the morning daily offering?"

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָרַךְ עָלֶיהָ הָעוֹלָה״, וְאָמַר רָבָא: ״הָעוֹלָה״ — הִיא עוֹלָה רִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: The verse states: and he shall place the burnt-offering upon it” and Rava said: the burnt-offering it ascends first.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall arrange on it the burnt offering." And Rava said: "The burnt offering" - this refers to the first burnt offering.

hebrew_text: וּמִנְחָה לַחֲבִיתִּין, עוֹלָה וּמִנְחָה.
human_translation: meal-offering griddle-cake burnt-offerings and meal-offerings,
llm_translation: And a Mincha for the Havitin, an Olah and a Mincha.

hebrew_text: וַחֲבִיתִּין לִנְסָכִים, שׁוּם מִנְחָה.
human_translation: And the griddle-cake libations category meal-offering.
llm_translation: And chaviteen for libations, a meal offering.

hebrew_text: וּנְסָכִים לְמוּסָפִין, זֶבַח וּנְסָכִים. וּמוּסָפִין לְבָזִיכִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: בָּזִיכִין קוֹדְמִין לְמוּסָפִין! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: And libations additional offerings, Offerings and libations, And the additional offerings the vessels But wasn’t it taught The vessels precede the additional offerings? is tanna’im
llm_translation: "And libations for additional offerings, sacrifice and libations. And additional offerings for libations, and it was taught: Libations take precedence over additional offerings! It is a teaching."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מוּסָפִין קוֹדְמִין לְבָזִיכִין — לָאו מִי אָמְרַתְּ ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״, לְהַקְדִּים? הָכָא נָמֵי: ״בַּיּוֹם״ ״בַּיּוֹם״, לְאַחֵר.
human_translation: Abaye said: reasonable in accordance with the one who said the additional offerings the vessels didn’t you say In the morning, in the morning, to prioritize Here too, on day, on day” postpone
llm_translation: Abaye said: It appears according to the one who says that additional offerings precede the morning offerings - did you not say "in the morning, in the morning" to prioritize? Here too: "in the day" "in the day," afterwards.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר בָּזִיכִין קוֹדְמִין לְמוּסָפִין? גָּמַר ״חוּקָּה״ ״חוּקָּה״ מֵחֲבִיתִּין.
human_translation: What is the rationale of the one who said: vessels precede the additional offerings? he derives: Statute, from: Statute, griddle-cake
llm_translation: What is the reason for the one who says that "Bazichin" precede "Musafin"? He derives "chukah" "chukah" from "chavitein."

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָתָם גָּמַר, לִיגְמְרַהּ כּוּלַּהּ מִילְּתָא מֵהָתָם? לְהָכִי אַהֲנִי ״בַּיּוֹם״ ״בַּיּוֹם״, לְאַחֵר.
human_translation: If he derived it from there, let him derive the entire matter from there, to that on day, on day,” is effective, to postpone
llm_translation: From there, did he finish, to finish it all from there? Therefore, it says "in the day" "in the day," afterwards.

hebrew_text: קְטוֹרֶת שֶׁל שַׁחַר הָיְתָה קְרֵיבָה בֵּין דָּם לְאֵיבָרִים וְכוּ׳. מַנִּי? אִי רַבָּנַן, בֵּין דָּם לְנֵרוֹת מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ. אִי אַבָּא שָׁאוּל, בֵּין נֵרוֹת לְאֵיבָרִים מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: The morning incense was burned between blood of the limbs. whose If the Rabbis should between blood and lamps. If Abba Shaul, should between lamps and of limbs.
llm_translation: Incense of the morning was offered between blood and limbs, etc. What is the difference? If according to the Rabbis, it requires between blood and lamps. If according to Abba Saul, it requires between lamps and limbs!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם רַבָּנַן הִיא, וּבְסִידְרָא לָא קָא מַיְירֵי.
human_translation: Actually, is the Rabbis, but is not speaking of the sequence
llm_translation: "Always it is the Rabbis, and in order not they are explaining."

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם הָיְתָה קְרֵיבָה בֵּין אֵיבָרִים לִנְסָכִים וְכוּ׳. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״כְּמִנְחַת הַבֹּקֶר וּכְנִסְכּוֹ תַּעֲשֶׂה״, מָה מִנְחַת הַבֹּקֶר — קְטוֹרֶת קוֹדֶמֶת לִנְסָכִים, אַף כָּאן — קְטוֹרֶת קוֹדֶמֶת לִנְסָכִים.
human_translation: afternoon between limbs libations. From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan said verse states: as the meal-offering in the morning and its libation, you shall present it, Just as the morning meal-offering incense precedes libations, so too here, incense precedes the libations.
llm_translation: Between the evenings, the offering was brought close between limbs and libations, etc. From where are these matters derived? Rabbi Yochanan said, as the verse states: "Like the morning offering and its libation, you shall do," just as the morning offering is incense before libations, so too here - incense before libations.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה לְהַלָּן קְטוֹרֶת קוֹדֶמֶת לְאֵיבָרִים, אַף כָּאן קְטוֹרֶת קוֹדֶמֶת לְאֵיבָרִים! מִי כְּתִיב ״כְּאֵיבְרֵי הַבֹּקֶר״? ״כְּמִנְחַת הַבֹּקֶר״ כְּתִיב. כְּמִנְחַת הַבֹּקֶר, וְלֹא כְּאֵיבְרֵי הַבֹּקֶר.
human_translation: If just as there, incense precedes limbs, so too here, incense precede limbs. Is it written: As the limbs in the morning? As the meal-offering in the morning, is written, like the meal-offering in the morning, and not like the limbs of the morning.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Just as there the incense comes before the limbs, so too here the incense comes before the limbs! Where is it written "like the limbs of the morning"? "Like the meal offering of the morning" is written. Like the meal offering of the morning, and not like the limbs of the morning.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנִסְכּוֹ רְבִיעִית הַהִין״ — יִלְמַד שֶׁל שַׁחֲרִית מִשֶּׁל עַרְבִית.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And its libation shall be a quarter- hin one will derive of morning from of afternoon
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And its libation a quarter hin" - one should learn from the morning libation for the evening.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עַרְבִית מִשֶּׁל שַׁחֲרִית.
human_translation: Rabbi says: afternoon from that of the morning.
llm_translation: Rabbi says: "Arvit precedes Shacharit."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבָּנַן, הַאי בְּתָמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם כְּתִיב. אֶלָּא רַבִּי, מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לַכֶּבֶשׂ הָאֶחָד״, אֵיזֶהוּ כֶּבֶשׂ שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בּוֹ ״אֶחָד״? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר.
human_translation: Granted, the Rabbis this is written afternoon However, what is the rationale of Rabbi Rabba bar Ulla said the verse states: “For the one lamb.” Which is the lamb with regard to which it is stated: One? You must say: That is daily morning offering
llm_translation: In truth, according to the sages, this is written regarding the daily offering between the evenings. Rather, Rabbi, what is the reason? Rabba bar Ulla said, Scripture says, "for the one lamb," which lamb is mentioned with the word "one"? You must say this is the morning daily offering.

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: מַאי ״אֶחָד״ — מְיוּחָד שֶׁבְּעֶדְרוֹ. וְרַבִּי: מִ״ומִּבְחַר נְדָרֶיךָ״ נָפְקָא. וְרַבָּנַן: חַד בְּחוֹבָה וְחַד בִּנְדָבָה, וּצְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what One? special that is in his flock. And Rabbi is derived all the choicest of your And the Rabbis one obligatory one And necessary,
llm_translation: The sages: What is "one" - unique in its category. And Rabbi: "From the choicest of your vows" is derived. The sages: One is obligatory and one is voluntary, and it is necessary.

hebrew_text: אִם הָיָה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל זָקֵן אוֹ אִיסְטְנִיס וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: עֲשָׁשִׁיּוֹת שֶׁל בַּרְזֶל הָיוּ מְחַמִּין מֵעֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וּמְטִילִין לְתוֹךְ צוֹנֵן, כְּדֵי שֶׁתָּפִיג צִינָּתָן. וַהֲלֹא מְצָרֵף! אָמַר רַב בִּיבִי: שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ לְצֵירוּף. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְצֵירוּף — דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין מוּתָּר.
human_translation: If the High Priest was old or delicate, It was taught Rabbi Yehuda said: They would heat blocks of iron on Yom Kippur eve and cast them into the cold to temper its chill. But doesn’t he harden Rav Beivai said: did not reach hardening Abaye said: Even you say that reached hardening an unintentional act, permitted.
llm_translation: If there was a high priest old or an istenis etc. It was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said: Iron spits were heated from the eve of Yom Kippur and inserted into the cold, in order that their sharpness should be blunted. But isn't this a form of tempering? Rab Bibi said: It did not reach the point of tempering. Abaye said: Even if you say it reached the point of tempering, a matter that is not intended is permitted.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר אַבָּיֵי הָכִי? וְהָתַנְיָא: ״בְּשַׂר עׇרְלָתוֹ״, אֲפִילּוּ בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁיֵּשׁ שָׁם בַּהֶרֶת — יָקוֹץ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. וְהָוֵינַן בָּהּ: קָרָא לְמָה לִי? וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין מִתְכַּוֵּין אָסוּר.
human_translation: And did Abaye say that But wasn’t it taught flesh of his foreskin ” one cut even if there is a white spot there? the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya. And we discussed Why do I a verse And Abaye said: Rabbi Yehuda, said an unintentional act is prohibited.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said thus, Abaye? And it was taught: "The flesh of his foreskin," even in a place where there is leprosy - it is forbidden, the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah. And we were in it: Why do I need it? And Abaye said: For Rabbi Yehudah, who said: An unintentional act is forbidden.

hebrew_text: הָנֵי מִילֵּי, בְּכׇל הַתּוֹרָה כּוּלָּהּ, אֲבָל הָכָא צֵירוּף דְּרַבָּנַן הוּא.
human_translation: that applies only to the whole Torah in its entirety. However, here, hardening by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: These words, in all the Torah entirely, but here it is an addition of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הֱבִיאוּהוּ לְבֵית הַפַּרְוָה, וּבַקֹּדֶשׁ הָיָתָה. פֵּרְסוּ סָדִין שֶׁל בּוּץ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵין הָעָם, קִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו וּפָשַׁט. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: פָּשַׁט, קִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. יָרַד וְטָבַל, עָלָה וְנִסְתַּפָּג. הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ בִּגְדֵי לָבָן, לָבַשׁ וְקִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו.
human_translation: They brought Hall of Parva , was in the sacred They spread a sheet of fine linen between him and the people And he sanctified his hands and his feet and removed Rabbi Meir says removed he sanctified his hands and his feet. He descended and immersed He ascended and dried himself. they brought him white garments, he dressed, and he sanctified his hands and his feet.
llm_translation: They taught: They brought him to the Chamber of the Parwah, and he was in the Sanctuary. They spread a linen sheet of fine linen between him and the people, he sanctified his hands and feet and removed his clothes. Rabbi Meir says: He removed his clothes, sanctified his hands and feet. He descended and immersed, he ascended and dried. They brought him white garments, he wore them and sanctified his hands and feet.

hebrew_text: בַּשַּׁחַר הָיָה לוֹבֵשׁ פִּלּוּסִין שֶׁל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מָנֶה. בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם הִנְדְּוִיִין שֶׁל שְׁמוֹנֶה מֵאוֹת זוּז, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: בַּשַּׁחַר הָיָה לוֹבֵשׁ שֶׁל שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר מָנֶה, וּבֵין הָעַרְבַּיִם שֶׁל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מָנֶה, הַכֹּל שְׁלֹשִׁים מָנֶה. אֵלּוּ מִשֶּׁל צִיבּוּר, וְאִם רָצָה לְהוֹסִיף — מוֹסִיף מִשֶּׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: In the morning he would wear from Pelusium worth twelve maneh , in the afternoon from India, worth eight hundred zuz . the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: In the morning he would wear worth eighteen maneh , and in the afternoon worth twelve maneh . total, thirty maneh . These from the community, and if wished to add he add
llm_translation: In the morning he would wear a cloak of twelve maneh. Between the evenings, a robe of eight hundred zuz, the words of Rabbi Meir. And the sages say: In the morning he would wear a cloak of eighteen maneh, and between the evenings a robe of twelve maneh, all totaling thirty maneh. These are from communal funds, and if he wished to add - he would add from his own.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאי ״פַּרְוָה״? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: פַּרְוָה אַמְגּוּשָׁא.
human_translation: What is Parva ? Rav Yosef said: Parva sorcerer,
llm_translation: Gemara: What is "Parvah"? Rav Yosef said: Parvah is a type of fish.

hebrew_text: פֵּרְסוּ סָדִין שֶׁל בּוּץ. מַאי שְׁנָא שֶׁל בּוּץ? אָמַר רַב כָּהֲנָא: כְּדֵי שֶׁיַּכִּיר שֶׁעֲבוֹדַת הַיּוֹם בְּבִגְדֵי בוּץ.
human_translation: They spread a sheet of fine linen. What is different fine linen? Rav Kahana said: so that will be aware that the service of the day in fine linen.
llm_translation: Spread a linen sheet. What is different about linen? Rav Kahana said: In order that one should recognize that the service of the day is with linen garments.

hebrew_text: בַּשַּׁחַר הָיָה לוֹבֵשׁ פִּלּוּסִין שֶׁל שְׁמוֹנָה עָשָׂר וְכוּ׳. וְתַנָּא מִנְיָינָא אֲתָא לְאַשְׁמוֹעִינַן? הָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דִּבְצִיר מֵהָנֵי לָא נֶעְבֵּיד. הָא אִי בָּצֵיר מֵהָנֵי וְטָפֵי אַהֲנִי — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: In the morning, he would wear worth eighteen Does the tanna come to tell us the tally This teach us that not fashion less than these If one decreases of these raises of those we have no with it.
llm_translation: In the morning, he would wear a cloak of eighteen cubits, etc. And a Mishnaic teaching comes to teach us? But we already heard that we do not conduct ourselves with produce from there. If it is with produce from there and it is small, then we do not have it.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת דְּשַׁחַר עֲדִיפִי, מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב עִילָּאֵי: אָמַר קְרָא: ״בַּד״ ״בַּד״ ״בַּד״ ״בַּד״, מוּבְחָר בַּבַּד.
human_translation: However, everyone, agrees that morning are superior From where do we Rav Huna, son of Rav Ilai, said the verse states: linen linen linen a linen choicest linen
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Regarding the inhabitants of the world, from the sixth hour onwards is preferable, how do we know? Rav Huna, son of Rav Ila'i, said: The verse states: 'Alone, alone, alone, alone,' chosen in solitude."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וְלָבְשׁוּ בְּגָדִים אֲחֵרִים וְלֹא יְקַדְּשׁוּ אֶת הָעָם בְּבִגְדֵיהֶם״,
human_translation: The Gemara raises an objection. and they shall put on other garments, so that they do not sanctify the people with their garments”
llm_translation: Challenger: "And they shall wear other garments and not sanctify the people with their garments."

hebrew_text: מַאי לָאו ״אֲחֵרִים״ — חֲשׁוּבִין מֵהֶן! לֹא, ״אֲחֵרִים״ — פְּחוּתִים מֵהֶן.
human_translation: What, doesn’t “other” more important than No, “other” inferior to them,
llm_translation: What is meant by "others" - they are considered greater than them! No, "others" - they are considered lesser than them.

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יְהוּדָה: אַחַר שֶׁכָּלְתָה עֲבוֹדַת צִיבּוּר, כֹּהֵן שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ כְּתוֹנֶת — לוֹבְשָׁהּ, וְעוֹבֵד בָּהּ עֲבוֹדַת יָחִיד, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁיִּמְסְרֶנָּה לַצִּיבּוּר. פְּשִׁיטָא?
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Yehuda, and some say Rav Shmuel bar Yehuda, taught: After the public service concluded, a priest whose mother had made him tunic wear it and perform an individual service it, provided he transfers it to the public. obvious;
llm_translation: It was taught by Rav Huna son of Yehuda, and some say it was taught by Rav Shmuel son of Yehuda: After the communal service is completed, if a priest's mother made him a tunic - he may wear it, and perform individual service with it, as long as he hands it over to the community. Is this not obvious?

hebrew_text: מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא נֵיחוּשׁ שֶׁמָּא לֹא יִמְסְרֶנָּה יָפֶה יָפֶה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן פִּאָבִי שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ כְּתוֹנֶת שֶׁל מֵאָה מָנֶה, וְלוֹבְשָׁהּ וְעוֹבֵד בָּהּ עֲבוֹדַת יָחִיד, וּמְסָרָהּ לַצִּיבּוּר.
human_translation: Lest you say perhaps and will not transfer it wholeheartedly; it teaches us They said about Rabbi Yishmael ben Pabi that his mother made him a tunic worth one hundred maneh . He donned it and performed an individual service and transferred to the public.
llm_translation: What is the reason that one might suspect that perhaps he will not deliver it very well, it is evident to us. They said about Rabbi Yishmael ben Piavi that his mother made for him a tunic worth a hundred mana, and he wore it and performed individual service in it, and he delivered it to the community.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן חַרְסוֹם שֶׁעָשְׂתָה לוֹ אִמּוֹ כְּתוֹנֶת מִשְׁתֵּי רִיבּוֹא, וְלֹא הֱנִיחוּהוּ אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים לְלוֹבְשָׁהּ מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנִּרְאָה כְּעָרוֹם. וּמִי מִתְחֲזֵי? וְהָאָמַר מָר: חוּטָן כָּפוּל שִׁשָּׁה! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כְּחַמְרָא בְּמִזְגָּא.
human_translation: they said about Rabbi Elazar ben Ḥarsum that his mother made him a tunic twenty thousand but his fellow priests did not allow him to wear it because he appeared as naked. And could be seen Didn’t the Master say: The threads were six-fold? Abaye said: It is like wine in glass
llm_translation: They said about Rabbi Elazar ben Charsum that his mother made for him a tunic of fine linen, woven of two threads, and his priestly brothers did not allow him to wear it because he appeared naked. And who is the one who sees? And Mar said: A double-threaded weaver, six! Abaye said: Like vinegar in a mixture.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עָנִי וְעָשִׁיר וְרָשָׁע בָּאִין לַדִּין, לֶעָנִי אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא עָסַקְתָּ בַּתּוֹרָה? אִם אוֹמֵר: עָנִי הָיִיתִי, וְטָרוּד בִּמְזוֹנוֹתַי, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: כְּלוּם עָנִי הָיִיתָ יוֹתֵר מֵהִלֵּל?
human_translation: the Sages taught: A poor and a wealthy and a wicked come to judgment To the poor say: Why did you not engage in Torah? If he and says: I was poor and preoccupied with my sustenance they say to him: Were you any poorer than Hillel,
llm_translation: The sages taught: A poor person, a rich person, and a wicked person come to judgment. To the poor person they say: "Why did you not engage in Torah study?" If he says: "I was poor and preoccupied with my sustenance," they say to him: "Were you more impoverished than Hillel?"

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל הִלֵּל הַזָּקֵן שֶׁבְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה וּמִשְׂתַּכֵּר בִּטְרַפָּעִיק, חֶצְיוֹ הָיָה נוֹתֵן לְשׁוֹמֵר בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ, וְחֶצְיוֹ לְפַרְנָסָתוֹ וּלְפַרְנָסַת אַנְשֵׁי בֵיתוֹ. פַּעַם אַחַת לֹא מָצָא לְהִשְׂתַּכֵּר, וְלֹא הִנִּיחוֹ שׁוֹמֵר בֵּית הַמִּדְרָשׁ לְהִכָּנֵס. עָלָה וְנִתְלָה וְיָשַׁב עַל פִּי אֲרוּבָּה כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּשְׁמַע דִּבְרֵי אֱלֹהִים חַיִּים מִפִּי שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן.
human_translation: They said about Hillel the Elder that each and every day he would work and earn a half-dinar, half of which he would give to the guard of the study hall and half of which for his sustenance and the sustenance of the members of his family. One time he did not find to earn and the guard of the study hall did not allow him to enter. He ascended suspended and sat at the edge of the skylight in order to hear the words of the living God from the mouths of Shemaya and Avtalyon,
llm_translation: They said about Hillel the Elder that every day he would work and earn a Trapaik, half of which he would give to the guard of the study hall, and half for his sustenance and the sustenance of the members of his household. One time he did not find work to earn, and the guard of the study hall did not allow him to enter. He went up, hung on the roof, and sat at the skylight in order to hear the words of the living God from the mouths of Shemaiah and Avtalyon.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ: אוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת הָיָה, וּתְקוּפַת טֵבֵת הָיְתָה, וְיָרַד עָלָיו שֶׁלֶג מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם. כְּשֶׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר אָמַר לוֹ שְׁמַעְיָה לְאַבְטַלְיוֹן: אַבְטַלְיוֹן אָחִי, בְּכׇל יוֹם הַבַּיִת מֵאִיר וְהַיּוֹם אָפֵל, שֶׁמָּא יוֹם הַמְעוּנָּן הוּא? הֵצִיצוּ עֵינֵיהֶן וְרָאוּ דְּמוּת אָדָם בַּאֲרוּבָּה. עָלוּ וּמָצְאוּ עָלָיו רוּם שָׁלֹשׁ אַמּוֹת שֶׁלֶג. פֵּרְקוּהוּ, וְהִרְחִיצוּהוּ וְסָכוּהוּ, וְהוֹשִׁיבוּהוּ כְּנֶגֶד הַמְּדוּרָה. אָמְרוּ: רָאוּי זֶה לְחַלֵּל עָלָיו אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: said: That day was Shabbat eve and it was the season of Tevet, and snow fell upon him from the sky. When it was dawn, Shemaya said to Avtalyon: Avtalyon, my brother, every day the hall bright and today it is dark; is it perhaps a cloudy day? They focused their eyes and saw the image of a man in the skylight. They ascended and found him snow three cubits high. They extricated him and they washed him and smeared on him, and they sat him opposite the bonfire They said: This is worthy to desecrate Shabbat for him.
llm_translation: They said: That day was Erev Shabbat, and it was the winter solstice, and snow descended upon him from the sky. When the morning light appeared, Shemaya said to Avtalyon: Avtalyon my brother, every day the house is illuminated, and today it is dark, perhaps it is a cloudy day? They glanced and saw a man's image in the chimney. They went up and found on him a height of three cubits of snow. They cleared it, washed him, and covered him, and sat him opposite the fire. They said: It is fitting to desecrate the Sabbath for him.

hebrew_text: עָשִׁיר, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא עָסַקְתָּ בַּתּוֹרָה? אִם אוֹמֵר: עָשִׁיר הָיִיתִי וְטָרוּד הָיִיתִי בִּנְכָסַי. אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: כְּלוּם עָשִׁיר הָיִיתָ יוֹתֵר מֵרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר? אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן חַרְסוֹם שֶׁהִנִּיחַ לוֹ אָבִיו אֶלֶף עֲיָירוֹת בַּיַּבָּשָׁה, וּכְנֶגְדָּן אֶלֶף סְפִינוֹת בַּיָּם. וּבְכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם נוֹטֵל נֹאד שֶׁל קֶמַח עַל כְּתֵיפוֹ וּמְהַלֵּךְ מֵעִיר לְעִיר וּמִמְּדִינָה לִמְדִינָה לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: a wealthy say to him: Why did you not engage in Torah? If he says: I was wealthy and preoccupied with my possessions, they say to him: Were you any wealthier than Rabbi Elazar, They said about Rabbi Elazar ben Ḥarsum that his father left him one thousand villages on land, and corresponding to them, one thousand ships at sea. And each and every day he takes jug of flour on his shoulder and walks from city to city and from state to state to study Torah
llm_translation: Rich, they say to him: Why did you not engage in Torah study? If he says: I was rich and preoccupied with my possessions. They say to him: Were you richer than Rabbi Elazar? They said about Rabbi Elazar son of Harsum that his father left him a thousand cities on land, and corresponding to them a thousand ships at sea. And every day he would take a sack of flour on his shoulder and walk from city to city and from province to province to study Torah.

hebrew_text: פַּעַם אַחַת מְצָאוּהוּ עֲבָדָיו, וְעָשׂוּ בּוֹ אַנְגַּרְיָא. אָמַר לָהֶן: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִכֶּם, הַנִּיחוּנִי וְאֵלֵךְ לִלְמוֹד תּוֹרָה. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: חַיֵּי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן חַרְסוֹם שֶׁאֵין מַנִּיחִין אוֹתְךָ. וּמִיָּמָיו לֹא הָלַךְ וְרָאָה אוֹתָן, אֶלָּא יוֹשֵׁב וְעוֹסֵק בַּתּוֹרָה כׇּל הַיּוֹם וְכׇל הַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: One time his servants found him, and, they pressed him into service [ angarya ] He said to them: I beseech you; let me be and I will go study Torah. They said: by the life of Rabbi Elazar ben Ḥarsum that will not let you be. And in all his days, he never went and saw rather, sit and engage in Torah all day and all night.
llm_translation: One time his servants found him, and they did to him a punishment. He said to them: "Please, leave me and let me go study Torah." They said to him: "By the life of Rabbi Elazar ben Charsum, we will not leave you." And from that day on, he did not go and see them, but sat and engaged in Torah study all day and all night.

hebrew_text: רָשָׁע, אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא עָסַקְתָּ בַּתּוֹרָה? אִם אָמַר: נָאֶה הָיִיתִי, וְטָרוּד בְּיִצְרִי, (הָיָה) אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: כְּלוּם נָאֶה הָיִיתָ מִיּוֹסֵף? אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל יוֹסֵף הַצַּדִּיק: בְּכׇל יוֹם וָיוֹם הָיְתָה אֵשֶׁת פּוֹטִיפַר מְשַׁדַּלְתּוֹ בִּדְבָרִים. בְּגָדִים שֶׁלָּבְשָׁה לוֹ שַׁחֲרִית לֹא לָבְשָׁה לוֹ עַרְבִית. בְּגָדִים שֶׁלָּבְשָׁה לוֹ עַרְבִית לֹא לָבְשָׁה לוֹ שַׁחֲרִית.
human_translation: say to him: Why did you not engage in Torah? If he said: I was handsome and preoccupied with my inclination, they say to him: Were you any more handsome than Joseph, They said about Joseph the righteous: Each and every day, the wife of Potiphar seduced him with words. the clothes that she wore to him in the morning, she did not wear to him in the evening. The clothes that she wore to him in the evening, she did not wear to him in the morning
llm_translation: Wicked, they say to him: Why did you not engage in Torah study? If he says: I was handsome, and my inclination troubled me, they say to him: Were you more handsome than Joseph? They said about him, about Joseph the Righteous: Every day Potiphar's wife would entice him with words. The garments she would dress him in for the morning, she would not dress him in for the evening. The garments she would dress him in for the evening, she would not dress him in for the morning.

hebrew_text: אָמְרָה לוֹ: הִשָּׁמַע לִי! אָמַר לָהּ: לָאו. אָמְרָה לוֹ: הֲרֵינִי חוֹבַשְׁתְּךָ בְּבֵית הָאֲסוּרִין! אָמַר לָהּ: ״ה׳ מַתִּיר אֲסוּרִים״. הֲרֵינִי כּוֹפֶפֶת קוֹמָתְךָ! ״ה׳ זוֹקֵף כְּפוּפִים״. הֲרֵינִי מְסַמָּא אֶת עֵינֶיךָ! ״ה׳ פּוֹקֵחַ עִוְרִים״. נָתְנָה לוֹ אֶלֶף כִּכְּרֵי כֶסֶף לִשְׁמוֹעַ אֵלֶיהָ ״לִשְׁכַּב אֶצְלָהּ לִהְיוֹת עִמָּהּ״, וְלֹא רָצָה לִשְׁמוֹעַ אֵלֶיהָ.
human_translation: she said to him: Submit to me He said to her: No. She said to him: I will incarcerate you in the prison. He said to her: “God releases prisoners” She said to him: I will bent over “God straightens those who are bent over” I will blind your eyes. “God opens the eyes of the blind” She gave him a thousand talents of silver to submit to her, “to lie with her and be with her” and he refused.
llm_translation: She said to him: Listen to me! He said to her: No. She said to him: I will tie you up in the prison! He said to her: "Hashem releases the imprisoned." I will bend your stature! "Hashem straightens the bent." I will blind your eyes! "Hashem opens the eyes of the blind." She gave him a thousand silver talents to listen to her "to lie with her," but he did not want to listen to her.

hebrew_text: ״לִשְׁכַּב אֶצְלָהּ״ בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, ״לִהְיוֹת עִמָּהּ״ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. נִמְצָא: הִלֵּל מְחַיֵּיב אֶת הָעֲנִיִּים, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן חַרְסוֹם מְחַיֵּיב אֶת הָעֲשִׁירִים, יוֹסֵף מְחַיֵּיב אֶת הָרְשָׁעִים.
human_translation: to lie with her in this world, be with her in the World-to-Come. Consequently, Hillel obligates the poor Rabbi Elazar ben Ḥarsum obligates the wealthy, Joseph obligates the wicked.
llm_translation: "To lie with her" in this world, "to be with her" in the world to come. It is found: Hillel obligates the poor, Rabbi Elazar ben Harsum obligates the rich, Yosef obligates the wicked.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל פָּרוֹ, וּפָרוֹ הָיָה עוֹמֵד בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ, רֹאשׁוֹ לַדָּרוֹם וּפָנָיו לַמַּעֲרָב. וְהַכֹּהֵן עוֹמֵד בַּמִּזְרָח וּפָנָיו לַמַּעֲרָב. וְסוֹמֵךְ שְׁתֵּי יָדָיו עָלָיו, וּמִתְוַדֶּה.
human_translation: comes next to his bull, and his bull was standing between the Entrance Hall and the altar its head to the south and its face to the west. And the priest stands to the east and his face to the west. And places his two hands on and confesses.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one came to his ox, and his ox was standing between the Ulam and the altar, its head facing south and its face westward. And the priest stands in the east, facing westward. And he places both his hands upon it, and confesses.

hebrew_text: וְכָךְ הָיָה אוֹמֵר: אָנָא הַשֵּׁם! עָוִיתִי, פָּשַׁעְתִּי, חָטָאתִי לְפָנֶיךָ אֲנִי וּבֵיתִי. אָנָא הַשֵּׁם! כַּפֶּר נָא לָעֲוֹנוֹת וְלַפְּשָׁעִים וְלַחֲטָאִים שֶׁעָוִיתִי וְשֶׁפָּשַׁעְתִּי וְשֶׁחָטָאתִי לְפָנֶיךָ אֲנִי וּבֵיתִי, כַּכָּתוּב בְּתוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה עַבְדֶּךָ: ״כִּי בַיּוֹם הַזֶּה יְכַפֵּר וְגוֹ׳״. וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד, מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״.
human_translation: And this is what he would say Please, God, I have sinned, I have done wrong, I have rebelled before You, I and my family. Please, God, grant atonement, please, for the sins, and for the wrongs, and for the rebellions that I have sinned, and done wrong, and rebelled before You, I and my family, as it is written in the Torah of Moses your servant: “For on this day atonement shall be made And respond after he Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom forever and all time.
llm_translation: And so he would say: "Please, Hashem! I have strayed, I have transgressed, I have sinned before You, I and my household. Please, Hashem! Atone now for the iniquities, the transgressions, and the sins that I have committed, that I have transgressed, and that I have sinned before You, I and my household, as it is written in the Torah of Your servant Moses: 'For on this day He shall make atonement...' And they respond after him: 'Blessed be the Name of His glorious kingdom forever and ever.'

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַאן שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ דְּאָמַר בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ צָפוֹן —
human_translation: whom did you learn that he said between the Entrance Hall and the altar north
llm_translation: Gemara: Who heard him say that between the hall and the altar is northward—

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵיזֶהוּ צָפוֹן — מִקִּיר שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ צְפוֹנִי וְעַד כּוֹתֶל הָעֲזָרָה, וּכְנֶגֶד כׇּל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ כּוּלּוֹ צָפוֹן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן מוֹסִיף אַף בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ. רַבִּי מוֹסִיף אַף מְקוֹם דְּרִיסַת רַגְלֵי הַכֹּהֲנִים וְאַף מְקוֹם דְּרִיסַת רַגְלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. אֲבָל מִן הַחֲלִיפוֹת וְלִפְנִים הַכֹּל מוֹדִים שֶׁפָּסוּל.
human_translation: It is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught What is north? from the northern wall of the altar until the wall of the courtyard. And opposite the entire altar north; the statement of Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda. And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, adds even between the Entrance Hall and the altar Rabbi adds even the place where the priests walk, and even the place where the Israelites walk, However, everyone agrees that from the of the knives and inward, is unfit
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: As it was taught: What is considered the north? From the northern wall of the altar until the wall of the Azarah, and opposite the entire altar is considered north, the words of Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon adds even between the hall and the altar. Rabbi Mosif adds even the place where the priests step and even the place where the Israelites step. But regarding the replacement and inside, everyone agrees that it is disqualified.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא וְלָא רַבִּי? אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי, וְרַבִּי הַשְׁתָּא אַדְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה מוֹסִיף, אַדְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא מוֹסִיף?!
human_translation: Let us say is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, and not Rabbi Even you say Rabbi now, Rabbi add Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, does not add Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: Let us say, is it Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, and not Rabbi? Even if you say Rabbi, and Rabbi now adds, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda adds, does Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon not add?!

hebrew_text: אֲנַן הָכִי קָא אָמְרִינַן: אִי רַבִּי הִיא, נוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּכוּלַּהּ עֲזָרָה! אֶלָּא מַאי — רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא? וְנוֹקְמֵיהּ בֵּין מִזְבֵּחַ וְלַכּוֹתֶל!
human_translation: This is what we are saying: If Rabbi let us stand in the entire courtyard Rather, what is Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon? And let us stand between the altar and the wall,
llm_translation: We thus say: If she is a Rabbi, her vengeance is complete! Rather, what is it - is she Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon? And her vengeance is between the altar and the wall!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר — מִשּׁוּם חוּלְשָׁא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, לְרַבִּי נָמֵי — מִשּׁוּם חוּלְשָׁא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say due to the weakness High Priest, Rabbi as well, due to the weakness High Priest
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say? — Because of the weakness of the High Priest, according to Rabbi Nami — because of the weakness of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: רֹאשׁוֹ לַדָּרוֹם וּפָנָיו לַמַּעֲרָב. הֵיכִי מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ? אָמַר רַב: בְּעוֹקֵם אֶת רֹאשׁוֹ. וְנוֹקְמֵיהּ לְהֶדְיָא. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יַרְבִּיץ גְּלָלִים.
human_translation: The head to the south and its face to the west. what circumstances be found Rav said: it turns its head And let us stand it straight Abaye said: It is a decree lest defecate
llm_translation: Its head to the south and its face to the west. How does one find it? Rav said: By bending its head. And its avengers to Hedyah. Abbaye said: A decree lest one scatter stones.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד סוֹמֵךְ הַזֶּבַח? עוֹמֵד בַּצָּפוֹן וּפָנָיו לַמַּעֲרָב, וְהַסּוֹמֵךְ עוֹמֵד בַּמִּזְרָח וּפָנָיו לַמַּעֲרָב, וּמַנִּיחַ שְׁתֵּי יָדָיו בֵּין שְׁתֵּי קְרָנוֹת שֶׁל זֶבַח, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא דָּבָר חוֹצֵץ בֵּינוֹ לְבֵין הַזֶּבַח, וּמִתְוַדֶּה. עַל חַטָּאת — עֲוֹן חַטָּאת, וְעַל אָשָׁם — עֲוֹן אָשָׁם, וְעַל עוֹלָה — עֲוֹן לֶקֶט שִׁכְחָה וּפֵאָה וּמַעְשַׂר עָנִי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: How place his hands the offering? stands in the north and its face to the west, and the one who is placing his hands stands to the east and his face to the west, and he places his two hands between the two horns of offering, provided nothing interposes between his and the offering. And he confesses over a sin-offering, transgression sin-offering, And over a guilt-offering the transgression guilt-offering, And over a burnt-offering, the sin of gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and produce of the corners [ pe’a ], as well as poor man’s tithe. the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: How does one lean (semichah) on the sacrifice? He stands in the north with his face to the west, and the one leaning (semichah) stands in the east with his face to the west, and he places his two hands between the two horns of the sacrifice, provided that nothing is blocking between him and the sacrifice, and he confesses. For a sin offering - the sin of the sin offering, and for a guilt offering - the sin of the guilt offering, and for a burnt offering - the sin of neglecting to leave gleanings, forgotten sheaves, and tithes for the poor, the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: אֵין עוֹלָה בָּאָה אֶלָּא עַל עֲשֵׂה, וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁנִּיתַּק לַעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: A burnt-offering is brought only over a positive and over a prohibition that is transformed into a positive
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: A burnt offering comes only for a positive commandment, and for a negative commandment that is connected to a positive commandment.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה:
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Yirmeya said:
llm_translation: In what do they disagree? Rabbi Yirmeya said:

hebrew_text: בְּלָאו דִּנְבֵילָה קָא מִיפַּלְגִי:
human_translation: with regard to prohibition an unslaughtered animal carcass, they disagree.
llm_translation: In the case of a "b'la'o" of a carcass, they are in dispute.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: לָאו מְעַלְּיָא הוּא. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: לָאו לָאו מְעַלְּיָא הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: It is a full-fledged prohibition, And Rabbi Yosei HaGelili holds: It is not a full-fledged prohibition;
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: It is not above. And Rabbi Yosei HaGalili holds: It is not not above.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָאו דִּנְבֵילָה — לָאו מְעַלְּיָא הָוֵי, וְהָכָא בְּ״תַעֲזוֹב״ קָא מִיפַּלְגִי,
human_translation: Abaye said that everyone agrees that the prohibition of animal carcass is a full-fledged prohibition, and here, with regard to they disagree. you shall leave
llm_translation: Abaye said: The general principle of the world is not like a carcass - it does not become impure through contact, and here in this case, it is divided by the term "leave."

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא סָבַר: ״תַּעֲזוֹב״ מֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע, וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי סָבַר: הַשְׁתָּא מַשְׁמַע.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds You shall leave, indicates from the outset, Rabbi Yosei HaGelili holds You shall leave, indicates now,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva holds: "Ta'azov" implies from the outset, and Rabbi Yosei HaGalili holds: "Hashta" implies now.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד מִתְוַדֶּה? ״עָוִיתִי פָּשַׁעְתִּי וְחָטָאתִי״, וְכֵן בְּשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהִתְוַדָּה עָלָיו אֶת כׇּל עֲוֹנוֹת בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְאֶת כׇּל פִּשְׁעֵיהֶם לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״, וְכֵן בְּמֹשֶׁה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן וָפֶשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: עֲוֹנוֹת אֵלּוּ הַזְּדוֹנוֹת, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״הִכָּרֵת תִּכָּרֵת הַנֶּפֶשׁ הָהִיא עֲוֹנָה בָּהּ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught How does he confess? I have done wrong, I have rebelled, and I have sinned. And likewise, with regard to the scapegoat, it says “And he shall confess over it all of the children of Israel’s wrongdoings and all their rebellions and all their sins” And likewise, Moses it says: “Forgiving wrongdoing and rebellion and sin” the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say Wrongdoings are intentional and likewise it says: “That soul shall be cut off, it bears its guilt”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: How does one confess? "I have sinned, transgressed, and committed iniquity." Similarly, regarding the goat that is sent away, it says: "And he shall confess over it all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions, for all their sins." And likewise, concerning Moses, it says: "Bearing iniquity, transgression, and sin," the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: These are intentional sins. And it also says: "That soul shall be cut off; its sin is upon it."

hebrew_text: פְּשָׁעִים אֵלּוּ הַמְּרָדִים, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב פָּשַׁע בִּי״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״אָז תִּפְשַׁע לִבְנָה בָּעֵת הַהִיא״. ״לְכׇל חַטֹּאתָם״ אֵלּוּ הַשְּׁגָגוֹת, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״נֶפֶשׁ כִּי תֶחֱטָא בִשְׁגָגָה״. וּמֵאַחַר שֶׁהִתְוַדָּה עַל הַזְּדוֹנוֹת וְעַל הַמְּרָדִים חוֹזֵר וּמִתְוַדֶּה עַל הַשְּׁגָגוֹת?!
human_translation: Rebellions are rebellious And likewise, it says: “The king of Moab rebelled [ pasha ] against me” And it is said: “Then Livna rebelled at that time” All of their sins, these are unwitting sins. And it says: “If a soul should sin unwittingly” once he confessed the wrongdoings and rebellions, he then confess the unwitting
llm_translation: Translating the Talmudic text into English: "Transgressors" - these are the rebels, as it also says: "The king of Moab transgressed against me," and it says: "Then the moon will be confounded at that time." "For all their sins" - these are the unintentional sins, as it also says: "If a person sins unintentionally." And after confessing for intentional sins and rebellions, one goes back and confesses for unintentional sins?!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא כָּךְ הָיָה מִתְוַדֶּה: חָטָאתִי וְעָוִיתִי וּפָשַׁעְתִּי לְפָנֶיךָ אֲנִי וּבֵיתִי וְכוּ׳. וְכֵן בְּדָוִד הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״חָטָאנוּ עִם אֲבוֹתֵינוּ הֶעֱוִינוּ הִרְשָׁעְנוּ״, וְכֵן בִּשְׁלֹמֹה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״חָטָאנוּ (וְהִרְשַׁעְנוּ וּמָרָדְנוּ)״, וְכֵן בְּדָנִיֵּאל הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״חָטָאנוּ (וְהֶעֱוִינוּ) וְהִרְשַׁעְנוּ וּמָרָדְנוּ״. אֶלָּא מַהוּ שֶׁאָמַר מֹשֶׁה ״נוֹשֵׂא עָוֹן וָפֶשַׁע וְחַטָּאָה״? אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל חוֹטְאִין לְפָנֶיךָ וְעוֹשִׂין תְּשׁוּבָה עֲשֵׂה לָהֶם זְדוֹנוֹת כִּשְׁגָגוֹת.
human_translation: Rather, this is he confesses: I have sinned, I have done wrong, and I have rebelled before You, I and my household. And likewise, with regard to David it says “We have sinned along with our forefathers, we have done wrong, we have performed evil” And likewise, with regard to Solomon it says: “We have sinned, and we have done wrong, we have done evil” And likewise, with regard to Daniel it says: “We have sinned, and we have done wrong, and we have done evil, and we have rebelled” However, what is which Moses said: Forgiving wrongdoing and rebellion and sin, Moses said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe, when the Jewish people sin before you and repent, render their intentional sins like unwitting ones,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Rather, thus he would confess: "I have sinned, transgressed, and rebelled before You, I and my household, etc." And so too, in the case of David, he says: "We have sinned with our fathers, we have acted perversely, we have committed iniquity." And likewise, in the case of Solomon, he says: "We have sinned (and acted wickedly and rebelled)." And similarly, in the case of Daniel, he says: "We have sinned (and acted perversely), we have acted wickedly, and rebelled." But what did Moses mean when he said, "bearing iniquity and transgression and sin"? Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe, at the time when the children of Israel sin before You and repent, treat their intentional sins as unintentional.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. פְּשִׁיטָא: יָחִיד וְרַבִּים הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּים! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא, מִסְתַּבֵּר טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר דְּקָמְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ קְרָא דְּמֹשֶׁה, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rabba bar Shmuel said Rav said: halakha is in accordance with the statement of the Rabbis. obvious an individual and the many, halakha is in accordance with the many. Lest you say the rationale of Rabbi Meir is reasonable, as the verse Moses supports his teaches us
llm_translation: Rabba bar Shmuel said in the name of Rav: The halakha follows the words of the sages. It is obvious: In a dispute between an individual and the majority, the halakha follows the majority! Lest you say, the reasoning of Rabbi Meir is more logical, as he is supported by the verse of Moses, it is clear to us.

hebrew_text: הַהוּא דִּנְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבָּה וַעֲבַד כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: שָׁבְקַתְּ רַבָּנַן וְעָבְדַתְּ כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר סְבִירָא לִי, כְּדִכְתִיב בְּסֵפֶר אוֹרָיְיתָא דְּמֹשֶׁה.
human_translation: a certain who descended before Rabba, and he performed Rabbi Meir. said to him: Have you forsaken the Rabbis, and performed Rabbi Meir? said to Rabba: I hold in accordance with Rabbi Meir, as it is written in the Torah of Moses.
llm_translation: That one who stood before Rabba and acted like Rabbi Meir, he said to him: "You have abandoned the teachings of the Rabbis and acted like Rabbi Meir?!" He said to him: "I hold by Rabbi Meir, as it is written in the Book of the Torah of Moses."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכִפֶּר״, בְּכַפָּרַת דְּבָרִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר בְּכַפָּרַת דְּבָרִים, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא כַּפָּרַת דָּמִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught and atone the verse is speaking of atonement words you say atonement words, or perhaps it is only atonement blood,
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And he shall make atonement," the atonement of words that the Scripture speaks of. Do you say it is the atonement of words, or is it only the atonement of blood.

hebrew_text: הֲרֵי אֲנִי דָּן: נֶאֶמְרָה כָּאן ״כַּפָּרָה״, וְנֶאֶמְרָה לְהַלָּן ״כַּפָּרָה״. מָה ״כַּפָּרָה״ הָאֲמוּרָה בַּשָּׂעִיר — דְּבָרִים, אַף ״כַּפָּרָה״ הָאֲמוּרָה בַּפָּר — דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: I will infer Atonement is stated here, and atonement is stated there, Just as atonement that is stated with regard to the goat words, so too, atonement stated with regard to the bull words.
llm_translation: Behold, I judge: It is stated here "kaparah," and it is stated there "kaparah." Just as the "kaparah" mentioned in regards to the goat is specific, so too the "kaparah" mentioned in regards to the cow is specific.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר: הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְהִקְרִיב אַהֲרֹן אֶת פַּר הַחַטָּאת אֲשֶׁר לוֹ וְכִפֶּר בַּעֲדוֹ וּבְעַד בֵּיתוֹ״, וַעֲדַיִין לֹא נִשְׁחַט הַפָּר.
human_translation: And if it is your wish to state It says: “And Aaron shall then offer his bull of sin-offering and atone for himself and his household. the bull has not yet been slaughtered.
llm_translation: And if your soul wishes to say: "Behold, it says, 'And Aaron shall bring the bull of the sin offering which is for himself, and make atonement for himself and for his household,'" yet the bull has not yet been slaughtered.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא נֵילַף מִשָּׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים, שֶׁכַּפָּרָתוֹ בְּדָמִים, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר ״וְכִפֶּר״, וַעֲדַיִין לֹא נִשְׁחַט הַפָּר.
human_translation: What And if it is your wish to say, And if you say let us derive from the goat that is offered within, whose atonement is through blood it says: And atone, and the bull has not yet been slaughtered.
llm_translation: What is "And if your soul says"? And if you say it is derived from the goat that is done inside, whose atonement is with blood, behold it says "and atone," and yet the bull has not been slaughtered.

hebrew_text: וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּ״אָנָּא״? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״כַּפָּרָה״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן בְּחוֹרֵב ״כַּפָּרָה״. מָה לְהַלָּן בְּ״אָנָּא״, אַף כָּאן בְּ״אָנָּא״. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁבַּ״שֵּׁם״? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״כַּפָּרָה״, וְנֶאֶמְרָה בְּעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה ״כַּפָּרָה״. מָה לְהַלָּן בַּ״שֵּׁם״, אַף כָּאן בַּ״שֵּׁם״.
human_translation: And from where please? It is stated here: Atonement, and it is stated there, at Horeb: atonement Just as there, “Please, so too here, please And from where that the name It is stated here: Atonement, and it is stated with regard to the heifer whose neck is broken: “Atone, Just as there, the name so too here, the name
llm_translation: From where do we derive the concept of "Ana" (a formula of confession)? It is stated here "kaparah" (atonement), and it is stated elsewhere at Horeb "kaparah." Just as there (at Horeb) with "Ana," so too here with "Ana." And from where do we derive the concept of "Shem" (using the Name of God)? It is stated here "kaparah," and it is stated in the case of the heifer whose neck is to be broken "kaparah." Just as there (in the case of the heifer) with "Shem," so too here with "Shem."

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא חוֹרֵב מֵעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה לָא יָלֵיף — מַאי דַהֲוָה הֲוָה. אֶלָּא עֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה תֵּילַיף מֵחוֹרֵב? וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי, וְהָתְנַן: ״הַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹמְרִים: כַּפֵּר לְעַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל״, וְאִילּוּ בְּ״אָנָּא״ לָא קָא אָמַר. קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: Granted, Horeb cannot be derived from the heifer whose neck is broken, what was, was. However, you derive heifer whose neck is broken from Horeb, And if you say that is so, didn’t we learn the priests say: “Atone, for Your nation, Israel” while does not state please. difficult
llm_translation: Abaye said: With regard to a burnt offering that is an egla arufa, it does not exempt from a sin offering. What is the reason? Because it is what it is. Rather, should an egla arufa exempt from a burnt offering? And if you wish, say this is the case, and we learned in a Mishnah: "The priests say: 'Atone for Your people Israel,'" and it does not say "for me." This is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו. תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי שֵׁם ה׳ אֶקְרָא הָבוּ גוֹדֶל לֵאלֹהֵינוּ״, אָמַר לָהֶם מֹשֶׁה לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֲנִי מַזְכִּיר שְׁמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, אַתֶּם הָבוּ גּוֹדֶל. חֲנַנְיָה בֶּן אֲחִי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: ״זֵכֶר צַדִּיק לִבְרָכָה״, אָמַר לָהֶם נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁאֲנִי מַזְכִּיר צַדִּיק עוֹלָמִים, אַתֶּם תְּנוּ בְּרָכָה.
human_translation: And respond after he It was taught Rabbi says “When I call out the name of the Lord, give glory to our God” Moses said to the Jewish people: When I mention the name of the Holy One, Blessed be He, you give glory Ḥananya, son of the brother of Rabbi Yehoshua, says “The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing” The prophet, said to the Jewish people: When I mention the Righteous One of all worlds, you accord Him a blessing.
llm_translation: They answer after him. It was taught: Rabbi says, "For the name of Hashem I proclaim; Give greatness to our God." Moses said to the Israelites: When I mention the name of the Holy One, blessed be He, you give greatness. Hananiah, son of Rabbi Yehoshua, says, "The memory of the righteous is for a blessing." A prophet said to the Israelites: When I mention the righteous of the world, you give a blessing.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּא לוֹ לְמִזְרַח הָעֲזָרָה לִצְפוֹן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, הַסְּגָן מִימִינוֹ וְרֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ. וְשָׁם שְׁנֵי שְׂעִירִים, וְקַלְפִּי הָיְתָה שָׁם, וּבָהּ שְׁנֵי גוֹרָלוֹת, שֶׁל אֶשְׁכְּרוֹעַ הָיוּ, וַעֲשָׂאָן בֶּן גַּמְלָא שֶׁל זָהָב, וְהָיוּ מַזְכִּירִים אוֹתוֹ לְשֶׁבַח.
human_translation: came to eastern of the courtyard, to north of the altar. The deputy to his right, and the head of the patrilineal family to his left. And two goats there, and there was a receptacle there, and in it were two lots. These were boxwood, ben Gamla fashioned them of gold, would mention him favorably
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He who came to the east of the Azarah, to the north of the altar, the deputy was on his right, and the head of the house of Av was on his left. And there were two goats there, and a box was there, and in it were two lots, which were of boxwood, and they made them of gold, and they would mention it for praise.

hebrew_text: בֶּן קָטִין עָשָׂה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר דַּד לַכִּיּוֹר, שֶׁלֹּא הָיָה לוֹ אֶלָּא שְׁנַיִם. וְאַף הוּא עָשָׂה מוּכְנִי לַכִּיּוֹר, שֶׁלֹּא יִהְיוּ מֵימָיו נִפְסָלִין בְּלִינָה.
human_translation: ben Katin made twelve spigots for the basin as had only two. He also made a machine [ mukheni ] for the basin so that its water would not be disqualified by remaining overnight.
llm_translation: Son of Katīn made twelve breasts for the cistern, when he had only two. And he also made a hole for the cistern, so that its waters would not become disqualified through stagnation.

hebrew_text: מוֹנְבַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה כָּל יְדוֹת הַכֵּלִים שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁל זָהָב. הֵילֶנִי אִמּוֹ עָשְׂתָה נִבְרֶשֶׁת שֶׁל זָהָב עַל פֶּתַח הֵיכָל, וְאַף הִיא עָשְׂתָה טַבְלָא שֶׁל זָהָב שֶׁפָּרָשַׁת סוֹטָה כְּתוּבָה עָלֶיהָ. נִקָנוֹר נַעֲשׂוּ נִסִּים לְדַלְתוֹתָיו, וְהָיוּ מַזְכִּירִין אוֹתָן לְשֶׁבַח.
human_translation: King Munbaz would make the handles of all the Yom Kippur vessels of gold. Helene, his mother, fashioned a gold chandelier above the entrance of the Sanctuary. She also fashioned a golden tablet [ tavla ] on which the portion sota was written. Nicanor, miracles were performed to his doors, And would mention those favorably.
llm_translation: The despised King would make all the handles of the vessels of the Day of Atonement of gold. His mother Helena made a golden tablet at the entrance of the sanctuary, and she also made a gold plate with the portion of the Sotah written on it. The doors of Nikanor were made with miracles, and they would mention them for praise.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִדְּקָאָמַר לִצְפוֹן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, מִכְּלָל דְּמִזְבֵּחַ לָאו בְּצָפוֹן קָאֵי. מַנִּי? רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״צָפוֹנָה לִפְנֵי ה׳״, שֶׁיְּהֵא צָפוֹן כּוּלּוֹ פָּנוּי, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב
human_translation: From that it says to north of the altar, by inference that altar does not stand in the north whose It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as it was taught northward before God” that entire north be vacant. the statement of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: From where do we derive that the altar is situated to the north? It is derived from the fact that the altar is not entirely in the north. Who is the Tanna? Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. As it was taught: 'To the north before the Lord,' that its entire north side should be open, these are the words of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov."

hebrew_text: וְהָא רֵישָׁא אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא! כּוּלַּהּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הִיא, וּתְנִי בְּבֵין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: But isn’t the first clause, Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, entire is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. and teach adjacent to between the Entrance Hall and the altar
llm_translation: The beginning: Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon is it! The entirety: Rabbi Eliezer son of Yaakov is it, and it was taught in the Chamber of the Hall and at the Altar.

hebrew_text: הַסְּגָן בִּימִינוֹ, וְרֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַמְהַלֵּךְ לִימִין רַבּוֹ הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר. תְּנַן: הַסְּגָן בִּימִינוֹ, וְרֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ!
human_translation: the deputy to the right and the head of the patrilineal family is to his left. Rav Yehuda said One who walks to the right of his teacher is a boor, we learn the deputy, is to the right and the head of the patrilineal family is to his left?
llm_translation: The deputy is on his right, and the head of the household is on his left. Rav Yehudah said: One who walks to his right, his teacher is considered as a pit. We learned: The deputy is on his right, and the head of the household is on his left!

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד, תַּנְיָא: שְׁלֹשָׁה שֶׁהָיוּ מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ — הָרַב בָּאֶמְצַע, גָּדוֹל בִּימִינוֹ, וְקָטָן מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ. וְכֵן מָצִינוּ בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת שֶׁבָּאוּ אֵצֶל אַבְרָהָם, מִיכָאֵל בָּאֶמְצַע, גַּבְרִיאֵל בִּימִינוֹ, וּרְפָאֵל בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ.
human_translation: And furthermore, it was taught Three who were walking on the road the teacher in the middle, the greater on his right, and the lesser to his left. And so too do we find with the three ministering angels who came to Abraham: Michael, in the middle, Gabriel was to his right, and Raphael was to his left.
llm_translation: And furthermore, it was taught: Three who were walking on the road - the leader in the middle, the greater on his right, and the smaller on his left. And so we find with the three angels who came to Abraham, Michael in the middle, Gabriel on his right, and Raphael on his left.

hebrew_text: תַּרְגְּמַהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר פָּפָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב אַדָּא: כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּתְכַּסֶּה בּוֹ רַבּוֹ. וְהָתַנְיָא: הַמְהַלֵּךְ כְּנֶגֶד רַבּוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה בּוּר, אֲחוֹרֵי רַבּוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה מִגַּסֵּי הָרוּחַ! דְּמַצְדֵּד אַצְדּוֹדֵי.
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Pappa interpreted it before Rav Adda: so that he is obscured by his teacher. But wasn’t it taught One who walks next to his teacher is a boor; behind his teacher, is among the arrogant. to side
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel, son of Papa, interpreted before Rav Adda: In order that his master should be covered by him. And it was taught: One who walks opposite his master — this one is a boor; one who walks behind his master — this one is arrogant! For he is like a side-winder.

hebrew_text: וְקַלְפִּי הָיְתָה שָׁם וּבָהּ שְׁנֵי גוֹרָלוֹת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנָתַן אַהֲרֹן עַל שְׁנֵי הַשְּׂעִירִם גּוֹרָלוֹת״, [גּוֹרָלוֹת] שֶׁל כׇּל דָּבָר.
human_translation: And there was receptacle there, and in it were two lots. The Sages taught “And Aaron shall place lots on the two goats, Lots from any material,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Kalfi was there, and in it were two lots. The Rabbis taught: 'And Aaron shall place lots upon the two he-goats,' lots for everything." English translation: "And Kalfi was there, and in it were two lots. The Rabbis taught: 'And Aaron shall place lots upon the two he-goats,' lots for everything."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִתֵּן שְׁנַיִם עַל זֶה וּשְׁנַיִם עַל זֶה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גּוֹרָל אֶחָד לַה׳ וְגוֹרָל אֶחָד לַעֲזָאזֵל״ — אֵין כָּאן לַשֵּׁם אֶלָּא גּוֹרָל אֶחָד, וְאֵין כָּאן לַעֲזָאזֵל אֶלָּא אֶחָד. יָכוֹל יִתֵּן שֶׁל שֵׁם וְשֶׁל עֲזָאזֵל עַל זֶה וְשֶׁל שֵׁם וְשֶׁל עֲזָאזֵל עַל זֶה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גּוֹרָל אֶחָד [לַה׳״ — אֵין כָּאן לַה׳ אֶלָּא אֶחָד, וְאֵין כָּאן לַעֲזָאזֵל אֶלָּא אֶחָד]. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״גּוֹרָלוֹת״ — שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שָׁוִין, שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲשֶׂה אֶחָד שֶׁל זָהָב וְאֶחָד שֶׁל כֶּסֶף, אֶחָד גָּדוֹל וְאֶחָד קָטָן.
human_translation: might he place two on this and two on that the verse states: “One lot for God and one lot for Azazel” there is only one lot here for God, and there is only one lot here for Azazel. might he place of God and of Azazel on this and of God and of Azazel on that the verse states: One lot for God, there is only one here for God, and there is only one here for Azazel. If so, what the verse states lots, that be identical; he should not make one of gold and one of silver, one big and one small.
llm_translation: One might have thought to place two lots on this and two lots on that, Scripture states: "One lot for the Lord and one lot for Azazel" — here there is only one for the Name, and here there is only one for Azazel. One might have thought to place one of the Name and one of Azazel on this, and one of the Name and one of Azazel on that, Scripture states: "One lot [for the Lord" — here there is only one for the Lord, and here there is only one for Azazel. If so, what is the teaching when it says "lots" — that they should be equal, so that one should not be made of gold and one of silver, one large and one small.

hebrew_text: גּוֹרָלוֹת שֶׁל כׇּל דָּבָר: פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, לְכִדְתַנְיָא: לְפִי שֶׁמָּצִינוּ בַּצִּיץ שֶׁהַשֵּׁם כָּתוּב עָלָיו וְהוּא שֶׁל זָהָב, יָכוֹל אַף זֶה כֵּן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גּוֹרָל״ ״גּוֹרָל״ רִיבָּה, רִיבָּה שֶׁל זַיִת, רִיבָּה שֶׁל אֱגוֹז, רִיבָּה שֶׁל אֶשְׁכְּרוֹעַ.
human_translation: lots from any material. obvious, No, necessary which was taught Because we find with regard to the frontplate that the name of God was written upon it and it was made of gold, might that this too, the verse states: Lot, lot, to include It includes olive includes walnut includes boxwood.
llm_translation: Lots of everything: Obviously! Not necessary, as it was taught: Since we found in the Tzitz that the Name is written on it and it is made of gold, one might think the same here as well — the Talmud teaches: "Goral, goral" multiplied, multiplied of olive, multiplied of nut, multiplied of walnut.

hebrew_text: בֶּן קָטִין עָשָׂה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר דַּד לַכִּיּוֹר וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים הָעֲסוּקִין בְּתָמִיד מְקַדְּשִׁין יְדֵיהֶן וְרַגְלֵיהֶן בְּבַת אַחַת. תָּנָא: שַׁחֲרִית בְּמִילּוּאוֹ — מְקַדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו מִן הָעֶלְיוֹן, עַרְבִית בִּירִידָתוֹ — מְקַדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו מִן הַתַּחְתּוֹן.
human_translation: ben Katin made twelve spigots for the basin. taught: so that twelve of his fellow priests, who are occupied with the daily offering sanctify their hands and their feet simultaneously. taught: In the morning, is full, one sanctifies his hands and his feet from at the top afternoon, when is low, he sanctifies his hands and his feet at the bottom.
llm_translation: Son of Katīn made twelve breastplates for the Kiyor, etc. It was taught: In order that his twelve priestly brothers who are engaged in the continual service may sanctify their hands and feet at once. It was taught: In the morning, in its filling — he sanctifies his hands and feet from the upper part, in the evening, in its emptying — he sanctifies his hands and feet from the lower part.

hebrew_text: וְאַף הוּא עָשָׂה מוּכְנִי לַכִּיּוֹר וְכוּ׳. מַאי מוּכְנִי? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: גִּילְגְּלָא דַּהֲוָה מְשַׁקְּעָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: He also made a machine for the basin. What machine? Abaye said: a wheel with which he lowered
llm_translation: And he also made a hole for the pitcher, etc. What is "mukhni"? Abaye said: A wheel that was turning for it.

hebrew_text: מוֹנְבַּז הַמֶּלֶךְ עָשָׂה כָּל יְדוֹת הַכֵּלִים וְכוּ׳. נַעְבְּדִינְהוּ לְדִידְהוּ דְּזָהָב!
human_translation: King Munbaz would make the handles of all the vessels he should have made themselves of gold,
llm_translation: The despised king made all the handles of the vessels, etc. Let us serve him with his own gold!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: בִּידוֹת סַכִּינִין. מֵיתִיבִי: אַף הוּא עָשָׂה כַּנֵּי כֵלִים, וְאוֹגְנֵי כֵלִים, וִידוֹת כֵּלִים, וִידוֹת סַכִּינִין שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁל זָהָב. תַּרְגְּמַהּ אַבָּיֵי: בְּקַתָּתָא דְּנַרְגֵי וַחֲצִינֵי.
human_translation: Abaye said: knife handles. raises an objection also made bases of vessels, grips of vessels, handles of vessels, and the handles of knives of Yom Kippur of gold. Abaye interpreted handles of axes and hatchets.
llm_translation: Abaye said: with the handles of knives. The questioner objects: he also made the bases of vessels, and the rims of vessels, and the handles of vessels, and the handles of knives of the golden Yom Kippur knives. Abaye translated it: with the pomegranate of the candlestick and its flowers.

hebrew_text: הֵילֶנִי אִמּוֹ עָשְׂתָה נִבְרֶשֶׁת שֶׁל זָהָב וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהַחַמָּה זוֹרַחַת נִיצוֹצוֹת יוֹצְאִין מִמֶּנָּה, וְהַכֹּל יוֹדְעִין שֶׁהִגִּיעַ זְמַן קְרִיאַת שְׁמַע.
human_translation: Helene, his mother, fashioned a gold chandelier taught When the sun rose, sparks emanate from and everyone knew that the time recite Shema had arrived.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Heleni Imo As'tah Nivreshet Shel Zahav V'chul. Tanah: B'sha'ah shehachamah zorachat nitzotzot yotzin mimena, v'hakol yod'in shehigia zman kriyat shema. English translation: Heleni, his mother, made for him a golden lamp, etc. It was taught: When the sun rises, its rays emit sparks, and everyone knows that the time for reciting the Shema has arrived.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַקּוֹרֵא אֶת שְׁמַע שַׁחֲרִית עִם אַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר, וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲמָד — לֹא יָצָא, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאַנְשֵׁי מִשְׁמָר מַשְׁכִּימִין וְאַנְשֵׁי מַעֲמָד מֵאֲחֵרִים! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לִשְׁאָר עַמָּא דְּבִירוּשְׁלֶם.
