human_translation: raises an objection: One who recites Shema morning with the men of the priestly watch, or with the men of the non-priestly watch, did not fulfill because the men of the priestly watch early and the men of the non-priestly watch, postpone Abaye said: for the rest of the people in Jerusalem,
llm_translation: Challenger: One who recites the Shema in the morning with the night watchmen and the standers has not fulfilled his obligation, because the night watchmen rise early and the standers come later! Abaye said: This is for the rest of the people of Jerusalem.

hebrew_text: וְאַף הִיא עָשְׂתָה טַבְלָא. שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ כּוֹתְבִין מְגִילָּה לְתִינוֹק לְהִתְלַמֵּד בָּהּ. אֲמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי יַנַּאי: בְּאָלֶף בֵּית.
human_translation: also fashioned tablet You learn from this one write a scroll from which a child may be taught. Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: of alef - beit ,
llm_translation: "And she also made a tabula. You heard from her kind, they write a Megillah for a child to learn from it. Reish Lakish said in the name of Rabbi Yannai: with Aleph Bet."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹתֵב רוֹאֶה וְכוֹתֵב מָה שֶׁכָּתוּב בַּטַּבְלָא! אֵימָא: רוֹאֶה וְכוֹתֵב כְּמָה שֶׁכָּתוּב בַּטַּבְלָא.
human_translation: raises an objection When writes he looks and writes that which is written on the tablet. say: He looks and writes like which is written on the tablet.
llm_translation: Challenger: When he writes, he sees and writes what is written in the ink! I would say: He sees and writes as much as is written in the ink.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כְּשֶׁהוּא כּוֹתֵב — רוֹאֶה וְכוֹתֵב מָה שֶׁכָּתוּב בַּטַּבְלָא, וּמָה כָּתוּב בַּטַּבְלָא — ״אִם שָׁכַב אִישׁ אוֹתָךְ״ [״וְאִם לֹא שָׁכַב״], ״אִם שָׂטִית״ ״אִם לֹא שָׂטִית״! הָתָם
human_translation: raises an objection When he writes, he looks and writes that which is written on the tablet. And what is written on the tablet? If a man lay with you…and if he did not lay with you; if you strayed…if you did not stray There,
llm_translation: Challenger: When he writes - he sees and writes what is written in the tablet, and what is written in the tablet - "If a man lies with you" "but if not lying", "if you have strayed" "if you have not strayed"! There it is.

hebrew_text: בְּסֵירוּגִין.
human_translation: alternating
llm_translation: In the lattice.

hebrew_text: נִיקָנוֹר נַעֲשׂוּ נִסִּים לְדַלְתוֹתָיו. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מָה נִסִּים נַעֲשׂוּ לְדַלְתוֹתָיו? אָמְרוּ: כְּשֶׁהָלַךְ נִיקָנוֹר לְהָבִיא דְּלָתוֹת מֵאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם, בַּחֲזִירָתוֹ עָמַד עָלָיו נַחְשׁוֹל שֶׁבַּיָּם לְטַבְּעוֹ, נָטְלוּ אַחַת מֵהֶן וֶהֱטִילוּהָ לַיָּם, וַעֲדַיִין לָא נָח הַיָּם מִזַּעְפּוֹ.
human_translation: Nicanor, miracles were performed to his doors. The Sages taught What miracles occurred for his doors? They said: When Nicanor went to bring doors from Alexandria in Egypt, on his return a storm arose in the sea to drown him. took one and cast it into the sea, And still the sea did not rest from its rage.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Nikanor na'asu nissim le'daltothav. Tanu Rabanan: Mah nissim na'asu le'daltothav? Amru: Kesh'halekh Nikanor le'haavi delathoth me'alekhsandriya shel Mitzrayim, bachaziratho amad alav nachshol shebayam letabo'o, natlu achath mehen vehetiluha layam, va'adayin lo nach hayam miz'afpo. English translation: Nikanor made miracles for his doors. The Rabbis taught: What miracles were made for his doors? They said: When Nikanor went to bring doors from Alexandria of Egypt, a sea snake stood in his way to drown him. They took one of them and threw it into the sea, and the sea has not calmed down from its anger yet.

hebrew_text: בִּקְּשׁוּ לְהָטִיל אֶת חֲבֶרְתָּהּ, עָמַד הוּא וּכְרָכָהּ, אָמַר לָהֶם: הֲטִילוּנִי עִמָּהּ. מִיָּד נָח הַיָּם מִזַּעְפּוֹ, וְהָיָה מִצְטַעֵר עַל חֲבֶרְתָּהּ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לִנְמֵלָהּ שֶׁל עַכּוֹ, הָיְתָה מְבַצְבֶּצֶת וְיוֹצְאָה מִתַּחַת דּוֹפְנֵי הַסְּפִינָה. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים בְּרִיָּה שֶׁבַּיָּם בְּלָעַתָּה, וֶהֱקִיאַתָּה לַיַּבָּשָׁה.
human_translation: They sought to cast the other stood and embraced it said to them: Cast me into with it. Immediately, the sea rested from its rage, and he regretted of the other When they arrived at the port of Akko was poking out under the sides of the ship. And some say a sea creature swallowed it and spewed it onto the land.
llm_translation: They sought to throw her companion, he stood and wrapped her, he said to them: throw me with her. Immediately the sea calmed from its anger, and he was distressed for her companion. Once he reached the port of Akko, she was sparkling and emerged from beneath the ship's threshold. And some say the sea creature swallowed her, and vomited her onto dry land.

hebrew_text: וְעָלֶיהָ אָמַר שְׁלֹמֹה: ״קוֹרוֹת בָּתֵּינוּ אֲרָזִים רַהִיטֵנוּ בְּרוֹתִים״, אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״בְּרוֹתִים״, אֶלָּא ״בְּרִית יָם״. לְפִיכָךְ, כׇּל הַשְּׁעָרִים שֶׁהָיוּ בַּמִּקְדָּשׁ נִשְׁתַּנּוּ לִהְיוֹת שֶׁל זָהָב, חוּץ מִשַּׁעֲרֵי נִיקָנוֹר מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנַּעֲשׂוּ בּוֹ נִסִּים. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁנְּחוֹשְׁתָּן מוּצְהֶבֶת הָיְתָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: נְחֹשֶׁת קְלוֹנִיתָא הָיְתָה, וְהָיְתָה מְאִירָה כְּשֶׁל זָהָב.
human_translation: And with regard to this, Solomon said: “The beams of our houses are cedars, and our doors are cypresses [ berotim ]” Do not read berotim but berit yam , Therefore, all the gates in the Temple were altered to become gold except the Gates of Nicanor because miracles were performed to them. And some say because their copper was brightly-colored Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says it was refined [ kelonita ] copper, and it illuminated like gold.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And regarding it, Solomon said: "The beams of our houses are cedars, our rafters are cypresses." Do not read "rafters," rather "a covenant of the sea." Therefore, all the gates that were in the Temple were changed to be of gold, except for the gates of Nicanor because miracles were performed through them. And some say: because they were made of fine brass. Rabbi Eliezer ben Jacob says: it was of inferior brass, yet it shone like gold.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ וְאֵלּוּ לִגְנַאי: שֶׁל בֵּית גַּרְמוּ לֹא רָצוּ לְלַמֵּד עַל מַעֲשֵׂה לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים, שֶׁל בֵּית אַבְטִינָס לֹא רָצוּ לְלַמֵּד עַל מַעֲשֵׂה הַקְּטוֹרֶת.
human_translation: those unfavorably. of the House of Garmu did not want to teach of the preparation of the shewbread of the House of Avtinas did not want to teach of the preparation of the incense.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: And these are for contempt: The students of the House of Garmu did not want to teach the practice of the showbread, and the students of the House of Avtinas did not want to teach the practice of the incense offering.

hebrew_text: הוּגְרַס בֶּן לֵוִי הָיָה יוֹדֵעַ פֶּרֶק בַּשִּׁיר וְלֹא רָצָה לְלַמֵּד, בֶּן קַמְצָר לֹא רָצָה לְלַמֵּד עַל מַעֲשֵׂה הַכְּתָב. עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנִים נֶאֱמַר: ״זֵכֶר צַדִּיק לִבְרָכָה״, וְעַל אֵלּוּ נֶאֱמַר: ״וְשֵׁם רְשָׁעִים יִרְקָב״.
human_translation: Hugras ben Levi knew a chapter music, and he did not want to teach ben Kamtzar did not want to teach act of writing. About the first it is stated: “The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing” and about these it is stated: “But the name of the wicked shall rot”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Hugras ben Levi was knowledgeable in a chapter of the Song of Songs but did not want to teach it; Ben Kamtzar did not want to teach about the incident of the Golden Calf. Concerning the former it is said: "The memory of the righteous is for a blessing," and concerning the latter it is said: "But the name of the wicked shall rot."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֵּית גַּרְמוּ הָיוּ בְּקִיאִין בְּמַעֲשֵׂה לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים וְלֹא רָצוּ לְלַמֵּד. שָׁלְחוּ חֲכָמִים וְהֵבִיאוּ אוּמָּנִין מֵאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם. וְהָיוּ יוֹדְעִין לֶאֱפוֹת כְּמוֹתָן, וְלֹא הָיוּ יוֹדְעִין לִרְדּוֹת כְּמוֹתָן. שֶׁהַלָּלוּ מַסִּיקִין מִבַּחוּץ וְאוֹפִין מִבַּחוּץ, וְהַלָּלוּ מַסִּיקִין מִבִּפְנִים וְאוֹפִין מִבִּפְנִים. הַלָּלוּ פִּיתָּן מִתְעַפֶּשֶׁת, וְהַלָּלוּ אֵין פִּיתָּן מִתְעַפֶּשֶׁת.
human_translation: The Sages taught House of Garmu were expert in preparation the shewbread, and they did not want to teach The Sages sent for and brought craftsmen from Alexandria in Egypt, And knew to bake like but they did not know to remove like they that these light outside and bake it outside and these light inside and bake inside. these their bread becomes moldy and these their bread does not become moldy.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The House of Garmu were experts in the preparation of the showbread, but they did not want to teach others. They sent for skilled craftsmen from Alexandria of Egypt, who knew how to bake like them, but did not know how to remove the bread like them. For the House of Garmu would bake the showbread from the outside and remove it from the outside, while the craftsmen from Alexandria would bake it from the inside and remove it from the inside. The bread of the House of Garmu would remain fresh, but the bread of the craftsmen would not remain fresh.

hebrew_text: כְּשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ חֲכָמִים בַּדָּבָר, אָמְרוּ: כֹּל מַה שֶּׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לִכְבוֹדוֹ בְּרָאוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּל הַנִּקְרָא בִשְׁמִי וְלִכְבוֹדִי בְּרָאתִיו״. וְחָזְרוּ בֵּית גַּרְמוּ לִמְקוֹמָן. שָׁלְחוּ לָהֶם חֲכָמִים — וְלֹא בָּאוּ, כָּפְלוּ לָהֶם שְׂכָרָן וּבָאוּ. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיוּ נוֹטְלִין שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מָנֶה, וְהַיּוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּכׇל יוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה, וְהַיּוֹם אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה.
human_translation: When the Sages heard of the matter they said: Whatever the Holy One, Blessed be He, created, He created in His honor, as it is stated: “Everyone who is called by My name, I have created for My glory” and the House of Garmu return to their station. The Sages sent for them and they did not come. They doubled their wages and they came. Each day they would take twelve maneh , and today twenty-four maneh . Rabbi Yehuda says: Each day twenty-four and today forty-eight.
llm_translation: When the sages heard this matter, they said: Everything that the Holy One, blessed be He, created in His honor, He created it, as it is stated: "All who are called by My name, and for My glory I have created him." The Beit Garmu returned to their place. They sent sages to them - and they did not come, so they doubled their wages and then they came. Every day they used to take twelve maneh, and today they took twenty-four. Rabbi Yehuda says: Every day they took twenty-four, and today they took forty-eight.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם חֲכָמִים: מָה רְאִיתֶם שֶׁלֹּא לְלַמֵּד? אָמְרוּ לָהֶם: יוֹדְעִין הָיוּ שֶׁל בֵּית אַבָּא שֶׁבַּיִת זֶה עָתִיד לֵיחָרֵב, שֶׁמָּא יִלְמוֹד אָדָם שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְהוּגָּן וְיֵלֵךְ וְיַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּכָךְ. וְעַל דָּבָר זֶה מַזְכִּירִין אוֹתָן לְשֶׁבַח: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא נִמְצֵאת פַּת נְקִיָּה בְּיַד בְּנֵיהֶם, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ מִמַּעֲשֵׂה לֶחֶם הַפָּנִים זֶה נִיזּוֹנִין, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וִהְיִיתֶם נְקִיִּים מֵה׳ וּמִיִּשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: The Sages said to them: What did you see that you not to teach They said: father’s house knew that this house, is destined to be destroyed, lest an unworthy man learn and go and engage in idol worship with And for this matter they are mentioned favorably: Never was refined bread found in the hands of their descendants, so that would not say they are sustained from that preparing the shewbread. to fulfill that which is stated: “And you shall be clear before the Lord and before Israel”
llm_translation: They said to them, the sages: What did you see that you did not learn? They said to them: They knew that the house of Abba in this city is destined to be destroyed, lest a person learn who is not accustomed and go and serve idolatry in this way. And regarding this matter, they mention them for praise: A clean piece of bread was never found in the hands of their children, so that they would not say, "From this showbread we are sustained," to fulfill what is said: "And you shall be clean from the Lord and from Israel."

hebrew_text: שֶׁל בֵּית אַבְטִינָס לֹא רָצוּ לְלַמֵּד עַל מַעֲשֵׂה הַקְּטוֹרֶת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֵּית אַבְטִינָס הָיוּ בְּקִיאִין בְּמַעֲשֵׂה הַקְּטוֹרֶת וְלֹא רָצוּ לְלַמֵּד, שָׁלְחוּ חֲכָמִים וְהֵבִיאוּ אוּמָּנִין מֵאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיָּא שֶׁל מִצְרַיִם. וְהָיוּ יוֹדְעִין לְפַטֵּם כְּמוֹתָם וְלֹא הָיוּ יוֹדְעִין לְהַעֲלוֹת עָשָׁן כְּמוֹתָן. שֶׁל הַלָּלוּ — מִתַּמֵּר וְעוֹלֶה כְּמַקֵּל, שֶׁל הַלָּלוּ — מַפְצִיעַ לְכָאן וּלְכָאן.
human_translation: of the House of Avtinas did not want to teach about the preparation of the incense, The Sages taught The House of Avtinas were expert in the preparing the incense, and they did not want to teach The Sages sent for and brought craftsmen from Alexandria in Egypt. And knew to blend like they but they did not know to cause the smoke to rise like did. of these rises in a column like a stick; of these branched out to here and to there
llm_translation: The household of Avtinas did not want to teach about the incense offering. The Rabbis taught: The household of Avtinas were knowledgeable in the incense offering but did not want to teach. They sent sages and brought skilled craftsmen from Alexandria of Egypt. They knew how to prepare it like them, but did not know how to produce the smoke like them. The incense of these craftsmen would turn and rise like a staff, the incense of these the household of Avtinas would spread out in all directions.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁשָּׁמְעוּ חֲכָמִים בַּדָּבָר, אָמְרוּ: כֹּל מַה שֶׁבָּרָא הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — לִכְבוֹדוֹ בְּרָאוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּל פָּעַל ה׳ לַמַּעֲנֵהוּ״, וְחָזְרוּ בֵּית אַבְטִינָס לִמְקוֹמָן. שָׁלְחוּ לָהֶם חֲכָמִים וְלֹא בָּאוּ, כָּפְלוּ לָהֶם שְׂכָרָן וּבָאוּ. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיוּ נוֹטְלִין שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מָנֶה, וְהַיּוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּכׇל יוֹם עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה, וְהַיּוֹם אַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה.
human_translation: When the Sages heard of the matter, they said: Whatever the Holy One, Blessed be He, created, He created in His honor, as it is stated: “God made everything for His sake” and the House of Avtinas return to their station. The Sages sent for and they did not come. They doubled their wages and they came. Each day they would take twelve maneh , and today twenty-four maneh . Rabbi Yehuda says: Each day twenty-four and today forty-eight.
llm_translation: When the sages heard this matter, they said: Everything that the Holy One, blessed be He, created, He created for His glory, as it is stated: "Everything the Lord has made is for His purpose." The House of Avtinas returned to their place. They sent sages to them, but they did not come; they doubled their wages and then they came. Every day they used to receive twelve maneh, and today they received twenty-four. Rabbi Yehudah says: Every day they received twenty-four, and today they received forty-eight.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם חֲכָמִים: מָה רְאִיתֶם שֶׁלֹּא לְלַמֵּד? אָמְרוּ: יוֹדְעִין הָיוּ שֶׁל בֵּית אַבָּא שֶׁבַּיִת זֶה עָתִיד לֵיחָרֵב, אָמְרוּ: שֶׁמָּא יִלְמוֹד אָדָם שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְהוּגָּן וְיֵלֵךְ וְיַעֲבוֹד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה בְּכָךְ. וְעַל דָּבָר זֶה מַזְכִּירִין אוֹתָן לְשֶׁבַח: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא יָצָאת כַּלָּה מְבוּשֶּׂמֶת מִבָּתֵּיהֶן, וּכְשֶׁנּוֹשְׂאִין אִשָּׁה מִמָּקוֹם אַחֵר, מַתְנִין עִמָּהּ שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְבַּסֵּם, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ: מִמַּעֲשֵׂה הַקְּטוֹרֶת מִתְבַּסְּמִין, לְקַיֵּים מַה שֶּׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וִהְיִיתֶם נְקִיִּים מֵה׳ וּמִיִּשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: The Sages said to them: What did you see that not to teach They said: father’s house knew that this house, is destined to be destroyed, lest an unworthy man learn and go and engage in idol worship with And for this matter they are mentioned favorably: Never did a perfumed bride emerge from their homes. And when they marry a woman from a different place, they stipulate with her that she will not perfume herself, so that would not say it is with the work of the incense they perfume themselves, to fulfill that which is stated: “And you shall be clear before the Lord and before Israel”
llm_translation: They said to them, the sages: "What did you see that you did not learn?" They said: "We knew that the house of Abba in this city is destined to be destroyed." They said: "Perhaps a person will learn who is not accustomed and will go and serve idolatry in this way." And regarding this matter, they mention them for praise: "A bride has never gone out adorned from their homes, and when they marry a woman from another place, they accompany her so she will not adorn herself, so they will not say: 'From the work of the incense they adorn themselves,' to fulfill what is said: 'And you shall be clean from the Lord and from Israel.'"

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: פַּעַם אַחַת הָיִיתִי מְהַלֵּךְ בַּדֶּרֶךְ וּמָצָאתִי אֶחָד מִבְּנֵי בְנֵיהֶם, אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: אֲבוֹתֶיךָ בִּקְּשׁוּ לְהַרְבּוֹת כְּבוֹדָן וְרָצוּ לְמַעֵט כְּבוֹד הַמָּקוֹם, עַכְשָׁיו כְּבוֹד מָקוֹם בִּמְקוֹמוֹ, וּמִיעֵט כְּבוֹדָם.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yishmael said: One time I was walking along the road and I found one of descendants I said to him: Your fathers sought to enhance their honor and sought to diminish God’s honor Now, the honor of God remains as it was, He diminished their honor,
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yishmael said: Once I was walking on the road and I found one of their descendants, I said to him: Your ancestors sought to increase their honor and they wanted to diminish the honor of the Omnipresent, now the honor of the Omnipresent is in its place, and their honor is diminished.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: (פַּעַם אַחַת) סָח לִי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן לוֹגָא: פַּעַם אַחַת יָצָאתִי אֲנִי וְאֶחָד מִבְּנֵי בְנֵיהֶם לַשָּׂדֶה לְלַקֵּט עֲשָׂבִים, וְרָאִיתִי (שֶׁשָּׂחַק וּבָכָה). אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה בָּכִיתָ? אָמַר לִי: כְּבוֹד אֲבוֹתַי נִזְכַּרְתִּי. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה שָׂחַקְתְּ? אָמַר לִי: שֶׁעָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחְזִירָהּ לָנוּ. וּמִפְּנֵי מָה נִזְכַּרְתָּ? אָמַר לִי: מַעֲלֶה עָשָׁן כְּנֶגְדִּי. הַרְאֵהוּ לִי! אָמַר לִי: שְׁבוּעָה הִיא בְּיָדֵינוּ שֶׁאֵין מַרְאִין אוֹתוֹ לְכׇל אָדָם.
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: One time Rabbi Yishmael ben Loga related to me: One time I and one of the descendants went out to the field to collect herbs, and I saw that he laughed and he cried. I said to him: Why did you cry? He said to me: I was reminded of the honor of my forefathers, And why did you laugh? He said to me: The Holy One, Blessed be He, is going to restore it to us in the future And why are you reminded He said to me: The smoke-raising is before me, Show it to me; He said to me: We are bound by oath not to show it to any person
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva said: (Once) Rabbi Ishmael ben Elisha conversed with me: (Once) I and one of their descendants went out to the field to gather herbs, and I saw (that he laughed and cried). I said to him: Why did you cry? He said to me: I remembered the honor of my ancestors. And why did you laugh? He said to me: Because the Holy One, blessed be He, is destined to restore it to us. And why did you remember? He said to me: Smoke rises before me. Show it to me! He said to me: It is a secret in our hands that it is not shown to anyone.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן נוּרִי: פַּעַם אַחַת מָצָאתִי זָקֵן אֶחָד וּמְגִילַת סַמְמָנִין בְּיָדוֹ. אָמַרְתִּי לוֹ: מֵאַיִן אַתָּה? אָמַר לִי: מִבֵּית אַבְטִינָס אֲנִי. וּמָה בְּיָדֶךָ? אָמַר לִי: מְגִילַּת סַמְמָנִין. הַרְאֵהוּ לִי! אָמַר לִי: כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁבֵּית אַבָּא הָיוּ קַיָּימִין, לֹא הָיוּ מוֹסְרִין אוֹתוֹ לְכׇל אָדָם, וְעַכְשָׁיו הֲרֵי הוּא לְךָ, וְהִזָּהֵר בָּהּ. וּכְשֶׁבָּאתִי וְסַחְתִּי דְּבָרַי לִפְנֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אָמַר לִי: מֵעַתָּה אָסוּר לְסַפֵּר בִּגְנוּתָן שֶׁל אֵלּוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Nuri said: One time I found an old man who had in his hand a scroll of spices. I said to him: Where are you from? He said to me: I am from the House of Avtinas. And what is in your hand? He said to me: A scroll of spices. Show it to me. He said to me: As long as the House my forefathers, was extant, they would not pass it on to anyone. And now, here it is; and be careful with it And when I came and related my statement before Rabbi Akiva, he said to me: And now it is prohibited to mention them unfavorably,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan ben Nuri: Once I found an elder holding a scroll of amulets in his hand. I said to him: From where are you? He said to me: I am from the house of Avtinas. And what is in your hand? He said to me: A scroll of amulets. Show it to me! He said to me: As long as the members of the house of Abba were alive, they did not hand it over to anyone, and now it is yours, but be cautious with it. And when I came and related my words before Rabbi Akiva, he said to me: From now on, it is forbidden to speak disparagingly about them.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמַר בֶּן עַזַּאי: בְּשִׁמְךָ יִקְרָאוּךְ, וּבִמְקוֹמְךָ יוֹשִׁיבוּךְ,
human_translation: From here, ben Azzai said: by your name they shall call you and in your place, they shall seat you,
llm_translation: From here Ben Azzai said: "In Your name they will call you, and in Your place they will honor you."

hebrew_text: וּמִשֶּׁלְּךָ יִתְּנוּ לְךָ. אֵין אָדָם נוֹגֵעַ בַּמּוּכָן לַחֲבֵירוֹ. וְאֵין מַלְכוּת נוֹגַעַת בַּחֲבֶרְתָּהּ אֲפִילּוּ כִּמְלֹא נִימָא.
human_translation: and from your they shall give you. No person touch which is prepared for another And one reign does not overlap with another even a hairbreadth.
llm_translation: And from yours they shall give to you. No person touches the property of his fellow. And one kingdom does not touch the property of another, even as much as a hair's breadth.

hebrew_text: הוּגְרַס בֶּן לֵוִי וְכוּ׳. תַּנְיָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא נוֹתֵן קוֹלוֹ בִּנְעִימָה, מַכְנִיס גּוּדָלוֹ לְתוֹךְ פִּיו, וּמַנִּיחַ אֶצְבָּעוֹ בֵּין הַנִּימִין, עַד שֶׁהָיוּ אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים נִזְקָרִים בְּבַת רֹאשׁ לַאֲחוֹרֵיהֶם.
human_translation: Hugras ben Levi It was taught When projects his voice in melody, places his thumb into his mouth and places his finger between the strings so that his brethren the priests were abruptly taken aback.
llm_translation: Hugras son of Levi, etc. It was taught: When he would raise his voice in a pleasant manner, he would insert his thumb into his mouth and place his finger between his teeth, until his priestly brothers would bow backwards.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֶּן קַמְצָר לֹא רָצָה לְלַמֵּד עַל מַעֲשֵׂה הַכְּתָב. אָמְרוּ עָלָיו שֶׁהָיָה נוֹטֵל אַרְבָּעָה קוּלְמוֹסִין בֵּין אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו, וְאִם הָיְתָה תֵּיבָה שֶׁל אַרְבַּע אוֹתִיּוֹת הָיָה כּוֹתְבָהּ בְּבַת אַחַת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מָה רָאִיתָ שֶׁלֹּא לְלַמֵּד? כּוּלָּן מָצְאוּ תְּשׁוּבָה לְדִבְרֵיהֶם, בֶּן קַמְצָר לֹא מָצָא תְּשׁוּבָה לִדְבָרָיו. עַל הָרִאשׁוֹנִים נֶאֱמַר: ״זֵכֶר צַדִּיק לִבְרָכָה״, וְעַל בֶּן קַמְצָר וַחֲבֵירָיו נֶאֱמַר: ״וְשֵׁם רְשָׁעִים יִרְקָב״.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Ben Kamtzar did not want to teach technique of writing. They said about him that he would take four quills between his fingers, and if there was a word of four letters he could write it simultaneously. They said to him: What did you see that not to teach All the came up a response to matter their ben Kamtzar did not come up a response to matter his With regard to the first it is stated: “The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing” and about ben Kamtzar and his counterparts it is stated: “But the name of the wicked shall rot”
llm_translation: The sages taught: Ben Kamtzar did not want to teach the work of the Scripture. They said about him that he would take four quill pens between his fingers, and if there was a tablet of four letters, he would write it in one stroke. They said to him: What did you see that you did not want to teach? They all found a way to retract their words, but Ben Kamtzar did not find a way to retract his words. Concerning the former, it is said: "The memory of the righteous is for a blessing," and concerning Ben Kamtzar and his colleagues, it is said: "But the name of the wicked will rot."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְשֵׁם רְשָׁעִים יִרְקָב״? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: רַקְבִּיבוּת תַּעֲלֶה בִּשְׁמוֹתָן, דְּלָא מַסְּקִינַן בִּשְׁמַיְיהוּ. מֵתִיב רָבִינָא. מַעֲשֶׂה בְּדוֹאֵג בֶּן יוֹסֵף, שֶׁהִנִּיחוֹ [אָבִיו] בֵּן קָטָן לְאִמּוֹ. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה אִמּוֹ מוֹדַדְתּוֹ בִּטְפָחִים וְנוֹתֶנֶת מִשְׁקָלוֹ שֶׁל זָהָב לְבֵית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, וּכְשֶׁגָּבַר אוֹיֵב טְבָחַתּוּ וַאֲכָלַתּוּ.
human_translation: What But the name of the wicked shall rot? Rabbi Elazar said: decay will spread on their names, that we do not call by their names, Ravina raised an objection an incident involving Doeg ben Yosef, whose father left him a young child to his mother, Each day his mother measured in handbreadths and donated gold the weight he to the Temple. enemy prevailed she slaughtered and ate him.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "And the name of the wicked shall rot"? Rabbi Elazar said: Only their putrefaction will rise in their names, as we do not mention them by name. Ravina objected: There was an incident with Doeg the Edomite, whose father left him as a young child with his mother. Every day his mother would measure him with handfuls and give his weight in gold to the Temple, and when he grew up, he became an enemy of the slaughter and consumption.

hebrew_text: וְעָלֶיהָ קוֹנֵן יִרְמְיָה: ״אִם תֹּאכַלְנָה נָשִׁים פִּרְיָם עוֹלְלֵי טִפּוּחִים״, מְשִׁיבָה רוּחַ הַקֹּדֶשׁ וְאוֹמֶרֶת: ״אִם יֵהָרֵג בְּמִקְדַּשׁ ה׳ כֹּהֵן וְנָבִיא״, חֲזִי מַאי סְלֵיק בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And with regard to her Jeremiah lamented: “Shall the women eat their fruit, their children in their care [ tipuḥim ]?” And the Divine Spirit responds and says: “Shall the priest and the prophet be slain in the Temple of the Lord?” See what befell him.
llm_translation: And regarding it, Yirmiyah establishes: "If women eat the fruit, offspring of cucumbers," the Holy Spirit responds and says: "If a Kohen and a prophet are killed in the sanctuary of the Lord," see what will come of it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: צַדִּיק מֵעַצְמוֹ, וְרָשָׁע מֵחֲבֵירוֹ. צַדִּיק מֵעַצְמוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״זֵכֶר צַדִּיק לִבְרָכָה״, וְרָשָׁע מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשֵׁם רְשָׁעִים יִרְקָב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A righteous person for his own and a wicked person of his counterpart. A righteous person for his actions, as it is written: “The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing”; A wicked person of his counterpart, as it is written: “But the name of the wicked shall rot”;
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A righteous person is from himself, and a wicked person is from his companion. A righteous person is from himself, as it is written: "The memory of the righteous is for a blessing," and a wicked person is from his companion, as it is written: "But the name of the wicked will rot."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִינָא לְהָהוּא מֵרַבָּנַן דַּהֲוָה מְסַדַּר אַגָּדָתָא קַמֵּיהּ: מְנַָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן ״זֵכֶר צַדִּיק לִבְרָכָה״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, דְּהָא כְּתִיב: ״זֵכֶר צַדִּיק לִבְרָכָה״! מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַה׳ אָמָר הַמְכַסֶּה אֲנִי מֵאַבְרָהָם אֲשֶׁר אֲנִי עוֹשֶׂה״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאַבְרָהָם הָיוֹ יִהְיֶה לְגוֹי גָּדוֹל וְעָצוּם״.
human_translation: Ravina said to one of the Sages who would organize aggadic before him: From where is this matter that the Sages stated: The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing,  He said to him: As it is written “The memory of the righteous shall be for a blessing.” From where in the Torah do we As it is written: “And God said: Shall I hide from Abraham that which I am doing?” And it is written: “And Abraham shall surely become a great and mighty nation”
llm_translation: He said to him, Ravina to that Sage who was arranging an Aggadah before him: "From where is the matter that the Rabbis say, 'A righteous person's memory is for a blessing'?" He said to him, "Because it is written, 'A righteous person's memory is for a blessing'! From where do we derive this from the Torah? As it is written, 'For I have known him, in order that he may command his children and his household after him to keep the way of the Lord by doing what is right and just, so that the Lord may bring about for Abraham what He has promised him.'"

hebrew_text: מְנַָא הָא מִילְּתָא דַאֲמוּר רַבָּנַן ״שֵׁם רְשָׁעִים יִרְקָב״? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, דְּהָא כְּתִיב: ״וְשֵׁם רְשָׁעִים יִרְקָב״. מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֶּאֱהַל עַד סְדוֹם״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאַנְשֵׁי סְדוֹם רָעִים וְחַטָּאִים לַה׳ מְאֹד״.
human_translation: From where is this matter that the Sages said: But the name of the wicked shall rot, He said to him: As it is written “But the name of the wicked shall rot.” From where in the Torah do we As it is written “And he moved his tent as far as Sodom” And it is written: “And the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked and sinful to God”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the meaning of the statement of the Sages, "The name of the wicked shall rot"? He said to him, for it is written: "And the name of the wicked shall rot." Do we derive this from the Torah? As it is written: "And he pitched his tent as far as Sodom," and it is written: "Now the people of Sodom were wicked and sinful before the Lord exceedingly." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: צַדִּיק דָּר בֵּין שְׁנֵי רְשָׁעִים וְלֹא לָמַד מִמַּעֲשֵׂיהֶם, רָשָׁע דָּר בֵּין שְׁנֵי צַדִּיקִים וְלֹא לָמַד מִמַּעֲשֵׂיהֶם. צַדִּיק דָּר בֵּין שְׁנֵי רְשָׁעִים וְלֹא לָמַד מִמַּעֲשֵׂיהֶם — עוֹבַדְיָה. רָשָׁע דָּר בֵּין שְׁנֵי צַדִּיקִים וְלֹא לָמַד מִמַּעֲשֵׂיהֶם — זֶה עֵשָׂו.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: a righteous person lived between two wicked people and did not learn from their actions; a wicked person lived between two righteous people and did not learn from their actions. A righteous person lived between two wicked people and did not learn from their actions Obadiah, A wicked person who lived between two righteous people and did not learn from their actions is Esau,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: A righteous person who lives among two wicked individuals and does not learn from their deeds, a wicked person who lives among two righteous individuals and does not learn from their deeds. A righteous person who lives among two wicked individuals and does not learn from their deeds - this is Ovadyah. A wicked person who lives among two righteous individuals and does not learn from their deeds - this is Esau.

hebrew_text: (אָמַר) רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִבִּרְכָתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים אַתָּה לָמֵד קְלָלָה לָרְשָׁעִים, וּמִקִּלְלָתָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים אַתָּה לָמֵד בְּרָכָה לַצַּדִּיקִים. מִבִּרְכָתָן שֶׁל צַדִּיקִים אַתָּה לָמֵד קְלָלָה לָרְשָׁעִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי יְדַעְתִּיו לְמַעַן אֲשֶׁר יְצַוֶּה וְגוֹ׳״, וּכְתִיב בָּתְרֵיהּ: ״וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ זַעֲקַת סְדוֹם וַעֲמוֹרָה כִּי רָבָּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: From the blessing of the righteous you infer a curse for the wicked; and from the curse of the wicked you infer a blessing for the righteous. From the blessing of the righteous you infer a curse for the wicked, as it is written “For I have known him to the end that he will command and it is written thereafter: “The cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is very great”
llm_translation: (He said) Rabbi Elazar: From the blessing of the righteous you learn a curse for the wicked, and from the curse of the wicked you learn a blessing for the righteous. From the blessing of the righteous you learn a curse for the wicked, as it is written: "For I have known him, to the end that he may command his children and his household after him, and they may keep the way of the Lord" (Genesis 18:19), and it is written afterwards: "And the Lord said, 'The outcry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great'" (Genesis 18:20).

hebrew_text: וּמִקִּלְלָתָן שֶׁל רְשָׁעִים אַתָּה לָמֵד בְּרָכָה לַצַּדִּיקִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאַנְשֵׁי סְדוֹם רָעִים וְחַטָּאִים לַה׳. וַה׳ אָמַר אֶל אַבְרָם אַחֲרֵי הִפָּרֶד לוֹט מֵעִמּוֹ״. (אָמַר) רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁבִיל צַדִּיק אֶחָד עוֹלָם נִבְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּרְא אֱלֹהִים אֶת הָאוֹר כִּי טוֹב״, וְאֵין טוֹב אֶלָּא צַדִּיק, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִמְרוּ צַדִּיק כִּי טוֹב״.
human_translation: from the curse of the wicked you infer a blessing for the righteous, as it is written: “And the men of Sodom were wicked and sinful to God” “And God said to Abram, after that Lot had separated from him” Rabbi Elazar said: Even for one righteous world is created, as it is stated: “And God saw the light, that it was good” and good means nothing other than righteous, as it is stated: “Say of the righteous that he is good”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And from the curse of the wicked you shall learn blessing for the righteous, as it is written: "And the men of Sodom were evil and sinful before the Lord exceedingly." And the Lord said to Abram after Lot had separated from him. Rabbi Elazar said: Even for the sake of one righteous person the world was created, as it is said: "And God saw the light, that it was good," and there is no good but the righteous, as it is said: "Say, the righteous is good."

hebrew_text: (אָמַר) רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: כׇּל הַמְשַׁכֵּחַ דָּבָר מִתַּלְמוּדוֹ — גּוֹרֵם גָּלוּת לְבָנָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתִּשְׁכַּח תּוֹרַת אֱלֹהֶיךָ אֶשְׁכַּח בָּנֶיךָ גַּם אָנִי״. רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר: מוֹרִידִין אוֹתוֹ מִגְּדוּלָּתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי אַתָּה הַדַּעַת מָאַסְתָּ וְאֶמְאָסְךָ מִכַּהֵן לִי״.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who causes himself to forget a matter of his studies causes exile for his children, as it is stated: “Because you have forgotten the Torah of your God, I will also forget your children” Rabbi Abbahu said: one reduces him from his prominence, as it is stated: “Because you have rejected knowledge, I will also reject you; you shall not serve Me”
llm_translation: (He said) Rabbi Elazar: Anyone who forgets a matter from his learning — causes exile to his children, as it is said: "And you have forgotten the Torah of your God, I will also forget your children." Rabbi Avahu said: They degrade him from his greatness, as it is said: "Since you have rejected knowledge, I will also reject you from being a priest to Me."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֵין צַדִּיק נִפְטָר מִן הָעוֹלָם עַד שֶׁנִּבְרָא צַדִּיק כְּמוֹתוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזָרַח הַשֶּׁמֶשׁ וּבָא הַשָּׁמֶשׁ״. עַד שֶׁלֹּא כָּבְתָה שִׁמְשׁוֹ שֶׁל עֵלִי, זָרְחָה שִׁמְשׁוֹ שֶׁל שְׁמוּאֵל הָרָמָתִי. (אָמַר) רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: רָאָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁצַּדִּיקִים מוּעָטִין, עָמַד וּשְׁתָלָן בְּכׇל דּוֹר וָדוֹר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לַה׳ מְצוּקֵי אֶרֶץ וַיָּשֶׁת עֲלֵיהֶם תֵּבֵל״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: No righteous person departs from this world until another comparable righteous person is created, as it is stated: “And the sun rises and the sun sets” Before the sun of Eli was extinguished, the sun of Samuel of Ramah shone Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, saw that righteous people were few, He arose and planted them in each and every generation As it is stated: “For the pillars of the earth are the Lord’s, and He has set the world upon them”
llm_translation: Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A righteous person does not depart from the world until another righteous person like him is created, as it is stated: "And the sun rises and the sun sets." Before the sun of Eli had set, the sun of Samuel the Ramathite had risen. Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The Holy One, blessed be He, saw that righteous individuals were few, so He arose and planted them in every generation, as it is stated: "For the Lord watches over the ways of the righteous, and their inheritance shall be forever."

hebrew_text: (אָמַר) רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁבִיל צַדִּיק אֶחָד הָעוֹלָם מִתְקַיֵּים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְצַדִּיק יְסוֹד עוֹלָם״. רַבִּי חִיָּיא דִּידֵיהּ אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״רַגְלֵי חֲסִידָיו יִשְׁמוֹר״ — חֲסִידָיו טוּבָא מַשְׁמַע! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: חֲסִידוֹ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even for one righteous person the world exists, as it is stated: “But the righteous is the foundation of the world” Rabbi Ḥiyya himself said: from here, “He will keep the feet of His pious ones” “pious ones” indicates many Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: is written His pious one”;
llm_translation: (He said) Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Even for the sake of one righteous person the world endures, as it is stated: "And the righteous is the foundation of the world." Rabbi Chiya his colleague said from here: "The steps of his pious ones He guards" - His pious ones, it implies something good! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: His pious one is written.

hebrew_text: (אָמַר) רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצְאוּ רוֹב שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם וְלֹא חָטָא — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹטֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רַגְלֵי חֲסִידָיו יִשְׁמוֹר״, דְּבֵי רַבִּי שֵׁילָא אָמְרִי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁבָּאָה לְיָדוֹ דְּבַר עֲבֵירָה פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה וְאֵינוֹ חוֹטֵא — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ חוֹטֵא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״רַגְלֵי חֲסִידָיו יִשְׁמוֹר״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Once most of a person’s years have passed and he did not sin, he will never sin, as it is stated: “He will keep the feet of His pious ones” the school of Rabbi Sheila they say: Once a sinful act presents itself a first time and a second, and he does not sin, he will never sin, as it is stated: “He will keep the feet of His pious ones”
llm_translation: (He said) Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said Rabbi Yochanan: Once the years of a person's life have passed and he has not sinned, he will no longer sin, as it is stated: "The steps of his pious ones He guards." The school of Rabbi Sheila say: Once a matter of transgression comes into his hand the first and second time, and he does not sin, he will no longer sin, as it is stated: "The steps of his pious ones He guards."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם לַלֵּצִים הוּא יָלִיץ וְלַעֲנָוִים יִתֶּן חֵן״, בָּא לִטַּמֵּא — פּוֹתְחִין לוֹ. בָּא לִטָּהֵר — מְסַיְּיעִין אוֹתוֹ. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: מָשָׁל לְאָדָם שֶׁהָיָה מוֹכֵר נֵפְטְ וַאֲפַרְסְמוֹן,
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: What is which is written: “If it concerns the scorners, He scorns them, but to the humble He gives grace” comes to impurify, they open comes to purify, they assist him. the school of Rabbi Yishmael it was taught comparable to a man who was selling naphtha [ neft ], balsam,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said, what is the meaning of what is written: "He mocks the mockers, but gives grace to the humble"? If one comes to become impure - they open for him. If one comes to become pure - they assist him. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: It is likened to a person who was selling naphtha and sulfur,

hebrew_text: בָּא לִמְדּוֹד נֵפְטְ, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: מְדוֹד אַתָּה לְעַצְמְךָ. בָּא לִמְדּוֹד אֲפַרְסְמוֹן, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: הַמְתֵּן לִי עַד שֶׁאֶמְדּוֹד עִמְּךָ, כְּדֵי שֶׁנִּתְבַּסֵּם אֲנִי וְאַתָּה.
human_translation: comes to measure naphtha, says to him: Measure for yourself, comes to measure balsam, says to him: Wait for me until I measure with you, so that you and I will be perfumed.
llm_translation: He came to learn from Nephtet, he says to him: "You are Nephtet to yourself." He came to learn from Apharsemon, he says to him: "Wait for me until I learn with you, so that I and you may be sealed."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: עֲבֵירָה מְטַמְטֶמֶת לִבּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלֹא תִטַּמְּאוּ בָּהֶם וְנִטְמֵתֶם בָּם״, אַל תִּקְרֵי ״וְנִטְמֵאתֶם״, אֶלָּא: ״וְנִטַּמְטֵם״.
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yishmael it was taught: Sin stupefies the heart of a person as it is stated: “And do not impurify yourselves with them, so that you should not be thereby impurified” Do not read “And be impurified [ venitmetem ]”; rather, And your be stupefied venitamtem ].
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: A transgression causes a person's heart to become sealed, as it is stated: "And you shall not defile yourselves with them, and you shall become defiled through them." Do not read it as "and you shall become defiled," rather read it as "and you shall become sealed."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״(אַל) תִטַּמְּאוּ בָּהֶם וְנִטְמֵתֶם בָּם״, אָדָם מְטַמֵּא עַצְמוֹ מְעַט — מְטַמְּאִין אוֹתוֹ הַרְבֵּה. מִלְּמַטָּה — מְטַמְּאִין אוֹתוֹ מִלְּמַעְלָה. בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — מְטַמְּאִין אוֹתוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And do not impurify yourselves with them, so that you should not be thereby impurified”; a person who impurifies himself a bit, they impurify him greatly. below, they impurify him above, in this world, they impurify him in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "(Do) not defile yourselves with them, and you will be defiled by them." If a person defiles himself a little - they defile him much. From below - they defile him from above. In this world - they defile him for the world to come.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהִתְקַדִּשְׁתֶּם וִהְיִיתֶם קְדוֹשִׁים״, אָדָם מְקַדֵּשׁ עַצְמוֹ מְעַט — מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ הַרְבֵּה, מִלְּמַטָּה — מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ מִלְּמַעְלָה, בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה — מְקַדְּשִׁין אוֹתוֹ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא.
human_translation: the Sages taught “Sanctify yourselves and you will be sanctified” a person sanctifies himself a bit, they sanctify him greatly. below, they sanctify him above. in this world, they sanctify him in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And you shall sanctify yourselves and be holy," a person sanctifies himself a little - they sanctify him much, from below - they sanctify him from above, in this world - they sanctify him for the world to come.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ אָמַר לָהֶם הַמְמוּנֶּה
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Hadrin alach amar lahem hamemunah English translation: "We will return to you," he said to them, "the trusted one."

hebrew_text: טָרַף בְּקַלְפִּי , וְהֶעֱלָה שְׁנֵי גוֹרָלוֹת, אֶחָד כָּתוּב עָלָיו ״לַשֵּׁם״, וְאֶחָד כָּתוּב עָלָיו ״לַעֲזָאזֵל״. הַסְּגָן בִּימִינוֹ, וְרֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב מִשְּׂמֹאלוֹ. אִם שֶׁל שֵׁם עָלָה בִּימִינוֹ — הַסְּגָן אוֹמֵר לוֹ: אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, הַגְבַּהּ יְמִינְךָ. וְאִם שֶׁל שֵׁם עָלָה בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ — רֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב אוֹמֵר לוֹ: אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, הַגְבַּהּ שְׂמֹאלְךָ.
human_translation: would mix in the receptacle and draw two lots Upon one was written: For God. And upon one was written: For Azazel. The deputy to right, and the head of the patrilineal family to his left. If for the name came up in his right the Deputy would say to him: My master, High Priest, raise your right And if name came up in his left the head of the patrilineal family would say to him: My master, High Priest, raise your left
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If it was torn in its membrane, and he brought up two lots, one written on it "for the Name," and one written on it "for Azazel." The deputy is on his right, and the head of the household is on his left. If the lot for the Name came up on his right, the deputy says to him: "My master, High Priest, raise your right hand." And if the lot for the Name came up on his left, the head of the household says to him: "My master, High Priest, raise your left hand."

hebrew_text: נְתָנָן עַל שְׁנֵי הַשְּׂעִירִים, וְאוֹמֵר: ״לַה׳ חַטָּאת״. רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״חַטָּאת״, אֶלָּא ״לַה׳״. וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וְעַד״.
human_translation: he would place upon the two goats, And he would say: For God, a sin-offering. Rabbi Yishmael says: He need not say: a sin-offering. Rather, For God. And respond after him: Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom forever and all time.
llm_translation: They placed upon the two goats, and he says: "For the Lord, a sin offering." Rabbi Yishmael says: It was not necessary to say "sin offering," rather "for the Lord." And they respond after him: "Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom forever and ever."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ לְמָה לִי טָרַף בְּקַלְפִּי? כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִיכַּוֵּין וְלִישְׁקוֹל.
human_translation: Why do I mixed a receptacle In order that he not intentionally take
llm_translation: "Gemara: Why do I need a torn piece in my basket? So that they should not be recognizable and to lighten."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: קַלְפִּי שֶׁל עֵץ הָיְתָה, וְשֶׁל חוֹל הָיְתָה, וְאֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם.
human_translation: Rava said: receptacle was of wood and was unconsecrated, and it had enough only for two hands.
llm_translation: Rava said: It was a basket made of wood, and it was made of sand, and it only strengthens with two handles.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: בִּשְׁלָמָא אֵינָהּ מַחְזֶקֶת אֶלָּא שְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם — כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא לִיכַּוֵּין וְלִישְׁקוֹל. אֶלָּא שֶׁל חוֹל? נַקְדְּשַׁהּ! אִם כֵּן הָוֵה לֵהּ כְּלִי שָׁרֵת שֶׁל עֵץ, וּכְלִי שָׁרֵת דְּעֵץ לָא עָבְדִינַן. וְנֶעְבְּדַהּ דְּכֶסֶף, וְנֶעְבְּדַהּ דְּזָהָב? הַתּוֹרָה חָסָה עַל מָמוֹנָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Ravina strongly objects to this: Granted, had enough only for two hands. in order that he not intentionally take But unconsecrated? Let it be consecrated If so, it would be a sacred vessel of wood, and we do not make a sacred vessel from wood. let it be made of silver let it be made of gold. the Torah spared the money of the Jewish people
llm_translation: Ravina objects to this: With a peace offering, it only becomes established through two hands - so that it will not be cut and weighed. But with sand? It becomes sanctified! If so, it would be like a wooden vessel, and we do not use a wooden vessel for the service. And if it is served with silver, and if it is served with gold? The Torah has compassion on the money of Israel.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כִּי הַאי תַּנָּא דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הַסְּגָן וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל מַכְנִיסִין יָדָן בַּקַּלְפִּי, אִם בִּימִינוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל עוֹלֶה — הַסְּגָן אוֹמֵר לוֹ: אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, הַגְבַּהּ יְמִינֶךָ. וְאִם בִּימִינוֹ שֶׁל סְגָן עוֹלֶה — רֹאשׁ בֵּית אָב אוֹמֵר לוֹ לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל: דַּבֵּר מִילָּךְ.
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna was taught Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: The Deputy and the High Priest insert their hands into the receptacle. If comes up in the High Priest’s right the Deputy says to him: My master, High Priest, raise your right And if comes up in the right of the Deputy, the head of the patrilineal family says to the High Priest: Speak your word
llm_translation: Mishnah: that not like this Tanna that teaches, Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: The deputy and the high priest insert their hand into the lottery box, if the lot of the high priest comes up in his right hand — the deputy says to him: My master, high priest, raise your right hand. And if the lot of the deputy comes up in his right hand — the head of the household says to the high priest: Speak your words.

hebrew_text: וְנֵימָא לֵיהּ סְגָן? כֵּיוָן דְּלָא סָלֵיק בִּידֵיהּ חָלְשָׁא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Let the Deputy say to him. Since the lot did not come up in hand, he be discouraged
llm_translation: And it was said about him, "deputy"? Since he did not ascend with the strength of his knowledge.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: יַמִּינָא דִּסְגָן עֲדִיף מִשְּׂמָאלֵיהּ דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. וּמָר סָבַר: כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Sage, holds the Deputy’s right is preferable to the High Priest’s left And Sage, holds they are equivalent.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Master holds: the right hand of a deputy is superior to the left hand of the high priest. And Master holds: they are like Hadadezer.

hebrew_text: וּמַאן הַאי תַּנָּא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה — רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי חֲנִינָא סְגַן הַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹמֵר: לָמָּה סְגָן מִימִינוֹ — שֶׁאִם אֵירַע בּוֹ פְּסוּל בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, נִכְנָס סְגָן וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ תַּחְתָּיו.
human_translation: And who is this tanna who argues with Rabbi Yehuda? It is Rabbi Ḥanina, the Deputy of the priests, as it was taught Rabbi Ḥanina, the Deputy of the priests, says: Why Deputy at the right Because if some disqualification befalls the High Priest, the Deputy can step in and serve in his stead.
llm_translation: And who is the Tanna who disputes with regard to the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda? — Rabbi Chanina is the deputy of the priests. As it was taught: Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, says: Why is a deputy needed on his right? So that if a disqualification occurs in the High Priest, the deputy enters and serves in his place.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה שֶׁשִּׁמֵּשׁ שִׁמְעוֹן הַצַּדִּיק, הָיָה גּוֹרָל עוֹלֶה בְּיָמִין. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, פְּעָמִים עוֹלֶה בְּיָמִין פְּעָמִים עוֹלֶה בִּשְׂמֹאל. וְהָיָה לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית מַלְבִּין. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, פְּעָמִים מַלְבִּין פְּעָמִים אֵינוֹ מַלְבִּין. וְהָיָה נֵר מַעֲרָבִי דּוֹלֵק. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, פְּעָמִים דּוֹלֵק פְּעָמִים כָּבֶה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: forty years that Shimon HaTzaddik served the lot the right From then onward, sometimes it arose in the right sometimes it arose in the left the strip of crimson turned white, From then onward, it sometimes turned white sometimes it did not turn white. the western lamp would burn From then onward, it sometimes burned sometimes it went out.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Forty years Shimon the Righteous served, the lot for the Yom Kippur goat always came up in the right hand. From here on, sometimes it came up in the right hand, sometimes in the left. And the tongue of crimson wool would turn white. From here on, sometimes it would turn white, sometimes it would not. And the western lamp would stay lit. From here on, sometimes it would stay lit, sometimes it would go out.

hebrew_text: וְהָיָה אֵשׁ שֶׁל מַעֲרָכָה מִתְגַּבֵּר, וְלֹא הָיוּ כֹּהֲנִים צְרִיכִין לְהָבִיא עֵצִים לְמַעֲרָכָה, חוּץ מִשְּׁנֵי גְּזִירֵי עֵצִים כְּדֵי לְקַיֵּים מִצְוַת עֵצִים. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, פְּעָמִים מִתְגַּבֵּר פְּעָמִים אֵין מִתְגַּבֵּר, וְלֹא הָיוּ כֹּהֲנִים נִמְנָעִין מִלְּהָבִיא עֵצִים לַמַּעֲרָכָה כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: And the fire on the arrangement kept going strongly, such that the priests did not need to bring wood to the arrangement except for the two logs in order to fulfill the mitzva of wood From then onward, sometimes kept going strongly sometimes it did not, and so the priests could not avoid bringing wood to the arrangement throughout the entire day.
llm_translation: And there was a fire of the arrangement strengthening, and the priests did not need to bring wood for the arrangement, except for two bundles of wood in order to fulfill the commandment of wood. From here and onwards, sometimes it would strengthen, sometimes it would not strengthen, and the priests were not prevented from bringing wood for the arrangement the entire day.

hebrew_text: וְנִשְׁתַּלְּחָה בְּרָכָה בָּעוֹמֶר, וּבִשְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם, וּבְלֶחֶם הַפָּנִים. וְכׇל כֹּהֵן שֶׁמַּגִּיעוֹ כְּזַיִת, יֵשׁ אוֹכְלוֹ וְשָׂבֵעַ, וְיֵשׁ אוֹכְלוֹ וּמוֹתִיר. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ, נִשְׁתַּלְּחָה מְאֵירָה בָּעוֹמֶר וּבִשְׁתֵּי הַלֶּחֶם וּבְלֶחֶם הַפָּנִים, וְכׇל כֹּהֵן מַגִּיעוֹ כְּפוּל. הַצְּנוּעִין מוֹשְׁכִין אֶת יְדֵיהֶן, וְהַגַּרְגְּרָנִין נוֹטְלִין וְאוֹכְלִין. וּמַעֲשֶׂה בְּאֶחָד שֶׁנָּטַל חֶלְקוֹ וְחֵלֶק חֲבֵירוֹ, וְהָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתוֹ ״בֶּן
human_translation: And a blessing was sent upon the omer ; and to the the two loaves and to the shewbread, And each priest that received an olive-bulk there were those ate it and were satisfied, and there were those ate of it and left over From then onward, a curse was sent upon the omer , and to the two loaves, and to the shewbread, each priest received size of a bean; the discreet, ones would withdraw their hands, and the voracious ones would take and eat And an incident occurred with one who took his portion and that of his fellow, and they called him: Son of
llm_translation: And the blessing shall be removed in the omer, and in the two loaves, and in the showbread. And any priest whose portion is the size of an olive, some eat it and are satisfied, and some eat it and leave over. From here and onwards, the blessing is removed in the omer, and in the two loaves, and in the showbread, and any priest whose portion is a double. The modest ones draw back their hands, and the gluttons take and eat. And there was an incident with one who took his portion and the portion of his fellow, and they called him "Ben."

hebrew_text: חַמְצָן״ עַד יוֹם מוֹתוֹ.
human_translation: a robber [ ḥamtzan ] until the day of his death.
llm_translation: "Chamtsan" until his death day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר (בַּר) שֵׁילָא, מַאי קְרָא: ״אֱלֹהַי פַּלְּטֵנִי מִיַּד רָשָׁע מִכַּף מְעַוֵּל וְחוֹמֵץ״. רָבָא אָמַר, מֵהָכָא: ״לִמְדוּ הֵיטֵב דִּרְשׁוּ מִשְׁפָּט אַשְּׁרוּ חָמוֹץ״. אׇשְׁרוֹ חָמוֹץ — וְאַל תַּאַשְׁרוּ חוֹמֵץ.
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Sheila said: What is the verse “O, my God, rescue me out of the hand of wicked, out of the hand of the unrighteous and robbing man [ ḥometz ]” Rava said: From here: “Learn to do well, seek justice, strengthen the robbed [ ḥamotz ]” strengthen the robbed, but not strengthen the robber.
llm_translation: Rabba bar (bar) Sheilah said, what is the verse: "My God, save me from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of the unjust and ruthless." Rava said, from here: "Learn to do good, seek justice, relieve the oppressed." Seek justice - and do not seek ruthlessness.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אוֹתָהּ שָׁנָה שֶׁמֵּת בָּהּ שִׁמְעוֹן הַצַּדִּיק, אָמַר לָהֶם: בְּשָׁנָה זוֹ הוּא מֵת. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִנַּיִין אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ? אָמַר לָהֶם: בְּכׇל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים הָיָה מִזְדַּמֵּן לִי זָקֵן אֶחָד לָבוּשׁ לְבָנִים וְעָטוּף לְבָנִים, נִכְנַס עִמִּי וְיָצָא עִמִּי, וְהַיּוֹם נִזְדַּמֵּן לִי זָקֵן אֶחָד לָבוּשׁ שְׁחוֹרִים וְעָטוּף שְׁחוֹרִים, נִכְנַס עִמִּי וְלֹא יָצָא עִמִּי. אַחַר הָרֶגֶל חָלָה שִׁבְעָה יָמִים וָמֵת.
human_translation: The Sages taught: the year in which Shimon HaTzaddik died, he said to them, In this year, he will die, They said to him: How do you know? He said to them: on every Yom Kippur, I was met, by an old man who was dressed in white, and wrapped up in white, he would enter with me, and he would leave with me. But today, I was met by an old man who was dressed in black, and wrapped up in black, he entered with me, he did not leave with me. after the festival he was ill for seven days and died.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: In that year that Shimon the Righteous died, he said to them: "In this year, I will die." They said to him: "How do you know?" He said to them: "Every Yom Kippur, an old man dressed in white and wrapped in white would appear to me and depart with me, but today an old man dressed in black and wrapped in black appeared to me and did not depart with me." After the holiday, he fell ill for seven days and died.

hebrew_text: וְנִמְנְעוּ אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים מִלְּבָרֵךְ בַּשֵּׁם.
human_translation: his brethren, the priests, refrained from blessing with the name of God
llm_translation: And his brothers, the priests, are prevented from blessing in the name.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַרְבָּעִים שָׁנָה קוֹדֶם חוּרְבַּן הַבַּיִת לֹא הָיָה גּוֹרָל עוֹלֶה בְּיָמִין, וְלֹא הָיָה לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית מַלְבִּין, וְלֹא הָיָה נֵר מַעֲרָבִי דּוֹלֵק.
human_translation: The Sages taught: forty years prior to the destruction of the Temple, lot did not arise in the right the strip of crimson did not turn white, and the westernmost lamp did not burn
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Forty years before the destruction of the Temple, the lot for the scapegoat did not come up in the right hand, the crimson-colored strap did not turn white, and the westernmost lamp did not stay lit.

hebrew_text: וְהָיוּ דַּלְתוֹת הַהֵיכָל נִפְתְּחוֹת מֵאֲלֵיהֶן, עַד שֶׁגָּעַר בָּהֶן רַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי. אָמַר לוֹ: הֵיכָל הֵיכָל! מִפְּנֵי מָה אַתָּה מַבְעִית עַצְמְךָ? יוֹדֵעַ אֲנִי בְּךָ שֶׁסּוֹפְךָ עָתִיד לֵיחָרֵב, וּכְבָר נִתְנַבֵּא עָלֶיךָ זְכַרְיָה בֶּן עִדּוֹא: ״פְּתַח לְבָנוֹן דְּלָתֶיךָ וְתֹאכַל אֵשׁ בַּאֲרָזֶיךָ״,
human_translation: And the doors of the Sanctuary opened by themselves until Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai scolded them. He said to Sanctuary, Sanctuary, why do you frighten yourself I know about you that you will ultimately be destroyed, and Zechariah, son of Ido, has already prophesied concerning you: “Open your doors, O Lebanon, that the fire may devour your cedars”
llm_translation: The doors of the Sanctuary were opened by themselves, until Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai rebuked them. He said to them: Sanctuary, Sanctuary! Why do you trouble yourselves? I know about you that you are destined to be destroyed, as Zechariah ben Iddo already prophesied about you: "Open your doors, O Lebanon, that fire may devour your cedars."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בֶּן טַבְלַאי: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ לְבָנוֹן — שֶׁמַּלְבִּין עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak ben Tavlai said: Why is called Lebanon [ Levanon ]? Because it whitens [ malbin ] the Jewish people’s sins,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak ben Tablai said: Why is his name called Lebanon? Because he whitens the sins of the children of Israel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמוֹ יַעַר, דִּכְתִיב: ״בֵּית יַעַר הַלְּבָנוֹן״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: מָה יַעַר מְלַבְלֵב — אַף בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ מְלַבְלֵב. דְּאָמַר רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁבָּנָה שְׁלֹמֹה בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ, נָטַע בּוֹ כׇּל מִינֵי מְגָדִים שֶׁל זָהָב, וְהָיוּ מוֹצִיאִין פֵּירוֹת בִּזְמַנֵּיהֶן. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהָרוּחַ מְנַשֶּׁבֶת בָּהֶן הָיוּ נוֹשְׁרִין פֵּירוֹתֵיהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יִרְעַשׁ כַּלְּבָנוֹן פִּרְיוֹ״, וּמֵהֶן הָיְתָה פַּרְנָסָה לַכְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: Rav Zutra bar Toviya said: Why is called: Forest, as it is written: “The house of the forest of Lebanon” To tell you: Just as a forest blooms, so too the Temple blooms. As Rav Hoshaya said: When Solomon built the Temple, he planted in it all kinds of sweet fruit of gold, and brought forth fruit in their season. And when the wind blew upon them, their fruit would fall off, as it is stated: “May his fruits rustle like Lebanon” And through there was a source of income for the priesthood.
llm_translation: Rav Zutra Bar Toviya said: Why is his name called Ya'ar (forest)? As it is written: "The house of the forest of Lebanon," to tell you: Just as a forest makes things white, so too the Temple makes things white. For Rav Hoshaya said: When Solomon built the Temple, he planted in it all kinds of golden fruit trees, and they would produce fruit in their seasons. And when the wind would blow upon them, they would shake off their fruits, as it is said: "The cedars of Lebanon shall shake off their fruit," and from them the priesthood was sustained.

hebrew_text: וְכֵיוָן שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ גּוֹיִם לַהֵיכָל יָבְשׁוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפֶרַח לְבָנוֹן אוּמְלָל״. וְעָתִיד הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְהַחְזִירָהּ לָנוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״פָּרוֹחַ תִּפְרַח וְתָגֵל אַף גִּילַת וְרַנֵּן כְּבוֹד הַלְּבָנוֹן נִתַּן לָהּ״.
human_translation: But once the nations entered the Sanctuary withered, as it states “And the blossoms of Lebanon wither” And in the future the Holy One, Blessed be He, will restore to us as it is stated: “It shall blossom abundantly, it shall also rejoice and shout, the glory of Lebanon will be given to it”
llm_translation: And when the nations entered the Temple, it became desolate, as it is stated: "And the flower of Lebanon withers." But the Holy One, blessed be He, will restore it to us, as it is stated: "It shall blossom abundantly and rejoice, even with joy and singing; the glory of Lebanon shall be given to it."

hebrew_text: נְתָנָן עַל שְׁנֵי הַשְּׂעִירִים. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֶשֶׂר פְּעָמִים מַזְכִּיר כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל אֶת הַשֵּׁם בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם: שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּוִידּוּי רִאשׁוֹן, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בְּוִידּוּי שֵׁנִי, וּשְׁלֹשָׁה בְּשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, וְאֶחָד בַּגּוֹרָלוֹת.
human_translation: places upon the two goats. the Sages taught The High Priest mentions the name ten times on that day: Three during the first confession; and three during the second confession, and three the scapegoat and one with the lots,
llm_translation: They placed upon the two goats. The Rabbis taught: Ten times the High Priest mentions the Name on it on that day: Three in the first confession, and three in the second confession, and three in the goat that is sent away, and one in the lots.

hebrew_text: וּכְבָר אָמַר ״הַשֵּׁם״, וְנִשְׁמַע קוֹלוֹ בִּירִיחוֹ. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לִירִיחוֹ עֲשָׂרָה פַּרְסָאוֹת.
human_translation: And there already said the name his voice was heard in Jericho. Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: from Jerusalem to Jericho is ten parasangs.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And as it already said "Hashem," and His voice was heard in Jericho. Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: From Jerusalem to Jericho is ten parsahs.

hebrew_text: וָצִיר דַּלְתוֹת הַהֵיכָל נִשְׁמַע בִּשְׁמוֹנָה תְּחוּמֵי שַׁבָּת. עִזִּים שֶׁבִּירִיחוֹ הָיוּ מִתְעַטְּשׁוֹת מֵרֵיחַ הַקְּטוֹרֶת. נָשִׁים שֶׁבִּירִיחוֹ אֵינָן צְרִיכוֹת לְהִתְבַּשֵּׂם מֵרֵיחַ קְטוֹרֶת. כַּלָּה שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה לְהִתְקַשֵּׁט מֵרֵיחַ קְטוֹרֶת.
human_translation: And the doors of the Sanctuary was heard eight Shabbat limits, goats that were in Jericho would sneeze from the fragrance of the incense women that were in Jericho did not need to perfume themselves, fragrance incense, a bride that was in Jerusalem did not need to adorn herself fragrance incense,
llm_translation: The pressing of the doors of the Sanctuary was heard in eight Sabbath boundaries. Goats in Jericho would become disheveled from the fragrance of the incense. Women in Jericho do not need to adorn themselves with the fragrance of incense. A bride in Jerusalem does not need to adorn herself with the fragrance of incense.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי (יוֹסֵי בֶּן) דּוּלְגַאי: עִזִּים הָיוּ לְאַבָּא בְּהָרֵי (מִכְמָר), וְהָיוּ מִתְעַטְּשׁוֹת מֵרֵיחַ הַקְּטוֹרֶת. אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אָבִין אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קׇרְחָה: סָח לִי זָקֵן אֶחָד, פַּעַם אַחַת הָלַכְתִּי לְשִׁילֹה, וְהֵרַחְתִּי רֵיחַ קְטוֹרֶת מִבֵּין כְּותָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben Dolgai said: Father had goats in the hills of Mikhmar, and they would sneeze from the fragrance of the incense. Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa said: An old man reported to me: One time I went to Shiloh, and I smelled the smell of the incense from between its walls.
llm_translation: Rabbi (Yosei ben) Dulgai said: There were goats belonging to Abba in the mountains of Michmar, and they would become disheveled from the smell of the incense. Rabbi Chiya bar Avin said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha said: I have one elderly man who told me, "Once I went to Shiloh, and I smelled the fragrance of the incense from between its walls."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: עֲלִיַּית גּוֹרָל מִתּוֹךְ קַלְפִּי — מְעַכֶּבֶת, הַנָּחָה — אֵינָהּ מְעַכֶּבֶת. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אַף עֲלִיָּיה אֵינָהּ מְעַכֶּבֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: drawing of the lot from inside the receptacle is an indispensable placing is not indispensable. And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Even drawing of the lots is not indispensable,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: The lifting of the lottery from within the basket - it delays, setting it down - does not delay. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Even the lifting does not delay.

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאָמַר: דְּבָרִים הַנַּעֲשִׂין בְּבִגְדֵי לָבָן מִבַּחוּץ לָא מְעַכְּבָא — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא מְעַכְּבָא. כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה, מַאן דְּאָמַר מְעַכְּבָא — כְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר לָא מְעַכְּבָא — הָנֵי מִילֵּי עֲבוֹדָה, הַגְרָלָה לָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, who said matters that are performed in white garments outside are not indispensable, everyone agrees that is not indispensable, When they disagree, it is in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya. The one who said is indispensable in accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya. And the one who said is not indispensable this applies to service. drawing of the lots is not service,
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: Actions done with white garments from the outside do not prevent the fulfillment of the commandment - the entire world does not dispute that it does not prevent. When do they dispute? In the school of Rabbi Nechemiah. Whoever says it prevents - is following the opinion of Rabbi Nechemiah. And whoever says it does not prevent - those matters are considered work, and casting lots is not considered work.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי,
human_translation: Some say
llm_translation: There is one who says,

hebrew_text: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה דְּאָמַר מְעַכְּבָא — כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דִּמְעַכְּבָא,
human_translation: In accordance with Rabbi Neḥemya, who said indispensable, everyone agrees that is indispensable.
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Nechemiah it was said: "Me'akva" - the entire world does not disagree that it is a delaying factor.

hebrew_text: כִּי פְּלִיגִי אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה. מַאן דְּאָמַר לָא מְעַכְּבָא — כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וּמַאן דְּאָמַר מְעַכְּבָא — שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דִּתְנָא בֵּיהּ קְרָא: ״אֲשֶׁר עָלָה״, ״אֲשֶׁר עָלָה״, תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי.
human_translation: When they disagree, it is in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, The one who said is not indispensable in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. And the one who said is indispensable it is different here, because the verse repeated “which came up” “which came up” two times.
llm_translation: When they disputed in the study hall of Rabbi Yehuda: Whoever says it does not impede - like Rabbi Yehuda, and whoever says it does impede - differs here from what was taught in it by the verse: "which ascended," "which ascended," two times.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מִצְוָה לְהַגְרִיל, וְאִם לֹא הִגְרִיל כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: raises an objection It is a mitzva to draw and if did not draw the lots is valid.
llm_translation: Challenger: It is a commandment to use a lottery, and if one did not use a lottery, it is valid.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּלָא מְעַכְּבָא, הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא.
human_translation: Granted, according to that version in which you said: In accordance with Rabbi Yehuda everyone, agrees that is not indispensable, whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: In truth, to strike the point of what you said, "Aliba d'Rabbi Yehuda, everyone does not argue, that it does not prevent," this is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְהָךְ לִישָּׁנָא דְּאָמְרַתְּ פְּלִיגִי, בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָא מְעַכְּבָא, הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא,
human_translation: But according to that version in which you said disagree granted, according to the one, who said is not indispensable, whose is this It is Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Rather, to strike the point of what you said, they disagree. Granted, according to the one who says it does not prevent, this is the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְעַכְּבָא, הָא מַנִּי? תְּנִי: מִצְוָה לְהַנִּיחַ.
human_translation: However, according to the one, who said is indispensable, whose this teach it is a mitzva to place
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says it is a hindrance, this is a contradiction? It was taught: It is a commandment to leave.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מִצְוָה לְהַגְרִיל וּלְהִתְוַדּוֹת. לֹא הִגְרִיל וְלֹא הִתְוַדָּה — כָּשֵׁר. וְכִי תֵּימָא הָכִי נָמֵי לְהַנִּיחַ, אֵימָא סֵיפָא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: לֹא הִגְרִיל — כָּשֵׁר, לֹא הִתְוַדָּה — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: Come hear It is a mitzva to draw the lots and to confess If he did not draw the lots did not confess, valid. And if you say: So too, to place say, the latter clause Rabbi Shimon says: If he does not draw the lots, it is valid. If he does not confess, it is invalid?
llm_translation: Come and hear: It is a commandment to cast lots and to confess. If one did not cast lots and did not confess - it is valid. And if you would say so, let us say the latter part, Rabbi Shimon says: If one did not cast lots - it is valid, if one did not confess - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: מַאי ״לֹא הִגְרִיל״? אִילֵּימָא לֹא הִנִּיחַ, מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר הַגְרָלָה מְעַכְּבָא, וְהָתַנְיָא: מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן, מֵבִיא חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בַּהַגְרָלָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: what He did not draw the lots? If we say he did not place by inference Rabbi Shimon holds drawing is indispensable. wasn’t it taught one of them died, is brought counterpart without drawing lots; this is the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: What is "Lo Higril"? If you say he did not cast lots, it implies that Rabbi Shimon holds that casting lots is a hindrance. And it was taught: If one of them dies, he brings his fellow without casting lots, the words of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן לָא יָדַע מַאי קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר לְהוּ: אִי הַגְרָלָה — הַגְרָלָה מַמָּשׁ קָא אָמְרִיתוּ, פְּלִיגְנָא עֲלַיְיכוּ בַּחֲדָא. אִי הַגְרָלָה דְּקָאָמְרִיתוּ הַיְינוּ הַנָּחָה — פְּלִיגְנָא עֲלַיְיכוּ בְּתַרְתֵּי.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon did not know what the Sages were saying, this is he is saying: If Drawing of the lots, you are saying actual drawing of the lots I disagree with you with regard to one if, Drawing of the lots, you are saying placing I disagree with you with regard to two
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon did not know what the Rabbis were saying, and thus he said to them: If you are talking about a literal lottery, then argue with me on one point. If you are talking about the lottery of rest, then argue with me on two points.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: פַּר מְעַכֵּב אֶת הַשָּׂעִיר,
human_translation: Come hear the bull disqualifies the goat,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A bull that impedes the goat,

hebrew_text: וְשָׂעִיר אֵין מְעַכֵּב אֶת הַפָּר בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: the goat does not disqualify the bull; applies to the applications inside
llm_translation: "And a goat does not prevent the cow in the gifts that are inside."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא פַּר מְעַכֵּב אֶת הַשָּׂעִיר: דְּאִי אַקְדְּמֵיהּ לְשָׂעִיר מִקַּמֵּי פַּר — לָא עֲבַד וְלֹא כְּלוּם. אֶלָּא שָׂעִיר אֵין מְעַכֵּב אֶת הַפָּר — מַאי נִיהוּ?
human_translation: Granted, the bull disqualifies the goat that if he advanced of the goat ahead of the bull, he has not performed anything at all. However, the goat does not disqualify the bull what is it
llm_translation: In truth, a bull impedes a he-goat. For if one were to precede a he-goat before a bull - it would not work and would not be effective. Rather, a he-goat does not impede a bull - what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אִילֵּימָא דְּאִי אַקְדֵּים מַתָּנוֹת דְּפַר בַּהֵיכָל מִקַּמֵּי מַתָּנוֹת דְּשָׂעִיר בִּפְנִים — ״חוּקָּה״ כְּתִיב בְּהוּ.
human_translation: If we say that if one advanced applications of the bull in the Sanctuary ahead of the applications of the goat inside “statute” is written concerning
llm_translation: The first opinion, that if one sets aside offerings of a bull in the Temple before setting aside offerings of the goat inside - "statute" is written with a "vav."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לָאו, דְּאַקְדֵּים מַתָּנוֹת דְּפַר בִּפְנִים מִקַּמֵּי הַגְרָלָה. וּמִדְּסִדְרָא לָא מְעַכְּבָא — (עִיקְרָא) הַגְרָלָה נָמֵי לָא מְעַכְּבָא!
human_translation: Rather, is it not one advanced applications of the bull inside ahead of drawing from sequencing is not indispensable, drawing itself is also not indispensable.
llm_translation: Rather, no, for one establishes gifts of a bull inside before the lottery. And from the order, it does not delay - the essence of the lottery does not delay!

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּאַקְדֵּים מַתָּנוֹת דְּפַר בְּמִזְבֵּחַ מִקַּמֵּי מַתָּנוֹת דְּשָׂעִיר בַּהֵיכָל, וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, דְּאָמַר: דְּבָרִים הַנַּעֲשִׂין בְּבִגְדֵי לָבָן בַּחוּץ — לָא מְעַכְּבִי.
human_translation: No, one advanced applications of the bull upon the altar ahead of the applications of the goat in the Sanctuary And is Rabbi Yehuda, who said: Matters that are performed in white garments outside are not indispensable.
llm_translation: Not, that we establish gifts of a bull on the altar before gifts of a goat in the sanctuary, and Rabbi Yehuda, that is, said: matters that are done in white garments outside - do not delay.

hebrew_text: וְהָא בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים קָתָנֵי!
human_translation: But didn’t teach applies to applications inside
llm_translation: And this, in the gifts that are inside, it is taught!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּאָמַר: הַגְרָלָה לָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: Rather, whose is this It is Rabbi Shimon, who said: drawing is not indispensable.
llm_translation: Rather: this is the teaching of Rabbi Shimon, as he said: "A lottery does not delay."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא, וּנְהִי דִּכְסִדְרָא לָא מְעַכְּבָא — הַגְרָלָה מִיהָא מְעַכְּבָא.
human_translation: And if you wish, say: Actually, is Rabbi Yehuda. Granted, that sequencing is not indispensable; drawing nevertheless indispensable.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "Indeed, it is always Rabbi Yehudah, and since it is not in order, it does not delay - a lottery does not delay it."

hebrew_text: וְאָזְדוּ לְטַעְמַיְיהוּ, דְּתַנְיָא:
human_translation: And follow their reasoning, as it was taught
llm_translation: And they went to their reasons, as it was taught:

hebrew_text: ״יׇעֳמַד חַי לִפְנֵי ה׳ לְכַפֵּר עָלָיו״, עַד מָתַי יִהְיֶה זָקוּק לַעֲמוֹד חַי? עַד שְׁעַת מַתַּן דָּמוֹ שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: עַד שְׁעַת וִידּוּי דְּבָרִים.
human_translation: shall be stood alive before the Lord, to make atonement over him, Until when required to stand alive? Until the time of the application of the blood of its counterpart, this is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: until the time of the verbal confession
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "A live animal shall stand before the Lord to atone for him," how long must the live animal be fit to stand? Until the time of the offering of the blood of his fellow - the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: Until the time of verbal confession.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״לְכַפֵּר״ — בְּכַפָּרַת דָּמִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְכִלָּה מִכַּפֵּר אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ״. מָה לְהַלָּן — בְּכַפָּרַת דָּמִים, אַף כָּאן — בְּכַפָּרַת דָּמִים, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? As it was taught “to make atonement” The verse speaks of atonement through blood And similarly it states: “When he has made an end of atoning for the Sanctuary, Just as there to atonement through blood, so too here atonement through blood. This is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? As it was taught: "For atonement" - the Scripture speaks of atonement with blood, as it also says: "And he shall make atonement for the holy place." Just as there - with atonement through blood, so too here - with atonement through blood, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״לְכַפֵּר עָלָיו״, בְּכַפָּרַת דְּבָרִים הַכָּתוּב מְדַבֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: “To make atonement over it”; the verse speaks of atonement through speech,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "To atone for him," in the atonement of words the Scripture speaks.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: עָלָה בִּשְׂמֹאל, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּחֲזוֹר לְיָמִין? אָמַר לָהֶן: אַל תִּתְּנוּ מָקוֹם לַמִּינִין לִרְדּוֹת.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Akiva’s students asked him: was drawn by left what is he may transfer to right He said to them: Do not give the heretics an opportunity to dominate.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema, sha'alu talmidav et Rabbi Akiva: alah bismol, mah shi'yachazor leyamin? Amar lahem: al titnu makom laMinin lirdot." English translation: "Come and hear, his students asked Rabbi Akiva: If one goes to the left, should he return to the right? He said to them: Do not give a place for the heretics to rebel."

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּאַל תִּתְּנוּ מָקוֹם לַמִּינִין לִרְדּוֹת, הָא לָאו הָכִי מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ, וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ הַגְרָלָה מְעַכְּבָא, וְכֵיוָן דִּקְבַעְתֵּיהּ שְׂמֹאל הֵיכִי מַהְדְּרִינַן לֵיהּ?
human_translation: The reason so as not to give heretics an opportunity to dominate, not for this transfer Didn’t you say the drawing is indispensable? And, once left how could we transfer
llm_translation: Reason for do not give place to the heretics to rule, this not so we honor him, and this you said lottery delays, and since you established it left how we honor him?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמְרִי: עָלָה הַגּוֹרָל בִּשְׂמֹאל, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּחֲזִירוּ לוֹ וְלִשְׂעִירוֹ לְיָמִין. אָמַר לָהֶם: אַל תִּתְּנוּ מָקוֹם לַמִּינִין לִרְדּוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said: This is are saying: the lot was drawn by left what is he may transfer it, and its goat to right He said to them: Do not give the heretics an opportunity to dominate.
llm_translation: Rava said, thus they are saying: The lot came up on the left, what should they return to it and to its counterpart on the right. He said to them: Do not give a place for the heretics to rule.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר: ״אֶת הַשָּׂעִיר אֲשֶׁר עָלָיו״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר יַנִּיחֶנּוּ עָלָיו, — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עָלָה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָלָה שׁוּב אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: Come hear If had stated “The goat upon which I would have said he place upon it. the verse states: it came up” once has come up it is not necessary more,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ta shema: ilu ne'emar: 'et hasa'ir asher alav', hayiti omer yanicheinu alav, — Talmud lomar: 'alah', keivan she'alah shuv einu tzarich." English translation: "Come and hear: If it were stated: 'the goat that is upon it,' I would say that it should be left upon it, — the Scripture teaches: 'it shall ascend,' once it has ascended, it is no longer necessary."

hebrew_text: לְמַאי? אִילֵימָא לְמִצְוָה, מִכְלָל דַּהֲנָחָה מִצְוָה נָמֵי לָא? אֶלָּא לָאו, לְעַכֵּב. וּשְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: הַגְרָלָה מְעַכְּבָא, הַנָּחָה — לָא מְעַכְּבָא!
human_translation: To what If we say as a mitzva, by inference, the placement not even a mitzva. Rather, is it not indispensable? And conclude from it drawing is indispensable, the placement is not indispensable.
llm_translation: For what? If you say it is for the sake of a commandment, is it not included in the category of a commandment of rest as well? Rather, no, it is to delay. And learn from it: Casting lots delays, resting does not delay!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אִילּוּ נֶאֱמַר ״אֲשֶׁר עָלָיו״, הָיִיתִי אוֹמֵר יַנִּיחֶנּוּ עָלָיו עַד שְׁעַת שְׁחִיטָה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר עָלָה״, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָלָה שׁוּב אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ.
human_translation: Rava said: this is what is saying: If had stated “The goat upon which I would have said he should place upon until the time of its slaughter. the verse states: it came up,” once has come up it is not necessary more,
