llm_translation: Rava said, thus he said: If it had said "that is upon it," I would say leave it upon it until the time of slaughter, Scripture states: "that goes up," once it has gone up, it is no longer necessary.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״, הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֵׂהוּ חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֵׂהוּ חַטָּאת.
human_translation: Come hear and he shall offer it for a sin-offering” the lottery makes it a sin-offering, the status does not make it a sin-offering.
llm_translation: "Come and hear: 'And he shall make it a sin offering,' the lot makes it a sin offering, but the Name does not make it a sin offering."

hebrew_text: שֶׁיָּכוֹל, וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל — קִידֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם, מְקוֹם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם?
human_translation: might Is there not an a fortiori inference Just as in a case in which a lottery does not consecrate the required status does consecrate them, a case in which a lottery does consecrate is it not right that the required status should consecrate them?
llm_translation: The text reads: "That he is able, and is it not the law: And what in a place where he did not sanctify the lot - he sanctified the Name, in a place where he sanctified the lot, is it not the law that he should sanctify the Name?"

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״, הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת.
human_translation: the verse states,
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall make it a sin offering," the lot makes it a sin offering, and the Name does not make it a sin offering.

hebrew_text: סְתָם סִיפְרָא מַנִּי — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וְקָא תָנֵי: הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת. אַלְמָא הַגְרָלָה מְעַכְּבָא, תְּיוּבְתָּא דְּמַאן דְּאָמַר הַגְרָלָה לָא מְעַכְּבָא. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: Who is anonymous Sifra ? Rabbi Yehuda. And teaches: The lottery makes it a sin-offering, the status does not make it a sin-offering. Apparently, the lottery is indispensable. refutation of the one who says that the lottery is not indispensable, is a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Stam sifra mani - Rabbi Yehuda, v'ka tanei: Ha'goral oseh chatat, v'ein hashem oseh chatat. Alma hagralah me'akva, teyuvta d'man de'amar hagralah la me'akva. Teyuvta."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵין הַקִּינִּין מִתְפָּרְשׁוֹת אֶלָּא אוֹ בִּלְקִיחַת בְּעָלִים, אוֹ בַּעֲשִׂיַּית כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Nests, become designated only Either upon the owner’s taking or upon the priest’s performance
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The laws of kinyan are only explained either in the acquisition of owners, or in the actions of a priest.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלָקְחָה״ ״וְעָשָׂה״. אוֹ בִּלְקִיחָה, אוֹ בַּעֲשִׂיָּיה.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: What is the reason of Rav Ḥisda? As it is written “And she shall take “And offer either upon taking or upon performance
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashei said: What is the reason for Rav Chisda's statement, as it is written: "and he shall take" "and he shall make." Either through taking, or through making.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״, הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת.
human_translation: raises an objection “And offer it for a sin-offering” the lottery makes it a sin-offering, the status does not make it a sin-offering.
llm_translation: Challenger: "And he shall make it a sin offering," the lot makes it a sin offering, and the Name does not make it a sin offering.

hebrew_text: שֶׁיָּכוֹל, וַהֲלֹא דִּין הוּא: וּמָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל — קִידֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם, מְקוֹם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם?!
human_translation: as might Is there not an a fortiori inference: Just as in a case in which a lottery does not consecrate the required status does consecrate them, a case in which a lottery does consecrate is it not right that the required status should consecrate them?
llm_translation: He is able, and isn't this the law: And what in a case where he did not sanctify the lot - he sanctified the Name, in a place where he sanctified the lot, is it not the law that he should sanctify the Name?!

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״, הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת.
human_translation: the verse states: “He shall make it a sin-offering” the lottery makes it a sin-offering, but the status does not make it a sin-offering.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall make it a sin offering," the lot makes it a sin offering, and the Name does not make it a sin offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דְּלָאו שְׁעַת לְקִיחָה וְלָאו שְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה הִיא, וְקָתָנֵי דְּקָבַע!
human_translation: But here, which is neither the time of taking nor the time of performing teaches establish
llm_translation: And here, where it is not the time for acquisition but it is not the time for action, and it is taught that he established!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: מָה בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁלֹּא קִידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת לְקִיחָה, וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה — קִידֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם בִּשְׁעַת לְקִיחָה וּבִשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה, מְקוֹם שֶׁקִּידֵּשׁ הַגּוֹרָל שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת לְקִיחָה וְשֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה, אֵינוֹ דִּין שֶׁיְּקַדֵּשׁ הַשֵּׁם בִּשְׁעַת לְקִיחָה וּבִשְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה?
human_translation: Rava said: This is what is saying: Just as in a case in which a lottery does not consecrate even at the time of taking or at the time of performing the required status does consecrate them at the time of taking or at the time of performing a case in which a lottery does consecrate neither at the time of taking nor at the time of performing is it not right that the required status should consecrate them, at the time of taking or at the time of performing
llm_translation: Rava said, thus he said: What in a place where he did not sanctify the lot, even at the time of taking, and even at the time of performing - he sanctified the Name at the time of taking and at the time of performing, a place where he sanctified the lot not at the time of taking and not at the time of performing, is it not the law that he should sanctify the Name at the time of taking and at the time of performing?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשָׂהוּ חַטָּאת״, הַגּוֹרָל עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת, וְאֵין הַשֵּׁם עוֹשֶׂה חַטָּאת.
human_translation: the verse states: “He shall make it a sin-offering” the lottery makes it a sin-offering, but the status does not make it a sin-offering.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall make it a sin offering." The lot makes it a sin offering, and the Name does not make it a sin offering.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: מְטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ עָנִי, וְהִפְרִישׁ מָעוֹת לְקִינּוֹ וְהֶעֱשִׁיר, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמַר: אֵלּוּ לְחַטָּאתוֹ, וְאֵלּוּ לְעוֹלָתוֹ —
human_translation: Come hear a poor person who ritually impurified the Temple, and he set aside money for his nests and he became wealthy, and afterward, said these are for his sin-offering and those are for his burnt-offering.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who renders impure the sanctuary of a poor person, and separates coins for his nest egg and for charity, and then says: "These are for his sin offering, and these are for his burnt offering" —

hebrew_text: מוֹסִיף וּמֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִדְּמֵי חַטָּאתוֹ, וְאֵין מוֹסִיף וּמֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִדְּמֵי עוֹלָתוֹ.
human_translation: adds and brings his obligation from the money for his sin-offering, he may not add and bring his obligation from the money for his burnt-offering.
llm_translation: Continues and brings his obligation from the money of his sin-offering, and one does not continue and bring his obligation from the money of his burnt offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָא הָכָא, דְּלָאו שְׁעַת לְקִיחָה וְלָאו שְׁעַת עֲשִׂיָּיה הִיא, וְקָתָנֵי דְּקָבַע!
human_translation: But here, which is neither the time of taking nor the time of performing And teaches establish
llm_translation: And here, where it is not the time for acquisition but it is not the time for action, and it is taught that he established!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: וְתִסְבְּרָא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: מְטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ עָשִׁיר וְהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי — לֹא יָצָא, וְכֵיוָן דְּלֹא יָצָא הֵיכִי קָבַע?
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: But can you understand Didn’t Rabbi Elazar say Rabbi Hoshaya said: A wealthy person who ritually impurifies the Temple and brings offering a poor does not fulfill Since he does not fulfill how establish
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: And is it to be assumed? But didn't Rabbi Elazar say in the name of Rabbi Hoshaya: If one renders impure a rich person's consecrated item and brings a sacrifice of a poor person - he has not fulfilled his obligation. And since he has not fulfilled his obligation, how can he establish it?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מַאי אִית לָךְ לְמֵימַר — שֶׁכְּבָר אָמַר מֵעֲנִיּוּתוֹ, הָכָא נָמֵי — שֶׁכְּבָר אָמַר מִשְּׁעַת הַפְרָשָׁה.
human_translation: Rather, what have you to say That he had already said while in his impoverished state. Here also, that he had already said at the time of setting aside
llm_translation: Rather, what do you have to say? — That he already said it out of his poverty, here too — that he already said it from the time of the separation.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי חַגָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה, דְּאָמַר יָצָא,
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Ḥaga, said Rabbi Yoshiya said does fulfill
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Chagga, Rabbi Yoshiyah said, as Rabbi Yoshiyah said: "He has fulfilled his obligation."

hebrew_text: מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? לָא תֵּימָא: וְאַחַר כָּךְ אָמַר, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: וְאַחַר כָּךְ לָקַח וְאָמַר.
human_translation: what can be said? Do not say afterward he said. Rather, say afterward he took, and said.
llm_translation: What is there to say? Do not say: "And afterwards he said," rather say: "And afterwards he took and said."

hebrew_text: לָקַח, מוֹסִיף וּמֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מַאי נִיהוּ?!
human_translation: taken adds and brings his obligation what does it taken
llm_translation: He took, added, and brought his obligation - what is it?!

hebrew_text: דְּפָרֵיק לֵיהּ. וְהָא אֵין פִּדְיוֹן לָעוֹף!
human_translation: which he redeemed But there is no redemption for a bird,
llm_translation: He broke it. But there is no redemption for birds!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּגוֹן שֶׁלָּקַח פְּרֵידָה אַחַת, אִי עוֹלָה זְבַן — מוֹסִיף וּמֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִדְּמֵי חַטָּאתוֹ, וְהַאי עוֹלָה אָזְלָא לִנְדָבָה. אִי חַטָּאת זְבַן — אֵין מוֹסִיף וּמֵבִיא חוֹבָתוֹ מִדְּמֵי עוֹלָתוֹ, וְהַאי חַטָּאת אָזְלָא לְמִיתָה.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: where he took one bird. If he purchased burnt-offering, add and bring his obligation from the money for his sin-offering. And this burnt-offering, goes toward a free-will offering. if he purchased sin-offering, cannot add and bring his obligation from the money for his burnt-offering. And this sin-offering, goes to death,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: For example, if one took a single bird offering, if it was intended for a burnt offering, he adds and brings its obligation from the money of his sin offering, and this burnt offering goes for a voluntary offering. If it was intended for a sin offering, he does not add and bring its obligation from the money of his burnt offering, and this sin offering goes for death.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: מְטַמֵּא מִקְדָּשׁ עָשִׁיר וְהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי — לֹא יָצָא. וְרַבִּי חַגָּא אָמַר רַבִּי הוֹשַׁעְיָא: יָצָא.
human_translation: the itself, Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Hoshaya said: A wealthy person who ritually impurifies the Temple, and brings offering a poor he does not fulfill Rabbi Ḥaga said Rabbi Hoshaya said: He does fulfill
llm_translation: Body. Rabbi Elazar said Rabbi Hoshaya: One who defiles a rich sanctuary and brings a poor offering - he has not fulfilled his obligation. And Rabbi Chagga said Rabbi Hoshaya: He has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מְצוֹרָע עָנִי שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָשִׁיר — יָצָא, עָשִׁיר שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי — לֹא יָצָא. שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״זֹאת״.
human_translation: raises an objection A poor leper who brings offering a wealthy person fulfills A wealthy person who brings offering a poor person does not fulfill It is different there, as it is written: “This
llm_translation: Challenger: A poor metzora who brought a rich offering - he has fulfilled his obligation; a rich person who brought a poor offering - he has not fulfilled his obligation. The case is different there, as it is written: "This."

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, רֵישָׁא נָמֵי! הָא רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״תּוֹרַת״, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״תּוֹרַת״, לְרַבּוֹת מְצוֹרָע עָנִי שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָשִׁיר. יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ עָשִׁיר שֶׁהֵבִיא קׇרְבַּן עָנִי — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זֹאת״.
human_translation: If so, the first clause, also The Merciful One includes “The law of” As it was taught “The law of” in order to include a poor leper who brought offering a wealthy might even a wealthy who brought offering a poor person the verse states “this”
llm_translation: If so, the beginning is also! Here, Rabbi Rachmana "Torah," and it was taught: "Torah," to include a poor metzora who brought a rich offering. One might have thought even a rich person who brought a poor offering - Scripture teaches: "This."

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִינַּהּ! מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״וְאִם דַּל הוּא״.
human_translation: And let us derive from the Merciful One excludes “If he be poor”
llm_translation: And let us differentiate! The Merciful One is sparing "and if he is poor."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ קָשַׁר לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית בְּרֹאשׁ שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, וְהֶעֱמִידוֹ כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית שִׁילּוּחוֹ, וְלַנִּשְׁחָט — כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית שְׁחִיטָתוֹ.
human_translation: tied a strip of crimson upon the head of the scapegoat and positioned opposite the place from which it was dispatched, and the slaughtered, opposite place of its slaughter.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: One ties the tongue of the scapegoat at the top of the cliff that it is pushed from, and stands it opposite the chamber of kindling, and to slaughter it — opposite the chamber of its slaughter.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל פָּרוֹ שְׁנִיָּה, וְסוֹמֵךְ שְׁתֵּי יָדָיו עָלָיו וּמִתְוַדֶּה, וְכָךְ הָיָה אוֹמֵר: אָנָא הַשֵּׁם! (חָטָאתִי עָוִיתִי וּפָשַׁעְתִּי) לְפָנֶיךָ אֲנִי וּבֵיתִי וּבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן עַם קְדוֹשֶׁךָ. אָנָא הַשֵּׁם! כַּפֶּר נָא לָעֲוֹנוֹת וְלַפְּשָׁעִים וְלַחֲטָאִים שֶׁעָוִיתִי וְשֶׁפָּשַׁעְתִּי וְשֶׁחָטָאתִי לְפָנֶיךָ אֲנִי וּבֵיתִי וּבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן עַם קְדוֹשֶׁךָ, כַּכָּתוּב בְּתוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה עַבְדֶּךָ: ״כִּי בַיּוֹם הַזֶּה יְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיכֶם לְטַהֵר אֶתְכֶם מִכֹּל חַטֹּאתֵיכֶם לִפְנֵי ה׳ תִּטְהָרוּ״, וְהֵן עוֹנִין אַחֲרָיו: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וְעַד״.
human_translation: He comes next to his bull a second and places his two hands upon it, and confesses. And this is what he would say: Please God, I have sinned, I have done wrong, I have rebelled before You, I and my family and the children of Aaron, your sacred people. Please God, grant atonement, please, for the sins, and for the wrongs, and for the rebellions that I have sinned, and done wrong, and rebelled before You, I, and my family, and the children of Aaron, your sacred people, as it is written in the Torah of Moses, your servant: “For on this day atonement shall be made for you to cleanse you And they, respond after him Blessed be the name of His glorious kingdom forever and all time.
llm_translation: He came to his bull a second time, and leaning his two hands upon it, he would confess, saying: "Please, Hashem! (I have sinned, I have done wrong, and I have transgressed) before You, I and my house, and the sons of Aaron, Your holy people. Please, Hashem! Atoned now for the iniquities, the transgressions, and the sins that I have sinned, that I have done wrong, and that I have sinned before You, I and my house, and the sons of Aaron, Your holy people, as it is written in the Torah of Your servant Moses: 'For on this day He will atone for you to cleanse you from all your sins before Hashem, you shall be cleansed,' and they respond after him: 'Blessed be the name of the glory of His kingdom forever and ever.'

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: ״וְלַנִּשְׁחָט״ — אַקְּשִׁירָה קָאֵי, אוֹ אַהַעֲמָדָה קָאֵי?
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before them: And the slaughtered one referring to tying Or, referring to positioning
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara inquires: "And for slaughter" - is it standing or is it leaning?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנֵי רַב יוֹסֵף: קָשַׁר לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית בְּרֹאשׁ שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, וְהֶעֱמִידוֹ כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית שִׁילּוּחוֹ, וְלַנִּשְׁחָט — כְּנֶגֶד בֵּית שְׁחִיטָתוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא יִתְעָרֵב זֶה בָּזֶה, וְלֹא יִתְעָרֵב בַּאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: Come hear that Rav Yosef taught: He ties a strip of crimson to the head of the scapegoat and positions it opposite the place from which it will be sent; and to the slaughtered one, opposite its place of slaughter. So that each cannot become mixed up with the other and cannot become mixed up with other
llm_translation: Come and hear, as taught by Rav Yosef: The tongue of the scapegoat is tied to a post of cedar that is planted, and it is placed opposite the chamber of the lottery, and for slaughter — opposite its slaughterhouse, so that one should not mix with the other, and not mix with others.

hebrew_text: אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא אַקְּשִׁירָה קָאֵי — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ אַהַעֲמָדָה קָאֵי, נְהִי דִּבְחַבְרֵיהּ לָא מִיעָרַב, דְּהַאי קְטִיר בֵּיהּ וְהַאי לָא קְטִיר בֵּיהּ, בְּאַחֲרִינֵי מִיהַת מִיעָרַב! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ אַקְּשִׁירָה קָאֵי. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Granted, if you say is referring tying, well. But, if you say it is referring positioning granted, cannot be mixed up with its counterpart, since this one, has tied to it, and that one, does not have tied to it. However, could be mixed up with other Rather, not conclude from it is referring to tying? learn from it
llm_translation: If you say it is standing in the form of a harp - it is beautiful. But if you say it is standing in the form of a pillar, even though they are not mixed together, for this one emits fragrance and that one does not emit fragrance, in the end, will they not mix together? Rather, no, understand from it that it is standing in the form of a harp. Understand from it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שְׁתֵּי לְשׁוֹנוֹת שָׁמַעְתִּי, אַחַת שֶׁל פָּרָה, וְאַחַת שֶׁל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ. אַחַת צְרִיכָה שִׁיעוּר, וְאַחַת אֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה שִׁיעוּר. וְלָא יָדַעְנָא הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: I heard two one of the heifer and one of the scapegoat. One requires amount, and one does not require amount. But I do not know which of them
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Two languages I have heard, one of a cow and one of a goat that is being milked. One requires a specific measurement, and one does not require a specific measurement. And I do not know which is which.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, נִיחְזֵי אֲנַן: שֶׁל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ דְּבָעֵי חֲלוּקָּה — בָּעֵי שִׁיעוּר, וְשֶׁל פָּרָה דְּלָא בָּעֵי חֲלוּקָּה — לָא בָּעֵי שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: Let us see of the scapegoat, which requires division, requires amount of the heifer does not require division, does not require amount.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, "We hold: the tail of a he-goat that requires division - requires measurement, and the tail of a cow that does not require division - does not require measurement."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: דְּפָרָה נָמֵי בָּעֵי כּוֹבֶד! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: כּוֹבֶד — תַּנָּאֵי הִיא.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama strongly objects to this: of the heifer also requires weight, Rava said to him: is tanna’im ,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Challenged him Ramei bar Ḥama: A cow also requires a liver! Rava said to him: Liver - it is taught in a Mishnah.

hebrew_text: וּדְפָרָה לָא בָּעֵי חֲלוּקָּה?! אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה, כּוֹרְכָן בִּשְׁיָרֵי לָשׁוֹן! אֵימָא, בִּזְנַב לָשׁוֹן.
human_translation: of the red heifer does not require division? Abaye raised an objection to How does he perform He wraps with the remnants of the strip say: with the tail end
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Does a cow not require division?! Abaye raised an objection: How does one do it? He ties them with strands of wool! I would say, with a tongue's tail.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָנִין אָמַר רַב: עֵץ אֶרֶז וּשְׁנִי תּוֹלַעַת שֶׁקְּלָטָתַן שַׁלְהֶבֶת — כְּשֵׁרָה. מֵיתִיבִי: נִתְהַבְהֵב הַלָּשׁוֹן — מֵבִיא לָשׁוֹן אַחֵר וּמְקַדֵּשׁ!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanin said Rav said: the cedar wood and the strip of crimson were caught by the flame it is valid. raises an objection was singed he brings another strip and sanctifies it
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanin said in the name of Rav: A cedar wood and a scarlet wool, when their flame is taken - it is valid. The question was raised: If the tongue is inflamed - it brings another tongue and sanctifies!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן בְּקוֹלַחַת, כָּאן בְּנִכְפֶּפֶת.
human_translation: Abaye said: This is not difficult: Here, with blazes high. There, with blazes low,
llm_translation: Abbaye said, it is not difficult: here with a spoon, here with a ladle.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אוֹמֵר: כּוֹבֶד תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: לָמָּה כּוֹרְכָן — כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כּוּלָּן בַּאֲגוּדָּה אַחַת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא בָּהֶן כּוֹבֶד, וְיִפְּלוּ לְתוֹךְ שְׂרֵיפַת הַפָּרָה.
human_translation: Rava said: weight is tanna’im , as it was taught Why he wrap So that they will all be in a single bundle this is the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: So that they will have weight and fall into the burning heifer.
llm_translation: Rava says: It is a weighty teaching. As it was taught: Why do they tie them? - So that they all be in one bundle, the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: So that they have weight in them, and fall into the ashes of the heifer's burning.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שָׁלֹשׁ לְשׁוֹנוֹת שָׁמַעְתִּי, אַחַת שֶׁל פָּרָה, וְאַחַת שֶׁל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, וְאַחַת שֶׁל מְצוֹרָע. אַחַת מִשְׁקַל עֲשָׂרָה זוּז, וְאַחַת מִשְׁקַל שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים, וְאַחַת מִשְׁקַל שֶׁקֶל, וְאֵין לִי לְפָרֵשׁ.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yoḥanan: I heard three One of the heifer, and one of the scapegoat, and one of the leper. One weight of ten zuz ; and one weight of two sela , and one weight of a shekel, but I cannot explain
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yochanan said: "I have heard three languages: one of a cow, one of a goat that is being stoned, and one of a leper. One language is worth ten zuz, one language is worth two sela'im, and one language is worth a shekel, and I do not have an explanation."

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, פֵּירְשַׁהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן,
human_translation: When Ravin came he explained in the name of Rabbi Yonatan
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he explained it in the name of Rabbi Yonatan,

hebrew_text: שֶׁל פָּרָה — מִשְׁקַל עֲשָׂרָה זוּז, וְשֶׁל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ — מִשְׁקַל שְׁנֵי סְלָעִים, וְשֶׁל מְצוֹרָע — מִשְׁקַל שֶׁקֶל.
human_translation: of the heifer weight ten zuz ; and of the scapegoat weight of two sela , and of the leper weight of a shekel,
llm_translation: Of a cow - a weight of ten zuz, and of a goat that is being redeemed - a weight of two sela, and of a leper - a weight of a shekel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פְּלִיגִי בַּהּ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן חֲלַפְתָּא וְרַבָּנַן בְּפָרָה, חַד אָמַר: מִשְׁקַל עֲשָׂרָה, וְחַד אָמַר: מִשְׁקַל שֶׁקֶל. וְסִימָנָיךְ: ״אֶחָד הַמַּרְבֶּה וְאֶחָד הַמַּמְעִיט״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan Rabbi Shimon ben Ḥalafta and the Rabbis disagree of heifer. One said: weight of ten And one said: weight of one shekel. And your mnemonic both the one who gives much and the one who gives little
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Shimon ben Chalfta and the Rabbis disagree regarding the case of a cow. One said: "Weigh ten," and one said: "Weigh a shekel." And your mnemonic is: "One who increases and one who decreases."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה מִדִּיפְתִּי לְרָבִינָא: לָא בְּפָרָה פְּלִיגִי, אֶלָּא בְּשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ פְּלִיגִי. וְהָהוּא יוֹמָא נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַבְיָא בַּר קִיסִי, וְאַנְּחוּ בַּהּ סִימָנָא: רַבְיָא [בַּר] קִיסִי מְכַפֵּר כְּשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya of Difti said to Ravina: not with regard to the heifer they disagree; rather, with regard to the scapegoat they disagree. And on that day Ravya bar Kisi and they made a mnemonic out of it, Ravya bar Kisi atones like the scapegoat,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Yirmeya, from Difti to Ravina: Not regarding a cow do they dispute, rather regarding a goat that grazes. And that day was a restful one for Rabbiya bar Qisi, and a sign was given in it: Rabbiya bar Qisi atones like a goat that grazes.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: שְׁתֵּי שְׁחִיטוֹת שָׁמַעְתִּי, אַחַת שֶׁל פָּרָה, וְאַחַת שֶׁל פָּרוֹ. אַחַת כְּשֵׁרָה בְּזָר, וְאַחַת פְּסוּלָה בְּזָר, וְלָא יָדַעְנָא הֵי מִינַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: I heard two slaughters: One of the heifer, and one of the bull one is valid by a non-priest, and one is invalid by a non-priest. But I do not know which of them
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Two slaughters I have heard, one of a cow, and one of a bull. One valid by a non-priest, and one invalid by a non-priest, and I do not know which is which.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: שְׁחִיטַת פָּרָה וּפָרוֹ, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. חַד אָמַר: פָּרָה פְּסוּלָה, פָּרוֹ כְּשֵׁרָה. וְחַד אָמַר: פָּרוֹ פְּסוּלָה, פָּרָה כְּשֵׁרָה.
human_translation: was stated: slaughter of the heifer and the bull Rav and Shmuel: One said: heifer is invalid, bull is valid. And one said: His bull is invalid, heifer is valid.
llm_translation: It was stated: The slaughtering of a cow and its calf, Rav and Shmuel. One said: The cow is invalid, the calf is valid. And one said: The calf is invalid, the cow is valid.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַב הוּא דְּאָמַר פָּרָה פְּסוּלָה, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: שְׁחִיטַת פָּרָה בְּזָר פְּסוּלָה, וְאָמַר רַב עֲלַהּ: ״אֶלְעָזָר״ וְ״חוּקָּה״ שָׁנִינוּ בָּהּ.
human_translation: Conclude it is Rav who said the heifer is invalid, as Rabbi Zeira said: The slaughter of the heifer by a non-priest is invalid. And Rav said concerning this we learned in “Elazar “statute”
llm_translation: It was completed according to Rav who said a disqualified cow, as Rabbi Zeira said: the slaughtering of a cow by a non-priest is disqualified, and Rav said: "Eleazar" and "Chukka" we learned from it.

hebrew_text: וְרַב, מַאי שְׁנָא פָּרָה — דִּכְתִיב ״אֶלְעָזָר״ וְ״חוּקָּה״, פָּרוֹ נָמֵי — הָא כְּתִיב ״אַהֲרֹן״ וְ״חוּקָּה״!
human_translation: And Rav, what is different heifer, that, it is written “Elazar” and “statute.” the bull it is also written “Aaron” “statute”
llm_translation: Rav, what is the difference between a cow - for it is written "Elazar" and "chukah," it is similar to a cow - here it is written "Aharon" and "chukah"!

hebrew_text: שְׁחִיטָה לָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא. אִי הָכִי פָּרָה נָמֵי! שָׁאנֵי פָּרָה, דְּקׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת הִיא.
human_translation: slaughtering is not service; If so, heifer also heifer is different. of consecrated for Temple maintenance,
llm_translation: Slaughter is not service. If so, a cow also! It is different, a cow, consecrated in the Temple is.

hebrew_text: וְלָאו כָּל דְּכֵן הוּא? אָמַר רַב שִׁישָׁא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב אִידִי: מִידֵּי דְּהָוֵה אַמַּרְאוֹת נְגָעִים, דְּלָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא וּבָעֲיָא כְּהוּנָּה.
human_translation: is it not an a fortiori inference, Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: just as in appearances of leprosy, which, not service, require the priesthood.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And is it not so entirely? Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: Because it is a matter of identifying skin afflictions, which is not considered service and requires priesthood."

hebrew_text: וְלִשְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר פָּרוֹ פְּסוּלָה, מַאי שְׁנָא פָּרוֹ — דִּכְתִיב: ״אַהֲרֹן״ וְ״חוּקָּה״, פָּרָה נָמֵי — הָא כְּתִיב: ״אֶלְעָזָר״ וְ״חוּקָּה״? שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשָׁחַט אוֹתָהּ לְפָנָיו״, שֶׁיְּהֵא זָר שׁוֹחֵט וְאֶלְעָזָר רוֹאֶה.
human_translation: And to Shmuel, who said the bull is invalid, what is different his bull that, it is written “Aaron,” and “statute,” heifer it is also written: “Elazar” and “statute” It is different there as it is written: “And he shall slaughter it before him” that it could be a non-priest slaughters and Elazar watches.
llm_translation: To Samuel, who said: "A cow that is disqualified, what is the difference between this cow and that cow?" — for it is written: "Aaron" and "statute," a cow also. But is it not written: "Eleazar" and "statute"? There it is different, for it is written: "And he shall slaughter it before him," that a non-priest may slaughter it and Eleazar may supervise.

hebrew_text: וְרַב: שֶׁלֹּא יַסִּיחַ דַּעְתּוֹ מִמֶּנָּה. וּשְׁמוּאֵל, שֶׁלֹּא יַסִּיחַ דַּעְתּוֹ מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ: מִ״וְּשָׂרַף אֶת הַפָּרָה לְעֵינָיו״.
human_translation: And Rav, that he should not divert his attention from And from where does Shmuel, that he should not divert his attention He derives it “And he shall burn the heifer in his sight”
llm_translation: Rav: that he should not distract his mind from it. And Shmuel, should he not distract his mind from it? It has been derived for him: "And he burned the cow before his eyes."

hebrew_text: וְרַב: חַד בִּשְׁחִיטָה וְחַד בִּשְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: And Rav one with regard to slaughtering, and one with regard to burning.
llm_translation: And Rav: one in slaughter and one in burning.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בִּשְׁחִיטָה — מִשּׁוּם דִּתְחִילַּת עֲבוֹדָה הִיא, אֲבָל שְׂרֵיפָה — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בִּשְׂרֵיפָה — מִשּׁוּם דְּהַשְׁתָּא הוּא דְּמִתַּכְשְׁרָא פָּרָה, אֲבָל שְׁחִיטָה — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary since, if the Merciful One had written it with regard to slaughtering, because it is the start of the service; but burning, I could say no, necessary And if the Merciful One had written with regard to burning, because it is now that heifer is being made ready but slaughtering, I could say no, necessary
llm_translation: The matter is, if the Merciful One wrote regarding slaughter - because it is the beginning of the service, but regarding burning - I might say no, it is necessary. And if the Merciful One wrote regarding burning - because it is the time when the cow becomes fit, but regarding slaughter - I might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? אִילֵּימָא לְמַעוֹטֵי אֲסִיפַת אֶפְרָהּ וּמִילּוּי מַיִם לְקִידּוּשׁ,
human_translation: to exclude what If we say, to exclude gathering its ashes and filling the water for sanctification,
llm_translation: To what does "l'ma'otei mai" refer? If you say it refers to the exclusion of the gathering of its ashes and the pouring of water for sanctification,

hebrew_text: ״לְמִשְׁמֶרֶת לְמֵי נִדָּה״ כְּתִיב. אֶלָּא לְמַעוֹטֵי הַשְׁלָכַת עֵץ אֶרֶז וְאֵזוֹב וּשְׁנִי תוֹלָעַת, דְּלָאו גּוּפַהּ דְּפָרָה נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: shall be kept for a water of sprinkling” was written, Rather, to exclude casting the cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the strip of crimson as they do not the heifer itself.
llm_translation: "Regarding 'for the purification of impurity of menstruation,' it is written. Rather, to exclude the throwing of cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson wool, for they are not its essence, but rather the body of the cow."

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: שְׁחִיטַת פָּרָה בְּזָר, רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר: כְּשֵׁרָה, וְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא אָמַר: פְּסוּלָה. עוּלָּא אָמַר: כְּשֵׁרָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ: פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: was stated the slaughter of the heifer by a non-priest: Rabbi Ami said: valid. And Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: It is invalid. Ulla said: It is valid, some say It is invalid.
llm_translation: It was stated: The slaughter of a cow by a non-Jew. Rabbi Ammi said: It is valid, and Rabbi Yitzchak Napacha said: It is invalid. Ulla said: It is valid, and some say: It is invalid.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בַּר אַבָּא לְסַיּוֹעֵיהּ לְרַב: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא הַזָּאַת מֵימֶיהָ שֶׁאֵין כְּשֵׁרִין בָּאִשָּׁה כְּבָאִישׁ, וְאֵין כְּשֵׁרִין אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua bar Abba raised an objection providing a support Rav, I have only the sprinkling of waters, that they are not valid by a woman as when by a man, and that is valid only during the day.
llm_translation: Rebbe Yehoshua bar Abba raised an objection to support Rav: I have only this to offer in support, that there is no validity in a woman like in a man, and validity is only during the day.

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִין לְרַבּוֹת שְׁחִיטָתָהּ וְקַבָּלַת דָּמָהּ וְהַזָּאַת דָּמָהּ וּשְׂרֵיפָתָהּ וְהַשְׁלָכַת עֵץ אֶרֶז וְאֵזוֹב וּשְׁנִי תוֹלָעַת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תּוֹרָה״. יָכוֹל שֶׁאֲנִי מְרַבֶּה אַף אֲסִיפַת אֶפְרָהּ וּמִילּוּי מַיִם וְקִידּוּשׁ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״זֹאת״.
human_translation: From where to include Its slaughter; and collection of its blood; and sprinkling of its blood; and its burning; and casting of cedar wood, and hyssop, and strip of crimson The verse states: “Law” might I should include even the collection of its ashes, and the filling of waters, and the sanctification. the verse states: this
llm_translation: From where do we derive to include its slaughtering, receiving its blood, sprinkling its blood, burning it, and throwing cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson wool - all as part of the purification process? The Torah says: "Torah." One might think to also include the gathering of its ashes, mixing with water, and sanctification - the Torah says: "This."

hebrew_text: וּמָה רָאִיתָ לְרַבּוֹת אֶת אֵלּוּ, וּלְהוֹצִיא אֶת אֵלּוּ? אַחַר שֶׁרִיבָּה הַכָּתוּב וּמִיעֵט, אָמְרַתְּ: הֲרֵי אָנוּ לְמֵדִין כּוּלָּן מֵהַזָּאַת מֵימֶיהָ, מָה הַזָּאַת מֵימֶיהָ אֵינָן כְּשֵׁרִין בָּאִשָּׁה כְּבָאִישׁ, וְאֵין כְּשֵׁרִין אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם — אַף אֲנִי אָבִיא שְׁחִיטָתָהּ וְקַבָּלַת דָּמָהּ, וְהַזָּאַת דָּמָהּ וּשְׂרֵיפָתָהּ, וְהַשְׁלָכַת עֵץ אֶרֶז וְאֵזוֹב וּשְׁנִי תוֹלָעַת
human_translation: And what did you see to include these and to exclude those? After that the verse includes and excludes you should say Indeed, we learn all from the sprinkling of its waters: Just as the sprinkling of its waters is not valid by a woman when by a man, and it is valid only during the day, so too I will include its slaughter; and the collection of its blood; and the sprinkling of its blood; and its burning; and casting of cedar wood, and hyssop, and strip of crimson.
llm_translation: And what did you see to include these, and to exclude these? After the Scripture made it stringent and limited, you say: We learn all of them from this one, what is this one that its waters are not valid in a woman like in a man, and they are only valid during the day — I too will bring its slaughter and receiving of its blood, and this one its blood and burning it, and throwing cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson wool.

hebrew_text: הוֹאִיל וְאֵין כְּשֵׁרִין בָּאִשָּׁה כְּבָאִישׁ — אֵין כְּשֵׁרִין אֶלָּא בַּיּוֹם. וּמוֹצִיא אֲנִי אֲסִיפַת אֶפְרָהּ וּמִילּוּי מַיִם וְקִידּוּשׁ, הוֹאִיל וּכְשֵׁרִין בָּאִשָּׁה כְּבָאִישׁ — כְּשֵׁרִין נָמֵי בַּיּוֹם וּבַלַּיְלָה.
human_translation: Since these are not valid by a woman when by a man, they are valid only during the day. And I exclude the collection of its ashes, and the filling of water, and the sanctification, since these are valid by a woman as when by a man, are valid both during the day and during the night.
llm_translation: Since there are no valid offerings in a woman like in a man - they are valid only during the day. And I maintain that the gathering of her ashes, the filling of water, and the sanctification of the ashes are valid, since offerings in a woman are like in a man - they are valid both during the day and at night.

hebrew_text: וְהַאי מַאי תְּיוּבְתָּא? אִילֵּימָא מִדִּפְסוּלִין בָּאִשָּׁה פְּסוּלִין נָמֵי בְּזָר, הַזָּאַת מֵימֶיהָ תּוֹכִיחַ, שֶׁפְּסוּלִין בָּאִשָּׁה וּכְשֵׁרִין בְּזָר!
human_translation: And what is the challenge from this If we say that that are invalid by a woman they are also invalid by a non-priest, let sprinkling the waters serve as a proof because invalid by a woman and valid by a non-priest.
llm_translation: And this, what is its relevance? If you say that those who are disqualified in the case of a woman are also disqualified in the case of a non-priest, this water will prove it, for they are disqualified in the case of a woman and permitted in the case of a non-priest!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הַיְינוּ תְּיוּבְתֵּיהּ: אִשָּׁה מַאי טַעְמָא? ״אֶלְעָזָר״ — וְלֹא אִשָּׁה, זָר נָמֵי: ״אֶלְעָזָר״ — וְלֹא זָר.
human_translation: Abaye said: This is the challenge: a woman, what is the reason “Elazar,” and not a woman. also a non-priest: “Elazar,” and not a non-priest.
llm_translation: Abaye said, "This is its explanation: What is the reason for a woman? 'Elazar' — and not a woman, only a stranger: 'Elazar' — and not a stranger."

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: כׇּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כּוּלָּהּ, מַשְׁמָע מוֹצִיא מִיַּד מַשְׁמָע, וּמַשְׁמָע מִמֵּילָא.
human_translation: Ulla said: the entire passage implied preclude implied implied on their own
llm_translation: Ula said: The entire parashah, all of it, the implication is derived from the implication, and the implication from the inference.

hebrew_text: ״וּנְתַתֶּם אוֹתָהּ אֶל אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן״ — אוֹתָהּ לְאֶלְעָזָר, וְלֹא לְדוֹרוֹת לְאֶלְעָזָר. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: לְדוֹרוֹת בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: לְדוֹרוֹת בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: “And you shall give it to Elazar the priest that to Elazar, generations not to Elazar, Some say: In generations, by High Priest. And some say: In generations, by a common priest.
llm_translation: "And you shall give it to Eleazar the priest" - it to Eleazar, and not to generations for Eleazar. There are those who say: for generations in a high priest, and there are those who say: for generations in a common priest.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְדוֹרוֹת בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — שַׁפִּיר. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְדוֹרוֹת בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, מְנָא לֵיהּ? גָּמַר ״חוּקָּה״ ״חוּקָּה״ מִיּוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who says in generations by a common priest, well, But according to the one who says in generations by the High Priest, from where He derives from Yom Kippur “statute” “statute”
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says that for generations a commoner may serve as a priest — it is fine. But according to the one who says that for generations only a high priest may serve, how does he derive it? He learns it from the repetition of the word "statute" in the context of the Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: ״וְהוֹצִיא אוֹתָהּ״ — שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא אַחֶרֶת עִמָּהּ. כְּדִתְנַן: לֹא הָיְתָה פָּרָה רוֹצָה לָצֵאת — אֵין מוֹצִיאִין עִמָּהּ שְׁחוֹרָה, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ שְׁחוֹרָה שָׁחֲטוּ. וְאֵין מוֹצִיאִין עִמָּהּ אֲדוּמָּה, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ שְׁתַּיִם שָׁחֲטוּ. רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: לֹא מִן הַשֵּׁם הוּא זֶה, אֶלָּא מִשּׁוּם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אוֹתָהּ״, לְבַדָּהּ.
human_translation: “And he shall take it out he should not take out another with it. As we learned the heifer did not want to go out we do not take out a black with it so that people will not say that they slaughtered the black And we do not take out red with it, so that people will not say they slaughtered two Rabbi says: This is not for reason, rather it is due to that it is stated “It,”
llm_translation: "And he shall bring her out" - that he should not bring out another with her. As we have learned: If the cow did not want to go out - they do not bring out a black one with her, so they should not say they slaughtered a black one. And they do not bring out a red one with her, so they should not say they slaughtered two. Rabbi says: It is not from the name itself, but because it is stated: "her," alone.

hebrew_text: וְתַנָּא קַמָּא: הָא כְּתִיב ״אוֹתָהּ״? מַאן תַּנָּא קַמָּא — רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא, דְּדָרֵישׁ טַעְמֵיהּ דִּקְרָא. מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ,
human_translation: And the first tanna, is it written “it”? Who is the first tanna ? It is Rabbi Shimon, who interprets the rationale in the verse what between them? The between them is
llm_translation: And it was taught in the first Tanna: It is written "her"? Who is the first Tanna? - Rabbi Shimon, who expounds the reasons of the verse. What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them,

hebrew_text: דְּאַפֵּיק חֲמוֹר בַּהֲדַהּ.
human_translation: where one took out a donkey with it.
llm_translation: He took out a donkey in secret.

hebrew_text: ״וְשָׁחַט אוֹתָהּ״ — שֶׁלֹּא יִשְׁחוֹט אַחֶרֶת עִמָּהּ. ״לְפָנָיו״, לְרַב — שֶׁלֹּא יַסִּיחַ דַּעְתּוֹ מִמֶּנָּה, לִשְׁמוּאֵל — שֶׁיְּהֵא זָר שׁוֹחֵט וְאֶלְעָזָר רוֹאֶה.
human_translation: “And he shall slaughter it,” that no other should be slaughtered with it. “Before him”; according to Rav, that he should not divert his attention from it. According to Shmuel, that a non-priest can slaughter and Elazar observes.
llm_translation: "And he shall slaughter it" - that he should not slaughter another with it. "Before him" - according to Rav, that he should not divert his attention from it; according to Shmuel, that a non-priest should slaughter and Eleazar should supervise.

hebrew_text: ״וְלָקַח אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן מִדָּמָהּ בְּאֶצְבָּעוֹ״, לִשְׁמוּאֵל — לְאַהֲדוֹרֵיהּ לְאֶלְעָזָר. לְרַב — הָוֵי מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט, וְאֵין מִיעוּט אַחַר מִיעוּט אֶלָּא לְרַבּוֹת, דַּאֲפִילּוּ כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: “And Elazar the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger” According to Shmuel, to return it to Elazar, According to Rav, this is a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression, And a restrictive expression following a restrictive expression only to amplify that even a common
llm_translation: "And Eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with his finger," to Shmuel - for his generation, for Eleazar. To Rav - it is to be understood as one exclusion after another exclusion, and an exclusion after an exclusion is only to include, for even a common priest.

hebrew_text: ״וְלָקַח הַכֹּהֵן עֵץ אֶרֶז וְאֵזוֹב וּשְׁנִי תוֹלָעַת״, לִשְׁמוּאֵל — דַּאֲפִילּוּ בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. לְרַב — אִצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא: כֵּיוָן דְּלָאו גּוּפַהּ דְּפָרָה נִינְהוּ, לָא לִיבְעֵי כֹּהֵן, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: “And the priest shall take cedar wood, and hyssop, and a strip of crimson” According to Shmuel, even a common priest According to Rav, is necessary enter your mind to say since do not the heifer itself, they do not require a priest teaches us
llm_translation: "The priest shall take cedar wood, hyssop, and crimson yarn" - according to Shmuel, even a non-priest. According to Rav, it is necessary, as your mind would say: since they are not the body of the cow, the priest is not required, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: ״וְכִבֶּס בְּגָדָיו הַכֹּהֵן״ — בְּכִיהוּנּוֹ. ״וְטָמֵא הַכֹּהֵן עַד הָעָרֶב״ — כֹּהֵן בְּכִיהוּנּוֹ לְדוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: “Then the priest shall wash his clothes” in his priestly “And the priest shall be impure until evening” in generations in his priestly
llm_translation: "And he shall wash his garments, the priest" - in his priesthood. "And the priest shall be unclean until evening" - a priest in his priesthood for generations.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְדוֹרוֹת בְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — שַׁפִּיר, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לְדוֹרוֹת בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, הַשְׁתָּא כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל בָּעֵינַן, בְּכִיהוּנּוֹ מִיבַּעְיָא?! אִין, מִילְּתָא דְּאָתְיָא בְּקַל וְחוֹמֶר — טָרַח וְכָתַב לַהּ קְרָא.
human_translation: well according to the one who said for generations by a common priest. But according to the one who said for generations by a High Priest, now that we require the High Priest, is necessary in his priestly Yes, a matter that be derived by an a fortiori inference, the verse unnecessarily writes it
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says that for generations a commoner may serve as a priest - it is fine, but for the one who says that for generations a high priest may serve, now we require a high priest, why do we need his priesthood?! No, the matter that comes with a logical inference - the verse has exerted itself and written it.

hebrew_text: ״וְאָסַף אִישׁ טָהוֹר אֵת אֵפֶר הַפָּרָה וְהִנִּיחַ״. ״אִישׁ״ — לְהַכְשִׁיר אֶת הַזָּר, ״טָהוֹר״ — לְהַכְשִׁיר אֶת הָאִשָּׁה, ״וְהִנִּיחַ״ — מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ דַּעַת לְהַנִּיחַ, יָצְאוּ חֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן שֶׁאֵין בָּהֶן דַּעַת לְהַנִּיחַ.
human_translation: “And a man who is pure shall gather up the ashes of the heifer and place them” “a man” to qualify a non-priest “pure” to qualify a woman “and place” one who has intelligence to to place excluding a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor, they do not have intelligence to to place
llm_translation: "And a man shall gather the ashes of the heifer and lay them down." "A man" - to validate the stranger, "pure" - to validate the woman, "and lay them down" - one who has the capacity to lay them down, excluding a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor who do not have the capacity to lay them down.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לְקַדֵּשׁ, חוּץ מֵחֵרֵשׁ שׁוֹטֶה וְקָטָן. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה מַכְשִׁיר בְּקָטָן, וּפוֹסֵל בְּאִשָּׁה וּבְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס.
human_translation: We learned there, Everyone qualified to sanctify except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor. Rabbi Yehuda qualifies a minor, but disqualifies a woman and a hermaphrodite.
llm_translation: We learned there: everything is valid for sanctification, except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor. Rabbi Yehuda deems a minor valid, and disqualifies a woman and an androgynos.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבָּנַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְלָקְחוּ לַטָּמֵא מֵעֲפַר שְׂרֵיפַת הַחַטָּאת״. הָנָךְ דִּפְסַלִי לָךְ בַּאֲסִיפָה — פְּסַלִי לָךְ בְּקִידּוּשׁ, וְהָנָךְ דְּאַכְשַׁרִי לָךְ בַּאֲסִיפָה — אַכְשַׁרִי לָךְ בְּקִידּוּשׁ.
human_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis, As it is written: “And they shall take for the impure of the ashes of the burning of the purification from sin, Those whom I disqualified for you for gathering I have disqualified for you for sanctification; and those whom I have qualified for you for gathering I have qualified for you sanctification.
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? — As it is written: "And they shall take for the unclean person some of the ashes of the burnt sin offering." Where you have invalidated it for you in the assembly — invalidate it for you in sanctification, and where you have validated it for you in the assembly — validate it for you in sanctification.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִם כֵּן לֵימָא קְרָא ״וְלָקַח״, מַאי ״וְלָקְחוּ״ — דַּאֲפִילּוּ קָטָן דִּפְסַלִי לָךְ הָתָם, הָכָא — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda If so, let the verse say: And he shall take. What “and they shall take”? that even a minor, who I disqualified there here, he is qualified.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda: If so, let us say the verse "and he shall take," what is "and they shall take" - for even a minor who disqualifies for you there, here - valid.

hebrew_text: אִשָּׁה מְנָא לֵיהּ? ״וְנָתַן״, וְלֹא ״וְנָתְנָה״. וְרַבָּנַן: אִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְלָקַח ... וְנָתַן״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: עַד דְּשָׁקֵיל חַד וְיָהֵיב חַד, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְלָקְחוּ״.
human_translation: From where a woman “and he shall put” and not: And she shall put. the Rabbis if the Merciful One had written: And he shall take…and he shall put, I would have said unless one takes and one puts the Merciful One writes “and they shall take”
llm_translation: A woman counts for him? "And he shall give," and not "and she shall give." And the Rabbis: If the Merciful One had written, "and he shall take... and he shall give," I would have said: Until he takes one and gives one, the Merciful One wrote: "and they shall take."

hebrew_text: וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״וְלָקְחוּ ... וְנָתְנוּ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: עַד דְּשָׁקְלִי תְּרֵי וְיָהֲבִי תְּרֵי, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״וְלָקְחוּ ... וְנָתַן״, דַּאֲפִילּוּ שָׁקְלִי תְּרֵי וְיָהֵיב חַד.
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written And they shall take…and they shall put, I would have said unless two take and two put. the Merciful One writes “and they shall take” “and he shall put” that even two take and one puts
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One had written "and they shall take... and they shall give," I would have said: until one weighs two and gives two, the Merciful One wrote: "and they shall take... and he shall give," for even if one weighs two and gives one.

hebrew_text: ״וְלָקַח אֵזוֹב וְטָבַל בַּמַּיִם אִישׁ טָהוֹר״, לְרַבָּנַן: אִישׁ וְלֹא אִשָּׁה. ״טָהוֹר״ — לְהַכְשִׁיר אֶת הַקָּטָן, וּלְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: ״אִישׁ״ — וְלֹא קָטָן, ״טָהוֹר״ — לְהַכְשִׁיר אֶת הָאִשָּׁה.
human_translation: “And a man who is pure shall take hyssop and dip it into the water” According to the Rabbis, “man” but not a woman, “pure” to qualify a minor And according to Rabbi Yehuda, man but not a minor, pure to qualify a woman
llm_translation: "And he shall take hyssop and dip it in the water, a pure man," according to the Rabbis: a man and not a woman. "Pure" — to render the minor fit, and according to Rabbi Yehuda: "man" — and not a minor, "pure" — to render the woman fit.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לְהַזּוֹת, חוּץ מִטּוּמְטוּם וְאַנְדְּרוֹגִינוֹס וְאִשָּׁה. וְקָטָן (שֶׁיֵּשׁ) בּוֹ דַּעַת, אִשָּׁה מְסַיַּעְתּוֹ וּמַזֶּה.
human_translation: raises an objection Everyone is qualified to sprinkle a person whose sexual organs are concealed [ tumtum ], and a hermaphrodite [ androginus ], and a woman. And a minor who has intelligence, a woman assist him and he sprinkles
llm_translation: Challenger: All are fit to sprinkle, except for tumtum and androgynous and a woman. And a minor (who has) understanding, a woman assists him and sprinkles.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיג רַבִּי יְהוּדָה!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda does not disagree.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda does not argue!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר מָר ״מַשְׁמָע מוֹצִיא מִיַּד מַשְׁמָע וּמַשְׁמָע מִמֵּילָא״ — פְּלִיג.
human_translation: Abaye said: Since the Master, said: implied precludes implied implied on their own disagrees
llm_translation: Abaye said: Since the Master said, "The implication of 'from the hand to the hand' is from the hand to the hand, and 'from the mouth' is from the beginning," they disagree.

hebrew_text: ״וְהִזָּה הַטָּהוֹר עַל הַטָּמֵא״. ״טָהוֹר״ מִכְּלָל שֶׁהוּא טָמֵא, לִימֵּד עַל טְבוּל יוֹם שֶׁכָּשֵׁר בְּפָרָה.
human_translation: “And the pure one shall sprinkle upon the impure” pure, by inference he was ritually impure teaches about one who immersed that day, that he is qualified in heifer.
llm_translation: "And he shall sprinkle the clean upon the unclean." "Clean" implies that it is unclean, teaching about a tevul yom that is valid for a cow.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: כִּי הֲווֹ בַּהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ בְּפָרָה, לָא מַסְּקִי מִינַּהּ אֶלָּא כְּמַאי דְּמַסֵּיק תַּעֲלָא מִבֵּי כְרָבָא. אֶלָּא אָמְרִי: ״מַשְׁמָע מוֹצִיא מִיַּד מַשְׁמָע וּמַשְׁמָע מִמֵּילָא״.
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said: When Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish analyzed of the heifer They brought up from it only as the amount that the fox brings up from a plowed field, Rather, they said that implied preclude implied implied on their own
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said: When Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish were discussing a cow, they did not conclude from it except as one who concludes a matter from the house of the wise. Rather, they said: "One who hears, let him bring forth from his hand; one who hears, let him bring forth from his mouth."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כׇּל הַשְּׁחִיטוֹת כְּשֵׁירוֹת בְּזָר, חוּץ מִשֶּׁל פָּרָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פּוֹק תְּנִי לְבָרָא: לֹא מָצִינוּ שְׁחִיטָה בְּזָר פְּסוּלָה.
human_translation: A tanna recited before Rabbi Yoḥanan: All slaughterings are valid by a non-priest, except that of heifer. Rabbi Yoḥanan said to him: Go out and teach outside We have not found a slaughtering by a non-priest invalid.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rabbi Yochanan: All slaughters are valid by a non-Jew, except for that of a cow. Rabbi Yochanan said to him: Go, teach it to the Creator: We did not find that a non-Jewish slaughter is invalid.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, לָא מִיבַּעְיָא לְתַנָּא דְּלָא צָיֵית, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ לְרַבֵּיהּ לָא צָיֵית. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יְהוֹצָדָק: שְׁחִיטַת פָּרָה בְּזָר — פְּסוּלָה. וַאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁירָה, לֹא מָצִינוּ שְׁחִיטָה שֶׁפְּסוּלָה בְּזָר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan Needless to say that he did not listen to tanna , but he did not even listen to his teacher, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: The slaughtering of the heifer by a non-priest is invalid. And I say it is valid, we have not found a slaughtering by a non-priest invalid.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan does not require the Mishna to not err, but even to his teacher he does not require it. For Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: The slaughter of a cow by a non-priest is invalid. And I say: It is valid, as we have not found a slaughter that is invalid by a non-priest.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל פָּרוֹ שְׁנִיָּה. מַאי שְׁנָא בְּוִידּוּי רִאשׁוֹן דְּלָא אָמַר: ״וּבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן עַם קְדוֹשֶׁךָ״, וּמַאי שְׁנָא בְּוִידּוּי שֵׁנִי דְּאָמַר: ״וּבְנֵי אַהֲרֹן עַם קְדוֹשֶׁךָ״?
human_translation: comes next to his bull a second What is different about the first confession which he did not say: And the children of Aaron, your sacred people, and what is different about the second confession which he said: And the children of Aaron, your sacred people?
llm_translation: He came to him to Pharaoh a second time. What is different in the first expression that he did not say, "And the sons of Aaron, the people of Your holiness," and what is different in the second expression that he said, "And the sons of Aaron, the people of Your holiness"?

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, כָּךְ הִיא מִדַּת הַדִּין נוֹתֶנֶת: מוּטָב יָבֹא זַכַּאי וִיכַפֵּר עַל הַחַיָּיב, וְאַל יָבֹא חַיָּיב וִיכַפֵּר עַל הַחַיָּיב.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: That is the attribute of justice lends Better that an innocent person should come and gain atonement on behalf of the guilty, and a guilty person should not come and gain atonement on behalf of guilty person.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Ishmael: This is the attribute of justice: It is better for the deserving to come and be acquitted, than for the guilty to come and be acquitted.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ שְׁחָטוֹ וְקִבֵּל בְּמִזְרָק אֶת דָּמוֹ, וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְמִי שֶׁהוּא מְמָרֵס בּוֹ עַל הָרוֹבֶד הָרְבִיעִי שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל, כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִקְרוֹשׁ. נָטַל מַחְתָּה וְעָלָה לְרֹאשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ, וּפִנָּה גֶּחָלִים אֵילָךְ וְאֵילָךְ, וְחוֹתֶה מִן הַמְעוּכָּלוֹת הַפְּנִימִיּוֹת, וְיָרַד וְהִנִּיחָהּ עַל הָרוֹבֶד הָרְבִיעִי שֶׁבָּעֲזָרָה.
human_translation: would slaughter and receive its blood in a bowl, and give it to the one who stirs it. on the fourth row in the Sanctuary lest it coagulate He would take a coal pan and ascend to the top of the altar and clear coals to side and to side and scoop up from the inner, consumed And he would descend and place on the fourth row in the courtyard.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He slaughtered it and received its blood in a basin, and he gave it to one who was stirring it on the fourth row in the Temple, so that it would not congeal. He took a firepan and went up to the top of the altar, and arranged the coals this way and that way, and removed the inner ashes, and descended and placed it on the fourth row in the Azarah.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיָה חוֹתֶה בְּשֶׁל כֶּסֶף וּמְעָרֶה בְּתוֹךְ שֶׁל זָהָב, וְהַיּוֹם חוֹתֶה בְּשֶׁל זָהָב וּבָהּ הָיָה מַכְנִיס.
human_translation: On every day, would scoop up of silver and pour into of gold. But this day, scoops up with of gold, and with he would bring into
llm_translation: In every day he would engrave on a silver tablet and insert it into a gold one, but today he engraved on a gold tablet and inserted it within.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם חוֹתֶה בְּשֶׁל אַרְבַּעַת קַבִּין וּמְעָרֶה לְתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין, וְהַיּוֹם חוֹתֶה בִּשְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין וּבָהּ הָיָה מַכְנִיס. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּכׇל יוֹם חוֹתֶה בְּשֶׁל סְאָה וּמְעָרֶה בְּתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין, וְהַיּוֹם חוֹתֶה בִּשְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין וּבָהּ הָיָה מַכְנִיס.
human_translation: On every day, of four kav and pours into three kav . But this day, scoops with three kav , and with it he would bring into Rabbi Yosei says On every day, of a se’a , and pours into three kav . But this day, scoops with three kav , and with it he would bring into
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Every day he would grind four kav of wheat and sift into three kav, and today he ground three kav and sifted into it. Rabbi Yosei says: Every day he would grind a se'ah of wheat and sift into three kav, and today he ground three kav and sifted into it.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה כְּבֵדָה, וְהַיּוֹם קַלָּה. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה יָדָהּ קְצָרָה, וְהַיּוֹם אֲרוּכָּה. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה זֶהָבָה יָרוֹק, וְהַיּוֹם אָדוֹם. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מְנַחֵם.
human_translation: On every day, was heavy. But this day light, On every day, its handle was short, but this day it was long On every day, it was greenish gold, but this day a red the statements of Rabbi Menaḥem.
llm_translation: In every day, her liver was heavy, and today it is light. In every day, her hand was short, and today it is long. In every day, her urine was greenish gold, and today it is red. The words of Rabbi Menachem.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם מַקְרִיב פְּרָס בְּשַׁחֲרִית וּפְרָס בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם, וְהַיּוֹם מוֹסִיף מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה דַּקָּה, וְהַיּוֹם דַּקָּה מִן הַדַּקָּה.
human_translation: On every day, sacrificed a peras , in the morning, and a peras in the afternoon, but this day adds handful On every day, was fine but this day it was superfine.
llm_translation: In every day, he brings a half a measure in the morning and a half a measure between the evenings, and today he adds a full handful. In every day it was fine, and today it is finer than fine.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם כֹּהֲנִים עוֹלִין בְּמִזְרָחוֹ שֶׁל כֶּבֶשׁ וְיוֹרְדִין בְּמַעֲרָבוֹ, וְהַיּוֹם כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל עוֹלֶה בָּאֶמְצַע וְיוֹרֵד בָּאֶמְצַע. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל עוֹלֶה בָּאֶמְצַע וְיוֹרֵד בָּאֶמְצַע.
human_translation: On every day, priests ascend on the eastern side of the ramp and descend on its western side, but this day the High Priest ascends in the middle and descends in the middle. Rabbi Yehuda says: the High Priest always ascends in the middle and descends in the middle,
llm_translation: In every day, the priests go up in the east of the lamb and go down in its west, and today the high priest goes up in the middle and goes down in the middle. Rabbi Yehuda says: Always the high priest goes up in the middle and goes down in the middle.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְקַדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו מִן הַכִּיּוֹר, וְהַיּוֹם מִן הַקִּיתוֹן שֶׁל זָהָב. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לְעוֹלָם כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְקַדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו מִן הַקִּיתוֹן שֶׁל זָהָב.
human_translation: On every day, the High Priest sanctifies his hands and his feet from the laver and on this day from the golden flask, Rabbi Yehuda says the High Priest always sanctifies his hands and his feet from the golden flask.
llm_translation: In every day, the High Priest sanctifies his hands and feet from the laver, and today from the golden pitcher. Rabbi Yehuda says: Always the High Priest sanctifies his hands and feet from the golden pitcher.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיוּ שָׁם אַרְבַּע מַעֲרָכוֹת, וְהַיּוֹם חָמֵשׁ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּכׇל יוֹם שָׁלֹשׁ, וְהַיּוֹם אַרְבַּע. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: בְּכׇל יוֹם שְׁתַּיִם, וְהַיּוֹם שָׁלֹשׁ.
human_translation: On every day there were four arrangements there, but this day there were five; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: On every day three, but this day four. Rabbi Yehuda says: On every day two, but this day three.
llm_translation: In every day there were four shifts, and today there are five, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yosei says: In every day there are three, and today there are four. Rabbi Yehuda says: In every day there are two, and today there are three.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְכׇל אָדָם לֹא יִהְיֶה בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: תְּנִי ״שֶׁל הֵיכָל״.
human_translation: But is it written “And there shall be no man in the Tent of Meeting Rav Yehuda said: teach of the Sanctuary,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemara: And it is written: 'And no man shall be in the tent of meeting.' Rav Yehudah said: Teach 'of the sanctuary.'"

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכׇל אָדָם לֹא יִהְיֶה בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״,
human_translation: The Sages taught “And there shall be no man in the Tent of Meeting
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And no man shall be in the Tent of Meeting,"

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ בַּעֲזָרָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד שֶׁבַּמִּדְבָּר, שִׁילֹה וּבֵית עוֹלָמִים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ״.
human_translation: might even in the courtyard. the verse states “in the Tent of Meeting,” I have only in the Tent of Meeting that was in the desert, from where Shiloh, and the Eternal House, The verse states “in the Sanctuary,”
llm_translation: I am able even in the courtyard - the Talmud teaches: "in the Tent of Meeting." I have only in the Tent of Meeting in the desert, how do I know about Shiloh and the Temple? The Talmud teaches: "in the sanctuary."

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה, בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן דָּמִים מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּבוֹאוֹ לְכַפֵּר״. אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בִּכְנִיסָתוֹ, בִּיצִיאָתוֹ מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עַד צֵאתוֹ״.
human_translation: I have only during the burning from where during the presentations of the blood The verse states: “When he goes in to make atonement,” I have only his entrance from where his exit? The verse states: “Until he comes out.”
llm_translation: I have only at the time of the incense offering, at the time of the blood application, from where? The verse teaches: "When he comes to atone." I have only at the time of his entry, at the time of his exit, from where? The verse teaches: "Until he goes out."

hebrew_text: ״וְכִפֶּר בַּעֲדוֹ וּבְעַד בֵּיתוֹ וּבְעַד כׇּל קְהַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״, כַּפָּרָתוֹ קוֹדֶמֶת לְכַפָּרַת בֵּיתוֹ, כַּפָּרַת בֵּיתוֹ קוֹדֶמֶת לְכַפָּרַת אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים, וְכַפָּרַת אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים קוֹדֶמֶת לְכַפָּרַת כׇּל קְהַל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: “And have made atonement for himself, and for his household, and for all the assembly of Israel” his atonement precedes the atonement of his household; the atonement of his household precedes that atonement of his brethren, the priests; the atonement of his brethren, the priests, precedes the atonement of the entire community of Israel.
llm_translation: "And he shall make atonement for himself and for his household and for the entire assembly of Israel," his atonement precedes the atonement of his household, the atonement of his household precedes the atonement of his fellow priests, and the atonement of his fellow priests precedes the atonement of the entire assembly of Israel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? אָמַר רָבָא, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר אַבְדִּימִי, וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְכִפֶּר בַּעֲדוֹ וּבְעַד בֵּיתוֹ וּבְעַד כׇּל קְהַל יִשְׂרָאֵל״, אֵיזֶהוּ כַּפָּרָה שֶׁשָּׁוָה לוֹ וּלְבֵיתוֹ וּלְאֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים וּלְכׇל קְהַל יִשְׂרָאֵל — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה הַקְטָרַת הַקְּטוֹרֶת.
human_translation: The Master said I have only during the burning where been inferred? Rava said, and similarly Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Avdimi said, and similarly Rabbi Elazar said: verse states: “And have made atonement for himself, and for his household, and for all the assembly of Israel.” Which atonement is the same for him, and for his household, and for his brethren, the priests, and for the entire community of Israel? You must say this is the burning of the incense.
llm_translation: The Master said: I only have merit at the time of the incense offering. What does this imply? Rava said, and so said Rabbi Yitzchak bar Avdimi, and so said Rabbi Elazar, the verse states: "And he shall make atonement for himself and for his household and for the entire assembly of Israel." Which atonement is equivalent for him, his household, his priestly brothers, and for the entire assembly of Israel? One would say this is the incense offering.

hebrew_text: וּקְטוֹרֶת מְכַפֶּרֶת? אִין, דְּהָא תָּנֵי רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא: לָמַדְנוּ לִקְטוֹרֶת שֶׁמְּכַפֶּרֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּתֵּן אֶת הַקְּטוֹרֶת וַיְכַפֵּר עַל הָעָם״, וְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: עַל מָה קְטוֹרֶת מְכַפֶּרֶת — עַל לָשׁוֹן הָרָע. יָבֹא דָּבָר שֶׁבַּחֲשַׁאי, וִיכַפֵּר עַל מַעֲשֵׂה חֲשַׁאי.
human_translation: incense effect atonement? Yes, as Rabbi Ḥananya teaches We learned of the incense that it effects atonement, it is stated: “And he put on the incense and made atonement for the people” And the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: For what does incense effect atonement? For slander. Let something that in secret, come and effect atonement for an act done in secret,
llm_translation: "And incense atones? No, for Rabbi Chananya taught: We have learned that incense atones, as it is stated: 'And he placed the incense and atoned for the people.' And it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: For what does incense atone? For evil speech. Let something that is worthwhile come, and it will atone for the deed that is worthwhile."

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: פּוֹרְשִׁין מִבֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה דְּהֵיכָל, אֲבָל בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה דְּלִפְנַי לִפְנִים — מֵהֵיכָל פָּרְשִׁי, מִבֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ לָא פָּרְשִׁי.
human_translation: We learned there: They remove from between the Entrance Hall and the altar during the burning Rabbi Elazar said: They taught only during the burning of the Sanctuary, but during the burning in the innermost remove from the Sanctuary. They do not need to remove themselves between the Entrance Hall and the altar.
llm_translation: We learned there: They spread out from between the hall and the altar at the time of the incense offering. Rabbi Elazar said: They only specified at the time of the incense offering of the sanctuary, but at the time of the incense offering of the Holy of Holies - they spread out from the sanctuary, not from between the hall and the altar.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ כְּדִי, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁפּוֹרְשִׁין מִבֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה, כָּךְ פּוֹרְשִׁין בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן פַּר כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ וּפַר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִיבּוּר וּשְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava raised an objection and some say it unattributed: Rabbi Yosei says: Just as they remove from between the Entrance Hall and the altar during the burning they similarly remove during the presentations of the bull of the anointed priest, of the bull for an unwitting sin of the goats of idol worship
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Adda bar Ahava asked, and some say it was Rabbi Yosei who said: Just as they would separate between the hall and the altar at the time of the incense offering, so too they would separate at the time of the giving of the bull of the anointed Kohen and the bull of the communal sin offering and the goats of the foreign service.

hebrew_text: הָא מָה מַעֲלָה יֵשׁ בֵּין הַהֵיכָל לְבֵין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ? אֶלָּא, שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל פּוֹרְשִׁין בֵּין בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה, וּמִבֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ אֵין פּוֹרְשִׁין אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה.
human_translation: what higher standard is to the Sanctuary relative to between the Entrance Hall and the altar? Only that in the Sanctuary remove both during the burning and also not during the burning. between the Entrance Hall and the altar remove only during the burning
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: What distinction is there between the Sanctuary and the Hall, and between the Hall and the Altar? Rather, in the Sanctuary, they separate the portions both during the time of the incense offering and not during the time of the incense offering, whereas between the Hall and the Altar, they only separate the portions during the time of the incense offering.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה מִיהָא פָּרְשִׁי. מַאי לָאו, בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה דְּלִפְנַי לִפְנִים?
human_translation: In any case, during the burning they do remove What, is it not during the burning of the innermost
llm_translation: Talmudic text: During the time of the incense offering, from where should he begin? What is the reason? During the time of the incense offering, is it not inside before inside?

hebrew_text: לָא, בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה דְּהֵיכָל. אִי הָכִי, הָא ״מָה מַעֲלָה״ וְתוּ לָא, הָא אִיכָּא הָא מַעֲלָה: דְּאִילּוּ מֵהֵיכָל פָּרְשִׁי בֵּין בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה דִידֵיהּ, בֵּין בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה דְּלִפְנַי לִפְנִים, וְאִילּוּ מִבֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ לָא פָּרְשִׁי אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה דְהֵיכָל!
human_translation: No, during the burning of the of the Sanctuary. If so, What higher standard Are there not more? Surely, there is this higher standard, that whereas in the Sanctuary remove both during its own, burning and during the burning of the innermost but in between the Entrance Hall and the altar they remove only during the burning of the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: Not at the time of the incense in the sanctuary. If so, there is "what is above" and not, there is this above: for if he spread from the sanctuary, whether at the time of his own incense, or at the time of incense before, but if from between the hall and the altar, he only spread at the time of the incense in the sanctuary!

hebrew_text: הָא קָתָנֵי: אֶלָּא שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל פּוֹרְשִׁין בֵּין בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה וּבֵין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה, וּמִבֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ אֵין פּוֹרְשִׁין
human_translation: This is is teaching: only that in the Sanctuary remove both during the burning and also not during the burning from between the Entrance Hall and the altar they do not remove
llm_translation: The Gemara teaches: Rather, in the Temple, they would separate between whether it was at the time of the incense offering or not at the time of the incense offering, and between the hall and the altar they would not separate.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא בִּשְׁעַת הַקְטָרָה.
human_translation: except during burning
llm_translation: Rather, at the time of the incense offering.

hebrew_text: וְהָא אִיכָּא הָא מַעֲלָה, דְּאִילּוּ מֵהֵיכָל פָּרְשִׁי בֵּין בִּקְדוּשָּׁה דִידֵיהּ, בֵּין בִּקְדוּשָּׁה דְּלִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, וְאִילּוּ מִבֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ לָא פָּרְשִׁי אֶלָּא בִּקְדוּשָּׁה דְהֵיכָל! אָמַר רָבָא: שֵׁם פְּרִישָׁה אַחַת הִיא.
human_translation: But there is this higher standard, that whereas from the Sanctuary they remove both during its own sanctification, and during the sanctification of the innermost but from between the Entrance Hall and the altar, they remove only during the sanctification of the Sanctuary. Rava said: one category of removal.
llm_translation: And there is this distinction, that even from the hall, whether he spread it between his own sanctuary, or between the sanctuary before and behind, and if he spread it from between the hall and the altar, he only spread it in the sanctuary of the hall! Rava said: It is one designation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: כָּךְ פּוֹרְשִׁין בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן פַּר כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ, וּפַר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר, וּשְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַבִּי פְּדָת: אָתְיָא ״כַּפָּרָה״ ״כַּפָּרָה״ מִיּוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: The Master said they similarly remove during the presentations of the bull of the anointed priest; of the bull for an unwitting sin; and of the goats of idol worship. From where do we Rabbi Pedat said: atonement atonement from Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Master said: Thus they separate at the time of giving the bull of the anointed priest, and the bull of the sin offering of the congregation, and the goats of foreign worship. From where do we derive this? Rabbi Pedat said: It is derived from the repetition of "atonement" on the Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר אַהֲבָה, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מַעֲלוֹת דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, וְהָכִי גְּמִירִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ahava said: Learn from this higher standards by Torah law, and learned them
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Ahava said, hear from it: the heights of the Torah, and thus they learned for them.

hebrew_text: דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּרַבָּנַן, מַאי שְׁנָא בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ? דִּילְמָא מִיקְּרוּ וְעָיְילִי — מִכּוּלַּהּ עֲזָרָה נָמֵי נִפְרְשׁוּ, דִּילְמָא מִיקְּרוּ וְעָיְילִי!
human_translation: As if it could enter your mind by rabbinic law, what is different between the Entrance Hall and the altar Perhaps happen to enter they remove also from the entire Temple courtyard, perhaps they happen to enter.
llm_translation: If it occurs to you, O scholars, what is the difference between the Hall and the Altar? Perhaps they will read and come — from all of it, the Courtyard was also spread out, perhaps they will read and come!

hebrew_text: בֵּין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ, כֵּיוָן דְּלָא מַפְסֵיק מִידֵּי — לָא מִינַּכְרָא מִילְּתָא. עֲזָרָה, כֵּיוָן דְּאִיכָּא מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן דְּמַפְסֵיק — מִינַּכְרָא מִילְּתָא.
human_translation: between the Entrance Hall and the altar, Since there is nothing that separates it is not conspicuous, Temple courtyard, since there is the outer altar that separates is conspicuous,
llm_translation: Between the hall and the altar, since it does not interrupt from it - it is not recognizable the matter. The courtyard, since there is an outer altar that interrupts - it is recognizable the matter.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: קְדוּשַּׁת אוּלָם וְהֵיכָל חֲדָא מִילְּתָא הִיא. דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת נִינְהוּ, אוּלָם גּוּפֵיהּ גְּזֵירָה, וְנֵיקוּם וְנִגְזוֹר גְּזֵירָה לִגְזֵירָה?!
human_translation: Rava said: Learn from this The sanctity of the Entrance Hall Sanctuary is one matter, For if it could enter your mind these have two of sanctity, Entrance Hall is itself decree. But will we arise and issue decree to decree
llm_translation: Rava said, hear from it: the holiness of the hall and the sanctuary is one matter. For if it were to enter your mind that they are two holinesses, the hall itself is a decree, and will a decree be established and decreed upon another decree?!

hebrew_text: לָא, אוּלָם וּבֵין הָאוּלָם וְלַמִּזְבֵּחַ חֲדָא קְדוּשָּׁה הִיא, הֵיכָל וְאוּלָם שְׁתֵּי קְדוּשּׁוֹת.
human_translation: No, the Entrance Hall and the between the Entrance Hall and the altar one sanctity. the Sanctuary and the Entrance Hall have two sanctities.
llm_translation: Not, however, and between the not and the altar one sanctity it is, sanctuary and not two sanctities.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיָה חוֹתֶה בְּשֶׁל כֶּסֶף וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא? הַתּוֹרָה חָסָה עַל מָמוֹנָן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: On every day, would scoop up of silver and pour into of gold. What is the reason the Torah spared the money of the Jewish people.
llm_translation: In every day he was cutting a silver coin, etc. What is the reason? The Torah has compassion on the money of Israel.

hebrew_text: וְהַיּוֹם חוֹתֶה בְּשֶׁל זָהָב וּבָהּ הָיָה מַכְנִיס. מַאי טַעְמָא? מִשּׁוּם חוּלְשָׁא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: But this day, scoops up with of gold, and with he would bring into What is the reason Due to the weakness High Priest.
llm_translation: And the day was adorned with a golden garment, and through it he would enter. What is the reason? Because of the weakness of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם בְּשֶׁל אַרְבַּעַת קַבִּין וְכוּ׳. תָּנָא: נִתְפַּזְּרוּ לוֹ קַב גֶּחָלִים, מְכַבְּדָן לָאַמָּה.
human_translation: On every day, of four kav It was taught a kav of coals became scattered, and he swept them into the canal
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "On every day with four kav of flour, etc." It was taught: "They scattered for him a kav of coals, honoring the mother."

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי חֲדָא: קַב, וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: קַבַּיִים. בִּשְׁלָמָא הָךְ דְּתָנֵי קַב — רַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא הָךְ דְּתָנֵי קַבַּיִים, מַנִּי? לָא רַבָּנַן וְלָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: was taught one A kav And it was taught in another Two kav Granted, this teaches that kav the Rabbis, But that teaches two kav with whose It is not the Rabbis and not Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: One taught: a kab, and another teaching: kabayim. Granted, when it teaches a kab - it is the Rabbis. But when it teaches kabayim, who is it? Not the Rabbis and not Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן בֶּן בְּרוֹקָה אוֹמֵר: בְּשֶׁל קַבַּיִים הָיָה מַכְנִיס.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, as it was taught Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: With of two kav he would bring into
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroḳah, she is, as it was taught: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroḳah, says: With two kidneys he would bring in.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי, וְהָכִי קָאָמַר: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיָה חוֹתֶה בְּשֶׁל סְאָה מִדְבָּרִית, וּמְעָרֶה לְתוֹךְ שְׁלֹשֶׁת קַבִּין יְרוּשַׁלְמִיּוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: You can even say Rabbi Yosei, and this is what he is saying: On every day, scooped with of a desert se’a , which and he poured into a coal pan of three Jerusalem kav .
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yosei, and thus he says: Every day he would grind a se'ah of desert produce, and sift it into three kavim of Jerusalem wheat.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה כְּבֵידָה, וְהַיּוֹם קַלָּה. תָּנָא, בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה גִּלְדָּהּ עָבֶה, וְהַיּוֹם רַךְ. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה קְצָרָה, וְהַיּוֹם אֲרוּכָּה. מַאי טַעְמָא — כְּדֵי שֶׁתְּהֵא זְרוֹעוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְסַיַּיעְתּוֹ.
human_translation: On every day, was heavy, but this day light. It was taught On every day its side was thick but this day soft On every day was short but this day it was long. What is the reason? So that the arm of the High Priest could assist him
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Every day her liver was heavy, and today it is light. It was taught: Every day her spleen was thick, and today it is soft. Every day her hair was short, and today it is long. What is the reason? — So that the arm of the High Priest may assist her."
