hebrew_text: תָּנָא, בְּכׇל יוֹם לֹא הָיָה לָהּ נִיאַשְׁתִּיק, וְהַיּוֹם הָיָה לָהּ נִיאַשְׁתִּיק. דִּבְרֵי בֶּן הַסְּגָן.
human_translation: taught On every day it did not have a ring, but this day it has a ring the statement of the son of the Deputy.
llm_translation: It was taught: Every day she did not have silence, and today she had silence. The words of Ben Hasgan.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיָה זְהָבָהּ יָרוֹק. אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: שִׁבְעָה זְהָבִים הֵן: זָהָב, וְזָהָב טוֹב, וּזְהַב אוֹפִיר, וְזָהָב מוּפָז, וְזָהָב שָׁחוּט, וְזָהָב סָגוּר, וּזְהַב פַּרְוַיִם. זָהָב וְזָהָב טוֹב, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּזְהַב הָאָרֶץ הַהִוא טוֹב״. זְהַב אוֹפִיר — דְּאָתֵי מֵאוֹפִיר. זָהָב מוּפָז —
human_translation: On every day, it was greenish gold Rav Ḥisda said: There are seven of gold Gold, and good gold, and gold of Ophir and glistering gold and shaḥut gold and closed gold and parvayim gold gold and good gold, as it is written “And the gold of that land is good” Gold of Ophir that comes from Ophir. Glistering [ mufaz ] gold
llm_translation: In every day, her gold was green. Rav Ḥisdah said: There are seven types of gold: gold, good gold, Ophir gold, refined gold, beaten gold, closed gold, and Parvaim gold. Gold and good gold, as it is written: "And the gold of that land is good." Ophir gold - that comes from Ophir. Refined gold -

hebrew_text: שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְפָז. זָהָב שָׁחוּט — שֶׁנִּטְוֶה כְּחוּט. זָהָב סָגוּר — בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּפְתָּח כָּל הַחֲנוּיוֹת נִסְגָּרוֹת. זְהַב פַּרְוַיִם — שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְדַם הַפָּרִים.
human_translation: because it resembles the luster of pearls [ paz ] Shaḥut gold because is spun like thread [ shenitve keḥut ]. Closed gold because when opens all the shops close, Parvayim gold because resembles the blood of bulls [ parim ].
llm_translation: Text: "She'domeh le'faz. Zahav shachut - she'nitveh ke'chut. Zahav sagur - b'sha'ah she'niftach kol ha'chanuyot nisgarot. Zahav parvaim - she'domeh le'dam ha'parim." Translation: "That resembles fine gold. Refined gold - that is stretched like a thread. Closed gold - at the moment it is opened, all the storehouses are closed. Parvaim gold - that resembles the blood of the bulls."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: חֲמִשָּׁה הֵן, וְכׇל חַד וְחַד אִית בֵּיהּ זָהָב וְזָהָב טוֹב. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיָה זְהָבָהּ יָרוֹק, וְהַיּוֹם אָדוֹם — וְהַיְינוּ זְהַב פַּרְוַיִם שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְדַם הַפָּרִים.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: There are five each and every one gold and good gold. That was also taught On every day of greenish gold, but this day a red and this is the parvayim gold which resembles the blood of bulls.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: They are five, and each and every one of them contains gold and good gold. It was taught similarly: Every day its gold was green, and today it is red — and this is the gold of Parvaim that resembles the blood of bulls.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם מַקְרִיב פְּרָס שַׁחֲרִית וְכוּ׳. בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיְתָה דַּקָּה, וְהַיּוֹם דַּקָּה מִן הַדַּקָּה. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״דַּקָּה״ מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁחַקְתָּ מִמֶּנָּה הָדֵק״! אֶלָּא, לְהָבִיא דַּקָּה מִן הַדַּקָּה.
human_translation: On every day, sacrificed a peras , in the morning, On every day, was fine but this day it was superfine. The Sages taught “finely ground What verse teach Has it not already been stated: “And you shall grind some of it finely” Rather, it teaches superfine.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Every day he brings the morning offering, etc. Every day it was thin, and today it is thinner than thin. The Rabbis taught: "Thin," what is the Talmud to say? Has it not already been said: "And you shall take from it fine flour"! Rather, to bring thinness from thinness.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם כֹּהֲנִים עוֹלִין בְּמִזְרָחוֹ שֶׁל כֶּבֶשׁ. דְּאָמַר מָר: כׇּל פִּינּוֹת שֶׁאַתָּה פּוֹנֶה לֹא יְהוּ אֶלָּא דֶּרֶךְ יָמִין לַמִּזְרָח.
human_translation: On every day, priests ascend on the eastern side of the ramp. As the Master said: All the turns that you turn should be only to the right, to the east
llm_translation: In every day, the priests go up in the east of the lamb. As Mar said: All corners that you turn should only be to the right towards the east.

hebrew_text: וְהַיּוֹם (עוֹלִין) בָּאֶמְצַע (וְיוֹרְדִין) בָּאֶמְצַע. מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: But this day ascend in the middle and descend in the middle. What is the reason? Due to the eminence High Priest
llm_translation: And the day (ascends) in the middle (and descends) in the middle. What is the reason? - Because of the honor of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם כֹּהֵן [גָּדוֹל] מְקַדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו מִן הַכִּיּוֹר וְכוּ׳. מַאי טַעְמָא — מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: every day the High Priest sanctifies his hands and his feet from the laver What is the reason? Due to the eminence High Priest.
llm_translation: In every day, the High Priest sanctifies his hands and feet from the laver, etc. What is the reason? — Because of the honor of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיוּ שָׁם אַרְבַּע מַעֲרָכוֹת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיוּ שְׁתַּיִם מַעֲרָכוֹת, וְהַיּוֹם שָׁלֹשׁ. אַחַת מַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה, וְאַחַת מַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת, וְאַחַת שֶׁמּוֹסִיפִין בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: On every day, there were four arrangements there, The Sages taught On every day there were two arrangements but this day three: One, large arrangement; and one, second arrangement for the incense; and one, which they add on that day the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Every day there were four shifts. The Sages taught: Every day there were two shifts, and today there are three. One is a large shift, one is a secondary shift of incense, and one is an additional shift for that day, the words of Rabbi Yehuda."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּכׇל יוֹם שָׁלֹשׁ, וְהַיּוֹם אַרְבַּע. אַחַת שֶׁל מַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה, וְאַחַת מַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת, וְאַחַת שֶׁל קִיּוּם הָאֵשׁ, וְאַחַת שֶׁמּוֹסִיפִין בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: On every day three but this day four: One, the large arrangement; and one, second arrangement for the incense; and one, for the upkeep of the fire, and one, that they add on that day
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: On every day three, and today four. One for the large arrangement, one for the secondary arrangement of incense, one for maintaining the fire, and one for adding to it on the day.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי (מֵאִיר) אוֹמֵר: בְּכׇל יוֹם אַרְבַּע, וְהַיּוֹם חָמֵשׁ. אַחַת שֶׁל מַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה, וְאַחַת שֶׁל מַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת, וְאַחַת שֶׁל קִיּוּם הָאֵשׁ, וְאַחַת לְאֵיבָרִים וּפְדָרִים שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַכְּלוּ מִבָּעֶרֶב, וְאַחַת שֶׁמּוֹסִיפִין בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: On every day there were four but this day five: One, large arrangement; and one, second arrangement for the incense; and one, for the upkeep of the fire; one, for the limbs and fats that were not consumed the evening; and one, that they add on that day
llm_translation: Rabbi (Meir) says: On every day four, and today five. One for the large arrangement, and one for the second arrangement of incense, and one for maintaining the fire, and one for the limbs and fats that were not inspected from the evening, and one for adding to it on the day.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת תַּרְתֵּי אִית לְהוּ, מְנָלַן? אָמַר קְרָא: ״הִיא הָעוֹלָה עַל מוֹקְדָה עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ כׇּל הַלַּיְלָה״ — זוֹ מַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה. ״וְאֵשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ תּוּקַד בּוֹ״ — זוֹ מַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, קִיּוּם הָאֵשׁ מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ: מִ״וְּהָאֵשׁ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ תּוּקַד בּוֹ״.
human_translation: At any rate, everyone has two From where do we The verse states: “It is the burnt-offering on the flame on the altar all night” this the large arrangement. “And the fire of the altar shall be kept burning thereby” this the second arrangement, for the incense. And from where does Rabbi Yosei for the upkeep of the fire? He derives it “And the fire upon the altar shall be kept burning thereby”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Dekhulei olma mi'ehat tartei it lehu, menalan? Amar kra: 'Hi ha'olah al moqedah al hamizbe'ah kol halaylah' — zo ma'arakhah gedolah. 'Ve'esh hamizbe'ah tuqad bo' — zo ma'arakhah shniyah shel ketoret. VeRabbi Yosei, kiyyum ha'esh mena lei? Nafka lei: mi'uveha'esh al hamizbe'ah tuqad bo." English translation: "The whole world is sustained by two things, what are they? The verse says: 'It is the burnt offering that burns on the altar all night long' — this is a great arrangement. 'And the fire of the altar shall be kept burning in it' — this is the second arrangement of the incense. And Rabbi Yosei, how does he derive the maintenance of the fire? It was derived for him: 'And the fire on the altar shall be kept burning in it.'"

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: הָהוּא, לְהַצָּתַת אֲלִיתָא הוּא דַּאֲתָא. דְּתַנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין לְהַצָּתַת אֲלִיתָא שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא בְּרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהָאֵשׁ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ תּוּקַד בּוֹ״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מִנַּיִין שֶׁעוֹשֶׂה מַעֲרָכָה לְקִיּוּם הָאֵשׁ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהָאֵשׁ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ תּוּקַד בּוֹ״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, That comes to the kindling thin wood chips, as it was taught Rabbi Yehuda would say: From where that the kindling of the wood chips should only at the top of the altar, The verse states: “And the fire upon the altar shall be kept burning thereby” Rabbi Yosei said: From where that an arrangement for the upkeep of the fire is made? The verse states: “And the fire upon the altar shall be kept burning thereby”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda: That one, for the kindling of the upper fire it is that he came. As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda would say, From where do we derive that the kindling of the upper fire should only be at the top of the altar? The verse teaches: "And the fire shall burn upon the altar." Rabbi Yosei said, From where do we derive that one should arrange the wood for the maintenance of the fire? The verse teaches: "And the fire shall burn upon the altar."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, הַצָּתַת אֲלִיתָא מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מֵהֵיכָא דְּנָפְקָא לֵיהּ לְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְנָתְנוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן אֵשׁ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ — לִימֵּד עַל הַצָּתַת אֲלִיתָא שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא בְּכֹהֵן כָּשֵׁר וּבִכְלִי שָׁרֵת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן: וְכִי תַּעֲלֶה עַל דַּעְתְּךָ שֶׁזָּר קָרֵב לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ? אֶלָּא, לִימֵּד עַל הַצָּתַת אֲלִיתָא שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא בְּרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: And from where Rabbi Yosei kindling of the wood chips He derives it from the place Rabbi Shimon derives it. As it was taught “And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar” teaches about the kindling of wood chips that it may be only by a fit priest and in vestments of service; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon said to him: for could it enter your mind that a non-priest could approach the altar? Rather, teaches kindling of the wood chips, that they may be lit only at the top of the altar.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, have you found a source for the upper half? It was derived for him from where it was derived for Rabbi Shimon. As it was taught: "And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar" — this teaches regarding the upper half that it should only be with a qualified priest and in a service vessel, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon said to him: Do you think that a non-priest should come close to the altar? Rather, this teaches regarding the upper half that it should only be on the top of the altar.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: קָאֵי אַאַרְעָא וְעָבֵיד בְּמַפּוּחָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda If from there, I would have said standing on the ground and using a bellows teaches us
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda? If from there, I would say: standing in the land and doing in the wind, he is informing us.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר, אֵיבָרִים וּפְדָרִים שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַכְּלוּ מִבָּעֶרֶב, מְנָא לֵיהּ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ: מִ״וְּאֵשׁ״. וְרַבָּנַן — וָאו לָא דָּרְשִׁי.
human_translation: And from where does Rabbi Meir limbs and the fats that were not consumed the evening? He derives it “and the fire.” And the Rabbis, do not expound “and.”
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir: Limbs and organs that were not examined since evening, how does one count them? He derived it from "u'esh" (Leviticus 1:7). And the Rabbis - but did they not expound "vav"?

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, אֵיבָרִים וּפְדָרִים שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַכְּלוּ מִבָּעֶרֶב מַאי עָבֵיד לְהוּ? מַהְדַּר לְהוּ לְמַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה. דְּתַנְיָא: מִנַּיִין לְאֵיבָרִים וּפְדָרִים שֶׁלֹּא נִתְעַכְּלוּ מִבָּעֶרֶב
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with the limbs and the fats that were not consumed the evening? returns them to the large arrangement, As it was taught From where for limbs and fats that were not consumed the evening,
llm_translation: The Sages: limbs and entrails that were not digested from the evening, what should one do with them? Return them for a large pile. As it was taught: From where do we derive that limbs and entrails that were not digested from the evening...

hebrew_text: שֶׁסּוֹדְרָן עַל גַּבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, וְאִם אֵין מַחֲזִיקָן, שֶׁסּוֹדְרָן עַל הַכֶּבֶשׁ אוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי סוֹבֵב, עַד שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה מַעֲרָכָה גְּדוֹלָה, וְסוֹדְרָן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאכַל הָאֵשׁ אֶת הָעוֹלָה עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״.
human_translation: that they are arranged upon the altar, and if cannot hold them, that they are arranged upon the ramp or upon the ledge until the large arrangement is made and they are arranged The verse states: “That which the fire will consume of the burnt-offering, on the altar”
llm_translation: Their order on top of the altar, and if they do not hold, their order on the lamb or on top of the surrounding, until he makes a large arrangement, and orders them? The Talmud teaches: "Which the fire shall consume the burnt offering on the altar."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: עִיכּוּלֵי עוֹלָה אַתָּה מַחֲזִיר, וְאִי אַתָּה מַחֲזִיר עִיכּוּלֵי קְטוֹרֶת. דְּתָנֵי רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בַּר מִנְיוֹמֵי בִּדְבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: ״אֲשֶׁר תֹּאכַל הָאֵשׁ אֶת הָעוֹלָה עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ — עִיכּוּלֵי עוֹלָה אַתָּה מַחֲזִיר, וְאִי אַתָּה מַחֲזִיר עִיכּוּלֵי קְטוֹרֶת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir parts of a burnt-offering consumed you should return them but you do not return incense consumed As Rabbi Ḥananya bar Minyomi from the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught “That which the fire will consume of the burnt-offering on the altar” parts of a burnt-offering consumed you should return them; but you do not return incense consumed
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: "You return the leftover portions of the burnt offering, but you do not return the leftover portions of the incense." For Rabbi Hananiah bar Minyomi taught in the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: " 'The fire shall consume the burnt offering on the altar' — you return the leftover portions of the burnt offering, but you do not return the leftover portions of the incense."

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת מוֹסִיפִין בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם אִית לְהוּ. מָנָא לְהוּ? נָפְקָא לְהוּ: מִ״וְּהָאֵשׁ״. וַאֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּלָא דָּרֵישׁ וָאו, וָאו הֵא דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: At any rate, everyone that they add on that day, From where they They derive it “And the fire And even one who does not expound “and” does expound “and the.”
llm_translation: The people of the world add to it during the day. How do they add to it? It was derived for them: "From the fire." And even for one who does not expound and interpret, this is the interpretation.

hebrew_text: ״אֵשׁ תָּמִיד״ לְמַאי אֲתָא? מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״אֵשׁ תָּמִיד תּוּקַד עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ לֹא תִכְבֶּה״ — לִימֵּד עַל מַעֲרָכָה שְׁנִיָּה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן.
human_translation: “a perpetual fire” for what come It is required for that was taught “A perpetual fire shall be kept burning on the altar, it shall not go out” teaches about the second arrangement for incense, that it is only on the outer altar.
llm_translation: "The 'eternal fire' - for what purpose does it come? He asked according to the teaching: 'A continuous fire shall burn upon the altar, it shall not be extinguished' - this teaches about a second arrangement of incense, that it should only be on the outer altar."

hebrew_text: אֵשׁ מַחְתָּה וּמְנוֹרָה מִנַּיִין? וְדִין הוּא: נֶאֶמְרָה אֵשׁ בִּקְטוֹרֶת, וְנֶאֶמְרָה אֵשׁ בְּמַחְתָּה וּמְנוֹרָה — מָה לְהַלָּן עַל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן, אַף כָּאן עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן.
human_translation: From where fire a coal pan and for the candelabrum It is a logical derivation. “Fire” is stated with regard to the incense and “fire” is stated with regard to the coal pan and the candelabrum. Just as there, upon the outer altar, so too upon the outer altar.
llm_translation: Fire, incense, and menorah, from where? And it is a law: fire was mentioned in connection with incense, and fire was mentioned in connection with the incense altar and the menorah — just as there, on the outer altar, so too here, on the outer altar.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: נֶאֶמְרָה אֵשׁ בִּקְטוֹרֶת, וְנֶאֶמְרָה אֵשׁ בְּמַחְתָּה וּמְנוֹרָה — מָה לְהַלָּן בְּסָמוּךְ לוֹ, אַף מַחְתָּה וּמְנוֹרָה בְּסָמוּךְ לוֹ.
human_translation: Or, go this way. “Fire” is stated with regard to the incense and “fire” is stated with regard to the coal pan and the candelabrum. Just as there, near to it, so too, coal pan and the candelabrum, near to it,
llm_translation: Or like this for the way: It was said fire in the incense, and it was said fire in the censer and the lamp — just as there, adjacent to it, so too the censer and the lamp adjacent to it.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֵשׁ תָּמִיד תּוּקַד עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ לֹא תִכְבֶּה״ — אֵשׁ תָּמִיד שֶׁאָמַרְתִּי לָךְ, לֹא תְּהֵא אֶלָּא בְּרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן.
human_translation: The verse states: “A perpetual fire shall be kept burning on the altar, it shall not go out” “perpetual fire” that I told you, should only upon the top of the outer altar.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "A continuous fire shall burn upon the altar; it shall not be extinguished" — the continuous fire that I have spoken to you about shall only be on the top of the outer altar.

hebrew_text: לָמַדְנוּ אֵשׁ לַמְּנוֹרָה, אֵשׁ לַמַּחְתָּה מִנַּיִין? וְדִין הוּא: נֶאֶמְרָה אֵשׁ בְּמַחְתָּה, וְנֶאֶמְרָה אֵשׁ בִּמְנוֹרָה — מָה לְהַלָּן עַל גַּבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן, אַף כָּאן עַל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן.
human_translation: We learned fire for candelabrum. From where fire for the coal pan It is a logical derivation. “Fire” is stated with regard to coal pan and “fire” is stated with regard to candelabrum. Just as there, upon the outer altar, so too, here, upon the outer altar.
llm_translation: We learned: "Fire for the menorah, fire for the incense altar, from where?" And it is a law: It was said fire in the incense altar, and it was said fire in the menorah - just as there, on the outer altar, so too here, on the outer altar.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: נֶאֶמְרָה אֵשׁ בִּקְטוֹרֶת, וְנֶאֶמְרָה אֵשׁ בְּמַחְתָּה — מָה לְהַלָּן בְּסָמוּךְ לוֹ, אַף כָּאן בְּסָמוּךְ לוֹ!
human_translation: Or, go this way: “Fire” is stated with regard to the incense and “fire” is stated with regard to the coal pan Just as there, near to it, so too, here, near to it,
llm_translation: Or like this for the way: It is stated fire in the incense, and it is stated fire in the censer - just as there it is adjacent to it, so too here it is adjacent to it!

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלָקַח מְלֹא הַמַּחְתָּה גַּחֲלֵי אֵשׁ מֵעַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ מִלִּפְנֵי ה׳״, אֵיזֶהוּ מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁמִּקְצָתוֹ לִפְנֵי ה׳ וְאֵין כּוּלּוֹ לִפְנֵי ה׳ — הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר זֶה מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן.
human_translation: The verse states: “And he shall take a pan full of coals of fire from upon the altar from before the Lord” Which altar partially before the Lord, but not all of it is before the Lord, You must say this is the outer altar.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall take a panful of coals of fire from off the altar before the Lord." Which altar has part of it before the Lord, and part of it not before the Lord? — One must say that this refers to the outer altar.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב: ״מֵעַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב: ״מִלִּפְנֵי ה׳״, דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא ״מֵעַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: מַאי ״מִזְבֵּחַ״ — מִזְבֵּחַ פְּנִימִי, כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״מִלִּפְנֵי ה׳״. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא: ״מִלִּפְנֵי ה׳״, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דַּוְקָא מִלִּפְנֵי ה׳,
human_translation: And it is necessary to write “from upon the altar” and it is necessary to write “from before God” because if the Merciful One had written “from upon the altar” I would have said: What altar inner altar. the Merciful One writes “from before God.” And if the Merciful One had written “from before God,” I would have said specifically from before God,
llm_translation: The text requires clarification: "above the altar," and the text requires clarification: "before the Lord," for if the Merciful One had written "above the altar," I would have said: What is "altar" - the inner altar, the Merciful One wrote: "before the Lord." And if the Merciful One had written "before the Lord," I would have said specifically "before the Lord."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מֵהַאי גִּיסָא וּמֵהַאי גִּיסָא אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: but from this side or from that side say no, necessary
llm_translation: But from this case and from that case, why not? It is necessary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר מִשּׁוּם בַּר קַפָּרָא, אוֹמֵר הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר: אֵיבְרֵי עוֹלָה שֶׁנִּתּוֹתְרוּ — עוֹשֶׂה לָהֶן מַעֲרָכָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ וְסוֹדְרָן, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said in the name of bar Kappara: Rabbi Meir would say: limbs of a burnt-offering that remained one should make a separate arrangement for them and arrange them And even on Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said in the name of Bar Kappara, Rabbi Meir used to say: If the limbs of the burnt-offering became dislocated - one should arrange them in their proper order and arrange them, even on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן? תְּנֵינָא: בְּכׇל יוֹם הָיוּ שָׁם אַרְבַּע מַעֲרָכוֹת. אָמַר רַבִּי אָבִין: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לִפְסוּלִין.
human_translation: What is teaching us we learned On every day, there were four arrangements there, Rabbi Avin said: is needed only disqualified
llm_translation: What is it teaching us? We learned: Every day there were four shifts. Rabbi Avin said: It was only necessary for the disqualified.

hebrew_text: וְדַוְקָא שֶׁמָּשְׁלָה בָּהֶן הָאוּר, אֲבָל לֹא מָשְׁלָה בָּהֶן הָאוּר — לֹא.
human_translation: But specifically the fire has taken hold of them But the fire taken hold of them, no,
llm_translation: And specifically that the light is compared to them, but the light is not compared to them - no.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אֶחָד כְּשֵׁירִין וְאֶחָד פְּסוּלִין, אִי מָשְׁלָה בָּהֶן הָאוּר — אִין, וְאִי לָא — לָא.
human_translation: There are who say Both valid and disqualified if the fire has taken hold of them yes, but if no,
llm_translation: There are some who say: one is valid and one is invalid, if the light is compared to them - no, and if not - no.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת — תְּנֵינָא: וְהַיּוֹם חָמֵשׁ!
human_translation: And even on Shabbat. we learned But this day, five.
llm_translation: And even on Shabbat - we learned: "And today is five!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: אִיצְטְרִיךְ, סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּחָל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לִהְיוֹת אַחַר הַשַּׁבָּת, דְּחֶלְבֵי שַׁבָּת קְרֵבִין בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, אֲבָל בְּאֶמְצַע שַׁבָּת — לָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: is necessary, it could enter your mind to say this applies when Yom Kippur occurs after Shabbat, that fats of Shabbat are sacrificed on Yom Kippur. However, in the middle of the week, no, teaches us
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: It is necessary, as your mind may think, that these matters are where Yom Kippur falls after Shabbat, for the fats of Shabbat offerings are brought on Yom Kippur, but if it falls in the middle of Shabbat — no, this is what is implied to us.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאן הַאי דְּלָא חָיֵישׁ לְקִמְחֵיהּ? הָא ״בְּכׇל יוֹם״ תְּנַן! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rava said: Who is this that does not care about his flour, Did we learn On every day. difficult.
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is this one who is not concerned for his flour? We learned in a Mishnah: "Every day." This is difficult.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב הוּנָא, דְּאָמַר: תְּחִילָּתוֹ דּוֹחָה, סוֹפוֹ אֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה.
human_translation: disagrees with Rav Huna, who said: The beginning overrides the end does not override
llm_translation: And the dispute of Rav Huna, for he said: Its beginning overrides, its end does not override.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. אָמַר רַב הוּנָא: תָּמִיד, תְּחִילָּתוֹ דּוֹחָה, סוֹפוֹ אֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה.
human_translation: the itself: Rav Huna said: The beginning daily offering overrides the end does not override
llm_translation: The body. Rav Huna said: A continual offering, its beginning overrides, its end does not override.

hebrew_text: מַאי אֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה? רַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר: דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, וְאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה. (וְרָבָא) אָמַר: דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, וְאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: What does not override Rav Ḥisda said: does override Shabbat, it does not override ritual impurity. And Rabba said: overrides ritual impurity, but it does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: What is not overridden? Rav Ḥisdah said: It overrides the Sabbath, but does not override ritual impurity. (And Rava) said: It overrides ritual impurity, but does not override the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי (לְרָבָא): לְדִידָךְ קַשְׁיָא, וּלְרַב חִסְדָּא קַשְׁיָא. לְדִידָךְ קַשְׁיָא: מַאי שְׁנָא טוּמְאָה, דִּכְתִיב ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה, שַׁבָּת נָמֵי — ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת!
human_translation: Abaye said to It a difficulty to your and it a difficulty to of Rav Ḥisda. It difficult to your opinion What is different ritual impurity Because it is written “in its season” in ritual impurity. also Shabbat. “in its season” even on Shabbat.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye (to Rava): According to your opinion, it is difficult, and according to Rav Hisda's opinion, it is difficult. According to your opinion, it is difficult: What is the difference with impurity, as it is written "in its appointed time" - even in impurity, only on Shabbat - "in its appointed time," even on Shabbat!

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב חִסְדָּא קַשְׁיָא: מַאי שְׁנָא שַׁבָּת, דִּכְתִיב ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״ — אֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת, טוּמְאָה נָמֵי — ״בְּמוֹעֲדוֹ״, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה?
human_translation: And it difficult to Rav Ḥisda: What is different Shabbat Because it is written “in its season,” even on Shabbat. also ritual impurity. “in its season” even in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Ḥisdah a question was difficult: What is the difference with Shabbat, as it is written "in its appointed time" — even on Shabbat, impurity is counted — "in its appointed time," and even in impurity?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא לְדִידִי קַשְׁיָא, וְלָא לְרַב חִסְדָּא קַשְׁיָא. לְדִידִי לָא קַשְׁיָא: סוֹפוֹ כִּתְחִילָּתוֹ,
human_translation: said to him: It not difficult to my and it does not a difficulty to Rav Ḥisda. It not difficult to my the end of is like its beginning.
llm_translation: He said to him: Not difficult for me, and not difficult for Rav Ḥisda. Not difficult for me: its end is like its beginning.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָה, דִּתְחִילָּתוֹ בַּר מִידְחֵא טוּמְאָה הוּא — סוֹפוֹ נָמֵי דָּחֵי. שַׁבָּת, דִּתְחִילָּתוֹ לָאו בַּר מִידְחֵא שַׁבָּת הוּא — סוֹפוֹ נָמֵי לָא דָּחֵי.
human_translation: ritual impurity, the beginning is fit to override ritual impurity, its end also overrides Shabbat, the beginning is not fit to override its end also does not override
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Tum'ah, ditkhilato bar midche tum'ah hu - sofo namei dachei. Shabbat, ditkhilato lav bar midche Shabbat hu - sofo namei lo dachei. English translation: Impurity, whose beginning is from a source of impurity - its end is also impure. Shabbat, whose beginning is not from a source of Shabbat - its end is also not considered Shabbat.

hebrew_text: לְרַב חִסְדָּא לָא קַשְׁיָא: סוֹפוֹ כִּתְחִילָּתוֹ (תְּחִילָּתוֹ) לֵית לֵיהּ. שַׁבָּת דְּהוּתְּרָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר — סוֹפוֹ נָמֵי דָּחֵי.
human_translation: not difficult to the Rav Ḥisda, he does not hold its end is like its beginning. Shabbat in a communal permitted, its end also overrides
llm_translation: To Rav Ḥisdah it is not difficult: its end is like its beginning, it has no beginning. Shabbat that is permitted in public - its end is indeed pushed off.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָה, דִּדְחוּיָה הִיא בְּצִיבּוּר, תְּחִלָּתוֹ דְּעִיקַּר כַּפָּרָה — דָּחֵי, סוֹפוֹ דְּלָאו עִיקַּר כַּפָּרָה — לָא דָּחֵי.
human_translation: ritual impurity, which is overridden in a communal the beginning of which is the essential atonement, overrides its end, which is not the essential atonement, does not override
llm_translation: Impure, that is pushed aside in the community, its beginning is like the essence of atonement - it is pushed aside, its end is not like the essence of atonement - it is not pushed aside.

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר: הַמְכַבֶּה אֵשׁ מַחְתָּה וּמְנוֹרָה, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: חַיָּיב, רָבָא אָמַר: פָּטוּר.
human_translation: was stated: one who extinguishes the fire of the coal pan or of the candelabrum, Abaye said: He is liable. Rava said: He is not liable.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who extinguishes a fire of a lamp or a menorah, Abbaye said: liable, Rava said: exempt.

hebrew_text: דְּכַבְּיַיהּ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּחַיָּיב. כִּי פְּלִיגִי דְּאַחֲתַיהּ אַאַרְעָא וְכַבְּיַיהּ. אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: חַיָּיב, אֵשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ הוּא, רָבָא אָמַר: פָּטוּר, כֵּיוָן דְּנַתְּקַהּ — נַתְּקַהּ.
human_translation: where one extinguished upon the top of the altar, everyone agrees that he is liable. When they disagree, where he brought down to ground and extinguished Abaye said: He is liable, fire of the altar. Rava said: He is not liable, once it has been removed it is removed
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "If it is on the top of the altar, everyone agrees that he is not liable. When do they disagree? When it is on its side and on the top. Abaye said: He is liable, it is the fire of the altar. Rava said: He is exempt, once it has detached - it has detached."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: הַמּוֹרִיד גַּחֶלֶת מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְכִיבָּהּ חַיָּיב, כְּמַאן? כְּאַבַּיֵּי!
human_translation: But this that Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: One who takes down a coal from upon the altar and extinguishes it is liable, in accordance with whose in accordance with Abaye?
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuh said: One who removes a coal from the altar and extinguishes it is liable. According to whom? According to Abbaye!

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא כְּרָבָא, הָתָם לָא אִינְּתִיק לְמִצְוָתַהּ, הָכָא אִינְּתִיקָה לְמִצְוָתַהּ.
human_translation: You can even say is in accordance with Rava There, was not removed to fulfill its mitzva. here, was removed to fulfill its mitzva.
llm_translation: Even if you say like Rava, there it is not established for its commandment, here it is established for its commandment.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי.
human_translation: There are who say
llm_translation: There is one who says:

hebrew_text: דְּאַחֲתַיהּ אַאַרְעָא וְכַבְּיַיהּ, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּפָטוּר. כִּי פְּלִיגִי, דְּכַבְּיַּיהּ בְּרֹאשׁוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ, אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: חַיָּיב, אֵשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ הוּא, רָבָא אָמַר: פָּטוּר, כֵּיוָן דְּנַתְּקַהּ — נַתְּקַהּ.
human_translation: where he brought down to the ground and extinguished everyone agrees that he is not liable. When they disagree where one extinguished upon the top of the altar. Abaye said: He is liable, fire of the altar. Rava said: He is not liable, once it has been removed it is removed
llm_translation: One of them, the earth and its utensils, the whole world does not argue that it is exempt. When they argue, that its utensils are at the top of the altar, Abbaye said: liable, it is the fire of the altar, Rava said: exempt, once it is detached — it is detached.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָא דְּאָמַר רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר אֲבוּהּ: הַמּוֹרִיד גַּחֶלֶת מֵעַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְכִבָּהּ — חַיָּיב, כְּמַאן? לָא כְּאַבַּיֵּי וְלָא כְּרָבָא! הָתָם לָא אִינְּתִיק לְמִצְוָתַהּ, הָכָא אִינְּתִיק לְמִצְוָתַהּ.
human_translation: But this that Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: He who takes down a coal from upon the altar and extinguishes it is liable, in accordance with whose neither in accordance with Abaye, nor in accordance Rava. There, was not removed to fulfill its mitzva; here, was removed to fulfill its mitzva,
llm_translation: Rather, this that Rav Nachman said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh: One who removes a coal from upon the altar and extinguishes it — is liable. According to whom? Not according to Abbaye and not according to Rava! There, he did not fulfill its commandment; here, he did not fulfill its commandment.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ טָרַף בַּקַּלְפִּי
llm_translation: We will return to you, Traf, in the Kalpi.

hebrew_text: הוֹצִיאוּ לוֹ אֶת הַכַּף וְאֶת הַמַּחְתָּה, חָפַן מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו וְנָתַן לְתוֹךְ הַכַּף. הַגָּדוֹל לְפִי גׇדְלוֹ, וְהַקָּטָן לְפִי קׇטְנוֹ. וְכָךְ הָיְתָה מִדָּתָהּ. נָטַל אֶת הַמַּחְתָּה בִּימִינוֹ וְאֶת הַכַּף בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ.
human_translation: They brought out the spoon and the coal pan He scoops his handfuls and places it into the spoon. The large corresponding to the large and the small corresponding to the small And this was the measure He took the coal pan in his right and the spoon in his left
llm_translation: They brought out for him the spoon and the censer, he scooped with both hands and placed into the spoon. The large one according to his size, and the small one according to his size. And so was its measure. He took the censer in his right hand and the spoon in his left.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מַחְתָּה? תְּנָא לֵיהּ: נָטַל אֶת הַמַּחְתָּה וְעָלָה לְרֹאשׁ הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וְחוֹתֶה וְיוֹרֵד! הָתָם מַחְתָּה דְגֶחָלִים, וְהָכָא מַחְתָּה דִקְטוֹרֶת, דְּתַנְיָא: הוֹצִיאוּ לוֹ כַּף רֵיקָן מִלִּשְׁכַּת הַכֵּלִים, וּמַחְתָּה גְּדוּשָׁה שֶׁל קְטוֹרֶת מִלִּשְׁכַּת בֵּית אַבְטִינָס.
human_translation: taught coal pan: He takes a coal pan and ascends to the top of the altar and rakes and descends. There coal pan of coals, and here coal pan of incense, As it was taught They brought out an empty spoon for him from the chamber of vessels, and a coal pan heaped with incense from the Chamber of the House of Avtinas.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemah mach'tah? Tenah lei: Natah et hamach'tah ve'alah le'rosh hamizbe'ach ve'choteh ve'yored! Hatam mach'tah degechalim, vehacha mach'tah diktorat, detanya: Hotzi'u lo kaf reikan milishkat hakelim, u'mach'tah gedushah shel ketoret milishkat beit Avtinas. English translation: Gemah mach'tah? It was taught: He takes the fire-pan and ascends to the top of the altar, scoops and descends! There, the fire-pan is for coals, and here, the fire-pan is for incense, as it was taught: They would bring him an empty spoon from the Chamber of Utensils, and a fire-pan of incense from the Chamber of Beit Avtinas.

hebrew_text: חָפַן מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו וְנוֹתֵן לְתוֹךְ הַכַּף. הַגָּדוֹל — לְפִי גׇדְלוֹ, וְהַקָּטָן — לְפִי קׇטְנוֹ. וְכָךְ הָיְתָה מִדָּתָהּ. כַּף בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לְמָה לִי? ״מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו וְהֵבִיא״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא!
human_translation: He scoops his handfuls and places it into the spoon. The large corresponding to the large and small corresponding to the small and this was the measure Why do I a spoon on Yom Kippur? the Merciful One states: his hands full and bring
llm_translation: He scoops a handful and places it into the palm. The large one — according to its size, and the small one — according to its size. And so was its measure. Why do I need a palmful on Yom Kippur? "He shall scoop a handful and bring" — the Merciful One said!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר, דְּהֵיכִי נֶעְבֵּיד? נְעַיֵּיל וַהֲדַר נְעַיֵּיל — הֲבָאָה אַחַת אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלָא שְׁתֵּי הֲבָאוֹת.
human_translation: because it is impossible As what should we do? Let him bring in and then bring in The Merciful One states one bringing and not two bringing.
llm_translation: From the fact that it is not possible, how is it done? We bring and then bring back - once said the Merciful One, and not twice.

hebrew_text: נִשְׁקְלַיהּ לִקְטוֹרֶת בְּחוֹפְנָיו וְנַחֲתַיהּ [לְמַחְתָּה] עֲלַהּ וְלֵיעוּל. כִּי מָטֵי הָתָם הֵיכִי לַעֲבֵיד? נִשְׁקְלַיהּ בְּשִׁינֵּיהּ וְנַחֲתַיהּ לְמַחְתָּה? הַשְׁתָּא לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וְדָם אֵין עוֹשִׂין כֵּן, לִפְנֵי מֶלֶךְ מַלְכֵי הַמְּלָכִים הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא — עַל אַחַת כַּמָּה וְכַמָּה.
human_translation: let him take incense by his handfuls and place coal pan on top of and enter, when he arrives there, what should he do? Let him take coal pan in his teeth and lower Now, before a king of flesh and blood one would not do so, All the more so, before the King of kings, the Holy One, Blessed be He.
llm_translation: He weighed it for the incense in his hands and placed it on the fire-pan, on the coals. When he goes there, how should he do it? He should weigh it with his teeth and place it on the fire-pan? Now, before a human king, flesh and blood, they do not do so; before the King of kings, the Holy One, blessed be He - all the more so.

hebrew_text: הִלְכָּךְ — לָא אֶפְשָׁר, וְכֵיוָן דְּלָא אֶפְשָׁר — עָבְדִינַן כִּדְאַשְׁכְּחַן בִּנְשִׂיאִים.
human_translation: Therefore, it is impossible and since it is impossible he acts as we find princes
llm_translation: Therefore - it is not possible, and since it is not possible - we act as we found with the princes.

hebrew_text: נָטַל אֶת הַמַּחְתָּה בְּיָמִין וְאֶת הַכַּף בִּשְׂמֹאל. יַצִּיבָא בְּאַרְעָא וְגִיּוֹרָא בִּשְׁמֵי שְׁמַיָּא!
human_translation: took the coal pan in his right and the spoon in his left The native is on the ground and the stranger is in the heavens;
llm_translation: He took the fire-pan with his right hand and the spoon with his left. He stood on the ground and the convert in the heavens above!

hebrew_text: זוֹ מְרוּבָּה, וְזוֹ מוּעֶטֶת. וַאֲפִילּוּ בִּזְמַן שֶׁשְּׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין, וּכְמַעֲשֶׂה דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן קִמְחִית, זוֹ — חַמָּה, וְזוֹ — צוֹנֶנֶת.
human_translation: this greater and that less. And even when the two of them are equal, like the action of Rabbi Yishmael ben Kimḥit, this is hot and that is cold
llm_translation: This is Merubah, and this is Mu'etet. And even when both are equal, as in the case of Rabbi Yishmael ben Kimchit, this one is the sun, and this one is the shade.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן קִמְחִית שֶׁהָיָה חוֹפֵן אַרְבַּעַת קַבִּין בִּמְלוֹא חׇפְנָיו, וְאוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַנָּשִׁים [זֶרֶד] זָרְדוּ, וְזֶרֶד אִימָּא עָלָה לַגָּג. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: בְּעַרְסָן, וְכִדְרַבָּה בַּר יוֹנָתָן. דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר יוֹנָתָן אָמַר רַבִּי יְחִיאֵל: עַרְסָן יָפֶה לַחוֹלֶה.
human_translation: They said about Rabbi Yishmael ben Kimḥit that he would scoop four kav , by his handfuls, and say: All the women selected but the selection of my mother rose to the roof, Some say of flour, in accordance with Rabba bar Yonatan. As Rabba bar Yonatan said Rabbi Yeḥiel said: Flour is beneficial for the sick.
llm_translation: They said about Rabbi Yishmael ben Kimchit that he would grasp four kavim in the fullness of his hands, and he would say: "All women Zered Zeradu, and Zered Ima went up to the roof." Some say: in the Arsan, and like Rabbah bar Yonatan. For Rabbah bar Yonatan said in the name of Rabbi Yechiel: Arsan is good for the sick.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי בְּשִׁכְבַת זֶרַע, וְכִדְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ. דְּרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״וַתַּזְרֵנִי [חַיִל] לַמִּלְחָמָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״הַמְאַזְּרֵנִי חַיִל״? אָמַר דָּוִד לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! זֵרִיתַנִי וְזֵרַזְתַּנִי.
human_translation: And some say in accordance with Rabbi Abbahu, as Rabbi Abbahu raised a contradiction It is written: “For You have girded me vatazreni with strength for battle” and it is written “Who girds me hame’azreni ] with strength” David said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the Universe: You selected me [ zeritani ] You fashioned me [ zeraztani ]
llm_translation: And there are those who say in the context of the emission of seed, as Rabbi Avahu said. Rabbi Avahu raised an objection: It is written, "He trains my hands for war" (Psalms 18:35), and it is also written, "He arms me with strength" (Psalms 18:33)? David said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the universe! You have scattered me and encouraged me.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן קִמְחִית: פַּעַם אַחַת סִיפֵּר דְּבָרִים עִם עֲרָבִי אֶחָד בַּשּׁוּק, וְנִתְּזָה צִינּוֹרָא מִפִּיו עַל בְּגָדָיו. וְנִכְנַס יְשֵׁבָב אָחִיו וְשִׁמֵּשׁ תַּחְתָּיו. וְרָאֲתָה אִמָּן שְׁנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים בְּיוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: They said about Rabbi Yishmael ben Kimḥit: Once he was talking to a certain Arab in the market and a drop sprayed from mouth onto the clothes And his brother Yeshevav entered and served in his stead. And, their mother saw two High Priests on a single day.
llm_translation: They said about Rabbi Yishmael ben Kimchit: Once he conversed with an Arab in the marketplace, and a pipe of oil dripped from his mouth onto his garments. Yeshayav, his brother, entered and served beneath him. Their mother saw two High Priests on the same day.

hebrew_text: וְשׁוּב אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בֶּן קִמְחִית: פַּעַם אַחַת יָצָא וְסִיפֵּר עִם הֶגְמוֹן אֶחָד בַּשּׁוּק, וְנִתְּזָה צִינּוֹרָא מִפִּיו עַל בְּגָדָיו. וְנִכְנַס יוֹסֵף (עִם) אָחִיו וְשִׁמֵּשׁ תַּחְתָּיו, וְרָאֲתָה אִמָּן שְׁנֵי כֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים בְּיוֹם אֶחָד.
human_translation: And they further said about Rabbi Yishmael ben Kimḥit: Once he went out and talked to a certain officer [ hegmon ] in the market, and a drop of saliva sprayed from mouth onto the clothes and his brother Yosef entered and served in his stead. And, their mother saw two High Priests on a single day.
llm_translation: And again they said about Rabbi Yishmael ben Kimchit: Once he went out and conversed with a certain heathen in the marketplace, and a tube of spittle issued from his mouth onto his garments. And Joseph entered with his brother and urinated beneath him, and their mother saw two high priests on the same day.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שִׁבְעָה בָּנִים הָיוּ לָהּ לְקִמְחִית, וְכוּלָּן שִׁמְּשׁוּ בִּכְהוּנָּה גְּדוֹלָה. אָמְרוּ לָהּ חֲכָמִים: מָה עָשִׂית שֶׁזָּכִית לְכָךְ? אָמְרָה לָהֶם: מִיָּמַי לֹא רָאוּ קוֹרוֹת בֵּיתִי קַלְעֵי שְׂעָרִי. אָמְרוּ לָהּ: הַרְבֵּה עָשׂוּ כֵּן וְלֹא הוֹעִילוּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught Kimḥit had seven sons, and they all served of the High Priesthood, The Sages said to her: What did you perform to merit this? She said to them: In all my days, the beams of my house never saw the braids of my hair, They said to her: Many did so and did not succeed
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: She had seven sons who all served in the high priesthood. The sages said to her: What did you do to merit this? She said to them: In all my days, the rafters of my house never saw the braids of my hair. They said to her: Many have done so and it did not benefit them.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בְּקוּמְצוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא יַעֲשֶׂה מִדָּה לַקּוֹמֶץ. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ שֶׁיַּעֲשֶׂה מִדָּה לַחֲפִינָה?
human_translation: The Sages taught: his handful, that he should not measure an amount for the handful A dilemma was raised before What is measure an amount for the handful
llm_translation: The Sages taught: In the case of a kometz, one should not make a measurement for the kometz. The question was asked: What about making a measurement for the handful?

hebrew_text: הָתָם הוּא דִכְתִיב ״בְּקוּמְצוֹ״: אֲבָל הָכָא דְּלָא כְּתִיב ״בְּחׇפְנָיו״, אֶלָּא: ״מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו קְטוֹרֶת סַמִּים דַּקָּה״, לָא. אוֹ דִילְמָא יָלֵיף ״מְלֹא״ ״מְלֹא״ מִקּוּמְצוֹ?
human_translation: there, it as it is written “in his handful,” However here, where it is not written: In his hands, but “and his hands full of sweet incense beaten small” not Or perhaps is derived “full” “full,” from “his handful,”
llm_translation: There, it is written "bekumtzo"; but here, where it is not written "bechafnav," rather: "melo chafnav ketoret samim dakka," no. Or perhaps it should be inferred that "melo" is repeated from "bekumtzo"?

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: ״וְכָךְ הָיְתָה מִדָּתָהּ״, מַאי לָאו, שֶׁאִם רָצָה לַעֲשׂוֹת מִדָּה אַחֶרֶת עוֹשֶׂה? לֹא, הָכִי קָאָמַר: וְכָךְ הָיָה חוֹזֵר וְחוֹפְנָהּ לִפְנִים.
human_translation: Come hear And this was the measure What, is it not that if he wanted to measure a different amount, he measure No, this is said; And so too, would return and scoop inside
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Come and hear: 'And so was her custom,' what is the reason that if she wanted to do another custom she could not do so? No, this is what it means: 'And so he would turn it back and examine it inwardly.'" English translation: "Come and hear: 'And so was her custom,' what is the reason that if she wanted to do another custom she could not do so? No, this is what it means: 'And so he would turn it back and examine it inwardly.'"

hebrew_text: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ: חוֹפֵן וְחוֹזֵר וְחוֹפֵן!
human_translation: learn from this scoops and again scoops.
llm_translation: Heard from her: "He turns and returns and turns!"

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא: שֶׁאִם רָצָה לַעֲשׂוֹת מִדָּה — עוֹשֶׂה. אִי נָמֵי: שֶׁלֹּא יְחַסֵּר וְשֶׁלֹּא יוֹתִיר.
human_translation: perhaps that if he wanted to measure a different amount, he measure Alternatively, that take neither less nor more,
llm_translation: Perhaps: that if he wants to do a measure - he does. Or rather: that he should not diminish and that he should not add.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״מְלֹא קוּמְצוֹ״. יָכוֹל מְבוֹרָץ — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּקוּמְצוֹ״. אִי בְּקוּמְצוֹ, יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ בְּרָאשֵׁי אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מְלֹא קוּמְצוֹ״, כִּדְקָמְצִי אִינָשֵׁי. הָא כֵּיצַד — חוֹפֶה שְׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו עַל פִּיסַּת יָדוֹ וְקוֹמֵץ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “His handfuls” might be overflowing the verse states: “His handful” If “his handful,” might even with his fingertips, the verse states: “His handfuls” as people take a handful, How He scoops his three fingers over the palm of his hand, and takes a handful
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "His handful." One might have thought it refers to a handful of a breach - the Torah teaches: "In his handful." If it were referring to his handful, one might have thought it includes even the tips of his fingers, the Torah teaches: "His handful," as people usually grasp. How so? He covers three of his fingers on the palm of his hand and grasps.

hebrew_text: וּבְמַחֲבַת וּבְמַרְחֶשֶׁת, מוֹחֵק בְּגוּדָלוֹ מִלְּמַעְלָה, וּבְאֶצְבָּעוֹ קְטַנָּה מִלְּמַטָּה. וְזוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָה קָשָׁה שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ. זוֹ הִיא וְתוּ לָא? וְהָא אִיכָּא מְלִיקָה, וְהָא אִיכָּא חֲפִינָה! אֶלָּא: זוֹ הִיא מֵעֲבוֹדוֹת קָשׁוֹת שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ.
human_translation: And in a pan and to a deep container, smooths with his thumb above and with his little finger below. And this is difficult rite in the Temple. This one and no other? But there is pinching, and there is taking handful Rather, this is of difficult rites in the Temple.
llm_translation: In the mortar and in the pestle, one wipes from above, and with his finger, he wipes from below. And this is the difficult service in the Temple. Is this it, or not? But there is sprinkling, and there is covering! Rather, these are the difficult services in the Temple.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, בָּעֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן עוּזָּאָה: בֵּין הַבֵּינַיִם שֶׁל מְלֹא קוּמְצוֹ, מַהוּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: דְּגַוַּאי לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ — דְּוַדַּאי קוֹמֶץ הוּא. דְּבָרַאי לָא תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ — דְּוַדַּאי שִׁירַיִם הוּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Uza’a raised a dilemma: What between of his handfuls? Rav Pappa said that is on the inside, do not raise the dilemma, as it certainly the handful. that is on the outside, do not raise the dilemma, as it certainly remainder
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Uzziel inquired: What is the status of the space between the letters of the word "kumtzoh"? Rav Papa said: If it does not require a "dagesh" (dot), then it is certainly a "kumtz." If it does require a "dagesh," then it is certainly "shirayim."

hebrew_text: כִּי תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ דְּבֵינֵי בֵּינֵי מַאי. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הֲדַר פַּשְׁטַהּ יְהוֹשֻׁעַ [בֶּן] עוּזָּאָה: בֵּין הַבֵּינַיִם סָפֵק נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: let the dilemma be raised between What is Rav Yoḥanan said: Yehoshua ben Uza’a then resolved between is doubtful,
llm_translation: When you will argue for yourself between the two, what is it? Rabbi Yochanan said: Joshua son of Nun retracted: Between the two, they are uncertain.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי עָבֵיד? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מַקְטִיר קוֹמֶץ לְחוֹדֵיהּ תְּחִלָּה, וַהֲדַר בֵּין הַבֵּינַיִם. דְּאִי אָמְרַתְּ בֵּין הַבֵּינַיִם בְּרֵישָׁא — דִּילְמָא שִׁירַיִם נִינְהוּ וְהָווּ לְהוּ שִׁירַיִם שֶׁחָסְרוּ בֵּין קְמִיצָה [לְהַקְטָרָה], וְאָמַר מָר: שִׁירַיִם שֶׁחָסְרוּ בֵּין קְמִיצָה לְהַקְטָרָה אֵין מַקְטִירִין עֲלֵיהֶן אֶת הַקּוֹמֶץ.
human_translation: How does one perform Rabbi Ḥanina said: first burns the handful by itself, and then between. For if you say first between, perhaps they are remainders, and they are remainders that became reduced between taking the handful and burning, And the Master said: remainders that became reduced between taking the handful and the burning, one not burn the handful on their
llm_translation: How does one perform the incense offering? Rabbi Chanina said: He places the handful of incense first, and then adds more incense in between. For if you say he adds more incense in between at the beginning - perhaps they are considered separate handfuls, and they will be lacking the additional handful required between the handful and the burning on the altar. And Mar said: If they are lacking the additional handful between the handful and the burning, one does not burn the handful on them.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, הַשְׁתָּא נָמֵי אִיקְּרִי כָּאן: כֹּל שֶׁמִּמֶּנּוּ לָאִשִּׁים — הֲרֵי הוּא בְּבַל תַּקְטִירוּ.
human_translation: If so, now too, apply here Whatever is partly in fire is subject to do not burn.
llm_translation: If so, now it is called here: anyone who derives benefit from it is considered as if he has offered it up.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי: דְּמַקְטֵיר לֵיהּ לְשׁוּם עֵצִים, כְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״לְרֵיחַ נִיחוֹחַ״ אִי אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה, אֲבָל אַתָּה מַעֲלֶה לְשׁוּם עֵצִים.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, said that burns it for the purpose of wood. in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. As it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: for a sweet savor you not bring up However, you bring up for the purpose of wood.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehudah, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi: who would burn it for the sake of the fragrance of the wood, like Rabbi Eliezer. As it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer says: "for a pleasing aroma" you do not bring up, but you do bring up for the sake of the wood.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, אֶלָּא לְרַבָּנַן מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רַב מָרִי: דְּקָמְצִי שַׁמִּינֵי. הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָתֵית לְהָכִי, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר נָמֵי לְכַתְּחִילָּה דְּקָמְצִי שַׁמִּינֵי.
human_translation: well according to Rabbi Eliezer, but according to the Rabbis, what can be said? Rav Mari said: that fat take handfuls Now that you have arrived at this Rabbi Eliezer as well, that fat take handfuls ab initio ,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Hanicha to Rabbi Eliezer, rather to the Rabbis what can be said? Rav Mari said: 'I am cutting the eighth.' Now that you have come to this, Rabbi Eliezer also initially cuts the eighth."

hebrew_text: (בֵּין הַבֵּינַיִים, פָּשַׁט, וּמָחַץ, וּפִזֵּר, וְחִשֵּׁב, בַּחֲפִינַת חֲבֵירוֹ — סִימָן). בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: בֵּין הַבֵּינַיִם שֶׁל מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו מַהוּ? מַאי קָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ? אִי גָּמַר ״מְלֹא״ ״מְלֹא״ מֵהָתָם — הַיְינוּ הָךְ!
human_translation: Bein habeinayim , pashat , umaḥatz , ufizer , veḥishev , baḥafinat , ḥaveiro : a mnemonic Rav Pappa raised a dilemma: What is in-between of his handfuls? What is his dilemma? If he derives “full” “full” there, this is that
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Between the fingers, he spread, and he cut, and he scattered, and he calculated, in the manner of his friend - a sign. Rav Papa asked: What is the law regarding the space between the fingers of a full hand? What is he asking about? If he completed 'full' 'full' from there - that is it!" English translation:

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא הָכִי בָּעֵי לֵיהּ: ״מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו וְהֵבִיא״ בָּעֵינַן — וְהָא אִיכָּא, אוֹ דִילְמָא: ״וְלָקַח״ ״וְהֵבִיא״ בָּעֵינַן — וְהָא לֵיכָּא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised the dilemma his hands full and bring we require that is Or perhaps we require “And he shall take…and he shall bring” And that is not Let it stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa thus asked: "He should fill his hands and bring" - do we require? But there is, or perhaps: "and take" "and bring" do we require? But is there not? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: פְּשִׁיטָא לִי מְלֹא קוּמְצוֹ כִּדְקָמְצִי אִינָשֵׁי. בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: קָמַץ בְּרָאשֵׁי אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו, מַהוּ?
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: obvious to me his handfuls people take a handful, Rav Pappa raised a dilemma: What is he took a handful with his fingertips,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is obvious to me that a "kumtzo" (handful) is like the "kamtzi" (handful) of people. Rav Papa asked: If one clenches his fingers, what is the law?

hebrew_text: מִלְּמַטָּה לְמַעְלָה, מַהוּ? מִן הַצְּדָדִין, מַהוּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: what is downward upward what is from the sides, Let it stand
llm_translation: From below to above, what is it? From the sides, what is it? The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: פְּשִׁיטָא לִי ״מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו״ כִּדְחָפְנִי אִינָשֵׁי. בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: חָפַן בְּרָאשֵׁי אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו, מַהוּ? מִלְּמַטָּה לְמַעְלָה, מַהוּ? מִן הַצַּד, מַהוּ? חָפַן בְּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ וְקֵרְבָן זוֹ אֵצֶל זוֹ, מַהוּ? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: obvious to me “His hands full” people fill their hands, Rav Pappa raised a dilemma: What is scooped a handful with his fingertips? what is from downward upward? What is from the side? what is he scooped a handful with this and with this and brought them together? Let it stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is obvious to me "the fullness of his palms" like the palms of people. Rav Papa asked: If one clasps with the tips of his fingers, what is the ruling? From below to above, what is the ruling? From the side, what is the ruling? If one clasps with this and this and the middle one is adjacent to the other, what is the ruling? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי
human_translation: dilemma raised
llm_translation: Inquiry

hebrew_text: רַב פָּפָּא: דַּבְּקֵיהּ לְקוֹמֶץ בְּדוּפְנֵיהּ דְּמָנָא, מַאי? תּוֹךְ כְּלִי בָּעֵינַן — וְהָא אִיכָּא, אוֹ דִילְמָא: הַנָּחָה בְּתוֹכוֹ כְּתִקְנוֹ בָּעֵינַן — וְהָא לֵיכָּא. תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa: What he stuck the handful onto the side of the vessel? we require inside the vessel, and that is Or perhaps we require placed properly inside and that is not Let it stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa: If one attaches it to the handle of a vessel of Mana, what is the law? We require it to be inside a vessel - but there is one, or perhaps we require it to be left within it as it was originally set up - but there is none. The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי מָר בַּר רַב אָשֵׁי: אַפְכֵיהּ לְמָנָא וְדַבְּקֵיהּ לְקוֹמֶץ בְּאַרְעִיתֵיהּ דְמָנָא, מַהוּ? הַנָּחָה בְּתוֹכוֹ בָּעֵינַן — וְהָא אִיכָּא, אוֹ דִילְמָא הַנָּחָה כְּתִקְנוֹ בָּעִינַן — וְלֵיכָּא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi raised dilemma: What overturned the vessel and stuck handful to the underside of the vessel? we require inside and that is or perhaps we require placed properly and that is not Let it stand
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: Ba'ei Mar bar Rav Ashi: Apkeih lemana u'dabkeih lekometz be'ar'iteih d'mana, mah? Hanacha betocho banein - ve'ha ika, o dilmah hanacha ketikno banein - ve'leika? Teiku. English translation: Ba'ei the son of Mar, the son of Rav Ashi, asked: If one turns it over to count and sticks it into a heap in his field, what is the law? Do we require that it be left within it? But perhaps we require that it be left as it was arranged? And there is no resolution.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו שֶׁאָמְרוּ — מְחוּקוֹת, אוֹ גְדוּשׁוֹת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא לְרַב אָשֵׁי, תָּא שְׁמַע: מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו שֶׁאָמְרוּ — לֹא מְחוּקוֹת, וְלֹא גְּדוּשׁוֹת, אֶלָּא טְפוּפוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised a dilemma: the handfuls to which referred smoothed or overflowing? Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: Come hear The handfuls to which referred neither smoothed nor overflowing, but full,
llm_translation: Inquiry of Rav Papa: When they said "full of his fists" - are they referring to "mechukot" (laws) or "gedushot" (separations)? Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi, come and hear: When they said "full of his fists" - not laws, and not separations, but rather clumps.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: נִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם עַל הָרִצְפָּה וַאֲסָפוֹ פָּסוּל. מִן הַכְּלִי עַל הָרִצְפָּה וַאֲסָפוֹ — כָּשֵׁר.
human_translation: We learned there, the blood spilled on the floor and collected it it is disqualified, from the vessel onto the floor, and collected it it is valid.
llm_translation: We learned there: If the blood spilled on the floor and they gathered it - it is disqualified. If it spilled from the vessel onto the floor and they gathered it - it is valid.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְלָקַח מִדַּם הַפָּר״, מִדַּם הַנֶּפֶשׁ, וְלֹא מִדַּם הָעוֹר, וְלֹא מִדַּם הַתַּמְצִית.
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught “And shall take from the blood of the bull” from the blood of the soul, and not from the blood of the skin, nor from the blood squeezed
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What are these words?" The Rabbis taught: "And he shall take from the blood of the bull," from the blood of the soul, and not from the blood of the skin, and not from the blood of the essence.

hebrew_text: ״מִדַּם הַפָּר״, דָּם מֵהַפָּר יְקַבְּלֶנּוּ, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ ״מִדַּם הַפָּר״ — ״מִדָּם״, וַאֲפִילּוּ מִקְצָת דָּם, וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַמְקַבֵּל, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּקַבֵּל אֶת כׇּל דָּמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵת כׇּל דַּם הַפָּר יִשְׁפּוֹךְ אֶל יְסוֹד מִזְבַּח״.
human_translation: “from the blood of the bull,” Blood from the bull, receive it For if it should enter your mind “from the blood of the bull,” and even some of the blood, didn’t Rav Yehuda say: He who receives must receive all of the blood of bull, as it is stated: “And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out on the base of the altar”
llm_translation: "From the blood of the bull," blood from the bull he shall receive, for if you were to say "from the blood of the bull" - "from" even a small amount of blood. And Rav Yehudah said: One who receives, must receive all the blood of the bull, as it is stated: "And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out at the base of the altar."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: מַאי ״מִדַּם הַפָּר״ — דָּם מֵהַפָּר יְקַבְּלֶנּוּ. וְקָסָבַר: גּוֹרְעִין וּמוֹסִיפִין וְדוֹרְשִׁין.
human_translation: Rather, learn from this what is “From the blood of the bull”? receive blood from the bull. And maintains subtract and add and interpret homiletically,
llm_translation: Rather, hear the inference: What is "from the blood of the bull"? — Blood from the bull one should receive. And he holds: We diminish, add, and interpret.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: נִתְפַּזֵּר הַקְּטוֹרֶת מִמְּלוֹא חׇפְנָיו, מַהוּ? יָדוֹ כְּצַוַּאר בְּהֵמָה דָּמֵי — וּפְסוּלָה, אוֹ דִילְמָא כִּכְלִי שָׁרֵת דָּמֵי — וְלָא פְּסוּלָה? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised a dilemma What the incense from his handfuls scattered? his hand considered like the neck of the animal, and disqualified? Or perhaps is considered like a vessel used in the Temple service, and it is not disqualified. Let it stand
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Papa: If the incense scattered from the filling of his hands, what is the law? His hand is like the neck of an animal — and it is disqualified, or perhaps it is like a service vessel — and not disqualified? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: חִישֵּׁב בַּחֲפִינַת קְטוֹרֶת, מַהוּ? מִי אָמְרִינַן יָלֵיף ״מְלֹא״ ״מְלֹא״ מִמִּנְחָה, מָה הָתָם מַהְנְיָא בַּהּ מַחְשָׁבָה, הָכָא נָמֵי מַהְנְיָא בַּהּ מַחְשָׁבָה, אוֹ לֹא?
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised dilemma: What thought during the taking of the handful of the incense, Do we say is derived “handfuls” “handfuls,” from a meal-offering, Just as there, thought is effective it, so too thought is effective it? Or not
llm_translation: Ba'ei Rav Papa: He calculated in the preparation of the incense, what is it? Who said we derive "full" "full" from the meal offering, what is the relevance there of intention, here too what is the relevance here of intention, or not?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שִׁימִי בַּר אָשֵׁי לְרַב פָּפָּא: תָּא שְׁמַע: הוֹסִיף רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא (הַקּוֹמֶץ) וְהַקְּטוֹרֶת, וְהַלְּבוֹנָה, וְהַגֶּחָלִים, שֶׁאִם נָגַע טְבוּל יוֹם בְּמִקְצָתָן — פָּסַל אֶת כּוּלָּן.
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said to Rav Pappa: Come hear Rabbi Akiva added the handful and the incense, and the frankincense, and the coals that if one who immersed himself during the day touched part of them, he disqualifies all of them.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Shimi bar Ashi to Rav Papa: Come and hear: Rabbi Akiva added (the incense) and the ketoret, and the levonah, and the coals, that if a tevul yom touched any of them — he invalidates all of them.

hebrew_text: קָא סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ: מִדְּפָסַל טְבוּל יוֹם — פָּסְלָה נָמֵי לִינָה. וּמִדְּלִינָה פָּסְלָה — פָּסְלָה נָמֵי מַחְשָׁבָה.
human_translation: It enters your mind from one who immersed himself during the day disqualifies leaving likewise disqualifies and from leaving disqualifies thought likewise disqualifies
llm_translation: Your question is raised: From when a Tevul Yom disqualifies - she disqualified for sleep. And from sleep she disqualified - she disqualified for thought.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא:
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised dilemma:
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Papa:

hebrew_text: חִישֵּׁב בַּחֲתִיַּית גֶּחָלִים, מַהוּ? מַכְשִׁירֵי מִצְוָה כְּמִצְוָה דָּמוּ, אוֹ לָא? תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: What thought the raking of the coals? actions that facilitate a mitzva are considered like the mitzva Or not Let it stand
llm_translation: He thought in the Hatziyit of coals, what? Are they valid for a mitzvah like their blood, or not? Teiku.

hebrew_text: בְּעוֹ מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הוֹלָכָה בִּשְׂמֹאל, מַהוּ? אֲמַר לְהוּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: נָטַל אֶת הַמַּחְתָּה בִּימִינוֹ וְאֶת הַכַּף בִּשְׂמֹאלוֹ.
human_translation: raised a dilemma before Rav Sheshet: What carrying left said to them: We learned it; He took the coal pan in his right and the spoon in his left
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Be'u mineih mei Rav Sheshet: holakha bismol, mahu? Amar lehu Rav Sheshet, tenituhah: natal et hamakhtah biymino ve'et hakaf bismoloh." English translation: "They asked Rav Sheshet: If one is walking to the left, what is the law? Rav Sheshet said to them: We have learned it - he takes the pan in his right hand and the spoon in his left."

hebrew_text: וְנִפְשׁוֹט לְהוּ מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הָרֶגֶל שֶׁל יָמִין בִּשְׂמֹאל וּבֵית עוֹרָהּ לַחוּץ!
human_translation: And let us resolve for them from that which we learned the right leg left with its hide outward
llm_translation: And it was explained from that which we learned: The right foot over the left, and the house of its skin outside!

hebrew_text: אִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי הוֹלָכָה דְּלָא מְעַכְּבָא כַּפָּרָה, אֲבָל הוֹלָכָה דִּמְעַכְּבָא כַּפָּרָה — לָא, קָמַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: If from there, I would have said: That applies carrying that does not invalidate atonement, However, with regard to carrying that does invalidate atonement, no, teaches us
llm_translation: From there, I would say: those words of walking that do not delay the atonement, but walking that delays the atonement - no, it is evident to us.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: זָר, וְאוֹנֵן, שִׁיכּוֹר, וּבַעַל מוּם, בְּקַבָּלָה וּבְהוֹלָכָה וּבִזְרִיקָה — פָּסוּל. וְכֵן יוֹשֵׁב, וְכֵן שְׂמֹאל — פָּסוּל! תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: raises an objection to receiving, carrying, or sprinkling a non-priest, a mourner a drunk and a blemished disqualified. And likewise sitting, and likewise left disqualified. a conclusive refutation,
llm_translation: Challenger: A non-priest, a mourner, a drunkard, and a blemished person, in offering, in walking, and in sprinkling — disqualified. And likewise, one who is sitting, and likewise, one who is left-handed — disqualified! The challenge stands.

hebrew_text: וְהָא רַב שֵׁשֶׁת הוּא דְּאוֹתְבַהּ, דַּאֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שֵׁשֶׁת לְאָמוֹרֵיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, בְּעִי מִינֵּיהּ מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: הוֹלָכָה בְּזָר מַהוּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: כְּשֵׁירָה, וּמִקְרָא מְסַיְּיעֵנִי: ״וַיִּשְׁחֲטוּ הַפָּסַח וַיִּזְרְקוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים מִיָּדָם וְהַלְוִיִּם מַפְשִׁיטִים״!
human_translation: But wasn’t Rav Sheshet one who objected As Rav Sheshet said to the interpreter of Rav Ḥisda: Raise the dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: What carrying by a non-priest? He said to him: valid, and a verse supports me: “And they slaughtered the Paschal offering and the priests sprinkled with their hand, and the Levites flayed”
llm_translation: And this, Rav Sheshet is the one who was sitting, as Rav Sheshet said to his mother, the words of Rav Ḥisda, ask from him on behalf of Rav Ḥisda: Is walking with a Zar permissible? He said to him: It is permitted, and a verse supports me: "And they slaughtered the Passover sacrifice, and the priests sprinkled the blood which they received from their hands, while the Levites skinned the animals."

hebrew_text: וּמוֹתֵיב רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: זָר וְאוֹנֵן, שִׁיכּוֹר וּבַעַל מוּם, בְּקַבָּלָה וּבְהוֹלָכָה וּבִזְרִיקָה — פָּסוּל, וְכֵן יוֹשֵׁב וְכֵן שְׂמֹאל — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet objected to receiving, carrying, or sprinkling a non-priest, a mourner a drunk and a blemished disqualified.
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet responds: A non-Jew, a mourner, a drunkard, a person with a blemish, whether in receiving or walking or sprinkling — invalid. And likewise, one who is sitting and likewise one who is left-handed — invalid.

hebrew_text: בָּתַר דְּשַׁמְעַהּ הֲדַר אוֹתְבַהּ. וְהָא רַב חִסְדָּא קְרָא קָאָמַר? דַּעֲבוּד מַעֲשֵׂה אִיצְטְבָא.
human_translation: After heard he objected But didn’t Rav Ḥisda cite a verse that they acted like benches
llm_translation: After he heard, he returned and sat down. But didn't Rav Ḥisdah say? "The work of the hands is established."

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא: חָפַן חֲבֵירוֹ, וְנָתַן לְתוֹךְ חׇפְנָיו מַהוּ? ״מְלֹא חׇפְנָיו״ בָּעֵינַן, וְהָא אִיכָּא! אוֹ דִילְמָא: ״וְלָקַח״ ״וְהֵבִיא״ בָּעֵינַן? וְהָא לֵיכָּא! תֵּיקוּ.
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised a dilemma: What another scooped and placed into the hands we require: “His full hands,” and that is Or perhaps we require “And he shall take…and he shall bring” and that is not Let it stand
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rav Papa: If one covers his friend's hand, and places something into his hand, what is the law? "Filling his hand" we require, and there is a case! Or perhaps "and take" "and bring" we require? And there is a case! Let it stand undecided.

hebrew_text: בָּעֵי רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: חָפַן וָמֵת, מַהוּ שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס אַחֵר בַּחֲפִינָתוֹ? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שְׁאֵלַת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi raised a dilemma: scooped and died, what that another enter with his handful? Rabbi Ḥanina said Come and see the question of the earlier
llm_translation: Inquiries of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: If a person turned pale and died, what should one who enters after his paleness do? Rabbi Chanina said: Come and see the question of the earlier ones.

hebrew_text: לְמֵימְרָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי קַשִּׁישׁ? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לִי הִתִּיר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא לִשְׁתּוֹת שַׁחֲלַיִים בְּשַׁבָּת!
human_translation: Is that to say that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi older But didn’t Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi say: Rabbi Ḥanina permitted me to drink cress juice on Shabbat
llm_translation: In the matter of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi is it difficult? But Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Rabbi Chanina permitted me to drink shachaliyim on Shabbat!

hebrew_text: לִשְׁתּוֹת, פְּשִׁיטָא? דִּתְנַן: כׇּל הָאוֹכָלִין אוֹכֵל אָדָם לִרְפוּאָה, וְכׇל הַמַּשְׁקִין שׁוֹתֶה!
human_translation: to drink obvious As we learned All food may be eaten by people for medicinal drink all drinks
llm_translation: To drink, obviously? For it was taught: All foods a person eats for healing, and all drinks one drinks!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לִשְׁחוֹק וְלִשְׁתּוֹת שַׁחֲלַיִים בְּשַׁבָּת. הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִי דְּאִיכָּא סַכַּנְתָּא — מִשְׁרָא שְׁרֵי. וְאִי דְּלֵיכָּא סַכַּנְתָּא — מֵיסָר אֲסִיר! לְעוֹלָם דְּאִיכָּא סַכַּנְתָּא, וְהָכִי קָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: מִי מַסְּיָא, דְּנֵיחוּל עֲלַיְיהוּ שַׁבְּתָא, אוֹ לָא מַסְּיָא וְלָא נֵיחוּל עֲלַיְיהוּ שַׁבְּתָא.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi’s to grind and drink cress on Shabbat? What are the circumstances? If where there is danger it is permitted; and if where there is no danger, prohibited Actually, where there is danger, and this is the dilemma that he raised before him: Does heal, that to violate Shabbat for it, or not heal, and not violate Shabbat for it?
llm_translation: Rather: for jesting and drinking alcoholic beverages on Shabbat. What is the case? If there is danger - it is permitted. And if there is no danger - it is forbidden! Indeed, if there is danger, and thus he inquires: Who can testify that they have a need for Shabbat, or who cannot testify and does not have a need for Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא? מִשּׁוּם דְּבָקִי בִּרְפוּאוֹת הוּא. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא שְׁאָלַנִי אָדָם עַל מַכַּת פִּרְדָּה לְבָנָה וְחָיָה.
human_translation: And what is different Rabbi Ḥanina? because he is an expert in medicines, as Rabbi Ḥanina said: No man ever consulted me about a wound white mule and recovered.
llm_translation: And what is the difference of Rabbi Chanina? Because he was expert in healing. For Rabbi Chanina said: "No one has ever asked me about a white mule's disease, and it lived."

hebrew_text: וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּחַיֵּי! אֵימָא: וְחָיָית. וְהָא קָא חָזֵינַן דְּמִיתַּסִּי! בְּסוּמָּקָן אִינְהוּ וְחִיוָּרָן רֵישׁ כַּרְעַיְהוּ קָאָמְרִינַן.
human_translation: But we see that do survive. say: and survives, But we see that does heal. We say when are red and the tops of their legs are white.
llm_translation: And here we see that he is alive! Say: "And you shall live." And here we see that he is dead! They are lying in the depth and their heads are between their knees.

hebrew_text: מִכׇּל מָקוֹם, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ דְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא קַשִּׁישׁ? אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: שְׁאֵלָתָן כִּשְׁאֵילָה שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹנִים.
human_translation: In any event, learn from this that Rabbi Ḥanina older Rather, this is he said, Their question is like the question of the early ones.
llm_translation: From every place, hear the type of Rabbi Chanina Kasha? Rather, this is what he is saying: Their question is like the questioning of the early authorities.

hebrew_text: וּמֵי אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: ״בְּפַר״, וְלֹא בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר.
human_translation: And did Rabbi Ḥanina say that But didn’t Rabbi Ḥanina say: with a bull” with a bull and not with the blood of bull?
llm_translation: And who said this? Rabbi Chanina said thus? But didn't Rabbi Chanina say, "with a bull," and not with the blood of a bull.

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: קְטוֹרֶת שֶׁחֲפָנָהּ קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטַת הַפָּר לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: scooped the incense before the slaughtering of the bull, he did nothing,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina said: The incense whose hand has touched it before the slaughter of the cow, he did not do and not anything!

hebrew_text: הָכִי קָאָמַר: מִדְּקָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ, הָא מִכְּלָל דְּקָסָבַר ״בְּפַר״, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר. וּלְמַאי דִּסְבִירָא לֵיהּ — שְׁאִילָתוֹ כִּשְׁאֵילַת הָרִאשׁוֹנִים.
human_translation: this is said: From raised this dilemma, by inference that he holds “with a bull” even with the blood of a bull. And according to that which maintains, his question is like the question of the earlier
llm_translation: So it is stated: From when does he require it? This is to include that he holds "in a bull," even with the blood of a bull. And the reason he includes it is because his inquiry is like the inquiry of the earlier ones.

hebrew_text: מַאי הָוֵי עֲלַהּ? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אִי חוֹפֵן חוֹזֵר וְחוֹפֵן — חֲבֵירוֹ נִכְנָס בַּחֲפִינָתוֹ — דְּהָא מִקַּיְימָא חֲפִינָה. אִי אֵין חוֹפֵן וְחוֹזֵר וְחוֹפֵן — תִּבְּעֵי לָךְ.
human_translation: What was about Rav Pappa said: If scoops again scoops another enter with the handful as scooping fulfilled. if not scoop and again scoop, let the dilemma be raised.
llm_translation: What is the ruling regarding it? Rav Papa said: If one turns back and forth, his fellow enters his domain, for the boundary is established. If one does not turn back and forth, he demands it from you.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: אַדְּרַבָּה, אִי חוֹפֵן וְחוֹזֵר וְחוֹפֵן, לֹא יִכָּנֵס אַחֵר בַּחֲפִינָתוֹ — אִי אֶפְשָׁר שֶׁלֹּא יְחַסֵּר וְשֶׁלֹּא יוֹתִיר. וְאִי אֵין חוֹפֵן חוֹזֵר וְחוֹפֵן — תִּיבְּעֵי לָךְ.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: On the contrary, if scoops and again scoops, another not enter with his handful, it is impossible will be neither less nor more But if he does not scoop and again scoop, let the dilemma be raised,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rav Papa: "Adraba, if one turns back and forth repeatedly, another should not enter his space - lest he neither lack nor have excess. And if one does not turn back and forth repeatedly - you should ask."

hebrew_text: דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: חוֹפֵן חוֹזֵר וְחוֹפֵן, אוֹ לָא? תָּא שְׁמַע: כָּךְ הָיְתָה מִידָּתָהּ. מַאי לָאו: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמִּדָּתָהּ מִבַּחוּץ כָּךְ מִדָּתָהּ מִבִּפְנִים!
human_translation: As a dilemma was raised before scoop and again scoop a handful or not Come hear This was the measure What, is it not just as its measure on the outside, so is its measure on the inside,
llm_translation: He wanted to say to them: Does it turn back and forth, or not? Come and hear: Thus was her measure. What is the reason? Just as her measure is from the outside, so is her measure from within!

hebrew_text: לָא, דִּילְמָא שֶׁאִם רָצָה לַעֲשׂוֹת מִדָּה — עוֹשֶׂה, אִי נָמֵי: שֶׁלֹּא יְחַסֵּר וְשֶׁלֹּא יוֹתִיר.
human_translation: No, Perhaps that if he wants to measure amount he may measure Alternatively, that neither less nor more
llm_translation: Not, perhaps, that if he wants to do a measure - he does, yes: that he should not diminish and that he should not add.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע:
human_translation: Come hear
llm_translation: Come and hear:

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד הוּא עוֹשֶׂה? אוֹחֵז אֶת הַבָּזֵךְ בְּרֹאשׁ אֶצְבְּעוֹתָיו, וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים בְּשִׁינָּיו, וּמַעֲלֶה בְּגוּדָלוֹ עַד שֶׁמַּגַּעַת לְבֵין אַצִּילֵי יָדָיו, וְחוֹזֵר וּמַחְזִירָהּ לְתוֹךְ חׇפְנָיו, וְצוֹבְרָהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא עֲשָׁנָהּ שׁוֹהֶה לָבוֹא. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: מְפַזְּרָהּ, כְּדֵי שֶׁיְּהֵא עֲשָׁנָהּ מְמַהֶרֶת לָבוֹא.
human_translation: How should act he holds the the ladle, with his fingertips, and some say with his teeth. And raises up with his thumb until it reaches between his elbows, He then returns into his palms, And he heaps so that its smoke rises slowly. And some say he scatters it so that its smoke rises quickly.
llm_translation: How does one do it? He holds the bazek with the tips of his fingers, and some say with his teeth, and raises it to the height that it touches between the joints of his fingers, then he returns it to his palm, and accumulates it, so that its smoke equalizes to enter. And some say: he scatters it, so that its smoke hastens to enter.

hebrew_text: וְזוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָה קָשָׁה שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ. זוֹ הִיא וְתוּ לָא? וְהָא אִיכָּא מְלִיקָה! וְהָא אִיכָּא קְמִיצָה! אֶלָּא: זוֹ הִיא עֲבוֹדָה קָשָׁה מֵעֲבוֹדוֹת קָשׁוֹת שֶׁבַּמִּקְדָּשׁ. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: חוֹפֵן וְחוֹזֵר וְחוֹפֵן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And this is difficult rite in the Temple. This one and no other? But there is pinching, and there is taking a handful Rather, this is of difficult rites in the Temple, learn from this scoops and again scoops. learn from this
llm_translation: And this is the difficult service in the Temple. Is this it, or not? But there is salting! But there is roasting! Rather, this is the most difficult service among the difficult services in the Temple. Learn from it: turning and returning and turning. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: שָׁחַט וָמֵת, מַה הוּא שֶׁיִּכָּנֵס אַחֵר בְּדָמוֹ? מִי אָמְרִינַן: ״בְּפַר״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר, אוֹ דִילְמָא: ״בְּפַר״ — וְלֹא בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before slaughtered and died, what is another enter with the blood Do we say with a bull” and even with the blood of a bull Or perhaps “With a bull,” and not with the blood of a bull
llm_translation: He asked them: If one slaughtered and died, what is the law regarding another animal entering with its blood? Do we say, "with a bull," — even with the blood of a bull, or perhaps, "with a bull," — but not with the blood of a bull.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא אוֹמֵר: ״בְּפַר״ — וְלֹא בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר, וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: ״בְּפַר״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר. רַבִּי אַמֵּי אָמַר: ״בְּפַר״ — וְלֹא בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר, רַבִּי יִצְחָק אָמַר: ״בְּפַר״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּדָמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: “With a bull,” and not with the blood of a bull, And Reish Lakish said: “With a bull,” and even with the blood of a bull. Rabbi Ami said: “With a bull” and not with the blood of a bull; Rabbi Yitzḥak said: “With a bull,” and even with the blood of a bull.
