llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina says: "In a bull" - and not in the blood of a bull. Reish Lakish says: "In a bull" - even in the blood of a bull. Rabbi Ammi says: "In a bull" - and not in the blood of a bull. Rabbi Yitzchak says: "In a bull" - even in the blood of a bull.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי לְרַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: נִמְנִין וּמוֹשְׁכִין יְדֵיהֶן מִמֶּנּוּ עַד שֶׁיִּשָּׁחֵט, וְאִם אִיתָא — ״עַד שֶׁיִּזְרוֹק״ מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Ami raised an objection to Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa, register and they withdraw from it until is slaughtered. And if it is so, should have said until is sprinkled.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Rabbi Ammi to Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha: They are counted and they extend their hands from him until he is slaughtered, and if it comes up - "until he is sprinkled" is what he requires!

hebrew_text: שָׁנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״מִהְיוֹת מִשֶּׂה״ — מֵחַיּוּתֵהּ דְּשֶׂה.
human_translation: It is different there, as it is written: for a lamb [ mehiyot miseh ], meiḥiyutei deseh ,
llm_translation: Two there, for it is written: "From the life of Moses" - from the life of sheep.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב מָר זוּטְרָא: וְאֵין פּוֹדִין — לֹא בָּעֵגֶל וְלֹא בְּחַיָּה וְלֹא בִּשְׁחוּטָה וְלֹא בִּטְרֵיפָה וְלֹא בְּכִלְאַיִם וְלֹא בְּכוֹי, אֶלָּא בְּשֶׂה. שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דְּיָלֵיף ״שֶׂה״ ״שֶׂה״ מִפֶּסַח.
human_translation: Mar Zutra raised an objection: And one may not redeem with a calf, nor with an undomesticated animal, nor with a slaughtered nor with an animal with a condition that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], nor with crossbreeding nor with a koy , but with a lamb. It is different there, as derives “lamb” “lamb” from the Paschal offering:
llm_translation: The Master Zutra raises an objection: "And one does not redeem - neither with a calf, nor with a beast, nor with a slaughtered animal, nor with a treifah, nor with a mixture of species, nor with a blemish, but with a sheep." The difference there is that it is derived "sheep" "sheep" from Passover.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה לְהַלָּן זָכָר תָּם וּבֶן שָׁנָה, אַף כָּאן זָכָר תָּם וּבֶן שָׁנָה? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תִּפְדֶּה״ ״תִּפְדֶּה״ רִיבָּה.
human_translation: If just as there, male, unblemished, and a year old, so too here, a male unblemished and a year old. the verse states: “You shall redeem,” “you shall redeem,” amplify
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If there, male, unblemished, and a year old, so too here, male, unblemished, and a year old? The Torah teaches: "You shall redeem," "You shall redeem," it multiplies.

hebrew_text: אִי ״תִּפְדֶּה״ ״תִּפְדֶּה״ רִיבָּה, אֲפִילּוּ כּוּלְּהוּ נָמֵי! אִם כֵּן, ״שֶׂה״ מַאי אַהֲנִי לֵיהּ?
human_translation: If “You shall redeem” “you shall redeem” amplify, even all also If so, what purpose does “lamb” serve?
llm_translation: "If 'redeem' redeem, it is a repetition, even all of them agree! If so, what does 'sheep' contribute to it?"

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי: ״וְהוֹצִיא אֶת כׇּל הַפָּר״! שֶׁיּוֹצִיא אֶת כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa raised an objection to Rabbi Ami: “And he shall remove the entire bull that he should remove the entire
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Rabbi Yitzchak Nappacha to Rabbi Amei: "And he shall bring out the entire bull!" - that he shall bring out all of it.

hebrew_text: ״וְאֵת פַּר הַחַטָּאת וְאֵת שְׂעִיר הַחַטָּאת״, אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: בְּעוֹר וּבָשָׂר וָפֶרֶשׁ דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי. כִּי פְּלִיגִי בְּדָם. מָר סָבַר: דָּם אִיקְּרִי פַּר, וּמָר סָבַר: דָּם לָא אִיקְּרִי פַּר.
human_translation: “And the bull of the sin-offering and the goat of the sin-offering, Rav Pappa said: Everyone agrees that with its hide, its flesh, and its excrement, When they disagree to blood. One Sage holds blood is called a bull, and one Sage holds blood is not called a bull.
llm_translation: "And the bull of the sin offering and the goat of the sin offering," Rav Papa said: In skin and flesh and hide, they do not differ. For they differ in blood. One Master holds: Blood is essential for the bull, and one Master holds: Blood is not essential for the bull."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּם אִיקְּרִי פַּר, דִּכְתִיב: ״בְּזֹאת יָבֹא אַהֲרֹן אֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ בְּפַר בֶּן בָּקָר״, אַטּוּ בְּקַרְנֵיהּ מְעַיֵּיל לֵיהּ?! אֶלָּא בְּדָמוֹ, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״פַּר״.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: It is reasonable in accordance with the one who said blood is called bull, as it is written: “With this Aaron shall come into the sacred place, with a bull” Is that to say he brings in, with its horns? Rather, with its blood, and calls that “a bull.”
llm_translation: Rav Ashei said: It appears as if one who says that blood is called a bull, as it is written: "With this shall Aaron enter the holy place: with a bull of the herd." Should he bring its horns with him?! Rather, with its blood, and it is called a "bull."

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? בַּמָּה הוּכְשַׁר אַהֲרֹן לָבֹא אֶל הַקֹּדֶשׁ — בְּפַר בֶּן בָּקָר לְחַטָּאת.
human_translation: And the other one, With what did Aaron become qualified to enter the sacred place? With a young bull for a sin-offering.
llm_translation: And the other? With what was Aharon fit to enter the Holy of Holies - with a bull of the herd for a sin offering.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ דְּחַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ הִיא, וְחַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ לְמִיתָה אָזְלָא! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא לְרָבָא: אָמְרִי תַּלְמִידָיךָ, אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם: חַטַּאת צִבּוּר הִיא, וְלָא לְמִיתָה אָזְלָא.
human_translation: And let him derive that it is a sin-offering whose owners have died. a sin-offering whose owners have died is left to die, Ravin bar Rav Adda said to Rava: Your students say Rav Amram said is a communal sin-offering, is not left to die.
llm_translation: And let it emerge that the sin offering whose owners died, it is hers, and the sin offering whose owners died, it goes to death! Rabin son of Rav Adda said to Rava: Your disciples said, Rav Amram said: It is a communal sin offering, and it does not go to death.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן, אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: וַהֲלֹא פַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וַחֲבִיתֵּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וּפֶסַח — דְּקָרְבַּן יָחִיד הוּא, וְדוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה. לָאו מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּצִבּוּר?
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Meir said to him: But the Yom Kippur bull, and the meal-offering resembling a wafer High Priest, and Paschal offering, is an individual offering and overrides Shabbat and ritual impurity. not by inference that there is one who says that communal?
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Meir said to him: But isn't the bull of Yom Kippur, and the woodpile of the High Priest, and the Passover offering — all individual offerings, and they override the Sabbath and impurity? Is it not evident that this is in accordance with the opinion of the one who said that the communal offering takes precedence?

hebrew_text: וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, דְּקָתָנֵי: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: וַהֲלֹא פַּר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר, וּשְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וַחֲגִיגָה — דְּקָרְבַּן צִבּוּר, וְאֵין דּוֹחִין לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה! מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּיָחִיד!
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, that taught Rabbi Ya’akov said to him: But bull for an unwitting communal sin, and the goats for idolatry, Festival peace-offering, which communal offerings and override neither Shabbat nor ritual impurity. by inference that there is one who says that individual
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, for it was taught: Rabbi Yaakov said to him: But isn't the bull of the sin-offering of the congregation, and the he-goats of foreign worship, and the festival offering — which is a communal offering, and do not override neither the Sabbath nor impurity! From which it can be inferred that it is in accordance with the opinion of the one who says it is an individual!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: לְתַנָּא קַמָּא קָא מַהְדַּר לֵיהּ, דְּשַׁמְעֵיהּ דְּקָאָמַר: קׇרְבַּן צִבּוּר דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, וְקָרְבַּן יָחִיד אֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי מֵאִיר: קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד כְּלָלָא הוּא? וַהֲלֹא פַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וַחֲבִיתֵּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, וּפֶסַח — דְּקָרְבַּן יָחִיד הוּא, וְדוֹחִין אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה!
human_translation: Rather, responded to the first tanna , as he heard him say Communal sacrifices override Shabbat and ritual impurity, but individual sacrifices override neither Shabbat nor ritual impurity. Rabbi Meir said to him: an individual offering principle? But the Yom Kippur bull, and the meal-offering resembling a wafer High Priest, and Paschal offering, is an individual offering and overrides Shabbat and ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Rather: to the first Tanna he responded, for he heard him saying: The communal offering overrides the Sabbath and impurity, but an individual offering does not override either the Sabbath or impurity. Rabbi Meir said to him: Is an individual offering a general principle? But is it not the bull of Yom Kippur, and the handfuls of the High Priest, and the Passover offering — which are individual offerings, and yet they override the Sabbath and impurity!

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב: קׇרְבַּן צִבּוּר כְּלָלָא הוּא? וַהֲלֹא פַּר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר, וּשְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וַחֲגִיגָה — דְּקָרְבַּן צִבּוּר הוּא, וְאֵין דּוֹחִין לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה!
human_translation: And Rabbi Ya’akov responded to a communal offering principle, But bull for an unwitting communal sin, and the goats for idolatry, Festival peace-offering, which communal offerings and override neither Shabbat nor ritual impurity.
llm_translation: And he said to him, Rabbi Yaakov: Is a communal offering considered a general principle? But isn't the bull of the sin-offering a matter of the community, and the goats of foreign worship, and the festival offering - they are all communal offerings, and we do not override either the Sabbath or impurity!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, נְקוֹט הַאי כְּלָלָא בִּידָךְ: כֹּל שֶׁזְּמַנּוֹ קָבוּעַ — דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה אֲפִילּוּ בְּיָחִיד, וְכֹל שֶׁאֵין זְמַנּוֹ קָבוּעַ — אֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה לֹא אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְלֹא אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּצִבּוּר.
human_translation: Rather, grasp this principle: Any that a fixed time overrides Shabbat and ritual impurity even if individual and any of no fixed time overrides neither Shabbat nor ritual impurity, and even is a communal
llm_translation: Rather, grasp this principle in your hand: Anything whose time is fixed overrides the Sabbath and ritual impurity even for an individual, and anything whose time is not fixed does not override neither the Sabbath nor ritual impurity, even in a communal setting.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: פַּר וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁאָבְדוּ, וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן — כּוּלָּם יָמוּתוּ. וְכֵן שְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁאָבְדוּ, וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן — כּוּלָּם יָמוּתוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר) וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ וְיִמָּכְרוּ וְיִפְּלוּ דְּמֵיהֶן לִנְדָבָה, שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה.
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to bull and goat of Yom Kippur that were lost, and he separated others in their stead, all shall die. And likewise, goats for idolatry that were lost and he separated others in their stead, all of them shall die. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: They shall graze until they become unfit, they are sold and their proceeds go free-will offering, as a communal sin-offering is not die.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him, Abaye: A bull and a goat of Yom Kippur that got lost, and others were designated in their place - all of them shall die. And similarly, the goats of foreign worship that got lost, and others were designated in their place - all of them shall die, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi (Eliezer) and Rabbi Shimon say: Let them graze until they get blemished, and then be sold, and their value be used for a donation, for the communal sin-offering does not die.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מַאי פַּר — פַּר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר. וְהָא ״שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים״ קָתָנֵי! כִּי קָתָנֵי — אַדְּשָׂעִיר.
human_translation: said to What bull bull for an unwitting communal sin. But taught: Of Yom Kippur, When taught: to the goat.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is "par" - a bull that is a communal offering. But isn't it taught "of Yom Kippur"? When it is taught - a goat.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: פַּר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁאָבְדוּ וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן — כּוּלָּם יָמוּתוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר) וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ וְיִמָּכְרוּ וְיִפְּלוּ דְּמֵיהֶן לִנְדָבָה, שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught the bull of Yom Kippur and the goat of Yom Kippur that were lost and he separated others in their stead, all shall die. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: They shall graze until they become unfit, they are sold and their proceeds go free-will offering, as a communal sin-offering is not die.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: And it was taught: The bull of Yom Kippur and the goat of Yom Kippur that got lost, and others were designated in their place - all of them shall die, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi (Eliezer) and Rabbi Shimon say: They shall graze until they become blemished, then be sold, and their value shall be used for a donation, for the communal sin-offering does not die.

hebrew_text: לָא תֵּימָא: ״שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה״, אֶלָּא אֵימָא: ״שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת הַשּׁוּתָּפִין מֵתָה״. וּמַאי נָפְקָא מִינַּהּ?
human_translation: Do not say: As a communal sin-offering is not die. Rather, say: As a sin-offering of partners is not die. And what is practical difference
llm_translation: Do not say: "That the communal sin-offering does not die," but rather say: "That the partnership sin-offering does not die." And what is derived from it?

hebrew_text: דְּלָא מַיְיתוּ כֹּהֲנִים פַּר בְּהוֹרָאָה.
human_translation: that priests do not bring a bull for ruling,
llm_translation: The priests did not bring a bull for instruction.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּבָעֵי רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר):
human_translation: Come hear, as Rabbi Elazar raised dilemma:
llm_translation: Come and hear, the words of Rabbi Eliezer:

hebrew_text: לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר פַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה אוֹ אֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה. לָאו מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּצִבּוּר?
human_translation: to who says bull of Yom Kippur an offering an individual, perform substitution or not perform substitution not by inference that there is one who says that communal?
llm_translation: According to the one who says a bull of Yom Kippur is an individual offering, does he make an exchange or does he not make an exchange? Is it not from the fact that there is someone who says it is a communal offering?

hebrew_text: לָא, מִכְּלָל דְּאִיכָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דְּשׁוּתָּפִין.
human_translation: No, by inference that there is one who says that of partners.
llm_translation: No, from the fact that there is someone who says that they are partners.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. בָּעֵי רַבִּי (אֱלִיעֶזֶר): לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר פַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה אוֹ אֵינוֹ עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה. מַאי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ?
human_translation: the matter itself. Rabbi Elazar asked: to who says bull of Yom Kippur an individual offering, perform substitution or not perform substitution? What is the dilemma he is raising?
llm_translation: Body. The students of Rabbi (Eliezer) asked: According to the one who says that the bull of Yom Kippur is a private offering, does he perform an exchange or does he not perform an exchange? What is he inquiring about?

hebrew_text: אִי בָּתַר מַקְדִּישׁ אָזְלִינַן, אִי בָּתַר מִתְכַּפֵּר אָזְלִינַן.
human_translation: Do we follow who consecrates Or do we follow who seeks atonement
llm_translation: If after sanctifying we go, if after atoning we go.

hebrew_text: פְּשִׁיטָא דְּבָתַר מִתְכַּפֵּר אָזְלִינַן, דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: הַמַּקְדִּישׁ — מוֹסִיף חוֹמֶשׁ, וְהַמִּתְכַּפֵּר — עוֹשֶׂה (בָּהּ) תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: obvious that we follow who seeks atonement, as Rabbi Abbahu said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: one who consecrates he adds a fifth And the one for whom atones perform substitution for it,
llm_translation: The simple understanding is that after the redemption, we go, as Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who sanctifies - adds a fifth, and one who redeems - makes an exchange.

hebrew_text: וְהַתּוֹרֵם מִשֶּׁלּוֹ עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ — טוֹבַת הֲנָאָה שֶׁלּוֹ!
human_translation: And one who separates from his for of another, benefit of discretion is his,
llm_translation: The one who lifts from his own onto that of his fellow - his benefit is good!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ דְּבָתַר מִתְכַּפֵּר אָזְלִינַן, וְהָכִי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים בִּקְבִיעוּתָא מִתְכַּפְּרִי, אוֹ דִילְמָא בְּקוּפְיָא מִתְכַּפְּרִי.
human_translation: Actually, obvious to that we follow who seeks atonement and this is his dilemma: his fellow priests achieve atonement by the essence Or perhaps they achieve atonement incidentally,
llm_translation: Always the simple interpretation is that after the fact he atones, and thus he is asking: Do his priestly brothers atone regularly, or perhaps they atone occasionally.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: חוֹמֶר בְּזֶבַח מִבִּתְמוּרָה, וְחוֹמֶר בִּתְמוּרָה מִבְּזֶבַח. חוֹמֶר בְּזֶבַח: שֶׁהַזֶּבַח נוֹהֵג בְּיָחִיד כִּבְצִבּוּר, וְדוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה, וְעוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה — מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בִּתְמוּרָה.
human_translation: Come hear a stricture to the sacrifice, beyond to the substitute; and a stricture to the substitution, beyond to the sacrifice. a stricture to the sacrifice, as the sacrifice applies to an individual as to a community, and overrides Shabbat and ritual impurity, perform substitution which is not to the substitute,
llm_translation: Come and hear: A stringency in a sacrifice from a designated offering, and a stringency in a designated offering from a sacrifice. A stringency in a sacrifice: for the sacrifice is performed by an individual like by the community, and overrides the Sabbath and impurity, and allows substitution - which is not the case with a designated offering.

hebrew_text: חוֹמֶר בִּתְמוּרָה מִבְּזֶבַח: שֶׁהַתְּמוּרָה חָלָה עַל בַּעַל מוּם קָבוּעַ, וְאֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה לְחוּלִּין לִיגָּזֵז וְלֵיעָבֵד — מַה שֶּׁאֵין כֵּן בְּזֶבַח.
human_translation: a stricture to the substitute beyond to the sacrifice, that substitution takes effect on a permanently blemished animal. And cannot vacate non-sacred to be sheared and to be worked, which is not to the sacrifice,
llm_translation: Material in exchange from sacrifice: that the exchange is valid on a blemished animal, and it does not go out to profane use to be redeemed and to be enslaved - that which is not so with a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: הַאי זֶבַח הֵיכִי דָמֵי? אִילֵּימָא דְּיָחִיד — מִי דָּחֵי שַׁבָּת וְטוּמְאָה? אֶלָּא דְּצִבּוּר — מִי עוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה? אֶלָּא לָאו דְּפַר, וְדוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה — דִּקְבִיעַ לֵיהּ זְמַן, וְעוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה — דְּקָרְבַּן יָחִיד הוּא.
human_translation: What are the circumstances this sacrifice? If we say of an individual, does override Shabbat and ritual impurity? Rather, of a community, can perform substitution Rather, is it not with bull, overrides Shabbat and ritual impurity, as that a fixed time? And perform substitution as it is an offering an individual.
llm_translation: This sacrifice, how are its blood? If you say it is for an individual - who overrides Shabbat and impurity? Rather, it is for the community - who makes an exchange? Rather, it is not a bull, and it overrides Shabbat and impurity - because a fixed time is established for it, and it makes an exchange - for it is a private offering.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לָא, בְּאֵילוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: No, to ram of Aaron
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: No, in the ram of Aharon.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּפָרוֹ, תְּמוּרָה דְּפַר שַׁבָּת וְטוּמְאָה הוּא דְּלָא דָּחֲיָא, הָא בְּחוֹל מִיקְרָב קָרְבָה?! הָא תְּמוּרַת חַטָּאת הִיא, וּתְמוּרַת חַטָּאת לְמִיתָה אָזְלָא!
human_translation: So, too, it is reasonable for if it should enter your mind with the bull of it Shabbat and ritual impurity substitution of the bull does not override, one sacrifice on a weekday? It is a substitute for a sin-offering, and the substitute for a sin-offering is left to die.
llm_translation: Thus it was stated: For if it were to enter your mind that a bullock, the substitute of a bullock that is fit for Shabbat and impurity, is not rejected, then on a weekday when it is close, is it not brought near?! This is the substitute of a sin-offering, and the substitute of a sin-offering goes to death!

hebrew_text: לָא, לְעוֹלָם פָּרוֹ. וּמַאי תְּמוּרָה — שֵׁם תְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: No, actually bull of and what is the substitution category substitution,
llm_translation: Not, always cow. And what is the exchange? - The name of the exchange.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, זֶבַח נָמֵי — שֵׁם זֶבַח? שֵׁם זֶבַח לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: If so, also sacrifice category sacrifices, not teaching category sacrifices,
llm_translation: If so, "sacrifice of faith" - the name of the sacrifice? The name of the sacrifice is not stated.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי — מִדְּקָתָנֵי: חוֹמֶר בִּתְמוּרָה, שֶׁהַתְּמוּרָה חָלָה עַל בַּעַל מוּם קָבוּעַ, וְאֵינָהּ יוֹצְאָה לְחוּלִּין לִיגָּזֵז וְלֵיעָבֵד. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ: מַאי זֶבַח — שֵׁם זֶבַח, וְהָא אִיכָּא
human_translation: From where From that it is taught: a stricture to the that substitution takes effect on a permanently blemished animal, and cannot vacate non-sacred to be sheared and to be worked. And should it enter your mind What is sacrifice category sacrifices; there is
llm_translation: From what — from where does it teach: a stringency in exchange, that the exchange takes effect on a blemished animal, and it does not go out to be redeemed or to be worked. And if you should say: what is a sacrifice — the name of a sacrifice, and there is this.

hebrew_text: בְּכוֹר וּמַעֲשֵׂר, דְּחָלִין עַל בַּעַל מוּם קָבוּעַ, וְאֵין יוֹצְאִין לְחוּלִּין לִיגָּזֵז וְלֵיעָבֵד. אֶלָּא שֵׁם זֶבַח לָא קָתָנֵי.
human_translation: a firstborn or tithe, takes effect on a permanently blemished animal, and cannot vacate non-sacred to be sheared and to be worked. Rather, not teaching category of sacrifices,
llm_translation: Firstborn and tithe, are disqualified on a permanent blemish, and do not fulfill their obligation for regular offerings to be redeemed or lost. Rather, the term "sacrifice" is not mentioned.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא? תְּמוּרָה — שֵׁם תְּמוּרָה אַחַת הִיא. זֶבַח — אִיכָּא בְּכוֹר וְאִיכָּא מַעֲשֵׂר.
human_translation: And what is different Substitution is one category, sacrifices, there is a firstborn and there is tithe,
llm_translation: And what is the difference? Temurah - the name Temurah is one. Zevach - there is a firstborn and there is a tithe.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב שֵׁשֶׁת, אַדְּמוֹקֵים לַהּ בְּאֵילוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן, לוֹקְמַהּ בְּפֶסַח, דְּדוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה וְעוֹשֶׂה תְּמוּרָה, דְּקׇרְבַּן יָחִיד הוּא? קָסָבַר: אֵין שׁוֹחֲטִין הַפֶּסַח עַל הַיָּחִיד.
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet, rather than establishing as the ram of Aaron, let him establish with the Paschal offering, which overrides Shabbat and ritual impurity and perform substitution as is the offering of an individual. maintains not slaughter the Paschal lamb on behalf of an individual,
llm_translation: To Rav Sheshet, they compare it to the ram of Aaron, it is established on Passover, that it overrides the Sabbath and impurity and allows substitution, as it is a private offering? He holds: One does not slaughter the Passover offering for an individual.

hebrew_text: וְנוֹקְמֵיהּ בְּפֶסַח שֵׁנִי! מִי דָּחֵי טוּמְאָה?
human_translation: And let establish to the second Pesaḥ , Does override ritual impurity?
llm_translation: And its avengers in the second Passover! Who pushes aside impurity?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרָבָא: וְתַנָּא, מַאי שְׁנָא פֶּסַח דְּקָרֵי לֵיהּ קׇרְבַּן יָחִיד, וּמַאי שְׁנָא חֲגִיגָה דְּקָרֵי לַהּ קׇרְבַּן צִיבּוּר? אִי מִשּׁוּם דְּאָתֵי בְּכִנּוּפְיָא — פֶּסַח נָמֵי אָתֵי בְּכִנּוּפְיָא? אִיכָּא פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי דְּלָא אָתֵי בְּכִנּוּפְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: And tanna what is different the Paschal offering, that he calls it the offering an individual? And what is different Festival peace-offering, that he calls it a communal offering? If because is brought by a multitude, the Paschal offering is also brought by a multitude, There is the second Pesaḥ , which is not brought by a multitude,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rava: And it was taught, what is the difference between the Pesach offering that is called a private offering, and the Chagigah offering that is called a communal offering? If it is because it comes with its wings - the Pesach offering also comes with its wings? There is a second Pesach offering that does not come with its wings.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִם כֵּן יְהֵא דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת וְאֶת הַטּוּמְאָה! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אִין, כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּחֵי, דְּתַנְיָא: פֶּסַח שֵׁנִי דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת, וְאֵינוֹ דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַף דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַטּוּמְאָה. מַאי טַעְמָא דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא — אָמַר לָךְ: מִפְּנֵי טוּמְאָה דְּחִיתוֹ וְיֵעָשֶׂה בְּטוּמְאָה?!
human_translation: He said to him: If so, it should override Shabbat and ritual impurity. He said to him: Yes, in accordance with the one who said overrides As it was taught The second Pesaḥ overrides Shabbat, but it does not override ritual impurity. Rabbi Yehuda says: even overrides ritual impurity. What is the reason of the first tanna ? said to you because ritual impurity overrode his And he perform second Pesaḥ in ritual impurity?
llm_translation: He said to him: If so, let it override the Sabbath and impurity! He said to him: No, like the one who said it overrides, as it was taught: The second Passover overrides the Sabbath, but it does not override impurity. Rabbi Yehuda says: It also overrides impurity. What is the reason for the first teaching? It tells you: Because of impurity they pushed it off, so it should be done in impurity?!

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר לָךְ, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כְּכׇל חֻקַּת הַפֶּסַח יַעֲשׂוּ אוֹתוֹ״, וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה. הַתּוֹרָה הֶחְזִירָה עָלָיו לַעֲשׂוֹתוֹ בְּטׇהֳרָה, לֹא זָכָה — יַעֲשֶׂנּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said to you the verse states: “According to all the statute of the Paschal offering they shall keep it” even in ritual impurity, The Torah sought for to perform it in ritual purity; he did not merit he should perform it in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to you, the verse says: "According to all the statutes of the Passover they shall keep it," even in a state of impurity. The Torah returned it to be done in purity, if one did not merit — they shall do it in impurity.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לִי דַּ״אֲשֶׁר לוֹ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא — מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא מֵבִיא.
human_translation: And let me derive the Merciful One states: which is for himself” brings from his own
llm_translation: And it shall be derived for me "that which is his," the Merciful One said - it is his own, he brings.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לוֹ״ — מִשֶּׁלּוֹ הוּא מֵבִיא, וְלֹא מִשֶּׁל צִיבּוּר. יָכוֹל לֹא יָבִיא מִשֶּׁל צִיבּוּר — שֶׁאֵין הַצִּיבּוּר מִתְכַּפְּרִין בּוֹ, אֲבָל יָבִיא מִשֶּׁל אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים — שֶׁהֲרֵי אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים מִתְכַּפְּרִים בּוֹ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲשֶׁר לוֹ״.
human_translation: As it was taught “Which is for himself” he brings from his own and not from of the community. might not bring from of the community the community does not gain atonement through it, but bring from of his fellow priests, as his fellow priests do gain atonement through it. the verse states: “Which is for himself,”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "That which is his" - he brings from his own, and not from communal property. One might have thought that he should not bring from communal property - because the community is not atoned for through it, but he may bring from the property of his fellow priests - for indeed his fellow priests are atoned for through it, as it is taught: "That which is his."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל לֹא יָבִיא, וְאִם הֵבִיא כָּשֵׁר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר שׁוּב: ״אֲשֶׁר לוֹ״ — שָׁנָה הַכָּתוּב עָלָיו לְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: might not bring but he did bring valid. the verse states again: which is for himself” the text repeats this is indispensable
llm_translation: He is able not to bring, and if he brought valid — the Talmud teaches to say return: "that he has" — the Scripture repeated concerning him to delay.

hebrew_text: וְלִיטַעְמָיךְ, אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים אִי לָאו דְּקָנוּ בְּגַוֵּיהּ הֵיכִי מְכַפַּר לְהוּ? אֶלָּא שָׁאנֵי בֵּי גַזָּא דְּאַהֲרֹן דְּאַפְקְרֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים. הָכָא [גַּבֵּי תְּמוּרָה] נָמֵי: שָׁאנֵי בֵּי גַזָּא דְּאַהֲרֹן דְּאַפְקְרֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא גַּבֵּי אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים.
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, if his fellow priests do not acquire in how does it atone for them? Rather, the property [ bei gazza ] of Aaron is different that the Merciful One rendered it ownerless with regard to his fellow priests. here too, with regard to substitution, the property of Aaron is different that the Merciful One rendered it ownerless with regard to his fellow priests.
llm_translation: And to sweeten it, his priestly brothers, if not that they acquired in his body, how do they atone for him? Rather, it is different in the house of Giza of Aaron, that the Merciful One appointed in place of his priestly brothers. Here regarding exchange it is also the same: it is different in the house of Giza of Aaron, that the Merciful One appointed in place of his priestly brothers.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ בַּהֵיכָל עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְבֵין שְׁתֵּי הַפָּרוֹכֹת הַמַּבְדִּילוֹת בֵּין הַקֹּדֶשׁ וּבֵין קֹדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים, וּבֵינֵיהֶן אַמָּה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיְתָה שָׁם אֶלָּא פָּרוֹכֶת אַחַת בִּלְבַד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהִבְדִּילָה הַפָּרוֹכֶת לָכֶם בֵּין הַקֹּדֶשׁ וּבֵין קֹדֶשׁ הַקֳּדָשִׁים״.
human_translation: would walk through the Sanctuary until he reaches between the two curtains that separated the Sanctuary and the Holy of Holies, and between them cubit. Rabbi Yosei says: There was only one curtain there, as it is stated: “And the curtain shall divide for you between the Sanctuary and the Holy of Holies”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: He would walk in the Sanctuary until he reached between the two curtains that separated between the Holy and the Holy of Holies, and between them was a cubit. Rabbi Yosei says: There was only one curtain there, as it is stated: "And the curtain shall separate for you between the Holy and the Holy of Holies."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ שַׁפִּיר קָאָמַר לְהוּ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי לְרַבָּנַן! וְרַבָּנַן אָמְרִי לְךָ: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּמִשְׁכָּן, אֲבָל בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי כֵּיוָן דְּלָא הֲוַאי אַמָּה טְרַקְסִין, וּבְמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן הוּא דַּהֲוַאי, וְאִיסְתַּפַּקָא לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן בִּקְדוּשְּׁתֵיהּ, אִי כְּלִפְנִים אִי כְּלַחוּץ, וַעֲבוּד שְׁתֵּי פָּרוֹכֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei is saying well to the Rabbis, And the Rabbis say to you: This applies in the Tabernacle, However, in the Second Temple, since there was no one-cubit partition teraksin ] as it in the First Temple that there was and the Rabbis were uncertain with regard to the sanctity whether of the inside or of the outside prepared two curtains
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "G'ma Shapir ka'amar lehu Rabbi Yosei l'Rabanan! VeRabanan amri lekha: hanei milei b'mishkan, aval b'mikdash sheini keivan de'lau havai amah trak'sin, u'v'mikdash rishon hu dehavai, ve'is'tapak'a lehu l'Rabanan b'k'dush'seih, i k'lifnim i k'lachutz, va'avud shtei parokhot." Translation: "An excellent point Rabbi Yosei made to the Rabbis! And the Rabbis say to you: these matters are regarding the Tabernacle, but in the Second Temple since it was not an amah thick, and in the First Temple it was, and it is a question for the Rabbis in its sanctity, whether it is considered inside or outside, and the service of the two curtains."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בֵּין הַמִּזְבֵּחַ לַמְּנוֹרָה הָיָה מְהַלֵּךְ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: בֵּין שֻׁלְחָן לַמִּזְבֵּחַ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: בֵּין שֻׁלְחָן לַכּוֹתֶל. מַאן יֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הִיא, דְּאָמַר: פִּיתְחָא בְּצָפוֹן קָאֵי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: he walked between the altar and the candelabrum. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says between the table and the altar. And some say between the table and the wall. Whose Some say? Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yosei who said entrance was positioned in the north.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Between the altar and the menorah he would walk, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: Between the table and the altar. And some say: Between the table and the wall. Who are the some who say? Rav Ḥisda said: It is Rabbi Yosei, who said: The entrance is in the north.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר לָךְ: פִּיתְחָא בְּדָרוֹם קָאֵי. וְרַבִּי מֵאִיר כְּמַאן סְבִירָא לֵיהּ? אִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סְבִירָא לֵיהּ — נֵיעוּל כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אִי כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ — נֵיעוּל כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי!
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda he said to you entrance was positioned in the south. And Rabbi Meir, in accordance with whose does he hold? If he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda enter as Rabbi Yehuda; if he holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, he enter as Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said to you: the opening is in the south. And Rabbi Meir, according to whom does he hold? If he holds like Rabbi Yehudah - let him go in the way of Rabbi Yehudah, and if he holds like Rabbi Yosei - let him go in the way of Rabbi Yosei!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סְבִירָא לֵיהּ, וַאֲמַר לְךָ: שׁוּלְחָנוֹת צָפוֹן וְדָרוֹם מוּנָּחִין, וּמַפְסְקָא לֵיהּ שֻׁלְחָן וְלָא מִתְעַיֵּיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Actually, holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, and he said to you: The tables, were arranged north to south, and the table blocked him and could not enter
llm_translation: Forever as Rabbi Yosei S'vira holds, and he said to you: "His tables north and south are placed, and the conclusion for him is a table, and not he is pleased with it."

hebrew_text: וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: לְעוֹלָם מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב מוּנָּחִין, וּמִשּׁוּם שְׁכִינָה לָאו אוֹרַח אַרְעָא
human_translation: And if you wish, say Actually the were arranged east to west, and due to the Divine Presence, it was not proper conduct
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "Always, east and west are settled, and because of the Divine Presence, not the way of the land."

hebrew_text: לְמֵיעַל לְהֶדְיָא. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אָמַר לָךְ: חֲבִיבִין יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁלֹּא הִצְרִיכָן הַכָּתוּב לְשָׁלִיחַ.
human_translation: to enter directly, And Rabbi Yosei said to you: The Jewish people are beloved as the Torah did not require them of an agent,
llm_translation: "Regarding the matter of Hedyah. And Rabbi Yosei said to her: Beloved are the children of Israel, for the Scripture did not need to appoint them as messengers."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה נָמֵי, נֵיעוּל בֵּין מְנוֹרָה לְכוֹתֶל! מַשְׁחֲרִי מָאנֵיהּ.
human_translation: But Rabbi Yehuda, too, let enter between candelabrum and the wall. blacken his clothes
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehudah Nami, locked between the menorah and the wall! He refused.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי נָתָן: אַמָּה טְרַקְסִין, לֹא הִכְרִיעוּ בּוֹ חֲכָמִים אִי כְּלִפְנִים אִי כְּלַחוּץ.
human_translation: Rabbi Natan said: one-cubit partition, the Sages did not determine whether of the inside or of the outside
llm_translation: Rabbi Natan said: "An amah of trakhsin, the sages did not rule upon it, whether it is like inside or like outside."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבִינָא: מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַבַּיִת אֲשֶׁר בָּנָה הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה לַה׳ שִׁשִּׁים אַמָּה אׇרְכּוֹ וְעֶשְׂרִים רׇחְבּוֹ וּשְׁלֹשִׁים אַמָּה קוֹמָתוֹ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְאַרְבָּעִים בָּאַמָּה הָיָה הַבָּיִת הוּא הַהֵיכָל לִפְנָי״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְלִפְנֵי הַדְּבִיר עֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה אוֹרֶךְ וְעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה רוֹחַב וְעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה קוֹמָתוֹ״, וְלָא יָדְעִינַן אַמָּה טְרַקְסִין אִי מֵהָנֵי עֶשְׂרִים, וְאִי מֵהָנֵי אַרְבָּעִים.
human_translation: Ravina strongly objects to this What is the reason If we say because it is written: “And the House that King Solomon built for the Lord was sixty cubits in length, and its width was twenty cubits, and its height was thirty cubits” and it is written: “And the House, that is, the Sanctuary, was forty cubits long” and it is written: “And before the partition twenty cubits in length, and twenty cubits in width, and twenty cubits in height” and we do not know whether the one-cubit partition of these twenty of these forty
llm_translation: Ravina objects to this: What is the reason? Perhaps because it is written: "The house that King Solomon built for the Lord was sixty cubits in length, twenty cubits in width, and thirty cubits in height," and it is also written: "The house was forty cubits long before the sanctuary," and it is also written: "And before the oracle there was twenty cubits in length, twenty cubits in width, and twenty cubits in height," and we do not know whether a cubit is twenty or forty.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא לָא מֵהָנֵי עֶשְׂרִין וְלָא מֵהָנֵי אַרְבְּעִין, וַחֲלָלָא קָא חָשֵׁיב, כְּותָלִים לָא קָא חָשֵׁיב. תִּדַּע, דְּכֹל הֵיכָא דְּקָא חָשֵׁיב כְּותָלִים — חָשֵׁיב לֵיהּ לְדִידֵיהּ,
human_translation: But perhaps not of these twenty nor of these forty counts the space does not count walls Know as anywhere that counts the walls counts
llm_translation: Perhaps it is not from the twenty and not from the forty, and the space is considered, it is not considered like walls. Know that wherever it is considered like walls - it is considered for itself.

hebrew_text: דִּתְנַן: הַהֵיכָל מֵאָה עַל מֵאָה בְּרוּם מֵאָה. כּוֹתֶל אוּלָם חָמֵשׁ, וְהָאוּלָם אַחַת עֶשְׂרֵה, כּוֹתֶל הַהֵיכָל שֵׁשׁ, וְאׇרְכּוֹ אַרְבָּעִים אַמָּה, וְאַמָּה טְרַקְסִין, וְעֶשְׂרִים אַמָּה בֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, כּוֹתֶל הַהֵיכָל שֵׁשׁ, וְהַתָּא שֵׁשׁ, וְכוֹתֶל הַתָּא חָמֵשׁ.
human_translation: As we learned The Sanctuary one hundred by one hundred with a height of one hundred wall of the Entrance Hall five and the Entrance Hall eleven wall of the Sanctuary six length forty cubits; and one-cubit partition; Hall of Holy of Holies twenty cubits; wall of the Sanctuary six and the chamber six and the wall of the chamber five
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: The Sanctuary is one hundred cubits by one hundred cubits, and its height is one hundred cubits. The wall of the Hall is five cubits, and the Hall itself is eleven cubits. The wall of the Sanctuary is six cubits, and its length is forty cubits, and a cubit and a half, and twenty cubits the Holy of Holies. The wall of the Sanctuary is six cubits, and the Chamber is six cubits, and the wall of the Chamber is five cubits.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא קְדוּשְּׁתֵיהּ אִי כְּלִפְנִים אִי כְּלַחוּץ.
human_translation: Rather, its sanctity, whether like the inside or like the outside
llm_translation: Rather, its holiness is either like inside or like outside.

hebrew_text: וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, בָּעֵי יוֹסֵף אִישׁ הוּצָל: ״וּדְבִיר בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת מִפְּנִימָה הֵכִין לְתִתֵּן שָׁם אֶת אֲרוֹן בְּרִית ה׳״. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵיכִי קָאָמַר קְרָא:
human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Yosef of Hutzal raised a dilemma “And he prepared a partition in the midst of the House within to set there the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord” dilemma was raised before what is speaking?
llm_translation: And this is what Rabbi Yochanan said, Yosef the man of Hutzal asked: "And the inner sanctuary within the house he prepared to place there the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord." The question was asked: How is the verse saying?

hebrew_text: ״וּדְבִיר בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת מִפְּנִימָה הֵכִין לְתִתֵּן שָׁם״, אוֹ דִילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״וּדְבִיר בְּתוֹךְ הַבַּיִת מִפְּנִימָה״?
human_translation: And prepared a partition in the midst of the House within to set there, Or perhaps this is states: A partition in the midst of the House within,
llm_translation: "And the Holy of Holies within the house he prepared to place there," or perhaps it means: "And the Holy of Holies within the house from within?"

hebrew_text: וּמִי מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ? וְהַתַּנְיָא, אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חָמֵשׁ מִקְרָאוֹת בַּתּוֹרָה אֵין לָהֶן הֶכְרֵעַ:
human_translation: And was uncertain But wasn’t it taught Isi ben Yehuda says: five verses in the Torah whose cannot be decided,
llm_translation: And who is in doubt about it? And it was taught: Issi ben Yehuda says: Five verses in the Torah do not have a definitive resolution.

human_translation: “ Se’et ”
llm_translation: "Se'et."

hebrew_text: ״מְשׁוּקָּדִים״.
human_translation: “ Meshukkadim ”
llm_translation: "Meshukadim."

human_translation: “ Maḥar ”
llm_translation: "Tomorrow."

hebrew_text: ״אָרוּר״.
human_translation: “ Arur ”
llm_translation: "Arur."

human_translation: “ Vekam ”
llm_translation: "And he arose."

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: הוּא יוֹסֵף אִישׁ הוּצָל, הוּא יוֹסֵף הַבַּבְלִי, הוּא אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה, הוּא אִיסִי בֶּן גּוּר אַרְיֵה, הוּא אִיסִי בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, הוּא אִיסִי בֶּן מַהֲלַלְאֵל, וּמָה שְׁמוֹ — אִיסִי בֶּן עֲקִיבָא שְׁמוֹ. בִּדְאוֹרָיְיתָא — לֵיכָּא, בְּדִנְבִיאֵי — אִיכָּא.
human_translation: And wasn’t it taught Yosef of Hutzal is the Yosef the Babylonian, he is Isi ben Yehuda, he is Isi ben Gur Arye, he is Isi ben Gamliel; he is Isi ben Mahalalel? And what is his name? Isi ben Akiva is his name. In the Torah no in the Prophets there are
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: He was Yosef Ish Hutzal, he was Yosef the Babylonian, he was Issi ben Yehuda, he was Issi ben Gur Aryeh, he was Issi ben Gamliel, he was Issi ben Mahalalel, and what is his name? Issi ben Akiva is his name. In matters of the Torah - there is, in matters of the Prophets - there is.

hebrew_text: וּבִדְאוֹרָיְיתָא לֵיכָּא? וְהָא אִיכָּא דְּבָעֵי רַב חִסְדָּא: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח אֶת נַעֲרֵי בְּנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וַיַּעֲלוּ עוֹלוֹת כְּבָשִׂים וַיִּזְבְּחוּ זְבָחִים שְׁלָמִים פָּרִים״ — אוֹ דִילְמָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי פָּרִים! לְרַב חִסְדָּא מְסַפְּקָא לֵיהּ, לְאִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה פְּשִׁיטָא לֵיהּ.
human_translation: And in the Torah are there no But there is dilemma that Rav Ḥisda raised “And he sent the young men of the children of Israel who sacrificed burnt-offerings” sheep, “And sacrificed peace-offerings of bulls to the Lord,” Or perhaps these and these bulls, according to Rav Ḥisda was uncertain obvious to Isi ben Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is it not derived from the Torah? But there is where Rav Ḥisda sought to say: "And he sent the youths of the children of Israel, and they brought burnt offerings of lambs and sacrificed peace offerings of oxen" — or perhaps both oxen! For Rav Ḥisda, it is a dilemma; for Issi ben Yehuda, it is obvious.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ הַחִיצוֹנָה הָיְתָה פְּרוּפָה מִן הַדָּרוֹם, וּפְנִימִית מִן הַצָּפוֹן. מְהַלֵּךְ בֵּינֵיהֶן, עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לַצָּפוֹן. הִגִּיעַ לַצָּפוֹן — הוֹפֵךְ פָּנָיו לַדָּרוֹם, מְהַלֵּךְ לִשְׂמֹאלוֹ עִם הַפָּרוֹכֶת עַד שֶׁהוּא מַגִּיעַ לָאָרוֹן,
human_translation: The outer was hooked [ perufa ] on the south and inner hooked on the north walks between until he reaches the north. he reaches the north, turns his face to the south, walks to his left along the curtain until he reaches the Ark.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: The outer altar was protruding from the south, and the inner altar from the north. One walks between them until reaching the north. When one reaches the north, he turns his face to the south, walks to his left with the curtain until he reaches the Ark.

hebrew_text: הִגִּיעַ לָאָרוֹן — נוֹתֵן אֶת הַמַּחְתָּה בֵּין שְׁנֵי הַבַּדִּים. צָבַר אֶת הַקְּטֹרֶת עַל גַּבֵּי גֶּחָלִים, וְנִתְמַלֵּא כָּל הַבַּיִת כּוּלּוֹ עָשָׁן. יָצָא וּבָא לוֹ בְּדֶרֶךְ בֵּית כְּנִיסָתוֹ, וּמִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה בַּבַּיִת הַחִיצוֹן. וְלֹא הָיָה מַאֲרִיךְ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ, שֶׁלֹּא לְהַבְעִית אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: he reaches the Ark, he places the coal pan between the two staves. He piles the incense atop coals, and the whole chamber in its entirety would fill with smoke. He exits and comes the way he entered. And he recites a brief prayer in the outer chamber, And he would not extend his prayer so as not to alarm the Jewish people,
llm_translation: He reached the Ark - he places the fire-pan between the staves. He piled the incense upon the coals, and the entire house was filled with smoke. He went out and came to his place of entry to the outer chamber, and he prayed a brief prayer in the outer house. And he did not prolong his prayer, so as not to trouble Israel.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִילֵימָא בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, מִי הֲווֹ פָּרוֹכֶת? אֶלָּא בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, מִי הֲוָה אָרוֹן?
human_translation: With what are we dealing If we say about the First Temple, were there curtains Rather, with the Second Temple, was there an Ark
llm_translation: We are dealing with what? Perhaps in the First Temple, what was the Parochet? Rather, in the Second Temple, what was the Ark?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מִשֶּׁנִּגְנַז אָרוֹן — נִגְנְזָה עִמּוֹ צִנְצֶנֶת הַמָּן, וּצְלוֹחִית שֶׁמֶן הַמִּשְׁחָה, וּמַקְלוֹ שֶׁל אַהֲרֹן וּשְׁקֵדֶיהָ וּפְרָחֶיהָ, וְאַרְגַּז שֶׁשִּׁגְּרוּ פְּלִשְׁתִּים דּוֹרוֹן לֵאלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּכְלֵי הַזָּהָב אֲשֶׁר הֲשֵׁיבוֹתֶם לוֹ אָשָׁם תָּשִׂימוּ בָאַרְגַּז מִצִּדּוֹ וְשִׁלַּחְתֶּם אוֹתוֹ וְהָלָךְ״.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught when Ark was buried, along with it was buried the jar of manna and the flask of oil used for anointing, and Aaron’s staff with its almonds and blossoms, and the chest that the Philistines sent as a gift [ doron ] to the God of Israel as it is stated: “And put the jewels of gold that you return to Him for a guilt-offering, in a coffer by its side, and send it away that it may go”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: From when the Ark was hidden - the jar of manna was hidden with it, and the cruse of anointing oil, and Aaron's staff and its almonds and blossoms, and the chest in which the Philistines sent back their guilt offering to the God of Israel, as it is said: "And the golden mice, according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, both fortified cities and country villages, even to the great stone, on which they set down the Ark of the Lord."

hebrew_text: וּמִי גְּנָזוֹ — יֹאשִׁיָּהוּ גְּנָזוֹ. מָה רָאָה שֶׁגְּנָזוֹ? רָאָה שֶׁכָּתוּב: ״יוֹלֵךְ ה׳ אוֹתְךָ וְאֶת מַלְכְּךָ אֲשֶׁר תָּקִים עָלֶיךָ״, עָמַד וּגְנָזוֹ.
human_translation: And who buried Josiah, buried it. And what did he see that bury it? He saw that it is written: “The Lord will bring you, and your king whom you shall set over you, he arose and buried it.
llm_translation: "And who hid it? Josiah hid it. What did he see that he hid it? He saw that it is written: 'The Lord will carry you and your king whom you set over you,' so he stood and hid it."

hebrew_text: שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לַלְוִיִּם הַמְּבִינִים לְכׇל יִשְׂרָאֵל הַקְּדוֹשִׁים לַה׳ תְּנוּ אֶת אֲרוֹן הַקּוֹדֶשׁ בַּבַּיִת אֲשֶׁר בָּנָה שְׁלֹמֹה בֶן דָּוִד מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל אֵין לָכֶם מַשָּׂא בַּכָּתֵף עַתָּה עִבְדוּ אֶת ה׳ אֱלֹהֵיכֶם וְאֵת עַמּוֹ יִשְׂרָאֵל״.
human_translation: As it is stated: “And he said to the Levites who taught all of Israel, who were sacred to the Lord: Put the sacred Ark in the house that Solomon, son of David, king of Israel, built. There shall no more be a burden upon your shoulders; now serve the Lord your God, and His people Israel”
llm_translation: As it is stated: "And he said to the Levites who understand all of Israel, the holy ones to the Lord, 'Put the holy ark in the house that Solomon son of David, king of Israel, built. You shall no longer carry it on your shoulders. Now serve the Lord your God and His people Israel.'"

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אָתְיָא ״שָׁמָּה״ ״שָׁמָּה״, וְאָתְיָא ״דּוֹרוֹת״ ״דּוֹרוֹת״.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: is derived there there, And it is derived “Generations” “generations”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: It is written "Shamah" "Shamah," and it is written "Dorot" "Dorot."

hebrew_text: וְאָתְיָא ״מִשְׁמֶרֶת״ ״מִשְׁמֶרֶת״.
human_translation: And it is derived “safekeeping” “safekeeping”
llm_translation: And it was taught: "Mishmeret" "Mishmeret."

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, וּמַאי ״הִגִּיעַ לָאָרוֹן״ — מְקוֹם אָרוֹן. וְהָא קָתָנֵי: נָתַן אֶת הַמַּחְתָּה לְבֵין שְׁנֵי הַבַּדִּים! אֵימָא: ״כְּבֵין שְׁנֵי הַבַּדִּים״.
human_translation: Actually, to the Second Temple, and what is Reaches the Ark? place of the Ark. But it is taught he places the coal pan between the two staves, say: As between the two staves,
llm_translation: Always in the second Temple, and what is "he reached the Ark" - the place of the Ark. And this is what it teaches: he placed the censer between the two staves! Say: "between the two staves."

hebrew_text: צָבַר אֶת הַקְּטֹרֶת עַל גַּבֵּי גֶּחָלִים. תְּנַן כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר צוֹבְרָהּ. תָּנֵי חֲדָא: צוֹבְרָהּ פְּנִימָה שֶׁהִיא חוּצָה לוֹ. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: צוֹבְרָהּ חוּצָה שֶׁהִיא פְּנִימָה לוֹ.
human_translation: He piles the incense atop coals. We learned in accordance with the one who said he piles It was taught one He piles closest which is farthest from And it was taught in another He piles it farthest which is closest to him.
llm_translation: He gathered the incense on top of the coals. We learned in accordance with whom who said, "He gathers it." One taught: He gathers it inside, which is outside to him. And it was taught elsewhere: He gathers it outside, which is inside to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. וְאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר פְּנִימָה שֶׁהִיא חוּצָה לוֹ — דִּתְנַן, מְלַמְּדִין אוֹתוֹ: הִזָּהֵר
human_translation: Abaye said this is tanna’im . And Abaye said: It is reasonable in accordance with the one who said closest which is farthest from him. As we learned they teach Be careful
llm_translation: Abaye said: It is taught in a Baraita. And Abaye said: It makes sense according to the one who says that the inside is considered outside for him - as we learned, they caution him: Be careful.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא תַּתְחִיל מִפָּנֶיךָ, שֶׁמָּא תִּכָּוֶה.
human_translation: not to begin in front of you, lest you be burned.
llm_translation: That you not begin from yourself, lest you be reproached.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְנָתַן אֶת הַקְּטוֹרֶת עַל הָאֵשׁ לִפְנֵי ה׳״ — שֶׁלֹּא יְתַקֵּן מִבַּחוּץ וְיַכְנִיס. לְהוֹצִיא מִלִּבָּן שֶׁל צַדּוּקִין, שֶׁאוֹמְרִים יְתַקֵּן מִבַּחוּץ וְיַכְנִיס.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And he shall put the incense upon the fire before the Lord” he not prepare outside, and bring to exclude the opinion of the Sadducees, who say he prepare outside bring
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And he shall place the incense upon the fire before the Lord" - that he should not prepare it outside and then bring it in. To remove it from the heart of the Sadducees, who say he should prepare it outside and then bring it in.

hebrew_text: מַאי דְּרוּשׁ? ״כִּי בֶּעָנָן אֵרָאֶה עַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיְּתַקֵּן מִבַּחוּץ וְיַכְנִיס.
human_translation: What did interpret; “For I will appear in a cloud upon the Ark cover” teaches that he should prepare outside, he bring
llm_translation: What is the meaning of the verse? "For in a cloud I will appear upon the mercy seat" — this teaches that one should prepare from outside and then enter.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ לָהֶם חֲכָמִים, וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וְנָתַן אֶת הַקְּטוֹרֶת עַל הָאֵשׁ לִפְנֵי ה׳״. אִם כֵּן, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי בֶּעָנָן אֵרָאֶה עַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״ —
human_translation: The Sages said to them: Wasn’t it already stated “And he shall put the incense upon the fire before the Lord” If so, what the verse states: “For I will appear in a cloud upon the Ark cover”
llm_translation: They said to them, the sages, "But hasn't it already been said: 'And he shall put the incense upon the fire before the Lord'?" If so, what is the Talmud to say: "For in a cloud I will appear upon the mercy seat"?

hebrew_text: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנּוֹתֵן בָּהּ מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן. וּמִנַּיִין שֶׁנּוֹתֵן בָּהּ מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן? שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְכִסָּה עֲנַן הַקְּטוֹרֶת אֶת הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״. הָא לֹא נָתַן בָּהּ מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן, אוֹ שֶׁחִיסַּר אַחַת מִכׇּל סַמָּנֶיהָ — חַיָּיב מִיתָה.
human_translation: teaches that he includes a smoke-raiser in its And from where that he includes a smoke-raiser in its As it is stated: “And the incense cloud shall cover the Ark cover” he did not include a smoke-raiser, or if he omitted any one of its spices, he is liable death
llm_translation: The text teaches that one who puts in it (the incense offering) a higher level of smoke. And from where do we derive that one who puts in it a higher level of smoke? As it is stated: "And the cloud of the incense shall cover the cover" (Leviticus 16:13). If one did not put in it a higher level of smoke, or if he omitted one of all its ingredients, he is liable to receive the death penalty.

hebrew_text: וְתִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ — דְּקָא מְעַיֵּיל בִּיאָה רֵיקָנִית!
human_translation: And let derive as his entry for no purpose.
llm_translation: And let him go out - for he is causing an empty entrance!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: הָכָא בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן, כְּגוֹן שֶׁשָּׁגַג בְּבִיאָה, וְהֵזִיד בְּהַקְטָרָה.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: With what are we dealing here? where he unwittingly entry, and he intentionally with burning,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Here we are dealing with what? For example, one who unintentionally violated a prohibition regarding sexual relations, and intentionally violated a prohibition regarding incense.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא הֵזִיד בְּזוֹ וּבָזוֹ, וּכְגוֹן דְּעַיֵּיל שְׁתֵּי הַקְטָרוֹת, אַחַת שְׁלֵימָה וְאַחַת חֲסֵירָה. אַבִּיאָה לָא מִיחַיַּיב — דְּהָא עַיֵּיל לֵיהּ שְׁלֵימָה, אַהַקְטָרָה — מִיחַיַּיב, דְּקָא מַקְטַר קְטוֹרֶת חֲסֵירָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said Even you say he intentionally with both this and that, And where he brought two incense one complete and one incomplete, For entry he is not liable as he brought in complete for burning he is liable as he burns incomplete incense.
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Even if one intentionally mixed the full measure with the deficient measure, for example, if he brought two incense offerings, one complete and one deficient, if he brought it, he is not liable - because he brought the complete one, and the offering is valid.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: וּמִנַּיִין שֶׁנּוֹתֵן בָּהּ מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִסָּה״. קְרָא לִקְרָא?
human_translation: The Master said And from where that he includes a smoke-raiser in its The verse states: “And it shall cover” verse for verse?
llm_translation: Master said: And from where do we derive that one should place incense in it? Scripture states: "And cover." A verse for a verse?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא עֲלֵה מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן, עִיקַּר מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִסָּה״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is said; I have nothing other a leaf of a smoke-raising From where a root of a smoke-raiser? The verse states: “And it shall cover,”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said, thus he said: I have only the uppermost uppermost smoke, the essence of the uppermost smoke, from where? Scripture says: "And he shall cover."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְהָא אִיפְּכָא תַּנְיָא! דְּתַנְיָא: נָתַן בָּהּ עִיקַּר מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן, הָיָה מִתַּמֵּר וְעוֹלֶה כְּמַקֵּל עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לִשְׁמֵי קוֹרָה. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לִשְׁמֵי קוֹרָה, מְמַשְׁמֵשׁ וְיוֹרֵד בַּכּוֹתָלִים עַד שֶׁנִּתְמַלֵּא הַבַּיִת עָשָׁן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְהַבַּיִת יִמָּלֵא עָשָׁן״!
human_translation: Abaye said But wasn’t the opposite taught As it was taught He put into a root of a smoke-raiser, would rise in a column like a staff until it reached ceiling. When it reached ceiling descended the walls until the House was filled with smoke, as it is stated: “And the House was filled with smoke”
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: But isn't the Mishnah contradictory? For it was taught in a Mishnah: If one placed the main part of the incense offering in it, and it was transforming and rising like a stick until it reached the height of the ceiling. Once it reached the height of the ceiling, it would spread out and descend along the walls until the entire house was filled with smoke, as it is stated: "And the house was filled with smoke" (Isaiah 6:4)!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא עִיקַּר מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן, עֲלֵה מַעֲלֵה עָשָׁן מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִסָּה״.
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said this is said; I have nothing other a root of a smoke-raising From where a leaf of a smoke-raiser? The verse states: “And it shall cover.”
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said, thus he said: I have only the main principle of ascending smoke, from where do we know to ascend ascending smoke? The Talmud teaches: "And he shall cover."

hebrew_text: רַב שֵׁשֶׁת אָמַר: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד שֶׁבַּמִּדְבָּר. שִׁילֹה וּבֵית עוֹלָמִים מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִסָּה״.
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said I have nothing other the Tent of Meeting that in the wilderness; from where Shiloh and the eternal Temple The verse states: “And it shall cover,”
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: I have only the Tent of Meeting in the wilderness. How do we know about Shiloh and the Temple? The Talmud teaches: "And it shall be covered."

hebrew_text: הַאי, מִ״וְּכֵן יַעֲשֶׂה לְאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד הַשּׁוֹכֵן אִתָּם״ נָפְקָא!
human_translation: This is derived from “And so shall he do for the Tent of Meeting that dwells with them”
llm_translation: This, "And so he shall do for the Tent of Meeting, dwelling among them," is derived!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה מִנַּיִין? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכִסָּה״.
human_translation: Rather, this is said: I have nothing other on Yom Kippur from where on the rest of the days of the year The verse states: “And it shall cover,”
llm_translation: Rather, thus he said: I have only on Yom Kippur. How do we know for the rest of the days of the year? The Torah teaches: "And he shall atone."

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: חַד לְמִצְוָה, וְחַד לְעַכֵּב. רָבָא אָמַר: חַד לְעוֹנֶשׁ, וְחַד לְאַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: One the mitzva and one indispensable, Rava said: One punishment and one as a warning
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: One for the fulfillment of a commandment, and one for the delay. Rava said: One for punishment, and one for warning.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: ״וְלֹא יָמוּת״ — עוֹנֶשׁ, ״כִּי בֶּעָנָן אֵרָאֶה״ — אַזְהָרָה.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: that he not die” punishment “For I will appear in a cloud warning
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says: "And he shall not die" - punishment, "for in a cloud I will appear" - warning.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יִהְיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲמוּרִין קוֹדֶם מִיתַת בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַחֲרֵי מוֹת שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן״. יָכוֹל יִהְיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶם אֲמוּרִים אַחַר מִיתַת שְׁנֵי בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי בֶּעָנָן אֵרָאֶה עַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״. הָא כֵּיצַד? אַזְהָרָה קוֹדֶם מִיתָה, וְעוֹנֶשׁ אַחַר מִיתָה.
human_translation: might both were said before the deaths of Aaron’s sons, the verse states: “After the deaths of the two sons of Aaron” might both of them, were said after the deaths of Aaron’s two sons. the verse states: “For I will appear in a cloud upon the Ark cover How so; warning before death and the punishment after the death
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Could they both be said before the death of the sons of Aaron? The Torah says: "After the death of the two sons of Aaron." Could they both be said after the death of the two sons of Aaron? The Torah says: "For in the cloud I will appear over the mercy seat." How so? Warning before death, and punishment after death.

hebrew_text: מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר רָבָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״כִּי בֶּעָנָן אֵרָאֶה״ — וַעֲדַיִין לֹא נִרְאָה. וְאֶלָּא מַאי טַעְמָא אִיעֲנוּשׁ?
human_translation: What is the derivation? Rava said the verse states: “For I will appear in a cloud”; had not yet appeared, Rather, what is the reason were punished
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the Talmud? Rava said, a verse says: "For in a cloud I will appear" - and yet He has not appeared. So what is the reason for the punishment? English translation:

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: לֹא מֵתוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן אֶלָּא עַל שֶׁהוֹרוּ הֲלָכָה בִּפְנֵי מֹשֶׁה רַבָּן. מַאי דְּרוּשׁ? ״וְנָתְנוּ בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן הַכֹּהֵן אֵשׁ עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״ — אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהָאֵשׁ יוֹרֶדֶת מִן הַשָּׁמַיִם, מִצְוָה לְהָבִיא מִן הַהֶדְיוֹט.
human_translation: as it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Aaron’s sons died only because they taught a halakha before Moses their teacher; What did they interpret “And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar” although fire descends from the heavens, mitzva to bring man-made
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: The sons of Aaron did not die except because they issued a halachah in front of their master, Moses the Rabbi. What is the verse to interpret? "And the sons of Aaron, the priests, shall put fire upon the altar" — even though the fire descends from heaven, it is a commandment to bring from the common people.

hebrew_text: יָצָא וּבָא לוֹ דֶּרֶךְ כְּנִיסָתוֹ. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיָּבֹא שְׁלֹמֹה לַבָּמָה אֲשֶׁר בְּגִבְעוֹן יְרוּשָׁלִַם״, וְכִי מָה עִנְיַן גִּבְעוֹן אֵצֶל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם?
human_translation: exits and comes the way he entered, From where are these matters Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said the verse states: “And Solomon came to the high place that was at Gibeon, Jerusalem” Now, what does Gibeon have to do with Jerusalem?
llm_translation: He went out and came to him on the way of his entering. What are these words? Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, Rabbi Yonatan said, a verse says: "And Solomon came to the high place that was in Gibeon, Jerusalem." And what is the relevance of Gibeon to Jerusalem?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מַקִּישׁ יְצִיאָתוֹ מִגִּבְעוֹן לִירוּשָׁלַיִם, לְבִיאָתוֹ מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְגִבְעוֹן: מָה בִּיאָתוֹ מִירוּשָׁלַיִם לְגִבְעוֹן — פָּנָיו כְּלַפֵּי בָמָה, כְּדֶרֶךְ בִּיאָתוֹ, אַף יְצִיאָתוֹ מִגִּבְעוֹן לִירוּשָׁלַיִם — פָּנָיו כְּלַפֵּי בָמָה, כְּדֶרֶךְ בִּיאָתוֹ.
human_translation: Rather, compares his exit from Gibeon to Jerusalem to his arrival from Jerusalem to Gibeon. Just as his arrival from Jerusalem to Gibeon his face was turned toward the high place, in the usual manner arrival, so too, his exit from Gibeon to Jerusalem his face turned toward the high place, in the manner of his arrival.
llm_translation: Rather: He juxtaposes his departure from Gib'on to Jerusalem, to his arrival from Jerusalem to Gib'on: Just as his arrival from Jerusalem to Gib'on - his face towards the altar, in the manner of his arrival, so too his departure from Gib'on to Jerusalem - his face towards the altar, in the manner of his departure.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן כֹּהֲנִים בַּעֲבוֹדָתָן, וּלְוִיִּם בְּדוּכָנָן, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּמַעֲמָדָן, כְּשֶׁהֵן נִפְטָרִין — לֹא הָיוּ מַחֲזִירִין פְּנֵיהֶן וְהוֹלְכִין, אֶלָּא מְצַדְּדִין פְּנֵיהֶן וְהוֹלְכִין.
human_translation: And likewise, priests in their service; and Levites on their platform and Israelites at their watches, When they departed they would not turn their faces and walk but would turn their faces sideways and walk,
llm_translation: And so too, Kohanim in their service, and Leviim in their rotation, and Yisrael in their standing, when they would finish - they would not turn their faces and go, but they would turn their faces and go.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן תַּלְמִיד הַנִּפְטָר מֵרַבּוֹ לֹא יַחֲזִיר פָּנָיו וְיֵלֵךְ, אֶלָּא מְצַדֵּד פָּנָיו וְהוֹלֵךְ. כִּי הָא דְּרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר כַּד הֲוָה מִיפְּטַר מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, כַּד הֲוָה בָּעֵי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְסַגּוֹיֵי, הֲוָה גָּחֵין קָאֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אַדּוּכְתֵּיהּ עַד דַּהֲוָה מִיכַּסֵּי רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן מִינֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And likewise, a student who takes leave of his teacher not turn his face and walk but turn his face sideways and walk. in accordance with that of Rabbi Elazar when he took leave of his teacher, Rabbi Yoḥanan. When Rabbi Yoḥanan wanted to leave Rabbi Elazar would bend down and stand in his place until Rabbi Yoḥanan disappeared from his sight;
llm_translation: And so, a student who is dismissed by his teacher should not turn his face and go, but should turn his face sideways and go. For this is like the case of Rabbi Elazar, when he was dismissed by Rabbi Yochanan, and when Rabbi Yochanan wanted to accompany him, Rabbi Elazar stood until Rabbi Yochanan was covered from his sight.

hebrew_text: וְכַד הֲוָה בָּעֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר לְסַגּוֹיֵי, הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל לַאֲחוֹרֵיהּ עַד דְּמִכַּסֵּי מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. רָבָא כַּד הֲוָה מִיפְּטַר מִינֵּיהּ דְּרַב יוֹסֵף, הֲוָה אָזֵיל לַאֲחוֹרֵיהּ עַד דְּמִנַּגְּפָן כַּרְעֵיהּ וּמִתַּוְּוסָן אִסְקוּפָּתָא דְּבֵי רַב יוֹסֵף דְּמָא.
human_translation: And when Rabbi Elazar wanted to leave, he would walk backward until he disappeared from Rabbi Yoḥanan’s sight, When Rava took leave of Rav Yosef, he would walk backward, until his legs were bruised and the threshold of Rav Yosef’s house was bloodied
llm_translation: When Rabbi Elazar needed to surpass someone, he would go behind him until he would uncover the heresies of Rabbi Yochanan. Rava, when he was departing from the teachings of Rav Yosef, would go behind him until he would strike his legs and overturn the inkwell of the study hall of the house of Rav Yosef with blood.

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף: הָכִי עָבֵיד רָבָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: יְהֵא רַעֲוָא דִּתְרוּם רֵישָׁךְ אַכּוּלֵּהּ כַּרְכָּא.
human_translation: They said to Rav Yosef: This is what Rava does. said to him: May it be will that you lift your head over the entire city,
llm_translation: They said to Rav Yosef: So did Rava do. He said to them: May the Merciful One grant that the crumbs of your table be as filling as a loaf.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּפְסִיעַ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּסִיעוֹת לַאֲחוֹרָיו, וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִתֵּן שָׁלוֹם. אָמַר לֵיהּ רַב מָרְדֳּכַי: כֵּיוָן שֶׁפָּסַע שָׁלֹשׁ פְּסִיעוֹת לַאֲחוֹרָיו — הָתָם אִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ לְמֵיקַם. מָשָׁל לְתַלְמִיד הַנִּפְטָר מֵרַבּוֹ, אִם חוֹזֵר לְאַלְתַּר, דּוֹמֶה לְכֶלֶב שֶׁשָּׁב עַל קִיאוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who prays must take three steps backward and then recite: Peace, Rav Mordekhai said to him: Since he has taken three steps backward, he should stand there analogous to a student who takes leave of his teacher. If he returns immediately he is similar to a dog who returns to its vomit,
llm_translation: Rabbi Alexandri said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: One who prays, should take three steps backwards, and then offer peace. Rav Mordechai said to him: Once he takes three steps backwards, there he should stand. This can be compared to a student who is dismissed by his teacher, if he returns immediately, he is likened to a dog that returns to its vomit.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: הַמִּתְפַּלֵּל, צָרִיךְ שֶׁיַּפְסִיעַ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּסִיעוֹת לַאֲחוֹרָיו וְאַחַר כָּךְ יִתֵּן שָׁלוֹם, וְאִם לֹא עָשָׂה כֵּן רָאוּי לוֹ שֶׁלֹּא הִתְפַּלֵּל. וּמִשּׁוּם שְׁמַעְיָה אָמְרוּ: שֶׁנּוֹתֵן שָׁלוֹם לְיָמִין, וְאַחַר כָּךְ לִשְׂמֹאל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִימִינוֹ אֵשׁ דָּת לָמוֹ״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״יִפּוֹל מִצִּדְּךָ אֶלֶף וּרְבָבָה מִימִינֶךָ״.
human_translation: this was also taught One who prays must take three steps backward and then recite: Peace. And if he did not do so, it is better for him not to have prayed, And they said in the name of Shemaya that one recites: Peace, to the right and then to the left, as it is stated: “At His right hand was a fiery law to them” and it says: “A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right side”
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Namai the Elder said: One who prays, should take three steps backwards and only then offer peace. And if he did not do so, it is fitting for him not to have prayed. And in the name of Shemaya they said: One should offer peace to the right first, and then to the left, as it is stated: "A fiery law from His right hand" (Deuteronomy 33:2), and it also says: "A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand" (Psalms 91:7).

hebrew_text: מַאי וְאוֹמֵר? וְכִי תֵּימָא אוֹרְחָא דְמִילְּתָא הִיא לְמִיתַּב בְּיָמִין, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״יִפּוֹל מִצִּדְּךָ אֶלֶף וּרְבָבָה מִימִינֶךָ״.
human_translation: What is And it says? If you say it is the usual manner to give with the right come hear: “A thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right side,”
llm_translation: What is "and he says"? And if you say it is a common expression to sit on the right, come and hear: "A thousand may fall at your side, ten thousand at your right hand."

hebrew_text: רָבָא חַזְיֵיהּ לְאַבָּיֵי דְּיָהֵיב שְׁלָמָא לְיַמִּינָא בְּרֵישָׁא אֲמַר לֵיהּ: מִי סָבְרַתְּ לִימִין דִּידָךְ? לִשְׂמֹאל דִּידָךְ קָא אָמֵינָא, דְּהָוֵי יְמִינוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא. אָמַר רַב חִיָּיא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב הוּנָא: חֲזֵינָא לְהוּ לְאַבָּיֵי וְרָבָא דְּפָסְעִי לְהוּ שָׁלֹשׁ פְּסִיעוֹת בִּכְרִיעָה אַחַת.
human_translation: Rava saw Abaye reciting: Peace, to right first. said to him: Do you maintain to your right? I say to your left as it is the right of the Holy One, Blessed be He, Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, said: I observed that Abaye and Rava took three steps all in one bowing,
llm_translation: Rava saw to Abaye that he gave a greeting to the right first. He said to him: "Who do you think you are greeting first, to your right? I say you should greet to your left, for it is the right side of the Holy One, blessed be He." Rav Chiya, son of Rav Huna, said: "I saw Abaye and Rava take three steps with one bow."

hebrew_text: וּמִתְפַּלֵּל תְּפִלָּה קְצָרָה בַּבַּיִת הַחִיצוֹן. מַאי מְצַלֵּי? רָבָא בַּר רַב אַדָּא וְרָבִין בַּר רַב אַדָּא תַּרְוַיְיהוּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב אָמְרִי: יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵינוּ שֶׁתְּהֵא שָׁנָה זוֹ גְּשׁוּמָה וּשְׁחוּנָה. שְׁחוּנָה מְעַלְּיוּתָא הִיא?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: אִם שְׁחוּנָה תְּהֵא גְּשׁוּמָה.
human_translation: And recites a brief prayer in the outer chamber. What he pray? Rava bar Rav Adda and Ravin bar Rav Adda both said in the name of Rav May it be your will, Lord our God, that this year shall be rainy and hot. heat a good Rather, say If hot, may it be rainy,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And one should pray a brief prayer in the outer chamber. What should one pray? Rava bar Rav Adda and Ravin bar Rav Adda both said in the name of Rav: "May it be Your will, Lord our God, that this year be rainy and not dry." Is it not a request for too much rain?! Rather say: "If it is to be rainy, may it be timely."

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרָבָא מְסַיֵּים בַּהּ מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוּדָה: לָא יִעְדֵּי עָבֵיד שׁוּלְטָן מִדְּבֵית יְהוּדָה, וְלֹא יִהְיוּ עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל צְרִיכִין לְפַרְנָסָה זֶה מִזֶּה, וְלֹא תִּכָּנֵס לְפָנֶיךָ תְּפִלַּת עוֹבְרֵי דְּרָכִים.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, concluded in the name of Rav Yehuda: May the rule of power not depart from the house of Judah; and may your nation Israel not depend on each other for sustenance, and let not the prayer of travelers enter Your presence
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rava, concludes in it in the name of Rav Yehuda: "Do not appoint a ruler from the house of Yehuda, and let not the people of Israel depend on each other for sustenance, and let not the prayer of travelers enter before you."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא הֲוָה קָא אָזֵיל בְּאוֹרְחָא. שְׁדָא מִטְרָא עֲלֵיהּ, אֲמַר: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ בְּנַחַת, וַחֲנִינָא בְּצַעַר. פְּסַק מִיטְרָא. כִּי אֲתָא לְבֵיתֵיהּ, אָמַר: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! כׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ בְּצַעַר, וַחֲנִינָא בְּנַחַת. אֲתָא מִיטְרָא. אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מַאי אַהְנְיָא לֵיהּ צְלוֹתֵיהּ דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל לְגַבֵּי רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן דּוֹסָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa was walking on the road rain fell upon him. He said: Master of the Universe, the entire world is comfortable and Ḥanina is suffering. The rain stopped. When he came to his house he said: Master of the Universe, the entire world is suffering and Ḥanina is comfortable. The rain came Rav Yosef said: What effect does the prayer of the High Priest have with regard to Rabbi Ḥanina ben Dosa?
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa was walking on the road. A rainstorm came upon him, he said: "Master of the world! The whole world is in comfort, and Chanina is in distress." The rain stopped. When he arrived home, he said: "Master of the world! The whole world is in distress, and Chanina is in comfort." Rain came. Rav Yosef said: What benefit does the shade of a High Priest provide to Rabbi Chanina ben Dosa?

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל אֶחָד שֶׁהֶאֱרִיךְ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ, וְנִמְנוּ אֶחָיו הַכֹּהֲנִים לִיכָּנֵס אַחֲרָיו. הִתְחִילוּ הֵם נִכְנָסִין וְהוּא יוֹצֵא. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מִפְּנֵי מָה הֶאֱרַכְתָּ בִּתְפִלָּתֶךָ? אָמַר לָהֶם: קָשֶׁה בְּעֵינֵיכֶם שֶׁהִתְפַּלַּלְתִּי עֲלֵיכֶם וְעַל בֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ שֶׁלֹּא יֵחָרֵב? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: אַל תְּהִי רָגִיל לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן, שֶׁהֲרֵי שָׁנִינוּ: לֹא הָיָה מַאֲרִיךְ בִּתְפִלָּתוֹ כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְהַבְעִית אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: The Sages taught an incident a certain High Priest who extended his prayer, and his fellow priests counted, to go in after him They began to enter and he emerged. They said to him: Why did you extend your prayer? He said to them: Does it trouble you that I prayed for you and for the Temple not to be destroyed? They said to him: Do not make a habit of doing so, as we learned: He would not extend his prayer, so as not to alarm the Jewish people,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: There was an incident with one High Priest who prolonged his prayer, and his fellow priests counted to enter after him. They began to enter while he was exiting. They said to him: Why did you prolong your prayer? He said to them: Is it difficult in your eyes that I prayed for you and for the Temple not to be destroyed? They said to him: Do not make it a habit to do so, for we have learned: One should not prolong his prayer excessively in order not to trouble the Jewish people.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִשֶּׁנִּיטַּל אָרוֹן, אֶבֶן הָיְתָה שָׁם מִימוֹת נְבִיאִים רִאשׁוֹנִים, וּשְׁתִיָּיה הָיְתָה נִקְרֵאת, גְּבוֹהָה מִן הָאָרֶץ שָׁלֹשׁ אֶצְבָּעוֹת וְעָלֶיהָ הָיָה נוֹתֵן. נָטַל אֶת הַדָּם מִמִּי שֶׁהָיָה מְמָרֵס בּוֹ, נִכְנַס לַמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּכְנַס, וְעָמַד בַּמָּקוֹם שֶׁעָמַד, וְהִזָּה מִמֶּנּוּ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה.
human_translation: After the Ark was taken there was a rock from the days of the early prophets, and was called foundation three fingerbreadths higher than the ground, and would place on it. he took the blood from who was stirring it, He entered into the place that he entered, and stood at the place where he stood And he sprinkled from one upward and seven downward.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: When the Ark was removed, there was a stone there from the days of the early prophets, and it was called "Shetiya." It was three fingerbreadths high from the ground, and upon it the blood was placed. He would take the blood from the one who was stirring it, enter the place where he entered, stand in the place where he stood, and sprinkle from it once upward and seven times downward.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא הָיָה מִתְכַּוֵּון לְהַזּוֹת לֹא לְמַעְלָה וְלֹא לְמַטָּה אֶלָּא כְּמַצְלִיף. וְכָךְ הָיָה מוֹנֶה: אַחַת, אַחַת וְאַחַת, אַחַת וּשְׁתַּיִם, אַחַת וְשָׁלֹשׁ, אַחַת וְאַרְבַּע, אַחַת וְחָמֵשׁ, אַחַת וְשֵׁשׁ, אַחַת וָשֶׁבַע. יָצָא וְהִנִּיחוֹ עַל כַּן הַזָּהָב שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל.
human_translation: And he would neither intend to sprinkle upward nor downward, but rather like one who whips, And this he would count One; one and one; one and two; one and three; one and four; one and five; one and six; one and seven. emerged and placed on the golden pedestal in the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: And he did not intend to sprinkle neither upwards nor downwards, but like a sifter. And thus he would count: one, one and one, one and two, one and three, one and four, one and five, one and six, one and seven. He would go out and place it on the golden altar in the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ אֶת הַשָּׂעִיר, שְׁחָטוֹ, וְקִבֵּל בְּמִזְרָק אֶת דָּמוֹ, נִכְנַס לַמָּקוֹם שֶׁנִּכְנַס, וְעָמַד בַּמָּקוֹם שֶׁעָמַד, וְהִזָּה מִמֶּנּוּ אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה, וְכָךְ הָיָה מוֹנֶה: אַחַת, אַחַת וְאַחַת, אַחַת וּשְׁתַּיִם וְכוּ׳. יָצָא וְהִנִּיחוֹ עַל כַּן הַזָּהָב הַשֵּׁנִי שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה שָׁם אֶלָּא כֵּן אֶחָד בִּלְבַד. נָטַל דַּם הַפָּר וְהִנִּיחַ דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר,
human_translation: They brought him the goat He slaughtered it and received its blood in the bowl. He entered into the place that he entered, and stood at the place that he stood, and sprinkled from one upward and seven downward. And this he would count, One; one and one; one and two; etc. emerged and placed on the second golden pedestal in the Sanctuary. Rabbi Yehuda says: There was only one pedestal there, took the blood of the bull and placed the blood of the goat
llm_translation: They brought to him the goat, slaughtered it, and received its blood in a basin. He entered the place where he entered, stood in the place where he stood, and sprinkled from it once upward and seven times downward, and thus he would count: one, one and one, one and two, etc. He went out and placed it on the second golden altar in the sanctuary. Rabbi Yehuda says: There was only one there. He took the blood of the bull and placed the blood of the goat.

hebrew_text: וְהִזָּה מִמֶּנּוּ עַל הַפָּרוֹכֶת שֶׁכְּנֶגֶד הָאָרוֹן מִבַּחוּץ, אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה וְלֹא הָיָה מִתְכַּוֵּון וְכוּ׳. וְכָךְ הָיָה מוֹנֶה וְכוּ׳. נָטַל דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר וְהִנִּיחַ דַּם הַפָּר, וְהִזָּה מִמֶּנּוּ עַל הַפָּרוֹכֶת שֶׁכְּנֶגֶד הָאָרוֹן מִבַּחוּץ, אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה וְכוּ׳. עֵירָה דַּם הַפָּר לְתוֹךְ דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר, וְנָתַן אֶת הַמָּלֵא בָּרֵיקָן.
