human_translation: And he sprinkled from on the curtain opposite the Ark from outside one upward and seven downward, and he would not intend, etc. And this he would count, etc. he took the blood of the goat and placed blood of the bull And he sprinkled from on the curtain opposite the Ark from outside, one upward and seven downward, etc. he poured the blood of the bull into the blood of the goat and placed from the full empty
llm_translation: And he shall sprinkle from it on the curtain that is opposite the Ark from the outside, one above and seven below, and he did not intend, etc. And so he would count, etc. He took the blood of the goat and placed the blood of the cow, and he shall sprinkle from it on the curtain that is opposite the Ark from the outside, one above and seven below, etc. He would mix the blood of the cow with the blood of the goat, and he would place the full measure in the basin.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״מִשֶּׁנִּגְנַז״ לָא קָתָנֵי, אֶלָּא ״מִשֶּׁנִּיטַּל״. תְּנַן כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אָרוֹן גָּלָה לְבָבֶל. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אָרוֹן גָּלָה לְבָבֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְלִתְשׁוּבַת הַשָּׁנָה שָׁלַח הַמֶּלֶךְ נְבוּכַדְנֶאצַּר וַיְבִיאֵהוּ בָבֶלָה עִם כְּלֵי חֶמְדַּת בֵּית ה׳״.
human_translation: not teach: After was buried, but: After was taken. we learned in accordance with the one who said the Ark was exiled to Babylonia as it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The Ark was exiled to Babylonia, as it is stated: “And at the turn of the year King Nebuchadnezzar sent and brought him to Babylonia, along with the precious vessels of the House of the Lord”
llm_translation: The text states: "From when it was 'hidden,' it does not teach, but when it was 'removed.' We learned in accordance with the one who said: The Ark was revealed to Babylon. As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says: The Ark was revealed to Babylon, as it is stated: 'And at the turn of the year King Nebuchadnezzar sent and brought him to Babylon with the precious vessels of the house of the Lord.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אוֹמֵר: אָרוֹן גָּלָה לְבָבֶל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יִוָּתֵר דָּבָר אָמַר ה׳״ — אֵלּוּ עֲשֶׂרֶת הַדִּבְּרוֹת שֶׁבּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: The Ark was exiled to Babylonia, as it is stated: nothing [ davar ] shall be left, says the Lord” These are the Ten Commandments [ dibrot ] that are inside it;
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: The Ark was exiled to Babylon, as it is stated: "Not a thing failed of all the good things which the Lord had spoken" - these are the Ten Commandments within it.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה (בֶּן לָקִישׁ) אוֹמֵר: אָרוֹן בִּמְקוֹמוֹ נִגְנַז, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֵּרָאוּ רָאשֵׁי הַבַּדִּים מִן הַקֹּדֶשׁ עַל פְּנֵי הַדְּבִיר וְלֹא יֵרָאוּ הַחוּצָה וַיִּהְיוּ שָׁם עַד הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish says: The Ark was buried in its place, as it is stated: “And the ends of the staves were seen from the sacred place before the partition, but they could not be seen without; and they are there to this day”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah (ben Lakish) says: The Ark was hidden in its place, as it is stated: "And the poles were so long that the ends of the poles were seen from the Holy Place before the inner sanctuary, but they could not be seen from outside, and there they are to this day."

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּעוּלָּא. דְּאָמַר עוּלָּא, שָׁאַל רַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶּן חָרָשׁ אֶת רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי בְּרוֹמִי: וְכִי מֵאַחַר שֶׁרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר מְלַמְּדֵנוּ פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה: אָרוֹן גָּלָה לְבָבֶל, רִאשׁוֹנָה הָא דַּאֲמַרַן: ״וַיְבִיאֵהוּ בָבֶלָה עִם כְּלֵי חֶמְדַּת בֵּית ה׳״, שְׁנִיָּה מַאי הִיא? — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֵּצֵא מִבַּת צִיּוֹן
human_translation: this disagrees with of Ulla, as Ulla said: Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash asked Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai in Rome: And since Rabbi Eliezer taught us once and twice, the Ark was exiled to Babylonia. The first that which we said: “And brought him to Babylonia, along with the precious vessels of the House of the Lord.” What is the second As it is written: “And gone from the daughter of Zion is
llm_translation: Disagreement of Ulla. Ulla said, Rabbi Matya ben Charash asked Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai in Rome: "Since Rabbi Eliezer taught us twice: 'The Ark was taken to Babylon with the precious vessels of the House of the Lord,' what is the second time?" - As it is written: "He came to Babylon with the vessels of the House of the Lord," what is the second time? - As it is written: "He came out of the daughter of Zion."

hebrew_text: כׇּל הֲדָרָהּ״. מַאי: ״כׇּל הֲדָרָהּ״ — חַדְרָהּ. אַתָּה, מַאי אַתָּה אוֹמֵר? אָמַר לוֹ, שֶׁאֲנִי אוֹמֵר: אָרוֹן בִּמְקוֹמוֹ נִגְנַז, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּאֲרִיכוּ הַבַּדִּים וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: all her splendor” What is “All her splendor [ hadara ]”? Her chamber [ ḥadra ], You, what do you say He said to him: As I say, the Ark was buried in its place as it is stated: “And the staves were so long
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "kol hadarah". Mai: "kol hadarah" - chadrah. Atah, mai atah omer? Amar lo, she'ani omer: aron bimkomo nignaz, shene'emar: "vaya'arichu habadim vego'." English translation: "All its beauty." What is "all its beauty"? - Its chamber. You, what do you say? He said to him, that I say: the Ark is hidden in its place, as it is said: "And they extended the poles, etc."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבָּה לְעוּלָּא: מַאי מַשְׁמַע? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּהְיוּ שָׁם עַד הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״, וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב: ״עַד הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״ לְעוֹלָם הוּא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת הַיְבוּסִי יוֹשֵׁב יְרוּשָׁלִַם לֹא הוֹרִישׁוּ בְּנֵי בִנְיָמִין וַיֵּשֶׁב הַיְבוּסִי אֶת בְּנֵי בִנְיָמִין בִּירוּשָׁלִַם עַד הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״, הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא גְּלוֹ?
human_translation: Rabba said to Ulla: From where be inferred as it is written: “And they are there to this day,” And anywhere that it is written “to this day” it forever, But isn’t it written: “And the children of Benjamin did not drive out the Jebusites who inhabited Jerusalem; but the Jebusites dwelt with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem, to this day” So too here, that were not exiled
llm_translation: Rabah said to Ula: What is the implication? As it is written: "And they are there until this day," and wherever it is written: "until this day," is it forever? But it is written: "The Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Benjamin did not drive out, and the Jebusites dwell with the children of Benjamin in Jerusalem until this day." Is it not so that they were not revealed?

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: חֲמִשִּׁים וּשְׁתַּיִם שָׁנָה לֹא עָבַר אִישׁ בִּיהוּדָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל הֶהָרִים אֶשָּׂא בְכִי וָנֶהִי וְעַל נְאוֹת מִדְבָּר קִינָה כִּי נִצְּתוּ מִבְּלִי אִישׁ עוֹבֵר וְלֹא שָׁמְעוּ קוֹל מִקְנֶה מֵעוֹף הַשָּׁמַיִם וְעַד בְּהֵמָה נָדְדוּ הָלָכוּ״, ״בְּהֵמָה״ בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא חַמְשִׁין וּשְׁתַּיִם הָווּ!
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught Rabbi Yehuda says: No person passed through Judea fifty-two years as it is stated: “I will raise crying and wailing for the mountains, and a lamentation for the pastures of the wilderness, for they have been burned, with no person passing through. And they do not hear the sound of the cattle; from the bird of the heavens to the beast [ behema ], all have fled and gone” Behema , has a numerical value of fifty-two,
llm_translation: The text states: "And it was taught, Rabbi Yehuda says: Fifty-two years no man transgressed in Judah, as it is stated: 'On the mountains I will lift up weeping and wailing, and on the pastures of the wilderness a lamentation, for they are burned up, so that no man passes through, and they hear not the voice of cattle; from the fowl of the heavens to the beast they are fled, they are gone.'" The word "beast" in gematria is fifty-two!

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: שֶׁבַע שָׁנִים נִתְקַיְּימָה גׇּפְרִית וּמֶלַח בְּאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — אָתְיָא ״בְּרִית״ ״בְּרִית״. כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״וְהִגְבִּיר בְּרִית לָרַבִּים שָׁבוּעַ אֶחָד״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״וְאָמְרוּ עַל אֲשֶׁר עָזְבוּ אֶת בְּרִית ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי אֲבוֹתָם״!
human_translation: And it was taught Rabbi Yosei says: seven years brimstone and salt endured in Eretz Yisrael, And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the rationale of Rabbi Yosei; derived from “covenant” “covenant.” It is written here: “And he shall make a firm covenant with many for one week” And it is written there: They shall say: Because they forsook the covenant of the Lord, the God of their fathers”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi Yosei says: "Sulfur and salt lasted seven years in the land of Israel." And Rabbi Yochanan said: "What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei's statement? It is derived from the repeated use of the word 'covenant.' It is written here: 'And he shall make a strong covenant with the many for one week,' and it is written there: 'And they said about those who abandoned the covenant of the Lord, the God of their fathers!'"

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָכָא כְּתִיב ״שָׁם״, הָתָם לָא כְּתִיב ״שָׁם״, וְכׇל הֵיכָא דִּכְתִיב: ״שָׁם״ — לְעוֹלָם הוּא. מֵיתִיבִי: ״וּמֵהֶם מִן בְּנֵי שִׁמְעוֹן הָלְכוּ לְהַר שֵׂעִיר אֲנָשִׁים חֲמֵשׁ מֵאוֹת וּפְלַטְיָה וּנְעַרְיָה וּרְפָיָה וְעוּזִּיאֵל בְּנֵי יִשְׁעִי בְּרֹאשָׁם. וַיַּכּוּ אֶת שְׁאֵרִית הַפְּלֵיטָה לַעֲמָלֵק וַיֵּשְׁבוּ שָׁם עַד הַיּוֹם הַזֶּה״.
human_translation: said to him: Here, it is written: there”; there, it is not written. And anywhere that “there” is written it forever. raises an objection “And some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to Mount Seir having for their captains Pelatiah and Neariah and Rephaiah and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi. And they smote the remnant of the Amalekites who escaped, and dwelt there to this day”
llm_translation: He said to him: Here it is written "there," there it is not written "there," and wherever it is written "there" - it is forever. They raise an objection: "And from the sons of Simeon, five hundred men went to Mount Seir, with Pelatiah, Neariah, Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi, at their head. They struck down the remnant of the Amalekites who had escaped, and they have lived there to this day."

hebrew_text: וּכְבָר עָלָה סַנְחֵרִיב מֶלֶךְ אַשּׁוּר וּבִלְבֵּל כׇּל הָאֲרָצוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָסִיר גְּבוּלוֹת עַמִּים וַעֲתוּדוֹתֵיהֶם שׁוֹשֵׂתִי״. תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: But Sennacherib, king of Assyria, already come, and he had scrambled all the lands, as it is stated “And I have removed the bounds of the peoples, and have robbed their treasures” a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: And as Sancheriv, king of Assyria, went up and confused all the lands, as it is said: "I have removed the borders of the peoples, and their treasures I have plundered." Teyuvta.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: תָּנָא, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אָרוֹן בְּלִשְׁכַּת דִּיר הָעֵצִים הָיָה גָּנוּז. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: אַף אֲנַן נָמֵי תְּנֵינָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּכֹהֵן אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מִתְעַסֵּק, וְרָאָה רִצְפָּה מְשׁוּנָּה מֵחַבְרוֹתֶיהָ, וּבָא וְהוֹדִיעַ אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, וְלֹא הִסְפִּיק לִגְמוֹר אֶת הַדָּבָר עַד שֶׁיָּצְתָה נִשְׁמָתוֹ. וְיָדְעוּ בְּיִחוּד שֶׁשָּׁם אָרוֹן גָּנוּז.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said taught And the Rabbis say Ark was buried in the Chamber of the Woodshed. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: We, too, have learned an incident involving a certain priest who was occupied and he saw a floor different from the others. He came and informed his friend but was unable to finish his report before his soul departed And they knew definitively that the Ark was buried there,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: It was taught in a Baraita, and the Sages say: The Ark was hidden in the Chamber of the Wood Room. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: We also learned: There was an incident with a certain priest who was occupied, and he saw a floor different from its companions, and he came and informed his friend, but he did not manage to finish the matter until his soul departed. They knew specifically that there the Ark was hidden.

hebrew_text: מַאי הֲוָה עָבֵיד? אָמַר רַבִּי חֶלְבּוֹ: מִתְעַסֵּק בְּקַרְדּוּמּוֹ הָיָה. תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: שְׁנֵי כֹהֲנִים בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין הָיוּ מַתְלִיעִין בְּעֵצִים, וְנִשְׁמְטָה קַרְדּוּמּוֹ שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶם וְנָפְלָה שָׁם, וְיָצְתָה אֵשׁ וַאֲכָלַתּוּ.
human_translation: What was he doing, Rabbi Ḥelbo said: He was occupied with his axe, The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Two blemished priests were sorting wormy wood when the axe of one of them dropped and fell there, And fire burst out and consumed
llm_translation: What was he doing? Rabbi Helbo said: He was involved with his crimson wool. It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Two priests with blemishes were tying wood, and the crimson wool of one of them slipped and fell there, and fire came out and consumed it.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה רָמֵי. כְּתִיב: ״וַיֵּרָאוּ רָאשֵׁי הַבַּדִּים״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא יֵרָאוּ הַחוּצָה״. הָא כֵּיצַד? נִרְאִין וְאֵין נִרְאִין. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״וַיֵּרָאוּ רָאשֵׁי הַבַּדִּים״, יָכוֹל לֹא יְהוּ זָזִין מִמְּקוֹמָן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וַיַּאֲרִיכוּ הַבַּדִּים״, יָכוֹל יְהוּ מְקָרְעִין בַּפָּרוֹכֶת וְיוֹצְאִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְלֹא יֵרָאוּ הַחוּצָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda raised a contradiction. It is written: “The ends of the staves were seen,” and it is written “But they could not be seen without” How They were seen and not seen, This was also taught “The ends of the staves were seen”; might they did not move from their position the verse states: “And the staves were so long.” might they ripped through the curtain and emerged the verse states: “They could not be seen without.”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah raises an objection. It is written: "And the tops of the pillars were seen," and it is written: "But they were not seen without." How so? They are seen and not seen. It was taught in a baraita similarly: "And the tops of the pillars were seen," one might have thought they should not move from their place - the Talmud teaches us to say: "And the pillars were lengthened." One might have thought they should tear the curtain and exit - the Talmud teaches us to say: "But they were not seen without."

hebrew_text: הָא כֵּיצַד? דּוֹחֲקִין וּבוֹלְטִין וְיוֹצְאִין בַּפָּרוֹכֶת, וְנִרְאִין כִּשְׁנֵי דַּדֵּי אִשָּׁה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״צְרוֹר הַמּוֹר דּוֹדִי לִי בֵּין שָׁדַי יָלִין״.
human_translation: How pushed and protruded and stuck out against the curtain and appeared like the two breasts of a woman As it is stated: “My beloved is to me like a bundle of myrrh, that lies between my breasts”
llm_translation: The text reads: "How so? They press and protrude and exit through the curtain, and appear like the two breasts of a woman, as it is stated: 'A bundle of myrrh is my beloved to me, between my breasts he shall lodge.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב קַטִּינָא: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל עוֹלִין לָרֶגֶל, מְגַלְּלִין לָהֶם אֶת הַפָּרוֹכֶת, וּמַרְאִין לָהֶם אֶת הַכְּרוּבִים שֶׁהָיוּ מְעוֹרִים זֶה בָּזֶה, וְאוֹמְרִים לָהֶן: רָאוּ חִבַּתְכֶם לִפְנֵי הַמָּקוֹם כְּחִבַּת זָכָר וּנְקֵבָה.
human_translation: Rav Ketina said: When the Jewish people would ascend for Festivals, roll up the curtain for them and show them the cherubs, which were clinging to one another, and say to them: See how you are beloved before God, like the love of a male and female.
llm_translation: Rav Katina said: At the time when the Israelites would ascend for the pilgrimage festival, they would roll for them the curtain, and show them the cherubim that were embracing each other, and say to them: "See the love of the Holy One, blessed be He, for you, like the love of a male and female."

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חִסְדָּא: ״וְלֹא יָבוֹאוּ לִרְאוֹת כְּבַלַּע אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ״, וְאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: בִּשְׁעַת הַכְנָסַת כֵּלִים לְנַרְתֵּק שֶׁלָּהֶם!
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda raised an objection: “But they shall not go in to see the sacred objects as they are being covered, and Rav Yehuda said Rav said: When the vessels were put into their containers
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: "And they shall not come to see the holy things as they are swallowed." And Rav Yehuda said in the name of Rav: At the time of bringing in their vessels to be untied!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: מָשָׁל לְכַלָּה, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁהִיא בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ צְנוּעָה מִבַּעְלָהּ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁבָּאתָה לְבֵית חָמִיהָ — אֵינָהּ צְנוּעָה מִבַּעְלָהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said analogous to a bride; as long as she is in her father’s house, she is modest of her husband. once she comes to her father-in-law’s house she is no longer modest of her husband.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: A parable for a bride, as long as she is in her father's house, she is modest from her husband. Once she comes to her father-in-law's house, she is not modest from her husband.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב חָנָא בַּר רַב קַטִּינָא: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּכֹהֵן אֶחָד שֶׁהָיָה מִתְעַסֵּק וְכוּ׳! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: נִתְגָּרְשָׁה קָא אָמְרַתְּ, נִתְגָּרְשָׁה חָזְרוּ לְחִיבָּתָהּ הָרִאשׁוֹנָה.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Rav Ketina raised an objection an incident involving a certain priest who was occupied said to him: you are speaking she was divorced. and when divorced she returns to her original beloved
llm_translation: The text reads: Rav Ḥana bar Rav Kattina raised an objection: There was an incident involving a certain priest who was engaged in his work, etc.! He said to him: You meant to say she was divorced, you meant to say they returned to her original obligation.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי עָסְקִינַן? אִי נֵימָא בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן — מִי הֲוַאי פָּרוֹכֶת? אֶלָּא בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי — מִי הֲווֹ כְּרוּבִים? לְעוֹלָם בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, וּמַאי פָּרוֹכֶת — פָּרוֹכֶת דְּבָבֵי.
human_translation: With what are we dealing If we say to First Temple, was there a curtain Rather, to Second Temple; were there cherubs Actually, to First Temple, and what is the curtain the curtain of the gates.
llm_translation: With what are we dealing? If you say in the First Temple - what was the Parochet made of? Rather, in the Second Temple - what were the Cherubim like? It is always in the First Temple, and what is the Parochet? The Parochet of the Holy of Holies.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא אָמַר רַב: שְׁלֹשָׁה עָשָׂר פָּרוֹכוֹת הָיוּ בְּמִקְדָּשׁ, שִׁבְעָה כְּנֶגֶד שִׁבְעָה שְׁעָרִים, שְׁתַּיִם — אַחַת לְפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל, וְאַחַת לְפִתְחוֹ שֶׁל אוּלָם. שְׁתַּיִם בַּדְּבִיר, וּשְׁתַּיִם כְּנֶגְדָּן בָּעֲלִיָּה.
human_translation: As Rabbi Zeira said Rav said: There were thirteen curtains in the Temple: Seven opposite, seven gates; two one at the entrance to the Sanctuary and one at the entrance to the Entrance Hall. Two within the partition, and two corresponding to them in the upper chamber.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Rabbi Zeira said in the name of Rav: There were thirteen curtains in the Temple, seven corresponding to the seven gates, two - one for the entrance of the Sanctuary, and one for the entrance of the Hall. Two in the Holy of Holies, and two corresponding to them in the upper chamber."

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם בְּמִקְדָּשׁ שֵׁנִי, וּכְרוּבִים דְּצוּרְתָּא הֲווֹ קָיְימִי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְאֶת כׇּל קִירוֹת הַבַּיִת מֵסַב קָלַע כְּרוּבִים וְתִמֹרוֹת וּפְטוּרֵי צִיצִּים וְצִפָּה זָהָב מְיֻשָּׁר עַל הַמְּחוּקֶּה״.
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Actually, to Second Temple: and there were images of cherubs there, As it is written: “And he carved all the walls of the house round about with carved figures of cherubs and palm trees and open flowers, “And he overlaid them with gold fitted upon the graven work”
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Always in the Second Temple, and the cherubim were of a formed shape, as it is written: "And all the walls of the house round about he carved cherubim and palm trees and open flowers, within and without."

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״כְּמַעַר אִישׁ וְלוֹיוֹת״. מַאי ״כְּמַעַר אִישׁ וְלוֹיוֹת״? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא:
human_translation: And it is written: “According to the space of each with loyot ” What is “According to the space of each with loyot ”? Rabba bar Rav Sheila said:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "like a cave, a man and his bundles." What is "like a cave, a man and his bundles"? Rabba bar Rav Sheila said:

hebrew_text: כְּאִישׁ הַמְעוֹרֶה בַּלְּוָיָיה שֶׁלּוֹ. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁנִּכְנְסוּ גּוֹיִם לַהֵיכָל רָאוּ כְּרוּבִים הַמְעוֹרִין זֶה בָּזֶה, הוֹצִיאוּן לַשּׁוּק וְאָמְרוּ: יִשְׂרָאֵל הַלָּלוּ, שֶׁבִּרְכָתָן בְּרָכָה וְקִלְלָתָן קְלָלָה — יַעַסְקוּ בִּדְבָרִים הַלָּלוּ? מִיָּד הִזִּילוּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כׇּל מְכַבְּדֶיהָ הִזִּילוּהָ כִּי רָאוּ עֶרְוָתָהּ״.
human_translation: like a man clinging to his livaya , Reish Lakish said: When gentiles entered the Sanctuary, they saw cherubs clinging to one another. took them out to the market, and said: These Jews, whose blessing is a blessing and whose curse is a curse, they be occupied with such matters, They immediately debased them, as it is stated: “All who honored her debase her because they have seen her nakedness”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Like a man who urinates his clothing. Reish Lakish said: When the gentiles entered the sanctuary, they saw the cherubim embracing each other, they took them out to the marketplace and said: These Jews, whose blessing is a blessing and their curse is a curse, do they engage in such matters? Immediately they disgraced them, as it is stated: "All who honored her despised her, for they saw her nakedness" (Lamentations 1:8).

hebrew_text: וּשְׁתִיָּה הָיְתָה נִקְרֵאת. תָּנָא: שֶׁמִּמֶּנָּה הוּשְׁתַּת הָעוֹלָם. תְּנַן כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מִצִּיּוֹן נִבְרָא הָעוֹלָם, דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: עוֹלָם מֵאֶמְצָעִיתוֹ נִבְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּצֶקֶת עָפָר לַמּוּצָק וּרְגָבִים יְדוּבָּקוּ״.
human_translation: and it was called foundation [ shetiyya ] taught because the world was created [ hushtat ] from it. We learned in accordance with the one who said the world was created from Zion. As it was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The world was created from its center, as it is stated: “When the dust runs into a mass, and the clods cleave fast together”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Shetiya was called. It was taught: From it the world was founded. We learned as it was said by the one who said, "From Zion, the world was created," as it was taught, Rabbi Eliezer says: The world was created from its center, as it is said: "When He established the heavens, I was there."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אוֹמֵר: עוֹלָם מִן הַצְּדָדִין נִבְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לַשֶּׁלֶג יֹאמַר הֱוֵי אָרֶץ וְגֶשֶׁם מָטָר וְגֶשֶׁם מִטְרוֹת עוּזּוֹ״. רַבִּי יִצְחָק (נַפָּחָא) אָמַר: אֶבֶן יָרָה הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא בַּיָּם, מִמֶּנּוּ נִשְׁתַּת הָעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל מָה אֲדָנֶיהָ הׇטְבָּעוּ אוֹ מִי יָרָה אֶבֶן פִּנָּתָהּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: world was created from the sides, as it is stated: “For He said to the snow: Become the earth, likewise to the shower of rain, and to the showers of His mighty rain” Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa said: The Holy One, Blessed be He, cast a stone into the sea, from which the world was created, as it is stated: “Upon what were its foundations fastened; or who laid its cornerstone?”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: The world was created from the sides, as it is stated: "For to the snow He says, 'Be on the earth,' and to the downpour of rain, and to the downpour of His mighty rains." Rabbi Yitzchak (Nappacha) says: The Holy One, blessed be He, cast a stone into the sea, from which the world was founded, as it is stated: "Upon what were its foundations sunk, or who cast its cornerstone?"

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִצִּיּוֹן נִבְרָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִזְמוֹר לְאָסָף אֵל אֱלֹהִים ה׳״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״מִצִּיּוֹן מִכְלַל יוֹפִי״ — מִמֶּנּוּ מוּכְלָל יׇפְיוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: was created from Zion, as it is stated: “A Psalm of Asaph. God, the Lord God and it states: “Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty,
llm_translation: The sages say: From Zion it was created, as it is stated: "A Psalm of Asaph. God, the Lord, has spoken" (Psalm 50:1). And it says: "Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty" — from it emanates the beauty of the world.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר הַגָּדוֹל אוֹמֵר: ״אֵלֶּה תוֹלְדוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם וְהָאָרֶץ בְּהִבָּרְאָם בְּיוֹם עֲשׂוֹת ה׳ אֱלֹהִים אֶרֶץ וְשָׁמָיִם״, ״תּוֹלְדוֹת שָׁמַיִם״ — מִשָּׁמַיִם נִבְרְאוּ, ״תּוֹלְדוֹת הָאָרֶץ״ — מֵאֶרֶץ נִבְרְאוּ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: “These are the generations of the heaven and the earth when they were created, on the day that the Lord God made earth and heaven” generations of the heavens, were created from the heavens, generations of the earth were created from the earth.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: "These are the generations of the heavens and the earth when they were created, on the day that the Lord God made earth and heaven." "Generations of the heavens" - they were created from the heavens. "Generations of the earth" - they were created from the earth.

hebrew_text: וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מִצִּיּוֹן נִבְרְאוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִזְמוֹר לְאָסָף אֵל אֱלֹהִים ה׳ דִּבֶּר וַיִּקְרָא אָרֶץ מִמִּזְרַח שֶׁמֶשׁ עַד מְבוֹאוֹ״. וְאוֹמֵר: ״מִצִּיּוֹן מִכְלַל יוֹפִי אֱלֹהִים הוֹפִיעַ״ — מִמֶּנּוּ מוּכְלָל יוֹפְיוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם.
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Both these and those were created from Zion, as it is stated: “A Psalm of Asaph. God, the Lord God has spoken and called the earth, from the rising of the sun to its place of setting,” and it says: “Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shined forth,” from the beauty of the world was perfected,
llm_translation: The sages say: "These and these were created from Zion," as it is stated: "A Psalm of Asaph. God, the Lord, has spoken, and called the earth from the rising of the sun to its going down." And it says: "Out of Zion, the perfection of beauty, God has shined forth" — from it emanates the perfection of the world.

hebrew_text: נָטַל אֶת הַדָּם מִמִּי שֶׁמְּמָרֵס בּוֹ וְכוּ׳. מַאי כְּמַצְלִיף? מַחְוֵי רַב יְהוּדָה —
human_translation: took the blood from who was stirring it and he entered What is Like one who whips? Rav Yehuda demonstrated
llm_translation: He took the blood from the one who was stirring it, etc. What is meant by "like a metalworker"? It is similar to the statement of Rav Yehuda —

hebrew_text: כִּמְנַגְּדָנָא. תָּנָא, כְּשֶׁהוּא מַזֶּה — אֵינוֹ מַזֶּה עַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת, אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד עוֹבְיָהּ שֶׁל כַּפּוֹרֶת. כְּשֶׁהוּא מַזֶּה לְמַעְלָה — מְצַדֵּד יָדוֹ לְמַטָּה. וּכְשֶׁהוּא מַזֶּה לְמַטָּה — מְצַדֵּד יָדוֹ לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: like one who lashes with a whip taught When sprinkles he does not sprinkle on the Ark cover; rather, against the thickness of the Ark cover. When he sprinkles upward, he turns his hand downward, And when he sprinkles downward, he turns his hand upward.
llm_translation: Opposite us. It was taught: When he sprinkles - he does not sprinkle on the cover, but opposite its thickness. When he sprinkles upwards - he inclines his hand downwards. And when he sprinkles downwards - he inclines his hand upwards.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהִזָּה אוֹתוֹ עַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת וְלִפְנֵי הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״, לֹא יֹאמַר ״לְמַטָּה״ בְּשָׂעִיר, דְּלָא צְרִיךְ, דְּגָמַר מִמַּטָּה דְּפַר,
human_translation: From where are these matters, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said Rabbi Zeira said: The verse states and sprinkle it upon the Ark cover and before the Ark cover” not say downward, to the goat, as is unnecessary; is derived from downward with bull.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What are these words? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said, Rabbi Zeira said, a verse says: "And he shall sprinkle it upon the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat," one should not say "below" in regard to the goat, for it is not necessary, as it is learned from below the bull.

hebrew_text: לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר — לְאַקּוֹשֵׁי ״עַל״ לְ״לִפְנֵי״: מָה ״לִפְנֵי״ דְּלָאו עַל, אַף ״עַל״ דְּלָאו עַל.
human_translation: why is stated to juxtapose “upon to “before just as “before” that not on so too, “upon” that not on
llm_translation: "Why is it stated - for those who are 'upon' 'before': Just as 'before' means not 'upon,' so too 'upon' means not 'upon.'"

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: לֹא יֵאָמֵר ״לְמַעְלָה״ בְּפַר דְּלָא צְרִיךְ, דְּגָמַר מִמַּעְלָה דְשָׂעִיר. לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר? לְאַקּוֹשֵׁי ״לִפְנֵי״ לְ״עַל״: מָה ״עַל״ — עַל מַמָּשׁ, אַף ״לִפְנֵי״ — עַל מַמָּשׁ!
human_translation: On the contrary, not say upward, to the bull, as is unnecessary; is derived from upward to goat. why does it state to juxtapose “before to “upon just as “upon” actually upon, so too, “before” actually upon
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ad'rabbah: lo yeamer "lema'alah" befar d'lo tzerikh, d'gamar mima'alah d'sa'ir. Lamah ne'emar? Le'akoshei "lifnei" le"'al": mah "'al" — al mamash, af "lifnei" — al mamash! English translation: Ad'rabbah: It should not be said "above" in the case of a bull that is not needed, as it is learned from above regarding the goat. Why is it stated? To equate "before" to "above": Just as "above" is literal, so too "before" is literal!

hebrew_text: הַאי מַאי?! אִי אָמְרַתְּ בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַטָּה דְשָׂעִיר לְאַקּוֹשֵׁי לְמַעְלָה דְפַר — מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב. דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב: ״עַל פְּנֵי הַכַּפּוֹרֶת קֵדְמָה״ — זֶה בָּנָה אָב: כׇּל מָקוֹם שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״פְּנֵי״ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא קָדִים. אֶלָּא אִי אָמְרַתְּ לְמַעְלָה דְפַר לְאַקּוֹשֵׁי לְמַטָּה דְשָׂעִיר — לְמַאי אֲתָא?
human_translation: What is this Granted, if you say downward to the goat to juxtapose it to upward to the bull, one needs for that which the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught. As the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught: “Upon [ al penei ] the Ark cover to the east” this forms an analogy Any place where it is stated “face [ penei ],” nothing other eastern However, if you say, upward to the bull to juxtapose for what purpose does downward to the goat come;
llm_translation: This what?! If you say, "below the hair of the goat to the horns above the bull," he requires it according to the teaching of the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. For it was taught in the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: "Eastward, toward the cover" - this is the father's son. Wherever it says "face," it means only eastward. But if you say, "above the bull to the horns below the goat," for what purpose does it come?

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהִזָּה אֹתוֹ עַל הַכַּפּוֹרֶת וְלִפְנֵי הַכַּפּוֹרֶת״ — לָמַדְנוּ: כַּמָּה לְמַעְלָה בַּשָּׂעִיר — אַחַת. לְמַטָּה בַּשָּׂעִיר, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ כַּמָּה!
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And sprinkle it upon the Ark cover and before the Ark cover” We learned how many upward for the goat, one downward for the goat, I do not know how many
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And he shall sprinkle it upon the mercy seat and before the mercy seat" - we learn: how many above on the goat - one. Below on the goat, I do not know how many!

hebrew_text: הֲרֵינִי דָּן: נֶאֶמְרוּ דָּמִים לְמַטָּה בַּפָּר, וְנֶאֶמְרוּ דָּמִים לְמַטָּה בַּשָּׂעִיר. מָה לְמַטָּה בַּפָּר — שֶׁבַע, אַף לְמַטָּה בַּשָּׂעִיר — שֶׁבַע.
human_translation: I derive It states blood downward of the bull, and it states blood downward of the goat. Just as downward of the bull seven so too, downward of the goat seven
llm_translation: I will judge: It was said blood below in the bull, and it was said blood below in the goat. Just as below in the bull — seven, so too below in the goat — seven.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לְדֶרֶךְ זוֹ: נֶאֶמְרוּ דָּמִים לְמַעְלָה בַּשָּׂעִיר, וְנֶאֶמְרוּ דָּמִים לְמַטָּה בַּשָּׂעִיר. מָה לְמַעְלָה בַּשָּׂעִיר — אַחַת, אַף לְמַטָּה בַּשָּׂעִיר — אַחַת? נִרְאֶה לְמִי דּוֹמֶה: דָּנִין מַטָּה מִמַּטָּה, וְאֵין דָּנִין מַטָּה מִלְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: Or go this way: It states blood upward of the goat, and it states blood downward of the goat. Just as upward of the goat one so too, downward of the goat one Let us see what resembles: One derives downward downward, and one does not derive downward from an upward
llm_translation: Or like to the way: It was said blood above in the goat, and it was said blood below in the goat. Just as above in the goat — one, so too below in the goat — one? It appears to whom it is similar: we judge below from below, and we do not judge below from above.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה, דָּנִין גּוּפוֹ מִגּוּפוֹ, וְאֵין דָּנִין גּוּפוֹ מֵעָלְמָא! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשָׂה אֶת דָּמוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה לְדַם הַפָּר״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה״ — שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כׇּל עֲשִׂיּוֹתָיו שָׁווֹת. כְּשֵׁם שֶׁלְּמַטָּה בַּפָּר — שֶׁבַע, כָּךְ לְמַטָּה בַּשָּׂעִיר — שֶׁבַע.
human_translation: On the contrary, one derives a matter from that matter, and one does not derive that matter from matter. the verse states: “And he shall do with its blood as he did with the blood of the bull” As no the verse to state: “As he did,” what the verse states: “As he did”? that all his actions should be alike, just as downward of the bull seven, so too, downward of the goat seven.
llm_translation: The Great Rabba said: One judges his body from his body, but one does not judge his body from the world! The Talmud teaches: "And he shall make atonement for the holy sanctuary, and he shall make atonement for the tent of meeting and for the altar, and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the congregation." Just as the actions below with the cow - seven, so too the actions below with the goat - seven.

hebrew_text: לָמַדְנוּ כַּמָּה לְמַטָּה? בַּפָּר וּבַשָּׂעִיר — שֶׁבַע. לְמַעְלָה בַּפָּר אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ כַּמָּה, וַהֲרֵינִי דָּן: נֶאֶמְרוּ דָּמִים לְמַעְלָה בַּשָּׂעִיר, וְנֶאֶמְרוּ דָּמִים לְמַעְלָה בַּפָּר. מָה לְמַעְלָה בַּשָּׂעִיר — אַחַת, אַף לְמַעְלָה בַּפָּר — אַחַת.
human_translation: We have learned how many downward of the bull and by the goat: Seven. I do not know how many upward of the bull. And I derive It states blood upward of the goat, and it states blood upward of the bull. Just as upward of the goat one so too, of the bull upward one
llm_translation: We learned: How many below? In the bull and in the goat - seven. Above in the bull, I do not know how many, and behold I judge: Bloods above in the goat were stated, and bloods above in the bull were stated. Just as above in the goat - one, so too above in the bull - one.

hebrew_text: אוֹ כְּלָךְ לַדֶּרֶךְ זוֹ: נֶאֶמְרוּ דָּמִים לְמַטָּה בַּפָּר, וְנֶאֶמְרוּ דָּמִים לְמַעְלָה בַּפָּר. מָה לְמַטָּה בַּפָּר — שֶׁבַע, אַף לְמַעְלָה בַּפָּר — שֶׁבַע! נִרְאֶה לְמִי דּוֹמֶה? דָּנִין מַעְלָה מִמַּעְלָה, וְאֵין דָּנִין מַעְלָה מִמַּטָּה!
human_translation: Or go this way: It is stated blood downward of the bull, and it is stated blood upward of the bull. Just as downward of the bull seven so too, upward of the bull seven Let us see what resembles: One derives upward upward, and one does not derive upward from a downward
llm_translation: Or like to the way: It was stated, blood for below in the bull, and it was stated, blood for above in the bull. Just as for below in the bull — seven, so too for above in the bull — seven! To whom is it similar? We judge above from above, and we do not judge above from below!

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: דָּנִין גּוּפוֹ מִגּוּפוֹ, וְאֵין דָּנִין גּוּפוֹ מֵעָלְמָא! תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְעָשָׂה אֶת דָּמוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״כַּאֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה״? שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כׇּל עֲשִׂיּוֹתָיו שָׁווֹת, כְּשֵׁם שֶׁלְּמַטָּה בַּפָּר — שֶׁבַע, כָּךְ לְמַטָּה בַּשָּׂעִיר — שֶׁבַע. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁלְּמַעְלָה בַּשָּׂעִיר — אַחַת, כָּךְ לְמַעְלָה בַּפָּר — אַחַת.
human_translation: On the contrary, one derives a matter from that matter, and one does not derive that matter from matter. the verse states: “And he shall do with its blood as he did.” As no the verse to state: “As he did,” what the verse states: “As he did”? that all his actions should be alike: Just as downward of the bull seven, so too, downward of the goat seven; and just as upward of the goat one, so too, upward of the bull one.
llm_translation: The Great Rabbi: One judges his body from his body, but one does not judge his body from the world! The Talmud teaches: "And he shall do with his blood as he did," for the Talmud does not say "as he did," so what does the Talmud say "as he did"? That all his actions should be equal, just as below in the bull - seven, so too below in the goat - seven. And just as above in the goat - one, so too above in the bull - one.

hebrew_text: אַחַת, אַחַת וְאַחַת, אַחַת וּשְׁתַּיִם. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אַחַת, אַחַת וְאַחַת, אַחַת וּשְׁתַּיִם, אַחַת וְשָׁלֹשׁ, אַחַת וְאַרְבַּע, אַחַת וְחָמֵשׁ, אַחַת וָשֵׁשׁ, אַחַת וָשֶׁבַע, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אַחַת, אַחַת וְאַחַת, שְׁתַּיִם וְאַחַת, שָׁלֹשׁ וְאַחַת, אַרְבַּע וְאַחַת, חָמֵשׁ וְאַחַת, שֵׁשׁ וְאַחַת, שֶׁבַע וְאַחַת.
human_translation: One; one and one; one and two. The Sages taught One; one and one; one and two; one and three; one and four; one and five; one and six; one and seven. the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says One; one and one; two and one; three and one; four and one; five and one; six and one; seven and one.
llm_translation: One, one and one, one and two. The Rabbis taught: one, one and one, one and two, one and three, one and four, one and five, one and six, one and seven, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: one, one and one, two and one, three and one, four and one, five and one, six and one, seven and one.

hebrew_text: וְלָא פְּלִיגִי: מָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ וּמָר כִּי אַתְרֵיהּ.
human_translation: They do not disagree Sage in accordance with in his place, and Sage in accordance with in his place.
llm_translation: And they did not argue: Master when he is present and Master when he is present.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת הַזָּאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה צְרִיכָה מִנְיָן עִם כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת, מַאי טַעְמָא? רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמַר: שֶׁלֹּא יִטְעֶה בַּהַזָּאוֹת.
human_translation: In any case, everyone, the first sprinkling must be counted with each and every one What is the reason Rabbi Elazar said: that he does not err in the sprinklings.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates to: "The entire world, from the beginning, needs a source with each and every one, what is the reason? Rabbi Elazar said: So that one does not err in the sources."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלִפְנֵי הַכַּפּוֹרֶת יַזֶּה״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יַזֶּה״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״יַזֶּה״? לִימֵּד עַל הַזָּאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה שֶׁצְּרִיכָה מִנְיָן עִם כׇּל אַחַת וְאַחַת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said the verse states: and before the Ark cover he shall sprinkle” As no the verse to state: He shall sprinkle” what the verse states: “He shall sprinkle”? teaches to the first sprinkling that it must be counted with each and every one,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, the verse says: "And before the mercy seat he shall sprinkle," as the Torah does not need to say "he shall sprinkle," so why does the Torah say "he shall sprinkle"? To teach about the first sprinkling that requires a count with each and every one.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּלֹא מָנָה וְלֹא טָעָה.
human_translation: What is between between them where he did not count and did not err.
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them in that he did not count and did not err.

hebrew_text: יָצָא וְהִנִּיחוֹ עַל כַּן הַזָּהָב שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל. תְּנַן הָתָם: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיוּ שׁוֹפָרוֹת לְקִינֵּי חוֹבָה, מִפְּנֵי הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת.
human_translation: emerged and placed on the golden pedestal in the Sanctuary, We learned there Rabbi Yehuda says: There were no horns for obligatory nests, due to the mixtures.
llm_translation: He went out and placed it on the golden stand in the Temple. We learned there: Rabbi Yehuda says: Shofars were not blown for communal fasts because of the mixtures.

hebrew_text: מַאי מִפְּנֵי הַתַּעֲרוֹבוֹת? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִפְּנֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת חוֹבָה בִּנְדָבָה. אָמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְנַעֲבֵיד תְּרֵי וְנִכְתּוֹב עֲלַיְיהוּ הֵי דְּחוֹבָה וְהֵי דִּנְדָבָה? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה
human_translation: What is Due to a mixture? Rav Yosef said: due to mixture of obligatory with free-will Abaye said to him: And let us prepare two and write on them which is for obligatory and which is free-will Rabbi Yehuda
llm_translation: What is the reason for the mixtures? Rav Yosef said: Because of a mixture of obligation and voluntary offering. Abaye said to him: And let us do two and write upon them, one for obligation and one for voluntary offering? Rabbi Yehuda

hebrew_text: לֵית לֵיהּ כְּתִיבָה. דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא הָיָה שָׁם אֶלָּא כַּן אֶחָד בִּלְבַד. תְּרֵי מַאי טַעְמָא לָא — מִשּׁוּם דְּמִחַלְּפִי. וְנַעֲבֵיד תְּרֵי וְלִיכְתּוֹב עֲלַיְיהוּ הֵי דְפַר וְהֵי דְשָׂעִיר. אֶלָּא, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֵית לֵיהּ כְּתִיבָה.
human_translation: does not accept writing As we learned Rabbi Yehuda says: There was only one pedestal What is the reason not two because exchanged But let us place two and write on them which is for the bull and which is for the goat. Rather, Rabbi Yehuda does not accept writing
llm_translation: There is no writing. As we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yehuda says: There was only one "kain" there. What is the reason that there are not two? Because they alternate. And we should do two and write on them, one "par" and one "sa'ir." Rather, according to Rabbi Yehuda, there is no writing.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: שְׁלֹשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה שׁוֹפָרוֹת הָיוּ בְּמִקְדָּשׁ, וְהָיָה כָּתוּב עֲלֵיהֶן: תִּקְלִין חַדְתִּין, וְתִקְלִין עַתִּיקִין, וְקִינִּין, וְגוֹזְלֵי עוֹלָה, וְעֵצִים, וּלְבוֹנָה, וְזָהָב לְכַפּוֹרֶת, וְשִׁשָּׁה לִנְדָבָה.
human_translation: raises an objection There were thirteen horns in the Temple, and they were inscribed New shekels. And old shekels Nests, young birds for burnt-offerings; wood, frankincense; and gold for the Ark cover. And six for free-will offerings
llm_translation: The question was raised: There were thirteen shofars in the Temple, and it was written upon them: "Tiklin Chadatin, and Tiklin Atikin, and Kinin, and Gozlei Olah, and Etzim, and Levonah, and Zahav Lekapporet, and Shisha Lindavah."

hebrew_text: תִּקְלִין חַדְתִּין — אֵלּוּ שְׁקָלִים שֶׁל כׇּל שָׁנָה וְשָׁנָה, תִּקְלִין עַתִּיקִין — מִי שֶׁלֹּא שָׁקַל אֶשְׁתָּקַד, יִשְׁקוֹל לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה. קִינִּין — הֵן תּוֹרִין, גּוֹזְלֵי עוֹלָה — הֵן בְּנֵי יוֹנָה, וְכוּלָּן עוֹלוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: New shekels, these are shekels of each and every year old shekels, one who did not donate a shekel the previous year, donate the next year; nests, these are the turtledoves young birds for burnt-offerings, these are pigeons; and all these are burnt-offerings; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: New shekels - these are the shekels of every year, old shekels - one who did not weigh should be weighed for the next year. Kinin - they are turei, robbers of burnt offerings - they are the sons of doves, and all of them are burnt offerings, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אֲמַר: אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא, גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ. וּמִי חָיְישִׁינַן? וְהָתְנַן: הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ חַטָּאתוֹ מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם — מַקְרִיבִין אוֹתָהּ בְּחֶזְקַת שֶׁהוּא קַיָּים!
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said: They say in the West, decree due to a sin-offering whose owners have died. And are we concerned But didn’t we learn one who sends his sin-offering from overseas, they sacrifice it on the presumption that he is alive,
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, he said: They say in the West, a decree because of a sin-offering whose owners died. And are we concerned? But we learned: One who sends his sin-offering from overseas - they bring it with the presumption that it is valid!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: מִשּׁוּם חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ וַדַּאי. וְנִבְרוֹר אַרְבָּעָה זוּזֵי וְנִשְׁדֵּי בְּמַיָּא, וְהָנָךְ נִישְׁתְּרוֹ? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה לֵית לֵיהּ בְּרֵירָה.
human_translation: Rather, due to a sin-offering whose owner has certainly died, let us select four zuz , and throw them into the water and these will be permitted. Rabbi Yehuda does not accept clarification.
llm_translation: Rather: because of the sin offering that died with its owners, for sure. And four coins were clarified and thrown into the water, and where are they? Rabbi Yehuda does not hold of it with certainty.

hebrew_text: מְנָא לַן? אִילֵּימָא מֵהָא דִּתְנַן: הַלּוֹקֵחַ יַיִן מִבֵּין הַכּוּתִיִּים, עֶרֶב שַׁבָּת עִם חֲשֵׁכָה — עוֹמֵד וְאוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי לוּגִּין שֶׁאֲנִי עָתִיד לְהַפְרִישׁ הֲרֵי הֵן תְּרוּמָה.
human_translation: From where do we If we say from that which we learned one who buys wine from among the Samaritans, on Shabbat eve at nightfall arise and say: Two log which I will separate in the future, shall be teruma
llm_translation: We ask: From where do we derive this? If we were to say from that which we learned: One who purchases wine from among the Kutim on Erev Shabbat at twilight - he stands and declares: "Two logim that I am about to separate, behold they are terumah."

hebrew_text: עֲשָׂרָה מַעֲשֵׂר רִאשׁוֹן, תִּשְׁעָה מַעֲשֵׂר שֵׁנִי, וּמֵיחֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה מִיָּד. דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: ten first tithe; nine second tithe. And he redeems and he immediately drink the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Ten ma'aser rishon, tish'ah ma'aser sheni, u'meichal v'shoteh miyad. Divrei Rabbi Meir. English translation: Ten tithe first, nine tithe second, and eat and drink immediately. The words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹסְרִין. אַלְמָא אֵין בְּרֵירָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit Apparently, there is no clarification.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Yosei, and Rabbi Shimon prohibit. This implies there is no choice.

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא, אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי מֵאִיר: אִי אַתָּה מוֹדֶה שֶׁמָּא יִבָּקַע הַנּוֹד וְנִמְצָא שׁוֹתֶה טְבָלִים לְמַפְרֵעַ? וְאָמַר לָהֶם: לִכְשֶׁיִּבָּקַע.
human_translation: From where Perhaps it is different there, as the reason is taught: said to Rabbi Meir: Do you not concede the jug might split open And he be found drinking untithed retroactively. And he said to them: if it splits open,
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps it is different there, as it is taught in the Mishnah, they said to Rabbi Meir: If you admit that perhaps the barrier will break and it will be found that he is drinking untithed produce? And he said to them: When it breaks.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, מִדְּתָנֵי אַיּוֹ. דְּתָנֵי אַיּוֹ, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין אָדָם מַתְנֶה עַל שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים כְּאֶחָד.
human_translation: Rather, from Ayo taught. As Ayo taught Rabbi Yehuda says: A person cannot stipulate conditions about two matters at once,
llm_translation: Rather, from where do we learn it? From where do we learn it? Rabbi Yehuda says: A person does not make a condition on two matters as one.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: אִם בָּא חָכָם לַמִּזְרָח — עֵירוּבוֹ לַמִּזְרָח. לַמַּעֲרָב — עֵירוּבוֹ לַמַּעֲרָב. אֲבָל לְכָאן וּלְכָאן — לָא.
human_translation: Rather, if the Sage comes to the east, his eiruv is to the east, to the west, his eiruv is to the west. However, not from here, and from there,
llm_translation: Rather: if a wise man comes to the east - his residence is in the east. To the west - his residence is in the west. But to here and to there - no.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: מַאי שְׁנָא לְכָאן וּלְכָאן דְּלָא, דְּאֵין בְּרֵירָה.
human_translation: And we discussed What is different from here and from there not that there is no clarification,
llm_translation: And we ask about it: What is the difference here and there that there is no choice.

hebrew_text: לְמִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב נָמֵי אֵין בְּרֵירָה?
human_translation: to the east and the west also there is no clarification.
llm_translation: To the east and to the west, Nami, is there choice?

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּשֶׁכְּבָר בָּא חָכָם.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said: as the Sage had already come
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said: When a wise man has already come.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמְרִינַן לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אֵין בְּרֵירָה, הָא כְּתִיבָה אִית לֵיהּ! יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים נָמֵי, נַעֲבֵיד תְּרֵי וְנִכְתּוֹב עֲלַיְיהוּ!
human_translation: And now that we have said according to Rabbi Yehuda there is no clarification, he is of writing, Yom Kippur as well, let us place two and write on them
llm_translation: At this time when we said to Rabbi Yehuda, "There is no free choice," behold, it is written! Yom Kippur indeed, we perform two and write upon them!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם חוּלְשָׁא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל לָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, בְּלָא כְּתִיבָה נָמֵי, הַאי נְפִישׁ וְהַאי זוּטַר.
human_translation: due to the High Priest’s weakness. not on his mind; As, if you do not say so, without writing also this is large and this is small.
llm_translation: On account of the weakness of the High Priest, I do not know. For if you do not say so, without a scriptural verse also, this one is significant and this one is insignificant.

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא לָא מְקַבֵּיל לֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ, וְהָאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַשּׁוֹחֵט צָרִיךְ שֶׁיְּקַבֵּל אֶת כׇּל דָּמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאֵת כׇּל דַּם הַפָּר יִשְׁפּוֹךְ אֶל יְסוֹד הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״.
human_translation: And if you say he does not collect all didn’t Rav Yehuda say: One who slaughters must receive all of the blood of bull, as it is stated: “And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out on the base of the altar”
llm_translation: And if you will say, he does not receive all of it, but Rav Yehudah said: One who slaughters must receive all the blood of the bull, as it is stated: "And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out at the base of the altar."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: דִּילְמָא מִשְׁתְּפִיךְ מִינֵּיהּ — הַאי חִיוָּר וְהַאי סוּמָּק. אֶלָּא, מִשּׁוּם חוּלְשָׁא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל לָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ. הָכָא נָמֵי, מִשּׁוּם חוּלְשָׁא דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל לָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And if you say perhaps some of might spill, this white and this is red Rather, due to the High Priest’s weakness, not on his mind. Here, too, due to the High Priest’s weakness not on his mind.
llm_translation: And if you will say: perhaps she became impure from him — this one is a wild animal and this one is a blind person. Rather, due to the weakness of the High Priest's knowledge. Here too, due to the weakness of the High Priest's knowledge.

hebrew_text: הָהוּא דִּנְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא, אֲמַר: יָצָא וְהִנִּיחוֹ עַל כַּן שֵׁנִי שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל, נָטַל דַּם הַפָּר, וְהִנִּיחַ דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר.
human_translation: A certain person descended before Rava he recited: emerged and placed on the second golden pedestal in the Sanctuary; he took the blood of the bull and placed the blood of the goat
llm_translation: That one who stood before Rava, said: He went out and placed it, therefore he placed two in the sanctuary, he took the blood of the bull, and placed the blood of the goat.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ: חֲדָא כְּרַבָּנַן וַחֲדָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה?! אֵימָא: הִנִּיחַ דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר, וְנָטַל דַּם הַפָּר.
human_translation: said to him: one in accordance with the Rabbis, and one in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. Rather, recite He placed the blood of the goat and took the blood of the bull
llm_translation: He said to him: One like the Rabbanan and one like Rabbi Yehuda?! Say: Let him leave the blood of the goat, and take the blood of the cow.

hebrew_text: וְהִזָּה מִמֶּנּוּ עַל הַפָּרוֹכֶת כְּנֶגֶד אָרוֹן מִבַּחוּץ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכֵן יַעֲשֶׂה לְאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? כְּשֵׁם שֶׁמַּזֶּה לִפְנַי לְפָנִים — כָּךְ מַזֶּה בַּהֵיכָל.
human_translation: And sprinkled from on the curtain opposite the Ark from outside The Sages taught: and so shall he do for the Tent of Meeting What the verse states Just as he sprinkles in the innermost sanctum, so he sprinkles in the Sanctuary,
llm_translation: And he shall sprinkle from it upon the curtain opposite the Ark outward. The Rabbis taught: "And so he shall do to the Tent of Meeting," what is the teaching? Just as he sprinkles inside before the inside, so he shall sprinkle in the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: מָה לִפְנַי לִפְנִים, אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה מִדַּם הַפָּר — כָּךְ מַזֶּה בַּהֵיכָל. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁלִּפְנַי לִפְנִים, אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה מִדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר — כָּךְ מַזֶּה בַּהֵיכָל. ״הַשּׁוֹכֵן אִתָּם בְּתוֹךְ טוּמְאֹתָם״, אֲפִילּוּ בִּשְׁעַת שֶׁהֵן טְמֵאִים — שְׁכִינָה עִמָּהֶם.
human_translation: Just as the innermost sanctum once upward and seven downward from the blood of the bull, so he sprinkles in the Sanctuary. And just as the innermost sanctum once upward and seven downward from the blood of the goat, so he sprinkles in the Sanctuary. “That dwells with them in the midst of their impurity,” even when are impure, the Divine Presence is with them.
llm_translation: Before, before, one above and seven below from the blood of the bull - so sprinkles in the sanctuary. And just as before, before, one above and seven below from the blood of the goat - so sprinkles in the sanctuary. "Who dwells among them in the midst of their impurities," even when they are impure - the Divine Presence is with them.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ הָהוּא צַדּוּקִי לְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא:
human_translation: A certain Sadducee said to Rabbi Ḥanina:
llm_translation: He said to him, that Sadducee to Rabbi Chanina:

hebrew_text: הַשְׁתָּא בָּרִי טְמֵאִים אַתּוּן, דִּכְתִיב: ״טוּמְאָתָהּ בְּשׁוּלֶיהָ״. אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תָּא חֲזִי מָה כְּתִיב בְּהוּ: ״הַשּׁוֹכֵן אִתָּם בְּתוֹךְ טוּמְאֹתָם״, אֲפִילּוּ בִּזְמַן שֶׁהֵן טְמֵאִין — שְׁכִינָה שְׁרוּיָה בֵּינֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Now you are certainly impure, as it is written “Her impurity was in her skirts” said to him: Come see what is written about “That dwells with them in the midst of their impurity” even when they are impure, the Divine Presence dwells among them.
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: Are you impure creatures coming to teach me? As it is written: "Her impurity is in her skirts." He said to them: Come and see what is written about them: "Who dwells among them in the midst of their impurities," even when they are impure - the Divine Presence dwells among them.

hebrew_text: וְכִי דָּבָר הַלָּמֵד בְּהֶיקֵּשׁ, חוֹזֵר וּמְלַמֵּד בְּהֶיקֵּשׁ?
human_translation: And does a matter derived by juxtaposition, again teach by juxtaposition?
llm_translation: And when a matter is learned with difficulty, does one go back and teach with difficulty?

hebrew_text: הַאי, הֵימֶנּוּ וְדָבָר אַחֵר הוּא, וְלָא הָוֵי הֶיקֵּשׁ.
human_translation: this is from that and something else is not a juxtaposition
llm_translation: This, he includes and another matter it is, and not it is a contradiction.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר לָא הָוֵי הֶיקֵּשׁ. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר הָוֵי הֶיקֵּשׁ, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: It works out well according to the one who said is not a juxtaposition but according to the one who says is a juxtaposition, what can be said?
llm_translation: He left it for the one who said it is not a contradiction. Rather, for the one who said it is a contradiction, what can be said?

hebrew_text: מְקוֹמוֹת הוּא דְּגָמְרִי מֵהֲדָדֵי.
human_translation: It is locations that are derived from one another.
llm_translation: Places he that learned from Hadadei.

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: חוּץ מִבִּפְנִים בַּחֲדָא זִימְנָא גָּמַר.
human_translation: If you wish, say outside is derived from inside all at once,
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: "Except from within, in one time, he finished."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא מַזֶּה, אֵינוֹ מַזֶּה עַל הַפָּרוֹכֶת, אֶלָּא כְּנֶגֶד הַפָּרוֹכֶת. אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ בְּרוֹמִי, וְהָיוּ עָלֶיהָ כַּמָּה טִיפֵּי דָמִים שֶׁל פַּר וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: taught: When sprinkles he does not sprinkle on the curtain but opposite the curtain. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I saw in Rome. And on were several drops of blood from the bull and the goat of Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Mishnah: When he sprinkles, he does not sprinkle on the Parochet, but opposite the Parochet. Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei said: I saw it in Rome, and there were on it like the drops of blood of the bull and goat of Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: וְדִילְמָא דְּפַר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר וּשְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה הֲווֹ!
human_translation: But Perhaps were bull for an unwitting communal sin the goats for idolatry,
llm_translation: Perhaps he nullified a matter of communal importance and the he-goats of foreign worship were there!

hebrew_text: דַּחֲזָא דַּעֲבִידִי כְּסִדְרָן. וּתְנַן נָמֵי גַּבֵּי פַּר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא: כְּשֶׁהוּא מַזֶּה, לֹא הָיוּ נוֹגְעִין בַּפָּרוֹכֶת, וְאִם נָגְעוּ — נָגְעוּ.
human_translation: that he saw that these were performed in their order, And we also learned a case like this with regard to bull for an unwitting communal sin: When he sprinkles, would not touch the curtain, but if it did touch, it touched,
llm_translation: See that he does as their order. And we learned in the Mishnah regarding the cow that conceals a matter of the community, for this is the case: when it defecates, they would not touch the curtain, and if they touched - they touched.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי: אֲנִי רְאִיתִיהָ בְּרוֹמִי, וְהָיוּ עָלֶיהָ כַּמָּה טִיפֵּי דָמִים שֶׁל פַּר הֶעְלֵם דָּבָר שֶׁל צִבּוּר, וּשְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה. וְדִילְמָא דְּפַר וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים נִינְהוּ? דַּחֲזַנְהוּ דַּעֲבִידִי שֶׁלֹּא כְּסִדְרָן.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I saw in Rome, and there were several drops of blood on it from bull for an unwitting communal sin and goats for idolatry. But perhaps they from the bull and goat of Yom Kippur? He saw that they were performed not in their order
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: I saw it in Rome, and there were on it drops of blood like the blood of the Par He'elem (a bull offered by the community for an unknown sin), and the he-goats of foreign worship. And perhaps they were the bull and he-goat of Yom Kippur? For I saw that they were being done not in their proper order.

hebrew_text: נִתְעָרְבוּ לוֹ דָּמִים בְּדָמִים, אָמַר רָבָא: נוֹתֵן אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה, וְעוֹלֶה לוֹ לְכָאן וּלְכָאן.
human_translation: the blood became mixed with the blood Rava said: present once upward and seven downward, and that counts toward this and that
llm_translation: The bloods mixed with blood, Rava said: One above and seven below, and it is effective for him here and here.

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה, אָמַר: בַּבְלָאֵי טַפְשָׁאֵי, מִשּׁוּם דְּדָיְירִי בְּאַרְעָא דַחֲשׁוֹכָא — אָמְרִי שְׁמַעְתָּא דִּמְחַשְּׁכָן! הָא קָא יָהֵיב לְמַעְלָה דְּשָׂעִיר מִקַּמֵּי מַטָּה דְּפַר, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: ״וְכִלָּה מִכַּפֵּר אֶת הַקֹּדֶשׁ״, כַּלֵּה דַּם הַפָּר וְאַחַר כָּךְ כַּלֵּה דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר!
human_translation: They said this before Rabbi Yirmeya he said: Foolish Babylonians! Because they live in a dark, land, they speak darkened halakhot , he presents upward of the goat before downward bull; and the Torah said: “And when he has finished atoning for the sacred place” He finishes the blood of the bull and afterward he finishes the blood of the goat.
llm_translation: They said before Rabbi Yirmeya, he said: Inhabitants of the Babylonian villages, because they dwell in a dark land — they say, "You have heard that they are darkening!" Here, he placed the scapegoat above the bull's head, and the Torah said: "And he shall make atonement for the Holy Place," first he completes the blood of the bull, and afterwards he completes the blood of the goat!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: נוֹתֵן אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה לְשֵׁם הַפָּר, וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹתֵן אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה לְשֵׁם הַשָּׂעִיר.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya said He presents once upward and seven downward for the purpose of the bull, And he again presents once upward and seven downward for the purpose of the goat.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yirmeya said: One above and seven below for the sake of the bull, and then he goes back and gives one above and seven below for the sake of the goat.

hebrew_text: נִתְעָרְבוּ לוֹ דָּמִים בְּדָמִים בְּמַתָּנוֹת הָאַחֲרוֹנוֹת, סְבַר רַב פָּפָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא לְמֵימַר: נוֹתֵן שֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה לְשֵׁם פַּר וּלְשֵׁם שָׂעִיר, וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹתֵן אַחַת לְמַעְלָה לְשֵׁם שָׂעִיר.
human_translation: the blood became mixed with the blood during the final presentations Rav Pappa, before Rava, thought to say: He presents seven downward for the purpose of the bull and for the purpose of the goat, and he again presents once upward for the purpose of the goat.
llm_translation: They became mixed with him bloods in bloods in the latter gifts, Rav Papa thought before Rava to say: One gives seven below for the sake of the bull and for the sake of the goat, and then goes back and gives one above for the sake of the goat.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: עַד הַשְׁתָּא קָרוּ לַן טַפְשָׁאֵי, וְהַשְׁתָּא — טַפְשָׁאֵי דְטַפְשָׁאֵי, דְּקָא מַגְמְרִינַן לְהוּ וְלָא גְּמִירִי. וְהָא קָא יָהֵיב מַטָּה דְשָׂעִיר מִקַּמֵּי מַעְלָה דְשָׂעִיר, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: תֵּן לְמַעְלָה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ לְמַטָּה!
human_translation: Rava said to him: Until now they called us foolish, and now foolish of the foolish, as we teach them and they do not learn. But he presents downward for the goat before upward for the goat, and the Torah said: Present upward and then downward.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: Until now, we have been dealing with fools, and now we are dealing with the fools of fools, for we are teaching them and they do not learn. And he gave the tail of the he-goat before the fat of the he-goat, and the Torah said: Give the fat first, and then the tail!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: נוֹתֵן שֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה לְשֵׁם פַּר, וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹתֵן אַחַת לְמַעְלָה וְשֶׁבַע לְמַטָּה לְשֵׁם שָׂעִיר.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: He presents downward seven for the purpose of the bull, and he again presents upward once and downward seven for the purpose of the goat.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: One places seven below for the name of a bull, then goes back and places one above and seven below for the name of a goat.

hebrew_text: נִתְעָרְבוּ לוֹ כּוֹסוֹת בְּכוֹסוֹת — נוֹתֵן, וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹתֵן,
human_translation: cups became mixed, He presents and he again presents
llm_translation: The cups were mixed with his cups - he gives, and then gives again.

hebrew_text: וְחוֹזֵר וְנוֹתֵן, שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּעָמִים.
human_translation: And he again presents three times.
llm_translation: And he returns and gives, three times.

hebrew_text: מִקְצָת דָּמִים נִתְעָרְבוּ לוֹ, וּמִקְצָת דָּמִים לֹא נִתְעָרְבוּ [לוֹ], פְּשִׁיטָא: כִּי יָהֵיב — מִוַּדָּאִין יְהֵיב.
human_translation: If part of blood became mixed and part of the blood did not become mixed, obvious: When he presents, he presents from the certain
llm_translation: Some of the blood mixed with him, and some of the blood did not mix with him, it is obvious: when he gives - he gives with certainty.

hebrew_text: מִיהוּ, הָנָךְ: שִׁירַיִם הָווּ, וְלִיסוֹד אָזְלִי, אוֹ דִילְמָא: דְּחוּיִין הָווּ, וְאָזְלִי לְאַמָּה?
human_translation: However, the other Are they remainder and goes to the base Or perhaps is rejected, and go to the canal
llm_translation: Who, there: Shirayim were, and to the foundation they went, or perhaps: they were destroyed, and went to the nation?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כּוֹס אֶחָד עוֹשֶׂה חֲבֵירוֹ שִׁירַיִם — הָנֵי מִילֵּי הֵיכָא דְּאִי בָּעֵי לְמֵיתַב מָצֵי יָהֵיב. אֲבָל הַאי, דְּאִי בָּעֵי לְמֵיתַב לָא מָצֵי יָהֵיב — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Even according to the one who says one cup renders its counterpart a remainder, this applies where he could present if he wanted However, this as not be presented if he wanted not
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Even according to the one who says one cup makes his fellow sing two songs - those words are applicable where if he wants to sit, he can give. But this one, where if he wants to sit, he cannot give - no.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ לְרַב פָּפָּא: אַדְּרַבָּה: אֲפִילּוּ לְמַאן דְּאָמַר כּוֹס אֶחָד עוֹשֶׂה חֲבֵירוֹ דָּחוּי — הָנֵי מִילֵּי, דְּדַחְיֵיהּ בְּיָדַיִם, אֲבָל הֵיכָא דְּלָא דַּחְיֵיהּ בְּיָדַיִם — לָא.
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said to Rav Pappa: On the contrary, even according to the one who says one cup renders its counterpart rejected, that applies he rejects with hands, However, where he does not reject it with hands, not
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said to Rav Papa: "Adrabah: Even according to the one who says one cup can nullify another - those words, which nullify with hands, but where it does not nullify with hands - no."

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, לְמַעְלָה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֶת דָּמוֹ יִשְׁפּוֹךְ״, וּלְמַטָּה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֶת כׇּל דָּמָהּ יִשְׁפּוֹךְ״.
human_translation: As it was taught above, it says: and he shall pour its blood And below it says: and he shall pour all its blood
llm_translation: It was taught: Above it says, "And his blood shall be poured out," and below it says, "And all her blood shall be poured out."

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִין לְחַטָּאת שֶׁקִּבֵּל דָּמָה בְּאַרְבַּע כּוֹסוֹת וְנָתַן מִזֶּה אַחַת וּמִזֶּה אַחַת, שֶׁכּוּלָּן נִשְׁפָּכִין לַיְּסוֹד — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֶת כׇּל דָּמָהּ יִשְׁפּוֹךְ״.
human_translation: From where with regard to a sin-offering that one collected its blood in four cups and presented once from this and once from that that all is poured on the base The verse states: “And he shall pour all its blood.”
llm_translation: From where do we derive that for a sin offering whose blood was received in four cups and he placed one from this and one from this, that all of them are poured out at the base? The Torah teaches: "And all of its blood shall be poured out."

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אֲפִילּוּ נָתַן אַרְבַּע מַתָּנוֹת מֵאַחַת מֵהֶן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֶת דָּמוֹ יִשְׁפּוֹךְ״ — הָהוּא נִשְׁפָּךְ לַיְּסוֹד, וְהֵן נִשְׁפָּכִין לָאַמָּה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִנַּיִין לְחַטָּאת שֶׁקִּבֵּל דָּמָה בְּאַרְבַּע כּוֹסוֹת וְנָתַן אַרְבַּע מַתָּנוֹת מֵאֶחָד מֵהֶן, שֶׁכּוּלָּן נִשְׁפָּכִין לַיְּסוֹד — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֶת כׇּל דָּמָהּ יִשְׁפּוֹךְ״.
human_translation: might even he presented four presentations from one of them, the verse states: “And he shall pour its blood.” that is poured on the base and the are poured into the canal. Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: From where with regard to a sin-offering that if one collected its blood in four cups and presented four presentations from one of them, that they are all poured at the base The verse states: “And he shall pour all its blood.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It might have been thought that even if he gave four gifts from one of them - Scripture states: "And its blood shall be poured out" - that one is poured out to the base, and they are poured out to the cubit. Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: From where do we derive for the sin offering that if he received its blood in four cups and gave four gifts from one of them, that all of them are poured out to the base - Scripture states: "And all of its blood shall be poured out." English translation:

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הָא כְּתִיב: ״וְאֶת דָּמוֹ יִשְׁפּוֹךְ״? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: לְמַעוֹטֵי שִׁירַיִם שֶׁבְּצַוַּאר בְּהֵמָה.
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Shimon, it written: “And he shall pour its blood”? Rav Ashi said: to exclude remainders that are in the throat of animal.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Eliezer the son of Rabbi Shimon, it is written: "And his blood shall be poured out"? Rav Ashi said: to exclude the songs that are in the throat of an animal.

hebrew_text: עֵירָה דַּם הַפָּר לְתוֹךְ דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר. תְּנַן כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר: מְעָרְבִין לִקְרָנוֹת. דְּאִיתְּמַר: רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה וְרַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, חַד אָמַר: מְעָרְבִין, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵין מְעָרְבִין.
human_translation: he poured the blood of the bull into the blood of the goat. We learned in accordance with the one who said mixes on the corners As it was stated: Rabbi Yoshiya and Rabbi Yonatan, One said: mixes and one said: He does not mix
llm_translation: City of blood of the bull into blood of the goat. We learned according to whom said: mix to the horns. It was said: Rabbi Yoshiyah and Rabbi Yonatan, one said: mix, and one said: do not mix.

hebrew_text: תִּסְתַּיֵּים דְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה הוּא דְּאָמַר מְעָרְבִין, דְּאָמַר: אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא כְּתִיב ״יַחְדָּיו״ — כְּמַאן דִּכְתִיב ״יַחְדָּיו״ דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Conclude Rabbi Yoshiya was who said mixes although Together, is not written it is considered as though Together, is written.
llm_translation: The completion of Rabbi Yoshiyah, who said they mix, as he said: Even though it is not written "together" - it is similar to one for whom it is written "together."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן הוּא, שָׁאנֵי הָכָא דִּכְתִיב: ״אַחַת״.
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Yonatan, it is different here, as it is written “once”
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yonatan, it is different here, as it is written: "one."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא דְּלָא כְּשִׁנּוּיַין: ״וְלָקַח מִדַּם הַפָּר וּמִדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר״, שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מְעוֹרָבִין, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: It was taught contrary to our response, and he shall take of the blood of the bull and of the blood of the goat, that be mixed. the statement of Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita that is not like the way they are usually mixed: "And he shall take from the blood of the bull and from the blood of the goat," that they should be mixed, the words of Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן אוֹמֵר: מִזֶּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, וּמִזֶּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״אַחַת״!
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: from this by itself, and from that by itself Rabbi Yoshiya said to him: But wasn’t it already stated: once
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: "From this by itself, and from this by itself." Rabbi Yoshiyah said to him: "But hasn't it already been said: 'one'!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״מִדַּם הַפָּר וּמִדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר״! אִם כֵּן, לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״אַחַת״? לוֹמַר לָךְ: אַחַת וְלֹא שְׁתַּיִם מִדַּם הַפָּר, אַחַת וְלֹא שְׁתַּיִם מִדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan said to him: But wasn’t it already stated: “Of the blood of the bull and of the blood of the goat” If so, why is “once” stated? to tell you once and not two from the blood of the bull; once and not two from the blood of the goat.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yonatan, but hasn't it already been said: "from the blood of the bull and from the blood of the goat"! If so, why is it stated "one"? To tell you: one and not two from the blood of the bull, one and not two from the blood of the goat.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״וְלָקַח מִדַּם הַפָּר וּמִדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר״ — שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר שֶׁיִּהְיוּ מְעוֹרָבִין זֶה בָּזֶה, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא מִזֶּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ וּמִזֶּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַחַת״. וּסְתָמָא כְּרַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה.
human_translation: It was taught another “And he shall take of the blood of the bull and of the blood of the goat” that should be mixed together. you say that they should be mixed together, or perhaps that is not from this by itself and from that by itself? the verse states: “Once.” And unattributed is in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiya,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: "And he shall take from the blood of the bull and from the blood of the goat" - that they should be mixed with each other. Do you say that they should be mixed with each other, or should it be only from this by itself and from this by itself? The verse teaches: "One." And the anonymous Mishnaic statement is in accordance with Rabbi Yoshiyah.

hebrew_text: נָתַן אֶת הַמָּלֵא בָּרֵיקָן וְכוּ׳. בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: הִנִּיחַ מִזְרָק בְּתוֹךְ מִזְרָק, וְקִבֵּל בּוֹ אֶת הַדָּם, מַהוּ? מִין בְּמִינוֹ חוֹצֵץ, אוֹ אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ?
human_translation: he placed from the full into the empty Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: What is he placed bowl inside bowl and collected the blood in type with its type interpose, Or does not interpose
llm_translation: He placed the full vessel into the empty vessel, etc. Rami bar Hama asked from Rav Ḥisda: If one placed a sprinkler within another sprinkler and received blood with it, what is the halakha? Does a species separate within its own species, or does it not separate?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵיתוּהָ: נָתַן אֶת הַמָּלֵא בָּרֵיקָן. מַאי לָאו: הוֹשִׁיב מִזְרָק מָלֵא לְתוֹךְ מִזְרָק רֵיקָן?
human_translation: said to him: We learned He placed from the full into the empty What, is it not he inserted full bowl into empty bowl?
llm_translation: He said to him, "You should give it to her: he placed the full one in the empty vessel." What is the reason? Did he not pour from a full vessel into an empty vessel?

hebrew_text: לָא, עֵירָה מִזְרָק מָלֵא לְתוֹךְ מִזְרָק רֵיקָן. הָא תְּנָא לֵיהּ רֵישָׁא: עֵירָה דַּם הַפָּר לְתוֹךְ דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר! כְּדֵי לְעָרְבָן יָפֶה יָפֶה.
human_translation: No, he poured full bowl into empty bowl. as taught first He poured the blood of the bull into the blood of the goat. in order to mix them very well.
llm_translation: Not, city, its sprinkling, full, into, sprinkling, empty. The, here, teaches, it, beginning: city, blood, the bull, into, blood, the goat! In order to mix them well.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: הָיָה עוֹמֵד עַל גַּבֵּי כְּלִי, אוֹ עַל גַּבֵּי רֶגֶל חֲבֵירוֹ — פָּסוּל! שָׁאנֵי רֶגֶל, דְּלָא מָצֵי מְבַטֵּיל לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear was standing on top of a vessel, or on the foot of another is disqualified, A foot is different, as he cannot nullify it.
llm_translation: Come and hear: If one was standing on top of a vessel, or on top of his fellow's foot - it is invalid! This is different from a foot, as one cannot nullify it.

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, הָכִי בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ: דֶּרֶךְ שֵׁירוּת בְּכָךְ, אוֹ אֵין דֶּרֶךְ שֵׁירוּת בְּכָךְ? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״אֶת כׇּל כְּלֵי הַשָּׁרֵת אֲשֶׁר יְשָׁרְתוּ בָם בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ״ — שְׁנֵי כֵלִים וְשֵׁירוּת אַחַת.
human_translation: Some say this is dilemma he raised before Is manner of service; or is this not manner of service, Come hear which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: all the service vessels, with which they serve in the Sanctuary” two vessels and one service,
llm_translation: There are some who say, thus he asked of him: Is this the way of service, or is this not the way of service? Come and hear, for it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "All the service vessels with which they serve in the sanctuary" - two vessels and one service.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא מֵרַב חִסְדָּא: הִנִּיחַ סִיב בְּתוֹךְ הַמִּזְרָק, וְקִבֵּל בּוֹ אֶת הַדָּם, מַהוּ: מִין בְּשֶׁאֵינוֹ מִינוֹ חוֹצֵץ, אוֹ אֵינוֹ חוֹצֵץ? כֵּיוָן דִּמְחַלְחֵל — לָא חָיֵיץ, אוֹ דִילְמָא לָא שְׁנָא?
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised dilemma before Rav Ḥisda What is he placed bast, inside the bowl, and collected the blood in type with not its type interpose; or it does not interpose? since the blood seeps does not interpose? Or perhaps no different,
llm_translation: The student asked Bar Ḥama from Rav Ḥisda: If one placed a sponge in the midst of the tube and received blood with it, what is the ruling: is a species that is not its own considered a barrier, or is it not a barrier? Since it absorbs — it does not block, or perhaps it is different?

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ, תְּנֵינָא: זוֹלֵף וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לַסְּפוֹג! שָׁאנֵי מַיָּא דִּקְלִישִׁי.
human_translation: said to him We learned He sprinkles and continues until he reaches the sponge. Water is different, as it is thin
llm_translation: He said to him, we learned: "He sifts and walks until he reaches the sponge! Different from the water of the palm tree."

hebrew_text: אִיכָּא דְאָמְרִי, הָכִי פְּשַׁט לֵיהּ: בְּדָם — כָּשֵׁר. בְּקוֹמֶץ — פָּסוּל.
human_translation: Some say this is how resolved for of the blood it is valid, of the handful it is disqualified.
llm_translation: There are some who say, thus he explained it: with blood — valid. with a fistful — invalid.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ ״וְיָצָא אֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ אֲשֶׁר לִפְנֵי ה׳״, זֶה מִזְבַּח הַזָּהָב. הִתְחִיל מְחַטֵּא וְיוֹרֵד, מֵהֵיכָן הוּא מַתְחִיל? מִקֶּרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית, מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית, דְּרוֹמִית מִזְרָחִית. מָקוֹם שֶׁהוּא מַתְחִיל בַּחַטָּאת עַל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן — מִשָּׁם הָיָה גּוֹמֵר עַל מִזְבֵּחַ הַפְּנִימִי.
human_translation: “And he shall go out to the altar that is before the Lord This is the golden altar, He began to cleanse downward. From where does he begin? from the northeast corner, northwest southwest southeast place he begins for a sin-offering on the outer altar, there he finishes on the inner altar.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: "And he shall go out to the altar that is before the Lord," this refers to the golden altar. He begins by sinning and descending, from where does he begin? From the northeastern corner, then to the northwestern corner, then to the southwestern corner, then to the southeastern corner. The place where he begins with the sin offering on the outer altar - from there he concludes on the inner altar.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ הָיָה עוֹמֵד וּמְחַטֵּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: he stood in place and sprinkled
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: "In his place he was standing and sinning."

hebrew_text: וְעַל כּוּלָּן הָיָה נוֹתֵן מִלְּמַטָּה לְמַעְלָה, חוּץ מִזּוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה לְפָנָיו, שֶׁהָיָה נוֹתֵן מִלְּמַעְלָה לְמַטָּה. הִזָּה עַל טׇהֳרוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים, וּשְׁיָרֵי הַדָּם הָיָה שׁוֹפֵךְ עַל יְסוֹד מַעֲרָבִי שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן, וְשֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן הָיָה שׁוֹפֵךְ אֶל יְסוֹד דְּרוֹמִי. אֵלּוּ וְאֵלּוּ מִתְעָרְבִין בָּאַמָּה וְיוֹצְאִין לְנַחַל קִדְרוֹן, וְנִמְכָּרִין לַגַּנָּנִין לְזַבֵּל, וּמוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: And on all the corners he would present from below upward, except for that that was before him, which he would present from above downward. He sprinkled on pure of the altar seven times And he would pour the remainder of the blood on the western base of the outer altar. he would pour on the outer altar, on its southern base. These and those mixed in the canal and flow out to the Kidron River. sold to gardeners for fertilizer. misuse
llm_translation: And upon all of them he would place from below to above, except for this one that was before him, for he would place from above to below.
