He would sprinkle upon the purity of the altar seven times, and the remainder of the blood he would pour on the western foundation of the outer altar, and of the outer altar he would pour onto the southern foundation. These and these would intermingle at the cubit and exit to the Kidron Valley, and would be sold to the gardeners for fertilizer, and they would be used for compost.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְיָצָא אֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אָמַר רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: לְפִי שֶׁמָּצִינוּ בְּפַר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת, שֶׁכֹּהֵן עוֹמֵד חוּץ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּמַזֶּה עַל הַפָּרוֹכֶת בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהוּא מַזֶּה, יָכוֹל אַף זֶה כֵּן,
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And he shall go out to the altar” What the verse states Rabbi Neḥemya said: because we find with regard to the bull brought for all the mitzvot, that when the priest sprinkles he stands past the altar and sprinkles toward the curtain; might that here, too, the same
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And he shall go out to the altar," what is the teaching to say? Rabbi Nechemiah said: Since we have found in the case of the bull brought for all the commandments, that the priest stands outside the altar and sprinkles on the curtain at the time of sprinkling, one might think the same applies here.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְיָצָא אֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״. הֵיכָן הָיָה — לִפְנִים מִן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: the verse states: “And he shall go out to the altar.” Where was he on the inner side of the altar,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Talmud teaches: "And he shall go out to the altar." Where was he — in front of the altar.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״לִפְנֵי ה׳״, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר? אָמַר רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: לְפִי שֶׁמָּצִינוּ בְּפַר וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁכֹּהֵן עוֹמֵד לִפְנִים מִן הַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּמַזֶּה עַל הַפָּרוֹכֶת בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁהוּא מַזֶּה, יָכוֹל אַף זֶה, כֵּן,
human_translation: It was taught another before the Lord What the verse states: Rabbi Neḥemya said: because we find with regard to the bull and the goat of Yom Kippur that when he sprinkles Priest stands on the inner side of the altar, and sprinkles toward the curtain; might here, too, the same
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Before the Lord," what does the Scripture come to teach? Rabbi Nechemiah said: Because we find with the bull and the goat of Yom Kippur that the priest stands in front of the altar and sprinkles on the curtain at the time he is sprinkling, one might think the same applies here as well.

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מִזְבַּח קְטֹרֶת הַסַּמִּים לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֲשֶׁר בְּאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ — מִזְבֵּחַ לִפְנֵי ה׳, וְאֵין כֹּהֵן לִפְנֵי ה׳. הָא כֵּיצַד? עוֹמֵד חוּץ לַמִּזְבֵּחַ וּמַזֶּה.
human_translation: the verse states: altar of sweet incense before the Lord, which is in the Tent of Meeting” altar before the Lord, but the priest is not before the Lord. How so? stands on the outer side of the altar and sprinkles.
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "An altar of incense, the spices before the Lord, which is in the Tent of Meeting" — an altar before the Lord, and there is no priest before the Lord. How so? He stands outside the altar and sprinkles.

hebrew_text: הִתְחִיל מְחַטֵּא וְיוֹרֵד וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הִתְחִיל מְחַטֵּא וְיוֹרֵד. מֵהֵיכָן הָיָה מַתְחִיל? מִקֶּרֶן מִזְרָחִית דְּרוֹמִית, דְּרוֹמִית מַעֲרָבִית, מַעֲרָבִית צְפוֹנִית, צְפוֹנִית מִזְרָחִית, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי אוֹמֵר: מִקֶּרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית, מַעֲרָבִית דְּרוֹמִית, דְּרוֹמִית מִזְרָחִית.
human_translation: He began to cleanse downward. The Sages taught He began to cleanse downward. From where would he begin? from the southeast corner southwest northwest northeast the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yosei HaGelili says: from the northeast corner, northwest southwest southeast
llm_translation: He began sinning and descending, etc. The Rabbis taught: He began sinning and descending. From where did he begin? From the southeast corner, southeast to southwest, southwest to northwest, northwest to northeast, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yosei the Galilean says: From the southeast corner to the northwest, northwest to southwest, southwest to southeast, southeast to northeast.

hebrew_text: מָקוֹם שֶׁרַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי מַתְחִיל, שָׁם רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא פּוֹסֵק. מָקוֹם שֶׁרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא מַתְחִיל, שָׁם רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי פּוֹסֵק.
human_translation: begins Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, there Rabbi Akiva ends; begins Rabbi Akiva, there Rabbi Yosei HaGelili ends.
llm_translation: The place where Rabbi Yosei the Galilean begins, there Rabbi Akiva concludes. The place where Rabbi Akiva begins, there Rabbi Yosei the Galilean concludes.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהָא, בְּהָהוּא קֶרֶן דְּפָגַע בְּרֵישָׁא — לָא עָבֵיד. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָצָא אֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, עַד דְּנָפֵיק מִכּוּלֵּיהּ מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: Everyone in any case, he does not perform at the corner that he encounters first. What is the reason Shmuel said: that the verse states: “And he shall go out to the altar,” until he goes out from entire altar.
llm_translation: The people of the world from it, in that horn that struck at first - did not do. What is the reason? Shmuel said, as the verse says: "And he shall go out to the altar," until he goes out from all the altar.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, נַקֵּיף דֶּרֶךְ יָמִין? לֵימָא בִּדְרָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל קָא מִיפַּלְגִי,
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, let him go around via the right. Let us say they disagree with regard to of Rami bar Yeḥezkel.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Akiva, is it clear the way of the right? Let us say in the south, in the house of Yechzekel, he would divide.

hebrew_text: דְּאָמַר רָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל: יָם שֶׁעָשָׂה שְׁלֹמֹה — ״עוֹמֵד עַל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר בָּקָר שְׁלֹשָׁה פוֹנִים צָפוֹנָה וּשְׁלֹשָׁה פוֹנִים יָמָּה וּשְׁלֹשָׁה פּוֹנִים נֶגְבָּה וּשְׁלֹשָׁה פּוֹנִים מִזְרָחָה וְהַיָּם עֲלֵיהֶם מִלְמָעְלָה וְכׇל אֲחוֹרֵיהֶם בָּיְתָה״. הָא לָמַדְתָּ, שֶׁכׇּל פִּינּוֹת שֶׁאַתָּה פּוֹנֶה לֹא יְהוּ אֶלָּא דֶּרֶךְ יָמִין, לַמִּזְרָח. מָר אִית לֵיהּ דְּרָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל, וּמָר לֵית לֵיהּ דְּרָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל.
human_translation: As Rami bar Yeḥezkel said: the sea, that Solomon built, “It stood upon twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east; and the sea was set upon them above, and all their hinder parts were inward” you learn that all turns that you turn should be only to the right to the east this Sage, is of of Rami bar Yeḥezkel, and this Sage, is of not Rami bar Yeḥezkel.
llm_translation: Ramai bar Yehezkel said: "A sea that Solomon made - 'He stood on twelve oxen, three facing north, three facing west, three facing south, and three facing east, and the sea was set on them, and all their rear parts were inward.' You have learned that all corners that you turn to should only be to the right, towards the east." There is one Master who agrees with Ramai bar Yehezkel, and one Master who does not agree with Ramai bar Yehezkel.

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא אִית לְהוּ דְּרָמֵי בַּר יְחֶזְקֵאל. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, מָר סָבַר: יָלְפִינַן פְּנִים מִחוּץ, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא יָלְפִינַן פְּנִים מִחוּץ.
human_translation: No, everyone is of Rami bar Yeḥezkel, but here they disagree with regard to this One Sage, holds: We derive inside from outside: And one Sage, holds: We do not derive inside from outside.
llm_translation: Not, for all the world has one who is like Bar Yehezkel. And here in this case they are in dispute, the Master thought: we should turn the face outward, and the Master thought: we should not turn the face outward.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נְהִי דְּלָא יָלֵיף פְּנִים מִחוּץ, אִי בָּעֵי — הָכִי נַעֲבֵיד, אִי בָּעֵי — הָכִי נַעֲבֵיד? אָמַר לָךְ רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: מִדִּינָא בְּהָהוּא קֶרֶן דְּפָגַע בְּרֵישָׁא — בְּהָהוּא עָבֵיד בְּרֵישָׁא, דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, although he does not derive inside from outside, if wants, let him perform this if he wants, let him perform that Rabbi Akiva said to you: by right he should begin by that corner that he reaches first, as Reish Lakish said: One does not pass on mitzvot.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, who did not turn his face away, if he wants to do so - let him do so, if he wants to do so - let him do so? Rabbi Akiva said to you: From the law in that corner where he encountered at first - in that corner he should do, as Reish Lakish said: We do not pass over the commandments.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי לָא עָבֵיד — מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״וְיָצָא אֶל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ״, עַד דְּנָפֵיק מִכּוּלֵּיהּ מִזְבֵּחַ. וְכֵיוָן דְּיָהֵיב בְּהָהוּא קֶרֶן — הָדַר אָתֵי לְהָהוּא קֶרֶן דְּאִיחַיַּיב לְמִיתַּב בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: And why does he not do due to which is written: “He shall go out to the altar,” until he goes out from entire altar. And since he presents at that corner he then comes to that corner where he should have presented first.
llm_translation: And why did he not do it? Because it is written: "And he shall go out to the altar," until he goes out from all the altar. And once he placed it on that horn, he must return to that horn that he is obligated to sit at the beginning.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: אִי סְבִירָא לַן הַקָּפָה בָּרֶגֶל — דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא לָא פְּלִיגִי דְּיָלְפִינַן פְּנִים מִחוּץ. וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר הַקָּפָה בַּיָּד, וּמָר סָבַר הַקָּפָה בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: And if you wish, say If we hold encircling by foot, everyone agrees that we learn inside outside. And here they disagree about this One Sage, holds encircling by hand; and one Sage, holds encircling by foot.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: If one holds that the coffee is like the foot - for everyone agrees that we do not pour outwards. And here, in this case, they are differing: one Master holds that the coffee is in the hand, and one Master holds that the coffee is in the foot.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא הַקָּפָה בַּיָּד, וְהָכָא בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר יָלְפִינַן יָד מֵרֶגֶל, וּמָר סָבַר: לָא יָלְפִינַן.
human_translation: And if you wish, say Everyone the encircling by hand, and here they disagree about this One Sage, holds we derive hand from foot, And one Sage, holds that we do not derive
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: that everyone in the world holds a spoon in their hand, and here in this case they are divided: one Master holds that we should wash the hand from the foot, and the other Master holds: we should not wash.

hebrew_text: וְסָבַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי הַגְּלִילִי הַקָּפָה בַּיָּד? וְהָא מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ הָיָה עוֹמֵד וּמְחַטֵּא, מִכְּלָל דְּתַנָּא קַמָּא לָא סְבִירָא לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא מְחַוַּורְתָּא כִדְשַׁנִּינַן מֵעִיקָּרָא: מָר סָבַר הַקָּפָה בַּיָּד, וּמָר סָבַר הַקָּפָה בָּרֶגֶל.
human_translation: And does Rabbi Yosei HaGelili hold the encircling by hand? But from that it is taught the latter clause Rabbi Eliezer says: He stood in place and sprinkled by inference the first tanna , does not maintain Rather, it is clear as we originally answered, one Sage, holds encircling by hand; and one Sage, holds encircling by foot.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yosei the Galilean thought, "Is the spoon in hand?" But it is taught in the latter part: Rabbi Eliezer says, "He was standing in his place and sinning," which implies that the first Tanna does not agree with him. Rather, it is as we learned initially: one Master holds the spoon in hand, and the other Master holds the spoon in the foot.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא, בְּהָא קָא מִיפַּלְגִי: מָר סָבַר: סָבִיב דְּמִזְבֵּחַ פְּנִימִי כְּסָבִיב דְּמִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן, וּמָר סָבַר: כּוּלֵּיהּ מִזְבֵּחַ פְּנִימִי בִּמְקוֹם חֲדָא קֶרֶן דְּמִזְבֵּחַ חִיצוֹן קָאֵי.
human_translation: And if you wish, say they disagree about this One Sage, holds perimeter of inner altar is like the perimeter of outer altar, and one Sage, holds entire inner altar stands in place of one corner of outer altar.
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: they are arguing about this. One Master holds: the inner altar is like the outer altar in circumference, and the other Master holds: the entire inner altar is in the place of one horn of the outer altar.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: שְׁנֵי כֹהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ בְּמִקְדָּשׁ רִאשׁוֹן, זֶה אוֹמֵר: בְּיָדִי הִקַּפְתִּי, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: בְּרַגְלַי הִקַּפְתִּי. זֶה נוֹתֵן טַעַם לִדְבָרָיו, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן טַעַם לִדְבָרָיו.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yishmael said: Two High Priests remained from the First Temple. This one says: I encircled by hand And that one says: I encircled by foot. This one gave a reason for his statement, and that one gave a reason for his statement.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yishmael said: Two High Priests remained in the First Temple, one said: "I grasped with my hand," and the other said: "I grasped with my foot." This one gives a reason for his words, and this one gives a reason for his words.

hebrew_text: זֶה נוֹתֵן טַעַם לִדְבָרָיו: סָבִיב דְּמִזְבֵּחַ פְּנִימִי כְּסָבִיב דְּמִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן, וְזֶה נוֹתֵן טַעַם לִדְבָרָיו: כּוּלֵּיהּ מִזְבֵּחַ פְּנִימִי בִּמְקוֹם חֲדָא קֶרֶן דְּחִיצוֹן קָאֵי.
human_translation: The one gave reason for his statement: The perimeter of the inner altar like the perimeter of the outer altar, And the one gave reason for his statement: entire inner altar stands in place of one corner of outer
llm_translation: This one gives reason to his words: "Around the inner altar" like "around the outer altar," and this one gives reason to his words: "The entire inner altar" in the place of one horn of the outer altar stands.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ הָיָה עוֹמֵד וּמְחַטֵּא. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי — רַבִּי יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ עוֹמֵד וּמְחַטֵּא, וְעַל כּוּלָּן הָיָה נוֹתֵן מִמַּעְלָה לְמַטָּה, חוּץ מֵאוֹתָהּ שֶׁבַּאֲלַכְסוֹן, שֶׁנּוֹתֵן מִמַּטָּה לְמַעְלָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: He stood in place and sprinkled whose the mishna? is Rabbi Yehuda, As it was taught Rabbi Meir says Rabbi Eliezer says He stood in place and sprinkled, and on all he presented from above downward, except for that on the diagonal [ alakhson ] he sprinkled from below upward.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: In his place he was standing and sinning. The Mishnah teaches — it is Rabbi Yehuda. As it was taught, Rabbi Meir says: Rabbi Eliezer says: In his place he was standing and sinning, and for all of them he was giving from above to below, except for that one on the diagonal, for which he gives from below to above.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: בִּמְקוֹמוֹ עוֹמֵד וּמְחַטֵּא, וְעַל כּוּלָּן הוּא נוֹתֵן מִלְּמַטָּה לְמַעְלָה, חוּץ מִזּוֹ שֶׁהָיְתָה לְפָנָיו מַמָּשׁ, שֶׁנּוֹתֵן מִמַּעְלָה לְמַטָּה, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִיתַּוְּוסָן מָאנֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says Rabbi Eliezer says: He stood in place and sprinkled, and on all of he sprinkled from below upward, except for that one which was directly before him, on which he would present from above downward. so as not to dirty his garments
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: Rabbi Eliezer says: In his place he stands and sins, and for all of them he gives from below to above, except for this one that was directly in front of him, for he gives from above to below, so that his utensils will not be despised.

hebrew_text: הִזָּה מִמֶּנּוּ עַל טׇהֳרוֹ שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ. מַאי ״טׇהֳרוֹ״? אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: פַּלְגֵיהּ דְּמִזְבֵּחַ, כִּדְאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: ״טְהַר טִיהֲרָא וְהָוֵי פַּלְגֵיהּ דְּיוֹמָא״.
human_translation: He sprinkled on pure [ tohoro ] of the altar. What tohoro ? Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: half altar, as people say: Tehar tihara , and it is the middle of the day.
llm_translation: He shall sprinkle from it upon the purity of the altar. What is "purity"? Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: The half of the altar, as people say: "Purify and be purified, and it will be the half of the day."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כְּשֶׁהוּא מַזֶּה — אֵינוֹ מַזֶּה לֹא עַל גַּבֵּי הָאֵפֶר וְלֹא עַל גַּבֵּי הַגֶּחָלִים, אֶלָּא חוֹתֶה גֶּחָלִים אֵילָךְ וְאֵילָךְ, וּמַזֶּה. אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: עַל גִּלּוּיֵהּ דְּמִזְבֵּחַ, כְּדִכְתִיב: ״וּכְעֶצֶם הַשָּׁמַיִם לָטוֹהַר״.
human_translation: raises an objection: When he sprinkles he sprinkles neither on top of the ash nor on top of the coals; rather, he rakes the coals to both sides and sprinkles. Rather, Rabba bar Rav Sheila on the exposed of altar, as it is written: “And the like of the very heaven for clearness [ letohar ]”
llm_translation: Challenger: When he is sprinkling - he does not sprinkle neither on top of the ashes nor on top of the coals, rather he circles the coals this way and that way, and sprinkles. Rather, Rabba bar Rav Sheila said: On its uncovered part of the altar, as it is written: "And like the appearance of the sky for purity."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, חֲנַנְיָא אוֹמֵר: בְּצַד צְפוֹנִי הוּא נוֹתֵן, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: בְּצַד דְּרוֹמִי הוּא נוֹתֵן. בְּמַאי קָמִיפַּלְגִי? מָר סָבַר: פִּיתְחָא בְּדָרוֹם קָאֵי, וּמָר סָבַר: פִּיתְחָא בְּצָפוֹן קָאֵי.
human_translation: It was taught Ḥananya says: presents on the north side Rabbi Yosei says: He presents on the south side. With regard to what they disagree? One Sage, holds the entrance positioned in the south, And one Sage, holds the entrance positioned in the north,
llm_translation: It was taught: Chananya says: He places it on the northern side, Rabbi Yosei says: He places it on the southern side. What are they arguing about? One Master holds: The entrance is in the south, and one Master holds: The entrance is in the north.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהָא, הֵיכָא דְּגָמְרָן מַתָּנוֹת דִּקְרָנוֹת, הָתָם יָהֵיב עַל גַּגּוֹ. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְטִהֲרוֹ וְקִדְּשׁוֹ״ — מָקוֹם שֶׁקִּדְּשׁוֹ, שָׁם טִיהֲרוֹ.
human_translation: Everyone in any case where he finishes the presentations corners, that where he places on top. What is the reason the verse states: and cleanse it and sanctify it” place he sanctified there he shall cleanse
llm_translation: The people of the world from her, where they learned the Mishnah of the horns, there he placed it on his roof. What is the reason? The verse says: "And purify him and sanctify him" - the place where he sanctified him, there he purified him.

hebrew_text: שְׁיָרֵי הַדָּם הָיָה שׁוֹפֵךְ עַל יְסוֹד מַעֲרָבִי שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן. דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְאֶת כׇּל דַּם הַפָּר יִשְׁפּוֹךְ״, וְכִי נָפֵיק — בְּהָהוּא פָּגַע בְּרֵישָׁא.
human_translation: And he would pour the remainder of the blood on the western base of the outer altar. that the verse states “And he shall pour out all the blood of the bull and when he goes out he first reaches that
llm_translation: The remnants of the blood would be poured on the western foundation of the outer altar. As the verse states: "And all the blood of the bull he shall pour out." And how do we derive this? From that which it was stated initially.

hebrew_text: וְשֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ הַחִיצוֹן הָיָה שׁוֹפֵךְ עַל יְסוֹד דְּרוֹמִית. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: יְסוֹד הַמִּזְבֵּחַ — זֶה יְסוֹד דְּרוֹמִית. אַתָּה אוֹמֵר יְסוֹד דְּרוֹמִית, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא יְסוֹד מַעֲרָבִית?
human_translation: And he would pour on the outer altar, on its southern base. The Sages taught “The base of the altar” is the southern base. you say the southern base? Or perhaps that is not rather the western base?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "And of the outer altar, he would pour the blood on the southern foundation. The Sages taught: The foundation of the altar—this is the southern foundation. Do you say the southern foundation, or is it rather the western foundation?"

hebrew_text: אָמַרְתָּ: יִלְמַד יְרִידָתוֹ מִן הַכֶּבֶשׁ לִיצִיאָתוֹ מִן הַהֵיכָל. מָה יְצִיאָתוֹ מִן הַהֵיכָל בְּסָמוּךְ לוֹ, וְאֵי זֶה — זֶה יְסוֹד מַעֲרָבִי, אַף יְרִידָתוֹ מִן הַכֶּבֶשׁ, בְּסָמוּךְ לוֹ, וְאֵי זֶה — זֶה יְסוֹד דְּרוֹמִי.
human_translation: You said: Let his descent from the ramp be derived from his exit from the Sanctuary Just as his exit from the Sanctuary on closest to him, and which is that, it is the western base; so too, his descent from the ramp on closest to him, and which is that? It is the southern base,
llm_translation: You said: His descent from the keves to his exit from the Heichal. What is his exit from the Heichal? Near it. And what is near it? This is the western foundation. Likewise, his descent from the keves, near it. And what is near it? This is the southern foundation.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: זֶה וָזֶה יְסוֹד מַעֲרָבִי. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי אוֹמֵר: זֶה וָזֶה יְסוֹד דְּרוֹמִי. בִּשְׁלָמָא, רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל קָסָבַר: יִלְמַד סָתוּם מִמְּפוֹרָשׁ.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yishmael says: this and that, the western base Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai says: this and that the southern base. Granted, Rabbi Yishmael maintains not clarified is derived from explicit:
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yishmael says: This and that is the foundation of the west. Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai says: This and that is the foundation of the south. Granted, Rabbi Yishmael holds: One should learn the implicit from the explicit.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי, מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: קָסָבַר פִּתְחָא בְּדָרוֹם קָאֵי.
human_translation: However, Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai, what is the reason Rav Ashi said: maintains entrance is positioned at the south
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai, what is the reason? Rav Ashi said: He holds that the entrance is situated in the south.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בִּדְבֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַאי: זֶה וָזֶה יְסוֹד דְּרוֹמִית. וְסִימָנָיךְ: מַשְׁכוּהּ גַּבְרֵי לְגַבְרָא.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught in the school of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: this and that, the southern base. And your mnemonic The men pulled the man,
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael in the school of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: This and that is the foundation of the southern wall. And your mnemonic: "Draw him, men, to a man."

hebrew_text: אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ מִתְעָרְבִין בָּאַמָּה וְיוֹצְאִין וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מוֹעֲלִין בְּדָמִים — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: These and those mixed in the canal and flow out The Sages taught: misuses by blood, the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Shimon. And the Rabbis say: not misuse by these
llm_translation: These and these mix in the cubit and go out, etc. The Rabbis taught: They are guilty of bloodshed - the words of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Shimon. And the Sages say: They are not guilty of bloodshed.

hebrew_text: עַד כָּאן לָא פְּלִיגִי אֶלָּא מִדְּרַבָּנַן, אֲבָל מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא אֵין מוֹעֲלִין בָּהֶן.
human_translation: disagree only with regard to by rabbinic law, however, by Torah law not misuse by these
llm_translation: Until here they do not argue except from the Rabbis, but from the Torah itself one does not act treacherously with them.

hebrew_text: מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר עוּלָּא, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לָכֶם״ — שֶׁלָּכֶם יְהֵא. דְּבֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן תָּנָא: ״לְכַפֵּר״ — לְכַפָּרָה נְתַתִּיו, וְלֹא לִמְעִילָה.
human_translation: From where are these matters, Ulla said the verse states: to you it shall be yours. The school Rabbi Shimon taught “to make atonement” I gave it for atonement and not for misuse
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Mena hanei millei?" Amar Ula, amar kra: 'lakhem' - shelakhem yeha. Dei Rabbi Shimon Tanah: 'lekhafer' - lekhaparah netatihu, velo l'me'ila. English translation: "What are these words?" Ula said, the verse says: 'to you' - it shall be yours. The school of Rabbi Shimon taught: 'for atonement' - I have given it for atonement, and not for misuse.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״הוּא״, לִפְנֵי כַפָּרָה כִּלְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה: מָה לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה אֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה — אַף לִפְנֵי כַּפָּרָה אֵין בּוֹ מְעִילָה.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan said The verse states: it is before atonement as after atonement: Just as after atonement not subject to misuse so too, before atonement it is not subject to misuse
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, the verse says: "He," before atonement and after atonement: Just as after atonement there is no cloak - so too, before atonement there is no cloak.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא, לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה כְּלִפְנֵי כַפָּרָה: מָה לִפְנֵי כַפָּרָה יֵשׁ בּוֹ מְעִילָה — אַף לְאַחַר כַּפָּרָה יֵשׁ בּוֹ מְעִילָה! אֵין לְךָ דָּבָר שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית מִצְוָתוֹ וּמוֹעֲלִין בּוֹ. וְלָא? וַהֲרֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן!
human_translation: But say Just as before atonement it is subject to misuse so too, after atonement it is subject to misuse There is nothing whose mitzva has been performed that is subject to misuse And no But there is removal of the ashes
llm_translation: And why not, after atonement before atonement: Just as before atonement has a covering — so too after atonement has a covering! You have nothing that you have done his commandment and transgressed it. And no? Behold the heave-offering of the ashes!

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן וּבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד — אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: because the removal of the ashes and the priestly vestments, two verses that come as one, And Any two verses that come as one do not teach,
llm_translation: Because the terumat ha-deshen and the priestly garments are two written laws that come as one, and any two written laws that come as one - they do not teach.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְרַבָּנַן, דְּאָמְרִי: ״וְהִנִּיחָם שָׁם״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁטְּעוּנִין גְּנִיזָה.
human_translation: This well to the Rabbis, who say and shall leave them there” teaches that they require interment.
llm_translation: The sages have left it, for they say: "And He left them there," teaches that they require genizah.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי דּוֹסָא, דְּאָמַר: בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה רְאוּיִן הֵן לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: However, to Rabbi Dosa, who said priestly vestments are fit for a common priest what is there to say?
llm_translation: Rather, according to Rabbi Dosa, who said: The priestly garments are fitting for a common priest, what can be said?

hebrew_text: מִשּׁוּם דְּהָוֵי תְּרוּמַת הַדֶּשֶׁן וְעֶגְלָה עֲרוּפָה שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד, וְכׇל שְׁנֵי כְתוּבִין הַבָּאִין כְּאֶחָד — אֵין מְלַמְּדִין.
human_translation: because removal of the ashes and the heifer whose neck is broken are two verses that come as one, and any two verses that come as one do not teach
llm_translation: Because the offering of the ashes and the heifer whose neck is broken are two written laws that come as one, and any two written laws that come as one - we do not teach from them.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין מְלַמְּדִין, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר מְלַמְּדִין, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? תְּרֵי מִיעוּטֵי כְּתִיבִי: ״וְשָׂמוֹ״, ״הָעֲרוּפָה״.
human_translation: It works out well according to the one who said do not teach but according to the one who says that two verses that come as one teach what is there to say? Two exclusions are written “And he shall put it” “Whose neck was broken”
llm_translation: He left it for the one who says we do not teach, but for the one who says we do teach, what can be said? Two minimal scriptural references: "and place," "the cursed one."

hebrew_text: וְהָנֵי תְּלָתָא קְרָאֵי בְּדָם — לְמָה לִי?
human_translation: And why do I these three verses with regard to blood,
llm_translation: And these three verses in blood - why do I need them?

hebrew_text: חַד לְמַעוֹטֵי מִנּוֹתָר, וְחַד לְמַעוֹטֵי מִמְּעִילָה, וְחַד לְמַעוֹטֵי מִטּוּמְאָה.
human_translation: One to exclude notar , And one to exclude from misuse and one to exclude from ritual impurity.
llm_translation: One for excluding from what is left over, and one for excluding from what is covered, and one for excluding from impurity.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִפִּיגּוּל לָא צְרִיךְ לְמַעוֹטֵי קְרָא, דִּתְנַן: כׇּל שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ מַתִּירִין, בֵּין לְאָדָם, בֵּין לְמִזְבֵּחַ — חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו מִשּׁוּם פִּיגּוּל. וְדָם עַצְמוֹ מַתִּיר הוּא.
human_translation: However, no verse is required to exclude from piggul , as we learned any that has permits it, one is liable to piggul . whether for human or whether on the altar. blood itself, permitted
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But from Pigul not need to lessen of verse, as we learned: All that has permission, whether for a person or for the altar - one is liable for Pigul. And the blood itself permits.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים הָאָמוּר — עַל הַסֵּדֶר. אִם הִקְדִּים מַעֲשֶׂה לַחֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם. הִקְדִּים דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר לְדַם הַפָּר — יַחְזוֹר וְיַזֶּה מִדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר לְאַחַר דַּם הַפָּר. וְאִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא גָּמַר אֶת הַמַּתָּנוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים נִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָבִיא דָּם אַחֵר, וְיַחְזוֹר בַּתְּחִילָּה מִבִּפְנִים.
human_translation: Each action of Yom Kippur stated in order. If performed actions before another, he has done nothing. he performed the blood of the goat before the blood of the bull, he repeat and sprinkle the blood of the goat after the blood of the bull, And if the blood spills before he completed the presentations that inside he bring other blood, and repeat from the beginning inside
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: Every action of Yom Kippur that is stated - in order. If one precedes his fellow in an action - he has done nothing. If he preceded the blood of the goat to the blood of the bull - he should return and sprinkle from the blood of the goat to after the blood of the bull. And if before he finished the applications inside, the blood spilled - he should bring other blood, and he should start again from the inside.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בַּהֵיכָל, וְכֵן בְּמִזְבַּח הַזָּהָב — שֶׁכּוּלָּן כַּפָּרָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק, מִשָּׁם הוּא מַתְחִיל.
human_translation: And similarly, in the Sanctuary, and likewise on the golden altar. Since they are each atonement in and of themselves, Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: From the place that he interrupted there he resumes
llm_translation: In the sanctuary, and so too in the golden altar - that they atone by themselves. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: From the place where it stopped, from there it begins.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ: רַבָּנַן כׇּל מַעֲשֵׂה יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים הָאָמוּר — עַל הַסֵּדֶר. אִם הִקְדִּים מַעֲשֶׂה לַחֲבֵירוֹ — לֹא עָשָׂה כְּלוּם. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אֵימָתַי? בִּדְבָרִים הַנַּעֲשִׂין בְּבִגְדֵי לָבָן מִבִּפְנִים, אֲבָל דְּבָרִים הַנַּעֲשִׂין בְּבִגְדֵי לָבָן מִבַּחוּץ, אִם הִקְדִּים מַעֲשֶׂה לַחֲבֵירוֹ — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Each action of Yom Kippur stated in order. If performed actions before another, he has done nothing. Rabbi Yehuda said: When to those actions performed in white garments inside However, those actions performed in white garments outside, if he performed action before another, what he did is done
llm_translation: Talmudic text: The Sages taught: All the actions of Yom Kippur that were stated - in order. If one preceded his fellow in the action - he has done nothing. Rabbi Yehuda said: When? In matters done with white garments from within, but in matters done with white garments from without, if one preceded his fellow in the action - what he did is considered done.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה אוֹמֵר: בַּמֶּה דְּבָרִים אֲמוּרִים — בִּדְבָרִים הַנַּעֲשִׂים בְּבִגְדֵי לָבָן, בֵּין מִבִּפְנִים בֵּין מִבַּחוּץ. אֲבָל בִּדְבָרִים הַנַּעֲשִׂים בְּבִגְדֵי זָהָב מִבַּחוּץ — מַה שֶּׁעָשָׂה עָשׂוּי. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״וְהָיְתָה זֹּאת לָכֶם לְחוּקַּת עוֹלָם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה״,
human_translation: Rabbi Neḥemya says: In what is this statement said, to actions performed in white garments, whether inside or outside However, to actions performed in golden garments outside what he did is done. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And both of them, derived from one verse: “And this shall be an everlasting statute to you, once a year”
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah says: In what are these matters said? In matters done with white garments, whether from inside or from outside. But in matters done with garments of gold from outside - what he did is done. Rabbi Yochanan said, and both of them expounded one verse: "And this shall be to you a statute of forever, once in the year."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: מָקוֹם שֶׁמִּתְכַּפְּרִין בּוֹ פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה. וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה סָבַר: דְּבָרִים הַמִּתְכַּפְּרִין בָּהֶן פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda maintains place where atonement is achieved once a year, And Rabbi Neḥemya maintains the actions through which atonement is achieved once a year,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah holds: a place where atone in it once in the year. And Rabbi Nechemiah holds: things atone in them once in the year.

hebrew_text: אַטּוּ לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה ״מָקוֹם״ כְּתִיב? אֶלָּא, הַיְינוּ טַעְמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: כְּתִיב ״זֹאת״, וּכְתִיב ״אַחַת״. חַד לְמַעוֹטֵי בִּגְדֵי לָבָן מִבַּחוּץ, וְחַד לְמַעוֹטֵי בִּגְדֵי זָהָב.
human_translation: Is that to say to Rabbi Yehuda place written? Rather, This is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda: It is written: “This” and it is written: “Once One to exclude in white garments outside and one to exclude in gold garments.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Atu l'Rabbi Yehuda 'makom' k'tiv? Ela, haynu ta'ameih d'Rabbi Yehuda: k'tiv 'zot', u'k'tiv 'achat'. Chad l'ma'utei bigdei lavan mi'bachutz, v'chad l'ma'utei bigdei zahav." English translation: "Did they come to Rabbi Yehuda 'place' written? Rather, this is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda: it is written 'this', and it is written 'one'. One to exclude white garments from the outside, and one to exclude golden garments."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: חַד לְמַעוֹטֵי בִּגְדֵי זָהָב, וְחַד לְמַעוֹטֵי שִׁירַיִם דְּלָא מְעַכְּבִי. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה: אִי מְעַכְּבִי — מְעַכְּבִי, וְאִי לָא מְעַכְּבִי — לָא מְעַכְּבִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi Neḥemya one to exclude gold garments, and one to exclude remainders that are not indispensable. And Rabbi Yehuda if indispensable, indispensable; and if not indispensable, not indispensable
llm_translation: Rabbi Nechemiah: One is liable for diminishing the size of golden garments, and one is liable for diminishing the lengths of the fringes so that they do not hang down. And Rabbi Yehudah: If it causes the garment to not hang down - it causes liability, and if it does not cause the garment to not hang down - it does not cause liability.

hebrew_text: כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְכִלָּה מִכַּפֵּר אֶת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ״, אִם כִּפֵּר — כִּלָּה, וְאִם לֹא כִּפֵּר — לֹא כִּלָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא נֶאֱמַר: אִם כִּלָּה — כִּפֵּר, וְאִם לֹא כִּלָּה — לֹא כִּפֵּר, שֶׁאִם חִיסֵּר אַחַת מִן הַמַּתָּנוֹת לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם.
human_translation: As it was taught “And when he has finished atoning for the sacred place” if he performed the atonement, he has finished and if he did not perform the atonement, he has not finished. the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Why do we not say if he finished he has performed atonement; and if he did not finish, he has not performed atonement? that if one of the presentations is lacking he did nothing.
llm_translation: As it was taught: "And the bride completes the sanctification." If she completed - she completed, and if she did not complete - she did not complete, the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Yehuda said to him: Why is it not stated: If she completed - she sanctified, and if she did not complete - she did not sanctify, for if she omitted even one of the conditions, she did not fulfill and did not complete.

hebrew_text: וְאָמְרִינַן: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. חַד אָמַר: מַשְׁמָעוּת דּוֹרְשִׁין אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ. וְחַד אָמַר: שִׁירַיִם מְעַכְּבִי אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: And we say What between them? Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi One said: There is between them the source from which they derive their interpretation, And one said: There is between them remainders indispensable
llm_translation: And we say: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. One said: The interpretation of the verse is the difference between them. And one said: The singing of songs is the difference between them.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תַּנָּא רַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר שִׁירַיִם מְעַכְּבִי! קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this, But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say Rabbi Neḥemya taught in accordance with the statement of the one who said that remainders are indispensable? difficult.
llm_translation: And who said thus, Rabbi Yochanan? But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: It was taught, Rabbi Nechemiah says, in accordance with the words of one who says, "My songs hinder me!" Difficult.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: קְטוֹרֶת שֶׁחֲפָנָהּ קוֹדֶם שְׁחִיטָתוֹ שֶׁל פַּר — לָא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם. כְּמַאן — דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָאָמַר: כִּי כְּתִיבָא ״חוּקָּה״ — בִּדְבָרִים הַנַּעֲשִׂים בְּבִגְדֵי לָבָן מִבִּפְנִים הוּא דִּכְתִיבָא!
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina said: incense that scooped before the slaughtering of the bull, he did nothing. In accordance with It is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda. As, if Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t say when it is written “statute” it is written to actions performed in white garments within
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: Incense whose handful was taken before the slaughter of the bull - it is invalid and has not fulfilled its purpose. According to whom? Not according to Rabbi Yehuda, for if it were according to Rabbi Yehuda, who said: "When it is written 'a statute' - it refers to matters that are done from within white garments."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, צוֹרֶךְ פְּנִים — כִּפְנִים דָּמֵי. תְּנַן: אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא גָּמַר מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים נִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָבִיא דָּם אַחֵר, וְיַחֲזוֹר וְיַזֶּה בַּתְּחִילָּה מִבִּפְנִים. וְאִם אִיתָא, יַחְזוֹר וְיַחְפּוֹן מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ!
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Yehuda, for the purpose of inside is considered like inside. We learned if the blood spills before completed the presentations that inside he bring other blood, and sprinkle again from the beginning inside. And if it is so, should have said he must return and scoop
llm_translation: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehuda, needs inside - like inside, the blood is similar. We learned: If before he finished the gifts inside the blood spilled - he should bring other blood, and he should return and sprinkle from the beginning from inside. And if it comes, he should return and cover what he needs!

hebrew_text: בִּקְטוֹרֶת לָא קָא מַיְירֵי.
human_translation: he is not dealing with the incense.
llm_translation: In the incense, not is mentioned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר עוּלָּא: שָׂעִיר שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ קוֹדֶם מַתַּן דָּמוֹ שֶׁל פַּר — לֹא עָשָׂה וְלֹא כְלוּם. תְּנַן: הִקְדִּים דַּם הַשָּׂעִיר לְדַם הַפָּר — יַחְזוֹר וְיַזֶּה מִדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר אַחַר דַּם הַפָּר. וְאִם אִיתָא — יַחְזוֹר וְיִשְׁחוֹט מִבְּעֵי לֵיהּ! תַּרְגְּמָא עוּלָּא, בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל. וְכֵן אָמַר רַבִּי אַפָּס, בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל.
human_translation: Ulla said: a goat that he slaughtered before presentation of the blood of the bull, he did nothing. we learned he performed the blood of the goat before the blood of the bull, he repeat and sprinkle the blood of the goat after the blood of the bull. And if it is so should have said he must return and slaughter Ulla interpreted to the presentations in the Sanctuary And likewise, Rabbi Afes said to the presentations in the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: Ula said: If one slaughtered a goat before giving the blood of the bull - he has not fulfilled his obligation. We learned in a Mishnah: If one placed the blood of the goat before the blood of the bull - he should return and sprinkle from the blood of the goat after the blood of the bull. And if it is necessary - he should return and slaughter another one! Ula translated this in the context of Temple offerings. And so said Rabbi Aḥa, in the context of Temple offerings.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן בַּהֵיכָל וְכֵן בַּמִּזְבֵּחַ וְכוּ׳. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכִפֶּר אֶת מִקְדַּשׁ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ״ — זֶה לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, ״אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ — זֶה הֵיכָל, ״מִזְבֵּחַ״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ, ״יְכַפֵּר״ — אֵלּוּ עֲזָרוֹת.
human_translation: And similarly in the Sanctuary, and likewise on the golden altar, The Sages taught: “And he shall make atonement for the most sacred place,” this is the innermost sanctum, “the Tent of Meeting,” this is the Sanctuary; “altar” as per its plain meaning; “he shall make atonement,” is these are the courtyards.
llm_translation: "And so in the sanctuary, and so at the altar, and so forth. The Rabbis taught: 'And he shall make atonement for the holy sanctuary' - this refers to inside and outside, 'the tent of meeting' - this is the sanctuary, 'the altar' - as it sounds, 'he shall make atonement' - these are the courtyards."

hebrew_text: ״הַכֹּהֲנִים״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעָן, ״עַם הַקָּהָל״ — אֵלּוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל, ״יְכַפֵּר״ — אֵלּוּ הַלְוִיִּם. הוּשְׁווּ כּוּלָּן לְכַפָּרָה אַחַת, שֶׁכּוּלָּן מִתְכַּפְּרִין בְּשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ בִּשְׁאָר עֲבֵירוֹת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: “The priests” as per its plain meaning; “people of the assembly,” these are the Israelites; “he shall make atonement,” these are the Levites, They are all equated in one atonement that they all achieve atonement through the scapegoat other transgressions, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: "The priests" - as their name implies, "the congregation" - these are the Israelites, "shall atone" - these are the Levites. They were all equated for one atonement, for they all atone with the scapegoat that is sent away for other transgressions, the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁדַּם הַשָּׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים מְכַפֵּר עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו — כָּךְ דַּם הַפָּר מְכַפֵּר עַל הַכֹּהֲנִים בְּטוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו. וּכְשֵׁם שֶׁוִּידּוּי שֶׁל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ מְכַפֵּר עַל יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּשְׁאָר עֲבֵירוֹת — כָּךְ וִידּוּי שֶׁל פָּר מְכַפֵּר עַל הַכֹּהֲנִים בִּשְׁאָר עֲבֵירוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Just as the blood of the goat presented inside atones for Israelites with the ritual impurity of the Temple and its consecrated objects, so too, the blood of the bull atones for the priests with the ritual impurity of the Temple and its consecrated objects. And just as the confession over the scapegoat atones for Israelites with regard to all other transgressions, so too, the confession over the bull atones for the priests with regard to all other transgressions,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Just as the blood of the goat, which is done inside, atones for the Israelites for impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things, so too the blood of the cow atones for the priests for impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things. And just as the confession of the goat, which is sent away, atones for Israel for other sins, so too the confession of the cow atones for the priests for other sins.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְכִלָּה מִכַּפֵּר אֶת הַקּוֹדֶשׁ״ — זֶה לִפְנַי וְלִפְנִים, ״אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״ — זֶה הֵיכָל, ״מִזְבֵּחַ״ — כְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁכּוּלָּן כַּפָּרָה כַּפָּרָה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן.
human_translation: The Sages taught “And when he has finished atoning for the sacred place,” this is the innermost sanctum, “Tent of Meeting,” this is the Sanctuary; “altar,” as per its plain meaning. teaches that they each a separate atonement unto themselves,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the bride shall atone for the sanctuary" - this refers to both before and after, "Tent of Meeting" - this is the Tabernacle, "altar" - as it sounds, teaches that all of them atone separately.

hebrew_text: מִכָּאן אָמְרוּ: נָתַן מִקְצָת מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָבִיא דָּם אַחֵר וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִלָּה בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מַתְחִיל אֶלָּא מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק. גָּמַר אֶת הַמַּתָּנוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָבִיא דָּם אַחֵר וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל.
human_translation: From here stated: presented some of the presentations inside and the blood spilled, he brings other blood and begins from the start of the presentations inside. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: he begins only from the place where he stopped. he finished the presentations inside and the blood spilled, he brings other blood and starts at the beginning of the presentations in the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: From here they said: If some of the offerings inside were placed and the blood spilled - he should bring other blood and begin again from the beginning with the offerings inside. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: He only begins from the place where it was interrupted. If he completed the offerings inside and the blood spilled - he should bring other blood and begin again from the beginning with the offerings in the Sanctuary.

hebrew_text: נָתַן מִקְצָת מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָבִיא דָּם אַחֵר וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה בַּהֵיכָל. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מַתְחִיל אֶלָּא מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק.
human_translation: he presented some of the presentations in the Sanctuary and the blood spilled, he brings other blood and begins from the start in the Sanctuary, Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: He begins only from the place where he stopped.
llm_translation: He gave some of the gifts in the Temple and the blood spilled - he should bring other blood and start again from the beginning in the Temple. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: He only starts from where it was interrupted.

hebrew_text: גָּמַר מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָבִיא דָּם אַחֵר וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּמַתְּנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. נָתַן מִקְצָת מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּמִּזְבֵּחַ וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָבִיא דָּם אַחֵר וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּמַתְּנוֹת הַמִּזְבֵּחַ. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק הוּא מַתְחִיל. גָּמַר מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּמִּזְבֵּחַ וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל לָא מְעַכְּבִי.
human_translation: he finished the presentations in the Sanctuary and the blood spilled, he brings other blood and begins at the start of the presentations at the altar, he presented some of the presentations at the altar and the blood spilled, he brings other blood and begins at the start of the presentations at the altar, Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say he begins from the place where he stopped. he finished the presentations at the altar and the blood spilled everyone agrees are not indispensable,
llm_translation: He completed the offerings in the Temple and the blood spilled - he should bring other blood and begin from the beginning with the offerings of the altar. If he placed some of the offerings on the altar and the blood spilled - he should bring other blood and begin from the beginning with the offerings of the altar. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: From the point where he stopped, he should begin. He completed the offerings on the altar and the blood spilled - the words of everyone do not delay.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: וּשְׁנֵיהֶם מִקְרָא אֶחָד דָּרְשׁוּ: ״מִדַּם חַטַּאת הַכִּפּוּרִים אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה״,
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: And both of them, derived from one verse: with the blood of the sin-offering of atonement once a year
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: And both of them interpreted one verse: "From the blood of the sin offering of atonements once in the year."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: חַטָּאת אַחַת אָמַרְתִּי לָךְ, וְלֹא שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבְרִי: חִטּוּי אֶחָד אָמַרְתִּי לָךְ, וְלֹא שְׁנֵי חִטּוּיִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Meir holds I said to you one sin-offering and not two sin-offerings. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon hold I said to you one sprinkling and not two sprinklings.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir holds: "One sin I told you, not two sins." Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon hold: "One atonement I told you, not two atonements."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי: לִי חִלֵּק רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּלּוּגִּין.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi said: Rabbi Ya’akov differentiated for me to lugin .
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi said: Rabbi Yaakov divided in the Lugim.

hebrew_text: וְלֹא? וְהָתַנְיָא: נָתַן מִקְצָת מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבִּפְנִים וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַלּוֹג — יָבִיא לוֹג אַחֵר וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק הוּא מַתְחִיל.
human_translation: And not But wasn’t it taught he presented some of the presentations that inside and the log spilled, he brings another log and begins from the start of the presentations in the Sanctuary; Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: He begins from the place where he stopped.
llm_translation: And not? And it was taught: If one gave some of the gifts inside and the log spilled - he should bring another log and begin from the beginning with the gifts of the Temple. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon say: From the place where he stopped, he should begin.

hebrew_text: גָּמַר מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּהֵיכָל וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַלּוֹג — יָבִיא לוֹג אַחֵר וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּבְּהוֹנוֹת. נָתַן מִקְצָת מַתָּנוֹת בַּבְּהוֹנוֹת וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַלּוֹג — יָבִיא לוֹג [אַחֵר] וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה בְּמַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּבְּהוֹנוֹת. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק הוּא מַתְחִיל. גָּמַר מַתָּנוֹת שֶׁבַּבְּהוֹנוֹת וְנִשְׁפַּךְ הַלּוֹג — דִּבְרֵי הַכֹּל מַתְּנוֹת הָרֹאשׁ לָא מְעַכְּבוֹת.
human_translation: he finished the presentations in the Sanctuary and the log spilled, he brings another log and begins from the start of the presentations the thumbs he put some of the presentations on thumbs and the log spilled, he brings another log and begins from the start of the presentations on thumbs. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: He begins from the place where he stopped. he finished the presentations on his thumbs and the log spilled, everyone agrees the presentations on the head are not indispensable.
llm_translation: He completed the gifts in the Sanctuary and the log spilled - he should bring another log and begin again from the beginning with the gifts in the Sanctuary. If he gave some gifts in the Sanctuary and the log spilled - he should bring another log and begin again from the beginning with the gifts in the Sanctuary. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon say: From the point where he stopped, he begins. He completed the gifts in the Sanctuary and the log spilled - everyone agrees that the gifts of the head do not delay.

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: לִי שָׁנָה רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב בַּלּוּגִּין.
human_translation: say: Rabbi Ya’akov taught me with regard to lugin .
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima: Li shanah Rabbi Yaakov balogin. English translation: Say: To me a year Rabbi Yaakov in Balogin.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מַתְּנוֹת הָרֹאשׁ — אֵין מְעַכְּבוֹת. מַאי טַעְמָא? אִילֵּימָא מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהַנּוֹתָר מִן הַשֶּׁמֶן״ — אֶלָּא מֵעַתָּה: ״וְהַנּוֹתֶרֶת מִן הַמִּנְחָה״ הָכִי נָמֵי דְּלָא מְעַכְּבִי?!
human_translation: The Master said presentations of the head are not indispensable. What is the reason If we say because it is written: “And the rest of the oil however, if so, “But the rest of the meal-offering so too, that they are not indispensable?
llm_translation: Master said: Gifts of the head — do not delay. What is the reason? If you say because it is written, "And the remainder of the oil" — rather, from now on: "And the remainder of the offering" is it not so that they do not delay?!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּמִיֶּתֶר ... וְהַנּוֹתָר״.
human_translation: It is different there, as it is written “And of the rest “And of the rest
llm_translation: The difference there, as it is written: "and the rest... and the remainder."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said:
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan:

hebrew_text: אֲשַׁם מְצוֹרָע שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ — בָּאנוּ לְמַחְלוֹקֶת רַבִּי מֵאִיר וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. רַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר יָבִיא אַחֵר וְיַתְחִיל בַּתְּחִילָּה — הָכָא נָמֵי יָבִיא אַחֵר וְיִשְׁחוֹט.
human_translation: a leper’s guilt-offering that was slaughtered not for its own sake we have arrived at the dispute between Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon Rabbi Meir, who said he brings another and starts from the beginning, here too, he brings another and slaughters
llm_translation: Guilt offering of a leper that he slaughtered not for its sake — we come to the dispute of Rabbi Meir, Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Meir, who says: Let him bring another and begin from the beginning — here too, let him bring another and slaughter.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן שֶׁאוֹמְרִים מִמָּקוֹם שֶׁפָּסַק מִשָּׁם הוּא מַתְחִיל — הָכָא אֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: And of Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon, who say he begins from the place where he stopped, here he has no remedy.
llm_translation: And for Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon who say, "From the place where he stopped, he begins - here he has no acquisition."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לֵיהּ רַב חִסְדָּא: וְהָא ״אוֹתוֹ״ כְּתִיב? קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda strongly objects to this: But isn’t it written: it difficult
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisdah objects to him: But isn't "he" written? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: אֲשַׁם מְצוֹרָע שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ, אוֹ שֶׁלֹּא נָתַן מִדָּמוֹ לְגַבֵּי בְהוֹנוֹת — הֲרֵי זֶה עוֹלֶה לְגַבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ, וְטָעוּן נְסָכִים, וְצָרִיךְ אָשָׁם אַחֵר לְהַכְשִׁירוֹ. וְרַב חִסְדָּא אָמַר לְךָ: מַאי צָרִיךְ — צָרִיךְ וְאֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: was taught in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan: a leper’s guilt-offering that slaughtered not for its own sake, or did not put some of its blood on thumbs, this is raised on the altar and requires libations And must another guilt-offering to make him eligible, And Rav Ḥisda said to you: What Must, he must but he has no remedy.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yochanan: A guilt-offering of a leper that he slaughtered not for its sake, or that he did not apply its blood to the thumb and toe — this one ascends upon the altar, requires libations, and needs another guilt-offering to validate it. And Rav Chisda said to you: What does it need? — It needs, and it has no remedy.

hebrew_text: וְתָנֵי תַּנָּא: ״צָרִיךְ״ — וְאֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה? אִין, וְהָתַנְיָא: נָזִיר מְמוֹרָט, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: צָרִיךְ הַעֲבָרַת תַּעַר, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: אֵין צָרִיךְ הַעֲבָרַת תַּעַר. וְאָמַר רַבִּי אֲבִינָא: כְּשֶׁאוֹמְרִים בֵּית שַׁמַּאי ״צָרִיךְ״, צָרִיךְ — וְאֵין לוֹ תַּקָּנָה.
human_translation: But would a tanna teach: Must, he has no remedy? Yes, and it was taught bald nazirite, Beit Shammai say: He must the passing of a razor and Beit Hillel say: He need not the passing of a razor. And Rabbi Avina said when Beit Shammai say: Must, he must he has no remedy.
llm_translation: The Tanna teaches: "tzarich" - and he does not have acquisition? No, and it was taught: a Nazirite from Memort, Beit Shammai say: he needs to pass a razor, and Beit Hillel say: he does not need to pass a razor. And Rabbi Avina said: when Beit Shammai say "tzarich," he needs - and he does not have acquisition.

hebrew_text: וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַבִּי פְּדָת. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי פְּדָת: בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אָמְרוּ דָּבָר אֶחָד. בֵּית שַׁמַּאי — הָא דַּאֲמַרַן. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר, (דְּתַנְיָא:) אֵין לוֹ בּוֹהֶן יָד וּבוֹהֶן רֶגֶל — אֵין לוֹ טׇהֳרָה עוֹלָמִית. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: נוֹתֵן עַל מְקוֹמוֹ וְיוֹצֵא. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: אִם נָתַן עַל שֶׁל שְׂמֹאל — יָצָא.
human_translation: disagrees with Rabbi Pedat. As Rabbi Pedat said: Beit Shammai and Rabbi Elazar said the same thing, Beit Shammai that which we said, Rabbi Elazar as it was taught has no thumb or big toe never ritual purity. Rabbi Elazar says: puts it on the spot and fulfills Rabbi Shimon says: If he put it on the left he has fulfilled
llm_translation: Disagreement of Rabbi Pedat. Rabbi Pedat said: Beit Shammai and Rabbi Eliezer said the same thing. Beit Shammai - this is what we said. Rabbi Eliezer (as it was taught): If it has no thumb and big toe - it has no eternal purity. Rabbi Eliezer says: He places it in its place and it goes out. Rabbi Shimon says: If he placed it on the left side - he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְלָקַח מִדַּם הָאָשָׁם״, יָכוֹל בִּכְלִי — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְנָתַן״. מָה נְתִינָה בְּעַצְמוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן — אַף לְקִיחָה בְּעַצְמוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן.
human_translation: The Sages taught: shall take of the blood of the guilt-offering, might in a vessel; the verse states: “And put.” Just as putting with the priest’s own so too, taking with the priest’s own
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And he shall take from the blood of the guilt offering," could it be taken in any vessel? The Talmud teaches us to say: "And he shall place." Just as the placing is done by the priest himself, so too the taking is done by the priest himself.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אַף לַמִּזְבֵּחַ כֵּן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי כַּחַטָּאת הָאָשָׁם הוּא״. מָה חַטָּאת טְעוּנָה כְּלִי — אַף אָשָׁם טָעוּן כְּלִי. נִמְצֵאתָ אַתָּה אוֹמֵר: אֲשַׁם מְצוֹרָע שְׁנֵי כֹהֲנִים מְקַבְּלִים אֶת דָּמוֹ, אֶחָד בַּיָּד וְאֶחָד בִּכְלִי. זֶה שֶׁקִּבֵּל בִּכְלִי בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל מִזְבֵּחַ, וְזֶה שֶׁקִּיבֵּל בַּיָּד בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל מְצוֹרָע.
human_translation: might even on the altar, so the verse states: “For as the sin-offering is, so is the guilt-offering” Just as a sin-offering requires a vessel so too, a guilt-offering requires a vessel. And you find that you say: The leper’s guilt-offering two priests collect its blood; one by hand, and one in a vessel. The one who collected in a vessel comes to the altar and the one who collected by hand comes to the leper
llm_translation: I am able to apply this rule even to the altar — as Scripture states: "For it is like the sin offering, it is the guilt offering" (Leviticus 7:7). Just as the sin offering requires a vessel, so too the guilt offering requires a vessel. You might say: In the case of the guilt offering brought by a leper, two priests receive its blood, one holds it in his hand and one holds it in a vessel. The one who received it in a vessel comes to apply it by the altar, and the one who received it in his hand comes to apply it by the leper.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: וְכוּלָּן מְטַמְּאִים בְּגָדִים וְנִשְׂרָפִין אַבֵּית הַדֶּשֶׁן, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵין מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים, וְאֵין נִשְׂרָפִין אַבֵּית הַדֶּשֶׁן אֶלָּא הָאַחֲרוֹן, הוֹאִיל וְגָמַר בּוֹ כַּפָּרָה.
human_translation: We learned there: And all render ritually impure the garments And these is burned in the place of the ashes, the statement of Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon. And the Rabbis say: They do not render garments impure and they are not burned in the place of the ashes, except for the last since atonement is completed with it.
llm_translation: We learned there: And all of them render garments impure and are burned in the ash heap, the words of Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon. And the Sages say: Garments do not render impure, and only the last one is burned in the ash heap, since it completes the atonement.

hebrew_text: בְּעָא מִינֵּיהּ רָבָא מֵרַב נַחְמָן: כַּמָּה שְׂעִירִים מְשַׁלֵּחַ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: וְכִי עֶדְרוֹ מְשַׁלֵּחַ? אָמַר לוֹ:
human_translation: Rava inquired before Rav Naḥman: How many goats does he send away? He said to him: Does he send away his flock? said to him:
llm_translation: Rava asked Rav Nachman: How many goats does he send away? He said to him: Does he send away his flock? He said to him:

hebrew_text: וְכִי עֶדְרוֹ שׂוֹרֵף? מִי דָּמֵי — הָתָם לָא כְּתִיב ״אוֹתוֹ״, הָכָא כְּתִיב ״אוֹתוֹ״.
human_translation: And does he burn his flock? Is it comparable? There, it is not written: “It,” here, it is written: “It,”
llm_translation: "And when his flock is burning? Whose blood — there it is not written 'him,' here it is written 'him.'"

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: רִאשׁוֹן מְשַׁלֵּחַ, וְרַב שִׁימִי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא אָמַר: אַחֲרוֹן מְשַׁלֵּחַ. בִּשְׁלָמָא רַב שִׁימִי (בַּר אָשֵׁי) מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, דְּאָמַר אַחֲרוֹן מְשַׁלֵּחַ — קָסָבַר: הוֹאִיל וְגָמַר בּוֹ כַּפָּרָה. אֶלָּא רַב פַּפִּי מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרָבָא, מַאי קָסָבַר? סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: מִצְוָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: It was stated Rav Pappi said in the name of Rava: He sends the first and Rav Shimi said in the name of Rava: He sends the last Granted, Rav Shimi bar Ashi in the name of Rava, who said he sends the last he holds since atonement is completed with it. However, Rav Pappi in the name of Rava, what does he hold? He holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, mitzva is with the first
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Pappi in the name of Rava said: The first one sends, and Rav Shimi in the name of Rava said: The last one sends. It is well according to Rav Shimi (bar Ashi) in the name of Rava, who said the last one sends — for he holds: since he completed the atonement with it. But Rav Pappi in the name of Rava, what does he hold? He holds like Rabbi Yosei, who said: The mitzvah is with the first one.

hebrew_text: הֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? אִילֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּקוּפּוֹת, דִּתְנַן (רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר): שָׁלֹשׁ קוּפּוֹת שֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ סְאִין שֶׁבָּהֶם תּוֹרְמִין אֶת הַלִּשְׁכָּה, וְהָיָה כָּתוּב עֲלֵיהֶם אב״ג.
human_translation: which Rabbi Yosei If we say Rabbi Yosei containers, As we learned Rabbi Yosei says: three containers of three se’a each, with which they collect the donation from the chamber. And alef , beit , gimmel were written on the
llm_translation: Be it Rabbi Yosei? Perhaps Rabbi Yosei of the courtyards, as we learned (Rabbi Yosei says): Three courtyards of three by three se'ahs each, in which they would store the wood for the Temple, and it was written upon them Aleph Bet Gimmel.

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לָמָּה כָּתוּב עֲלֵיהֶן אב״ג — לֵידַע אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן נִתְרְמָה רִאשׁוֹן, לְהָבִיא הֵימֶנָּה רִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁמִּצְוָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: And it was taught Rabbi Yosei said: Why were alef , beit , gimmel written on them? to ascertain which of them the donation was collected first, bring from it first, as mitzva is of the first
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said, "Why is it written on them A-B-G? - To know which of them was first tithed, to bring the first from them, for the mitzvah is with the first."

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא בְּעִידָּנָא דְּאִיתְחֲזַאי קַמַּיְיתָא, לָא אִיתְחֲזַאי בָּתְרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: perhaps at the time when the first was fit to be used, the last was not fit to be used.
llm_translation: Perhaps in the time when witnesses are present, it is not seen afterwards.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּפֶסַח (דִּתְנַן): הַמַּפְרִישׁ פִּסְחוֹ וְאָבַד, וְהִפְרִישׁ אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִמְצָא הָרִאשׁוֹן, וַהֲרֵי שְׁנֵיהֶן עוֹמְדִין — אֵי זֶה מֵהֶן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יַקְרִיב, דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן, וְאִם הָיָה שֵׁנִי מוּבְחָר מִמֶּנּוּ — יְבִיאֶנּוּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei with regard to the Paschal offering, as it was taught one who separated his Paschal offering and was lost, and he separated another in its stead, and afterward the first was found, and they both stand he sacrifices whichever of them he wants; the statement of the Rabbis. Rabbi Yosei says: mitzva with the first And if the second was superior to it, he brings
llm_translation: Rather Rabbi Yosei of Pesach (as we learned): one who designated his Passover offering and it got lost, and another designated one in its place, and then the first one was found, and both are standing - which one of them should he offer, according to the sages? Rabbi Yosei says: the mitzvah is with the first one, and if the second one is superior to it - he should bring it.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ הוֹצִיאוּ לוֹ
llm_translation: We will return to you, bring him out for him.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי שְׂעִירֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — מִצְוָתָן שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין בַּמַּרְאֶה וּבַקּוֹמָה וּבַדָּמִים וּבִלְקִיחָתָן כְּאֶחָד. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שָׁוִין — כְּשֵׁרִין. לָקַח אֶחָד הַיּוֹם וְאֶחָד לְמָחָר — כְּשֵׁרִין.
human_translation: The mitzva of the two Yom Kippur goats, is That they will both be identical in appearance, and in height, and in monetary value, and their acquisition as one, And even if they are not identical, they are valid. he acquired one today and one tomorrow, they are valid.
llm_translation: The two goats of Yom Kippur - their commandment is that they should be equal in appearance, height, blood, and taking, like one. And even though they are not equal - they are valid. If one was taken today and one tomorrow - they are valid.

hebrew_text: מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶם, אִם עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִגְרִיל מֵת — יִקַּח זוּג לַשֵּׁנִי. וְאִם מִשֶּׁהִגְרִיל מֵת — יָבִיא זוּג אַחֵר וְיַגְרִיל עֲלֵיהֶם בַּתְּחִילָּה,
human_translation: one died, if it died before drew the lots, he takes a counterpart for the second, And if it died after drew the lots, he brings another pair and draws lots over them from the start.
llm_translation: One of them dies, if before he drew lots he died - the second one should take his place. But if after he drew lots he died - another pair should be brought and lots should be drawn again for them initially.

hebrew_text: וְיֹאמַר: אִם שֶׁל שֵׁם מֵת — זֶה שֶׁעָלָה עָלָיו הַגּוֹרָל לַשֵּׁם יִתְקַיֵּים תַּחְתָּיו, וְאִם שֶׁל עֲזָאזֵל מֵת — זֶה שֶׁעָלָה עָלָיו הַגּוֹרָל לַעֲזָאזֵל יִתְקַיֵּים תַּחְתָּיו. וְהַשֵּׁנִי יִרְעֶה עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֵב, וְיִמָּכֵר, וְיִפְּלוּ דָּמָיו לִנְדָבָה, שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תָּמוּת.
human_translation: he utters If to God died, that upon which the lot for God shall stand in its stead; and if to Azazel died, that upon which the lot for Azazel shall stand in its stead. And the second, should graze until it becomes unfit, it will be sold, and the money its will go toward a gift-offering. as a communal sin-offering not to die. Rabbi Yehuda says: it should die.
llm_translation: And he shall say: If the lot of the name came up for a dead person - this one for whom the lot of the name came up, the name shall be established in his place. And if the lot of Azazel came up for a dead person - this one for whom the lot of Azazel came up, Azazel shall be established in his place. And the second one shall graze until it becomes blemished, and then be sold, and its proceeds shall be designated for a voluntary offering, for the communal sin-offering does not die. Rabbi Yehuda says: Let it die.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָמוּת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ. מֵת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ — יִשָּׁפֵךְ הַדָּם.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: the blood spilled the scapegoat to die. if the scapegoat dies, the blood should be spilled,
llm_translation: And furthermore said Rabbi Yehuda: spilled the blood - shall die the recipient. Died the recipient - shall spill the blood.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יִקַּח שְׁנֵי שְׂעִירֵי עִזִּים״, מִיעוּט ״שְׂעִירֵי״ — שְׁנַיִם. מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שְׁנֵי״? שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִים. מִנַּיִין אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין כְּשֵׁירִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שָׂעִיר״ ״שָׂעִיר״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “He shall take two goats” minimum goats two. what the verse states: Two? that the two should be identical. from where even if the two are not identical valid? The verses state goat, goat to amplify
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "He shall take two male goats," the inclusion of "male goats" - two. What is the reason for the Torah to say "two"? That they should be equal. From where do we derive that even though they are not equal in value, they are fit? The Torah says: "a goat" "a goat" - this increases the dispute.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא, הָא לָא רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא פְּסוּלִין, עִיכּוּבָא מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: The reason because the Merciful One amplified Doesn’t this the Merciful One did not amplify, I would have said disqualified? From where do we prevented
llm_translation: Reasoning of Rabbi Rachamana, this is not Rabbi Rachamana - would I say they are invalid, the verse supports us?

hebrew_text: סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, ״שְׁנֵי״ ״שְׁנֵי״ ״שְׁנֵי״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: enter your mind to say two, two, two, is written
llm_translation: The text reads: "Salka datach ameina, 'shnei' 'shnei' 'shnei' kativ."

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״שָׂעִיר״ ״שָׂעִיר״, ״שְׁנֵי״ ״שְׁנֵי״ ״שְׁנֵי״, לְמָה לִי? חַד לְמַרְאֶה, וְחַד לְקוֹמָה, וְחַד לְדָמִים.
human_translation: And now that the Merciful One has amplified goat, goat, why do I two, two, two? One in appearance, one in height, and one in monetary value.
llm_translation: At this time of Rabbi Rachamana, "sa'ir" "sa'ir," "shnei" "shnei" "shnei," why do I need? One for appearance, and one for standing, and one for blood.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי גַּבֵּי כִּבְשֵׂי מְצוֹרָע: ״יִקַּח שְׁנֵי כְּבָשִׂים״, מִיעוּט ״כְּבָשִׂים״ שְׁנַיִם, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שְׁנֵי״? שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין כְּשֵׁירִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כֶּבֶשׂ״ ״כֶּבֶשׂ״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: this was also taught with regard to lambs leper, “He shall take two lambs” minimum lambs, two. what the verse states “two”? that the two should be identical. from where that even if the two are not identical valid? The verses state: Lamb, lamb, to amplify
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Just as with regard to the lambs of the metzora it is stated, "He shall take two lambs," to exclude that "lambs" means two, what is the teaching when it says "two"? That they should both be equal. And from where do we know that even though they are not equal they are still valid? The teaching states: "lamb" "lamb" - this increases the dispute.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא, הָא לָא רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא — הֲוָה אָמֵינָא פְּסוּלִין, עִיכּוּבָא מְנָא לַן? סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, ״תִּהְיֶה״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: The reason because the Merciful One amplified Doesn’t this the Merciful One did not amplify, I would have said disqualified? From where do we prevented enter your mind to say it is written: shall be
llm_translation: Reason of Rabbi Rachmana, this not Rabbi Rachmana — was I saying disqualified, obligation from us? Refutation of your opinion was I saying, "it shall be" is written.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״כֶּבֶשׂ״ ״כֶּבֶשׂ״ — ״תִּהְיֶה״ לְמָה לִי? לִשְׁאָר הֲוָיָתוֹ שֶׁל מְצוֹרָע.
human_translation: And now that the Merciful One has amplified lamb, lamb, why do I shall be”? to the rest of the are of the leper,
llm_translation: And now, in the time of Rabbi Rachamana, "like a lamb" "like a lamb" — "shall it be" what is it to me? For the remaining existence of the leper.

hebrew_text: (וּתְנַן) נָמֵי גַּבֵּי מְצוֹרָע כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא: ״צִפֳּרִים״ — מִיעוּט צִפֳּרִים (שְׁנַיִם), מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שְׁתֵּי״ — שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁתֵּיהֶן שָׁווֹת. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵינָן שָׁווֹת כְּשֵׁרוֹת — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״צִפּוֹר״ ״צִפּוֹר״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: And we also learned similarly with regard to a leper. birds” minimum birds two. What the verse states: Two? that the two should be identical. And from where that even if they are not identical valid? The verses state: Bird, bird amplify.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Regarding a leper bird, what is the case? "Birds" - a minimum of two birds. What is the teaching when it says "two" - that they should be equal. And from where do we derive that even if they are not equal, they are still valid? The teaching says: "Bird" "Bird" - it increases the dispute.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא, הָא לָא רַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא — פְּסוּלוֹת, עִכּוּבָא מְנָא לַן? סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ אָמֵינָא, ״תִּהְיֶה״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: The reason because the Merciful One amplified Doesn’t this the Merciful One did not amplify, disqualified? From where do we prevented enter your mind to say it is written: shall be
llm_translation: The reason of Rabbi Rachamana, this is not Rabbi Rachamana - disqualified, a contradiction is presented to us? Perhaps according to your opinion I would say, "It shall be" is written.

hebrew_text: וְהַשְׁתָּא דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא ״צִפּוֹר״, ״תִּהְיֶה״ לְמָה לִי? לִשְׁאָר הֲוָיָתוֹ שֶׁל מְצוֹרָע.
human_translation: And now that the Merciful One has amplified bird, why do I shall be”? to the rest of the are of the leper,
llm_translation: At this time, when Rabbi Rachamana said "bird," "it shall be," what is it to me? For the remaining existence of the leper.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, גַּבֵּי תְמִידִין נָמֵי, נֵימָא: ״כְּבָשִׂים״ — מִיעוּט כְּבָשִׂים שְׁנַיִם, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שְׁנַיִם״ — שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין. וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין כְּשֵׁירִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כֶּבֶשׂ״ ״כֶּבֶשׂ״ — רִיבָּה. וּלְמִצְוָה הָכִי נָמֵי דְּבָעֵינַן?
human_translation: If so, daily offerings as well. Let us say lambs minimum lambs is two. What the verse states “two”? that the two should be identical. And from where that even if the two are not identical they are valid? The verse states lamb, lamb amplify. to the mitzva we also require
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, regarding the daily offerings, let it be said: "lambs" - a few lambs, what does the Talmud say "two" - that they should be equal. And from where do we know that even though they are not equal they are still valid? The Talmud says: "lamb" "lamb" - it increases. And for a mitzvah, is it thus said that we require?

hebrew_text: הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״שְׁנַיִם לַיּוֹם״, כְּנֶגֶד הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: That is needed for that which was taught “Two day by day” opposite the day.
llm_translation: That one asked him according to the teaching: "Two for the day," corresponding to the day.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר כְּנֶגֶד הַיּוֹם, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא חוֹבַת הַיּוֹם? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״אֶת הַכֶּבֶשׂ אֶחָד תַּעֲשֶׂה בַבֹּקֶר וְאֵת הַכֶּבֶשׂ הַשֵּׁנִי תַּעֲשֶׂה בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם״, הֲרֵי חוֹבַת הַיּוֹם אָמוּר, וּמָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״שְׁנַיִם לַיּוֹם״ — כְּנֶגֶד הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: you say opposite the day, or only obligation of day? When it states: “One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer in the afternoon” the obligation of day is stated And how do I uphold “Two day by day”? opposite the day.
llm_translation: You say "opposite the day," or is it only the obligation of the day? When it says, "One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer in the evening," the obligation of the day is stated. And how do I fulfill "two each day"? — Opposite the day.

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד? תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר הָיָה נִשְׁחָט עַל קֶרֶן צְפוֹנִית מַעֲרָבִית, עַל טַבַּעַת שְׁנִיָּה. וְשֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם הָיָה נִשְׁחָט עַל קֶרֶן מִזְרָחִית צְפוֹנִית, עַל טַבַּעַת שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: How daily offering of morning was slaughtered opposite northwest corner on second ring, And of afternoon was slaughtered opposite northeast corner on second ring,
llm_translation: How so? The daily offering of the morning was slaughtered on the northwest horn, on the second ring. And the one of the evenings was slaughtered on the northeast horn, on the second ring.

hebrew_text: מוּסָפִין שֶׁל שַׁבָּת, וַדַּאי צְרִיכִין שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוִין.
human_translation: additional offerings Shabbat, certainly that the two should be identical
llm_translation: Additional offerings of Shabbat, and certainly they must be equal.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: שְׁנֵי שְׂעִירֵי יוֹם הַכִּיפּוּרִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן בַּחוּץ, עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִגְרִיל עֲלֵיהֶן — חַיָּיב עַל שְׁנֵיהֶם. מִשֶּׁהִגְרִיל עֲלֵיהֶן — חַיָּיב עַל שֶׁל שֵׁם, וּפָטוּר עַל שֶׁל עֲזָאזֵל.
human_translation: The Sages taught: slaughtered the two Yom Kippur goats outside when he had not yet drawn lots them he is liable for both of them, after he drew lots them, he is liable for God, and he is exempt for for Azazel,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Two goats of Yom Kippur that were slaughtered outside, until they cast lots for them - one is liable for both. Once they cast lots for them - one is liable for the one named for God, and exempt for the one sent away to Azazel.

hebrew_text: עַד שֶׁלֹּא הִגְרִיל עֲלֵיהֶם חַיָּיב עַל שְׁנֵיהֶם. לְמַאי חֲזוּ? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי לְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ.
human_translation: when he had not yet drawn lots, he is liable for both of them, For what are they fit? Rav Ḥisda said: since they are fit as the goat performed outside.
llm_translation: Until he did not cast lots upon them, he is liable for both of them. For what did they see? Rav Ḥisdah said: Since it is fit for the scapegoat that is done outside.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי שְׁנָא לְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בִּפְנִים דְּלָא, דִּמְחוּסָּר הַגְרָלָה? לְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ נָמֵי לָא חֲזֵי, דִּמְחַסְּרִי עֲבוֹדַת הַיּוֹם!
human_translation: What is different the goat performed inside not they lack the lottery? They are also unfit as the goat performed outside as they lack the service of the day.
llm_translation: And what is the difference for the goat that is done inside, that it does not require a lottery? For the goat that is done outside, it is not fitting, as it lacks the service of the day!

hebrew_text: קָסָבַר רַב חִסְדָּא: אֵין מְחוּסַּר זְמַן לְבוֹ בַּיּוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda holds not lacking time that day.
llm_translation: He holds, Rav Ḥisdah: there is no need for a specific time for Lev to be in the day.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: הַשְׁתָּא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא מְחוּסָּר הַגְרָלָה כִּמְחוּסָּר מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: שְׁלָמִים שֶׁשְּׁחָטָן קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּפְתְּחוּ דַּלְתוֹת הַהֵיכָל פְּסוּלִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּשְׁחָטוֹ פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״, בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא פָּתוּחַ, וְלֹא בִּזְמַן שֶׁהוּא נָעוּל.
human_translation: Ravina said: Now that Rav Ḥisda said lacking the lottery is comparable to lacking an action that which Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: Peace-offerings that one slaughtered before the doors of the Sanctuary were opened are disqualified, it is stated “And he shall slaughter it at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting” when is open but not when it is locked.
llm_translation: Ravina said: The year that Rav Chisda said that the lack of a lottery is like the lack of the blood application, this is what Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Peace offerings that were slaughtered before the doors of the Sanctuary were opened are invalid, as it is stated: "And he shall slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting," when it is open, and not when it is closed.
