hebrew_text: שְׁחָטָן בַּחוּץ קוֹדֶם שֶׁנִּפְתְּחוּ דַּלְתוֹת הַהֵיכָל — פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא: מְחוּסָּר פְּתִיחָה כִּמְחוּסָּר מַעֲשֶׂה דָּמֵי.
human_translation: he slaughtered them outside before the doors of the Sanctuary were opened he is exempt. What is the reason? Lacking opening is comparable to lacking an action.
llm_translation: They slaughter outside before the doors of the sanctuary - exempt. What is the reason? Lack of opening is like lack of action of blood.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אִית לֵיהּ לְרַב חִסְדָּא ״הוֹאִיל״?
human_translation: Does Rav Ḥisda accept Since
llm_translation: And who has it according to Rav Ḥisda, "since"?

hebrew_text: וְהָאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: פֶּסַח שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ בַּחוּץ בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, לִשְׁמוֹ — פָּטוּר, שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And didn’t Rav Ḥisda say: slaughtered a Paschal lamb outside during the rest of the days of the year for its own sake, he is exempt, not for its own sake he is liable.
llm_translation: And it was said by Rav Ḥisdah: A Paschal lamb that was slaughtered outside on the rest of the days of the year, for its own sake — exempt; not for its own sake — liable.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּשֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ, הָא סְתָמָא, לִשְׁמוֹ הוּא וּפָטוּר. וְאַמַּאי? לֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וְרָאוּי שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ בִּפְנִים!
human_translation: The reason not for its own sake. However, without specifying it is for its own sake and he is exempt. But why Let us say: Since it is fit within not for its own sake,
llm_translation: Reason of not to his name, this anonymous, to his name he is and exempt. And why? Say: Since fitting not to his name inside!

hebrew_text: הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה, הַאי לָא בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה.
human_translation: How can be compared? There, requires uprooting These do not require uprooting
llm_translation: So now?! There, it requires uprooting, here, it does not require uprooting.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה בַּר שִׁימִי מַתְנֵי לְהוּ בִּדְרַבָּה, וְקַשְׁיָא לֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה אַדְּרַבָּה. וּמְשַׁנֵּי כִּדְשַׁנִּינַן.
human_translation: Rabba bar Shimi taught these in Rabba, and he a difficulty between Rabba Rabba. And he resolved as we resolved
llm_translation: Rabba bar Shimi teaches it to him in the manner of Rabba, and it is difficult for him because of Rabba, the great Rabba. And he repeats it as we have learned.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פֶּסַח שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ בַּחוּץ בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, בֵּין לִשְׁמוֹ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ — פָּטוּר.
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came he said Rabbi Yirmeya said Rabbi Yoḥanan slaughtered a Paschal lamb outside during the rest of the days of the year, whether for its own sake, or not for its own sake, he is exempt.
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A Paschal lamb that was slaughtered outside on any other day of the year, whether for its sake or not for its sake — it is exempt.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב דִּימִי: אַמְרִיתַהּ לִשְׁמַעְתָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בִּשְׁלָמָא לִשְׁמוֹ, דְּהָא לָא חֲזֵי לֵיהּ. אֶלָּא שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ, אַמַּאי? הָא חֲזֵי שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ בִּפְנִים?
human_translation: Rav Dimi said: I said this halakha before Rabbi Yirmeya Granted, for its own sake because it is not fit However, not for its own sake, why Isn’t it fit not for its own sake inside
llm_translation: Rav Dimi said: I said it for you to hear before Rabbi Yirmeya. If it is for his name, for he does not see it. But if not for his name, why? For he sees it not for his name inwardly.

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר לִי: עֲקִירַת חוּץ לָאו שְׁמַהּ עֲקִירָה.
human_translation: And said to me Uprooting outside is not called uprooting.
llm_translation: And he said to me: Uprooting outside is not called uprooting.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: פֶּסַח שֶׁשְּׁחָטוֹ בַּחוּץ בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה, בֵּין לִשְׁמוֹ בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: When Ravin came he said Rabbi Yirmeya said Rabbi Yoḥanan slaughtered a Paschal lamb outside during the rest of the days of the year, whether for its own sake or not for its own sake, he is liable.
llm_translation: When Ravin came, Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If one slaughtered the Passover offering outside on any other day of the year, whether for its sake or not for its sake — he is liable.

hebrew_text: וַאֲפִילּוּ לִשְׁמוֹ? וְהָתְנַן: מְחוּסַּר זְמַן — בֵּין בְּגוּפוֹ, בֵּין בִּבְעָלִים.
human_translation: even for its own sake? Didn’t we learn lacking time? whether itself or due to owners.
llm_translation: And even for his name? And we learned in a Mishnah: lacking time - whether in his body, or in his possessions.

hebrew_text: וְאֵיזֶהוּ מְחוּסַּר זְמַן בִּבְעָלִים — הַזָּב וְהַזָּבָה וְהַיּוֹלֶדֶת וְהַמְצוֹרָע
human_translation: And what is lacking time due to owners? A zav , a zava , a woman after childbirth, and a leper,
llm_translation: And which one is lacking time in owners - the male zav and the female zavah and the woman who gave birth and the metzora.

hebrew_text: שֶׁהִקְרִיבוּ חַטָּאתָם וַאֲשָׁמָם בַּחוּץ — פְּטוּרִין. עוֹלוֹתֵיהֶן וְשַׁלְמֵיהֶן בַּחוּץ — חַיָּיבִין.
human_translation: who sacrificed their sin-offering and, their guilt-offering outside are exempt. their burnt-offerings and peace-offerings outside they are liable.
llm_translation: "They brought their sin-offering and guilt-offering outside - exempt. Their burnt-offerings and peace-offerings outside - obligated."

hebrew_text: וַאֲמַר רַב חִלְקִיָּה בַּר טוֹבִי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לִשְׁמוֹ, אֲבָל שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ — חַיָּיב.
human_translation: And Rav Ḥilkiya bar Tovi said: They only taught for its own sake, but not for its own sake, he is liable,
llm_translation: And Rav Chilkiyah son of Tovi said: They only taught regarding his name, but if not regarding his name - he is liable.

hebrew_text: לִשְׁמוֹ מִיהָא פָּטוּר, אַמַּאי? נֵימָא: הוֹאִיל וּרְאוּיִן שֶׁלֹּא לִשְׁמוֹ בִּפְנִים! הָכִי הַשְׁתָּא?! הָתָם בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה, הָכָא פֶּסַח בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה — שְׁלָמִים נִינְהוּ.
human_translation: for its own sake, in any event he is exempt. Why? Let us say: Since they are fit inside not for their own sake, How can be compared? There, requires uprooting Here, a Paschal lamb during the rest of the days of the year is a peace-offering,
llm_translation: To his name from it exempt, why? Say: since fitting not to his name internally! So now?! There, requires uprooting, here, Passover on other days of the year - they are peace offerings.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי מַתְנֵי: חַיָּיב, כִּדְאָמְרִינַן. רַב יִרְמְיָה מִדִּפְתִּי מַתְנֵי: פָּטוּר. קָסָבַר: פֶּסַח בִּשְׁאָר יְמוֹת הַשָּׁנָה בָּעֵי עֲקִירָה, וַעֲקִירַת חוּץ לָאו שְׁמָהּ עֲקִירָה. וּפְלִיגָא דְּרַב חִלְקִיָּה בַּר טוֹבִי.
human_translation: Rav Ashi taught: He is liable, as we stated. Rav Yirmeya of Difti taught: He is exempt. held a Paschal lamb during the rest of the days of the year requires uprooting and uprooting outside is not called uprooting. And this disagrees with of Rav Ḥilkiya bar Tovi,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi teaches: obligated, as we say. Rav Yirmeya from Difti teaches: exempt. He holds: the Paschal lamb on other days of the year requires uprooting, and uprooting outside the Temple is not called uprooting. And this is in dispute with Rav Chilkiyah bar Tovi.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: מִשֶּׁהִגְרִיל עֲלֵיהֶן חַיָּיב עַל שֶׁל שֵׁם, וּפָטוּר עַל שֶׁל עֲזָאזֵל.
human_translation: The Master said: after he drew lots them he is liable for for God, and exempt for to Azazel.
llm_translation: The Master said: When one casts lots upon them, he is liable for the one designated for the Name, and exempt for the one designated for Azazel.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ אִישׁ מִבֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁחַט שׁוֹר אוֹ כֶשֶׂב אוֹ עֵז בַּמַּחֲנֶה אוֹ אֲשֶׁר יִשְׁחַט מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה. וְאֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד לֹא הֱבִיאוֹ לְהַקְרִיב קׇרְבָּן לַה׳״.
human_translation: The Sages taught “Any man of the house of Israel who shall slaughter a bull, or a lamb, or a goat in the camp, or who slaughters it outside the camp, and has not brought it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting to present it as an offering to the Lord
llm_translation: The sages taught: "A man from the house of Israel who slaughters an ox or a lamb or a goat in the camp, or who slaughters outside the camp. And he did not bring it to the entrance of the Tent of Meeting to offer it as an offering to the Lord."

hebrew_text: אִי ״קׇרְבָּן״, שׁוֹמֵעַ אֲנִי אֲפִילּוּ קׇדְשֵׁי בֶּדֶק הַבַּיִת, שֶׁנִּקְרְאוּ קׇרְבָּן, כָּעִנְיָן שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַנַּקְרֵב אֶת קׇרְבַּן ה׳״, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְאֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד לֹא הֱבִיאוֹ״. כׇּל הָרָאוּי לְפֶתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד — חַיָּיב עָלָיו בַּחוּץ, כֹּל שֶׁאֵינוֹ רָאוּי לְפֶתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד — אֵין חַיָּיבִין עָלָיו בַּחוּץ.
human_translation: If offering, I derive even consecrated for Temple maintenance which are called offering, as it is stated: “And we have brought the Lord’s offering, the verse states: “And has not brought it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting” any fit the entrance to the Tent of Meeting one is liable for it outside any that is not fit the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, one is not liable for it outside
llm_translation: If "korban," I hear I even holy of the Temple courtyard, that are called korban, as the matter that is said: "And he brought the offering of the Lord," Scripture teaches to say: "And to the entrance of the tent of meeting he did not bring it." Anyone fitting for the entrance of the tent of meeting — obligated upon him outside, anyone who is not fitting for the entrance of the tent of meeting — not obligated upon him outside.

hebrew_text: אוֹצִיא אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין רְאוּיִן לְפֶתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, וְלֹא אוֹצִיא פָּרַת חַטָּאת וְשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ שֶׁהוּא רָאוּי לָבוֹא אֶל פֶּתַח אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לַה׳״, מִי שֶׁמְּיוּחָדִין לַה׳, יָצְאוּ אֵלּוּ שֶׁאֵין מְיוּחָדִין לַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: I exclude these which are not fit the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and I will not exclude the heifer of a purification offering and scapegoat, which are fit to come to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. the verse states “to the Lord” those that are designated exclusively for God These, are excluded, as they are not designated exclusively for God
llm_translation: To bring out those that are not fit for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, and not to bring out the bull of the sin offering and the scapegoat that is fit to enter the entrance of the Tent of Meeting, Scripture teaches: "To the Lord." Those that are designated for the Lord have gone out, these that are not designated for the Name.

hebrew_text: וְ״לַה׳״ לְהוֹצִיא הוּא? וּרְמִינְהוּ: ״יֵרָצֶה לְקׇרְבַּן אִשֶּׁה לַה׳״, אֵלּוּ אִישִּׁים,
human_translation: Does “to the Lord” to exclude? raises a contradiction it may be accepted as an offering by fire to the Lord” These are by fire,
llm_translation: "And 'to the Lord' to bring out he? And we raise a contradiction: 'He desires to bring a sacrifice of a woman to the Lord,' these are men,"

hebrew_text: מִנַּיִן שֶׁלֹּא יַקְדִּישֶׁנּוּ מְחוּסָּר זְמַן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״קׇרְבָּן״, ״לַה׳״ — לְרַבּוֹת שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ!
human_translation: From where that he may not consecrate lacking time, The verse states: An offering, To the Lord to include the scapegoat,
llm_translation: From where do we derive that one should not sanctify it before its designated time? The Talmud teaches: "Offering," "to the Lord" - to include the goat that is intermingled!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: הָתָם מֵעִנְיָנָא דִקְרָא וְהָכָא מֵעִנְיָנָא דִקְרָא. הָתָם דְּ״אֶל פֶּתַח״ לְרַבּוֹת — ״לַה׳״ לְהוֹצִיא. הָכָא דְּ״אִשֶּׁה״ לְהוֹצִיא — ״לַה׳״ לְרַבּוֹת.
human_translation: Rava said There in the context of the verse and here in the context of the verse. There, where To the entrance, to include To the Lord to exclude. here, where by fire to exclude, To the Lord to include.
llm_translation: Rava said: There, the implication of the verse is to include, and here, the implication of the verse is to include. There, where it says "to God" is to exclude, to exclude. Here, where it says "a woman" is to exclude, to include.

hebrew_text: טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי רַחֲמָנָא, הָא לָא רַבִּי, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ קָדוֹשׁ בִּמְחוּסַּר זְמַן. וְהָא אֵין הַגּוֹרָל קוֹבֵעַ אֶלָּא בְּרָאוּי לַשֵּׁם!
human_translation: The reason is because the Merciful One included But had it not included I would have said: The scapegoat consecrated when lacking time. Isn’t the lottery establishes only fit to God?
llm_translation: Reason of Rabbi Rachmana, this not Rabbi, was saying: "A he-goat that mates is holy in a deficiency of time." And this: "The lot only determines what is fitting for the Name!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָא מַנִּי, חָנָן הַמִּצְרִי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: חָנָן הַמִּצְרִי אוֹמֵר: אֲפִילּוּ דָּם בַּכּוֹס — מֵבִיא חֲבֵירוֹ וּמְזַוֵּוג לוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: whose is this It is Ḥanan the Egyptian, as it was taught Ḥanan the Egyptian says: Even blood in the cup, he brings a counterpart and pairs it with
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: This is the teaching of Hanan the Egyptian, as it was taught: Hanan the Egyptian says: Even if there is blood in the cup - he brings his friend and dilutes it for him.

hebrew_text: אֵימַר דְּשָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ לְחָנָן הַמִּצְרִי דְּלֵית לֵיהּ דְּחוּיִין, דְּלֵית לֵיהּ הַגְרָלָה מִי שָׁמְעַתְּ לֵיהּ? דִּילְמָא מַיְיתֵי וּמַגְרִיל.
human_translation: Say that you heard Ḥanan the Egyptian that he does not rejected. Did you hear him that he does not lottery Perhaps brings and draws lots,
llm_translation: Said that heard to Hanan the Egyptian that does not have to him ropes, that does not have to him lottery who heard to him? Perhaps will come and will cast.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: הָא מַנִּי, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: מֵת אֶחָד מֵהֶן — מֵבִיא חֲבֵירוֹ שֶׁלֹּא בְּהַגְרָלָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: whose is this? It is Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught If one of dies, he brings another without a lottery; the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Yosef: Here is a dispute, it is Rabbi Shimon. As it was taught: If one of them dies — his fellow brings another without using a lottery, this is the statement of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר, כְּגוֹן שֶׁהוּמַם וְחִילְּלוֹ עַל אַחֵר.
human_translation: Ravina said where became blemished and they redeemed it with another.
llm_translation: Ravina said, for example, that he confused and desecrated another.

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא תֵּימְרָא דְּפָסֵיל בֵּיהּ מוּמָא! דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְאִשֶּׁה לֹא תִתְּנוּ מֵהֶם״, אֵלּוּ הַחֲלָבִים.
human_translation: From where do you say that is disqualified blemish? As it was taught nor make by fire of them these are the fats
llm_translation: And who said that a blemish is in it! As it was taught: "And you shall not give any of them to a woman," these are the fats.

hebrew_text: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא כּוּלָּן, מִקְצָתָן מִנַּיִן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״מֵהֶם״. ״מִזְבֵּחַ״, זוֹ זְרִיקַת דָּמִים. ״לַה׳״, לְרַבּוֹת שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ.
human_translation: I have only all from where some of them? The verse states “of them,” “The altar”; this is sprinkling the blood “to the Lord” to include the scapegoat,
llm_translation: I have only all of them, some of them from where? Scripture says: "from them." "Altar," this is the sprinkling of blood. "To the Lord," to include the scapegoat.

hebrew_text: וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב בַּעַל מוּם, וְאִיצְטְרִיךְ לְמִיכְתַּב מְחוּסַּר זְמַן. דְּאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא מְחוּסַּר זְמַן — מִשּׁוּם דְּלָא מָטֵי זִמְנֵיהּ, אֲבָל בַּעַל מוּם דְּמָטֵי זִמְנֵיהּ — אֵימָא לָא. וְאִי כְּתַב רַחֲמָנָא בַּעַל מוּם — מִשּׁוּם דִּמְאִיס, אֲבָל מְחוּסַּר זְמַן דְּלָא מְאִיס — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary to write a blemished and necessary to write lacking time. Since if the Merciful One had written lacking time, because its time has not come However, a blemished whose time has arrived, say not And if the Merciful One had written that a blemished because abhorrent However, lacking time, which is not abhorrent, say not necessary
llm_translation: The text states: "And it is necessary to write regarding a Ba'al Mum, and it is necessary to write regarding one lacking time. For if the Merciful One wrote regarding one lacking time - because his time has not yet arrived, but a Ba'al Mum whose time has arrived - I might say no. And if the Merciful One wrote regarding a Ba'al Mum - because he is despised, but one lacking time who is not despised - I might say no, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: כְּגוֹן שֶׁהָיָה לוֹ חוֹלֶה בְּתוֹךְ בֵּיתוֹ, וְשָׁחַט אִמּוֹ בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Rava said: where had ill person in his household, and he slaughtered the mother on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Rava said: For example, if he had a sick person in his house, and he slaughtered his mother on Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: וְכִי הַאי גַּוְונָא מִי אֲסִיר? ״לֹא תִשְׁחֲטוּ״ אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְהָא לָאו שְׁחִיטָה הִיא! הָא אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא דְּחִיָּיתוֹ לַצּוּק זוֹ הִיא שְׁחִיטָתוֹ.
human_translation: Is it prohibited in a case like this? The Merciful One stated you shall not slaughter and this is not slaughter. They say in the West, pushing it the cliff, is its slaughter.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "And is this action of his considered a violation? 'Do not slaughter,' the Merciful One said, but this is not slaughter! This is what they say in the West: His intention was for this specific squeezing, that is his method of slaughter."

hebrew_text: אִם שֶׁל שֵׁם מֵת, זֶה שֶׁעָלָה עָלָיו וְכוּ׳.
human_translation: If to God died, that upon which
llm_translation: If of Shem dead, this that came upon him etc.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: שֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג רִאשׁוֹן — יִקְרַב, שֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג שֵׁנִי — יִרְעֶה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: שֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג רִאשׁוֹן — יִרְעֶה, שֵׁנִי שֶׁבַּזּוּג שֵׁנִי — יִקְרַב.
human_translation: Rav said: he should sacrifice the second of the first pair and the second of the second pair should graze Rabbi Yoḥanan said: The second of the first pair should graze, he should sacrifice the second of the second pair.
llm_translation: Rav said: The second in the first pair - should be brought close, the second in the second pair - should be fed. Rabbi Yochanan said: The second in the first pair - should be fed, the second in the second pair - should be brought close.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַב סָבַר: בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים אֵינָן נִידְחִין, וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן סָבַר: בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִידְחִין.
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rav holds animals are not rejected. And Rabbi Yoḥanan holds animals are rejected.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Rav holds: living animals are not disqualified, and Rabbi Yochanan holds: living animals are disqualified.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַב? דְּיָלֵיף מִמְּחוּסַּר זְמַן. מְחוּסַּר זְמַן, לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּהַשְׁתָּא לָא חֲזֵי, כִּי הָדַר מִיחֲזֵי — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא. מִי דָּמֵי? הָתָם לָא אִיתְחֲזִי כְּלָל. הָכָא נִרְאָה וְנִדְחָה!
human_translation: What is the reason of Rav? He derives from lacking time. lacking time, is it not although it is unfit now, when it again becomes fit, it seems well, Here, too, no different. Is it comparable? There, it was never fit Here, was fit and was rejected.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rav's opinion? Because it is preferable due to a lack of time. Due to a lack of time, it is not even seen now, but it will be seen later - it is fitting. There, it is not seen at all. Here, it is seen and rejected!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא דְּרַב, דְּיָלֵיף מִבַּעַל מוּם עוֹבֵר. בַּעַל מוּם עוֹבֵר, לָאו אַף עַל גַּב דְּלָא חֲזֵי הַשְׁתָּא, כִּי הָדַר מִיחֲזֵי — שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי לָא שְׁנָא.
human_translation: Rather, this is the reasoning of Rav: He derives from an animal with a temporary blemish. an animal with a temporary blemish, is it not although it is unfit now, when it again becomes fit, it seems well, Here too, no different.
llm_translation: Rather: this is the reason of Rav, that it is preferable from a Baal Mum who transgresses. A Baal Mum who transgresses, it is not even though he does not see now, for later he will see - it is good, the money is good, here it is not different.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״כִּי מׇשְׁחָתָם בָּהֶם מוּם בָּם״, מוּם בָּם — הוּא דְּלֹא יֵרָצוּ, הָא עָבַר מוּמָן — יֵרָצוּ.
human_translation: There, from where do we As it is written: “Because their corruption is in them, there is a blemish in them; blemish is in them that they shall not be accepted; but if their blemish passes, they shall be accepted.
llm_translation: And there, how do we establish it for ourselves? For it is written: "For their blemish is within them" (Deuteronomy 32:5), "blemish within them" - that they should not be accepted, but if their blemish has passed - they should be accepted.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן? מִיעֵט רַחֲמָנָא ״בָּהֶם״, הֵם הוּא דְּכִי עָבַר מוּמָן יֵרָצוּ, הָא כׇּל דְּחוּיִין, הוֹאִיל וְנִדְחוּ — נִדְחוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan The Merciful One limited In them, it is they, that are accepted when their blemishes pass, but all once they are rejected they rejected.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan? Minimize mercy "in them," they are the ones that when a blemish passes, they will be accepted, but all that are pushed aside, since they are pushed aside — they are pushed aside.

hebrew_text: וְרַב? הָהוּא ״בָּהֶם״ בְּעֵינַיְיהוּ הוּא דְּלָא מִירְצוּ, הָא עַל יְדֵי תַּעֲרוֹבוֹת — מִירְצוּ.
human_translation: And Rav That In them, It is on their own that they are not accepted; but in mixtures are accepted.
llm_translation: Rav Hahu said, "In them" in their eyes, he is the one who is not pleased, but through mixtures - they are pleased.

hebrew_text: כְּדִתְנַן: אֵיבָרִים תְּמִימִים בְּאֵיבָרִים בַּעֲלֵי מוּמִין. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: אִם קָרַב הָרֹאשׁ שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן — יַקְרִיבוּ כׇּל הָרָאשִׁין כּוּלָּן, כְּרָעָיו שֶׁל אֶחָד מֵהֶן — יַקְרִיבוּ כָּל הַכְּרָעַיִים כּוּלָּן. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֲפִילּוּ קָרְבוּ כּוּלָּן חוּץ מֵאֶחָד מֵהֶן — יֵצֵא לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: As we learned If limbs unblemished with limbs blemished Rabbi Eliezer says: the head of one of them is sacrificed they should sacrifice all the heads, the legs of one of them they should sacrifice all the legs. And the Rabbis say: Even if all of them were sacrificed except for one, should be taken out to the place burning
llm_translation: As it was taught: Whole limbs with whole limbs, blemished limbs with blemished limbs. Rabbi Eliezer says: If the head of one of them approached, all the heads should be offered, if the legs of one of them approached, all the legs should be offered. And the Sages say: Even if all of them approached except for one of them, he should be taken out to be burned.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ מִ״בָּם״ ״בָּהֶם״. וְאִידַּךְ? ״בָּם״ ״בָּהֶם״ לָא דָּרֵישׁ.
human_translation: And the other He derives it from bam , bahem , And the other does not expound bam bahem ,
llm_translation: And the other one? It emerges for him from "bam" "bahem." And the other one? "Bahem" "bam" is not expounded.

hebrew_text: וּלְרַב, נְהִי נָמֵי דְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים אֵינָן נִדְחִין, אִי בָּעֵי הַאי נַקְרֵיב אִי בָּעֵי הַאי נַקְרֵיב!
human_translation: According to Rav, although living beings are not rejected, If he wants this he should sacrifice it, and if he wants that he should sacrifice that.
llm_translation: And for Rav, it is as the words of the owners of animals are not rejected, if this one wants to bring an offering, or if this one wants to bring an offering!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: רַב סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי, דְּאָמַר: מִצְוָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן. הֵי רַבִּי יוֹסֵי? אִי נֵימָא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּקוּפּוֹת, דִּתְנַן: שָׁלֹשׁ קוּפּוֹת שֶׁל שָׁלֹשׁ שָׁלֹשׁ סְאִין, שֶׁבָּהֶן תּוֹרְמִין אֶת הַלִּשְׁכָּה, וְכָתוּב עֲלֵיהֶן: אָלֶף בֵּית גִּימֶל. וְתַנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: לָמָּה כָּתוּב עֲלֵיהֶן אָלֶף בֵּית גִּימֶל — לֵידַע אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן נִתְרְמָה רִאשׁוֹן, לְהָבִיא הֵימֶנָּה רִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁמִּצְוָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rava said: Rav holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said: mitzva from the first Which Rabbi Yosei If we say Rabbi Yosei regard to containers, as we learned three containers, of which three se’a , with which they collected the chamber. And alef , beit , gimmel were written on them. And it was taught Rabbi Yosei said: Why were alef , beit , gimmel written on them? to know which of them was collected first, to bring from it first, as the mitzva is with the first
llm_translation: Rava said: Rav holds like Rabbi Yosei, who said: Mitzvah in the first. Is it Rabbi Yosei? If we say Rabbi Yosei of the pits, as we learned: Three pits of three se'ahs each, from which they contribute to the chamber, and it is written on them: Aleph Bet Gimel. And it was taught, Rabbi Yosei said: Why is Aleph Bet Gimel written on them? To know which of them was contributed first, to bring from it first, for mitzvah in the first.

hebrew_text: דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי הָתָם, דִּבְעִידָּנָא דְּאִתְחֲזַי קַמַּיְיתָא לָא אִתְחֲזַי בָּתְרָיְיתָא.
human_translation: Perhaps different there, because at the time when the first was fit the later not fit
llm_translation: Perhaps it is different there, for in the case where it is visible in front, it is not visible behind.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּפֶסַח, (דִּתְנַן:) הַמַּפְרִישׁ פִּסְחוֹ וְאָבַד, וְהִפְרִישׁ אַחֵר תַּחְתָּיו, וְאַחַר כָּךְ נִמְצָא הָרִאשׁוֹן, וַהֲרֵי שְׁנֵיהֶן עוֹמְדִין — אֵיזֶה מֵהֶן שֶׁיִּרְצֶה יִקְרַב, דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִצְוָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei with regard to the Paschal lamb. As we learned one who separated his Paschal lamb and it became lost, and he separated another in its stead, and afterward, the first is found, and they are both standing bring whichever of them he wishes. statement of the Rabbis. Rabbi Yosei says: mitzva with the first
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei of Pesach (as we learned): One who designates his Passover offering and it gets lost, and another designates one in its place, and then the first one is found, and both are standing - whichever one he wishes, he may bring, the words of the Sages. Rabbi Yosei says: The mitzvah is with the first one.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הָיָה הַשֵּׁנִי מוּבְחָר מִמֶּנּוּ — יְבִיאֶנּוּ.
human_translation: And if the second one was superior to it, he brings that one.
llm_translation: And if the second was chosen from him - he shall bring him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: דַּיְקָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, וּבָרַיְיתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. מַתְנִיתִין כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב, דְּקָתָנֵי: אִם שֶׁל שֵׁם מֵת — זֶה שֶׁעָלָה עָלָיו הַגּוֹרָל לַשֵּׁם יִתְקַיֵּים תַּחְתָּיו, וְאִידַּךְ כִּדְקָאֵי קָאֵי.
human_translation: Rava said: the mishna is precise in accordance with of Rav, and the baraita in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan. the mishna in accordance with of Rav, as it teaches: If to God died, that upon which the lot for God shall stand in its stead. And the other stands as it stood
llm_translation: Rava said: The Mishnah is precisely in accordance with the opinion of Rav, and the Baraita is in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan. The Mishnah is in accordance with the opinion of Rav, as it teaches: If the name of a deceased person is mentioned — this one upon whom the lot falls will be established in place of the name, and the other one stands as he is.

hebrew_text: בָּרַיְיתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּקָתָנֵי: ״שֵׁנִי״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ אִם שֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג רִאשׁוֹן אִם שֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג שֵׁנִי, כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״יׇעֳמַד חַי״, וְלֹא שֶׁחֲבֵירוֹ מֵת. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? ״יׇעֳמַד חַי״, וְלֹא שֶׁכְּבָר עָמַד.
human_translation: the baraita in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as it teaches: second I do not know whether the second of the first pair, or the second of the second pair. When states: “It shall be stood alive not whose counterpart died. From where may it be inferred, “It shall be stood alive,” not that already stood
llm_translation: Baraita like the opinion of Rabbi Yohanan, as it was taught: "Sheni," I do not know if it is the second of the first pair or the second of the second pair, when he says "let the living one stand" and not that his fellow should die. What is implied? "Let the living one stand," and not that he has already stood.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָמוּת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, מֵת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ — יִשָּׁפֵךְ הַדָּם. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, דְּאָמַר בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים נִדְחִין — מִשּׁוּם הָכִי יָמוּת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ. אֶלָּא לְרַב, דְּאָמַר בַּעֲלֵי חַיִּים אֵינָן נִדְחִין — אַמַּאי יָמוּת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ?
human_translation: We learned And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: the blood spilled the scapegoat to die. if the scapegoat dies, the blood should be spilled, Granted, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said animals are rejected, due to that the scapegoat to die. However, according to Rav, who said animals are not rejected, why is the scapegoat to die?
llm_translation: We learned in the Mishnah, and furthermore Rabbi Yehuda said: If the blood spills - the fetus shall die, if the fetus dies - the blood shall spill. According to Rabbi Yochanan, who said living creatures are considered as rejected i.e., not viable - therefore the fetus shall die. But according to Rav, who said living creatures are not considered as rejected - why should the fetus die?

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְךָ רַב: אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה לָא קָא אָמֵינָא. כִּי אָמֵינָא, אַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: Rav said to you: I did not state in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda. I stated in accordance with of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: He said to you, Rav: "Regarding the teaching of Rabbi Yehuda, I do not agree." When I say, "I do not agree," I mean, "Regarding the teaching of the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב, בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה וְרַבָּנַן. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, בְּמַאי פְּלִיגִי? אָמַר רָבָא: הָא אָמְרִינַן דַּיְיקָא מַתְנִיתִין כְּווֹתֵיהּ דְּרַב.
human_translation: Granted, according to of Rav, Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis disagree with regard to However, according to of Rabbi Yoḥanan, with regard to what do disagree? Rava said: Didn’t we say the mishna is precise in accordance with of Rav,
llm_translation: In peace to Rav, in this they argue Rabbi Yehuda and the Rabbis. Rather, to Rabbi Yochanan, with what do they argue? Rava said: This we say specifically according to the opinion of Rav.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן: שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה. הָא דְּיָחִיד כִּי הַאי גַוְונָא — מֵתָה. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, כִּדְרַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי אַבָּא אָמַר רַב:
human_translation: We learned that a communal sin-offering is not to die. This of an individual a case like this to die. Granted, according to of Rabbi Yoḥanan, in accordance with Rabbi Abba Rav said. As Rabbi Abba said that Rav said:
llm_translation: We learned: The communal sin-offering does not die. This individual one, however, dies. According to Rabbi Yochanan, as Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav. For Rabbi Abba said in the name of Rav:

hebrew_text: הַכֹּל מוֹדִים שֶׁאִם נִתְכַּפֵּר בְּשֶׁאֵינָהּ אֲבוּדָה — אֲבוּדָה מֵתָה.
human_translation: Everyone concedes that if he gained atonement through that was not lost, the one that was lost to die.
llm_translation: All agree that if it was atoned for with something that is not Avodah - the Avodah is invalid.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב הָוֵה לֵיהּ כְּמַפְרִישׁ שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת לְאַחְרָיוּת, וְאָמַר רַבִּי אוֹשַׁעְיָא: הִפְרִישׁ שְׁתֵּי חַטָּאוֹת לְאַחְרָיוּת — מִתְכַּפֵּר בְּאַחַת מֵהֶם, וְהַשְּׁנִיָּה תִּרְעֶה.
human_translation: However, according to of Rav, This is like designates two sin-offerings as a guarantee, And Rabbi Oshaya said one separated two sin-offerings as a guarantee, he gains atonement through one of them, and the second to graze
llm_translation: Rather, for Rav it was like one who separates two sin-offerings for afterbirth, and Rabbi Oshaya said: One who separates two sin-offerings for afterbirth — he atones with one of them, and the other one grazes.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן דְּאָמַר רָבָא: רַב סָבַר לַהּ כְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי דְּאָמַר מִצְוָה בָּרִאשׁוֹן, מֵעִיקָּרָא כְּמַפְרִישׁ לְאִיבּוּד דָּמֵי.
human_translation: Since Rava said Rav holds in accordance with Rabbi Yosei, who said the mitzva with the first from the beginning to be comparable to separated to be lost.
llm_translation: Since Rava said: Rav holds like Rabbi Yosei who said the mitzvah is at the outset, from the beginning, as he separates for the purpose of redeeming the blood.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תָּמוּת. בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמַר שֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג רִאשׁוֹן יִרְעֶה, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה יָמוּת — מִתְכַּפֵּר בַּשֵּׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג שֵׁנִי.
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Yehuda says: It should die. Granted, according to of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said second of the first pair should graze, according to Rabbi Yehuda, it should to die, he gains atonement with second of the second pair.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehudah says: "Tāmūt." Granted, according to Rabbi Yochanan who said, "The second in a pair should graze," but according to Rabbi Yehudah who said, "It shall die," it is atoned for by the second in the pair, the second.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא לְרַב דְּאָמַר שֵׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג שֵׁנִי יִרְעֶה, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה יָמוּת — לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בְּמַאי מִיכַּפַּר? מִי סָבְרַתְּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַשֵּׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג שֵׁנִי קָאֵי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אַשֵּׁנִי שֶׁבְּזוּג רִאשׁוֹן קָאֵי.
human_translation: However, according to Rav, who said second of the second pair should graze, according to Rabbi Yehuda it should die, according to Rabbi Yehuda With which will he gain atonement? Do you maintain Rabbi Yehuda was referring to the second of the second pair Rabbi Yehuda was referring to the second of the first pair.
llm_translation: Instead, to Rav who says, "The second animal in a pair is the one that grazes," to Rabbi Yehuda who says, "It shall die." — To Rabbi Yehuda, with what will it be atoned? Do you think Rabbi Yehuda holds that the second animal in a pair is standing for atonement? Rabbi Yehuda holds that the first animal in a pair is standing for atonement.

hebrew_text: וְאִיכָּא דְּקָא מוֹתֵיב הָכִי: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם יָמוּת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, מֵת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ יִשָּׁפֵךְ הַדָּם.
human_translation: There are those who raised this objection And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: the blood spilled the scapegoat to die. the scapegoat dies, the blood should be spilled,
llm_translation: And there is one who is standing and saying thus: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: "If the blood is spilled, the one who receives the blood shall die; if the one who receives the blood dies, the blood shall be spilled."

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְרַב, רֵישָׁא פְּלִיגִי בְּחַטַּאת צִבּוּר וְסֵיפָא פְּלִיגִי בְּבַעֲלֵי חַיִּים. אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, מַאי ״וְעוֹד״. קַשְׁיָא.
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav, the first clause they disagree with regard to a communal sin-offering. And the latter clause they disagree with regard to animals However, according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, what And furthermore, difficult.
llm_translation: In truth, according to Rav, the beginning part disputes regarding the communal sin offering, and the end part disputes regarding living creatures. But according to Rabbi Yochanan, what is "and still"? It is difficult.

hebrew_text: וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: נִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם — יָמוּת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ. בִּשְׁלָמָא נִשְׁפַּךְ הַדָּם יָמוּת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ — דְּאַכַּתִּי לָא אִיתְעֲבִיד מִצְוְתֵיהּ.
human_translation: And furthermore, Rabbi Yehuda said: the blood spilled the scapegoat should die. Granted, the blood spilled, the scapegoat should die, as the mitzva has not yet been performed,
llm_translation: And furthermore said Rabbi Yehuda: If the blood spills — the one who receives the blood shall die. Granted, if the blood spills and the one who receives the blood shall die — for it is reasonable that he cannot fulfill his commandments.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵת הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, אַמַּאי יִשָּׁפֵךְ הַדָּם? הָא אִיתְעֲבִיד לֵיהּ מִצְוְתֵיהּ!
human_translation: However, the scapegoat dies, why should the blood be spilled? The mitzva of has been performed.
llm_translation: Rather, one who is being shaved has died, why should blood be spilled? Indeed, he is fulfilling his commandments!

hebrew_text: אָמְרִי דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי: אָמַר קְרָא: ״יׇעֳמַד חַי לִפְנֵי ה׳ לְכַפֵּר״, עַד מָתַי יְהֵא זָקוּק לִהְיוֹת חַי — עַד שְׁעַת מַתַּן דָּמִים שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: of the house of Rabbi Yannai said the verse states: shall be stood alive before the Lord, to make atonement Until when must be alive? Until the blood of its counterpart is sprinkled,
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yannai said: The verse says, "Let the living stand before the Lord to atone." Until when should one be considered alive? Until the moment of the giving of the blood of his fellow.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: בְּנֵי הָעִיר שֶׁשָּׁלְחוּ אֶת שִׁקְלֵיהֶן וְנִגְנְבוּ אוֹ שֶׁאָבְדוּ, אִם נִתְרְמָה תְּרוּמָה — נִשְׁבָּעִין לְגִזְבָּרִין.
human_translation: We learned there residents of a city sent their shekels and were stolen or were lost if funds were collected, take an oath to the treasurers
llm_translation: We learned there: The residents of a city who sent their shekels and they were stolen or lost, if the terumah was separated - they swear to the treasurers.

hebrew_text: וְאִם לָאו — נִשְׁבָּעִין לִבְנֵי הָעִיר, וּבְנֵי הָעִיר שׁוֹקְלִין אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: And if not take an oath to the residents of the city, and the residents of the city donate other in their stead.
llm_translation: "If not — they swear to the residents of the city, and the residents of the city appoint others in their place."

hebrew_text: נִמְצְאוּ אוֹ שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּם הַגַּנָּבִים — אֵלּוּ וָאֵלּוּ שְׁקָלִים הֵם, וְאֵין עוֹלִין לָהֶן לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עוֹלִין לָהֶן לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: are found or the thieves returned them, both these and those are shekels, but they do not count the following year. Rabbi Yehuda says: They do count toward the following year.
llm_translation: Found or that returned the thieves - these and these are shekels they, and do not ascend for them to the next year. Rabbi Yehuda says: they ascend for them to the next year.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה? אָמַר רָבָא: קָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה חוֹבוֹת שֶׁל שָׁנָה זוֹ קְרֵיבוֹת לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה.
human_translation: What is the reason for of Rabbi Yehuda? Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda holds the obligations of this year are brought the following year,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehuda's opinion? Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda holds that debts of this year are considered as if they were due in the following year.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: פַּר וְשָׂעִיר שֶׁל יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁאָבְדוּ וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן, וְכֵן שְׂעִירֵי עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה שֶׁאָבְדוּ וְהִפְרִישׁ אֲחֵרִים תַּחְתֵּיהֶן — כּוּלָּן יָמוּתוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה. רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמְרִים: יִרְעוּ עַד שֶׁיִּסְתָּאֲבוּ וְיִמָּכְרוּ, וְיִפְּלוּ דְּמֵיהֶם לִנְדָבָה, שֶׁאֵין חַטַּאת צִבּוּר מֵתָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to this the bull and goat of Yom Kippur were lost and one designated others in their stead, and similarly the goats idol worship were lost and he designated others in their stead, all should die, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon say: They should graze until they become unfit. they are sold, and the money their will go to a gift-offering, as a communal sin-offering not die. said to him:
llm_translation: He raised an objection to him: Abaye raised an objection: The bull and the goat of Yom Kippur that got lost, and others were designated in their place, and similarly, the goats of foreign worship that got lost, and others were designated in their place - all of them shall die, the words of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon say: They shall graze until they develop a blemish and are sold, and their proceeds shall be used for a freewill offering, for a communal sin-offering does not die. He said to him:

hebrew_text: קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִבּוּר קָא אָמְרַתְּ? שָׁאנֵי קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִבּוּר, כִּדְרַבִּי טָבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי טָבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה: אָמַר קְרָא: ״זֹאת עוֹלַת חֹדֶשׁ בְּחׇדְשׁוֹ״, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: חַדֵּשׁ וְהָבֵא לִי קׇרְבָּן מִתְּרוּמָה חֲדָשָׁה.
human_translation: You speak of communal offerings? Communal offerings are different, in accordance with Rabbi Tavi said Rabbi Yoshiya. As Rabbi Tavi said Rabbi Yoshiya said the verse states: “This is the burnt-offering for every New Moon upon its renewal The Torah said: Renew and bring Me an offering from the new contribution.
llm_translation: Offerings of the community, did you say? Different are offerings of the community, as Rabbi Tavi said in the name of Rabbi Yoshiyah. For Rabbi Tavi said in the name of Rabbi Yoshiyah: The verse states, "This is the burnt offering of the new moon in its month." The Torah said: Renew and bring Me an offering from the new contribution.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח שָׂעִיר, פַּר מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? גְּזֵירָה פַּר אַטּוּ שָׂעִיר.
human_translation: well goat, bull what is there to say? a decree bull due to the goat.
llm_translation: The he-goat shall be left, what is there to say about the bull? A decree regarding the bull, or perhaps regarding the he-goat.

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה יָמוּתוּ? וְעוֹד: הָא דְּרַבִּי טָבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יֹאשִׁיָּה גּוּפַהּ מִצְוָה הִיא. דְּאָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: קׇרְבְּנוֹת צִבּוּר הַבָּאִין בְּאֶחָד בְּנִיסָן — מִצְוָה לְהָבִיא מִן הֶחָדָשׁ, וְאִם הֵבִיא מִן הַיָּשָׁן — יָצָא, אֶלָּא שֶׁחִסֵּר מִצְוָה!
human_translation: due to a decree should die And furthermore, this that Rabbi Tavi said Rabbi Yoshiya is itself a mitzva As Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: communal offerings that are brought on the first of Nisan, it is a mitzva to bring from the new if he brought from the old he has fulfilled but he lacked the mitzva,
llm_translation: And because of a decree shall they die? And furthermore: This that Rabbi Tavi said, Rabbi Yoshiyah said: It is a mitzvah in itself. For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If communal sacrifices come on the first of Nisan, it is a mitzvah to bring from the new funds, and if one brought from the old funds, he has fulfilled his obligation, but he lacks the mitzvah!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין הַגּוֹרָל קוֹבֵעַ מִשָּׁנָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ. וְנַיְיתֵי וְנַגְרֵיל? גְּזֵירָה שֶׁמָּא יֹאמְרוּ הַגּוֹרָל קוֹבֵעַ מִשָּׁנָה לַחֲבֶרְתָּהּ.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said because the lottery does not establish from year to another. But let us bring and draw lots It is a decree lest say the lottery establishes from year to another.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Zeira said: Because the lot does not determine for its companion. And if we were to come and cast lots? It is a decree lest they say, "The lot determines for its companion."

hebrew_text: הָא תִּינַח שָׂעִיר, פַּר מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? גְּזֵירָה פַּר אַטּוּ שָׂעִיר. וּמִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה יָמוּתוּ?
human_translation: This well goat, bull what is there to say? a decree bull due to goat. due to a decree should die
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: "Ha tinach sa'ir, par mai ikka le'meimar? Gezeirah par atu sa'ir. U'mishum gezeirah yamutu?" English translation: "This goat is resting, what can be said about the bull? A decree for the bull, or perhaps for the goat. And because of the decree, will they die?"

hebrew_text: אַמְרוּהָ רַבָּנַן קַמֵּיהּ דְּאַבָּיֵי: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם חַטָּאת שֶׁמֵּתוּ בְּעָלֶיהָ. הָא תִּינַח פַּר, שָׂעִיר מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? גְּזֵירָה שָׂעִיר אַטּוּ פַּר.
human_translation: The Rabbis stated before Abaye: a decree, due to a sin-offering whose owners have died, This well bull, goat, what is there to say? a decree goat due to the bull.
llm_translation: The sages said before Abaye: A decree because of a sin-offering whose owners died. If a bull is left, what can be said about a goat? A decree for a goat, then certainly for a bull.

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה יָמוּתוּ? אֶלָּא: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם חַטָּאת שֶׁעִבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ. גְּזֵירָה? הִיא גּוּפַהּ חַטָּאת שֶׁעִבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ הִיא!
human_translation: due to a decree should die Rather, a decree due to a sin-offering whose year has passed. a decree? It is a sin-offering whose year has passed,
llm_translation: "And because of a decree shall they die? Rather, a decree due to a sin that its year has passed. A decree? It is the essence of the sin that its year has passed, it is!"

hebrew_text: הָא לָא קַשְׁיָא, כְּרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא: ״שָׁנָה תְּמִימָה״, מוֹנֶה שְׁלֹשׁ מֵאוֹת וְשִׁשִּׁים וַחֲמִשָּׁה יוֹם כְּמִנְיָן יְמוֹת הַחַמָּה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מוֹנֶה שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר חֹדֶשׁ מִיּוֹם לְיוֹם.
human_translation: This is not difficult, in accordance with Rabbi As it was taught a full year” he counts 365 days, in accordance with the number days solar year; the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: He counts twelve months from day to day.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: The matter is not difficult, like Rabbi. For it was taught: "A complete year," counts three hundred and sixty-five days according to the count of the days of the sun, the words of Rabbi. And the Sages say: Count twelve months from day to day.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נִתְעַבְּרָה — נִתְעַבְּרָה לַמּוֹכֵר. הָתִינַח שָׂעִיר, פַּר מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? גְּזֵירָה פַּר אַטּוּ שָׂעִיר.
human_translation: And if extended it is extended for the seller, well goat, bull, what is there to say? There is a decree bull due to the goat.
llm_translation: If she was violated - she was violated to the seller. He set a he-goat, what is there to say? A decree for a bull, yet he set a he-goat.

hebrew_text: וּמִשּׁוּם גְּזֵירָה יָמוּת?! וְעוֹד, חַטָּאת שֶׁעִבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ — לִרְעִיָּה אָזְלָא! דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: חַטָּאת שֶׁעִבְּרָה שְׁנָתָהּ, רוֹאִין אוֹתָהּ כְּאִילּוּ הִיא עוֹמֶדֶת בְּבֵית הַקְּבָרוֹת וְרוֹעָה.
human_translation: due to a decree should die And furthermore, sin-offering whose year has passed goes to graze. As Reish Lakish said: We consider a sin-offering whose year has passed as though it stands in a cemetery, it grazes
llm_translation: And because of a decree shall he die?! And furthermore, a sin offering whose year has passed — goes for grazing! For Reish Lakish said: A sin offering whose year has passed, we view it as if it is standing in the cemetery and grazing.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: גְּזֵירָה מִשּׁוּם תַּקָּלָה. אֵין מַקְדִּישִׁין, וְאֵין מַעֲרִיכִין, וְאֵין מַחְרִימִין בַּזְּמַן הַזֶּה.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: decree due to mishap One may neither consecrate nor valuate, nor dedicate for sacred use at this time,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: A decree due to a concern for irreverence. We do not sanctify, we do not appraise, and we do not place under a ban in this time.

hebrew_text: וְאִם הִקְדִּישׁ וְהֶעֱרִיךְ וְהֶחְרִים, בְּהֵמָה — תֵּיעָקֵר. פֵּירוֹת כְּסוּת וְכֵלִים — יֵרָקְבוּ, מָעוֹת וּכְלֵי מַתָּכוֹת — יוֹלִיךְ הֲנָאָה לְיָם הַמֶּלַח. וְאֵי זֶה הוּא עִיקּוּר — נוֹעֵל דֶּלֶת לְפָנֶיהָ, וְהִיא מֵתָה מֵאֵלֶיהָ.
human_translation: And if one did consecrate, valuate, or dedicate an animal it is uprooted, produce, garments, or vessels they decompose. money or metal vessels, he transport benefit to the Dead Sea. And what uprooting? He locks the door before it, and it dies on its own
llm_translation: "And if one consecrated and appraised and banned, an animal — it shall be uprooted. Fruits, garments, and vessels — shall rot, coins and metal vessels — shall be thrown into the Dead Sea. And what is considered 'uprooting' — locking a door in front of it, and it dies from within."

hebrew_text: תַּקָּלָה דְּמַאי? אִי תַּקָּלָה דְּהַקְרָבָה, אֲפִילּוּ כׇּל רְעִיּוֹת נָמֵי! אִי תַּקָּלָה דְּגִיזָּה וַעֲבוֹדָה, אֲפִילּוּ כׇּל רְעִיּוֹת נָמֵי!
human_translation: What mishap If mishap of offering even all graze. If mishap of shearing and working even all graze.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is the case of demai? If it is a case of proximity, even all the shepherds are also included! If it is a case of theft and labor, even all the shepherds are also included!

hebrew_text: לְעוֹלָם תַּקָּלָה דְּהַקְרָבָה, וְהָנָךְ דְּלָאו בְּנֵי הַקְרָבָה נִינְהוּ — לָא טְרִיד בְּהוּ, הָךְ דְּבַת הַקְרָבָה הִיא — טְרִיד בַּהּ.
human_translation: Actually, a mishap of sacrifice. And those which are not fit for sacrifice, he is not preoccupied with, This which are fit for sacrifice he is preoccupied with
llm_translation: Always lightness of the approach, and there where not of the sons of the approach they are — not trouble with them, there where of the daughter of the approach she is — trouble with her.

hebrew_text: וְתַקָּלָה עַצְמָהּ תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא חֲדָא: פֶּסַח שֶׁלֹּא קָרַב בְּרִאשׁוֹן — יִקְרַב בַּשֵּׁנִי, בַּשֵּׁנִי — יִקְרַב לְשָׁנָה הַבָּאָה. וְתַנְיָא אִידַּךְ: לֹא יִקְרַב. מַאי לָאו, בְּתַקָּלָה פְּלִיגִי?
human_translation: itself, mishap, is tanna’im . As it was taught one A Paschal lamb that was not sacrificed on the first sacrificed on the second on the second it is sacrificed the following year. And it was taught another it is not sacrificed What, is it not that they disagree about mishap?
llm_translation: The mishna itself is a teaching. As it was taught in a baraita: If one did not bring the Passover offering on the first day, he should bring it on the second day; if on the second day, he should bring it the following year. And it was taught in another baraita: He should not bring it. What is the difference? Do they not disagree in the case of a blemish?

hebrew_text: לָא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא [לָא] חָיְישִׁינַן לְתַקָּלָה, וְהָכָא בִּפְלוּגְתָּא דְּרַבִּי וְרַבָּנַן קָא מִיפַּלְגִי, וְלָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא רַבִּי, הָא רַבָּנַן.
human_translation: No, that everyone agrees we are not concerned about a mishap, and here they disagree about the dispute between Rabbi and the Rabbis And not difficult. This Rabbi That the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Not, that all the world not we are concerned for danger, and here in the dispute of Rabbi and the Rabbis they are differing, and it is not difficult: this is Rabbi, this is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: וְכֵן הַמָּעוֹת! אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ — בְּתַקָּלָה פְּלִיגִי, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Wasn’t it taught And, so too, money Rather, isn’t it conclude from this that they disagree with regard to a mishap? learn from this
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "And it was taught: And so too with the ma'ot! Rather, it is not a conclusive refutation - they argue in a lenient manner, it is a conclusive refutation."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל שָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ, וְסוֹמֵךְ שְׁתֵּי יָדָיו עָלָיו וּמִתְוַדֶּה. וְכָךְ הָיָה אוֹמֵר: אָנָא הַשֵּׁם! חָטְאוּ, עָווּ, פָּשְׁעוּ לְפָנֶיךָ עַמְּךָ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל. אָנָא הַשֵּׁם! כַּפֶּר נָא לַחֲטָאִים וְלָעֲוֹנוֹת וְלַפְּשָׁעִים שֶׁחָטְאוּ וְשֶׁעָווּ וְשֶׁפָּשְׁעוּ לְפָנֶיךָ עַמְּךָ בֵּית יִשְׂרָאֵל, כַּכָּתוּב בְּתוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה עַבְדֶּךָ לֵאמֹר: ״כִּי בַיּוֹם הַזֶּה יְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיכֶם לְטַהֵר אֶתְכֶם מִכֹּל חַטֹּאתֵיכֶם לִפְנֵי ה׳ תִּטְהָרוּ״.
human_translation: comes over to the scapegoat, places both his hands upon it, and confesses. And he would say as follows: Please, God, Your people, the house of Israel, have sinned, and done wrong, and rebelled before You. Please, God, grant atonement, please, for the sins, and for the wrongs, and for the rebellions that they have sinned, and done wrong, and rebelled before You, Your people, the house of Israel, as it is written in the Torah of Moses Your servant, saying: “For on this day atonement shall be made for you to cleanse you of all your sins; before the Lord you shall be purified”
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one comes to Se'ir the scapegoat, and leans his two hands upon it and confesses, he would say as follows: "Please, Hashem! Your people, the house of Israel, have sinned, transgressed, and acted wickedly before You. Please, Hashem! Atone, I pray, for the sins, iniquities, and transgressions that Your people, the house of Israel, have sinned, transgressed, and acted wickedly before You, as it is written in the Torah of Your servant Moses, saying: 'For on this day shall atonement be made for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins before Hashem shall you be cleansed.'"

hebrew_text: וְהַכֹּהֲנִים וְהָעָם הָעוֹמְדִים בָּעֲזָרָה כְּשֶׁהָיוּ שׁוֹמְעִים שֵׁם הַמְּפוֹרָשׁ שֶׁהוּא יוֹצֵא מִפִּי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל, הָיוּ כּוֹרְעִים וּמִשְׁתַּחֲוִים וְנוֹפְלִים עַל פְּנֵיהֶם, וְאוֹמְרִים: ״בָּרוּךְ שֵׁם כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתוֹ לְעוֹלָם וָעֶד״. מְסָרוֹ לְמִי שֶׁהָיָה מוֹלִיכוֹ. הַכֹּל כְּשֵׁרִין לְהוֹלִיכוֹ, אֶלָּא שֶׁעָשׂוּ הַכֹּהֲנִים גְּדוֹלִים קֶבַע, וְלֹא הָיוּ מַנִּיחִין אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל לְהוֹלִיכוֹ.
human_translation: And the priests and the people standing in the courtyard, when they would hear the Explicit Name emerging from the mouth of the High Priest, they would kneel and prostrate and fall on their faces, and say: Blessed is the name of His glorious kingdom forever and ever. passed to the one who was to lead it everyone is eligible to lead it, but the High Priests established fixed and did not allow an Israelite to lead it.
llm_translation: The priests and the people standing in the Temple courtyard, when they would hear the explicit Name that came out of the mouth of the High Priest, would bow, prostrate, and fall on their faces, and say: "Blessed be the Name of the glory of His kingdom forever and ever." They would hand over to whoever was leading him. Everyone was fit to lead him, but the High Priests established a fixed order, and they would not allow Israel to lead him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: מַעֲשֶׂה וְהוֹלִיכוֹ עַרְסְלָא, וְיִשְׂרָאֵל הָיָה. וְכֶבֶשׁ עָשׂוּ לוֹ מִפְּנֵי הַבָּבְלִיִּים, שֶׁהָיוּ מְתַלְּשִׁים בִּשְׂעָרוֹ וְאוֹמְרִים לוֹ: טוֹל וָצֵא טוֹל וָצֵא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: an incident where Arsela led and he was an Israelite. And they made a ramp for due to the Babylonian who would pluck at hair and say to Take and go, take and go,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: There was an incident involving an Arisla, and there was an Israelite. And they made for him a lamb because of the Babylonians, who used to pull his hair and say to him: "Take and go out, take and go out."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ וְאִילּוּ ״בְּנֵי אַהֲרֹן עַם קְדוֹשֶׁךָ״ לָא קָאָמַר. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, דְּאִי כְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה, הָא אָמַר: יֵשׁ לָהֶם כַּפָּרָה בְּשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ.
human_translation: whereas he did not say: The children of Aaron, Your sacred people, Who taught Rabbi Yirmeya said: is not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, for if in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, didn’t say: atonement through the scapegoat,
llm_translation: Gemara: And if "the sons of Aaron, the people of your holiness" is not stated. Who is the Tanna? Rabbi Yirmeya said: Not like Rabbi Yehuda, for if it were like Rabbi Yehuda, he said: They have atonement with the scapegoat that is sent away.

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, אַטּוּ כֹּהֲנִים לָאו בִּכְלַל ״עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל״ נִינְהוּ?
human_translation: Abaye said: Even you say Rabbi Yehuda, is that to say that priests are not included among: Your people, Israel?
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say it is Rabbi Yehuda, are the priests not included in the term "your people, Israel"?

hebrew_text: מְסָרוֹ לְמִי שֶׁמּוֹלִיכוֹ. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״אִישׁ״ — לְהַכְשִׁיר אֶת הַזָּר, ״עִתִּי״ —
human_translation: passed to the one who was to lead it The Sages taught, man to qualify a non-priest appointed
llm_translation: They handed him over to the one who was leading him. The Rabbis taught: "A man" - to validate the stranger, "my time" -

hebrew_text: שֶׁיְּהֵא מְזוּמָּן. ״עִתִּי״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת, ״עִתִּי״ — וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה.
human_translation: that he should be designated appointed and even on Shabbat. appointed and even in impurity.
llm_translation: The text reads: "That he should be prepared. 'My time' - even on Shabbat, 'My time' - even in a state of impurity."

hebrew_text: ״אִישׁ״ — לְהַכְשִׁיר אֶת הַזָּר. פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: ״כַּפָּרָה״ כְּתִיבָא בֵּיהּ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: man qualify a non-priest. obvious Lest you say: atonement is written with regard to it, it teaches us
llm_translation: "אִישׁ" — to validate the stranger. Obviously? What might you say: "atonement" is written in it, teaching us.

hebrew_text: ״עִתִּי״ וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּשַׁבָּת. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לוֹמַר, שֶׁאִם הָיָה חוֹלֶה — מַרְכִּיבוֹ עַל כְּתֵפוֹ.
human_translation: appointed even on Shabbat. to what halakha Rav Sheshet said: to state that if were ill carries it on his shoulder.
llm_translation: "Season" and even on Shabbat. For what halakha? Rav Sheshet said: To say, that if one was sick - they may place it on their shoulder.

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן, דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי נָתָן. דְּאִי רַבִּי נָתָן, הָאָמַר: חַי נוֹשֵׂא אֶת עַצְמוֹ: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי נָתָן, חָלָה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Natan, as, if Rabbi Natan, didn’t say a living carries itself? Even you say Rabbi Natan, ill is different.
llm_translation: As one who is not like Rabbi Natan. For if it were Rabbi Natan, he said: "A living person bears his own self." Even if you were to say it is Rabbi Natan, the case is different.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַפְרָם, זֹאת אוֹמֶרֶת: עֵירוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְשַׁבָּת, וְאֵין עֵירוּב וְהוֹצָאָה לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: Rafram said: That is to say eiruv and carrying out to Shabbat, eiruv and carrying out do not to Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Rafhram said, this means: Eruv and carrying out for Shabbat, and there is no Eruv and carrying out for Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: ״עִתִּי״ וַאֲפִילּוּ בְּטוּמְאָה. לְמַאי הִלְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לוֹמַר שֶׁאִם נִטְמָא מְשַׁלְּחוֹ — נִכְנָס טָמֵא לָעֲזָרָה, וּמְשַׁלְּחוֹ.
human_translation: appointed even in impurity. to what halakha Rav Sheshet said: to tell that if the one sending became impure, he enters the courtyard impure and sends it
llm_translation: "עִתִּי" and even in impurity. For what halakha? Rav Sheshet said: To say that if his emissary becomes impure - an impure person enters the Temple courtyard, and his emissary.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: חָלָה, מַהוּ שֶׁיַּרְכִּיבֵהוּ עַל כְּתֵפוֹ? אָמַר לָהֶם: יָכוֹל הוּא לְהַרְכִּיב אֲנִי וְאַתֶּם. חָלָה מְשַׁלְּחוֹ, מַהוּ שֶׁיְּשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ בְּיַד אַחֵר? אָמַר לָהֶם: אֱהֵא בְּשָׁלוֹם אֲנִי וְאַתֶּם.
human_translation: asked Rabbi Eliezer: became ill, what is carry it on his shoulder? He said to them: That can carry me and you, the one sending became ill, what is they send it with someone else? He said to them I and you shall be in peace,
llm_translation: They asked Rabbi Eliezer: He is sick, what should one do to carry him on his shoulder? He said to them: He can carry me and you. If he sends him, what should one do to send him with another? He said to them: Be in peace, me and you.

hebrew_text: דְּחָפוֹ וְלֹא מֵת, מַהוּ שֶׁיֵּרֵד אַחֲרָיו וִימִיתֶנּוּ? אָמַר לָהֶם: ״כֵּן יֹאבְדוּ כׇל אוֹיְבֶיךָ ה׳״. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: חָלָה — מַרְכִּיבוֹ עַל כְּתֵפוֹ, חָלָה מְשַׁלְּחוֹ — יְשַׁלְּחֶנּוּ בְּיַד אַחֵר. דְּחָפוֹ וְלֹא מֵת — יֵרֵד אַחֲרָיו וִימִיתֶנּוּ.
human_translation: If he pushed and it did not die what is he should follow it down and kill it? He said to them: “So may all your enemies perish, Lord” the Sages say: became ill, carries it on his shoulder. If the one sending out became ill, he sends with someone else. If he pushes it and it does not die, he follows it down and kills it.
llm_translation: He pushed him and he did not die, what should one do if he goes after him and kills him? He said to them: "So may all your enemies perish, O Lord." And the sages say: If he fell ill - he should carry him on his shoulders, if he fell ill and sent him - he should send him with another. He pushed him and he did not die - he should go after him and kill him.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: פְּלוֹנִי, מַהוּ לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא? אָמַר לָהֶם לֹא שְׁאֶלְתּוּנִי אֶלָּא עַל פְּלוֹנִי.
human_translation: They asked Rabbi Eliezer: What is so-and-so, to the World-to-Come? He said to them: You have only asked me about so-and-so,
llm_translation: They asked Rabbi Eliezer: "So-and-so, what is the World to Come?" He said to them, "You did not ask me about so-and-so."

hebrew_text: מַהוּ לְהַצִּיל רוֹעֶה כִּבְשָׂה מִן הָאֲרִי? אָמַר לָהֶם: לֹא שְׁאֶלְתּוּנִי אֶלָּא עַל הַכִּבְשָׂה. מַהוּ לְהַצִּיל הָרוֹעֶה מִן הָאֲרִי? אָמַר לָהֶם: לֹא שְׁאֶלְתּוּנִי אֶלָּא עַל הָרוֹעֶה. מַמְזֵר, מַה הוּא לִירַשׁ? מַהוּ לְיַבֵּם? מַהוּ לָסוּד אֶת בֵּיתוֹ? מַהוּ לָסוּד אֶת קִבְרוֹ?
human_translation: What is a shepherd may save a ewe from a lion He said to them: You have only asked me about the ewe? What is saving the shepherd from the lion He said to them: You have only asked me about the shepherd? What is a mamzer inherits what is perform levirate marriage? What is to plaster one’s house What is to plastering one’s grave?
llm_translation: What is to save a shepherd of sheep from a lion? He said to them: You did not ask me about the shepherd, but about the sheep. What is to save the shepherd from a lion? He said to them: You did not ask me about the shepherd, but about the lion. What is a mamzer, what is for him to inherit? What is for him to perform the duty of levirate marriage? What is to support his household? What is to support his grave?

hebrew_text: לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהִפְלִיגָן בִּדְבָרִים. אֶלָּא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁלֹּא אָמַר דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא שָׁמַע מִפִּי רַבּוֹ מֵעוֹלָם.
human_translation: It was not because he was distancing them with words, Rather, because he never said anything that he did not hear from the mouth of his teacher.
llm_translation: Not because he disagreed in matters. Rather, because he did not say anything that he did not hear from the mouth of his teacher ever.

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלָה אִשָּׁה חֲכָמָה אֶת רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: מֵאַחַר שֶׁמַּעֲשֵׂה הָעֵגֶל שָׁוִין, מִפְּנֵי מָה אֵין מִיתָתָן שָׁוָה? אָמַר לָהּ: אֵין חׇכְמָה לָאִשָּׁה אֶלָּא בְּפֶלֶךְ, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְכׇל אִשָּׁה חַכְמַת לֵב בְּיָדֶיהָ טָווּ״.
human_translation: A wise woman asked Rabbi Eliezer: Since equal incident of the Calf, due to what their deaths not equal? He said to her: There is no wisdom in a woman except with a spindle, and so it states: “And any woman who was wise-hearted spun with her hands”
llm_translation: A woman wise asked Rabbi Eliezer: "After the incident of the Golden Calf, why is their death not equal?" He said to her: "Wisdom is not fitting for a woman except in spinning, as it says: 'And every wise-hearted woman spun with her hands.'"

hebrew_text: אִיתְּמַר, רַב וְלֵוִי. חַד אָמַר: זִיבֵּחַ וְקִיטֵּר — בְּסַיִיף. גִּפֵּף וְנִישֵּׁק — בְּמִיתָה. שָׂמַח בִּלְבָבוֹ — בְּהִדְרוֹקָן.
human_translation: it was stated Rav and Levi One said: sacrificed and burned by the sword. embraced and kissed death who rejoiced inwardly by hidrokan .
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav and Levi. One said: If one slaughters and offers incense - by sword. If one slaps and kisses - by death. If one rejoices in his heart - by strangulation.

hebrew_text: וְחַד אָמַר: עֵדִים וְהַתְרָאָה — בְּסַיִיף, עֵדִים בְּלֹא הַתְרָאָה — בְּמִיתָה, לֹא עֵדִים וְלֹא הַתְרָאָה — בְּהִדְרוֹקָן.
human_translation: And one said: witnesses and warning by the sword. witnesses without warning death without witnesses and without warning by hidrokan .
llm_translation: And one said: Witnesses and warning - by sword, witnesses without warning - by death, neither witnesses nor warning - by strangulation.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שִׁבְטוֹ שֶׁל לֵוִי לֹא עָבַד עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעֲמוֹד מֹשֶׁה בְּשַׁעַר הַמַּחֲנֶה וְגוֹ׳״.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said: The tribe of Levi did not engage in idol worship, as it is stated: “Then Moses stood in the gate of the camp,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: The tribe of Levi did not perform foreign service, as it is stated: "And Moses stood at the gate of the camp, etc."

hebrew_text: יָתֵיב רָבִינָא וְקָאָמַר לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא. אֵיתִיבֵיהּ בְּנֵי רַב פָּפָּא בַּר אַבָּא לְרָבִינָא: ״הָאוֹמֵר לְאָבִיו וּלְאִמּוֹ לֹא רְאִיתִיו״.
human_translation: Ravina sat and related this halakha The sons of Rav Pappa bar Abba raised an objection to Ravina: “Who said of his father and of his mother: I have not seen him,
llm_translation: Ravina was sitting and saying this teaching. The sons of Rav Papa bar Abba raised an objection to Ravina: "One who says to his father and mother, 'I have not seen him.'"

hebrew_text: ״אָבִיו״ — אֲבִי אִמּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, ״אֶחָיו״ — אֶחָיו מֵאִמּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, ״בָּנָיו״ — בְּנֵי בִתּוֹ מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: “His father” his mother’s father, Israelite. “his brothers” his brothers from his mother, by an Israelite. “His sons” his daughter’s sons from an Israelite,
llm_translation: "His father" - his father from Israel, "his brothers" - his brothers from his mother from Israel, "his sons" - the sons of his daughter from Israel.

hebrew_text: וְכֶבֶשׁ עָשׂוּ לוֹ כּוּ׳. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לֹא בָּבְלִיִּים הָיוּ, אֶלָּא אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיִּים הָיוּ. וּמִתּוֹךְ שֶׁשּׂוֹנְאִים אֶת הַבָּבְלִיִּים הָיוּ קוֹרִין אוֹתָן עַל שְׁמָן. תַּנְיָא רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: לֹא בָּבְלִיִּים הָיוּ, אֶלָּא אֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרִיִּים הָיוּ. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: תָּנוּחַ דַּעְתְּךָ, שֶׁהִנַּחְתָּ אֶת דַּעְתִּי.
human_translation: they made a ramp for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: They were not Babylonians, rather they were Alexandrians And since they hate the Babylonians, they would call by their name it was taught Rabbi Yehuda says: They were not Babylonians, rather they were Alexandrians. Rabbi Yosei, said to him: May your mind be at ease, since you have put my mind at ease.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And they made for him a calf." Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: They were not Babylonians, rather they were Alexandrians. And because they hated the Babylonians, they would call them by their name. It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi Yehuda says: They were not Babylonians, rather they were Alexandrians. Rabbi Yosei said to him: Let your mind be at ease, for you have put my mind at ease.

hebrew_text: טוֹל וָצֵא. תָּנָא: מָה שָׁהֵי צָפִירָא דֵּין, וְחוֹבֵי דָרָא סַגִּיאִין.
human_translation: Take and go. taught Why does this goat remain with the many sins of the generation;
llm_translation: Take and go out. It was taught: What is the meaning of "the morning star is his sign," and "the heights of the hills are his"?

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ מִיַּקִּירֵי יְרוּשָׁלַיִם הָיוּ מְלַוִּין אוֹתוֹ עַד סוּכָּה הָרִאשׁוֹנָה. עֶשֶׂר סוּכּוֹת מִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְעַד צוּק,
human_translation: from the prominent of Jerusalem would escort until the first booth. ten booths from Jerusalem to the cliff,
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: From the walls of Jerusalem they would accompany him until the first Sukkah. Ten Sukkot from Jerusalem to Tzuk.

hebrew_text: תִּשְׁעִים רִיס, שִׁבְעָה וּמֶחֱצָה לְכׇל מִיל. עַל כׇּל סוּכָּה וְסוּכָּה אוֹמְרִין לוֹ: הֲרֵי מָזוֹן, וַהֲרֵי מַיִם. וּמְלַוִּין אוֹתוֹ מִסּוּכָּה לְסוּכָּה, חוּץ מֵאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבָּהֶן, שֶׁאֵינוֹ מַגִּיעַ עִמּוֹ לַצּוּק, אֶלָּא עוֹמֵד מֵרָחוֹק וְרוֹאֶה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו.
human_translation: ninety ris seven and a half for each mil , At each and every booth, say to him: Here is food; here is water, And they escort him from booth to booth, except for the last who does not reach the cliff with him. Rather, he stands from a distance and observes his actions
llm_translation: Ninety reeds, seven and a half for each Mil. For every Sukkah, they say to him: Here is food, and here are water. And they accompany him from one Sukkah to another, except for the last one, which does not reach with him to the boundary, but stands from afar and observes his actions.

hebrew_text: מֶה הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה? חוֹלֵק לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית חֶצְיוֹ קָשׁוּר בַּסֶּלַע, וְחֶצְיוֹ קָשׁוּר בֵּין שְׁנֵי קַרְנָיו. וּדְחָפוֹ לַאֲחוֹרָיו, וְהוּא מִתְגַּלְגֵּל וְיוֹרֵד. וְלֹא הָיָה מַגִּיעַ לַחֲצִי הָהָר עַד שֶׁנַּעֲשֶׂה אֵבָרִים אֵבָרִים. בָּא וְיָשַׁב לוֹ תַּחַת סוּכָּה אַחֲרוֹנָה עַד שֶׁתֶּחְשַׁךְ. וּמֵאֵימָתַי מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים — מִשֶּׁיֵּצֵא חוּץ לְחוֹמַת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִשְּׁעַת דְּחִיָּיתוֹ לַצּוּק.
human_translation: What did do He divided a strip of crimson half tied to the rock, and half of it tied between the two horns And he pushed the goat backward, and it rolls and descends. And it would not reach halfway the mountain until it was limb limb. came and sat under the last booth until it grows dark And from what point are the garments rendered impure, From he emerges outside the wall of Jerusalem. Rabbi Shimon says: from the moment that he pushes from the cliff.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What was he doing? He divided a tongue of Zehorit, half of it tied to the rock, and half of it tied between its two horns. And he pushed it backwards, and it rolled down. And it did not reach halfway up the mountain until it became limb by limb. He came and sat under the last booth until it darkened. And from when do garments become unclean? From when they go out beyond the wall of Jerusalem. Rabbi Shimon says: From the time of its pushing to the cliff.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֶשֶׂר סוּכּוֹת, וּשְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מִילִין הָיוּ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: תֵּשַׁע סוּכּוֹת, וַעֲשָׂרָה מִילִין. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: חָמֵשׁ סוּכּוֹת, וַעֲשָׂרָה מִילִין הָיוּ. וְכוּלָּן עַל יְדֵי עֵירוּב.
human_translation: The Sages taught: There ten booths, and twelve mil ; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: nine booths and ten mil . Rabbi Yosei says: five booths and ten mil , and all of them by a joining
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Ten sukkot, and twelve milin were there, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Nine sukkot, and ten milin. Rabbi Yosei says: Five sukkot, and ten milin were there. And all of them were through an eruv.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: סָח לִי אֶלְעָזָר בְּנִי: אִם עַל יְדֵי עֵירוּב — יָכוֹלְנִי לַעֲשׂוֹת אֲפִילּוּ שְׁתֵּי סוּכּוֹת וַעֲשָׂרָה מִילִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: Elazar my son told me: If by an eiruv , I could even make two booths ten mil .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: "Elazar my son told me: If by way of an eruv — I am able to make even two sukkot and ten mil."

hebrew_text: כְּמַאן אָזְלָא הָא דְּתַנְיָא: חוּץ מֵאַחֲרוֹן שֶׁבָּהֶן שֶׁלֹּא הִגִּיעַ עִמּוֹ לַצּוּק אֶלָּא עוֹמֵד מֵרָחוֹק וְרוֹאֶה אֶת מַעֲשָׂיו, כְּמַאן כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר.
human_translation: In accordance with whose that which was taught except for the last who did not reach the cliff with him; rather, he stands from a distance and observes his actions? In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: As to where did he go? This is like what is taught: Except for the last ones among them who did not reach the narrow place with him, but stood from afar and observed his actions, this is like Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: עַל כׇּל סוּכָּה וְסוּכָּה אוֹמְרִים לוֹ: הֲרֵי מָזוֹן וַהֲרֵי מַיִם. תָּנָא: מֵעוֹלָם לֹא הוּצְרַךְ אָדָם לְכָךְ, אֶלָּא שֶׁאֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ, לְמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ.
human_translation: At each and every booth say to him: Here is food; here is water, taught: No man ever needed this However, because one who has bread in his basket is not similar to one who does not have bread in his basket.
llm_translation: On every Sukkah and Sukkah they say to him: "Here is food and here are water." It was taught: A person never needed this, but rather to show that one who has bread in his basket is not like one who does not have bread in his basket.

hebrew_text: מֶה הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה — חוֹלֵק לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית. וְנִקְטְרֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ בְּסֶלַע? כֵּיוָן דְּמִצְוָה בְּשָׂעִיר, דִּילְמָא קָדֵים וּמַלְבִּין וּמִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: What did do He divided a strip of crimson Let him tie the whole to the rock. Since it is a mitzva the goat perhaps it would turn white quickly, and his mind would be eased
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What was he doing? — He was dividing the language of Zehorit. And he would burn it all in a rock? Since it is a commandment with a goat, perhaps he would precede and mix and his mind would be settled.

hebrew_text: וְנִקְטְרֵיהּ כּוּלֵּיהּ בֵּין קַרְנָיו? זִמְנִין דְּגָמֵישׁ לֵיהּ לְרֵישֵׁיהּ, וְלָאו אַדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: let him tie the whole between horns. Sometimes the goat turns its head and will not know
llm_translation: "And its entire incense was between its horns? Sometimes he would bring it close to its head, and sometimes not."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ קוֹשְׁרִין לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית עַל פֶּתַח הָאוּלָם מִבַּחוּץ, הִלְבִּין — הָיוּ שְׂמֵחִין, לֹא הִלְבִּין — הָיוּ עֲצֵבִין וּמִתְבַּיְּישִׁין. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיִּהְיוּ קוֹשְׁרִין עַל פֶּתַח אוּלָם מִבִּפְנִים. וַעֲדַיִין הָיוּ מְצִיצִין וְרוֹאִין, הִלְבִּין — הָיוּ שְׂמֵחִין, לֹא הִלְבִּין — הָיוּ עֲצֵבִין. הִתְקִינוּ שֶׁיִּהְיוּ קוֹשְׁרִין אוֹתוֹ חֶצְיוֹ בְּסֶלַע וְחֶצְיוֹ בֵּין קַרְנָיו.
human_translation: The Sages taught: At first they would tie strip of crimson to the opening of the Entrance Hall on the outside. turned white they would rejoice, it did not turn white they would be sad and ashamed. they established that they should tie to the opening of the Entrance Hall on the inside, And would still peek and see: it turned white, they would rejoice, it did not turn white they would be sad. established that they should tie half of to the rock and half of it between horns,
llm_translation: The sages taught: Initially, they would tie a thread of crimson wool on the entrance of the hall from the outside; if it turned white, they would rejoice, if not, they would be distressed and embarrassed. They then instituted that they should tie it on the entrance of the hall from the inside. Yet, they would still peek and see; if it turned white, they would rejoice, if not, they would be distressed. They then instituted that they should tie half of it on the rock and half of it between its horns.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי נַחוּם בַּר פָּפָּא מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַקַּפָּר: בָּרִאשׁוֹנָה הָיוּ קוֹשְׁרִין לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית עַל פֶּתַח אוּלָם מִבִּפְנִים, וְכֵיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ שָׂעִיר לַמִּדְבָּר הָיָה מַלְבִּין, וְיָדְעוּ שֶׁנַּעֲשֵׂית מִצְוָתוֹ. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם יִהְיוּ חֲטָאֵיכֶם כַּשָּׁנִים כַּשֶּׁלֶג יַלְבִּינוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Naḥum bar Pappa said in the name of Rabbi Elazar HaKappar: At first they would tie the strip of crimson to the opening of the Entrance Hall on the inside, and when the goat reached the wilderness, would turn white, and they knew that the mitzva was fulfilled. is stated: “Though your sins be as scarlet, they will become white as snow;
llm_translation: Rabbi Nahum son of Papa said in the name of Rabbi Elazar HaKappar: Initially, they would tie a thread of crimson wool on the entrance of the Sanctuary from the inside, and once the scapegoat reached the wilderness, it would turn white, and they would know that his command had been fulfilled. As it is stated: "Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow."

hebrew_text: לֹא הָיָה מַגִּיעַ לְמַחֲצִית הָהָר. אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: אוֹתָן אֵבָרִים מַה הֵן בַּהֲנָאָה? רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל. חַד אָמַר: מוּתָּרִין, וְחַד אָמַר: אֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: would not reach halfway the mountain A dilemma was raised before What those limbs? pleasure Rav and Shmuel One said they are permitted and one said they are prohibited.
llm_translation: He did not reach half the mountain. It was asked of them: What are those limbs for benefit? Rav and Shmuel. One said: Permitted, and one said: Forbidden.

hebrew_text: מַאן דְּאָמַר מוּתָּרִין,
human_translation: The one who said they are permitted
llm_translation: The one who said "mutarin,"

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״בַּמִּדְבָּר״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲסוּרִין, דִּכְתִיב: ״גְּזֵירָה״.
human_translation: as it is written: in the wilderness” And the one said are prohibited as it is written, “cut off” [ gezeira ],
llm_translation: Talmudic text: It is written: "in the wilderness." And one who says they are forbidden, it is written: "a decree." English translation: It is written: "in the wilderness." And one who says they are forbidden, it is written: "a decree."

hebrew_text: וּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֲסוּרִין, הַאי ״מִדְבָּר״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״הַמִּדְבָּרָה״, ״הַמִּדְבָּרָה״, ״בַּמִּדְבָּר״ — לְרַבּוֹת נוֹב וְגִבְעוֹן, שִׁילֹה, וּבֵית עוֹלָמִים.
human_translation: And the one said are prohibited, what does he do this wilderness, He needs it for that which was taught “Into the wilderness” “into the wilderness” “in the wilderness” to include Nov and Givon Shiloh, and the eternal Temple.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And one who says they are forbidden, this "midbar," what does he do with it? He needs it for what was taught: "the midbarah," "the midbarah," "in the midbar" - to include Nov and Giv'on, Shiloh, and Beit Olamim.

hebrew_text: וְאִידַּךְ, הַאי ״גְּזֵירָה״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: ״גְּזֵירָה״ — אֵין גְּזֵירָה אֶלָּא חֲתוּכָה. דָּבָר אַחֵר: אֵין גְּזֵירָה אֶלָּא דָּבָר הַמִּתְגַּזֵּר וְיוֹרֵד.
human_translation: And the other, what does he do with this gezeira ? He needs it for that which was taught gezeira : Gezeira nothing other cut. Alternatively, gezeira nothing other something that breaks apart and falls,
llm_translation: And the other opinion, this word "גְּזֵירָה," what does it do? It is necessary for it according to what is taught: "גְּזֵירָה" — it means only a decree. Another explanation: it means only a matter that is cut off and descends.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״גְּזֵירָה״, שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר מַעֲשֵׂה תֹהוּ הוּא, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲנִי ה׳״, אֲנִי ה׳ גְּזַרְתִּיו, וְאֵין לְךָ רְשׁוּת לְהַרְהֵר בָּהֶן.
human_translation: Alternatively, gezeira lest you say is a meaningless act, the verse states: “I am the Lord” I, the Lord, decreed it [ gezartiv ], and you have no right to question it.
llm_translation: Another explanation: "Gezeirah," lest you say it is a matter of chaos, Scripture states: "I am the Lord," I, the Lord, decreed it, and you have no permission to speculate about them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מִסְתַּבְּרָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר מוּתָּרִין, לֹא אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה ״שַׁלַּח״ לְתַקָּלָה.
human_translation: Rava said: It is reasonable in accordance with the one that said are permitted, the Torah did not say: “And send to mishap.
llm_translation: Rava said: It appears as according to the one who says permitted, the Torah did not say "send" for disaster.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״עֲזָאזֵל״ — שֶׁיְּהֵא עַז וְקָשֶׁה. יָכוֹל בַּיִּשּׁוּב, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּמִּדְבָּר״, וּמִנַּיִן שֶׁבְּצוּק? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״גְּזֵירָה״. תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״עֲזָאזֵל״ — קָשֶׁה שֶׁבֶּהָרִים, וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְאֶת אֵילֵי הָאָרֶץ לָקָח״.
