human_translation: The Sages taught: Azazel that should be rough and hard. might in a settled the verse states: “In the wilderness.” And from where that a cliff? The verse states “ gezeira ,” It was taught in another Azazel the hardest mountain, and so it says: “And the mighty [ eilei ] of the land he took away”
llm_translation: The sages taught: "Azazel" - that it should be strong and hard. Could it be in a desolate place? The Torah teaches: "In the wilderness." And how do we know that it should be in a rocky place? The Torah teaches: "A steep area." Another teaching: "Azazel" - the hardest of the mountains, as it says: "And he took the male goats of the land."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: ״עֲזָאזֵל״ — שֶׁמְּכַפֵּר עַל מַעֲשֵׂה עוּזָּא וְעַזָּאֵל.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Azazel it atones for the actions of Uzza and Azael.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: "Azazel" - that atones for the incident of Uzza and Azael.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, ״אֶת מִשְׁפָּטַי תַּעֲשׂוּ״ — דְּבָרִים שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא (לֹא) נִכְתְּבוּ דִּין הוּא שֶׁיִּכָּתְבוּ, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: עֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, וְגִלּוּי עֲרָיוֹת, וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים, וְגָזֵל, וּבִרְכַּת הַשֵּׁם.
human_translation: The Sages taught “You shall do My ordinances, matters that, had they not been written, logical that they be written. They are idol worship, prohibited sexual relations, bloodshed, theft, and blessing God,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "You shall perform My statutes" - matters that if they were not written as law, it would be necessary to write them, and these are they: idolatry, forbidden sexual relations, murder, theft, and blessing the Name.

hebrew_text: ״אֶת חוּקּוֹתַי תִּשְׁמְרוּ״ — דְּבָרִים שֶׁהַשָּׂטָן מֵשִׁיב עֲלֵיהֶן, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: אֲכִילַת חֲזִיר, וּלְבִישַׁת שַׁעַטְנֵז, וַחֲלִיצַת יְבָמָה, וְטׇהֳרַת מְצוֹרָע, וְשָׂעִיר הַמִּשְׁתַּלֵּחַ. וְשֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר מַעֲשֵׂה תוֹהוּ הֵם, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֲנִי ה׳״, אֲנִי ה׳ חֲקַקְתִּיו, וְאֵין לְךָ רְשׁוּת לְהַרְהֵר בָּהֶן.
human_translation: And you shall keep my statutes, matters that Satan challenge They are: eating pork; wearing diverse kinds ḥalitza a yevama , the purification of the leper; and the scapegoat. And lest you say these are meaningless acts, the verse states: “I am the Lord” I am the Lord, I decreed these and you have no right to doubt them.
llm_translation: "Guard His statutes" - matters that the Satan challenges, and these are they: eating pork, wearing shaatnez, levirate marriage, purification of the leper, and the scapegoat. And lest you say they are meaningless, Scripture teaches: "I am the Lord," I, the Lord, have decreed them, and you have no permission to speculate about them.

hebrew_text: אֵימָתַי מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַמְשַׁלֵּחַ מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים, וְאֵין הַשּׁוֹלֵחַ אֶת הַמְשַׁלֵּחַ מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים.
human_translation: what point the garments rendered impure. The Sages taught The garments of the one who dispatches are rendered impure, but the garments of the one who dispatches the dispatcher, are not rendered impure.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: When does one become impure through garments? The Rabbis taught: One who sends garments becomes impure through them, but the sender of the sender does not become impure through them.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל מִשֶּׁיֵּצֵא חוּץ לְחוֹמַת עֲזָרָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״הַמְשַׁלֵּחַ״. אִי ״הַמְשַׁלֵּחַ״, יָכוֹל עַד שֶׁיַּגִּיעַ לַצּוּק — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהַמְשַׁלֵּחַ״. הָא כֵּיצַד: מִשֶּׁיֵּצֵא חוּץ לְחוֹמַת יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה.
human_translation: might he leaves the wall of the courtyard the verse states: “He that dispatched” if He that dispatched, might until he reaches the cliff. the verse states: “And he that dispatched,” How is this when he emerged outside the wall of Jerusalem. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Yachol misheshetzei chutz lechomat azarah - Talmud lomar: 'hameshalei'." Ei 'hameshalei', yachol ad sheyagiya la'tzuk - Talmud lomar: 'vehameshalei'. Ha keitzad: misheshetzei chutz lechomat Yerushalayim, divrei Rabbi Yehudah. English translation: One might have thought he is liable from when he exits beyond the wall of the Temple courtyard - the Torah teaches the phrase "the one who sends." If it were only "the one who sends," one might have thought he is liable until he reaches the rock - the Torah teaches the phrase "and the one who sends." How so? From when he exits beyond the wall of Jerusalem, these are the words of Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: ״עֲזָאזֵל וְכִבֶּס״ — עַד שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לַצּוּק. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: ״וְהַמְשַׁלֵּחַ אֶת הַשָּׂעִיר לַעֲזָאזֵל יְכַבֵּס בְּגָדָיו״, זוֹרְקוֹ בְּבַת רֹאשׁ וּמְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says Azazel shall wash” until he has reached the cliff. Rabbi Shimon says: “And he that dispatched the goat to Azazel shall wash his clothes” he throws it headlong his garments are rendered impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "Azazel and wash" - until he reached the cliff. Rabbi Shimon says: "And the one who sends the goat to Azazel should wash his clothes," he throws it off a cliff and renders the clothes impure.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ בָּא לוֹ אֵצֶל פַּר וְשָׂעִיר הַנִּשְׂרָפִין, קְרָעָן, וְהוֹצִיא אֶת אֵימוּרֵיהֶן, נְתָנָן בְּמָגֵיס וְהִקְטִירָן עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: he came next to the bull and the goat that were to be burned. He tore their and removed the portions and placed them in a large bowl [ magis ] and burned them on the altar.
llm_translation: He taught: If one came to the bull and the goat that are to be burned, he tears them and takes out their portions, places them in a pan, and burns them on the top of the altar.

hebrew_text: קְלָעָן בְּמִקְלָעוֹת וְהוֹצִיאָן לְבֵית הַשְּׂרֵיפָה. וּמֵאֵימָתַי מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים — מִשֶּׁיֵּצְאוּ חוּץ לְחוֹמַת הָעֲזָרָה. רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: מִשֶּׁיַּצִּית הָאוּר בְּרוּבָּן.
human_translation: He interwove into braids took them out to the place burning, And at what point do the render garments impure, from that they emerged outside the wall of the courtyard. Rabbi Shimon says: from that the fire has ignited in most of
llm_translation: They may fold in the folds and take them out to the house of burning. And from when do garments become impure? - From when they go out beyond the wall of the Azarah. Rabbi Shimon says: From when the light is extinguished in their majority.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ ״וְהִקְטִירָן״ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: לְהַקְטִירָן עַל גַּבֵּי מִזְבֵּחַ.
human_translation: Would it enter your mind he burned them? Rather, say to burn them on the altar
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Gemar 'vehiktiran' sakla da'tach? Ela eima: lehaktiran al gabei mizbeach." English translation: "Is it the end when it says 'and he shall burn them'? Rather say: to burn them upon the altar."

hebrew_text: ״קְלָעָן בְּמִקְלָעוֹת״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כְּמִין קְלִיעָה. תָּנָא: לֹא הָיָה מְנַתְּחָן נִיתּוּחַ בְּשַׂר עוֹלָה, אֶלָּא עוֹר עַל גַּבֵּי בָּשָׂר. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? דְּתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן עוֹר וּבָשָׂר וָפֶרֶשׁ, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן עוֹר וּבָשָׂר וָפֶרֶשׁ,
human_translation: interwove into braids Rabbi Yoḥanan said: like a braid, It was taught: He would not dissect dissection of the flesh of a burnt-offering, Rather, skin on top of the flesh From where are these matters As it was taught Rabbi says: It is stated here skin and flesh and dung and it is stated below, skin and flesh and dung
llm_translation: "Kela'an b'mikla'ot." Amar Rabbi Yochanan: k'min k'li'ah. Tana: lo hayah menatchan nituchah b'sar olah, ela or al gabei basar. Menah hanei milei? Detanya: Rabbi omer: ne'emar kan or u'basar va'peresh, v'ne'emar lehallan or u'basar va'peresh.

hebrew_text: מָה לְהַלָּן, עַל יְדֵי נִיתּוּחַ וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי הֶפְשֵׁט, אַף כָּאן, עַל יְדֵי נִיתּוּחַ וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי הֶפְשֵׁט.
human_translation: Just as below by means of dissection and not by means of skinning, so too here by means of dissection and not by means of skinning.
llm_translation: There, through analysis and not through simple interpretation, so too here, through analysis and not through simple interpretation.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְקִרְבּוֹ וּפִרְשׁוֹ וְהוֹצִיא״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁמּוֹצִיאוֹ שָׁלֵם. יָכוֹל יִשְׂרְפֶנּוּ שָׁלֵם? נֶאֱמַר כָּאן: ״רֹאשׁוֹ וּכְרָעָיו״, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן: (״רֹאשׁ וּכְרָעַיִם״), מָה לְהַלָּן עַל יְדֵי נִיתּוּחַ, אַף כָּאן עַל יְדֵי נִיתּוּחַ.
human_translation: And there, from where do we As it was taught and its innards, and its dung, shall he carry teaches that he brings it out whole. might that he should burn it whole. It is stated here: Its head and its legs, and it is stated there, head and legs. Just as there, by means of dissection, so too here it is by means of dissection.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And there, how do we know? For it was taught: "And they shall bring it and its parts and present it" — this teaches that one must present it whole. Could it be that one should burn it whole? It is stated here: "Its head and its legs," and it is stated elsewhere: ("Its head and its legs"), just as there it is by way of dismemberment, so too here it is by way of dismemberment.

hebrew_text: אִי מָה לְהַלָּן עַל יְדֵי הֶפְשֵׁט, אַף כָּאן עַל יְדֵי הֶפְשֵׁט, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְקִרְבּוֹ וּפִרְשׁוֹ״. מַאי תַּלְמוּדָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁפִּרְשׁוֹ בְּקִרְבּוֹ, כָּךְ בְּשָׂרוֹ בְּעוֹרוֹ.
human_translation: If Just as there, with skinning, so too here with skinning, the verse states “and its innards, and its dung.” What is the derivation Rav Pappa said: Just as its dung is within its innards so too, its flesh is in its skin
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Just as there, by means of interpretation, so too here, by means of interpretation, the Talmud teaches: "And he shall bring it near and lay his hand upon it." What is the interpretation? Rav Papa said: Just as he separated it within its proximity, so too his flesh within his skin.

hebrew_text: מֵאֵימָתַי מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״יוֹצִיא אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה וְשָׂרְפוּ״.
human_translation: at what point the render the garments impure. The Sages taught shall be taken outside the camp and they shall burn”
llm_translation: From when do garments become impure? The Sages taught: "He shall take it outside the camp and burn it."

hebrew_text: לְהַלָּן אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לָהֶם שָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת, וְכָאן אַתָּה נוֹתֵן לָהֶם מַחֲנֶה אַחַת? אִם כֵּן לָמָּה נֶאֱמַר ״מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״, לוֹמַר לָךְ: כֵּיוָן שֶׁיָּצָא חוּץ לְמַחֲנֶה אַחַת — מְטַמְּאִים בְּגָדִים.
human_translation: Below, you give them three camps, And here you give them one camp, If so, why is it stated: “Outside the camp”? to say to you: Once it has left one camp renders the garments impure.
llm_translation: There, you give them three camps, and here you give them one camp? If so, why does it say "outside the camp," to tell you: once he goes outside one camp - garments become impure.

hebrew_text: וְהָתָם מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא: ״וְהוֹצִיא אֶת כׇּל הַפָּר״ — חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת.
human_translation: And there, from where do we As it was taught “Even the whole bull shall he carry outside outside of three camps.
llm_translation: And there, do we establish for ourselves? For it was taught: "And he shall bring out the entire bull" - outside the three camps.

hebrew_text: אַתָּה אוֹמֵר חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ אֶלָּא חוּץ לְמַחֲנֶה אַחַת? כְּשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר בְּפַר הָעֵדָה ״אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״וְשָׂרַף אוֹתוֹ כַּאֲשֶׁר שָׂרַף אֵת הַפָּר הָרִאשׁוֹן״, וּמָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֶל מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ — לִיתֵּן לוֹ מַחֲנֶה שְׁנִיָּה.
human_translation: you say outside of three camps, or is outside of only one camp? When it says the bull the community: outside the camp” as no the verse to state since it was already stated: “And burn it as he burned the first bull” And what the verse states outside the camp? To give it a second camp,
llm_translation: You say outside of three camps, or is it only outside of one camp? When it says in the case of the Red Heifer, "outside the camp," there is no need for the teaching, for it is already stated, "and he shall burn it as he burned the first bull." So why does it need to say "outside the camp" - to give it a second camp.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁהוּא אוֹמֵר ״מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ בַּדֶּשֶׁן, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר, שֶׁהֲרֵי כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״אֶל שֶׁפֶךְ הַדֶּשֶׁן״, תֵּן לוֹ מַחֲנֶה שְׁלִישִׁית.
human_translation: And when it says: “Outside the camp” ash, as no the verse to state since it was already stated where the ashes are poured out give it a third camp,
llm_translation: "And when he says 'outside the camp' in the ash, that there is no need to say, for it has already been stated: 'onto the ash heap,' give him a third camp."

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, הַאי ״מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ לְכִדְתַנְיָא: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן ״מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״ וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן ״מִחוּץ לַמַּחֲנֶה״, מָה כָּאן חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת, אַף לְהַלָּן חוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת. וּמָה לְהַלָּן בְּמִזְרָחָהּ שֶׁל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם — אַף כָּאן בְּמִזְרָחָהּ שֶׁל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם.
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Shimon do with outside the camp, He needs it for that which was taught Rabbi Eliezer says: It is stated here, outside the camp, and it is stated there, “outside the camp” Just as here, outside three camps, so too there outside three camps. And just as there east of Jerusalem, so too here east of Jerusalem.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said, "What does the phrase 'outside the camp' mean? He learns it from what Rabbi Eliezer taught: It is stated here 'outside the camp' and it is stated there 'outside the camp.' Just as here it is outside the three camps, so too there it is outside the three camps. And just as there it is in the east of Jerusalem, so too here it is in the east of Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן, הֵיכָא שָׂרֵיף לְהוּ? כִּדְתַנְיָא: הֵיכָן נִשְׂרָפִין?
human_translation: And according to the Rabbis, where do they burn them? As it was taught Where are they burned?
llm_translation: The sages, where do we burn them? As it was taught: Where are they burned?

hebrew_text: לִצְפוֹנָהּ שֶׁל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם, וְחוּץ לְשָׁלֹשׁ מַחֲנוֹת. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: אַבֵּית הַדֶּשֶׁן נִשְׂרָפִין.
human_translation: North of Jerusalem, and outside of three camps. Rabbi Yosei says: They are burned in the place of the ashes.
llm_translation: To its north of Jerusalem, and outside of three camps. Rabbi Yosei says: The House of the Ashes is burned.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: מַאן תְּנָא דִּפְלִיג עֲלֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי — רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב הוּא. דְּתַנְיָא: ״אֶל שֶׁפֶךְ הַדֶּשֶׁן יִשָּׂרֵף״, שֶׁיְּהֵא לְשֵׁם דֶּשֶׁן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: שֶׁיְּהֵא מְקוֹמוֹ מְשׁוּפָּךְ.
human_translation: Rava said: Who is tanna who disagrees with Rabbi Yosei It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as it was taught “Where the ashes are poured out [ shefekh hadeshen ] shall it be burned” that there shall be ash there Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: that its place should be slanted [ meshupakh ]
llm_translation: Rava said: Who is the Tanna that disputes with regard to the statement of Rabbi Yosei? It is Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. As it was taught: "But the fat of the ashes shall be burned," that it should be for the sake of the ashes. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: that its place should be swept away.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: וְדִילְמָא בִּמְקוֹמוֹ מְשׁוּפָּךְ הוּא דִּפְלִיגִי.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: perhaps they disagree about whether the place must be slanted.
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye: "And perhaps in its place it is poured out, that is the point of their dispute."

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וְהַשּׂוֹרֵף״ — הַשּׂוֹרֵף מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים וְלֹא הַמַּצִּית אֶת הָאוּר וְלֹא הַמְסַדֵּר אֶת הַמַּעֲרָכָה. וְאֵי זֶהוּ הַשּׂוֹרֵף? זֶה הַמְסַיֵּיעַ בִּשְׁעַת שְׂרֵיפָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: “And he who burns garments who burns are rendered impure, but not who kindles the fire, and not who arranges the pile And who is the one who burns? It is the one who assists at the time of burning.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the one who burns" - the one who burns renders garments impure, but did not ignite the light and did not arrange the pyre. And who is the one who burns? This is one who assists at the time of burning.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל אַף מִשֶּׁנַּעֲשׂוּ אֵפֶר מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אוֹתָם״, אוֹתָם מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים, וְלֹא מִשֶּׁנַּעֲשׂוּ אֵפֶר מְטַמְּאִין בְּגָדִים. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: הַפָּר מְטַמֵּא, נִיתַּךְ הַבָּשָׂר אֵינוֹ מְטַמֵּא בְּגָדִים.
human_translation: might garments would be rendered impure even become ash. the verse states: Them, they render garments impure, but they do not render garments impure once they become ash. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: The bull causes ritual impurity the flesh is burned it no longer renders garments impure.
llm_translation: One might have thought that even when they have turned into ashes, they render garments unclean. The Scripture teaches: "them" - they render garments unclean, but not when they have turned into ashes. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: The bull renders unclean; its flesh, when poured out, does not render garments unclean.

hebrew_text: מַאי בֵּינַיְיהוּ? אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ דְּשַׁוְּיֵהּ חֲרוֹכָא.
human_translation: What is between the There is between them when he turned it into a charred
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them that is like a needle.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אָמְרוּ לוֹ לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל: הִגִּיעַ שָׂעִיר לַמִּדְבָּר. וּמִנַּיִין הָיוּ יוֹדְעִין שֶׁהִגִּיעַ שָׂעִיר לַמִּדְבָּר? דִּירְכָּאוֹת הָיוּ עוֹשִׂין וּמְנִיפִין בְּסוּדָרִין. וְיוֹדְעִין שֶׁהִגִּיעַ שָׂעִיר לַמִּדְבָּר.
human_translation: They said to the High Priest: The goat has reached the wilderness. And how did they know that the goat reached the wilderness? They would build platforms [ dirkaot ] and wave scarves [ sudarin ] And they knew that the goat reached the wilderness.
llm_translation: They taught him to the High Priest: "The goat has reached the wilderness." And from where did they know that the goat had reached the wilderness? They would make pathways and wave with handkerchiefs. And they knew that the goat had reached the wilderness.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וַהֲלֹא סִימָן גָּדוֹל הָיָה לָהֶם: מִירוּשָׁלַיִם וְעַד בֵּית חֲדוֹדוֹ, שְׁלֹשָׁה מִילִין, הוֹלְכִין מִיל וְחוֹזְרִין מִיל, וְשׁוֹהִין כְּדֵי מִיל וְיוֹדְעִין שֶׁהִגִּיעַ שָׂעִיר לַמִּדְבָּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Didn’t they have a reliable indicator? From Jerusalem to Beit Ḥiddudo, three mil . walked a mil and returned a mil , and waited equivalent a mil , they knew that the goat reached the wilderness.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said, "But didn't they have a great sign: from Jerusalem to Beit Chadodo, a distance of three mil, they would walk one mil and return one mil, and measure a mil, and know that the goat had reached the wilderness."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל אוֹמֵר: וַהֲלֹא סִימָן אַחֵר הָיָה לָהֶם: לָשׁוֹן שֶׁל זְהוֹרִית הָיָה קָשׁוּר עַל פִּתְחוֹ שֶׁל הֵיכָל, וּכְשֶׁהִגִּיעַ שָׂעִיר לַמִּדְבָּר הָיָה הַלָּשׁוֹן מַלְבִּין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם יִהְיוּ חֲטָאֵיכֶם כַּשָּׁנִים כַּשֶּׁלֶג יַלְבִּינוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: Didn’t they have a different indicator? There was a strip of crimson tied to the entrance to the Sanctuary, and when goat reached the wilderness the strip would turn white, as it is stated: “Though your sins be as scarlet, they will become white as snow”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: But did they not have another sign? The language of Zehorit was tied to the entrance of the sanctuary, and when the goat reached the desert, the language became white, as it is stated: "Though your sins be as scarlet, they shall be as white as snow."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בֵּית חֲדוֹדוֹ בַּמִּדְבָּר קָיְימָא, וְהָא קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּקָסָבַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה: כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ שָׂעִיר לַמִּדְבָּר — נַעֲשֵׂית מִצְוָתוֹ.
human_translation: Abaye said: Learn from this Beit Ḥiddudo is located in the wilderness, and this teach us that Rabbi Yehuda holds that once the goat has reached the wilderness, its mitzva is complete
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara said Abaye: Hear from it Beit Chadodo in the desert is established, and this it is heard to us that Rabbi Yehuda holds: Once the goat reached the desert - its commandment is fulfilled.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ שְׁנֵי שְׂעִירֵי
llm_translation: We will return to you, two goats.

hebrew_text: בָּא לוֹ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לִקְרוֹת, אִם רָצָה לִקְרוֹת בְּבִגְדֵי בוּץ — קוֹרֵא, וְאִם לָאו — קוֹרֵא בְּאִצְטְלִית לָבָן מִשֶּׁלּוֹ.
human_translation: The High Priest came to read If he wished to read in fine linen garments, he read and if not he read in a white robe of his own,
llm_translation: A High Priest came to read, if he wants to read in linen garments - he reads, and if not - he reads in his own white tunic.

hebrew_text: חַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת נוֹטֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה, וְנוֹתְנוֹ לְרֹאשׁ הַכְּנֶסֶת, וְרֹאשׁ הַכְּנֶסֶת נוֹתְנוֹ לַסְּגָן, וְהַסְּגָן נוֹתְנוֹ לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל עוֹמֵד וּמְקַבֵּל, וְקוֹרֵא בְּ״אַחֲרֵי מוֹת״ וְ״אַךְ בֶּעָשׂוֹר״, וְגוֹלֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וּמַנִּיחוֹ בְּחֵיקוֹ וְאוֹמֵר: יוֹתֵר מִמַּה שֶּׁקָּרָאתִי לִפְנֵיכֶם כָּתוּב כָּאן. ״וּבֶעָשׂוֹר״ שֶׁבְּחוֹמֶשׁ הַפְּקוּדִים קוֹרֵא עַל פֶּה.
human_translation: The synagogue attendant takes a Torah scroll and gives it to the head of the synagogue and the head of the synagogue gives it to the deputy and the Deputy gives it to the High Priest, and the High Priest stands and receives And he reads “After the death” and “But on the tenth” and furls the Torah scroll and places it on his bosom and says: More than what I have read before you is written here. “And on the tenth,” from the book of Numbers he reads by heart.
llm_translation: The cantor of the synagogue takes the Torah scroll, and gives it to the head of the synagogue, and the head of the synagogue gives it to the deputy, and the deputy gives it to the high priest, and the high priest stands and receives it, and reads "Acharei Mot" and "Uve'asor Be'asor," and rolls the Torah scroll and places it in his lap and says: "More than what I have read before you is written here." "Uve'asor" which is in the fifth of the counting, he reads aloud.

hebrew_text: וּמְבָרֵךְ עָלֶיהָ שְׁמוֹנֶה בְּרָכוֹת: עַל הַתּוֹרָה, וְעַל הָעֲבוֹדָה, וְעַל הַהוֹדָאָה, וְעַל מְחִילַת הֶעָוֹן, וְעַל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְעַל יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, וְעַל יְרוּשָׁלַיִם בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וְעַל הַכֹּהֲנִים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, וְעַל שְׁאָר הַתְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: And he recites after eight blessings: Concerning the Torah: and concerning the service: and concerning thanksgiving: and concerning pardon of iniquity: and concerning the Temple in and of itself, and concerning the Jewish People in and of itself, and concerning Jerusalem in and of itself, and concerning the priests in and of themselves, and concerning the rest of the prayer,
llm_translation: And one blesses upon it eight blessings: upon the Torah, and upon the service, and upon thanksgiving, and upon forgiveness of sin, and upon the Temple itself, and upon Israel by themselves, and upon Jerusalem by itself, and upon the priests by themselves, and upon the rest of the prayer.

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל כְּשֶׁהוּא קוֹרֵא — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה פַּר וְשָׂעִיר הַנִּשְׂרָפִין, וְהָרוֹאֶה פַּר וְשָׂעִיר הַנִּשְׂרָפִין — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל כְּשֶׁהוּא קוֹרֵא. וְלֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי, אֶלָּא שֶׁהָיְתָה דֶּרֶךְ רְחוֹקָה, וּמְלֶאכֶת שְׁנֵיהֶן שָׁוָה כְּאַחַת.
human_translation: One who sees the High Priest reading does not see the bull and goat that are burned; and one who sees the bull and goat that are burned does not see the High Priest reading And not due to that one is not permitted but because there was a distant path and performance of both of them simultaneously.
llm_translation: The one who sees the High Priest while he is reading - does not see the bull and the goat that are being burned, and the one who sees the bull and the goat that are being burned - does not see the High Priest while he is reading. And not because he is not permitted, but because it was a distant path, and the work of both of them is equal as one.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ מִדְּקָתָנֵי בְּאִצְטְלִית לָבָן מִשֶּׁלּוֹ, מִכְּלָל דִּקְרִיאָה לָאו עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: From that it is taught in a white robe of his own, by inference reading is not a service,
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive that the white linen garments are from his own funds? From the fact that it is not included in the category of "reading" from the Torah, indicating that it is not considered a form of service.

hebrew_text: וְקָתָנֵי: אִם רָצָה לִקְרוֹת בְּבִגְדֵי בוּץ — קוֹרֵא, שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה נִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן! דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי קְרִיאָה דְּצוֹרֶךְ עֲבוֹדָה הִיא.
human_translation: But teaches: If he wished to read in fine linen garments, he read Learn from this it is permitted to derive benefit from priestly vestments, perhaps reading is different, it is for the purpose of service;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: If one wishes to read the Shema while wearing linen garments - he may read, for perhaps the linen garments were given to derive benefit from them! Perhaps the reading is different because it is necessary for the service.

hebrew_text: דְּאִיבַּעְיָא לַן: בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה נִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן, אוֹ לֹא נִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן.
human_translation: As the dilemma was raised before us: Is it permitted to derive benefit from priestly vestments, or is it not permitted to derive benefit from priestly vestments?
llm_translation: We are inquired: The priestly garments were they given to benefit from them, or were they not given to benefit from them.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לֹא הָיוּ יְשֵׁנִים בְּבִגְדֵי קוֹדֶשׁ. שֵׁינָה הוּא דְּלָא, הָא מֵיכָל — אָכְלִי! דִּילְמָא שָׁאנֵי אֲכִילָה דְּצוֹרֶךְ עֲבוֹדָה הִיא, כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְאָכְלוּ אוֹתָם אֲשֶׁר כּוּפַּר בָּהֶם״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהַכֹּהֲנִים אוֹכְלִים וּבְעָלִים מִתְכַּפְּרִין.
human_translation: Come hear would not sleep in sacred vestments It is sleep which is not but they may eat perhaps eating is different, it is for the purpose of service. As it was taught “And they shall eat those things with which atonement was made” teaches that the priests eat and the owners achieve atonement.
llm_translation: Come and hear: They were not sleeping in holy garments. Sleep is not considered eating, for from the Temple — they may eat! Perhaps eating is different because it is necessary for the service, as it was taught: "And they shall eat those with which atonement was made for them" — this teaches that the priests eat and the owners are atoned for.

hebrew_text: שֵׁינָה הוּא דְּלָא, הָא הַלּוֹכֵי — מְהַלְּכִי! בְּדִין הוּא דְּהַלּוֹכֵי נָמֵי לָא,
human_translation: it is sleep which is not but they may walk by right walking is also not
llm_translation: It is sleep that is not, this these walkers — walking! In judgment it is that these walkers are also not.

hebrew_text: וְסֵיפָא אִיצְטְרִיכָא לֵיהּ: פּוֹשְׁטִין וּמְקַפְּלִין וּמַנִּיחִין תַּחַת רָאשֵׁיהֶם.
human_translation: is needed for the latter clause They remove and fold them and place them under their heads.
llm_translation: And the latter part requires it: they spread out, fold, and place beneath their heads.

hebrew_text: פּוֹשְׁטִין וּמְקַפְּלִין וּמַנִּיחִין אוֹתָן תַּחַת רָאשֵׁיהֶן, שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ בִּגְדֵי כְּהוּנָּה נִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן! אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לָא תֵּימָא תַּחַת רָאשֵׁיהֶן, אֶלָּא אֵימָא כְּנֶגֶד רָאשֵׁיהֶן. אָמַר רַב מְשַׁרְשְׁיָא: שָׁמְעַתְּ מִינַּהּ תְּפִילִּין מִן הַצַּד שַׁפִּיר דָּמֵי.
human_translation: They remove and fold them and place them under their heads. Learn from this it is permitted to derive benefit from priestly vestments. Rav Pappa said: Do not say under their heads rather, say next to their heads. Rav Mesharshiyya said: learn from here phylacteries to the side well;
llm_translation: We spread out and fold them and place them under their heads, have you heard that the priestly garments were given to be enjoyed in them! Rav Papa said: Do not say under their heads, rather say opposite their heads. Rav Mesharshaya said: Have you heard that Tefillin from the side is good, it resembles the head.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא דִּכְנֶגֶד רָאשֵׁיהֶן, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ תַּחַת רָאשֵׁיהֶן, וְתִיפּוֹק לִי מִשּׁוּם כִּלְאַיִם — דְּהָא אִיכָּא אַבְנֵט. וּנְהִי נָמֵי דְּנִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן — הָא מִתְהֲנֵי מִכִּלְאַיִם!
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable that next to their heads as, if it could enter your mind under their heads, and I would derive due to diverse kinds, as there is belt, And even if that it is permitted to derive benefit from deriving benefit from diverse kinds.
llm_translation: So it was established that they are opposite their heads, for if it were to enter your mind that it is beneath their heads, and it would emerge to me because of the kilayim - for there is a belt. And since they were given to them to enjoy them - he enjoys them from the kilayim!

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל זֶה הוּא אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לֹא זֶה הוּא אַבְנֵטוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר!
human_translation: it works out well according to the one who said: The belt of the High Priest is the same as the belt of a common priest. However, according to the one who said the High Priest’s belt is not the same as the belt of a common priest, what is there to say?
llm_translation: The Gemara: He left it for the one who says that the belt of the High Priest is this, the belt of the ordinary priest. Rather, for the one who says that the belt of the High Priest is not this, the belt of the ordinary priest, what can be said?

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כִּלְאַיִם בִּלְבִישָׁה וְהַעֲלָאָה — הוּא דַּאֲסִיר, בְּהַצָּעָה שְׁרֵי, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״לֹא יַעֲלֶה עָלֶיךָ״, אֲבָל אַתָּה מוּתָּר לְהַצִּיעוֹ תַּחְתֶּיךָ. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: אָסוּר לַעֲשׂוֹת כֵּן, שֶׁמָּא תִּיכָּרֵךְ נִימָא אַחַת עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ.
human_translation: And if you say diverse kinds wearing placing upon oneself is prohibited, but spreading them out is permitted, wasn’t it taught “Neither shall there come upon you But you are permitted to spread it beneath you but the Sages said: It is prohibited to do so, lest a fiber wrap upon his flesh,
llm_translation: And if you will say: "Kil'ayim in clothing and raising up - that is prohibited, in covering it is permitted, and it was taught: 'Do not let it come upon you,' but you are permitted to cover it beneath you. But the sages said: It is forbidden to do so, lest one thread of wool be recognized on his flesh."

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא דְּמַפְסֵיק לֵיהּ מִידֵּי בֵּינֵי בֵּינֵי — וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן פַּזִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי אָמַר רַבִּי מִשּׁוּם קְהָלָא קַדִּישָׁא שֶׁבִּירוּשָׁלַיִם: אֲפִילּוּ עֶשֶׂר מַצָּעוֹת זוֹ עַל גַּב זוֹ וְכִלְאַיִם תַּחְתֵּיהֶן — אָסוּר לִישַׁן עֲלֵיהֶן. אֶלָּא לָאו שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כְּנֶגֶד רָאשֵׁיהֶן, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: And if you say placing a separation between didn’t Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi say Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said Rabbi said in the name of the holy community in Jerusalem: Even ten mattresses one atop the other and diverse kinds underneath them it is prohibited to sleep upon them? Rather, not conclude from next to their heads? Learn from it
llm_translation: And if you will say that one may separate it from in between - but didn't Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi say in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi in the name of Rabbi in the name of the Holy Congregation of Jerusalem: Even if there are ten mattresses, one on top of the other, and two pillows beneath them - it is forbidden to sleep on them. Rather, isn't this the conclusion: opposite their heads, this is the conclusion.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: לְעוֹלָם תַּחַת רָאשֵׁיהֶן, וְהָא קָא מִתְהֲנֵי מִכִּלְאַיִם — בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה קָשִׁין הֵן. כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: הַאי נַמְטָא גַּמְדָּא דְּנַרֶשׁ — שַׁרְיָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: Actually, under their heads. deriving benefit from diverse kinds priestly vestments, are stiff, in accordance with that Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yehoshua, said: This stiff felt [ namta ], in Neresh, is permitted,
llm_translation: Rav Ashe said: Always underneath their heads, and this is what is inferred from the verse "the garments of the priesthood are hard." For this is what Rav Huna, son of Rabbi Yehoshua, said: This folded cloth of the head-turban is permitted.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה, הַיּוֹצֵא בָּהֶן לַמְּדִינָה — אָסוּר. וּבַמִּקְדָּשׁ, בֵּין בִּשְׁעַת עֲבוֹדָה בֵּין שֶׁלֹּא בִּשְׁעַת עֲבוֹדָה — מוּתָּר, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁבִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה נִיתְּנוּ לֵיהָנוֹת בָּהֶן. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Come hear priestly vestments, it is prohibited to go out to the country, wearing them, but in the Temple it is permitted whether during the service or not during the service, due to that it is permitted to derive benefit from priestly vestments. Learn from this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Come and hear: Priestly garments, one who goes out with them to the province — forbidden. And in the Temple, whether during the service or not during the service — permitted, because the priestly garments were given for the purpose of deriving benefit from them. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: וּבַמְּדִינָה לָא? וְהָתַנְיָא: בְּעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה [בְּטֵבֵת] יוֹם הַר גְּרִזִים [הוּא], דְּלָא לְמִסְפַּד?
human_translation: not in the country? Wasn’t it taught The twenty-fifth of Tevet the day of Mount Gerizim, eulogizing not
llm_translation: And in the province not? And it was taught: On the twenty-fifth day of Tevet, Mount Gerizim it is, for not to eulogize?

hebrew_text: יוֹם שֶׁבִּקְּשׁוּ כּוּתִיִּים אֶת בֵּית אֱלֹהֵינוּ מֵאֲלֶכְּסַנְדְּרוֹס מוֹקְדוֹן לְהַחְרִיבוֹ, וְנָתְנוּ לָהֶם. בָּאוּ וְהוֹדִיעוּ אֶת שִׁמְעוֹן הַצַּדִּיק. מֶה עָשָׂה? לָבַשׁ בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה, וְנִתְעַטֵּף בְּבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה, וּמִיַּקִּירֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל עִמּוֹ, וַאֲבוּקוֹת שֶׁל אוֹר בִּידֵיהֶן. וְכׇל הַלַּיְלָה, הַלָּלוּ הוֹלְכִים מִצַּד זֶה, וְהַלָּלוּ הוֹלְכִים מִצַּד זֶה, עַד שֶׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר.
human_translation: day that the Samaritans [ kutim ] requested the House of our Lord from Alexander the Macedonian in order to destroy it, and he gave it to them, came and informed Shimon HaTzaddik, What did he do? He donned the priestly vestments and wrapped himself in the priestly vestments. And the nobles of the Jewish People with him, torches of fire in their hands. And all that night, these, approached from this side, and those, approached from that side, until dawn,
llm_translation: Day that sought Kutiyim the house of our God from Alkisandros Mokedon to destroy it, and they gave to them. Came and informed Shimon the Righteous. What did he do? Wore garments of priesthood, and wrapped himself in garments of priesthood, and leaders of Israel with him, and torches of light in their hands. And all the night, these go from this side, and these go from that side, until rose the morning star.

hebrew_text: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָלָה עַמּוּד הַשַּׁחַר, אָמַר לָהֶם: מִי הַלָּלוּ? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: יְהוּדִים שֶׁמָּרְדוּ בְּךָ. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְאַנְטִיפַּטְרֵס זָרְחָה חַמָּה וּפָגְעוּ זֶה בָּזֶה. כֵּיוָן שֶׁרָאָה לְשִׁמְעוֹן הַצַּדִּיק, יָרַד מִמֶּרְכַּבְתּוֹ וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוָה לְפָנָיו. אָמְרוּ לוֹ: מֶלֶךְ גָּדוֹל כְּמוֹתְךָ יִשְׁתַּחֲוֶה לִיהוּדִי זֶה?! אָמַר לָהֶם: דְּמוּת דְּיוֹקְנוֹ שֶׁל זֶה מְנַצַּחַת לְפָנַי בְּבֵית מִלְחַמְתִּי.
human_translation: When dawn arrived, said to Who are these They said to him: Jews who rebelled against you. When he reached Antipatris, the sun shone and met each other. When saw Shimon HaTzaddik, he descended from his chariot and bowed before him. said to him: an important king such as you bow to this Jew? said to them: the image of this man’s face is victorious before me on my battlefields,
llm_translation: When the pillar of dawn arose, he said to them: "Who are these?" They said to him: "Jews who rebelled against you." When he reached Antipatris, the sun rose and they met each other. When he saw Shimon the Righteous, he descended from his chariot and prostrated himself before him. They said to him: "A great king like you bows to this Jew?!" He said to them: "The likeness of this one's image always precedes me in my battles."

hebrew_text: אָמַר לָהֶם: לָמָּה בָּאתֶם? אָמְרוּ: אֶפְשָׁר בַּיִת שֶׁמִּתְפַּלְּלִים בּוֹ עָלֶיךָ וְעַל מַלְכוּתְךָ שֶׁלֹּא תֶּחְרַב, יַתְעוּךָ גּוֹיִם לְהַחְרִיבוֹ? אָמַר לָהֶם: מִי הַלָּלוּ? אָמְרוּ לוֹ: כּוּתִיִּים הַלָּלוּ, שֶׁעוֹמְדִים לְפָנֶיךָ. אָמַר לָהֶם: הֲרֵי הֵם מְסוּרִין בִּידֵיכֶם.
human_translation: He said Why have you come? They said Is it possible that house in which we pray for you and for your kingdom not to be destroyed, gentiles will mislead you into destroying it, He said to them: Who are these said to him: these Samaritans who stand before you. He said to them: they are delivered into your hands
llm_translation: He said to them: Why have you come? They said: Perhaps a house in which we pray for you and your kingdom not to be destroyed, you will hand over to the nations to destroy it? He said to them: Who are these? They said to him: These are Kutim, who are standing before you. He said to them: Behold, they are in your hands.

hebrew_text: מִיָּד נְקָבוּם בְּעִקְבֵיהֶם וּתְלָאוּם בְּזַנְבֵי סוּסֵיהֶם, וְהָיוּ מְגָרְרִין אוֹתָן עַל הַקּוֹצִים וְעַל הַבַּרְקָנִים, עַד שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לְהַר גְּרִיזִים. כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעוּ לְהַר גְּרִיזִים — חֲרָשׁוּהוּ, וּזְרָעוּהוּ כַּרְשִׁינִין, כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁבִּקְּשׁוּ לַעֲשׂוֹת לְבֵית אֱלֹהֵינוּ. וְאוֹתוֹ הַיּוֹם עֲשָׂאוּהוּ יוֹם טוֹב.
human_translation: Immediately, they stabbed in their heels and hung them from their horses’ tails and continued to drag them over the thorns and thistles until they reached Mount Gerizim. When they arrived at Mount Gerizim, they plowed it over and seeded with leeks, just as they had sought to do to the House of our Lord. And they made that day a festival
llm_translation: Immediately they were punctured in their heels and hung by the tails of their horses, and they were dragged on thorns and thistles until they reached Mount Gerizim. Once they reached Mount Gerizim - they plowed it and sowed it like one plows and sows, as they sought to do for the House of our God. And that day they made it a holiday.

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: רְאוּיִין לְבִגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה. וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: ״עֵת לַעֲשׂוֹת לַה׳ הֵפֵרוּ תּוֹרָתֶךָ״.
human_translation: If you wish, say fitting to be priestly vestments And if you wish, say “It is time to act for the Lord, they have nullified your Torah”
llm_translation: If you wish, say: Suitable for priestly garments. And if you wish, say: "It is time to act for the Lord; they have violated Your Torah."

hebrew_text: חַזַּן הַכְּנֶסֶת נוֹטֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חוֹלְקִין כָּבוֹד לְתַלְמִיד בִּמְקוֹם הָרַב! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: כּוּלָּהּ מִשּׁוּם כְּבוֹדוֹ דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל הִיא.
human_translation: The synagogue attendant takes a Torah scroll Learn from here honor may be given to a student in the presence of the teacher. Abaye said: the entire is for the honor of the High Priest.
llm_translation: The cantor of the synagogue takes the Torah scroll: "Hear from it, we give honor to a student in the place of the teacher!" Abaye said: The entire reason is due to his honor as a high priest.

hebrew_text: וְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל עוֹמֵד. מִכְּלָל שֶׁהוּא יוֹשֵׁב, וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן:
human_translation: The High Priest stands By inference, he sitting. But didn’t we learn
llm_translation: And the Kohen Gadol is standing. From the inference that he is sitting, but we teach:

hebrew_text: אֵין יְשִׁיבָה בָּעֲזָרָה אֶלָּא לְמַלְכֵי בֵּית דָּוִד בִּלְבַד. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיָּבֹא הַמֶּלֶךְ דָּוִד וַיֵּשֶׁב לִפְנֵי ה׳״? כִּדְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא — בְּעֶזְרַת נָשִׁים, הָכָא נָמֵי — בְּעֶזְרַת נָשִׁים.
human_translation: Sitting in the courtyard is only for kings of the House of David, as it is stated: “Then King David went in and sat before the Lord” As Rav Ḥisda said in the women’s courtyard. Here, too, in the women’s courtyard,
llm_translation: There is no sitting in the Azarah except for the kings of the House of David alone. As it is stated: "And King David came and sat before the Lord." As Rav Ḥisdah said: in the women's section. Here too, in the women's section.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָא אִיתְּמַר דְּרַב חִסְדָּא? אַהָא. מֵיתִיבִי: דְּתַנְיָא, הֵיכָן קוֹרִין בּוֹ — בָּעֲזָרָה, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: בְּהַר הַבַּיִת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּקְרָא בוֹ לִפְנֵי הָרְחוֹב אֲשֶׁר לִפְנֵי שַׁעַר הַמַּיִם״, וְאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּעֶזְרַת נָשִׁים.
human_translation: And where was of Rav Ḥisda stated? in relation to the following: raised an objection which was taught Where did they read in the courtyard. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: on the Temple Mount, as it is stated “And he read from it before the wide road that was before the Gate of the Water” And Rav Ḥisda said: the women’s courtyard.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And where is it stated that Rav Ḥisda said? Here it is. It was taught: Where is it read? — In the Azarah. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: On the Temple Mount, as it is stated: "And he read in it before the broad place that was before the Water Gate" (Nehemiah 8:3). And Rav Ḥisda said: In the women's courtyard.

hebrew_text: ״וַיְבָרֶךְ עֶזְרָא אֶת ה׳ הָאֱלֹהִים הַגָּדוֹל״. מַאי ״גָּדוֹל״? אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב: שֶׁגִּדְּלוֹ בְּשֵׁם הַמְפוֹרָשׁ. רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר: ״בָּרוּךְ ה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל מִן הָעוֹלָם וְעַד הָעוֹלָם״.
human_translation: “And Ezra blessed the Lord, the great God” What is “great” Rav Yosef said Rav said: that he ascribed greatness to Him by explicit name. Rav Giddel said: “Blessed be the Lord, God of Israel, from eternity to eternity”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And Ezra blessed the Lord, the great God." What is "great"? Rav Yosef said in the name of Rav: that He was magnified with the explicit Name. Rav Giddel said: "Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרַב דִּימִי: וְדִילְמָא שֶׁגִּידְּלוֹ בְּשֵׁם הַמְפוֹרָשׁ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אֵין אוֹמְרִים שֵׁם הַמְפוֹרָשׁ בִּגְבוּלִים.
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Dimi: Perhaps that he ascribed greatness to Him by explicit name? said to him: The explicit name may not be enunciated in the provinces,
llm_translation: He said to him Abaye to Rav Dimi: And perhaps they attributed it in the name of the explicit one? He said to him: One does not mention the name of the explicit one in boundaries.

hebrew_text: וְלָא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעֲמוֹד עֶזְרָא הַסּוֹפֵר עַל מִגְדַּל עֵץ אֲשֶׁר עָשׂוּ לַדָּבָר״. וְאָמַר רַב גִּידֵּל: שֶׁגִּדְּלוֹ בְּשֵׁם הַמְפוֹרָשׁ! הוֹרָאַת שָׁעָה הָיְתָה.
human_translation: And not Isn’t it written: “And Ezra the Scribe stood upon a pulpit of wood, which they had made for the purpose... and Rav Giddel said: that he ascribed greatness to Him by explicit name. was a provisional edict
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And not? And it is written: "And Ezra the scribe stood upon a wooden tower which they had made for the purpose." And Rav Giddel said: They made it in the name of the explicitly stated! It was a temporary teaching.

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּצְעֲקוּ אֶל ה׳ אֱלֹהִים בְּקוֹל גָּדוֹל״. מַאי אֲמוּר? אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בִּיָּיא בִּיָּיא הַיְינוּ הַאי דְּאַחְרְבֵיהּ לְמַקְדְּשָׁא וְקַלְיֵהּ לְהֵיכְלֵיהּ וְקַטְלִינְהוּ לְכוּלְּהוּ צַדִּיקֵי וְאַגְלִינְהוּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאַרְעֲהוֹן, וַעֲדַיִין מְרַקֵּד בֵּינַן. כְּלוּם יְהַבְתֵּיהּ לַן אֶלָּא לְקַבּוֹלֵי בֵּיהּ אַגְרָא? לָא אִיהוּ בָּעֵינַן, וְלָא אַגְרֵיהּ בָּעֵינַן!
human_translation: And they cried with a loud voice to the Lord God What was said? Rav said, and some say Rabbi Yoḥanan Woe, woe. It is this, that destroyed the Temple, and burned its Sanctuary, and murdered all the righteous ones, and caused the Jewish people to be exiled from their land. And it still dances among us, Didn’t You give it to us solely for the purpose of receiving reward We do not want it, and we do not want its reward.
llm_translation: "And they cried out to the Lord God with a loud voice." What is meant by this? Rav said, and some say Rabbi Yochanan said: 'Bia bia' - this refers to the one who destroyed the Temple, burned the Sanctuary, killed the righteous, and exiled Israel from their land, and he still dances among them. Did He give it to us only to receive reward from us? He does not want it, and we do not want his reward!

hebrew_text: נְפַל לְהוּ פִּיתְקָא מֵרְקִיעָא, דַּהֲוָה כְּתִב בֵּהּ ״אֱמֶת״.
human_translation: a note fell to them from the heavens upon which was written: Truth,
llm_translation: He fell to him a note from the sky, which was written in it "truth."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חֲנִינָא: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ חוֹתָמוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא ״אֱמֶת״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina said: Learn from this the seal of the Holy One, Blessed be He, is truth.
llm_translation: Rav Chanina said: Learn from it, the seal of the Holy One, blessed be He, is "truth."

hebrew_text: אוֹתִיבוּ בְּתַעֲנִיתָא תְּלָתָא יוֹמִין וּתְלָתָא לֵילָוָאתָא, מַסְרוּהוּ נִיהֲלַיְהוּ. נְפַק אֲתָא כִּי גוּרְיָא דְנוּרָא מִבֵּית קָדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, אֲמַר לְהוּ נָבִיא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: הַיְינוּ יִצְרָא דַעֲבוֹדָה זָרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר זֹאת הָרִשְׁעָה״.
human_translation: they observed a fast for three days and three nights, and He delivered to them. A form of a fiery lion cub came forth from the chamber of the Holy of Holies. the prophet said to the Jewish people: This is the inclination for idol worship, as it is stated “And he said: This is the evil one”
llm_translation: They answered with a fast of three days and three nights, they handed him over to the gentiles. When he came out like a lion from the Holy of Holies, a prophet said to the Israelites: "This is the inclination of foreign worship," as it is said: "And he said, 'This is the wickedness.'"

hebrew_text: בַּהֲדֵי דְּתַפְסוּהּ לֵיהּ אִשְׁתְּמִיט בִּינִיתָא מִמַּזְּיֵיא וּרְמָא קָלָא, וַאֲזַל קָלֵיהּ אַרְבַּע מְאָה פַּרְסֵי. אָמְרוּ: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? דִּילְמָא חַס וְשָׁלוֹם מְרַחֲמִי עֲלֵיהּ מִן שְׁמַיָּא. אֲמַר לְהוּ נָבִיא: שַׁדְיוּהוּ בְּדוּדָא דַאֲבָרָא, וְחַפְיוּהוּ לְפוּמֵּיהּ בַּאֲבָרָא, דַּאֲבָרָא מִשְׁאָב שָׁאֵיב קָלָא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר זֹאת הָרִשְׁעָה וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ אוֹתָהּ אֶל תּוֹךְ הָאֵיפָה וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ אֶת אֶבֶן הָעוֹפֶרֶת אֶל פִּיהָ״.
human_translation: When they caught hold of it one of its hairs fell, and it let out a shriek that was heard for four hundred parasangs. They said: What we do Perhaps, Heaven forfend, they will have mercy upon him from Heaven, The prophet said to them: Throw it into a container of lead and seal the opening with lead, since lead absorbs sound. As it is stated: “And he said: This is the evil one. And he cast it down into the midst of the measure, and he cast a stone of lead upon its opening”
llm_translation: In the case where it is difficult for him, he should throw a coin from his right side and cast a light arrow, and his arrow should go four hundred parasangs. They said: How should we act? Perhaps Heaven forbid, mercy will be shown to him from heaven. A prophet said to them: "Cast him into the pit of the cistern, and throw the stone of the cistern upon his mouth," for the cistern is empty and the pit is dry, as it is stated: "And he said, 'This is wickedness,' and he cast it into the midst of the ephah and cast the leaden weight upon its opening."

hebrew_text: אֲמַרוּ: הוֹאִיל וְעֵת רָצוֹן הוּא, נִבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי אַיִּצְרָא דַעֲבֵירָה. בְּעוֹ רַחֲמֵי וְאִמְּסַר בִּידַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: said: Since it is an auspicious time, let us pray also concerning the inclination for sin They prayed, and it was delivered into their hands.
llm_translation: They said: Since it is a time of favor, the gates of mercy are open wide for repentance. Let him arouse mercy and place it in their hands.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ: חֲזוֹ, דְּאִי קָטְלִיתוּ לֵיהּ לְהָהוּא, כָּלֵי עָלְמָא. חַבְשׁוּהוּ תְּלָתָא יוֹמֵי, וּבָעוּ בֵּיעֲתָא בַּת יוֹמָא בְּכׇל אֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלָא אִשְׁתְּכַח. אָמְרִי: הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? נִקְטְלֵיהּ — כָּלֵי עָלְמָא, נִיבְעֵי רַחֲמֵי אַפַּלְגָא — פַּלְגָא בִּרְקִיעָא לָא יָהֲבִי. כַּחְלִינְהוּ לְעֵינֵיהּ וְשַׁבְקוּהוּ, וְאַהְנִי דְּלָא מִיגָּרֵי בֵּיהּ לְאִינִישׁ בְּקָרִיבְתֵּהּ.
human_translation: said to them: See that if you kill the world will be destroyed they imprisoned it for three days. searched for a fresh egg throughout all of Eretz Yisrael and could not find They said: What we do? we kill it, the world will be destroyed. we pray for half, Heaven does not grant half They gouged its eyes, and set it free. And was effective that a person is no aroused to his relatives.
llm_translation: He said to them: "See, if you kill him, it is a lost cause. Bind him for three days, and on the third day, at the third hour, search throughout the land of Israel and he will not be found." They said: "What shall we do?" If we kill him - it is a lost cause, the mercies of Heaven will be divided - a division in the firmament will not be given. Blindfold him, lead him, and I will stand so that no one approaches him closely."

hebrew_text: בְּמַעְרְבָא מַתְנוּ הָכִי: רַב גִּידֵּל אָמַר: ״גָּדוֹל״ — שֶׁגִּדְּלוֹ בְּשֵׁם הַמְפוֹרָשׁ, וְרַב מַתְנָא אָמַר: ״הָאֵל הַגָּדוֹל הַגִּבּוֹר וְהַנּוֹרָא״.
human_translation: In the West, they taught as follows: Rav Giddel said: “Great” that he ascribed greatness to Him by explicit name. And Rav Mattana said: “The great, the mighty, and the awesome God”
llm_translation: In the West, they taught thus: Rav Giddel said: "Great" - that he was made great in the name of the explicitly stated, and Rav Matna said: "The great, mighty, and awesome God."

hebrew_text: וְהָא דְּרַב מַתְנָא מָטְיָיא לִדְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָן אַנְשֵׁי כְּנֶסֶת הַגְּדוֹלָה — שֶׁהֶחְזִירוּ עֲטָרָה לְיוֹשְׁנָהּ. אֲתָא מֹשֶׁה, אָמַר: ״הָאֵל הַגָּדוֹל הַגִּבּוֹר וְהַנּוֹרָא״. אֲתָא יִרְמְיָה וַאֲמַר: גּוֹיִם מְקַרְקְרִין בְּהֵיכָלוֹ, אַיֵּה נוֹרְאוֹתָיו? לָא אֲמַר ״נוֹרָא״. אֲתָא דָּנִיאֵל אֲמַר: גּוֹיִם מִשְׁתַּעְבְּדִים בְּבָנָיו, אַיֵּה גְּבוּרוֹתָיו? לָא אֲמַר ״גִּבּוֹר״.
human_translation: This Rav Mattana leans to, of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. As Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Why are called the members of the Great Assembly? because they returned the crown to its former Moses came said “The great, the mighty, and the awesomeGod” Jeremiah came and said: Gentiles, are carousing in His sanctuary; where is His awesomeness? he did not say awesome Daniel came said: Gentiles are enslaving His children; where is His might? he did not say mighty
llm_translation: And this that Rav Matna came to Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. For Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Why are they called the men of the Great Assembly? Because they restored the crown to its former glory. Moses came and said: "The Great, Mighty, and Awesome God." Jeremiah came and said: The nations are destroying His sanctuary, where are His awesome deeds? He did not say "awesome." Daniel came and said: The nations are enslaving His children, where are His mighty deeds? He did not say "mighty."

hebrew_text: אֲתוֹ אִינְהוּ וְאָמְרוּ: אַדְּרַבָּה, זוֹ הִיא (גְּבוּרַת) גְּבוּרָתוֹ: שֶׁכּוֹבֵשׁ אֶת יִצְרוֹ — שֶׁנּוֹתֵן אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם לָרְשָׁעִים. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן נוֹרְאוֹתָיו — שֶׁאִלְמָלֵא מוֹרָאוֹ שֶׁל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא הֵיאַךְ אוּמָּה אַחַת יְכוֹלָה לְהִתְקַיֵּים בֵּין הָאוּמּוֹת?
human_translation: came and said: On the contrary, this is the might of His might, that He conquers His inclination that He exercises patience toward the wicked. And these His awesomeness: Were it not for the awesomeness of the Holy One, Blessed be He, how could one people, survive among the nations?
llm_translation: They came and said: Adrabah, this is his might: that he subdues his inclination - for he gives patience to the wicked. And these are his awesome deeds - for if not for the awe of the Holy One, blessed be He, how could one nation endure among the nations?

hebrew_text: וְרַבָּנַן: הֵיכִי עָבְדִי הָכִי וְעָקְרִי תַּקַּנְתָּא דְּתַקֵּין מֹשֶׁה? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁיּוֹדְעִין בְּהַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא שֶׁאֲמִתִּי הוּא, לְפִיכָךְ לֹא כִּיזְּבוּ בּוֹ.
human_translation: And the Rabbis, how could they do this and uproot an ordinance instituted by Moses, Rabbi Elazar said: because they knew of the Holy One Blessed be He, that He is truthful Consequently, they did not speak falsely about Him.
llm_translation: The Sages said: How did they do this and uproot the enactment that Moses enacted? Rabbi Elazar said: Because they knew that the Holy One, blessed be He, is true, therefore they did not lie about it.

hebrew_text: וְקוֹרֵא ״אַחֲרֵי מוֹת״ וְ״אַךְ בֶּעָשׂוֹר״. וּרְמִינְהִי: מְדַלְּגִין בַּנָּבִיא, וְאֵין מְדַלְּגִין בַּתּוֹרָה!
human_translation: And he reads “After the death” and “But on the tenth” raises a contradiction: One skip in the Prophets, but one not skip in the Torah.
llm_translation: And he reads "Acharei Mot" and "Ach Be'asor." And they asked: We skip in the Prophets, but we do not skip in the Torah!

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן, בִּכְדֵי שֶׁיַּפְסִיק הַתּוּרְגְּמָן. כָּאן, בִּכְדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַפְסִיק הַתּוּרְגְּמָן.
human_translation: This is not difficult: There, of such length that the translator will conclude Here, of such length that the translator will not conclude
llm_translation: Not difficult: here, in order that the translator may pause. Here, in order that the translator may not pause.

hebrew_text: וְהָא עֲלַהּ קָתָנֵי: מְדַלְּגִין בַּנָּבִיא, וְאֵין מְדַלְּגִין בַּתּוֹרָה. וְעַד כַּמָּה מְדַלֵּג — בִּכְדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַפְסִיק הַתּוּרְגְּמָן, הָא בַּתּוֹרָה — כְּלָל כְּלָל לָא!
human_translation: But it was taught concerning this One skip in the Prophets, and one not skip in the Torah. And how much one skip? when the of length that the translator will not have concluded but the Torah, not at all.
llm_translation: And this is what the Mishnah teaches: One may skip in the Prophets, but one may not skip in the Torah. And how much may one skip? Enough so that the translator does not pause, but in the Torah - absolutely not!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן, בְּעִנְיָן אֶחָד. כָּאן, בִּשְׁנֵי עִנְיָנִין.
human_translation: Abaye said: This is not difficult. Here, pertain to a single topic, There, pertain to two topics.
llm_translation: Abaye said, it is not difficult: here, regarding one matter. Here, regarding two matters.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: מְדַלְּגִין בַּתּוֹרָה בְּעִנְיָן אֶחָד, וּבַנָּבִיא בִּשְׁנֵי עִנְיָנִין. כָּאן וְכָאן בִּכְדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יַפְסִיק הַתּוּרְגְּמָן. וְאֵין מְדַלְּגִין מִנָּבִיא לְנָבִיא. וּבַנָּבִיא שֶׁל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר מְדַלְּגִין,
human_translation: As it was taught One skip in the Torah pertain to one topic, and in the Prophets pertain to two topics. here and there, when of such length that the translator will not have concluded one not skip from one Prophets to another Prophets among the Twelve Prophets one may skip,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: We skip in the Torah regarding one matter, and in the Prophets regarding two matters. Here and here in order that the interpreter not interrupt. And we do not skip from one prophet to another prophet. And in the case of the Twelve Prophets, we skip.

hebrew_text: וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְדַלֵּג מִסּוֹף הַסֵּפֶר לִתְחִילָּתוֹ.
human_translation: provided that he does not skip from the end of the book to its beginning,
llm_translation: And only not should he skip from the end of the book to its beginning.

hebrew_text: וְגוֹלֵל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה וְכוּ׳. וְכׇל כָּךְ לָמָּה — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא לְהוֹצִיא לַעַז עַל סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: furls the Torah scroll And why all this? so as not to cast aspersions on the Torah scroll,
llm_translation: "And he rolls the Torah scroll, etc. And why all this? In order not to disgrace the Torah scroll."

hebrew_text: ״וּבֶעָשׂוֹר״ שֶׁל חוֹמֶשׁ הַפְּקוּדִים קוֹרֵא עַל פֶּה. אַמַּאי? נִגְלוֹל וְנִיקְרֵי! אָמַר רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב יְהוֹשֻׁעַ אָמַר רַב שֵׁשֶׁת: לְפִי שֶׁאֵין גּוֹלְלִין סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה בְּצִיבּוּר, מִפְּנֵי כְּבוֹד צִיבּוּר.
human_translation: “And on the tenth,” from the book of Numbers he reads by heart. Why Let him furl and read it Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said Rav Sheshet said: because one may not furl a Torah scroll in public, out of respect for the community.
llm_translation: "And on the twentieth of the fifth month, one reads by mouth the count of the census. Why? Because it is rolled and read! Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said in the name of Rav Sheshet: Because we do not roll the Torah scroll in public, out of respect for the congregation."

hebrew_text: וְנַיְיתֵי אַחֲרִינָא וְנִקְרֵי! רַב הוּנָא בַּר יְהוּדָה אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם פְּגָמוֹ שֶׁל רִאשׁוֹן. וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מִשּׁוּם בְּרָכָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ צְרִיכָה.
human_translation: let another be brought and read Rav Huna bar Yehuda said: due to a flaw in the first And Reish Lakish said due to unnecessary blessing
llm_translation: And we will come and read another source! Rav Huna son of Yehuda said: Due to the blemish of the first. And Reish Lakish said: Due to a blessing that is unnecessary.

hebrew_text: וּמִי חָיְישִׁינַן לִפְגָמָא? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק נַפָּחָא: רֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ טֵבֵת שֶׁחָל לִהְיוֹת בְּשַׁבָּת מְבִיאִין שָׁלֹשׁ תּוֹרוֹת וְקוֹרִין אַחַת בְּעִנְיָנוֹ שֶׁל יוֹם, וְאַחַת שֶׁל רֹאשׁ חוֹדֶשׁ, וְאַחַת שֶׁל חֲנוּכָּה.
human_translation: Are we concerned a flaw? Didn’t Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa say: the New Moon of Tevet, occurs on Shabbat, one brings three Torah One reads one the topic of the day, and one of the New Moon; and one
llm_translation: We are concerned about the blemish? And Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha said: On the first day of Tevet that falls on Shabbat, three Torah scrolls are brought out and one is read for the current day, one for Rosh Chodesh, and one for Chanukah.

hebrew_text: תְּלָתָא גַּבְרֵי בִּתְלָתָא סִפְרֵי — לֵיכָּא פְּגָמָא, חַד גַּבְרָא בִּתְרֵי סִפְרֵי — אִיכָּא פְּגָמָא.
human_translation: three men from three scrolls there is no a flaw, one man from two scrolls, there is a flaw,
llm_translation: Three men with three books - there is a deficiency; one man with two books - there is no deficiency.

hebrew_text: וּמְבָרֵךְ עָלֶיהָ שְׁמוֹנֶה בְּרָכוֹת. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַל הַתּוֹרָה — כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁמְּבָרְכִים בְּבֵית הַכְּנֶסֶת, עַל הָעֲבוֹדָה, וְעַל הַהוֹדָאָה, וְעַל מְחִילַת הֶעָוֹן כְּתִיקְנָהּ. וְעַל הַמִּקְדָּשׁ בִּפְנֵי עַצְמוֹ, וְעַל הַכֹּהֲנִים בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, וְעַל יִשְׂרָאֵל בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן, וְעַל שְׁאָר תְּפִלָּה.
human_translation: And recites eight blessings The Sages taught concerning the Torah in the way one recites a blessing in the synagogue: concerning the service, concerning thanksgiving, and concerning pardon of iniquity, according to their established forms concerning the Temple in and of itself; concerning the priests in and of themselves; concerning the Jewish people in and of itself; concerning the rest of the prayer.
llm_translation: And one blesses upon it eight blessings. The Rabbis taught: On the Torah - as is the way one blesses in the synagogue, on the service, and on thanksgiving, and on forgiveness of sin as it is instituted. And on the Temple separately, and on the priests separately, and on Israel separately, and on other prayers.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: וּשְׁאָר הַתְּפִלָּה ״רִנָּה תְּחִינָּה בַּקָּשָׁה מִלְּפָנֶיךָ עַל עַמְּךָ יִשְׂרָאֵל שֶׁצְּרִיכִין לְהִוָּשַׁע״ וְחוֹתֵם בְּשׁוֹמֵעַ תְּפִלָּה. וְאַחַר כָּךְ, כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד מֵבִיא סֵפֶר תּוֹרָה מִבֵּיתוֹ, וְקוֹרֵא בּוֹ כְּדֵי לְהַרְאוֹת חָזוּתוֹ לְרַבִּים.
human_translation: The Sages taught And concerning the rest of the prayer Song, supplication, petition before You for Your people Israel, who need to be saved. And he concludes with: The One Who hears prayer. And after each and every brings a Torah scroll from his house, and reads from it in order to show its appearance to the community.
llm_translation: The sages taught: "And the rest of the prayer, 'a song, a supplication in difficulty from before You, for Your people Israel who need salvation,' and concludes with 'He who hears prayer.' And afterwards, each and every one brings a Torah scroll from his house, and reads from it in order to show his vision to the many."

hebrew_text: הָרוֹאֶה כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל כּוּ׳ לֹא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רַשַּׁאי. פְּשִׁיטָא? מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא כִּדְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין מַעֲבִירִין עַל הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: One who sees the High Priest not because one is not permitted obvious lest you say that in accordance with Reish Lakish, as Reish Lakish said: One does not pass over mitzvot,
llm_translation: The one who sees the High Priest in this state, not because he is not permitted. Obviously? Lest you say as Reish Lakish said: "We do not pass over the commandments."

hebrew_text: וּמַאי מִצְוָה — ״בְּרׇב עָם הַדְרַת מֶלֶךְ״, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: And what mitzva “The king’s glory is in the multitude of people” teaches us
llm_translation: And what is the commandment? "In the multitude of people is the king's glory," it is heard for us.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ אִם בְּבִגְדֵי בוּץ קוֹרֵא, קִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. פָּשַׁט, יָרַד וְטָבַל, עָלָה וְנִסְתַּפַּג, וְהֵבִיאוּ לוֹ בִּגְדֵי זָהָב וְלָבַשׁ, וְקִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו,
human_translation: If read in fine linen garments, he sanctified his hands and feet removed descended and immersed. ascended and dried himself and they brought him golden garments and he dressed and sanctified his hands and feet.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: If one reads the Shema while wearing linen garments, he should sanctify his hands and feet. Afterward, he removes the linen garments, descends and immerses in a mikvah, ascends and dries himself, and they bring him garments of gold and he wears them, and sanctifies his hands and feet.

hebrew_text: וְיָצָא וְעָשָׂה אֶת אֵילוֹ וְאֶת אֵיל הָעָם וְאֶת שִׁבְעַת כְּבָשִׂים תְּמִימִים בְּנֵי שָׁנָה, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר הָיוּ קְרֵבִין. וּפַר הָעוֹלָה וְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ — הָיוּ קְרֵבִין עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: He emerged and offered his ram and the ram of the people and the seven unblemished year-old lambs the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Akiva says: rather, with the daily morning offering; and the bull burnt-offering; and the goat whose are performed outside were sacrificed with the daily afternoon offering.
llm_translation: And he shall bring forth his ram, and the ram of the people, and seven lambs, sons of a year, unblemished, the words of Rabbi Eliezer. Rabbi Akiva says: With the continual offering of the morning they were brought. And the bullock of the sin-offering and the goat of the sin-offering that were done outside - they were brought with the continual offering of the afternoon.

hebrew_text: קִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו וּפָשַׁט, וְיָרַד וְטָבַל וְעָלָה וְנִסְתַּפָּג.
human_translation: he sanctified his hands and feet and removed and he descended and immersed and ascended and dried himself.
llm_translation: He sanctified his hands and his feet and removed his clothes, and descended and immersed and ascended and became disqualifed.

hebrew_text: הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ בִּגְדֵי לָבָן וְלָבַשׁ, וְקִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. נִכְנַס לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַכַּף וְאֶת הַמַּחְתָּה. קִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו וּפָשַׁט, וְיָרַד וְטָבַל עָלָה וְנִסְתַּפָּג.
human_translation: They brought him the white garments and he dressed and sanctified his hands and feet. he entered to take out the spoon and the coal pan, He sanctified his hands and feet and removed and descended and immersed and ascended and dried himself
llm_translation: They brought for him white garments and he wore them, and sanctified his hands and feet. He entered to bring out the spoon and the censer. He sanctified his hands and feet and removed, and descended and immersed in the mikveh and became pure.

hebrew_text: הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ בִּגְדֵי זָהָב וְלָבַשׁ, וְקִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו, וְנִכְנַס לְהַקְטִיר קְטוֹרֶת שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבָּיִם, וּלְהֵטִיב אֶת הַנֵּרוֹת, וְקִדֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו וּפָשַׁט, וְיָרַד וְטָבַל עָלָה וְנִסְתַּפָּג.
human_translation: They brought him golden garments, and he dressed and sanctified his hands and feet and entered to burn the afternoon incense and to remove the lamps, And he sanctified his hands and feet and removed and he descended and immersed and ascended and dried himself.
llm_translation: They brought to him garments of gold and he wore them, and sanctified his hands and feet, and entered to burn the incense of the afternoon, and to arrange the lamps, and sanctified his hands and feet and removed them, and descended and immersed in the mikveh and became clean.

hebrew_text: הֵבִיאוּ לוֹ בִּגְדֵי עַצְמוֹ וְלָבַשׁ, וּמְלַוִּין אוֹתוֹ עַד בֵּיתוֹ. וְיוֹם טוֹב הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה לְאוֹהֲבָיו בְּשָׁעָה שֶׁיָּצָא בְּשָׁלוֹם מִן הַקּוֹדֶשׁ.
human_translation: They brought him his own clothing and he dressed, escort him to his house And would make a feast for his loved ones when he emerged in peace from the Sanctuary.
llm_translation: They brought to him his own clothes and he dressed, and they accompany him until his house. And on a festival he used to make for his beloved at the time he would depart in peace from the Holy Temple.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הֵיכִי קָאָמַר, עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר הָיוּ קְרֵבִין, וּפַר הָעוֹלָה וְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם,
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is saying? were sacrificed with the daily morning offering, the bull burnt-offering and the goat whose are performed outside were sacrificed with the daily afternoon offering?
llm_translation: Gemara inquires: How does he say it? With the daily morning offering they were brought, and the burnt offering and the sin offering that were made outside with the daily afternoon offering.

hebrew_text: אוֹ דִילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר: עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר הָיוּ קְרֵבִין, וּפַר הָעוֹלָה בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ, וְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: Or perhaps this is what he is saying: were sacrificed with the daily morning offering the bull burnt-offering together with them, the goat whose are performed outside, with the daily afternoon offering.
llm_translation: Or perhaps this is what he is saying: The daily morning offerings were brought, and the bull of the burnt offering alongside them, and the goat that was to be sent outside with the afternoon daily offering.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: פַּר הָעוֹלָה לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּשַׁיְּירֵיהּ, אֵימַת עָבֵיד לֵיהּ?
human_translation: And furthermore, the bull burnt-offering, to Rabbi Eliezer’s he omitted it, when performs
llm_translation: And come and learn: The bull of the burnt offering for Rabbi Eliezer, when does he offer it?

hebrew_text: וְתוּ: בֵּין לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֵּין לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא, אֵימוּרֵי חַטָּאת אֵימַת עָבֵיד לְהוּ?
human_translation: And furthermore, both Rabbi Eliezer’s and Rabbi Akiva’s portions of the sin-offering when performs their
llm_translation: And come: between Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Akiva, the statements of the sin offering, when does he do for them?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ מְתַקַּנְתָּא, אֶלָּא אוֹ לְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר דְּתָנָא בִּדְבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל, אוֹ לְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא כִּדְתוֹסֶפְתָּא.
human_translation: Rava said: You will only find it properly to Rabbi Eliezer as taught by the school Shmuel, or to Rabbi Akiva as in the Tosefta .
llm_translation: Rava said: You do not find it in the text, rather either to Rabbi Eliezer as taught in the school of Shmuel, or to Rabbi Akiva as in the Tosefta.

hebrew_text: דְּתָנָא דְּבֵי שְׁמוּאֵל: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר אוֹמֵר: יָצָא וְעָשָׂה אֵילוֹ וְאֵיל הָעָם וְאֵימוּרֵי חַטָּאת, אֲבָל פַּר הָעוֹלָה וְשִׁבְעַת כְּבָשִׂים וְשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ — עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: The school of Shmuel taught Rabbi Eliezer says: He came out and offered his ram and the ram of the people and the portions of the sin-offering But the bull burnt-offering and the seven lambs and the goat whose are performed outside with the daily afternoon offering.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: D'tana d'bei Shmuel: Rabbi Eliezer omer: yatza v'asa eilo v'eil ha'am v'eimurei chatat, aval par ha'olah v'shiv'at kevasim v'sa'ir han'aseh bachutz - im tamid shel bein ha'arbayim. English translation: It was taught in the school of Shmuel: Rabbi Eliezer says: If one went out and performed the offering of the ram and the ram of the people and the leftover sin-offerings, but the bull of the burnt offering and the seven lambs and the goat that are done outside - with the afternoon continual offering.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּתוֹסֶפְתָּא מַאי הִיא? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: פַּר הָעוֹלָה וְשִׁבְעַת כְּבָשִׁים עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר הָיוּ קְרֵבִין, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִלְּבַד עוֹלַת הַבֹּקֶר אֲשֶׁר לְעוֹלַת הַתָּמִיד״, וְאַחַר כָּךְ עֲבוֹדַת הַיּוֹם.
human_translation: What is Rabbi Akiva’s Tosefta ? As it was taught Rabbi Akiva says: The bull burnt-offering and the seven lambs were sacrificed with the daily morning offering, as it is stated “Besides the morning burnt-offering which is the daily burnt-offering And afterward the service of the day,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva of Tosefta, what is it? As it was taught, Rabbi Akiva says: The bull of the burnt offering and seven lambs with the morning continual offering were brought, as it is stated: "Besides the burnt offering of the morning, and its continual offering," and afterwards the service of the day.

hebrew_text: וְאַחַר כָּךְ שָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שְׂעִיר עִזִּים אֶחָד חַטָּאת מִלְּבַד חַטַּאת הַכִּפּוּרִים״, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אֵילוֹ וְאֵיל הָעָם, וְאַחַר כָּךְ אֵימוּרֵי חַטָּאת, וְאַחַר כָּךְ תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: And afterward, the goat whose are performed outside as it is stated: “One goat for a sin-offering besides the sin-offering of atonement And afterward his ram and the ram of the people, and afterward portions of the sin-offering and afterward he sacrifices the daily afternoon offering.
llm_translation: And after that, the he-goat that is done outside, as it is said: "One he-goat for a sin offering, besides the sin offering of atonement." And after that, the ram and the ram of the people, and after that, the statements of sin offering, and after that, the daily offering of the twilight.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר? עָבֵיד כְּדִכְתִיב: עָבֵיד בְּרֵישָׁא דְּתוֹרַת כֹּהֲנִים, וַהֲדַר עָבֵיד דְּחוֹמֶשׁ הַפְּקוּדִים.
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer? acts in accordance with which it is written First he performs Leviticus, and afterward he performs the book of Numbers.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer? He does as it is written: he does at the beginning of the Torah of the Priests, and then he does the tithe of the counts.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא? כִּדְקָתָנֵי טַעְמָא: ״מִלְּבַד עוֹלַת הַבֹּקֶר אֲשֶׁר לְעוֹלַת הַתָּמִיד״, אַלְמָא מוּסָפִין עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר עָבֵיד לְהוּ.
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva’s reasoning that as teaches “Besides the morning burnt-offering which is the daily burnt-offering it is apparent additional offerings performed with the daily morning offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva? As it is taught in the tradition: "Besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for the continual burnt offering," indicating that the additional offerings are performed together with the morning continual offering.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר, הַאי ״מִלְּבַד חַטַּאת הַכִּפּוּרִים״ מַאי עָבֵיד לֵיהּ? הַהוּא מִיבְּעֵי לֵיהּ, עַל מָה שֶׁזֶּה מְכַפֵּר — זֶה מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer, what does he do with this “Besides the sin-offering of atonement,” That is necessary for him for what this one, atones, that one, atones.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, this "aside from the sin offering of atonements," what does he do with it? That one requires it, for that which this atones - this atones.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: אֶחָד קָרֵב עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, וְשִׁשָּׁה עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר מִשְּׁמוֹ: שִׁשָּׁה קְרֵבִין עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל שַׁחַר, וְאֶחָד עִם תָּמִיד שֶׁל בֵּין הָעַרְבַּיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says in name of One is sacrificed with the daily morning offering, and six with the daily afternoon offering. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says in name of Six are sacrificed with the daily morning offering and one with the daily afternoon offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says in his name: One animal offering is brought with the morning daily offering, and six with the afternoon daily offering. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says in his name: Six animal offerings are brought with the morning daily offering, and one with the afternoon daily offering.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? תְּרֵי קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי. כְּתִיב: ״מִלְּבַד עוֹלַת הַבֹּקֶר״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיָצָא וְעָשָׂה אֶת עוֹלָתוֹ״, הִלְכָּךְ, עָבֵיד מִנַּיְיהוּ הָכָא וּמָנַיְיהוּ הָכָא.
human_translation: What is the rationale of the Rabbis, Two verses are written It is written “Besides the morning burnt-offering But it is written “And he shall exit and make his burnt-offering Therefore, he performs some of them here, and some of them there,
llm_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? Two verses are written. It is written: "Besides the burnt offering of the morning," and it is written: "And he shall offer his burnt offering." Therefore, he does one here and one there.

hebrew_text: בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי? רַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: עָבֵיד חַד כְּדִכְתִיב: ״מִלְּבַד עוֹלַת הַבֹּקֶר״, וַהֲדַר עָבֵיד עֲבוֹדַת הַיּוֹם — דִּילְמָא חוּלְשָׁא חָלֵישׁ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Rabbi Yehuda holds performs one as it is written: “Besides the morning burnt-offering,” and then he performs the service of the day lest the High Priest become weak
llm_translation: Talmudic text: With what do they disagree? Rabbi Yehuda holds: He performs one as it is written: "Besides the burnt offering of the morning," and then he performs the service of the day - perhaps the High Priest is weak.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן סָבַר: כֵּיוָן דְּאַתְחֵיל — עָבֵיד שִׁשָּׁה, דִּילְמָא פָּשַׁע. דִּלְגַבֵּי עֲבוֹדַת הַיּוֹם — זָרִיז הוּא.
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, holds: Since he has begun he performs six lest he be negligent with regard to the service of the day, diligent
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon holds: once one begins - he should complete six, lest he transgress. Regarding the Temple service - one should be diligent.

hebrew_text: דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִיהַת, חַד אַיִל הוּא. כְּמַאן — כְּרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: אַיִל אֶחָד הָאָמוּר כָּאן, הוּא הָאָמוּר בְּחוֹמֶשׁ הַפְּקוּדִים. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן אוֹמֵר: שְׁנֵי אֵילִים הֵן, אֶחָד הָאָמוּר כָּאן, וְאֶחָד הָאָמוּר בְּחוֹמֶשׁ הַפְּקוּדִים.
human_translation: everyone however, there is one ram In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi As it was taught Rabbi says: the one stated here is the same one stated in the Book of Numbers: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: There are two rams One that is stated here and one stated in the Book of Numbers,
llm_translation: The whole world is from him, one ram he is. Like whom? Like Rabbi. For it was taught, Rabbi says: The ram mentioned here is the same as the one mentioned in the five accounts of the numbering. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: They are two rams, one mentioned here, and one mentioned in the five accounts of the numbering.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּרַבִּי? דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶחָד״. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן, מַאי ״אֶחָד״? מְיוּחָד שֶׁבְּעֶדְרוֹ.
human_translation: What is the rationale of Rabbi As it is written: “One,” And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, what “one”? unique one, of its flock.
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi's opinion? As it is written: "one." And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, what is "one"? The unique one in his flock.

hebrew_text: וְרַבִּי? נָפְקָא לֵיהּ: מִ״מִּבְחַר נְדָרֶיךָ״. וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בְּרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן? חַד בְּחוֹבָה, וְחַד בִּנְדָבָה. וּצְרִיכִי.
human_translation: And Rabbi He derives it from “Your choice vows” And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, One obligatory and one free-will And are necessary
llm_translation: Rabbi? He went out: "From the choice of your vows." And Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon? One is obligatory, and one is voluntary. And it is necessary.

hebrew_text: קִידֵּשׁ יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״וּבָא אַהֲרֹן אֶל אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״. לָמָה הוּא בָּא? לְהוֹצִיא אֶת הַכַּף וְאֶת הַמַּחְתָּה,
human_translation: sanctified his hands and feet The Sages taught: “And Aaron shall come into the Tent of Meeting” Why does he come? to take out the spoon and the coal pan
llm_translation: He sanctified his hands and his feet. The Rabbis taught: "And Aaron came into the tent of meeting." Why did he come? To bring out the censer and the shovel.

hebrew_text: שֶׁכׇּל הַפָּרָשָׁה כּוּלָּהּ נֶאֶמְרָה עַל הַסֵּדֶר, חוּץ מִפָּסוּק זֶה.
human_translation: as the whole portion is written in this order, except for this verse,
llm_translation: The entire portion was stated in order, except for this verse.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: גְּמִירִי, חָמֵשׁ טְבִילוֹת וַעֲשָׂרָה קִידּוּשִׁין טוֹבֵל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל וּמְקַדֵּשׁ בּוֹ בַּיּוֹם,
human_translation: What is the reason Rav Ḥisda said: They learned five immersions and ten sanctifications on that day.
llm_translation: What is the reason? Rav Ḥisdah said: It is learned, five immersions and ten sanctifications, a High Priest immerses and sanctifies with it on the same day.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אָמְרַתְּ כְּסִדְרָן כְּתִיבִי, לָא מַשְׁכַּחַתְּ לַהּ אֶלָּא שָׁלֹשׁ טְבִילוֹת וְשִׁשָּׁה קִידּוּשִׁין.
human_translation: And if you say written in order, you find only three immersions and six sanctifications.
llm_translation: And if you say, according to their order as written, you do not forget her, except three immersions and six sanctifications.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: וְדִילְמָא מַפְסֵיק לֵיהּ בְּשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ!
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this: But perhaps he interrupts with the goat are performed outside
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira objects to this: Perhaps he interrupted it with the goat that is made outside!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְיָצָא וְעָשָׂה אֶת עוֹלָתוֹ״, מִיצִיאָה רִאשׁוֹנָה עָבֵיד אֵילוֹ וְאֵיל הָעָם.
human_translation: Abaye said: the verse states: “And he shall exit and make his burnt-offering following first exit he performs his ram and the ram of the people
llm_translation: Abaye said, the verse says: "And he shall go out and make his burnt offering," the first going out he does with a ram and the ram of the people.
