hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וּפָשַׁט אֶת בִּגְדֵי הַבָּד״, שֶׁאֵין תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֲשֶׁר לָבַשׁ״, כְּלוּם אָדָם פּוֹשֵׁט אֶלָּא מַה שֶּׁלּוֹבֵשׁ?! אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֲשֶׁר לָבַשׁ״ — שֶׁלָּבַשׁ כְּבָר.
human_translation: Rava said The verse states: and he shall remove the linen garments the verse does not state “which he wore,” can remove than what he is wearing? Rather, what the verse states “which he wore”? those which he had already worn
llm_translation: Rava said, the verse says: "And he shall take off the garments of linen," as the Torah does not say "that he wore," as if a person takes off anything other than what he is wearing?! Rather, what does the Torah mean by saying "that he wore" - that he had already worn.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבָּה בַּר רַב שֵׁילָא: וְאֵימָא דְּמַפְסֵיק לֵיהּ בְּשָׂעִיר הַנַּעֲשֶׂה בַּחוּץ! הָכְתִיב: ״וְיָצָא וְעָשָׂה״.
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Sheila strongly objects to this: Say he interrupts with the goat are performed outside Isn’t it written: “And he shall exit and make his burnt-offering
llm_translation: Rabah bar Rav Sheilah objects to him: But what about the case of the goat that is designated for outside use! It is written: "And he shall go out and perform."

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הַפָּרָשָׁה כּוּלָּהּ נֶאֶמְרָה עַל הַסֵּדֶר? וְהָא קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי: ״וְאֵת חֵלֶב הַחַטָּאת יַקְטִיר הַמִּזְבֵּחָה״, וַהֲדַר: ״וְאֵת פַּר הַחַטָּאת וְאֵת שְׂעִיר הַחַטָּאת״, וְאִילּוּ אֲנַן תְּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה אֶת כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל כְּשֶׁהוּא קוֹרֵא — אֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה פַּר וְשָׂעִיר הַנִּשְׂרָפִין. וְאִילּוּ אֵמוּרֵי חַטָּאת בָּתַר הָכִי מַקְטֵיר לְהוּ!
human_translation: Is the entire passage written in order? But the verses it is written: “And he shall burn the fat of the sin-offering upon the altar” and then “And the bull of the sin-offering, and the goat of the sin-offering, Yet we learned One who sees the High Priest reading does not see the bull and goat that are burned, while the portions of the sin-offering are burned afterward.
llm_translation: The entire portion is said in order? But the verses are written: "And the fat of the sin offering shall be offered up on the altar," and further: "And the bull of the sin offering and the goat of the sin offering." And we learned: One who sees the High Priest reading - he does not see the bull and the goat that are burnt. And if the sin-offering verses come after, he should offer them!

hebrew_text: אֵימָא: חוּץ מִפָּסוּק זֶה וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: Say except for this verse and onward.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Eima: chutz mipasuk zeh ve'eilakh. English translation: Say: except for this verse and onwards.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי חָזֵית דִּמְשַׁבְּשַׁתְּ קְרָאֵי, שַׁבֵּישׁ מַתְנִיתָא!
human_translation: And what did you see that you rearrange the verses? the mishna.
llm_translation: And what do you see that you are mixing up verses, the Mishnah is clear!

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְהַמְשַׁלֵּחַ ... וְהַשּׂוֹרֵף״. מָה מְשַׁלֵּחַ דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא — אַף שׂוֹרֵף דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא.
human_translation: Abaye said: the verse states: “And the one who sends “And the one who burns just as one who sends earlier, so too, one who burns earlier,
llm_translation: Abaye said, the verse says: "And the one who sends away ... and the one who burns." Just as the one who sends away is from the outset — so too the one who burns is from the outset.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: מָה שׂוֹרֵף דְּהַשְׁתָּא — אַף מְשַׁלֵּחַ דְּהַשְׁתָּא!
human_translation: On the contrary, Just as one who burns now, so too, one who sends now,
llm_translation: Ad Ravva: ma soref dehashta - af meshaleach dehashta!

hebrew_text: ״וְהַמְשַׁלֵּחַ״, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא מַשְׁמַע. רָבָא אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״יׇעֳמַד חַי״, עַד מָתַי יְהֵא זָקוּק לַעֲמוֹד חַי? עַד שְׁעַת כַּפָּרָה. וְאֵימָתַי שְׁעַת כַּפָּרָה? בִּשְׁעַת מַתַּן דָּמִים, וְתוּ לָא.
human_translation: “And the one who sends” implies that it was earlier. Rava said: the verse states: shall be stood alive How long must it stand alive? until the moment of atonement. And when is the moment of atonement? at the moment of the presenting of the blood, no later.
llm_translation: "The one who sends," as it is implied from the outset. Rava said, the verse says: "Let the living stand," until when should one be prepared to stand? Until the time of atonement. And when is the time of atonement? At the time of the giving of blood, and no more.

hebrew_text: אָתֵי מְשַׁלֵּחַ, מְצָאוֹ בַּשּׁוּק לְכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: אִישִׁי כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל! עָשִׂינוּ שְׁלִיחוּתְךָ. מְצָאוֹ בְּבֵיתוֹ, אוֹמֵר לוֹ: מְחַיֵּה חַיִּים, עָשִׂינוּ שְׁלִיחוּתוֹ.
human_translation: one who sends comes he finds the High Priest in the market, he says to him: My Master, High Priest, we performed your mission, he finds him in his house, he says to him: The One Who grants life to the living,  we performed His mission.
llm_translation: He comes, the messenger, he finds in the market to the High Priest, he says to him: "My master, High Priest! We have done your mission." He finds in his house, he says to him: "He who gives life, we have done his mission."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבָּה: כִּי מִיפַּטְרִי רַבָּנַן מֵהֲדָדֵי בְּפוּמְבְּדִיתָא אָמְרִי הָכִי: ״מְחַיֵּה חַיִּים יִתֵּן לְךָ חַיִּים אֲרוּכִּים וְטוֹבִים וּמְתוּקָּנִין״.
human_translation: Rabba said: When the Sages take leave from one another in Pumbedita, they say as follows: May the One Who grants life to the living grant you a long, good, and established life.
llm_translation: Rabba said: When the Rabbis would take leave of each other in the study hall, they would say the following: "May the One who gives life give you a life that is long, good, and perfected."

hebrew_text: ״אֶתְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵי ה׳ בְּאַרְצוֹת הַחַיִּים״, אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: זֶה מָקוֹם שְׁוָוקִים.
human_translation: “I shall walk before the Lord in the lands of the living” Rav Yehuda said: This is the place of markets,
llm_translation: "אֶתְהַלֵּךְ לִפְנֵי ה׳ בְּאַרְצוֹת הַחַיִּים", אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: זֶה מָקוֹם שְׁוָוקִים. "I will walk before the Lord in the lands of the living," said Rav Yehudah: This is the marketplace.

hebrew_text: ״כִּי אוֹרֶךְ יָמִים וּשְׁנוֹת חַיִּים וְשָׁלוֹם יוֹסִיפוּ לָךְ״, וְכִי יֵשׁ שָׁנִים שֶׁל חַיִּים וְיֵשׁ שָׁנִים שֶׁאֵינָן שֶׁל חַיִּים? אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: אֵלּוּ שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם הַמִּתְהַפְּכוֹת עָלָיו מֵרָעָה לְטוֹבָה.
human_translation: “For length of days, and years of life, and peace, will they add to you” Are there years of life and years that are not of life? Rabbi Elazar said: these years of a person’s life which are transformed for him from bad to good.
llm_translation: "‘For length of days and years of life and peace they will add to you.’ And are there years of life that are and years of life that are not? Rabbi Elazar said: These are the years of a person that turn upon him from evil to good."

hebrew_text: ״אֲלֵיכֶם אִישִׁים אֶקְרָא״, אָמַר רַבִּי בֶּרֶכְיָה: אֵלּוּ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁדּוֹמִין לְנָשִׁים וְעוֹשִׂין גְּבוּרָה כַּאֲנָשִׁים. וְאָמַר רַבִּי בֶּרֶכְיָה: הָרוֹצֶה לְנַסֵּךְ יַיִן עַל גַּבֵּי הַמִּזְבֵּחַ — יְמַלֵּא גְּרוֹנָם שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים יַיִן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֲלֵיכֶם אִישִׁים אֶקְרָא״.
human_translation: “To you men ishim do I call, Rabbi Berekhya said: these Torah scholars, who are similar to women but they act mightily like men And Rabbi Berekhya said one who wishes to pour libations of wine over the altar should fill the throats of Torah scholars with wine, as it is stated: “To you men ishim do I call.”
llm_translation: "To you, men I call," Rabbi Berachiah said: These are the Torah scholars, who are similar to women and perform acts of valor like men. And Rabbi Berachiah said: One who wishes to pour wine on the altar - let him fill the throats of Torah scholars with wine, as it is stated: "To you, men I call."

hebrew_text: וְאָמַר רַבִּי בֶּרֶכְיָה: אִם רוֹאֶה אָדָם שֶׁתּוֹרָה פּוֹסֶקֶת מִזַּרְעוֹ — יִשָּׂא בַּת תַּלְמִיד חָכָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אִם יַזְקִין בָּאָרֶץ שׇׁרְשׁוֹ וּבֶעָפָר יָמוּת גִּזְעוֹ
human_translation: And Rabbi Berekhya said: If a person sees that Torah is ceasing from his children, he should marry the daughter of a Torah scholar. as it is stated: “Though its root will grow old in the earth, and its trunk will die in the ground,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Berakhiyah said: If a person sees that Torah is ceasing from his offspring, he should marry the daughter of a Torah scholar, as it is said: "If its root is old in the earth, and its stump dies in the dust."

hebrew_text: מֵרֵיחַ מַיִם יַפְרִיחַ וְעָשָׂה קָצִיר כְּמוֹ נָטַע״.
human_translation: from the scent of water it will blossom and put forth branches like a plant”
llm_translation: From the scent of water it will bud and produce a harvest as one who plants.

hebrew_text: וְיוֹם טוֹב הָיָה עוֹשֶׂה לְאוֹהֲבָיו. תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מַעֲשֶׂה בְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל אֶחָד שֶׁיָּצָא מִבֵּית הַמִּקְדָּשׁ וַהֲווֹ אָזְלִי כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא בָּתְרֵיהּ. כֵּיוָן דְּחַזְיוּנְהוּ לִשְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן, שַׁבְקוּהוּ לְדִידֵיהּ וְאָזְלִי בָּתַר שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן.
human_translation: And he would make a feast for his loved ones. The Sages taught There was an incident involving one High Priest who exited the Holy Temple and everyone followed him. When they saw Shemaya and Avtalyon, they left by himself and walked after Shemaya and Avtalyon.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And a good day he made for his beloved. The Rabbis taught: There was an incident with one High Priest who left the Temple and everyone followed after him. Once they saw Shemaiah and Avtalyon, they left him and went after Shemaiah and Avtalyon.

hebrew_text: לְסוֹף אֲתוֹ שְׁמַעְיָה וְאַבְטַלְיוֹן לְאִיפְּטוֹרֵי מִינֵּיהּ דְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל. אָמַר לָהֶן: יֵיתוֹן בְּנֵי עַמְמִין לִשְׁלָם. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: יֵיתוֹן בְּנֵי עַמְמִין לִשְׁלָם דְּעָבְדִין עוֹבָדָא דְאַהֲרֹן, וְלָא יֵיתֵי בַּר אַהֲרֹן לִשְׁלָם דְּלָא עָבֵיד עוֹבָדָא דְאַהֲרֹן.
human_translation: Eventually, Shemaya and Avtalyon came to take leave of the High Priest he said to them: Let the descendants of nations come in peace. They said to him: Let the descendants of the nations come in peace, who perform the acts of Aaron, and let not a descendant of Aaron come in peace, who does not perform the acts of Aaron
llm_translation: At the end, Shemaiah and Avtalyon came to the city of the heretics of the High Priest. He said to them: Let the sons of Ammin come to peace. They said to him: Let the sons of Ammin come to peace, for they perform the service of Aaron, but let not the son of Aaron come to peace, for he does not perform the service of Aaron.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בִּשְׁמוֹנָה כֵּלִים, וְהַהֶדְיוֹט בְּאַרְבָּעָה: בִּכְתוֹנֶת וּמִכְנָסַיִם וּמִצְנֶפֶת וְאַבְנֵט. מוֹסִיף עָלָיו כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל: חֹשֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד וּמְעִיל וְצִיץ. בְּאֵלּוּ נִשְׁאָלִין בְּאוּרִים וְתוּמִּים. וְאֵין נִשְׁאָלִין אֶלָּא לְמֶלֶךְ וּלְאַב בֵּית דִּין וּלְמִי שֶׁהַצִּיבּוּר צָרִיךְ בּוֹ.
human_translation: the High Priest serves in eight garments, and the common priest in four: In a tunic and trousers and a mitre and a belt. The High Priest adds beyond A breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a frontplate. in these be consulted for Urim VeTummim . And he may be consulted only on behalf of the king, or on behalf of the president of the court, or on behalf of one whom the community needs.
llm_translation: The Mishnah teaches: A High Priest serves with eight garments, while an ordinary priest with four: tunic, breeches, turban, and sash. Additionally, the High Priest wears the breastplate, ephod, robe, and headplate. With these, inquiries are made through the Urim and Thummim. And inquiries are made only for a king, the head of the court, and someone upon whom the community relies.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן, דְּבָרִים שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״שֵׁשׁ״ חוּטָן כָּפוּל שִׁשָּׁה. ״מׇשְׁזָר״ שְׁמוֹנָה. מְעִיל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר. פָּרוֹכֶת עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה. חוֹשֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught items it is stated linen [ shesh ], their threads six-fold, twined, eight fold.  robe twelve curtain twenty-four breastplate and ephod twenty-eight
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Regarding items in which the word "six" is mentioned, the warp threads are folded six times. Regarding "twisted," there are eight. The robe has twelve. The curtain has twenty-four. The breastplate and the ephod have twenty-eight.

hebrew_text: חוּטָן כָּפוּל שִׁשָּׁה מְנָא לַן — דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וַיַּעֲשׂוּ אֶת הַכׇּתְנֹת שֵׁשׁ ... וְאֵת הַמִּצְנֶפֶת שֵׁשׁ וְאֶת פַּאֲרֵי הַמִּגְבָּעֹת שֵׁשׁ וְאֶת מִכְנְסֵי הַבָּד שֵׁשׁ מׇשְׁזָר״. חַמְשָׁה קְרָאֵי כְּתִיבִי: חַד לְגוּפֵיהּ, דְּכִיתָּנָא נִיהְווֹ. וְחַד, שֶׁיְּהֵא חוּטָן כָּפוּל שִׁשָּׁה. וְחַד, שֶׁיִּהְיוּ שְׁזוּרִין. וְחַד, לִשְׁאָר בְּגָדִים שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן שֵׁשׁ. וְחַד, לְעַכֵּב.
human_translation: the threads six-fold, from where do we The verse states: “And they made the tunics of linen shesh And the mitre of linen, and the adorning mitres of linen, and the linen [ bad ] trousers of twined linen” Five mentions written; One for that itself, that they should be linen. And one that the threads should be six-fold, And one should be spun together And one to the other garments, shesh is not stated And one indispensable
llm_translation: Thread doubled six hundred for us - as the verse states: "And they made the tunics of fine linen ... and the turban of fine linen, and the sashes of fine twisted linen, and the trousers of fine twisted linen." Five scriptural verses are written: one for itself, that it should be woven. And one, that the thread should be doubled six hundred. And one, that they should be twisted. And one, for the other garments for which it is not stated that they are of linen. And one, for reinforcement.

hebrew_text: מַאי מַשְׁמַע דְּהַאי ״שֵׁשׁ״ כִּיתָּנָא הוּא? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: דְּאָמַר קְרָא ״בַּד״ — דָּבָר הָעוֹלֶה מִן הַקַּרְקַע בַּד בַּד. וְאֵימָא עַמְרָא! עַמְרָא אִיפְּצוֹלֵי מִיפַּצְלָא. כִּיתָּנָא נָמֵי אִיפְּצוֹלֵי מִפְּצִיל! כִּיתָּנָא אַגַּב לָקוּתֵיהּ מִפְּצִיל.
human_translation: From where be inferred that this shesh linen? Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: As the verse states: “ Bad ,” something which sprouts from the ground stalk by stalk [ bad bad ], And say wool, Wool splits, flax also splits Flax, splits when beaten.
llm_translation: What is the implication that this "six" is mentioned? Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: As the verse states "bad" - a matter that ascends from the ground ascends gradually. And why not say "amra"! Amra ascends from the pit. The verse also states that amra ascends gradually! The verse, in accordance with his statement, ascends gradually.

hebrew_text: רָבִינָא אָמַר מֵהָכָא: ״פַּאֲרֵי פִשְׁתִּים יִהְיוּ עַל רֹאשָׁם וּמִכְנְסֵי פִשְׁתִּים יִהְיוּ עַל מׇתְנֵיהֶם״.
human_translation: Ravina said: from here: “They shall have linen pishtim mitres upon their heads, and linen trousers upon their loins”
llm_translation: Ravinah said from here: "Fine linen turbans shall be on their heads, and linen undergarments shall be on their loins."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אָשֵׁי: הָא מִקַּמֵּי דְּאָתֵי יְחֶזְקֵאל, מַאן אַמְרַהּ? וּלְטַעְמָיךְ, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: דָּבָר זֶה מִתּוֹרַת מֹשֶׁה רַבֵּינוּ לֹא לָמַדְנוּ, מִדִּבְרֵי יְחֶזְקֵאל בֶּן בּוּזִי לָמַדְנוּ: ״כׇּל בֶּן נֵכָר עֶרֶל לֵב וְעֶרֶל בָּשָׂר לֹא יָבֹא אֶל מִקְדָּשִׁי״ — הָא מִקַּמֵּי דְּאָתֵי יְחֶזְקֵאל, מַאן אַמְרַהּ? אֶלָּא גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, וַאֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל וְאַסְמְכַהּ אַקְּרָא. הָכָא נָמֵי: גְּמָרָא גְּמִירִי לַהּ, וַאֲתָא יְחֶזְקֵאל וְאַסְמְכַהּ אַקְּרָא.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to him: But before Ezekiel came, who said And according to your reasoning, that which Rav Ḥisda said This matter we did not learn from the Torah of Moses our teacher, we learned it from the words of Ezekiel ben Buzi, “No foreigner, uncircumcised of heart or uncircumcised of flesh, shall enter into My sanctuary” Before Ezekiel came, who said Rather, they learned it as a tradition and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse. Here, too, they learned it as a tradition and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Ashi: From where does this come, that Ezekiel said? Who said it? And according to your reasoning, this that Rav Hisda said: We did not learn this matter from the Torah of Moses our teacher, but we learned it from the words of Ezekiel son of Buzi: "No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter My sanctuary" — From where does this come, that Ezekiel said? Rather, the Gemara concludes it, and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse. Here too: the Gemara concludes it, and Ezekiel came and supported it with a verse.

hebrew_text: ״מׇשְׁזָר״ שְׁמוֹנָה. מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעֲשׂוּ עַל שׁוּלֵי הַמְּעִיל רִמּוֹנֵי תְּכֵלֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן וְתוֹלַעַת שָׁנִי מׇשְׁזָר״, וְיָלֵיף ״מׇשְׁזָר״ ״מׇשְׁזָר״ מִפָּרוֹכֶת, מָה לְהַלָּן עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה — אַף כָּאן עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה, דַּהֲוָה כׇּל חַד וְחַד תַּמְנֵי.
human_translation: twined eight from where do we As it is written: “And they made upon the skirts of the robe pomegranates of sky-blue, and purple, and scarlet, twined” and derive “twined” “twined” from the curtain: Just as there, twenty-four so too here, twenty-four that each one of them was eight
llm_translation: "Meshzar" his name is eight. From where do we derive this? As it is written: "And they made on the hems of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson, and twisted linen" (Exodus 39:24). And it adds "meshzar" "meshzar" from the curtain. Just as there were twenty-four there, so too here there are twenty-four, for each and every one was doubled.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מֵחֹשֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד: מָה לְהַלָּן עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה, אַף כָּאן עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה! דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ זָהָב, מִדָּבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ זָהָב, לְאַפּוֹקֵי חֹשֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בָּהֶן זָהָב. אַדְּרַבָּה: דָּנִין בֶּגֶד מִבֶּגֶד, לְאַפּוֹקֵי פָּרוֹכֶת — דְּאֹהֶל הוּא!
human_translation: Let us derive from breastplate and ephod Just as there, twenty-eight so too, here twenty-eight derive an item, with regard to which gold is not stated, from an item, with regard to which gold is not stated. to exclude breastplate and ephod, with regard to which gold is stated. On the contrary, derive garment from garment, to exclude curtain, which is a tent,
llm_translation: And they shall take from the blue and the purple and the scarlet, and the fine linen. What is there, twenty-eight? Also here, twenty-eight! We evaluate something that gold is not mentioned in it, something that gold is not mentioned in it, to exclude the breastplate and the ephod, in which gold is mentioned. On the contrary: we evaluate garment from garment, to exclude the curtain - for it is a tent!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דָּנִין מֵאַבְנֵט, וְדָנִין בֶּגֶד וְדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ זָהָב, מִבֶּגֶד וְדָבָר שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בּוֹ זָהָב, וְאֵין דָּנִין דָּבָר שֶׁאֵין בּוֹ זָהָב מִדָּבָר שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ זָהָב.
human_translation: Rather, is derived from the belt, and a garment and an item with regard to which gold is not stated, are derived a garment and an item with regard to which gold is not stated. And an item with no gold, is not derived from an item that has gold in it,
llm_translation: Rather: we judge from a net, and we judge from a garment and a matter in which gold is not mentioned, from a garment and a matter in which gold is not mentioned, and we do not judge a matter that does not have gold from a matter that has gold.

hebrew_text: רַב מָרִי אָמַר: ״תַּעֲשֶׂנּוּ״ כְּתִיב. תַּעֲשֶׂנּוּ לָזֶה, וְלֹא לְאַחֵר.
human_translation: Rav Mari said you shall make it” is written you shall make it, for this, and not for anything else.
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: "Ta'asenu" is written. Ta'asenu for this, and not for another.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ״ כְּתִיב, שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כׇּל עֲשִׂיּוֹת שָׁווֹת. וְהֵיכִי נֶעְבֵּיד? נֶעְבֵּיד תְּלָתָא דְּעַשְׂרָה עַשְׂרָה — הָווּ לְהוּ תְּלָתִין! נֶעְבֵּיד תְּרֵי דְּתִשְׁעָה תִּשְׁעָה וְחַד דְּעַשְׂרָה — אֲמַר קְרָא: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ״, שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כׇּל עֲשִׂיּוֹתָיו שָׁווֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said “And you shall make is written that all the makings of it must be equal, how should we do Let us make three of ten each; they are thirty Let us make two of nine and one of ten; the verse states: “And you shall make,” that all the makings of it must be equal.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "And you shall make" is written, that all actions should be equal. And how is this done? It is done with three sets of ten - let them be thirty! It is done with two sets of nine and one of ten - the verse says: "And you shall make," that all his actions should be equal.

hebrew_text: מְעִיל שְׁנֵים עָשָׂר, מְנָא לַן — דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ אֶת מְעִיל הָאֵפוֹד
human_translation: robe twelve from where do we As it is written: “And you shall make the robe of the ephod
llm_translation: Cloak twelve, count to us - as it is written: "And you shall make the cloak of the ephod"

hebrew_text: כְּלִיל תְּכֵלֶת״, וְיָלֵיף ״תְּכֵלֶת״ ״תְּכֵלֶת״ מִפָּרוֹכֶת: מָה לְהַלָּן שִׁשָּׁה, אַף כָּאן שִׁשָּׁה.
human_translation: spun of sky-blue” And derive “sky-blue” “sky-blue” from the curtain: Just as there, six so too here, six
llm_translation: "Kilay Techelet," and he deduced "Techelet" "Techelet" from Parochet: Just as there (it is) six, so too here (it is) six."

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מִשּׁוּלָיו וְרִמּוֹנָיו — מָה לְהַלָּן שְׁמוֹנָה, אַף כָּאן שְׁמוֹנָה! דָּנִין כְּלִי מִכְּלִי, וְאֵין דָּנִין כְּלִי מִתַּכְשִׁיט כְּלִי.
human_translation: Let us derive from its hem and pomegranates: Just as there, eight so too here, eight derive a utensil, from utensil, and not derive a utensil from an ornament of a utensil,
llm_translation: And he peeled off its branches and its pomegranates — just as there its name is eight, so too here its name is eight! We evaluate a vessel from a vessel, but we do not evaluate a vessel from an adorned vessel.

hebrew_text: אַדְּרַבָּה: דָּנִין גּוּפוֹ מִגּוּפוֹ, וְאֵין דָּנִין גּוּפוֹ מֵעָלְמָא. הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִינַן: לִשְׁאָר בְּגָדִים שֶׁלֹּא נֶאֱמַר בָּהֶן ״שֵׁשׁ״.
human_translation: On the contrary, derive an object from that object itself, and not derive object from elsewhere. This is what we said to other garments about which shesh is not stated,
llm_translation: The Great Ravah said: One judges his own body from his own body, and one does not judge his body from elsewhere. This is what we say: for other garments that do not have "six" mentioned in them.

hebrew_text: פָּרֹכֶת עֶשְׂרִים וְאַרְבָּעָה — אַרְבְּעָה דְּשִׁיתָּא שִׁיתָּא, לָא דִּינָא וְלָא דַּיָּינָא.
human_translation: curtain twenty-four four each one of six there is neither judgment nor judge,
llm_translation: The curtain twenty and four — four of six, not judgment and not wine.

hebrew_text: חוֹשֶׁן וְאֵפוֹד עֶשְׂרִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ חֹשֶׁן מִשְׁפָּט מַעֲשֵׂה חוֹשֵׁב כְּמַעֲשֵׂה אֵפוֹד תַּעֲשֶׂנּוּ זָהָב תְּכֵלֶת וְאַרְגָּמָן וְתוֹלַעַת שָׁנִי וְשֵׁשׁ מׇשְׁזָר״, אַרְבְּעָה דְּשִׁיתָּא שִׁיתָּא — עֶשְׂרִין וְאַרְבְּעָה, זָהָב — אַרְבְּעָה, הָא עֶשְׂרִין וּתְמָנְיָא.
human_translation: breastplate and ephod twenty-eight From where do we As it is written: “And you shall make a breastplate of judgment, the work of the skilled craftsman; like the work of the ephod you shall make it: Of gold, sky-blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen” four each of six twenty-four. gold four twenty-eight.
llm_translation: The breastplate and the ephod, how many do we have? As it is written: "And you shall make a breastplate of judgment, the work of a skillful workman; like the work of the ephod you shall make it: of gold, of blue, purple, and scarlet material, and fine twisted linen you shall make it." Four of the six — twenty-eight, gold — four, so we have twenty-eight and four.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא זָהָב נָמֵי שִׁשָּׁה! אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וְקִצֵּץ פְּתִילִים״. ״פְּתִיל״, ״פְּתִילִים״ — הֲרֵי כָּאן אַרְבָּעָה.
human_translation: say gold six Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said the verse states: and cut it into cords, “Cord” “cords” Accordingly, there are four here.
llm_translation: And why not gold like linen? Rav Acha bar Yaakov said, the verse says: "And he shall cut the threads." "Thread," "threads" - here are four.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר, אָמַר קְרָא: ״לַעֲשׂוֹת בְּתוֹךְ הַתְּכֵלֶת וּבְתוֹךְ הָאַרְגָּמָן״. הֵיכִי נַעֲבֵיד? נַעֲבֵיד אַרְבְּעָה דִּתְרֵי תְּרֵי — הָווּ לְהוּ תְּמָנְיָא. נַעֲבֵיד תְּרֵי דִּתְרֵי תְּרֵי, וּתְרֵי דְּחַד חַד — ״וְעָשִׂיתָ״, שֶׁיִּהְיוּ כׇּל עֲשִׂיּוֹתָיו שָׁווֹת.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: the verse states “To work it into the sky-blue, and into the purple” What we do? we make four of two each there would be eight. we make two of two each, and two of one each, “And you shall make,” that all its makings should be the same.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, the verse says: "to do within the blue and within the purple." How do we do it? We do four threads of two threads - they should be eight. We do two threads of three threads, and three threads of one thread - "and you shall make," so that all his deeds are equal.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַחֲבָא אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: הַמְקָרֵעַ בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה לוֹקֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יִקָּרֵעַ״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, וְדִילְמָא הָכִי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא: נַעֲבֵיד לֵיהּ שָׂפָה כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נִיקְּרַע! מִי כְּתִיב ״שֶׁלֹּא יִקָּרֵעַ״?
human_translation: Raḥava said Rav Yehuda said: One who tears priestly vestments is flogged, as it is stated it shall not be torn” Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov strongly objects to this: But perhaps this is what the Merciful One is saying An opening should be made in order that it not tear. Is it written: In order that it not be torn?
llm_translation: Said Rahava said Rav Yehudah: One who tears the priestly garments is liable, as it is stated: "He shall not tear." Rav Acha bar Yaakov objected to him: Perhaps the Merciful One meant that we should make a hem for it so that it will not tear! Where is it written "He shall not tear"?

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הַמַּזִּיחַ חוֹשֶׁן מֵעַל הָאֵפוֹד, וְהַמֵּסִיר בַּדֵּי אָרוֹן — לוֹקֶה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֹא יִזַּח״ וְ״לָא יָסוּרוּ״. מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: וְדִילְמָא כִּי קָאָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, חַדְּקִינְהוּ וְעַבְדִינְהוּ שַׁפִּיר כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יִזַּח וְלֹא יָסוּרוּ! מִי כְּתִיב ״שֶׁלֹּא יִזַּח״ וְ״שֶׁלֹּא יָסוּרוּ״?!
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who detaches the breastplate from upon the ephod one who removes the staves of the Ark is flogged, as it is stated: shall not be detached they shall not be removed Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov strongly objects to this: perhaps when the Merciful One said to strengthen them and make them fast so that not become detached and not be removed. Is it written: In order that it not become detached, and: In order that they not be removed?
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who removes the breastplate from above the ephod, and one who removes the staves from the ark, is liable, as it is stated: "They shall not be removed" and "nor shall they be removed." Rav Acha bar Yaakov objected: Perhaps when the Merciful One said to attach and to make them well, it is in order that they shall not be removed and not be removed! Where is it written "they shall not be removed" and "nor shall they be removed"?!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״בְּטַבְּעוֹת הָאָרוֹן יִהְיוּ הַבַּדִּים לֹא יָסוּרוּ מִמֶּנּוּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְהוּבָא אֶת בַּדָּיו בַּטַּבָּעוֹת״! הָא כֵּיצַד? מִתְפָּרְקִין וְאֵין נִשְׁמָטִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, raised a contradiction. it is written: “The staves shall be in the rings of the Ark; they shall not be removed from it” it is written: “And its staves shall be put into the rings” How is this could be removed did not come out.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina raised a contradiction: It is written, "The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark; they shall not be removed from it," and it is also written, "And he inserted the poles into the rings!" How is this so? They would be disassembled but not removed.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: ״בְּטַבְּעוֹת הָאָרוֹן יִהְיוּ הַבַּדִּים״. יָכוֹל לֹא יִהְיוּ זָזִין מִמְּקוֹמָן? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְהוּבָא אֶת בַּדָּיו בַּטַּבָּעוֹת״, אִי ״וְהוּבָא אֶת בַּדָּיו״, יָכוֹל יִהְיוּ נִכְנָסִין וְיוֹצְאִין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בְּטַבְּעוֹת הָאָרוֹן יִהְיוּ הַבַּדִּים״. הָא כֵּיצַד? מִתְפָּרְקִין, וְאֵין נִשְׁמָטִין.
human_translation: That was also taught “The staves shall be in the rings of the Ark; might they should not move from their place the verse states: “And its staves shall be put into the rings” If And its staves shall be put, might they are inserted and removed the verse states: “The staves shall be in the rings of the Ark; How is this? They could be removed did not come out.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita in the name of the Sage Nahum the Mede: "In the rings of the Ark shall the poles be." Could it be that they should not move from their place? The Torah teaches us: "And the poles shall be in the rings," if it had only said "and the poles," one might have thought they could be inserted and removed - therefore the Torah states: "In the rings of the Ark shall the poles be." How so? They may be unscrewed, but not removed.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים עוֹמְדִים״, שֶׁעוֹמְדִים דֶּרֶךְ גְּדִילָתָן. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״עוֹמְדִים״, שֶׁמַּעֲמִידִין אֶת צִפּוּיָין. דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״עוֹמְדִים״. שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר אָבַד סִבְרָן וּבָטֵל סִכּוּיָין — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״עוֹמְדִים״, שֶׁעוֹמְדִין לְעוֹלָם וּלְעוֹלָמִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: What is which is written: acacia wood, standing” that stand in the direction in which they grew Alternatively, “standing” that they supported their plating Alternatively, “standing” Perhaps you will say their hope is lost and their chance is abandoned, the verse states “standing” that they stand forever and ever.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama son of Rabbi Ḥanina said, what is the meaning of what is written: "Acacia trees standing," that they stand in their greatness. Another explanation: "standing," that they establish the prophecy. Another explanation: "standing," lest you say their thought has been lost and their covering has been nullified - the Talmud teaches: "standing," that they stand forever and ever.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא בַּר חֲנִינָא, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״אֶת בִּגְדֵי הַשְּׂרָד לְשָׁרֵת בַּקּוֹדֶשׁ״ —
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: What is which is written: “The plaited serad garments, for serving in the Sanctuary”
llm_translation: Rabbi Hama son of Hanina said, what is the meaning of what is written: "The holy garments for ministering in the sanctuary" —

hebrew_text: אִלְמָלֵא בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה, לֹא נִשְׁתַּיֵּיר מִשּׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׂרִיד וּפָלִיט.
human_translation: Were it not for the priestly vestments, there would not remain a remnant sarid or survivor from the haters of the Jewish people,
llm_translation: If not for the priestly garments, the remnants and survivors of the Israelites would not have been left.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר: דְּבֵי רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן תָּנָא: בְּגָדִים שֶׁגּוֹרְדִין אוֹתָן כִּבְרִיָּיתָן מִכְּלֵיהֶן, וּמְשָׂרְדִין מֵהֶן כְּלוּם. מַאי הִיא? רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אֵלּוּ מַעֲשֵׂה מַחַט.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said the school Rabbi Shimon taught: garments that are woven in their completed form upon the loom, and a small part of them remains masridin What is Reish Lakish said: This is the needle-work
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: The school of Rabbi Shimon taught: with garments that one tears them like their original state from their vessels, and they remain intact. What is it? Reish Lakish said: these are the actions of Mahat.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה אֵין עוֹשִׂין אוֹתָן מַעֲשֵׂה מַחַט, אֶלָּא מַעֲשֵׂה אוֹרֵג, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מַעֲשֵׂה אוֹרֵג״! אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לְבֵית יָד שֶׁלָּהֶם. כִּדְתַנְיָא: בֵּית יָד שֶׁל בִּגְדֵי כְהוּנָּה נֶאֱרֶגֶת בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ, וְנִדְבֶּקֶת עִם הַבֶּגֶד, וּמַגַּעַת עַד פִּיסַּת הַיָּד.
human_translation: raises an objection to this Priestly vestments not be made through needle-work but woven work, as it is stated: “Woven work” Abaye said: is necessary only for, the sleeves. As it was taught A sleeve priestly vestments is woven separately and attached to the garment and reach as far as the palm of the hand.
llm_translation: Challenger: The garments of the priesthood are not made with the work of a needle, but with the work of weaving, as it is stated: "work of weaving"! Abbaye said: It is only needed for their own household. As it was taught: The household of the garments of the priesthood is woven separately, and it is sewn onto the garment, and it touches until the edge of the hand.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַחֲבָה אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: שָׁלֹשׁ אֲרוֹנוֹת עָשָׂה בְּצַלְאֵל, אֶמְצָעִי שֶׁל עֵץ תִּשְׁעָה, פְּנִימִי שֶׁל זָהָב שְׁמוֹנָה, חִיצוֹן עֲשָׂרָה וּמַשֶּׁהוּ.
human_translation: Raḥava said Rav Yehuda said: Bezalel made three arks: A middle one of wood, nine an inner one of gold, eight outer one ten and a bit.
llm_translation: Rahavah said, Rav Yehudah said: Three arks were made by Betzalel, the middle one of wood nine, the inner one of gold eight, the outer one of ten and its measurement.

hebrew_text: וְהָתַנְיָא: אַחַד עָשָׂר וּמַשֶּׁהוּ! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר יֵשׁ בְּעׇבְיוֹ טֶפַח, הָא כְּמַאן דְּאָמַר אֵין בְּעׇבְיוֹ טֶפַח. וּמַאי מַשֶּׁהוּ — זֵיר.
human_translation: But wasn’t it taught eleven and a bit? This is not difficult: This is in accordance with the one who said the thickness was one handbreadth. That is in accordance with the one who said the thickness was not one handbreadth And what is bit? crown
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught: "One is eleven and it is sufficient!" It is not difficult: this one is like the one who says there is a handbreadth in its thickness, and this one is like the one who says there is no handbreadth in its thickness. And what is "it is sufficient" - a crown. English translation: And it was taught: "One is eleven and it is sufficient!" It is not difficult: this one is like the one who says there is a handbreadth in its thickness, and this one is like the one who says there is no handbreadth in its thickness. And what is "it is sufficient" - a crown.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, שְׁלֹשָׁה זֵירִים הֵן: שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ, וְשֶׁל אָרוֹן, וְשֶׁל שֻׁלְחָן. שֶׁל מִזְבֵּחַ — זָכָה אַהֲרֹן וּנְטָלוֹ. שֶׁל שֻׁלְחָן — זָכָה דָּוִד וּנְטָלוֹ. שֶׁל אָרוֹן — עֲדַיִין מוּנָּח הוּא, כָּל הָרוֹצֶה לִיקַּח — יָבֹא וְיִקַּח. שְׁמָּא תֹּאמַר פָּחוּת הוּא, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בִּי מְלָכִים יִמְלוֹכוּ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: There three crowns of the altar, and of the Ark, and of the table. of the altar Aaron was deserving and took it, of the table David was deserving and took it of the Ark it is still sitting and anyone who wishes to take come and take Perhaps you will say it is inferior the verse states “Through me kings will reign”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said, "There are three compartments: one for the altar, one for the ark, and one for the table. Regarding the altar - Aaron merited and took it. Regarding the table - David merited and took it. Regarding the ark - it is still placed, anyone who wishes to take it may come and take it. Lest you say it is of lesser importance, the Scripture states: 'By me kings reign.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רָמֵי. כְּתִיב: ״זָר״, וְקָרֵינַן ״זֵיר״. זָכָה — נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ זֵיר, לֹא זָכָה — זָרָה הֵימֶנּוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised a contradiction: is written zar , but we read zeir , is deserving it becomes a crown [ zeir ] for him; is not deserving, will be a stranger [ zara ] to him
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raises an objection. It is written: "zar," and we read it as "zeir." If he merited it, it becomes a "zeir" for him; if he did not merit it, it becomes a "zar" for him.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן רָמֵי. כְּתִיב: ״וְעָשִׂיתָ לְּךָ אֲרוֹן עֵץ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְעָשׂוּ אֲרוֹן עֲצֵי שִׁטִּים״, מִכָּאן לְתַלְמִיד חָכָם, שֶׁבְּנֵי עִירוֹ מְצֻוִּוין לַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ מְלַאכְתּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised a contradiction: It is written: “And you shall make for yourself a wooden Ark” and it is written: “And they shall make an Ark of acacia wood” from here to a Torah scholar that the members of his town should perform his work for him
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raises a contradiction. It is written: "And you shall make for yourself an ark of wood," and it is written: "And they shall make an ark of acacia wood." From here we learn regarding a Torah scholar, that the residents of his city are commanded to provide for him his livelihood.

hebrew_text: ״מִבַּיִת וּמִחוּץ תְּצַפֶּנּוּ״. אָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל תַּלְמִיד חָכָם שֶׁאֵין תּוֹכוֹ כְּבָרוֹ — אֵינוֹ תַּלְמִיד חָכָם.
human_translation: “From within and from without you shall cover it” Rava said: any Torah scholar whose inside is not like his outside, is not a Torah scholar.
llm_translation: "From inside and from outside you shall cover it." Rava said: Any Torah scholar whose inside is not like his outside - he is not a Torah scholar.

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבָּה בַּר עוּלָּא: נִקְרָא נִתְעָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַף כִּי נִתְעָב וְנֶאֱלָח אִישׁ שׁוֹתֶה כַמַּיִם עַוְלָה״.
human_translation: Abaye said, and some say Rabba bar Ulla called loathsome, as it is stated: “What then of one loathsome and foul, man who drinks iniquity like water”
llm_translation: Abaye said, and some say it was Rabba bar Ulla: It is called "disgusting," as it is stated: "Even though disgusting and corrupt is a man who drinks like water injustice."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״לָמָּה זֶּה מְחִיר בְּיַד כְּסִיל לִקְנוֹת חׇכְמָה וְלֶב אָיִן״ — אוֹי לָהֶם לְשׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, שֶׁעוֹסְקִין בַּתּוֹרָה וְאֵין בָּהֶן יִרְאַת שָׁמַיִם.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: What is which is written: “Why is there a price in the hand of a fool to buy wisdom, as he has no heart?” Woe to them, haters of Torah scholars, who immerse themselves in Torah and have no fear of Heaven.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan, what is the meaning of what is written: "Why is there a price in the hand of a fool to acquire wisdom, when he has no heart?" Woe to the enemies of the disciples of the sages, who engage in Torah study but lack fear of Heaven.

hebrew_text: מַכְרִיז רַבִּי יַנַּאי: חֲבָל עַל דְּלֵית לֵיהּ דָּרְתָּא, וְתַרְעָא לְדָרְתֵּיהּ עָבֵיד.
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai declared Pity who has no courtyard but makes a gate for his courtyard.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai proclaims: "Woe to one who has no dwelling, and woe to one who has two dwellings."

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לְהוּ רָבָא לְרַבָּנַן: בְּמָטוּתָא מִינַּיְיכוּ, לָא תִּירְתוּן תַּרְתֵּי גֵּיהִנָּם.
human_translation: Rava said to the Sages I beg of you, do not inherit Gehenna twice.
llm_translation: Rava said to the Rabbis: In matters of halakha, do not fear the two Gehinnoms.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי, מַאי דִּכְתִיב: ״וְזֹאת הַתּוֹרָה אֲשֶׁר שָׂם מֹשֶׁה״, זָכָה — נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ סַם חַיִּים, לֹא זָכָה — נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ סַם מִיתָה. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רָבָא: דְּאוֹמֵן לַהּ — סַמָּא דְחַיָּיא, דְּלָא אוֹמֵן לַהּ — סַמָּא דְמוֹתָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: What is which is written: “And this is the Torah which Moses put sam is deserving, becomes a potion [ sam ] of life for him. is not deserving, becomes a potion of death for him. And this is what Rava said: For one who is skillful a potion of life; for one who is not skillful it is a potion of death.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said, what is the meaning of what is written: "And this is the Torah that Moses placed"? If one merits, it becomes for him a potion of life; if one does not merit, it becomes for him a potion of death. And this is what Rava said: one who is accustomed to it, it is a potion of life; one who is not accustomed to it, it is a potion of death.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי, רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״פִּקּוּדֵי ה׳ יְשָׁרִים מְשַׂמְּחֵי לֵב״, וּכְתִיב: ״אִמְרַת ה׳ צְרוּפָה״. זָכָה — מְשַׂמַּחְתּוֹ, לֹא זָכָה — צוֹרַפְתּוֹ. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר, מִגּוּפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא נָפְקָא: זָכָה — צוֹרַפְתּוֹ לְחַיִּים, לֹא זָכָה — צוֹרַפְתּוֹ לְמִיתָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan raised a contradiction: It was written: “The precepts of the Lord are upright, gladdening the heart” “The word of the Lord is refining” is deserving, gladdens him; is not deserving, refines him. Reish Lakish said: emerges from that verse itself: is deserving, refines him for life; is not deserving, it refines him for death.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, Rabbi Yonatan the Roman said, as it is written: "The precepts of the Lord are upright, gladdening the heart," and it is written: "The word of the Lord is refined." If one merits it - it gladdens him, if one does not merit it - it refines him. Reish Lakish said, from the body of the verse it emerges: if one merits it - it refines him for life, if one does not merit it - it refines him for death.

hebrew_text: ״יִרְאַת ה׳ טְהוֹרָה עוֹמֶדֶת לָעַד״. אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: זֶה הַלּוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה בְּטָהֳרָה. מַאי הִיא? נוֹשֵׂא אִשָּׁה, וְאַחַר כָּךְ לוֹמֵד תּוֹרָה.
human_translation: “Fear of the Lord is pure, it stands forever” Rabbi Ḥanina said: This one who studies Torah in purity; What is this; One marries a woman and afterward studies Torah.
llm_translation: "The fear of the Lord is pure, enduring forever." Rabbi Chanina said: This refers to one who learns Torah in purity. What is it? He marries a woman, and only afterwards learns Torah.

hebrew_text: ״עֵדוּת ה׳ נֶאֱמָנָה״, אָמַר רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא: נֶאֱמָנָה הִיא לְהָעִיד בְּלוֹמְדֶיהָ.
human_translation: “The testimony of God is faithful” Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: is faithful to testify about those who study it
llm_translation: "The testimony of the Lord is trustworthy," Rabbi Hiyya bar Abba said: It is trustworthy to testify in favor of its students."

hebrew_text: ״מַעֲשֵׂה רוֹקֵם״, ״מַעֲשֵׂה חוֹשֵׁב״, אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: שֶׁרוֹקְמִין בִּמְקוֹם שֶׁחוֹשְׁבִין.
human_translation: “work of an embroiderer” “work of a designer” Rabbi Elazar said: They embroidered the place where they had designed.
llm_translation: "The matter of a weaver," "the matter of a designer," Rabbi Elazar said: weavers in a place where designers are."

hebrew_text: תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי נְחֶמְיָה: ״רוֹקֵם״ — מַעֲשֵׂה מַחַט, לְפִיכָךְ פַּרְצוּף אֶחָד. ״חוֹשֵׁב״ — מַעֲשֵׂה אוֹרֵג, לְפִיכָךְ שְׁנֵי פַּרְצוּפוֹת.
human_translation: taught in the name of Rabbi Neḥemya: an embroiderer” needlework, therefore one face. a designer” woven work, therefore two faces.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Nechemiah: "Roqem" - the work of a weaver, therefore one pattern. "Choshev" - the work of an embroiderer, therefore two patterns.

hebrew_text: בְּאֵלּוּ נִשְׁאָלִין בְּאוּרִים וְתוּמִּים. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי, אָמַר: בְּגָדִים שֶׁכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבִגְדֵי הַקּוֹדֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר לְאַהֲרֹן יִהְיוּ לְבָנָיו אַחֲרָיו״, לְמִי שֶׁבָּא בִּגְדוּלָּה אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: in these be consulted for Urim VeTummim . When Rav Dimi came said: garments in which the High Priest serves priest anointed for war serves. As it is stated: “And the sacred garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him” to the one who comes after him in greatness,
llm_translation: In these cases they inquire with Urim and Thummim. When Rav Dimi came, he said: With garments that the High Priest serves in, one involved in warfare serves in, as it is said: "And the holy garments that are for Aaron shall be for his sons after him," for one who comes after him in greatness.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַהֲבָה, וְאָמְרִי לַהּ כְּדִי: יָכוֹל יְהֵא בְּנוֹ שֶׁל מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה מְשַׁמֵּשׁ תַּחְתָּיו כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁבְּנוֹ שֶׁל כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְשַׁמֵּשׁ תַּחְתָּיו —
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava raised an objection, and some say it unattributed: might the son of the priest anointed for war serves in his place, in the same way that the son of a High Priest serves in his place
llm_translation: The text states: Rav Adda bar Ahava raised an objection, and they said to him in response: Is it possible that the son of an anointed one for war serves beneath him, just as the son of the High Priest serves beneath him?

hebrew_text: תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שִׁבְעַת יָמִים יִלְבָּשָׁם הַכֹּהֵן תַּחְתָּיו מִבָּנָיו אֲשֶׁר יָבֹא אֶל אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד״, מִי שֶׁרָאוּי לָבֹא אֶל אֹהֶל מוֹעֵד. וְאִם אִיתָא — מִיחְזֵא חֲזֵי!
human_translation: the verse states: “Seven days shall he wear them, the one who serves in his stead from among his sons, who comes into the Tent of Meeting who is fit to enter the Tent of Meeting, And if it is so, he is fit
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "Seven days shall the priest put on the garments, under him from his sons, when he enters the tent of meeting." Only one who is fitting to enter the tent of meeting. And if it comes — see and see!

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, הָכִי קָאָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁעִיקַּר מְשִׁיחָתוֹ לְאֹהֶל מוֹעֵד. יָצָא זֶה, שֶׁעִיקַּר מְשִׁיחָתוֹ לְמִלְחָמָה.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said this is what is saying: anyone for whom the primary purpose of his anointment Tent of Meeting. excludes this for whom the primary purpose of his anointment is for war.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, thus he said: Anyone whose primary intent is for the Tent of Meeting. This one has fulfilled his obligation, whose primary intent is for war.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה אֵינוֹ מְשַׁמֵּשׁ לֹא בְּאַרְבָּעָה כְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט, לֹא בִּשְׁמוֹנָה כְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: raises an objection the priest anointed for war serves neither in four like a common nor in eight like a High Priest.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: Challenger: One anointed for war does not serve, neither in a group of four like a common priest, nor in a group of eight like the High Priest.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אֶלָּא זָר מְשַׁוֵּית לֵיהּ! אֶלָּא: כְּכֹהֵן גָּדוֹל — מִשּׁוּם אֵיבָה, כְּכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט — מִשּׁוּם מַעֲלִין בַּקֹּדֶשׁ וְלֹא מוֹרִידִין.
human_translation: Abaye said to him: you make him like a non-priest? Rather, like a High Priest due to animosity like a common priest, due to One elevates in sanctity and one does not downgrade.
llm_translation: He said to him, Abaye: Rather, a non-priest is disqualified for her! Rather: as a high priest - due to enmity, as a regular priest - due to elevating in holiness and not lowering.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב אַדָּא בַּר אַבָּא לְרָבָא: וְהַאי תַּנָּא דְּלֵית לֵיהּ אֵיבָה, וְלָא קָא מְשַׁמֵּשׁ.
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Abba said to Rava: But this tanna who does not animosity does not serve
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Adda bar Abba to Rava: And this Tanna who does not have enmity, yet he does not serve.

hebrew_text: דְּתַנְיָא, דְּבָרִים שֶׁבֵּין כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל לְכֹהֵן הֶדְיוֹט: פַּר כֹּהֵן מָשִׁיחַ, וּפַר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת, וּפַר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה.
human_translation: As it was taught The matters in which between a High Priest and a common The bull of the anointed priest, the bull brought for all the mitzvot, And the bull of Yom Kippur; And the tenth of an ephah
llm_translation: It was taught: Regarding matters between the High Priest and an ordinary priest: a bull for the anointed priest, and a bull for the congregation for all the commandments, and a bull for the Day of Atonement, and a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew_text: לֹא פּוֹרֵעַ, וְלֹא פּוֹרֵם, אֲבָל פּוֹרֵם הוּא מִלְּמַטָּה, וְהַהֶדְיוֹט מִלְמַעְלָה. וְאֵין מִטַּמֵּא לִקְרוֹבָיו, וּמְצֻוֶּוה עַל הַבְּתוּלָה, וּמוּזְהָר עַל הָאַלְמָנָה, וּמַחֲזִיר אֶת הָרוֹצֵחַ.
human_translation: does not let grow wild, nor does he rend But he does rend from below, the common from above And he not become ritually impure his close relatives, And he is commanded to virgin, and he is prohibited from widow, And allows the return of the killer
llm_translation: He does not uncover, and they do not uncover, but he uncovers from below, and the layman from above. And one does not become impure for his relatives, and he is commanded concerning the virgin, and he is warned concerning the widow, and he returns the murderer.

hebrew_text: וּמַקְרִיב אוֹנֵן, וְאֵינוֹ אוֹכֵל, וְאֵינוֹ חוֹלֵק, וְנוֹטֵל חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ, וּמַקְרִיב חֵלֶק בָּרֹאשׁ. וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ בִּשְׁמֹנָה כֵּלִים, וּפָטוּר עַל טוּמְאַת מִקְדָּשׁ וְקָדָשָׁיו, וְכׇל עֲבוֹדוֹת יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אֵינָן כְּשֵׁירוֹת אֶלָּא בּוֹ.
human_translation: And he sacrifices an acute mourner, but he may not eat and he may not take a portion And he takes portion first And first to sacrifice And he serves eight garments. And he is exempt from ritual impurity to the Temple and its sacred objects. And all Yom Kippur service are valid only by him.
llm_translation: He who is an onen, and does not eat, and does not divide, and takes a portion at the head, and offers a portion at the head. And he serves with eight vessels, and is exempt from impurity of the sanctuary and its holy things, and all the services of Yom Kippur are not valid except with him.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן נוֹהֲגוֹת בִּמְרוּבֵּה בְּגָדִים, חוּץ מִפַּר הַבָּא עַל כׇּל הַמִּצְוֹת.
human_translation: And all these apply of many garments. except the bull brought for all the mitzvot,
llm_translation: And all of them are accustomed with the majority in garments, except for a cow that comes upon all the commandments.

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן נוֹהֲגוֹת בְּמָשׁוּחַ שֶׁעָבַר, חוּץ מִפַּר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וַעֲשִׂירִית הָאֵיפָה.
human_translation: And all these apply to a former High Priest except the bull on Yom Kippur and the tenth of an ephah
llm_translation: "And all of them are practiced with anointing that has passed, except for the bull of Yom Kippur and the tenth of the ephah."

hebrew_text: וְכוּלָּן אֵין נוֹהֲגוֹת בִּמְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה, חוּץ מֵחֲמִשָּׁה דְּבָרִים הָאֲמוּרִין בַּפָּרָשָׁה: לֹא פּוֹרֵעַ, וְלֹא פּוֹרֵם, וְלֹא מִטַּמֵּא לִקְרוֹבָיו, וּמְצֻוֶּוה עַל הַבְּתוּלָה, וּמוּזְהָר עַל הָאַלְמָנָה, וּמַחְזִיר אֶת הָרוֹצֵחַ כְּדִבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה, וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: אֵינוֹ מַחְזִיר.
human_translation: And none of them applies to the priest anointed for war, except for five items stated in the passage does not let grow wild nor does he rend And he not become ritually impure his close relatives. And he is commanded to a virgin, and he is prohibited from a widow. And allows the return of the killer in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Yehuda And the Rabbis say: does not allow the return
llm_translation: And all of them do not engage in anointing for war, except for five matters stated in the Torah portion: not to loosen, not to bind, not to defile oneself for his relatives, one who is commanded concerning the virgin, and one who is warned concerning the widow, and returning the murderer according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda, and the sages say: he does not return.

hebrew_text: כִּי לֵית לֵיהּ אֵיבָה — בְּדִכְווֹתֵיהּ, בִּדְזוּטַר מִינֵּיהּ — אִית לֵיהּ.
human_translation: When has no animosity where is similar to him, inferior to him he does
llm_translation: For he has no enmity - in his thoughts, in his actions - he has enmity.

hebrew_text: יְתֵיב רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ וְקָאָמַר לַהּ לְהָא שְׁמַעְתָּא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן. אַהְדְּרִינְהוּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי לְאַפַּיְיהוּ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, רַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא אֲמַרָה, וְאַהְדְּרִינְהוּ רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי לְאַפַּיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu was sitting and saying this halakha in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan. Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi turned their faces Some say Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said it, and Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi turned their faces.
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu was sitting and saying to her, "You have heard this from the name of Rabbi Yochanan." Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Assi repeated it to their faces. Some say, Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said it, and Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Assi repeated it to their faces.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב פָּפָּא: בִּשְׁלָמָא רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ — מִשּׁוּם יְקָרָא דְבֵי קֵיסָר, אֶלָּא לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא בַּר אַבָּא — נֵימְרוּ לֵיהּ מֵימָר: לָא אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן הָכִי.
human_translation: Rav Pappa strongly objects to Granted, Rabbi Abbahu due to the honor of the house of caesar, But they should have said outright to Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba Rabbi Yoḥanan did not say this,
llm_translation: The Gemara challenges him: Rav Papa: With regard to Rabbi Avahu, it is understandable — because of the honor of the house of Caesar. However, with regard to Rabbi Chiya bar Abba — a statement was said to him: Rabbi Yochanan did not say so.

hebrew_text: כִּי אֲתָא רָבִין, אָמַר: נִשְׁאַל אִיתְּמַר. תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: בְּגָדִים שֶׁכֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל מְשַׁמֵּשׁ בָּהֶן — מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה נִשְׁאָל בָּהֶן.
human_translation: When Ravin came said: was stated being consulted That was also taught The garments in which the High Priest serves priest anointed for war is consulted
llm_translation: When Ravin came, he said: It was asked. It was taught similarly: Regarding garments that the High Priest serves in - if they are worn out from battle, they are asked about.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: כֵּיצַד שׁוֹאֲלִין? הַשּׁוֹאֵל פָּנָיו כְּלַפֵּי נִשְׁאָל, וְהַנִּשְׁאָל פָּנָיו כְּלַפֵּי שְׁכִינָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: How does one consult The one asking his face toward the one who is asked, And the one who is asked, his face toward the Divine Presence,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: How do we inquire? The inquirer turns his face towards the one being asked, and the one being asked turns his face towards the Divine Presence.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹאֵל אוֹמֵר: ״אֶרְדּוֹף אַחֲרֵי הַגְּדוּד הַזֶּה״, וְהַנִּשְׁאָל אוֹמֵר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ עֲלֵה וְהַצְלַח״. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אֵין צָרִיךְ לוֹמַר ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳״, אֶלָּא ״עֲלֵה וְהַצְלַח״.
human_translation: The one who asks says “Shall I pursue after this troop?” And the one who is asked says, Thus says God: Go up and succeed. Rabbi Yehuda says: He need not say Thus says God; rather, Go up and succeed,
llm_translation: The inquirer says: "I will pursue after this band," and the one being asked says: "Thus says the Lord: Go up and prosper." Rabbi Yehuda says: It is not necessary to say "Thus says the Lord," rather "Go up and prosper."

hebrew_text: אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין בְּקוֹל, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁאַל לוֹ״. לֹא מְהַרְהֵר בְּלִבּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְשָׁאַל לוֹ לִפְנֵי ה׳״, אֶלָּא כְּדֶרֶךְ שֶׁאָמְרָה חַנָּה בִּתְפִלָּתָהּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְחַנָּה הִיא מְדַבֶּרֶת עַל לִבָּהּ״.
human_translation: One does not ask in a voice, as it is stated: “And who shall inquire for him And he should not think in his heart as it is stated: “And…who shall inquire for him before God” Rather, akin to the way that Hannah spoke in her prayer, as it is stated: “Now Hannah spoke in her heart;
llm_translation: One does not ask in a loud voice, as it is stated: "And he shall inquire of him." He does not ponder in his heart, as it is stated: "And he shall inquire of him before the Lord." Rather, in the manner that Hannah said in her prayer, as it is stated: "Now Hannah spoke in her heart."

hebrew_text: אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין שְׁנֵי דְבָרִים כְּאֶחָד. וְאִם שָׁאַל — אֵין מַחְזִירִין אֶלָּא אֶחָד, וְאֵין מַחְזִירִין לוֹ אֶלָּא רִאשׁוֹן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲיַסְגִּירוּנִי בַעֲלֵי קְעִילָה בְיָדוֹ הֲיֵרֵד שָׁאוּל וְגוֹ׳ וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ יֵרֵד״. וְהָא אָמְרַתְּ אֵין מַחְזִירִין אֶלָּא רִאשׁוֹן! דָּוִד שָׁאַל
human_translation: One does not ask two matters simultaneously; And if he asks he is answered only one and he is answered only the first As it is stated “Will the men of Keilah deliver me into his hand? Will Saul come down?” “And God said: He will come down.” But didn’t you say answered only first David asked
llm_translation: One does not ask two things as one. And if he asked - one does not respond except one, and one does not respond to him except the first, as it is stated: "Will the lords of Keilah deliver me into his hand? Will Saul descend?" And Hashem said, "He will descend." But didn't you say one does not respond except the first! David asked.

hebrew_text: שֶׁלֹּא כַּסֵּדֶר, וְהֶחְזִירוּ לוֹ כַּסֵּדֶר. וְכֵיוָן שֶׁיָּדַע שֶׁשָּׁאַל שֶׁלֹּא כַּסֵּדֶר, חָזַר וְשָׁאַל כַּסֵּדֶר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הֲיַסְגִּירוּ בַּעֲלֵי קְעִילָה אוֹתִי וְאֶת אֲנָשַׁי בְּיַד שָׁאוּל וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ יַסְגִּירוּ״.
human_translation: out of order and he was answered in order. And once he realized that he had asked out of order he went back and asked in order, as it is stated “Will the men of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul? And God said: They will deliver you”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "That they did not act properly, and they returned to him properly. And once he knew that he asked improperly, he returned and asked properly, as it is stated: 'Will the lords of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul?' And the Lord said, 'They will deliver.'"

hebrew_text: וְאִם הוּצְרַךְ הַדָּבָר לִשְׁנַיִם — מַחְזִירִין לוֹ שְׁנַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיִּשְׁאַל דָּוִד בַּה׳ לֵאמֹר הַאֶרְדּוֹף אַחֲרֵי הַגְּדוּד הַזֶּה הַאַשִּׂיגֶנּוּ וַיֹּאמֶר (ה׳) לוֹ רְדוֹף כִּי הַשֵּׂג תַּשִּׂיג וְהַצֵּל תַּצִּיל״.
human_translation: But if the matter requires two he is answered two as it is stated: “And David asked of God, saying: Shall I pursue after this troop? Will I overtake them? And He answered him: Pursue, for you will surely overtake them, and will surely rescue”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if the matter required two - they return two to him, as it is stated: "And David inquired of the Lord, saying, Shall I pursue after this troop? shall I overtake them? And He answered him: Pursue; for thou shalt surely overtake them, and shalt without fail recover all."

hebrew_text: וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁגְּזֵירַת נָבִיא חוֹזֶרֶת — גְּזֵירַת אוּרִים וְתוּמִּים אֵינָהּ חוֹזֶרֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּמִשְׁפַּט הָאוּרִים״.
human_translation: Even though a decree of a prophet can be retracted, a decree of the Urim VeTummim cannot be retracted. As it is stated: “By the judgment of the Urim ”
llm_translation: And even though the decree of a prophet is reversible - the decree of Urim and Thummim is not reversible, as it is stated: "According to the judgment of Urim."

hebrew_text: לָמָּה נִקְרָא שְׁמָן אוּרִים וְתוּמִּים? ״אוּרִים״ — שֶׁמְּאִירִין אֶת דִּבְרֵיהֶן, ״תּוּמִּים״ — שֶׁמַּשְׁלִימִין אֶת דִּבְרֵיהֶן.
human_translation: Why is it called Urim VeTummim ? Urim , it illuminates its words. Tummim , it fulfills its words,
llm_translation: Why are they called Urim and Thummim? "Urim" - because they illuminate their words, "Thummim" - because they complete their words.

hebrew_text: וְאִם תֹּאמַר: בְּגִבְעַת בִּנְיָמִין מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא הִשְׁלִימוּ?
human_translation: And if you say: In the Gibeah of Benjamin why did not fulfill
llm_translation: And if you will say: In Gibeah of Benjamin, why did they not complete?

hebrew_text: הֵם שֶׁלֹּא בִּיחֲנוּ אִם לְנַצֵּחַ אִם לְהִנָּצֵחַ, וּבָאַחֲרוֹנָה שֶׁבִּיחֲנוּ הִסְכִּימוּ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפִנְחָס בֶּן אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן אַהֲרֹן עוֹמֵד לְפָנָיו בַּיָּמִים הָהֵם לֵאמֹר הַאוֹסִיף עוֹד לָצֵאת לַמִּלְחָמָה עִם בְּנֵי בִנְיָמִין אָחִי אִם אֶחְדָּל וַיֹּאמֶר ה׳ עֲלוּ כִּי מָחָר אֶתְּנֶנּוּ בְיָדֶךָ״.
human_translation: they did not check whether they would be victorious or be defeated But on the last time, when they did check agreed as it is stated: “And Pinehas, the son of Elazar, the son of Aaron, stood before it in those days, saying: Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother, or shall I cease? And God said: Go up, for tomorrow I will deliver him into your hand”
llm_translation: They who did not inquire whether to win or to be defeated, and in the latter inquiry they agreed, as it is stated: "And Phinehas son of Eleazar son of Aaron stood before him in those days, saying, 'Shall I yet again go out to battle against the children of Benjamin my brother, or shall I cease?' And the Lord said, 'Go up, for tomorrow I will deliver them into your hand.'"

hebrew_text: כֵּיצַד נַעֲשֵׂית? רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אוֹמֵר: בּוֹלְטוֹת. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אוֹמֵר: מִצְטָרְפוֹת.
human_translation: How is it done? Rabbi Yoḥanan says: protrude, Reish Lakish says: join
llm_translation: How is it done? Rabbi Yochanan says: protruding. Reish Lakish says: overlapping.

hebrew_text: וְהָא לָא כְּתִיב בְּהוּ צָדִי? אָמַר רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר יִצְחָק: ״אַבְרָהָם יִצְחָק וְיַעֲקֹב״ כְּתִיב שָׁם. וְהָא לָא כְּתִיב טֵית! אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: ״שִׁבְטֵי יְשׁוּרוּן״ כְּתִיב שָׁם.
human_translation: But tzadi is not written Rav Shmuel bar Yitzḥak said: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob were written there. But surely tet was not written Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: Shivtei Yeshurun , was written there.
llm_translation: The text states: "But is it not written there 'tzadi' (righteous)?" Rav Shmuel bar Yitzchak said: "Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob" are written there. "But is it not written there 'tet' (good)?" Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: "The tribes of Yeshurun" are written there.

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כׇּל כֹּהֵן שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְדַבֵּר בְּרוּחַ הַקּוֹדֶשׁ וּשְׁכִינָה שׁוֹרָה עָלָיו אֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין בּוֹ, שֶׁהֲרֵי שָׁאַל צָדוֹק וְעָלְתָה לוֹ, אֶבְיָתָר וְלֹא עָלְתָה לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַיַּעַל אֶבְיָתָר עַד תּוֹם כׇּל הָעָם וְגוֹ׳״!
human_translation: raises an objection Any priest who does not speak with Divine Spirit and upon whom the Divine Presence does not rest is not consulted As Zadok inquired and it was effective for him, Ebiathar and it was not effective for him, As it is stated: “But Ebiathar went up until all the people had finished”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A question was raised: Any priest who does not speak with the Holy Spirit and the Divine Presence does not have inquired of him, for Sadducee inquired and it was successful for him, Abiathar inquired and it was not successful for him, as it is stated: "And Abiathar went up until all the people had finished passing out."

hebrew_text: סַיּוֹעֵי הֲוָה מְסַיַּיע בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: assisted the
llm_translation: Helper was helping with them.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין שׁוֹאֲלִין אֶלָּא לְמֶלֶךְ. מְנָא הָנֵי מִילֵּי? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ, דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״וְלִפְנֵי אֶלְעָזָר הַכֹּהֵן יַעֲמֹד וְשָׁאַל לוֹ בְּמִשְׁפַּט הָאוּרִים וְגוֹ׳״. ״הוּא״ — זֶה מֶלֶךְ, ״וְכׇל [בְּנֵי] יִשְׂרָאֵל אִתּוֹ״ — זֶה מְשׁוּחַ מִלְחָמָה, ״וְכׇל הָעֵדָה״ — זוֹ סַנְהֶדְרִין.
human_translation: And may be consulted only on behalf of the king, From where are these matters Rabbi Abbahu said the verse states: “And he shall stand before Elazar the priest, who shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim “He”; this is to a king, “All the children of Israel with him”; this is the priest anointed for war, “Even all the congregation”; this is the Sanhedrin,
llm_translation: And one asks only to the king. From where are these words? Rabbi Abbahu said, as the verse says: "And before Eleazar the priest he shall stand, and he shall inquire for him by the judgment of the Urim, etc." "He" - this is the king, "and all the sons of Israel with him" - this is anointed for war, "and all the congregation" - this is the Sanhedrin.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ בָּא לוֹ כֹּהֵן גָּדוֹל
llm_translation: We will return to you, "Ba lo Kohen Gadol."

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה וּבִשְׁתִיָּה וּבִרְחִיצָה וּבְסִיכָה וּבִנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל, וּבְתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה. וְהַמֶּלֶךְ וְהַכַּלָּה יִרְחֲצוּ אֶת פְּנֵיהֶם, וְהַחַיָּה תִּנְעוֹל אֶת הַסַּנְדָּל, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹסְרִין.
human_translation: Yom Kippur, prohibited in eating and in drinking, and in bathing, and in smearing and in wearing shoes, and in conjugal relations. the king, bride wash their faces A woman after childbirth, wear shoes the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. The Rabbis prohibit
llm_translation: It was taught in a Mishnah: On Yom Kippur, it is prohibited to eat, drink, wash, anoint oneself, wear sandals, or engage in marital relations. The king and the bride may wash their faces, and an animal may wear sandals - the words of Rabbi Eliezer. The Sages prohibit these actions.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹכֵל כְּכוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה, כָּמוֹהָ וּכְגַרְעִינָתָהּ, וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה מְלֹא לוּגְמָיו — חַיָּיב. כׇּל הָאוֹכָלִים מִצְטָרְפִין לְכַכּוֹתֶבֶת, וְכׇל הַמַּשְׁקִין מִצְטָרְפִין לִמְלֹא לוּגְמָיו. הָאוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: One who eats a large date-bulk and its pit, or who drinks a cheekful liable All foods join a date-bulk; and all liquids join a cheekful. one eats and drinks, do not join
llm_translation: The one who eats like a kotevet hagasah, like it and like its kernel, and one who drinks a lug of its water - is liable. All those who eat combine to the measure of a kotevet, and all those who drink combine to a lug of its water. One who eats and drinks do not combine.

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָסוּר?! עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת הוּא! אָמַר רַבִּי אִילָא, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: לֹא נִצְרְכָה אֶלָּא לַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר.
human_translation: prohibited, It punishable by karet Rabbi Ila said, and some say Rabbi Yirmeya said: needed only for a half-measure,
llm_translation: Gemara: Is it really forbidden?! It is a punishment of excision! Rabbi Ila said, and some say Rabbi Yirmeya: It is only needed for half the measure.

hebrew_text: הָנִיחָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חֲצִי שִׁיעוּר אָסוּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה, אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר חֲצִי שִׁיעוּר מוּתָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה, מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר?
human_translation: works out well according to one who said a half-measure is prohibited by Torah But according to one who says a half-measure is permitted by Torah what is to say
llm_translation: The text reads: "Hanicha lemaan de'amar chatzi shiur asur min haTorah, ela lemaan de'amar chatzi shiur mutar min haTorah, mai ikka lemeimar?"

hebrew_text: דְּאִיתְּמַר חֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אָסוּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה, רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מוּתָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה. הָנִיחָא לְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן, אֶלָּא לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? מוֹדֶה רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ שֶׁאָסוּר מִדְּרַבָּנַן.
human_translation: as it was stated a half-measure Rabbi Yoḥanan said: prohibited by Torah Reish Lakish said: permitted by Torah This well to Rabbi Yoḥanan. However, Reish Lakish, what can be said? Reish Lakish concedes that prohibited rabbinic
llm_translation: It was stated: half a measure. Rabbi Yohanan said: forbidden by the Torah. Resh Lakish said: permitted by the Torah. It is fine for Rabbi Yohanan, but for Resh Lakish, what can be said? Resh Lakish concedes that it is forbidden by rabbinic decree.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, לָא נִיחַיַּיב עֲלֵיהּ קׇרְבַּן שְׁבוּעָה, אַלְּמָא תְּנַן: שְׁבוּעָה שֶׁלֹּא אוֹכַל, וְאָכַל נְבֵילוֹת וּטְרֵיפוֹת שְׁקָצִים וּרְמָשִׂים — חַיָּיב. וְרַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן פּוֹטֵר.
human_translation: If so, one should not be liable to bring an offering an oath Why, learn an oath that I will not eat, and ate animal carcasses, tereifot , reptiles, or creeping animals, liable Rabbi Shimon exempts
llm_translation: If so, not liable on it offering oath, but we learned: oath not eating, and ate carrion and torn, abominations and creeping things - liable. And Rabbi Shimon exempts.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: אַמַּאי חַיָּיב? מוּשְׁבָּע וְעוֹמֵד מֵהַר סִינַי הוּא? רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן דְּאָמְרִי: בְּכוֹלֵל דְּבָרִים הַמּוּתָּרִים עִם דְּבָרִים הָאֲסוּרִין.
human_translation: And we discussed it: Why be liable He was already sworn and obligated at Mount Sinai, Rav, and Shmuel, and Rabbi Yoḥanan say includes permitted foods with forbidden foods. animal carcasses
llm_translation: We were in it: Why is he liable? Swearing and standing from Mount Sinai he is? Rav and Shmuel and Rabbi Yochanan who say: Including permissible matters with forbidden matters.

hebrew_text: וְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: אִי אַתָּה מוֹצֵא אֶלָּא בִּמְפָרֵשׁ חֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, וְאַלִּיבָּא דְרַבָּנַן, אוֹ בִּסְתָם,
human_translation: And Reish Lakish said: you will find is explicitly a half-measure, and in accordance with the Rabbis. no specification
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: If you only find in a half measure, and according to the view of the Rabbis, or in a general sense.

hebrew_text: וְאַלִּיבָּא דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא דְּאָמַר: אָדָם אוֹסֵר עַצְמוֹ בְּכׇל שֶׁהוּא!
human_translation: and in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, said: A man prohibits himself from any amount.
llm_translation: And the statement of Rabbi Akiva, who said: "A person restrains himself in every way possible!"

hebrew_text: וְכִי תֵּימָא: כֵּיוָן דְּאִית לֵיהּ הֶיתֵּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה, קָא חָיֵיל קׇרְבַּן שְׁבוּעָה, וְהָתְנַן: שְׁבוּעַת הָעֵדוּת אֵינָהּ נוֹהֶגֶת אֶלָּא בִּרְאוּיִין לְהָעִיד. וְהָוֵינַן בַּהּ: לְמַעוֹטֵי מַאי? רַב פָּפָּא אָמַר: לְמַעוֹטֵי מֶלֶךְ.
human_translation: And if you say: maintains since is permitted by Torah liable bring an offering an oath, Didn’t we learn An oath of testimony applies only to those who are eligible to give testimony. And we discussed it: to exclude what? Rav Pappa said: to exclude a king.
llm_translation: And if you will say: Since he has something extra beyond what is required by the Torah, he is liable for a Korban Shevu'ah. And we learned in a Mishnah: The oath of testimony is only administered to those fitting to testify. And we ask about it: What is it coming to exclude? Rav Papa said: It is coming to exclude a king.

hebrew_text: רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב אָמַר: לְמַעוֹטֵי מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא. וְהָא מְשַׂחֵק בְּקוּבְיָא — מִדְּאוֹרָיְיתָא מִיחְזֵי חֲזֵי, וְרַבָּנַן הוּא דְּפַסְלוּהוּ, וְלָא קָא חָיְילָא עֲלֵיהּ שְׁבוּעָה!
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: to exclude one who plays with dice, But surely one who plays with dice is eligible by Torah law and the Sages disqualified him. an oath of testimony does not apply to him
llm_translation: Rav Ahah bar Ya'akov said: For those who play with a kuvya. But one who plays with a kuvya - from the Torah it appears, let them appear, and it is the Rabbis who have prohibited it, and it does not bring about a violation of an oath!

hebrew_text: שָׁאנֵי הָתָם דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״אִם לֹא יַגִּיד״, וְהַאי לָאו בַּר הַגָּדָה הוּא כְּלָל.
human_translation: It is different there, the verse states: “If he does not utter it, But this person cannot ever give testimony
llm_translation: The difference there is that the verse says: "If he does not tell," and this is not a matter of Aggadah, it is a general principle.

hebrew_text: וְכׇל הֵיכָא דְּתָנֵי עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת, לָא תָּנֵי אָסוּר? וְהָתַנְיָא: אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאָמְרוּ אָסוּר בְּכוּלָּן — לֹא אָמְרוּ עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת אֶלָּא עַל הָאוֹכֶל וְשׁוֹתֶה וְעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בִּלְבַד. הָכִי קָאָמַר: כְּשֶׁאָמְרוּ אָסוּר — לָא אָמְרוּ אֶלָּא בְּכַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, אֲבָל כְּשִׁיעוּר — עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁעָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת — אֵין עָנוּשׁ כָּרֵת אֶלָּא אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה וְעוֹשֶׂה מְלָאכָה בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: And anywhere that it teaches punishable by karet , teach prohibited? Was it not taught Although they said prohibited with all of the they said punishment of karet only to one who eats, or drinks, or performs labor. This is is saying: When they said prohibited, they said that only a half-measure; but measure is punishable by karet . And although is punishable by karet , it is punishable by karet only eats, or drinks, or performs labor; alone
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And in every place where it teaches a punishment of excision, it does not teach a prohibition? And it was taught: Even though they said prohibited in all of them — they did not say punishment of excision except for eating, drinking, and performing labor alone. This is what it is saying: When they said prohibited — they did not say except for half the measure, but when it comes to the full measure — the punishment of excision. And even though there is a punishment of excision — the punishment of excision is only for eating, drinking, and performing labor alone.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: כִּי קָתָנֵי אָסוּר — אַשְּׁאָרָא. דְּתָנוּ רַבָּה וְרַב יוֹסֵף בִּשְׁאָר סִיפְרֵי דְבֵי רַב: מִנַּיִין לְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים שֶׁאָסוּר בִּרְחִיצָה בְּסִיכָה וּבִנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל וּבְתַשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״שַׁבָּתוֹן״ — שְׁבוּת.
human_translation: And if you wish, say when it is taught prohibited, the other As Rabba and Rav Yosef taught this in other books Rav’s school, From where that prohibited in bathing, and in smearing and in wearing shoes, and in having relations on Yom Kippur? The verse states: “ Shabbaton ” resting
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: When it teaches "forbidden" - I will say: it is different. For Rabba and Rav Yosef taught in other books of the house of Rav: From where do we derive that on Yom Kippur it is forbidden to wash, anoint oneself with oil, wear sandals, and engage in marital relations? The verse teaches: "a Sabbath of complete rest" - a cessation.

hebrew_text: גּוּפָא. חֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אָסוּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה, רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר: מוּתָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר אָסוּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה: כֵּיוָן דַּחֲזִי לְאִיצְטְרוֹפֵי, אִיסּוּרָא קָא אָכֵיל. רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ אָמַר מוּתָּר מִן הַתּוֹרָה: אֲכִילָה אָמַר רַחֲמָנָא, וְלֵיכָּא.
human_translation: the itself: a half-measure? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It is prohibited by Torah Reish Lakish said: It is permitted by Torah Rabbi Yoḥanan said it is prohibited by Torah because it is fit to combine he is eating forbidden Reish Lakish said it is permitted by Torah the Merciful One states “Eat,” and there is no
llm_translation: Body. Half measure, Rabbi Yochanan said: forbidden from the Torah, Reish Lakish said: permitted from the Torah. Rabbi Yochanan said: forbidden from the Torah: since he sees the intestines, he is eating forbidden food. Reish Lakish said: permitted from the Torah: eating, the Merciful One said, and there is no issue.

hebrew_text: אֵיתִיבֵיהּ רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן לְרֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אֵין לִי אֶלָּא כֹּל שֶׁיֶּשְׁנוֹ בְּעוֹנֶשׁ יֶשְׁנוֹ בְּאַזְהָרָה, כּוֹי וַחֲצִי שִׁיעוּר, הוֹאִיל וְאֵינוֹ בְּעוֹנֶשׁ — יָכוֹל אֵינוֹ בְּאַזְהָרָה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כׇּל חֵלֶב״! מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּקְרָא — אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish I have only anything that is included in the punishment is included in the prohibition. might there is no prohibition a koy , or a half-measure since there is no punishment the verse states: “All fat” rabbinic, and the verse a mere support.
llm_translation: He raised an objection to Reish Lakish: I have only that which is subject to punishment is also subject to warning, like a full and half measure. Since it is not subject to punishment, can it be subject to warning? The verse states: "All fat"! This is a Rabbinic teaching, and the verse is merely a support.

hebrew_text: הָכִי נָמֵי מִסְתַּבְּרָא, דְּאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא, כּוֹי סְפֵיקָא הוּא, אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְאֵתוֹיֵי סְפֵיקָא? אִי מִשּׁוּם הָא — לָא אִירְיָא, קָסָבְרִי
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable For if it could enter your mind by Torah law, uncertainty a koy a verse necessary to include an uncertainty? If that is the reason, there is no argument. have thought
llm_translation: Thus it is fittingly reasoned, for if it were according to your opinion that it is a matter of Torah law, it is a doubt, is it necessary to have a verse for the coming of a doubt? If it is for this reason - it is not so, he holds.

hebrew_text: כּוֹי בְּרִיָּה בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָהּ הִיא. דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, הָא דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: אַף ״כׇּל״ לְאֵתוֹיֵי כּוֹי, כּוֹי סְפֵיקָא הוּא, אִיצְטְרִיךְ קְרָא לְרַבּוֹיֵי סְפֵיקָא? אֶלָּא בְּרִיָּה שָׁאנֵי, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּרִיָּה שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: a koy is its own species, For if you do not say so Rav Idi bar Avin said, also “all” to include koy . koy is a case of uncertainty, is a verse necessary to include an uncertainty? Rather, species, it is different Here too, species, is different.
llm_translation: A creature by itself it is. For if you do not say so, this that Rav Idi bar Avin said: Also "all" comes to include a creature, a doubtful creature it is, is it necessary for a verse to come to include doubtful creatures? Rather, a creature that is different, here too a creature that is different.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״תְּעַנּוּ אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם״, יָכוֹל יֵשֵׁב בַּחַמָּה אוֹ בַּצִּנָּה כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּצְטַעֵר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכׇל מְלָאכָה לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ״. מָה מְלָאכָה שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה, אַף עִנּוּי נֶפֶשׁ שֵׁב וְאַל תַּעֲשֶׂה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: you shall afflict your souls” might sit in the sun or in the cold to suffer the the verse states: “And you shall not do any labor, just as labor is sit and do nothing, so too, affliction soul is also sit and do nothing.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Afflict your souls." One might have thought that one should sit in the sun or in the shade in order to cause distress - the Torah teaches: "And no manner of work shall you do." Just as with work, one should refrain and not do, so too with affliction of the soul, one should refrain and not do.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא: הֵיכָא דְּיָתֵיב בְּשִׁימְשָׁא וְחָיֵים לֵיהּ לָא נֵימָא לֵיהּ קוּם תּוּב בְּטוּלָּא, יָתֵיב בְּטוּלָּא וְקָרֵיר לֵיהּ לָא נֵימָא לֵיהּ קוּם תּוּב בְּשִׁימְשָׁא! דּוּמְיָא דִּמְלָאכָה: מָה מְלָאכָה לֹא חִלַּקְתָּ בָּהּ, אַף עִנּוּי לֹא תַּחְלוֹק בּוֹ.
human_translation: And say that when sits in the sun and it is hot for him, we do not say to him: Get up and sit in the shade. sits in the shade and it is cold for him, we do not say to him: Get up and sit in the sun. similar labor. Just as labor you did not distinguish so too, you do not distinguish affliction,
llm_translation: And why? Where one sits in the sun and it is harmful to him, we do not say to him, "Get up and sit in the shade," but if he sits in the shade and it is harmful to him, we do not say to him, "Get up and sit in the sun!" This is similar to work: just as you have not divided work, so too, you should not divide suffering.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: ״תְּעַנּוּ אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם״, יָכוֹל יֵשֵׁב בַּחַמָּה וּבַצִּנָּה וְיִצְטַעֵר — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְכׇל מְלָאכָה לֹא תַעֲשׂוּ״, מָה מְלָאכָה דָּבָר שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו בִּמְקוֹם אַחֵר, אַף עִנּוּי נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁחַיָּיבִין עָלָיו בִּמְקוֹם אַחֵר, וְאִי זֶה זֶה? זֶה פִּגּוּל וְנוֹתָר.
human_translation: It was taught another “You shall afflict your souls” might one sit in the sun or the cold and be uncomfortable; the the verse states: “And you shall not do any labor” Just as labor is something incurs in other circumstances, so too, affliction in other circumstances incur And what is that That is piggul and notar ,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "Afflict your souls." One might have thought that one could sit in the sun or in the shade and cause oneself distress. The Torah teaches us: "And you shall not do any work." Just as work is something for which one is liable in another place, so too affliction of the soul is something for which one is liable in another place. And if this is so, is this not the case? This is Pigul and Nosar.
