hebrew_text: אָבִיא פִּגּוּל וְנוֹתָר שֶׁהֵן בְּכָרֵת, וְלֹא אָבִיא אֶת הַטֶּבֶל שֶׁאֵינוֹ בְּכָרֵת, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּעַנּוּ״, ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: I will include piggul and notar , for which with karet but I will not include untithed produce, which does not of karet the verse states: “You shall afflict” “And you shall afflict your souls” include
llm_translation: I will bring Pigul and Notar which are liable to karet, and I will not bring Tevel which is not liable to karet, as the verse says: "Afflict yourselves," "and you shall afflict your souls" - a dispute.

hebrew_text: אָבִיא הַטֶּבֶל שֶׁהוּא בְּמִיתָה וְלֹא אָבִיא אֶת הַנְּבֵילָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּמִיתָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּעַנּוּ״, ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: I will include untithed produce, death but I will not include an animal carcass, is not death the verse states “you shall afflict” “and you shall afflict your souls.” includes
llm_translation: I will bring the tevel which is subject to death, but I will not bring the neveilah which is not subject to death - the Talmud teaches: "Afflict yourselves," "and you shall afflict your souls" - it is a dispute.

hebrew_text: אָבִיא אֶת הַנְּבֵילָה שֶׁהוּא בְּלָאו, וְלֹא אָבִיא אֶת הַחוּלִּין שֶׁאֵינָן בְּלָאו? תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּעַנּוּ״, ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: I will include an animal carcass, which a negative mitzva, but I will not include non-sacred, which is not a negative mitzva. the verse states “you shall afflict” “and you shall afflict your souls.” includes
llm_translation: I will bring the neveilah which is forbidden, and I will not bring the chullin which are not forbidden? The verse teaches: "Afflict yourselves," "and you shall afflict your souls" - it is a dispute.

hebrew_text: אָבִיא הַחוּלִּין שֶׁאֵינָן בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל, וְלֹא אָבִיא אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה שֶׁהִיא בְּקוּם אֱכוֹל, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּעַנּוּ״, ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם״ — רִיבָּה. אָבִיא אֶת הַתְּרוּמָה שֶׁאֵינָהּ בְּבַל תּוֹתִירוּ, וְלֹא אָבִיא אֶת הַקֳּדָשִׁים שֶׁהֵן בְּבַל תּוֹתִירוּ, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״תְּעַנּוּ״, ״וְעִנִּיתֶם אֶת נַפְשׁוֹתֵיכֶם״ — רִיבָּה.
human_translation: I will include non-sacred food, which is not arise eat, but I will not include teruma , which arise eat, the verse states “you shall afflict” “and you shall afflict your souls.” includes I will include teruma , which is not “You shall not leave over” but I will not include sacred food, “you shall not leave over”; the verse states “you shall afflict” “and you shall afflict your souls,” include
llm_translation: I will bring unconsecrated items that are not fit for eating, and I will not bring the terumah that is fit for eating, Scripture states: "Afflict yourselves," "and you shall afflict your souls" - it is a dispute. I will bring the terumah that should not be left over, and I will not bring the holy items that should not be left over, Scripture states: "Afflict yourselves," "and you shall afflict your souls" - it is a dispute.

hebrew_text: וְאִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר, הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהַאֲבַדְתִּי אֶת הַנֶּפֶשׁ הַהִיא״, עִנּוּי שֶׁהוּא אֲבֵידַת הַנֶּפֶשׁ, וְאֵי זֶה זֶה? זֶה אֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה.
human_translation: And if it is your wish to say Surely, states “I will destroy that soul affliction that destroys a soul. And what is that? That is eating and drinking,
llm_translation: "And if your soul desires to say, behold he says: 'And I will destroy that soul,' affliction that is the destruction of the soul, and what is this? This is eating and drinking."

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאִם נַפְשְׁךָ לוֹמַר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: בַּעֲרָיוֹת קָא מִישְׁתַּעֵי קְרָא, — הֲרֵי הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וְהַאֲבַדְתִּי הַנֶּפֶשׁ״, עִנּוּי שֶׁיֵּשׁ בּוֹ אֲבֵידַת נֶפֶשׁ, וְאֵי זֶה זֶה? זֶה אֲכִילָה וּשְׁתִיָּה.
human_translation: What is And if it is your wish to say? And if you say the verse is discussing those with whom relations are forbidden, the verse states: I will destroy that soul, an affliction that can cause death. And what is that? That is eating and drinking.
llm_translation: What does "And if your soul says" mean? And if you were to say: The verse is speaking about forbidden relationships, behold, it says: "And I will destroy the soul," indicating a form of destruction of life, and what is this? This is eating and drinking.

hebrew_text: דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל תָּנָא: נֶאֱמַר כָּאן עִנּוּי, וְנֶאֱמַר לְהַלָּן עִנּוּי. מָה לְהַלָּן עִנּוּי רְעָבוֹן, אַף כָּאן עִנּוּי רְעָבוֹן.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught affliction is stated here and affliction is stated further on Just as further on affliction hunger, so too, here, affliction hunger.
llm_translation: The House of Rabbi Yishmael taught: It is stated here "affliction," and it is stated there "affliction." Just as there "affliction" refers to hunger, so too here "affliction" refers to hunger.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מֵ״אִם תְּעַנֶּה אֶת בְּנוֹתַי״? דָּנִין עִנּוּי דְּרַבִּים מֵעִנּוּי דְּרַבִּים, וְאֵין דָּנִין עִנּוּי דְּרַבִּים מֵעִנּוּי דְּיָחִיד.
human_translation: And let us derive it “If you shall afflict my daughters” We derive affliction the public from affliction the public, and we do not derive affliction the public from affliction an individual,
llm_translation: And is it derived from "if you afflict my daughters"? We evaluate the affliction of the public from the affliction of the public, and we do not evaluate the affliction of the public from the affliction of the individual.

hebrew_text: וְנֵילַף מֵעִנּוּי דְּמִצְרַיִם, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּרְא אֶת עׇנְיֵנוּ״, וְאָמְרִינַן: זוֹ פְּרִישׁוּת דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ! אֶלָּא: דָּנִין עִנּוּי בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם מֵעִנּוּי בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם, וְאֵין דָּנִין עִנּוּי בִּידֵי שָׁמַיִם מֵעִנּוּי בִּידֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: And let us derive from affliction Egypt, as it is written: “And He saw our affliction” We say that abstinence from conjugal relations. Rather, We derive affliction by the hand of God from affliction by the hand of God, and we do not derive affliction by the hand of God from affliction by the hand of man.
llm_translation: And we derive a comparison from the affliction of Egypt, as it is written: "And He saw their affliction," and we say: This is the way of proper conduct! Rather, it means they judge affliction in the hands of Heaven as distinct from affliction in the hands of man, and they do not judge affliction in the hands of Heaven as distinct from affliction in the hands of man.

hebrew_text: ״הַמַּאֲכִילְךָ מָן בַּמִּדְבָּר ... לְמַעַן עַנּוֹתְךָ״? רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, חַד אָמַר: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ לְמִי שֶׁאֵין לוֹ פַּת בְּסַלּוֹ, וְחַד אָמַר: אֵינוֹ דּוֹמֶה מִי שֶׁרוֹאֶה וְאוֹכֵל לְמִי שֶׁאֵינוֹ רוֹאֶה וְאוֹכֵל.
human_translation: “Who feeds you manna in the desert in order to afflict you” Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi One said: There is no comparison between one who has bread in his basket and one who does not have bread in his basket. And one said: There is no comparison between one who sees and eats and one who does not see and eats
llm_translation: "The one who feeds you manna in the wilderness ... in order to afflict you"? Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, one said: It is not the same for one who has bread in his basket as for one who does not have bread in his basket, and one said: It is not the same for one who sees and eats as for one who does not see and eat.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִכָּאן רֶמֶז לְסוֹמִין, שֶׁאוֹכְלִין וְאֵין שְׂבֵעִין. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הִלְכָּךְ, מַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ סְעוֹדְתָּא לָא לֵיכְלַהּ אֶלָּא בִּימָמָא. אֲמַר רַבִּי זֵירָא, מַאי קְרָא: ״טוֹב מַרְאֵה עֵינַיִם מֵהֲלׇךְ נָפֶשׁ״. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: טוֹב מַרְאֵה עֵינַיִם בְּאִשָּׁה יוֹתֵר מִגּוּפוֹ שֶׁל מַעֲשֶׂה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״טוֹב מַרְאֵה עֵינַיִם מֵהֲלׇךְ נָפֶשׁ״.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From here allusion that blind eat but are not satisfied Abaye said: Therefore, one who has a meal should eat it only during daytime, Rabbi Zeira said: What is the verse “Better is the seeing of the eyes than the wandering of the desire” Reish Lakish said: The sight of a woman is better than the actual act as it is stated: “Better is the seeing of the eyes than the wandering of the desire.”
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From here is an allusion to those who fast, that they eat and are not satisfied. Abaye said: Therefore, one who has a meal should not eat it except during the day. Rabbi Zeira said, what is the verse: "Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of desire"? Resh Lakish said: Better is the sight of the eyes in a woman more than the body of an action, as it is said: "Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of desire."

hebrew_text: ״כִּי יִתֵּן בַּכּוֹס עֵינוֹ יִתְהַלֵּךְ בְּמֵישָׁרִים״, רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, חַד אָמַר: כׇּל הַנּוֹתֵן
human_translation: when it gives its color in the cup, when it glides down smoothly [ bemeisharim ]” Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi One said: Whoever casts
llm_translation: "When he gives in the cup, his eye will go straight." Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, one said: Whoever gives...

hebrew_text: עֵינוֹ בְּכוֹסוֹ, עֲרָיוֹת כּוּלָּן דּוֹמוֹת עָלָיו כְּמִישׁוֹר. וְחַד אָמַר: כָּל הַנּוֹתֵן עֵינוֹ בְּכוֹסוֹ, כָּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ דּוֹמֶה עָלָיו כְּמִישׁוֹר.
human_translation: his eye on his cup, those with whom relations are forbidden seem to him like level [ mishor ] And one said: Whoever casts his eye on his cup, the whole world seems to him like level [ mishor ] ground.
llm_translation: His eye in his cup, all forbidden relationships are as if they are leveled upon him. And one said: Whoever puts his eye in his cup, the whole world is as if it is leveled upon him as a level place.

hebrew_text: ״דְּאָגָה בְלֶב אִישׁ יַשְׁחֶנָּה״, רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, חַד אָמַר: יַשִּׂחֶנָּה מִדַּעְתּוֹ, וְחַד אָמַר: יְשִׂיחֶנָּה לַאֲחֵרִים.
human_translation: “If there is care in a man’s heart, let him quash it [ yashḥena ]” Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi One said: He should forcefully push it [ yasḥena ] out of his mind. And one said: he should tell [ yesiḥena ] others his
llm_translation: "Anxiety in a man's heart will weigh it down." Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, one said: he will speak from his own knowledge, and one said: he will speak to others.

hebrew_text: ״וְנָחָשׁ עָפָר לַחְמוֹ״, רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, חַד אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אוֹכֵל כָּל מַעֲדַנֵּי עוֹלָם — טוֹעֵם בָּהֶם טַעַם עָפָר, וְחַד אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ אוֹכֵל כׇּל מַעֲדַנֵּי עוֹלָם — אֵין דַּעְתּוֹ מְיוּשֶּׁבֶת עָלָיו עַד שֶׁיֹּאכַל עָפָר.
human_translation: “And dust shall be the serpent’s food” Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi One said: Even if eats all the delicacies in the world, they will taste like dust. And one said: Even if it eats all the delicacies in the world, its mind is unsettled until it eats dust.
llm_translation: "And the serpent eats dust," Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, one said: even if one eats all the delicacies of the world - he tastes in them the taste of dust, and one said: even if one eats all the delicacies of the world - his mind is not settled until he eats dust."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי: בּוֹא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם. מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם: מַקְנִיט אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ — יוֹרֵד עִמּוֹ לְחַיָּיו. אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא אֵינוֹ כֵּן: קִלֵּל אֶת הַנָּחָשׁ, עוֹלֶה לַגָּג — מְזוֹנוֹתָיו עִמּוֹ, יוֹרֵד לְמַטָּה — מְזוֹנוֹתָיו עִמּוֹ.
human_translation: it was taught Rabbi Yosei said: Come and see that the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He, is different than the attribute of flesh and blood. The attribute of flesh and blood provoke another harasses him his life, but the Holy One, Blessed be He, does not this He cursed the serpent the serpent goes up to the roof its food is with it, it comes down its food is with it.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei said: Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood: one who curses his fellow - he descends with him to Gehenna. But the Holy One, blessed be He, is not so: He cursed the serpent, it ascended to the roof - its sustenance with it, it descended below - its sustenance with it.

hebrew_text: קִלֵּל אֶת כְּנַעַן, אוֹכֵל מַה שֶּׁרַבּוֹ אוֹכֵל וְשׁוֹתֶה מַה שֶּׁרַבּוֹ שׁוֹתֶה. קִלֵּל אֶת הָאִשָּׁה — הַכֹּל רָצִין אַחֲרֶיהָ. קִלֵּל אֶת הָאֲדָמָה — הַכֹּל נִיזּוֹנִין הֵימֶנָּה.
human_translation: He cursed Canaan He eats what his master eats, and drinks what his master drinks, He cursed the woman everyone pursues her He cursed the land everyone is sustained from it.
llm_translation: He cursed Canaan, he eats what his abundance eats, and drinks what his abundance drinks. He cursed the woman - everyone desires her. He cursed the land - everyone benefits from it.

hebrew_text: ״זָכַרְנוּ אֶת הַדָּגָה אֲשֶׁר נֹאכַל בְּמִצְרַיִם חִנָּם״, רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל, חַד אָמַר: דָּגִים, וְחַד אָמַר: עֲרָיוֹת. מַאן דְּאָמַר דָּגִים, דִּכְתִיב: ״נֹאכַל״. וּמַאן דְּאָמַר עֲרָיוֹת, דִּכְתִיב: ״חִנָּם״.
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel “We remember the fish which we ate in Egypt for nothing” One said: fish. And one said: relations The one who said fish as it is written “which we ate.” And the one who said forbidden sexual relations as it is written “for nothing.”
llm_translation: "We remembered the fish that we ate in Egypt for free," Rav and Shmuel, one said: fish, and one said: forbidden relationships. The one who said fish, as it is written: 'ate.' And the one who said forbidden relationships, as it is written: 'for free.'"

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר עֲרָיוֹת, הָא כְּתִיב: ״נֹאכַל״! לִישָּׁנָא מְעַלְּיָא נָקֵט, דִּכְתִיב: ״אָכְלָה וּמָחֲתָה פִיהָ וְאָמְרָה לֹא פָעַלְתִּי אָוֶן״. וּלְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּגִים, מַאי ״חִנָּם״? דַּהֲווֹ מַיְיתִין לְהוּ מֵהֶפְקֵירָא. דְּאָמַר מָר: כְּשֶׁהָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל שׁוֹאֲבִין מַיִם, הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מַזְמִין לָהֶם בְּתוֹךְ הַמַּיִם דָּגִים קְטַנִּים בְּכַדֵּיהֶן.
human_translation: according to the one who said relations, but written “which we ate”? employed a euphemistic expression. as it is written: she eats, and wipes her mouth, and says I have done no wickedness” And according to the one who said fish, what “for nothing”? brought the fish from ownerless property, The Master said: When the Jews drew water the Holy One, Blessed be He, prepared little fish for them in the water. into their jugs.
llm_translation: The one who says the prohibition applies to relatives, behold it is written: "we will eat"! The one who raises an objection from above, for it is written: "She ate and wiped her mouth and said, 'I have done no wrong.'" And the one who says the prohibition applies to fish, what is "free"? They would bring them from hefker. As the Master said: When the Israelites were drawing water, the Holy One, blessed be He, would provide for them small fish in their pitchers.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּגִים, אֲבָל עֲרָיוֹת לָא פְּרִיצִי בְּהוּ — הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִב: ״גַּן נָעוּל אֲחוֹתִי כַלָּה [גּוֹ׳]״. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עֲרָיוֹת, מַאי ״מַעְיָן חָתוּם״? מֵהָנָךְ דַּאֲסִירִין לָא פְּרִיצִי בְּהוּ.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said fish but not promiscuous forbidden relations this is what is written “A garden enclosed is my sister the bride; However, according to the one who said forbidden sexual relations, what “a sealed spring” not promiscuous those who were forbidden
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says fish, but not forbidden relationships, are promiscuous - this is as it is written: "A locked garden is my sister, my bride." But according to the one who says forbidden relationships, what is "a sealed fountain"? From here, those that are forbidden are not promiscuous with them.

hebrew_text: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר עֲרָיוֹת, הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁמַע מֹשֶׁה אֶת הָעָם בּוֹכֶה לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָיו״, עַל עִסְקֵי מִשְׁפְּחוֹתָיו, שֶׁנֶּאֶסְרוּ לָהֶם לִשְׁכַּב אֶצְלָם. אֶלָּא לְמַאן דְּאָמַר דָּגִים, מַאי ״בּוֹכֶה לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָיו״? הָא וְהָא הֲוַאי.
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said forbidden sexual relations, this is as it is written: “And Moses heard the people weeping for their families” with regard to the issue of their families, because it became prohibited for them to cohabit with them. But according to the one who says fish what “weeping for their families” Both this and that happened.
llm_translation: In truth, according to the one who says it refers to forbidden relationships, this is as it is written: "And Moses heard the people weeping, every family at the door of their tent." concerning matters of their families, that they were forbidden to lie with them. But according to the one who says it refers to fish, what is the meaning of "every family at the door of their tent"? This and that are both correct.

hebrew_text: ״אֵת הַקִּשּׁוּאִים וְאֵת הָאֲבַטִּיחִים״, רַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי, חַד אָמַר: טַעַם כׇּל הַמִּינִין טָעֲמוּ בַּמָּן, טַעַם חֲמֵשֶׁת הַמִּינִין הַלָּלוּ לֹא טָעֲמוּ בּוֹ, וְחַד אָמַר: טַעַם כָּל הַמִּינִין טָעֲמוּ טַעְמָן וּמַמָּשָׁן, וְהַלָּלוּ טַעְמָן וְלֹא מַמָּשָׁן.
human_translation: the cucumbers, and the melons, Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi One said: They tasted the flavor of all types of food in the manna, they could not taste the tastes of these five foods And one said: They tasted the flavor of all types of food, their textures. their flavor but not their texture.
llm_translation: "The cucumbers and the watermelons," Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi, one said: All types tasted the manna, these five types did not taste it, and one said: All types tasted their taste and substance, and these tasted their taste but not their substance."

hebrew_text: ״(וְהַמָּן) כְּזֶרַע גַּד לָבָן (וְטַעְמוֹ)״. אָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי: עָגוֹל כְּגִידָּא וְלָבָן כְּמַרְגָּלִית. (תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי:) גַּד — שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְזֶרַע פִּשְׁתָּן בַּגִּבְעוֹלִין.
human_translation: “And it was white [ lavan ] like coriander seed; and its flavor Rabbi Asi said: round like coriander but white like a pearl. This was also taught Coriander [ gad ] because it is similar to flax seeds on their stalks,
llm_translation: "(And the manna) like coriander seed, white (and its taste)." Rabbi Assi said: round like a coriander seed and white like a pearl. It was taught similarly: Gad - which resembles the seed of flax in the hills."

hebrew_text: אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: גַּד — שֶׁדּוֹמֶה לְהַגָּדָה שֶׁמּוֹשֶׁכֶת לִבּוֹ שֶׁל אָדָם כַּמַּיִם. תַּנְיָא אִידַּךְ: גַּד — שֶׁמַּגִּיד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אִי בֶּן תִּשְׁעָה לָרִאשׁוֹן וְאִי בֶּן שִׁבְעָה לָאַחֲרוֹן.
human_translation: Others say: coriander [ gad ] because it is similar to a tale [ haggada ], which draws a person’s heart like water, It was taught another gad ? Because it told [ maggid ] the Jewish people if nine first or if seven second
llm_translation: Others say: "Gad is like a tale that captures the heart of a person like water." Another teaching: "Gad informs the children of Israel whether the firstborn is a nine-month baby or a seven-month baby."

hebrew_text: ״לָבָן״ — שֶׁמַּלְבִּין עֲוֹנוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: white because it whitened Israel’s sins.
llm_translation: "Lavan" - who whitens the sins of the children of Israel.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כְּשֵׁם שֶׁהַנָּבִיא הָיָה מַגִּיד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מַה שֶּׁבְּחוֹרִין וּמַה שֶּׁבִּסְדָקִין, כָּךְ הַמָּן מַגִּיד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מַה שֶּׁבְּחוֹרִין וּמַה שֶּׁבִּסְדָקִין. כֵּיצַד? שְׁנַיִם שֶׁבָּאוּ לִפְנֵי מֹשֶׁה לְדִין, זֶה אוֹמֵר: עַבְדִּי גָּנַבְתָּ, וְזֶה אוֹמֵר: אַתָּה מְכַרְתּוֹ לִי. אָמַר לָהֶם מֹשֶׁה: לַבּוֹקֶר מִשְׁפָּט. לְמָחָר, אִם נִמְצָא עוֹמְרוֹ בְּבֵית רַבּוֹ רִאשׁוֹן — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁזֶּה גְּנָבוֹ. אִם נִמְצָא עוֹמְרוֹ בְּבֵית רַבּוֹ שֵׁנִי — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁזֶּה מְכָרוֹ לוֹ.
human_translation: it was taught Rabbi Yosei says: Just like the prophet would tell the Jewish people what was in the holes and what was in the cracks so too, the manna clarified for Israel what was in the holes and what was in the cracks. How so? two came before Moses for a judgment, one saying: You stole my slave, and one saying: you sold him to me, Moses say to them: In the morning a judgment. If on the following day found his omer in his first master’s house, it would be clear that he was stolen, And if on the following day he found his omer in his second master’s house, it would be clear that he had been sold.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei says: Just as the prophet used to inform the Israelites what was among the free and what was among the condemned, so too does the manna inform the Israelites what is among the free and what is among the condemned. How so? Two people came before Moses for judgment, one says: "My servant, you stole," and the other says: "You sold him to me." Moses said to them: "The judgment will be in the morning." The next day, if his bundle is found in the first person's house - it is known that he stole it. If his bundle is found in the second person's house - it is known that he sold it to him.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אִישׁ וְאִשָּׁה שֶׁבָּאוּ לִפְנֵי מֹשֶׁה לַדִּין, זֶה אוֹמֵר הִיא סָרְחָה עָלַי, וְהִיא אוֹמֶרֶת הוּא סָרַח עָלַי. אָמַר לָהֶם מֹשֶׁה: לַבֹּקֶר מִשְׁפָּט. לְמָחָר, אִם נִמְצָא עוֹמְרָהּ בְּבֵית בַּעְלָהּ — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהִיא סָרְחָה עָלָיו, נִמְצָא עוֹמְרָהּ בְּבֵית אָבִיהָ — בְּיָדוּעַ שֶׁהוּא סָרַח עָלֶיהָ.
human_translation: a man and a woman came to Moses for a judgment, he saying: She sinned against me, and she saying: He sinned against me Moses say to them: In the morning there will be a judgment. The following day, if her omer was found in her husband’s house, it would be clear that she sinned against him. If her omer was found in her father’s house, it would be clear that he sinned against her.
llm_translation: And so, a man and a woman who came before Moses for judgment, this one says, "She committed adultery with me," and she says, "He committed adultery with me." Moses said to them: "Tomorrow is the trial. If her 'omer is found in her husband's house - it is known that she committed adultery with him. If her 'omer is found in her father's house - it is known that he committed adultery with her."

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב: ״וּבְרֶדֶת הַטַּל עַל הַמַּחֲנֶה לָיְלָה [יֵרֵד הַמָּן עָלָיו]״, וּכְתִיב: ״וְיָצָא הָעָם וְלָקְטוּ״, וּכְתִיב: ״שָׁטוּ הָעָם וְלָקְטוּ״, הָא כֵּיצַד? צַדִּיקִים, יָרַד עַל פֶּתַח בָּתֵּיהֶם. בֵּינוֹנִים, יָצְאוּ וְלָקְטוּ. רְשָׁעִים, שָׁטוּ וְלָקְטוּ.
human_translation: It is written: “And when the dew fell upon the camp in the night, the manna fell upon it” And it is written: “And the people shall go out and gather And it is written: “The people went about and gathered it” How these righteous, fell at the opening of their homes. average people went out and gathered The wicked to go about to gather.
llm_translation: It is written: "And when the dew fell upon the camp at night, the manna fell upon it." And it is written: "And the people shall go out and gather." And it is written: "And the people went about and gathered." How so? The righteous, went down to the entrance of their houses. The average, went out and gathered. The wicked, went about and gathered.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב ״לֶחֶם״, וּכְתִיב ״עוּגוֹת״, וּכְתִיב ״וְטָחֲנוּ״, הָא כֵּיצַד? צַדִּיקִים — לֶחֶם, בֵּינוֹנִים — עוּגוֹת, רְשָׁעִים — טָחֲנוּ בָּרֵיחַיִם.
human_translation: it is written “bread” and it is written “cakes” and it is written “and ground it How these righteous, bread; average people, cakes; wicked ground it
llm_translation: It is written "bread," and it is written "cakes," and it is written "they grind." How so? Righteous individuals - bread, intermediate individuals - cakes, wicked individuals - they grind with their teeth.

hebrew_text: ״אוֹ דָכוּ בַּמְּדוֹכָה״, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב, וְאִיתֵּימָא רַבִּי חָמָא בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עִם הַמָּן תַּכְשִׁיטֵי נָשִׁים, דָּבָר שֶׁנִּידּוֹךְ בִּמְדוֹכָה. ״וּבִשְּׁלוּ בַּפָּרוּר״, אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא: מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עִם הַמָּן צִיקֵי קְדֵירָה.
human_translation: “Or beat it in a mortar” Rabbi Yehuda said Rav said, and some say Rabbi Ḥama, son of Rabbi Ḥanina: This teaches that women’s perfumes fell for the Jewish people with the manna an item beaten in a mortar. “And cooked it in a pot” Rabbi Ḥama said: This teaches that cooking spices fell for the Jewish people with the manna.
llm_translation: "Or they crushed in a mortar," Rabbi Yehuda said in the name of Rav, and some say Rabbi Chama son of Rabbi Chanina: This teaches that there descended for them to the Israelites with the manna women's ornaments, a matter that is crushed in a mortar. "And they cooked in a pot," Rabbi Chama said: This teaches that there descended for them to the Israelites with the manna delicacies of a pot.

hebrew_text: ״וְהֵם הֵבִיאוּ אֵלָיו עוֹד נְדָבָה בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״, מַאי ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״? אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: מִדָּבָר שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶם ״בַּבֹּקֶר בַּבֹּקֶר״. מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרְדוּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֲבָנִים טוֹבוֹת וּמַרְגָּלִיּוֹת עִם הַמָּן. ״וְהַנְּשִׂיאִים הֵבִיאוּ אֵת אַבְנֵי הַשֹּׁהַם״, תָּנָא: נְשִׂיאִים מַמָּשׁ. וְכֵן הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״נְשִׂיאִים וְרוּחַ וְגֶשֶׁם אָיִן״.
human_translation: “And they brought yet to him free-will offerings every morning” What “every morning”? Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: from that which fell every morning This teaches that pearls and precious stones fell for the Israelites with the manna. “And the rulers [ nesi’im ] brought the onyx [ shoham ] stones” taught nesi’im actual As it states: “As clouds [ nesi’im ] and wind without rain
llm_translation: "They brought to him still a freewill offering in the morning, in the morning." What is "in the morning, in the morning"? Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yonatan: From a matter that descended to them "in the morning, in the morning." This teaches that they brought to them to the Israelites good stones and pearls with the manna. "And the princes brought the onyx stones." It was taught: Literal princes. And so it says: "Princes and wind and rain are lacking."

hebrew_text: ״וְהָיָה טַעְמוֹ כְּטַעַם לְשַׁד הַשָּׁמֶן״. אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: מָה שַׁד זֶה תִּינוֹק טוֹעֵם בָּהּ כַּמָּה טְעָמִים, אַף הַמָּן, כׇּל זְמַן שֶׁיִּשְׂרָאֵל אוֹכְלִין אוֹתוֹ מוֹצְאִין בּוֹ כַּמָּה טְעָמִים. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: לְשֵׁד מַמָּשׁ. מָה שֵׁד זֶה מִתְהַפֵּךְ לְכַמָּה גְּווֹנִין — אַף הַמָּן מִתְהַפֵּךְ לְכַמָּה טְעָמִים.
human_translation: “And its taste was as the taste of a cake [ shad ] baked with oil [ hashamen ]” Rabbi Abbahu said: Just as a baby tastes different flavors from the breast, so too with the manna, every time that the Jewish people ate they found in it many flavors, There are those who say literally a demon. Just as a demon changes into different forms so too, the manna changed into different flavors.
llm_translation: "And its taste was like the taste of oil-cake." Rabbi Avahu said: Just as a baby tastes in it many flavors, so too the manna, whenever Israel eats it, they find in it many flavors. Some say: literally like oil-cake. Just as this oil-cake transforms into many colors, so too the manna transforms into many flavors."

hebrew_text: ״וַיֹּאמֶר מֹשֶׁה בְּתֵת ה׳ לָכֶם בָּעֶרֶב בָּשָׂר לֶאֱכוֹל וְלֶחֶם בַּבֹּקֶר לִשְׂבּוֹעַ״, תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קָרְחָה: בָּשָׂר שֶׁשָּׁאֲלוּ שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן — נִיתַּן לָהֶם שֶׁלֹּא כַּהוֹגֶן,
human_translation: “And Moses said: This shall be, when the Lord will give you in the evening meat to eat, and in the morning bread to the full” taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa: The meat that the Jewish people asked for inappropriately, given to them inappropriately,
llm_translation: "And Moses said, 'When the Lord gives you meat to eat in the evening and bread to the full in the morning.'" It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha: "Meat that they requested not in a proper manner - it was given to them not in a proper manner."

hebrew_text: לֶחֶם שֶׁשָּׁאֲלוּ כַּהוֹגֶן — נִיתַּן לָהֶם כַּהוֹגֶן. מִכָּאן לִמְּדָה תּוֹרָה דֶּרֶךְ אֶרֶץ שֶׁלֹּא יֹאכַל אָדָם בָּשָׂר אֶלָּא בַּלַּיְלָה. וְהָאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הַאי מַאן דְּאִית לֵיהּ סְעוֹדְתָּא — לָא לֵאכְלַיהּ אֶלָּא בִּימָמָא! כְּעֵין יְמָמָא קָא אָמְרִינַן. אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב: בַּתְּחִלָּה הָיוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל דּוֹמִין כְּתַרְנְגוֹלִים שֶׁמְּנַקְּרִין בָּאַשְׁפָּה, עַד שֶׁבָּא מֹשֶׁה וְקָבַע לָהֶם זְמַן סְעוּדָה.
human_translation: bread, they asked for appropriately. was given to them appropriately, From here, the Torah teaches etiquette, that to eat meat only at night, But didn’t Abaye say someone who has a meal should eat it only in the day? We mean to say: Like day. Rabbi Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: At the beginning, the Jewish people were like chickens pecking at the garbage; until Moses came and set specific times to eat,
llm_translation: Bread that they requested like the regular portion — given to them like the regular portion. From here the Torah taught the way of the land, that a person should not eat meat except at night. And Abaye said: Whoever has a meal — should not eat it except during the day! We say it is like during the day. Rav Acha bar Yaakov said: Initially, the Israelites were like roosters pecking in the garbage, until Moses came and established for them a designated time for meals.

hebrew_text: ״הַבָּשָׂר עוֹדֶנּוּ בֵּין שִׁינֵּיהֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״עַד חֹדֶשׁ יָמִים״, הָא כֵּיצַד? בֵּינוֹנִים, לְאַלְתַּר מֵתוּ. רְשָׁעִים, מִצְטַעֲרִין וְהוֹלְכִין עַד חֹדֶשׁ יָמִים.
human_translation: “While the meat was yet between their teeth, an entire month How these The average people died immediately, the wicked continued to suffer for a month
llm_translation: "The flesh is still between their teeth," and it is written: "until a month of days." How so? In the case of intermediates, they did not die immediately. The wicked, they suffer and go until a month of days.

hebrew_text: ״וַיִּשְׁטְחוּ״, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״וַיִּשְׁטְחוּ״, אֶלָּא ״וַיִּשְׁחֲטוּ״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּתְחַיְּיבוּ שׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שְׁחִיטָה. ״שָׁטוֹחַ״, תָּנָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן קָרְחָה: אַל תִּיקְרֵי ״שָׁטוֹחַ״, אֶלָּא ״שָׁחוּט״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עִם הַמָּן דָּבָר שֶׁטָּעוּן שְׁחִיטָה. אָמַר רַבִּי: וְכִי מִכָּאן אַתָּה לָמֵד? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״וַיַּמְטֵר עֲלֵיהֶם כֶּעָפָר שְׁאֵר וּכְחוֹל (הַיָּם) עוֹף כָּנָף״.
human_translation: “And they spread them [ vayishteḥu ] Reish Lakish said: Do not read it vayishteḥu . Rather, vayishḥatu . teaches that enemies of the Jewish people, were liable to slaughter “Spread out [ shato’aḥ ]” taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korḥa: Do not read it shato’aḥ but shaḥot . teaches that fell for the Jewish people with the manna. that requires ritual slaughtering [ sheḥita ], Rabbi said: And do you learn from here? Isn’t it already stated “And he rained meat upon them like dust, and winged birds like the sand of the seas”
llm_translation: "And they rinsed," Reish Lakish said: Do not read "וַיִּשְׁטְחוּ" (and they rinsed), rather "וַיִּשְׁחֲטוּ" (and they slaughtered) — this teaches that their enemies of Israel were liable for ritual slaughter. "Shatoach," a Tanna taught in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Korcha: Do not read "שָׁטוֹחַ" (rinsed), rather "שָׁחוּט" (slaughtered), teaching that it descended upon them for Israel with the manna, a matter that requires slaughter. Rabbi said: And from here do you learn? Has it not already been said: "And He rained upon them like dust, feathered fowl like the sand of the sea."

hebrew_text: וְתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: ״וְזָבַחְתָּ כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוִּיתִיךְ״, מְלַמֵּד שֶׁנִּצְטַוָּה מֹשֶׁה עַל הַוֶּשֶׁט וְעַל הַקָּנֶה, עַל רוֹב אֶחָד בָּעוֹף, וְעַל רוֹב שְׁנַיִם בַּבְּהֵמָה. אֶלָּא מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״שָׁטוֹחַ״ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶם מַשְׁטִיחִין מַשְׁטִיחִין.
human_translation: And it was taught Rabbi says: “Then you shall slaughter as I have commanded you” This teaches that Moses was commanded in gullet and the windpipe And with a bird the majority one and with an animal the majority of Rather, what the verse states: Shatoaḥ ? teaches that fell in layers [ mashtiḥin ]
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught, Rabbi says: "And you shall sacrifice as I have commanded you," teaches that Moses was commanded concerning the whip and the reed, concerning the majority of one in birds, and concerning the majority of two in animals. Rather, what is the Talmud to say "spread out" - teaches that he should sprinkle for them sprinklings.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב ״לֶחֶם״, וּכְתִיב ״שֶׁמֶן״, וּכְתִיב ״דְּבַשׁ״. אֲמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: לִנְעָרִים — לֶחֶם, לִזְקֵנִים — שֶׁמֶן, לְתִינוֹקוֹת — דְּבַשׁ.
human_translation: it is written “bread” and it is written “oil” and it is written “honey” Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: For the youth bread, for the elderly oil, for the children honey.
llm_translation: It is written "bread", and it is written "oil", and it is written "honey". Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: For youths - bread, for elders - oil, for infants - honey.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב: ״שָׁלֵיו״ וְקָרֵינַן סְלָיו? אָמַר רַבִּי חֲנִינָא: צַדִּיקִים אוֹכְלִין אוֹתוֹ בְּשַׁלְוָה, רְשָׁעִים אוֹכְלִין אוֹתוֹ וְדוֹמֶה לָהֶן כְּסִילְוִין.
human_translation: is written shlav , but we read slav , Rabbi Ḥanina said: The righteous eat it in peace [ shalva ], the wicked eat it, and it seems to them like thorns [ silvin ],
llm_translation: It is written: "shalayv" and we read it as "salayv"? Rabbi Chanina said: The righteous eat it in peace, the wicked eat it and resemble fools.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָן בַּר רָבָא: אַרְבָּעָה מִינֵי סְלָיו הֵן, וְאֵלּוּ הֵן: שִׁיכְלִי, וְקִיבְלִי, וּפַסְיוֹנִי, וּשְׂלָיו. מְעַלְּיָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ: שִׂיכְלִי, גְּרִיעָא דְּכוּלְּהוּ: שְׂלָיו. וְהָוֵי כְּצִיפַּורְתָּא, וּמוֹתְבִינַן לֵהּ בְּתַנּוּרָא וְתָפַח וְהָוֵה מְלֵי תַּנּוּרָא, וּמַסְּקִינַן לֵיהּ אַתְּלֵיסַר רִיפֵי, וְאַחֲרוֹנָה אֵינָהּ נֶאֱכֶלֶת אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי תַּעֲרוֹבֶת.
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Rava said: There are four types of quail and these are they: Sikhli , and kivli , and pasyoni , and slav . The best of all sikhli . The worst of all slav . It was as a sparrow, and they would place it in the oven and it expanded until it filled the oven. They would place it upon thirteen loaves last could be eaten only mixed with other food,
llm_translation: Rav Hanan bar Rava said: There are four types of Salayv, and these are they: Shikli, Kivli, Pasyoni, and Salayv. The highest of them all is Shikli, the lowest of them all is Salayv. And it is like a bird, and we place it in the oven and it bakes, and it becomes full of the oven, and we sprinkle on it thirteen types of spices, and the last one is not eaten except with a mixture.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה מִשְׁתְּכַח לֵיהּ בֵּי דַנֵּי, רַב חִסְדָּא מִשְׁתְּכַח לֵיהּ בֵּי צִיבֵי. רָבָא מַיְיתֵי לֵיהּ אֲרִיסֵיהּ כׇּל יוֹמָא. יוֹמָא חַד לָא אַיְיתִי. אֲמַר: מַאי הַאי? סְלֵיק לְאִיגָּרָא, שַׁמְעֵיהּ לְיָנוֹקָא דְּקָאָמַר: ״שָׁמַעְתִּי וַתִּרְגַּז בִּטְנִי״. אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִנֵּיהּ נָח נַפְשֵׁיהּ דְּרַב חִסְדָּא, וּבְדִיל רַבָּה אָכֵיל תַּלְמִידָא.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda found among his barrels of wine, Rav Ḥisda found among logs of wood Every day Rava’s sharecropper brought him One day, he did not bring said What is this, He went up to the roof He heard a child say “When I heard, my innards trembled, said: Learn from this that Rav Ḥisda has died. account of the teacher the student eats.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah forgot the house of Danai, Rav Chisda forgot the house of Tzivei. Rava would bring his worker every day. One day he did not bring him. He said: What is this? He went up to the attic, he heard the child saying: "I heard and my stomach was upset." He said: The soul of Rav Chisda is at ease, but Rava is eating his student.

hebrew_text: כְּתִיב: ״וַתַּעַל שִׁכְבַת הַטָּל״, וּכְתִיב: ״וּבְרֶדֶת הַטַּל״? אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי חֲנִינָא: טַל מִלְמַעְלָה, וְטַל מִלְּמַטָּה, וְדוֹמֶה כְּמוֹ שֶׁמּוּנָּח בְּקוּפְסָא.
human_translation: it is written: “And when the layer of dew lifted, And it is written: And when the dew fell Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, said: dew above and dew below, and appeared as if placed in a box [ kufsa ]
llm_translation: It is written: "And the dew of the ground went up," and it is written: "And the dew descended." Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Chanina, said: Dew from above, and dew from below, and it is likened to one who is placed in a basket.

hebrew_text: ״דַּק מְחוּסְפָּס״, אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: דָּבָר שֶׁנִּימּוֹחַ עַל פִּיסַּת הַיָּד. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: דָּבָר שֶׁנִּבְלָע בְּמָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה אֵבָרִים. מְחוּסְפָּס — טוּבָא הָוֵי! אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: ״מְחֻסְפָּס״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: “a fine flaky [ meḥuspas ] Reish Lakish said: a substance that dissolved [ ] on the palm [ ] of the hand. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: It was a substance that was absorbed in 248 limbs, meḥuspas , is more, Rabbi Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Meḥuspas is written
llm_translation: "Dak Mechuspas," said Reish Lakish: A matter that is rubbed smooth by the edge of the hand. Rabbi Yochanan said: A matter that is swallowed in one hundred and forty-eight limbs. Mechuspas - it should be good! Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "Mechuspas" is written.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: ״לֶחֶם אַבִּירִים אָכַל אִישׁ״, לֶחֶם שֶׁמַּלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת אוֹכְלִין אוֹתוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא. וּכְשֶׁנֶּאְמְרוּ דְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר לָהֶם: צְאוּ וְאִמְרוּ לוֹ לַעֲקִיבָא: עֲקִיבָא טָעִיתָ! וְכִי מַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת אוֹכְלִין לֶחֶם? וַהֲלֹא כְּבָר נֶאֱמַר: ״לֶחֶם לֹא אָכַלְתִּי וּמַיִם לֹא שָׁתִיתִי״! אֶלָּא, מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״אַבִּירִים״ — לֶחֶם שֶׁנִּבְלַע בְּמָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנֶה אֵבָרִים.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Man did eat the bread of the mighty [ abirim ]” bread that the ministering angels eat; statement of Rabbi Akiva. When these words were said before Rabbi Yishmael, he said to them go and tell Akiva: Akiva you have erred. Do the ministering angels eat bread? It is already stated “Bread I did not eat and water I did not drink” Rather, how do I establish abirim ? bread that was absorbed into 248 limbs [ eivarim ],
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "A man should eat 'bread of mighty men'," bread that the ministering angels eat, these are the words of Rabbi Akiva. And when they said words before Rabbi Yishmael, he said to them: Go out and tell Akiva: Akiva, you have erred! Do ministering angels eat bread? Has it not already been said: "I have not eaten bread, nor have I drunk water"! Rather, how do I fulfill 'mighty men' - bread that is swallowed with one hundred and forty-eight limbs.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים: ״וְיָתֵד תִּהְיֶה לְךָ עַל אֲזֵנֶיךָ (וְיָצָאתָ שָׁמָּה חוּץ)״, דְּבָרִים שֶׁתַּגָּרֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מוֹכְרִין אוֹתָן לָהֶם.
human_translation: But how do I establish “And you shall have a spade among your weapons, where you can relieve yourself items that the gentile merchants sold them.
llm_translation: Rather, how do I fulfill: "And a peg shall be for you on your tools (and you shall go outside with it)" - items that non-Jews manufacture, one may sell them to them.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן פַּרְטָא אוֹמֵר: אַף דְּבָרִים שֶׁתַּגָּרֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם מוֹכְרִין לָהֶן — מָן מְפִיגָן. אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְיָתֵד תִּהְיֶה לְךָ עַל אֲזֵנֶיךָ״ — לְאַחַר שֶׁסָּרְחוּ אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: אֲנִי אָמַרְתִּי יִהְיוּ כְּמַלְאֲכֵי הַשָּׁרֵת, עַכְשָׁיו אֲנִי מַטְרִיחַ אוֹתָם שָׁלֹשׁ פַּרְסָאוֹת.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Perata says: The manna caused even items that the gentile merchants sold them to be digested, But how do I establish “And you shall have a spade among your weapons”? After they sinned, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: I said they would be like ministering angels now I will trouble them to walk three parasangs
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Parta says: Even things that the nations of the world need, we may sell to them - such as manure. But how do I fulfill "And a peg shall be for you to lean upon" - after they became insolent, the Holy One, blessed be He, said: I said they should be like ministering angels, now I trouble them with three rows.

hebrew_text: דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּחֲנוּ עַל הַיַּרְדֵּן מִבֵּית הַיְשִׁימוֹת עַד אָבֵל הַשִּׁטִּים״, וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: לְדִידִי חֲזֵי לִי הָהוּא אַתְרָא וְהָוְיָא תְּלָתָא פַּרְסֵי. וְתָנָא: כְּשֶׁנִּפְנִין, אֵין נִפְנִין לֹא לִפְנֵיהֶן, וְלֹא לְצִדְדֵיהֶן, אֶלָּא לַאֲחוֹרֵיהֶן.
human_translation: As it is written: “And they camped by the Jordan from Beth-Jeshimoth to Abel-shittim” and Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: I saw that site and it was three parasangs And taught: When relieved themselves they did not relieve ahead of themselves, nor to the side but behind
llm_translation: It is written: "And they camped by the Jordan from Beth-jeshimoth to Abel-shittim." And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: In my opinion, that place appeared to me and it was three parasangs. And it was taught: When they turn, they do not turn neither to their front nor to their sides, but to their backs.

hebrew_text: ״וְעַתָּה נַפְשֵׁנוּ יְבֵשָׁה אֵין כֹּל״. אָמְרוּ: עָתִיד מָן זֶה שֶׁתִּיפַּח בְּמֵעֵיהֶם, כְּלוּם יֵשׁ יְלוּד אִשָּׁה שֶׁמַּכְנִיס וְאֵינוֹ מוֹצִיא?
human_translation: “But now our soul is dry, there is nothing at all; They said: This manna will eventually swell in our stomachs is there born of a woman who ingests but does not expel
llm_translation: "And now our soul is dried up, there is nothing." They said: In the future, this man will blow into their innards, as if there is a woman who conceives and does not give birth?

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁנֶּאְמְרוּ דְּבָרִים לִפְנֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל, אָמַר לָהֶם: אַל תִּקְרֵי ״אַבִּירִים״, אֶלָּא ״אֵיבָרִים״ — דָּבָר שֶׁנִּבְלַע בְּמָאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה אֵיבָרִים. אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״וְיָתֵד תִּהְיֶה לְךָ עַל אֲזֵנֶיךָ״ — בִּדְבָרִים שֶׁבָּאִין לָהֶם מִמְּדִינַת הַיָּם.
human_translation: When these words were said before Rabbi Yishmael, he said to them: Do not read abirim . Rather, eivarim , something that was absorbed by 248 limbs. But, how do I establish “And you shall have a spade among your weapons”? From the items that came to them from overseas lands.
llm_translation: When they said words before Rabbi Yishmael, he said to them: Do not read "abirim" (mighty ones), but "eivarim" (limbs) - a matter that consists of two hundred and forty-eight limbs. Rather, how do I fulfill "and a peg shall be for you on your ear" - with matters that come from the sea.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: ״לֶחֶם אַבִּירִים אָכַל אִישׁ״ —
human_translation: Alternatively, “Man [ ish ] did eat the bread of the mighty”
llm_translation: Another matter: "The mighty man has eaten bread" —

hebrew_text: זֶה יְהוֹשֻׁעַ שֶׁיָּרַד לוֹ מָן כְּנֶגֶד כׇּל יִשְׂרָאֵל. כְּתִיב הָכָא ״אִישׁ״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״קַח לְךָ אֶת יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בִּן נוּן אִישׁ אֲשֶׁר רוּחַ בּוֹ״. וְאֵימָא מֹשֶׁה, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְהָאִישׁ מֹשֶׁה עָנָו מְאֹד״? דָּנִין ״אִישׁ״ מֵ״אִישׁ״, וְאֵין דָּנִין ״אִישׁ״ מִ״וְּהָאִישׁ״.
human_translation: Joshua, for whom manna fell corresponding all the Jewish people, “Man” is written here, and “man” is written there: “Take to you Joshua, the son of Nun, a man in whom there is spirit, Say Moses, it is written: “Now the man Moses was very humble” We can learn “man” from the word “man,” but we cannot learn “man” from “the man,”
llm_translation: This is Joshua who received for himself manna opposite all Israel. It is written here "man", and it is written there: "Take for yourself Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is spirit." But why not Moses, as it is written: "Now the man Moses was very humble"? We differentiate "man" from "the man", but we do not differentiate "man" from "and the man".

hebrew_text: שָׁאֲלוּ תַּלְמִידָיו אֶת רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן יוֹחַי: מִפְּנֵי מָה לֹא יָרַד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל מָן פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה? אָמַר לָהֶם: אֶמְשׁוֹל לָכֶם מָשָׁל: לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לְמֶלֶךְ בָּשָׂר וָדָם שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ בֵּן אֶחָד, פָּסַק לוֹ מְזוֹנוֹתָיו פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה, וְלֹא הָיָה מַקְבִּיל פְּנֵי אָבִיו אֶלָּא פַּעַם אַחַת בַּשָּׁנָה. עָמַד וּפָסַק מְזוֹנוֹתָיו בְּכׇל יוֹם, וְהָיָה מַקְבִּיל פְּנֵי אָבִיו כׇּל יוֹם.
human_translation: students of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai asked him: Why didn’t the manna fall for the Jewish people once a year He said to them: I will give you a parable: To what does this matter compare? To a king of flesh and blood who has one son. He granted him food once a year and greeted his father only once a year, he arose and granted him his food every day, and visited him every day.
llm_translation: The disciples asked Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: "Why did the manna not descend for them in Israel once a year?" He said to them: "I will give you a parable: To what is the matter similar? To a king of flesh and blood who has one son, he would provide his sustenance once a year, and he would only turn his face to his father once a year. He stood and provided his sustenance every day, and he would turn his face to his father every day."

hebrew_text: אַף יִשְׂרָאֵל, מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ לוֹ אַרְבָּעָה וַחֲמִשָּׁה בָּנִים הָיָה דּוֹאֵג וְאוֹמֵר: שֶׁמָּא לֹא יֵרֵד מָן לְמָחָר, וְנִמְצְאוּ כּוּלָּן מֵתִים בָּרָעָב, נִמְצְאוּ כּוּלָּן מְכַוְּונִים אֶת לִבָּם לַאֲבִיהֶן שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם.
human_translation: So too, the Jewish people, someone who had four or five children would be worried and say: Perhaps the manna will not fall tomorrow and we will all die of starvation. Consequently, everyone directed their hearts to their Father in heaven
llm_translation: Even Israel, one who has four or five sons, was anxious and said: perhaps the manna will not descend for tomorrow, and they all were found dead from famine, they all directed their hearts to their Father in Heaven.

hebrew_text: דָּבָר אַחֵר: שֶׁהָיוּ אוֹכְלִין אוֹתוֹ כְּשֶׁהוּא חַם. דָּבָר אַחֵר: מִפְּנֵי מַשּׂאוֹי הַדֶּרֶךְ.
human_translation: Alternatively, so that they would eat it while it was hot Alternatively, due to carrying on the journey.
llm_translation: Another explanation: they would eat it while it was hot. Another explanation: due to the burden of the journey.

hebrew_text: וּכְבָר הָיָה רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וּזְקֵנִים יוֹשְׁבִין וְעוֹסְקִין בְּפָרָשַׁת הַמָּן, וְהָיָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַמּוֹדָעִי יוֹשֵׁב בֵּינֵיהֶן. נַעֲנָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַמּוֹדָעִי וְאָמַר: מָן שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶן לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הָיָה גָּבוֹהַּ שִׁשִּׁים אַמָּה. אָמַר לוֹ רַבִּי טַרְפוֹן: מוֹדָעִי, עַד מָתַי אַתָּה מְגַבֵּב דְּבָרִים וּמֵבִיא עָלֵינוּ!
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon, and Rabbi Yishmael, and the Elders were sitting and discussing the passage about the manna and Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i was sitting among them. Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i responded and said: The manna that fell for the Jewish people was sixty cubits high. Rabbi Tarfon said to him: Moda’i, how long will you collect words and bring upon us
llm_translation: And already was Rabbi Tarfon and Rabbi Yishmael and elders sitting and engaging in the matter of the manna, and Rabbi Elazar HaModa'i was sitting among them. Rabbi Elazar HaModa'i answered and said: The manna that descended to Israel was sixty cubits high. Rabbi Tarfon said to him: Moda'i, until when will you magnify matters and bring upon us!

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ: רַבִּי, מִקְרָא אֲנִי דּוֹרֵשׁ: ״חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה מִלְמַעְלָה גָּבְרוּ הַמָּיִם וַיְכֻסּוּ הֶהָרִים״, וְכִי חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה בָּעֵמֶק, (חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה בַּשְּׁפֵלָה,) חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה בֶּהָרִים? וְכִי מַיָּא שׁוּרֵי שׁוּרֵי קָיְימִי. וְעוֹד: תֵּיבָה הֵיכִי סַגִּיָא? אֶלָּא, נִבְקְעוּ כׇּל מַעְיְנוֹת תְּהוֹם רַבָּה עַד דְּאַשְׁווֹ מַיָּא בַּהֲדֵי טוּרֵי, וַהֲדַר ״חֲמֵשׁ עֶשְׂרֵה אַמָּה מִלְמַעְלָה גָּבְרוּ הַמָּיִם״.
human_translation: He said to him: Rabbi, I am interpreting a verse. “Fifteen cubits above did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered” Is it possible that it would be fifteen cubits from a valley, fifteen from the plain, fifteen from the mountains? Did the water stand as though in layers, Furthermore, how could the Ark travel Rather: “On the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up” until the water was level with the mountains. Afterward, “fifteen cubits above did the waters prevail.”
llm_translation: He said to him: Rabbi, a verse I am interpreting: "Fifteen cubits above, the waters prevailed, and the mountains were covered." And are fifteen cubits in the valley, (fifteen in the plain,) fifteen in the mountains? And are the waters bulls, bulls standing? And furthermore: how can a box be closed? Rather, all the springs of the great deep were split open until the water rose over the mountains, and then "the waters prevailed fifteen cubits above."

hebrew_text: וְכִי אֵי זֶה מִדָּה מְרוּבָּה, מִדָּה טוֹבָה אוֹ מִדַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת? הֱוֵי אוֹמֵר: מִדָּה טוֹבָה מִמִּדַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת, בְּמִדַּת פּוּרְעָנוּת הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַאֲרוּבּוֹת הַשָּׁמַיִם נִפְתָּחוּ״. בְּמִדָּה טוֹבָה הוּא אוֹמֵר: ״וַיְצַו שְׁחָקִים מִמָּעַל וְדַלְתֵי שָׁמַיִם פָּתָח וַיַּמְטֵר עֲלֵיהֶם מָן לֶאֱכוֹל וּדְגַן שָׁמַיִם נָתַן לָמוֹ״.
human_translation: But which attribute is greater, the attribute of goodness or the attribute of retribution? One must say the attribute of goodness than the attribute of retribution. With regard to the attribute of retribution, states: “And the windows of heaven were opened” with regard to the attribute of goodness, states: “He commanded the skies above, and opened the doors of heaven, and rained down manna upon them to eat and gave them heavenly grain”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And when is this attribute of abundance, a good attribute or a attribute of punishment? One should say: it is a good attribute rather than an attribute of punishment, for in the attribute of punishment it is said: 'And the windows of heaven were opened.' In the attribute of goodness it is said: 'And He commanded the skies above, and opened the doors of heaven, and rained down manna upon them to eat, and gave them the grain of heaven.'" English translation:

hebrew_text: כַּמָּה אֲרוּבּוֹת יֵשׁ בְּדֶלֶת — אַרְבַּע אַרְבַּע, הֲרֵי כָּאן שְׁמוֹנֶה, וְנִמְצָא מָן שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל גָּבוֹהַּ שִׁשִּׁים אַמָּה.
human_translation: how many windows are in a door? Four. four This equals eight it turns out that the manna that fell for the Jewish people was sixty cubits high,
llm_translation: How many doorposts are there? Four by four, here are eight, and it is found that the manna that descended for the Israelites was sixty cubits high.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, אִיסִי בֶּן יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: מָן שֶׁיָּרַד לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל הָיָה מִתְגַּבֵּר וְעוֹלֶה עַד שֶׁרוֹאִין אוֹתוֹ כׇּל מַלְכֵי מִזְרָח וּמַעֲרָב, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״תַּעֲרוֹךְ לְפָנַי שֻׁלְחָן נֶגֶד צוֹרְרָי [וְגוֹ׳ כּוֹסִי רְוָיָה]״, אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ כָּסָא דְּדָוִד לְעָלְמָא דְּאָתֵי, מָאתַן וְעֶשְׂרִין וְחַד לוּגָּא מַחֲזִיק, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כּוֹסִי רְוָיָה״, רְוָיָה בְּגִימַטְרִיָּא הָכִי הָוֵי.
human_translation: it was taught Isi ben Yehuda said: The manna that fell for the Jewish people would accumulate and ascend until all the kings of the East and West could see it, as it is stated: “You prepared a table before me in the presence of my enemies; my cup runs over” “My cup runs over [ revaya ]”; Abaye said: We learn from this that the cup of David in the next world holds 221 log , since it is stated: “My cup runs over,” revaya has that numerical value.
llm_translation: It was taught: Issi son of Judah says: The manna that descended for the Israelites was becoming stronger and rising until all the kings of the East and West would see him, as it is stated: "You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies and my cup overflows." Abaye said: Learn from this that the throne of David will endure forever, one hundred and twenty-one log holding, as it is stated: "My cup overflows," overflowing in gematria thus it shall be.

hebrew_text: הָא לָא דָּמְיָא. הָתָם בְּאַרְבְּעִין יוֹמִין, הָכָא חֲדָא שַׁעְתָּא. הָתָם לְכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא, הָכָא לְיִשְׂרָאֵל לְחוֹדֵיהּ, וּנְפִישׁ לְהוּ טְפֵי. רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר הַמּוֹדָעִי ״פְּתִיחָה״ ״פְּתִיחָה״ גָּמַר.
human_translation: This is not similar, There, forty days; here, one hour there for everyone here was for the Jewish people alone. And there much more for them Rabbi Elazar HaModa’i derived “opening” “opening”
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: "This is not comparable. There, the time period was forty days, here it is one hour. There, it applied to all the world, here it applies to Israel alone, and it is more stringent for them. Rabbi Elazar HaModa'i concluded 'opening,' 'opening.'"

hebrew_text: אָסוּר בַּאֲכִילָה. הָנֵי חֲמִשָּׁה עִנּוּיִין כְּנֶגֶד מִי? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: כְּנֶגֶד חֲמִשָּׁה עִנּוּיִין שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה: ״וּבֶעָשׂוֹר״, וְ״אַךְ בֶּעָשׂוֹר״, ״שַׁבַּת שַׁבָּתוֹן״, וְ״שַׁבַּת שַׁבָּתוֹן״, ״וְהָיְתָה לָכֶם״.
human_translation: prohibited in eating These five afflictions what correspond? Rav Ḥisda said: the five afflictions in the Torah. “And on the tenth “But on the tenth a Shabbat of solemn rest, “It is a Shabbat of solemn rest [ shabbaton ] “And it shall be for you
llm_translation: Forbidden to eat. Those five afflictions correspond to whom? Rav Ḥisdah said: Corresponding to the five afflictions in the Torah: "And on the tenth," and "But on the tenth," "A sabbath of solemn rest," and "A sabbath of solemn rest," "And it shall be unto you."

hebrew_text: הָנֵי חֲמִשָּׁה הָווּ? וַאֲנַן שִׁיתָּא תְּנַן! שְׁתִיָּה בִּכְלַל אֲכִילָה הִיא. דְּאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: מִנַּיִן לִשְׁתִיָּה שֶׁהִיא בִּכְלַל אֲכִילָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ לִפְנֵי ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ מַעְשַׂר דְּגָנְךָ תִּירוֹשְׁךָ וְיִצְהָרֶךָ״, תִּירוֹשׁ חַמְרָא הוּא, וְקָרֵי לֵיהּ ״וְאָכַלְתָּ״.
human_translation: Are these five We learn six: Drinking is included in eating; As Reish Lakish said: From where do we derive that drinking is included in eating? As it is stated: “And you shall eat before the Lord your God, the tithe of your grain, your wine [ tirosh ], and your oil” Tirosh is wine, calls “and you shall eat,”
llm_translation: These five? But we learned six! Two are included in eating. As Reish Lakish said: From where do we derive that drinking is included in eating? As it is stated: "And you shall eat before the Lord your God, in the place which He shall choose to cause His name to dwell there, the tithe of your grain, your wine, and your oil." Wine is comparable to grain, and it is called "and you shall eat."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? וְדִילְמָא דְּאַכְלֵיהּ עַל יְדֵי אֲנִיגְרוֹן! דְּאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר שְׁמוּאֵל: אַנִיגְרוֹן מַיָּא דְסִילְקָא, אַכְּסִיגְרוֹן מַיָּא דְּכוּלְּהוּ שִׁלְקֵי.
human_translation: From where Perhaps was eaten as anigron , Rabba bar Shmuel said: Anigron beet juice Akhsigron water that comes from boiled vegetables
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps because he ate it with Anigron! For Rabba bar Shmuel said: Anigron is the water of the Silka, Akseegron is the water of all the Shilkei.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אַחָא בַּר יַעֲקֹב, מֵהָכָא: ״וְנָתַתָּה הַכֶּסֶף בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר תְּאַוֶּה נַפְשְׁךָ בַּבָּקָר וּבַצֹּאן בְּיַיִן וּבַשֵּׁכָר״. שֵׁכָר שְׁתִיָּה הוּא, וְקַרְיֵיהּ רַחֲמָנָא ״וְאָכַלְתָּ״.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: From here “And you shall spend that money on all that your soul desires, on oxen, or on sheep, or on wine, or on strong drink [ sheikhar ] Strong drink is a drink, but the Merciful One calls “and you shall eat.”
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Acha bar Yaakov said from here: "And you shall spend the money for whatever your soul desires, for oxen or for sheep, for wine or for strong drink." Strong drink is intoxicating liquor, and the Merciful One calls it "and you shall eat."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? וְדִילְמָא הָכָא נָמֵי דְּאַכְלֵיהּ עַל יְדֵי אֲנִיגְרוֹן! ״שֵׁכָר״ כְּתִב, מִידֵּי דִּמְשַׁכַּר. וְדִילְמָא דְּבֵילָה קְעִילִית? דְּתַנְיָא: אָכַל דְּבֵילָה קְעִילִית וְשָׁתָה דְּבַשׁ וְחָלָב וְנִכְנַס לַמִּקְדָּשׁ —
human_translation: From where Perhaps here too it was eaten as anigron ? writes “strong drink [ sheikhar ],” something intoxicates. Perhaps a sweet dried fig from Keilah. As it was taught ate a sweet dried fig from Keilah or drank honey or milk, and entered the Temple
llm_translation: From what? Perhaps here it is similar to where he ate it through a tube! "Wine" it wrote, from the hands of one who is intoxicated. And perhaps it is referring to a gluttonous person? For it was taught: One who eats gluttonously and drinks wine and milk, and enters the Temple —

hebrew_text: (חַיָּיב).
human_translation: is liable
llm_translation: Guilty.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: יָלֵיף ״שֵׁכָר״ ״שֵׁכָר״ מִנָּזִיר, מָה לְהַלָּן — יַיִן, אַף כָּאן יַיִן.
human_translation: Rather, It is derived “ sheikhar ” “ sheikhar ” of nazirite Just as there, wine, so too, here, wine
llm_translation: Rather: infer "wine" "wine" from Nazir, what there — wine, so here wine.

hebrew_text: וְתִירוֹשׁ חַמְרָא הוּא? וְהָתַנְיָא: הַנּוֹדֵר מִן הַתִּירוֹשׁ — אָסוּר בְּכׇל מִינֵי מְתִיקָה וּמוּתָּר בְּיַיִן! וְלָאו חַמְרָא הוּא? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְתִירוֹשׁ יְנוֹבֵב בְּתוּלוֹת״, דָּבָר הַבָּא מִן הַתִּירוֹשׁ — יְנוֹבֵב בְּתוּלוֹת.
human_translation: Is tirosh wine? Isn’t it taught One vows from tirosh is not allowed sweet foods, but is allowed wine. And is not wine? But isn’t it written: “ Tirosh shall make the young women flourish [ yenovev ]” Something that comes from tirosh , causes virgins to come forth;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Is grape juice wine? But it was taught: One who vows from grape juice - forbidden in all types of sweetness and permitted in wine! And is it not wine? But it is written: "And the grape juice will be sweetened in virgins," a matter that comes from grape juice - will be sweetened in virgins.

hebrew_text: וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְתִירוֹשׁ יְקָבֶיךָ יִפְרוֹצוּ״! דָּבָר הַבָּא מִן הַתִּירוֹשׁ — יְקָבֶיךָ יִפְרוֹצוּ.
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And your vats shall overflow with tirosh ” the vats shall overflow with something that comes from tirosh ,
llm_translation: And it is written: "And your vineyards shall be breached"! A matter that comes from the grapevine - your vineyards shall be breached.

hebrew_text: וְהָא כְּתִיב ״זְנוּת וְיַיִן וְתִירוֹשׁ יִקַּח לֵב״! אֶלָּא, דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא תִּירוֹשׁ חַמְרָא הוּא, וּבִנְדָרִים הַלֵּךְ אַחַר לְשׁוֹן בְּנֵי אָדָם.
human_translation: But it is written: “Harlotry, and wine, and tirosh take away the heart” Rather, according to everyone, tirosh wine, but vows follow colloquial language.
llm_translation: And this, as it is written, "Harlotry, wine, and new wine take away the heart"! Rather, all the world, new wine is wine, and in vows we follow the language of people.

hebrew_text: וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ יַיִן, וְאַמַּאי קָרֵי לֵיהּ תִּירוֹשׁ? יַיִן — שֶׁמֵּבִיא יְלָלָה לְעוֹלָם. תִּירוֹשׁ — שֶׁכׇּל הַמִּתְגָּרֶה בּוֹ נַעֲשָׂה רָשׁ.
human_translation: And why does call wine why does it call it tirosh ? “Wine” that it brings lament to the world “ Tirosh ” that those who indulge in it become poor [ rash ].
llm_translation: And why is it called wine, and why is it called grape juice? Wine - because it brings wailing to the world. Grape juice - because anyone who engages with it becomes poor.

hebrew_text: רַב כָּהֲנָא רָמֵי: כְּתִיב ״תִּירָשׁ״, וְקָרֵינַן ״תִּירוֹשׁ״. זָכָה — נַעֲשָׂה רֹאשׁ, לֹא זָכָה — נַעֲשָׂה רָשׁ. (וְהַיְינוּ דְּרָבָא דְּרָבָא) רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״יְשַׁמַּח״, וְקָרֵינַן יְשַׂמַּח. זָכָה — מְשַׂמְּחוֹ, לֹא זָכָה — מְשַׁמְּמוֹ. וְהַיְינוּ דְּאָמַר רָבָא: חַמְרָא וְרֵיחָנֵי — פַּקְחֻין.
human_translation: Rav Kahana raised a contradiction: It is written tirash but we read it tirosh . one merits he is made a head [ rosh ]; one does not merit he is made poor [ rash ]. This is the same as Rava Rava raised a contradiction: It is written: makes glad [ yishamaḥ ] we read it yisamaḥ If one merits, makes him happy [ same’aḥ ]; if one does not merit, makes him confounded [ shamem ]. This is what Rava said: Wine and good scents make me wise,
llm_translation: Rav Kahana raises a contradiction: It is written "tirash," and we read it as "tirosh." If one merits it, it becomes a head; if one does not merit it, it becomes poor. (And this is the same as what Rava said: Rava raises a contradiction: It is written "yismach," and we read it as "yesameach." If one merits it, he rejoices; if one does not merit it, he makes desolate. And this is what Rava said: Wine and spices make one's mind open.)

hebrew_text: רְחִיצָה וְסִיכָה, מְנָא לַן דְּאִיקְּרִי עִינּוּי. דִּכְתִיב: ״לֶחֶם חֲמוּדוֹת לֹא אָכַלְתִּי וּבָשָׂר וָיַיִן לֹא בָא אֶל פִּי וְסוֹךְ לֹא סָכְתִּי״. מַאי ״לֶחֶם חֲמוּדוֹת לֹא אָכַלְתִּי״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר שִׁילַת: אֲפִילּוּ נַהֲמָא דְּחִיטֵּי דַּכְיָיתָא, לָא אֲכַל.
human_translation: From where do we bathing and smearing is called affliction? As it is written “I ate no pleasant bread, neither did meat nor wine enter my mouth, neither did I anoint myself at all” What “I ate no pleasant bread”? Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, said: He did not eat even bread refined wheat;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Rechitzah v'sichah, mana lan d'ikri inui. Dichtiv: 'Lechem chamudot lo achalti u'vasar vayayin lo ba el pi v'soch lo sachti.' Mai 'lechem chamudot lo achalti'? Amar Rav Yehudah brei d'Rav Shmuel bar Shilat: Afilu nahama d'chitei dachyata, lo achal." English translation: "Washing and anointing, how do we know that they are called affliction? As it is written: 'I have not eaten desirable bread, and neither has meat and wine entered my mouth, nor have I anointed myself.' What is 'desirable bread that I have not eaten'? Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel bar Shilat, said: Even the finest flour of wheat, I have not eaten."

hebrew_text: וּמְנָא לַן דַּחֲשִׁיב כְּעִינּוּי — דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלַי אַל תִּירָא דָנִיֵּאל כִּי מִן הַיּוֹם הָרִאשׁוֹן אֲשֶׁר נָתַתָּ אֶת לִבְּךָ לְהָבִין וּלְהִתְעַנּוֹת לִפְנֵי אֱלֹהֶיךָ נִשְׁמְעוּ דְבָרֶיךָ וַאֲנִי בָאתִי בִּדְבָרֶיךָ״. (״כִּי חֲמוּדוֹת אָתָּה״.)
human_translation: And from where do we considered affliction? As it is written: “Then he said to me: Fear not, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand and to afflict yourself before your God, your words were heard, and I have come due to your words” “For you are greatly loved”
llm_translation: And count for us that it is considered as if - as it is written: "And he said to me, 'Do not fear, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand and to humble yourself before your God, your words were heard, and I have come because of your words.'" ("For you are greatly beloved.")

hebrew_text: אַשְׁכְּחַן סִיכָה, רְחִיצָה מְנָא לַן? אָמַר רַב זוּטְרָא בְּרַבִּי טוֹבִיָּה, אָמַר קְרָא: ״וַתָּבֹא כַמַּיִם בְּקִרְבּוֹ וְכַשֶּׁמֶן בְּעַצְמוֹתָיו״. וְאֵימָא כִּשְׁתִיָּה! דּוּמְיָא דְּשֶׁמֶן: מָה שֶׁמֶן מֵאַבָּרַאי, אַף מַיִם מֵאַבָּרַאי.
human_translation: We have found smearing from where do we bathing Rav Zutra, son of Rabbi Toviya, said: The verse states: “And it came into his innards like water, and like oil into his bones” But say drinking It is similar oil. Just as oil from outside so too, water from the outside.
llm_translation: We found a plaster, how do we immerse it? Rav Zutra, son of Rabbi Toviya, said: It says in the verse, "And it shall come like water within him, and like oil in his bones." But why not like drinking? Resembling oil: Just as oil is from the limbs, so too water is from the limbs.

hebrew_text: וְהָא תַּנָּא אִיפְּכָא קָא נָסֵיב לַהּ, דִּתְנַן: מִנַּיִן לְסִיכָה שֶׁהִיא כִּשְׁתִיָּה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים? אַף עַל פִּי שֶׁאֵין רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר, זֵכֶר לַדָּבָר, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַתָּבֹא כַמַּיִם בְּקִרְבּוֹ וְכַשֶּׁמֶן בְּעַצְמוֹתָיו״! אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: רְחִיצָה מִגּוּפֵיהּ דִּקְרָא שְׁמִיעַ לֵיהּ, דִּכְתִיב: ״וְסוֹךְ לֹא סָכְתִּי״.
human_translation: But the tanna took opposite as we learned From where do we derive that smearing is like drinking on Yom Kippur? Although there is no proof of the matter there is an allusion to the matter as it is stated: “And it came into his innards like water, and like oil into his bones” Rather, Rav Ashi said: Bathing is derived from the same verse as it is written: “Neither did I anoint myself at all”
llm_translation: The Gemara asks: But didn't we learn the opposite? As we learned in a Mishnah: From where do we derive the halacha regarding the prohibition of anointing oneself with oil on Yom Kippur? Even though there is no direct proof for this matter, there is an allusion to it, as it is stated: "And it entered like water into his innards, and like oil into his bones" (Psalms 109:18). Rather, Rav Ashei said: The verse itself indicates washing one's body, as it is written: "And I did not anoint myself" (Daniel 10:3).

hebrew_text: מַאי: ״וַאֲנִי בָּאתִי בִּדְבָרֶיךָ״? הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשִׁבְעִים אִישׁ מִזִּקְנֵי [בֵית] יִשְׂרָאֵל וְיַאֲזַנְיָהוּ בֶן שָׁפָן עוֹמֵד בְּתוֹכָם עוֹמְדִים לִפְנֵיהֶם וְאִישׁ מִקְטַרְתּוֹ בְּיָדוֹ וַעֲתַר עֲנַן הַקְּטוֹרֶת עֹלֶה״. ״וַיִּשְׁלַח תַּבְנִית יָד וַיִּקָּחֵנִי בְּצִיצִת רֹאשִׁי וַתִּשָּׂא אוֹתִי רוּחַ בֵּין הָאָרֶץ וּבֵין הַשָּׁמַיִם וַתָּבֵא אוֹתִי יְרוּשָׁלַיְמָה בְּמַרְאוֹת אֱלֹהִים אֶל פֶּתַח שַׁעַר הַפְּנִימִית הַפּוֹנֶה צָפוֹנָה אֲשֶׁר
human_translation: What “And I have come due to your words” This is as it is written: “And there stood before them seventy men of the Elders of the house of Israel, and Jaazaniah, son of Shaphan, standing in the midst of them, each man with his censer in his hand, and a thick cloud of incense went up” “And the form of a hand was put forth, and I was taken by a lock of my head; and a spirit lifted me up between the earth and the heaven, and brought me in the visions of God to Jerusalem, to the door of the gate of the inner court that faces northward where
llm_translation: What is meant by "And I came by your words"? That which is written: "And seventy men of the elders of the house of Israel, and Yaazaniah son of Shaphan standing among them, and each man had his censer in his hand, and the cloud of incense was ascending." "And He sent forth the form of a hand and took me by a lock of my head, and the spirit lifted me up between the earth and the heavens and brought me to Jerusalem in visions of God, to the entrance of the inner gate that faces north, where...

hebrew_text: שָׁם מוֹשַׁב סֵמֶל הַקִּנְאָה הַמַּקְנֶה״, ״וַיָּבֵא אוֹתִי אֶל חֲצַר בֵּית ה׳ הַפְּנִימִית וְהִנֵּה פֶתַח הֵיכַל ה׳ בֵּין הָאוּלָם וּבֵין הַמִּזְבֵּחַ כְּעֶשְׂרִים וַחֲמִשָּׁה אִישׁ אֲחוֹרֵיהֶם אֶל הֵיכַל ה׳ וּפְנֵיהֶם קֵדְמָה וְהֵמָּה מִשְׁתַּחֲוִים קֵדְמָה לַשָּׁמֶשׁ״. מִמַּשְׁמַע שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר ״וּפְנֵיהֶם קֵדְמָה״, אֵינִי יוֹדֵעַ שֶׁאֲחוֹרֵיהֶם אֶל הֵיכַל ה׳? אֶלָּא, מָה תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר ״אֲחוֹרֵיהֶם אֶל הֵיכַל ה׳ — מְלַמֵּד שֶׁהָיוּ פּוֹרְעִין עַצְמָן וְהָיוּ מַתְרִיזִין כְּלַפֵּי מַטָּה.
human_translation: there was the seat of the image of jealousy, which provokes jealousy” “And he brought me into the inner court of the Lord’s House, and behold at the opening of the Entrance Hall of God, between the porch and the altar were about twenty-five men with their backs toward the Temple of the Lord, and their faces toward the east, and they worshipped the sun toward the east” From the fact that it is stated “and their faces toward the east,” is it not clear that their backs were to the Sanctuary, Rather, what the verse states “their backs toward the Temple of the Lord”? This teaches that they would uncover and defecate downward,
llm_translation: There sat Semel the Zealot, who acquired, "And he brought me to the inner courtyard of the house of the Lord, and behold, the entrance of the sanctuary of the Lord between the hall and the altar, about twenty-five men with their backs to the sanctuary of the Lord, and their faces eastward; they were bowing eastward to the sun." From the fact that it says, "and their faces eastward," do I not know that their backs were to the sanctuary of the Lord? Rather, what is the teaching when it says, "with their backs to the sanctuary of the Lord"? It teaches that they were turning their backs and provoking towards the sanctuary.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לוֹ הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא לְמִיכָאֵל: מִיכָאֵל! סָרְחָה אוּמָּתֶךָ. אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, דַּיִּי לַטּוֹבִים שֶׁבָּהֶם! אָמַר לוֹ: אֲנִי שׂוֹרֵף אוֹתָם וְלַטּוֹבִים שֶׁבָּהֶם, מִיָּד: ״וַיֹּאמֶר (לָאִישׁ) לְבוּשׁ הַבַּדִּים וַיֹּאמֶר בּוֹא אֶל בֵּינוֹת לַגַּלְגַּל אֶל תַּחַת לַכְּרוּב וּמַלֵּא חׇפְנֶיךָ גַחֲלֵי אֵשׁ מִבֵּינוֹת לַכְּרוּבִים וּזְרוֹק עַל הָעִיר וַיָּבֹא לְעֵינָי״. מִיָּד: ״וַיִּשְׁלַח הַכְּרוּב אֶת יָדוֹ מִבֵּינוֹת לַכְּרוּבִים אֶל הָאֵשׁ אֲשֶׁר בֵּינוֹת הַכְּרוּבִים וַיִּשָּׂא וַיִּתֵּן אֶל חׇפְנֵי לְבוּשׁ הַבַּדִּים וַיִּקַּח וַיֵּצֵא״.
human_translation: The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Michael, Michael, your nation has sinned He replied: Master of the Universe, it be enough for the good among them He said to him: I will burn them and the good among them Immediately, “He spoke to the man clothed in linen and said: Go in between the wheelwork and beneath the cherub, and fill your hands with coals of fire from between the cherubs, and scatter them over the city; and he came before my eyes” Immediately: “And the cherub stretched out his hand from between the cherubs into the fire that was between the cherubs, and took and put it into the hands of him that was clothed in linen, who took it and went out”
llm_translation: He said to him, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Michael: Michael! Your omah has turned away. He said before Him: Master of the universe, it is enough for the good ones among them! He said to him: I will burn them and for the good ones among them, immediately: "And he said (to the man) clothed in linen, 'Go within the wheelwork, beneath the cherubs, fill your hands with burning coals from among the cherubs, and scatter them over the city.' And he went before my eyes." Immediately: "And the cherub stretched out his hand from among the cherubs to the fire that was among the cherubs, took and put it into the hands of the one clothed in linen, who took it and went out."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב חָנָא בַּר בִּיזְנָא אָמַר רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן חֲסִידָא: אִילְמָלֵא לֹא נִצְטַנְּנוּ גֶּחָלִים מִיָּדוֹ שֶׁל כְּרוּב לְיָדוֹ שֶׁל גַּבְרִיאֵל — לֹא נִשְׁתַּיְּירוּ מִשּׂוֹנְאֵיהֶן שֶׁל יִשְׂרָאֵל שָׂרִיד וּפָלִיט.
human_translation: Rav Ḥana bar Bizna said Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida said: If it were not for the fact that the embers cooled from the hand of the cherub to the hand of Gabriel, not a remnant or a refugee of the enemies of the Jewish people, would have survived.
llm_translation: Rav Ḥanina bar Bizna said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida: If not for the fact that fiery coals were snatched from the hand of the cherub to the hand of Gabriel, the enemies of Israel would not have been able to survive and escape.

hebrew_text: וּכְתִיב: ״וְהִנֵּה הָאִישׁ לְבוּשׁ הַבַּדִּים אֲשֶׁר הַקֶּסֶת בְּמׇתְנָיו מֵשִׁיב דָּבָר לֵאמֹר עָשִׂיתִי כַּאֲשֶׁר צִוִּיתָנִי״. אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: בְּאוֹתָהּ שָׁעָה הוֹצִיאוּ לְגַבְרִיאֵל מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד, וּמַחְיוּהוּ שִׁיתִּין פּוּלְסֵי דְנוּרָא. אֲמַרוּ לֵיהּ: אִי לָא עֲבַדְתְּ — לָא עֲבַדְתְּ, אִי עֲבַדְתְּ — אַמַּאי לָא עֲבַדְתְּ כִּדְפַקְּדוּךְ? וְעוֹד: דַּעֲבַדְתְּ, לֵית לָךְ אֵין מְשִׁיבִין עַל הַקַּלְקָלָה?
human_translation: And it is written: “And behold, the man clothed in linen with the slate by his side, reported the matter saying: I have done as You have commanded me” Rabbi Yoḥanan said: At that moment, they cast out Gabriel from behind the curtain [ pargod ], and they struck him with sixty blows [ pulsei ] of fire. They said to him: If you did not do it, you did not do it; if you did do it, why did you not do it according to what you were commanded Moreover, you already did it, do you not have One should not deliver about destruction?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it is written: "And behold, the man clothed in linen, whose loins were girded with the fine gold of Uphaz, answered and said: 'I have done as You commanded me.'" Rabbi Yochanan said: At that moment they took Gabriel from behind the curtain, and they revived him with sixty pulses of light. They said to him: If you did not do it - you did not do it, if you did it - why did you not do it as you were commanded? Furthermore, if you did it, why do you not respond to the accusation?

hebrew_text: אַיְיתוּהּ לְדוּבִּיאֵל שָׂרָא דְפָרְסָאֵי וְאוֹקְמוּהּ בַּחֲרִיקֵיהּ, וְשַׁמֵּשׁ עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד יוֹם. הַיְינוּ דִּכְתִיב: ״וְשַׂר מַלְכוּת פָּרַס עוֹמֵד לְנֶגְדִּי עֶשְׂרִים וְאֶחָד יוֹם וְהִנֵּה מִיכָאֵל אַחַד הַשָּׂרִים הָרִאשׁוֹנִים בָּא לְעׇזְרֵנִי וַאֲנִי נוֹתַרְתִּי שָׁם אֵצֶל מַלְכֵי פָרָס״, יְהַבוּ לֵיהּ עֶשְׂרִין וְחַד מַלְכֵי וּפַרְווֹתָא דְּמַשְׁהִיג.
human_translation: They brought Dubiel, the ministering angel of the Persians and put him in the place of [ baḥarikei ] and he served for twenty-one days. As it is written: “But the prince of the kingdom of Persia stood opposed to me for twenty-one days, but, lo, Michael, one of the chief princes, came to help me and I remained there beside the kings of Persia” they gave him, twenty-one kings the seaport Mashhig.
llm_translation: They brought him to Dubiel, the prince of Persia, and they established him in his position, and he served for twenty-one days. That is what is written: "And the prince of the kingdom of Persia withstood me for twenty-one days, and behold, Michael, one of the chief princes, came to help me, and I remained there with the kings of Persia." They gave him twenty-one kings and fruits of the vineyard.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר: כְּתִיבוּ לִי לְיִשְׂרָאֵל בְּאַכְּרָגָא. כְּתַבוּ לֵיהּ. כְּתִיבוּ לִי רַבָּנַן בְּאַכְּרָגָא. כְּתַבוּ לֵיהּ. בְּעִידָּנָא דְּבָעוּ לְמִיחְתַּם, עָמַד גַּבְרִיאֵל מֵאֲחוֹרֵי הַפַּרְגּוֹד וְאָמַר: ״שָׁוְא לָכֶם מַשְׁכִּימֵי קוּם מְאַחֲרֵי שֶׁבֶת אוֹכְלֵי לֶחֶם הָעֲצָבִים כֵּן יִתֵּן לִידִידוֹ שֵׁנָא״, מַאי ״כֵּן יִתֵּן לִידִידוֹ שֵׁנָא״? אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אֵלּוּ נְשׁוֹתֵיהֶן שֶׁל תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים שֶׁמְּנַדְּדוֹת שֵׁינָה בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה וְזוֹכוֹת לָעוֹלָם הַבָּא, וְלֹא הִשְׁגִּיחוּ עָלָיו.
human_translation: said: Write for me that the Jews taxes [ akarga ] They wrote it for him Write for me that the Sages taxes. They wrote for him. When they wanted to sign Gabriel stood from behind the curtain and said: “It is vain for you who rise early who sit up late to eat the bread of sorrow, for He gives His beloved sleep” What “for He gives His beloved sleep” Rav Yitzḥak said: These are the wives of Torah scholars who disturb sleep in this world and merit the World-to-Come. They did not listen to
llm_translation: He said: Write for me to the Israelites in Akraga. They wrote for him. Write for the Rabbis in Akraga. They wrote for him. At the time they came to take leave, Gabriel stood behind the curtain and said: "It is equal for you, those who rise early after Shabbat and eat the bread of sorrow, so shall it be given to his beloved friend." What is "so shall it be given to his beloved friend"? Rabbi Yitzchak said: These are the wives of the Torah scholars who wander in this world and merit the World to Come, and they did not pay attention to him.

hebrew_text: אָמַר לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! אִם יִהְיוּ כׇּל חַכְמֵי אוּמּוֹת הָעוֹלָם בְּכַף מֹאזְנַיִם, וְדָנִיֵּאל אִישׁ חֲמוּדוֹת בְּכַף שְׁנִיָּה, לֹא נִמְצָא מַכְרִיעַ אֶת כּוּלָּם?! אָמַר הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: מִי הוּא זֶה שֶׁמְּלַמֵּד זְכוּת עַל בָּנַי? אָמְרוּ לְפָנָיו: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם, גַּבְרִיאֵל. אָמַר לָהֶם: יָבֹא. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וַאֲנִי בָאתִי בִּדְבָרֶיךָ״. אֲמַר לְהוּ: לֵיעוּל. אַעַיְילוּהוּ.
human_translation: He said before Him: Master of the Universe, if all the wise men of other nations were placed on one side of the scale, and Daniel the beloved man were on the other side, would he not outweigh them? The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Who is the one who teaches the virtue of My children? They said to Him: Master of the Universe, Gabriel. He said to them: Let him come is stated: “And I have come due to your words” God said Let him ascend. They brought him up.
llm_translation: He said before Him: Master of the Universe! If all the sages of the nations of the world were on one side of the scale, and Daniel the beloved man on the other side of the scale, would he not outweigh them all?! The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Who is it that advocates merit for My children? They said before Him: Master of the Universe, Gabriel. He said to them: Let him come. As it is stated: "And I have come because of your words." He said to him: Let him ascend.

hebrew_text: אֲתָא, אַשְׁכְּחֵיהּ לְדוּבִּיאֵל דְּנָקֵט לֵיהּ לְאִיגַּרְתֵּיהּ בִּידֵיהּ, בְּעָא לְמִרְמַא מִינֵּיהּ, בַּלְעַהּ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: מִיכְתָּב הֲוָה כְּתִיבָא, מִיחְתָּם לָא הֲוָה חֲתִימָא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: אַף מִיחְתָּם נָמֵי הֲוָה חֲתִימָא, כִּדְבַלְעַהּ, מְחֵיק לַהּ מִינֵּיהּ. הַיְינוּ דִּבְמַלְכוּתָא דְפָרַס, אִיכָּא דְּיָהֵיב כְּרָגָא וְאִיכָּא דְּלָא יָהֵיב כְּרָגָא: ״וַאֲנִי יוֹצֵא וְהִנֵּה שַׂר יָוָן בָּא״, עַוִּי עַוִּי וְלֵיכָּא דְּאַשְׁגַּח בֵּיהּ.
human_translation: He came found Dubiel holding the letter in his hand. wanted to take from him, swallowed it. Some say the letter was written, but it was not signed. Some say it was also signed, when he swallowed it, was erased. This is in the kingdom of Persia, there are who pay taxes and there are who do not pay taxes, “And when I depart from him, the prince of Greece comes” screamed and screamed but no one listened to him.
llm_translation: He came, he found Dubiel who was holding his purse in his hand, he wanted to deceive him, he swallowed it. Some say: the writing was indeed written, but the signature was not there. Some say: even the signature was also there, like in the case of swallowing, it was removed from him. This is like in the kingdom of Persia, where there are some who give a purse and some who do not give a purse: "And I went out, and behold, a prince of Greece came," woe, woe, and there is no one to pay attention to it.

hebrew_text: וְאִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: רְחִיצָה דְּאִיקְּרִי עִנּוּי מְנָא לַן — מֵהָכָא, דִּכְתִיב: ״וּלְאֶבְיָתָר הַכֹּהֵן אָמַר הַמֶּלֶךְ עֲנָתוֹת לֵךְ עַל שָׂדְךָ כִּי אִישׁ מָוֶת אָתָּה וּבַיּוֹם הַזֶּה לֹא אֲמִיתֶךָ כִּי נָשָׂאתָ [אֶת] אֲרוֹן ה׳ לִפְנֵי דָּוִד אָבִי וְכִי הִתְעַנִּיתָ בְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר הִתְעַנָּה אָבִי״. וּכְתִיב בֵּיהּ בְּדָוִד: ״כִּי אָמְרוּ הָעָם רָעֵב וְעָיֵף וְצָמֵא בַּמִּדְבָּר״. רָעֵב מִלֶּחֶם, וְצָמֵא מִמַּיִם, עָיֵף מִמַּאי — לָאו מֵרְחִיצָה? וְדִילְמָא מִנְּעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל?
human_translation: If you wish, say that bathing is considered affliction, from where do we As it is written: “And to Ebiathar the priest the king said: Get to Anatoth to your fields, for you are deserving of death. But I will not put you to death today, because you carried the Ark of the Lord God before David my father, and because you have been afflicted in all that my father was afflicted” And it is written with regard to David: “For they said the people is hungry, and weary, and thirsty in the wilderness” Hunger from bread and thirst from water weary from what? Is it not from bathing? And perhaps wearing shoes?
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: The immersion that is called affliction, from where do we derive it? - From here, as it is written: "And after the king said, 'Let Bathsheba come to you, for you are a man of death, and on this day I will not kill you, for you carried the ark of the Lord before my father David, and because you fasted with all that my father fasted.'" And it is written about David: "For the people said, 'We are hungry, weary, and thirsty in the wilderness.'" Hungry for bread, thirsty for water, weary from what - is it not from immersion?
