And perhaps from removing the sandal strap?

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק, מֵהָכָא: ״מַיִם קָרִים עַל נֶפֶשׁ עֲיֵפָה״. וְדִילְמָא מִשְּׁתִיָּה? מִי כְּתִיב ״בְּנֶפֶשׁ עֲיֵפָה״? ״עַל נֶפֶשׁ עֲיֵפָה״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yitzḥak said: from here: “As cold water on a weary soul, But perhaps from drinking? Is it written: As cold water in a weary soul? “on a weary soul” is written,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yitzchak said from here: "Cold water upon a weary soul." But perhaps one drank? Is it not written "upon a weary soul"? "Upon a weary soul" is written.

hebrew_text: וּנְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״וְדָוִד עוֹלֶה בְמַעֲלֵה הַזֵּיתִים עוֹלֶה וּבוֹכֶה וְרֹאשׁ לוֹ חָפוּי (וְהוֹלֵךְ) יָחֵף״, יָחֵף מִמַּאי — לָאו מִנְּעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל? וְדִילְמָא מִסּוּסְיָא וּמַרְטְקָא.
human_translation: wearing shoes from where do we As it is written: “And David went up by the ascent of the Mount of Olives, and wept as he went up, and he had his head covered, and was walking barefoot” Barefoot of what? Is it not of wearing shoes? perhaps from a horse and whip.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And how do we derive the law of the sandal strap? As it is written: 'And David went up by the ascent of the Mount of Olives, weeping as he went, with his head covered and walking barefoot.' From where is it barefoot? Is it not from the sandal strap? Perhaps it is from the horse and the mule."

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, מֵהָכָא: ״לֵךְ וּפִתַּחְתָּ הַשַּׂק מֵעַל מׇתְנֶיךָ וְנַעַלְךָ תַחֲלוֹץ מֵעַל רַגְלֶךָ״, וּכְתִיב: ״וַיַּעַשׂ כֵּן הָלוֹךְ עָרוֹם וְיָחֵף״. יָחֵף מִמַּאי — לָאו מִנְּעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל? וְאֵימָא בְּמִנְעָלִים הַמְטוּלָּאִים? דְּאִי לָא תֵּימָא הָכִי, ״עָרוֹם״ — עָרוֹם מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא בִּבְגָדִים בְּלוּיִים, הָכָא נָמֵי בְּמִנְעָלִים הַמְטוּלָּאִים.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: from here, “Go and loose the sackcloth from your loins, and remove your shoe from your foot” And it is written: “And he did so, walking naked and barefoot” Barefoot of what? Is it not wearing shoes? And say with patched shoes. Because if you do not say this, actually naked? Rather, ragged garments. Here too, in patched shoes.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said from here: "Go and remove the sackcloth from upon your loins, and your sandals you shall take off from your feet," and it is written: "And he did so, walking naked and barefoot." "Barefoot" - from what? Not from the removal of sandals? Rather, say it is referring to worn-out sandals. For if you do not say so, "naked" - truly naked, rather it is referring to worn-out garments, here too it is referring to worn-out sandals.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק, מֵהָכָא: ״מִנְעִי רַגְלֵךְ מִיָּחֵף וּגְרוֹנֵךְ מִצִּמְאָה״, מִנְעִי עַצְמְךָ מִן הַחֵטְא כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יָבֹא רַגְלְךָ לִידֵי יִחוּף, מִנְעִי לְשׁוֹנֵךְ מִדְּבָרִים בְּטֵלִים כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יָבֹא גְּרוֹנֵךְ לִידֵי צִמְאָה.
human_translation: Rather, Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said from here: “Withhold your foot from being barefoot, and your throat from thirst” Keep yourself from sin, so that your feet will not come to be barefoot; keep your tongue from idle talk, so that your throat will not come to be thirsty.
llm_translation: Rather, said Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak, from here: "Remove your foot from being barefoot and your throat from thirst." Remove yourself from sin so that your foot does not come to be barefoot, restrain your tongue from idle words so that your throat does not come to thirst.

hebrew_text: תַּשְׁמִישׁ הַמִּטָּה דְּאִיקְּרִי עִנּוּי מְנָא לַן? דִּכְתִיב: ״אִם תְּעַנֶּה אֶת בְּנוֹתַי וְאִם תִּקַּח נָשִׁים״.
human_translation: From where do we conjugal relations is called affliction? As it is written, “If you shall afflict my daughters, and if you shall take wives
llm_translation: The use of the bed, which is called 'affliction,' how do we derive it? As it is written: "If you afflict my daughters, and if you take wives."

hebrew_text: ״אִם תְּעַנֶּה״ — מִתַּשְׁמִישׁ, ״וְאִם תִּקַּח״ — מִצָּרוֹת. וְאֵימָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מִצָּרוֹת? מִי כְּתִיב ״אִם תִּקַּח״? ״וְאִם תִּקַּח״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: “If you shall afflict from conjugal relations, “and if you shall take from rival And say that this and that rival Is it written: If you take? “And if you shall take” is written.
llm_translation: "If you afflict" — from marital relations, "and if you take" — from afflictions. But why both from afflictions? Who is it written "and if you take"? "And if you take" is written.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי מִצָּרוֹת, חַד לְצָרוֹת דִּידֵיהּ, וְחַד לְצָרוֹת דְּאָתְיָין לֵיהּ מֵעָלְמָא, דּוּמְיָא דְּ״אִם תִּקַּח״! מִי כְּתִיב ״אִם תִּקַּח וְאִם תְּעַנֶּה״? ״אִם תְּעַנֶּה וְאִם תִּקַּח״ כְּתִיב.
human_translation: And say that this and that are referring to rival One his rivals. And one rivals who come to him from the world similar “if you shall take.” Is it written: If you take and if you afflict? “if you shall afflict and if you shall take” is written.
llm_translation: And why not? Both the case of his own distresses and the case of distresses that will come upon him from the world, are considered one for his distresses, and one for the distresses that will come upon him from the world, is similar to "if you take"! Who is it written, "if you take and if you afflict"? "If you afflict and if you take" is written.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא לְאַבָּיֵי: הָא תַּשְׁמִישׁ גּוּפֵהּ אִיקְּרִי עִנּוּי, דִּכְתִיב: ״וַיִּשְׁכַּב אוֹתָהּ וַיְעַנֶּהָ״! אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הָתָם שֶׁעִינָּהּ מִבִּיאוֹת אֲחֵרוֹת.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But conjugal relations themselves are called affliction, as it is written: and he lay with her and afflicted her” He said to him: There, afflicted her from different relations,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Papa to Abbaye: The act itself is called 'affliction,' as it is written: "And he lay with her and afflicted her"! He said to him: There, her eyes were bringing others.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: אָסוּר לִרְחוֹץ מִקְצָת גּוּפוֹ כְּכׇל גּוּפוֹ, וְאִם הָיָה מְלוּכְלָךְ בְּטִיט וּבְצוֹאָה — רוֹחֵץ כְּדַרְכּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ. אָסוּר לָסוּךְ מִקְצָת גּוּפוֹ כְּכׇל גּוּפוֹ, וְאִם הָיָה חוֹלֶה, אוֹ שֶׁהָיוּ לוֹ חֲטָטִין בְּרֹאשׁוֹ — סָךְ כְּדַרְכּוֹ וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: It is prohibited to bathe part of the body the whole body. But if one is dirty from mud or excrement, he bathe in his manner, and he not be concerned it is prohibited to part of the body just as the whole body. But if one was sick or if one had scabs on his head he smear in his manner, and he not be concerned
llm_translation: The Sages taught: It is forbidden to wash part of one's body like one's entire body, and if one was soiled with mud and excrement - he washes as usual and is not concerned. It is forbidden to anoint part of one's body like one's entire body, and if one was ill, or had scabs on his head - he anoints as usual and is not concerned.

hebrew_text: תְּנָא דְּבֵי מְנַשֶּׁה: רַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל אוֹמֵר: מְדִיחָה אִשָּׁה יָדָהּ אַחַת בְּמַיִם, וְנוֹתֶנֶת פַּת לַתִּינוֹק, וְאֵינָהּ חוֹשֶׁשֶׁת.
human_translation: The school of Menashe taught Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A woman rinse one hand in water, and give bread to her child, and she not be concerned
llm_translation: Tanna of the school of Menasheh: Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: A woman may rinse her hand in water, and give bread to a child, and she is not concerned.

hebrew_text: אָמְרוּ עָלָיו עַל שַׁמַּאי הַזָּקֵן שֶׁלֹּא רָצָה לְהַאֲכִיל בְּיָדוֹ אַחַת, וְגָזְרוּ עָלָיו לְהַאֲכִיל בִּשְׁתֵּי יָדַיִם. מַאי טַעְמָא? אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מִשּׁוּם שִׁיבְתָּא.
human_translation: They said about Shammai the Elder that he did not want to feed with one hand, they decreed that he must feed with two hands, What is the reason Abaye said: Due to Shivta,
llm_translation: They said about Shammai the Elder that he did not want to feed with one hand, and they decreed upon him to feed with two hands. What is the reason? Abaye said: Because of etiquette.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הַהוֹלֵךְ לְהַקְבִּיל פְּנֵי אָבִיו אוֹ פְּנֵי רַבּוֹ, אוֹ פְּנֵי מִי שֶׁגָּדוֹל מִמֶּנּוּ — עוֹבֵר עַד צַוָּארוֹ בְּמַיִם וְאֵינוֹ חוֹשֵׁשׁ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who goes to greet his father or his teacher, or to greet one who is greater than him cross until his neck is in the water, and he not be concerned
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One who goes to greet the face of his father, or the face of his teacher, or the face of one greater than himself - he may walk until his neck is submerged in water and he need not be concerned.

hebrew_text: אִיבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: הָרַב אֵצֶל תַּלְמִיד מַאי? תָּא שְׁמַע, דְּאָמַר רַב יִצְחָק בַּר בַּר חָנָה: אֲנָא חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לִזְעֵירִי דַּאֲזַל לְגַבֵּי רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי תַּלְמִידֵיהּ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: הָהוּא רַב חִיָּיא בַּר אָשֵׁי הוּא דַּאֲזַל לְגַבֵּיהּ דִּזְעֵירִי רַבֵּיהּ.
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before them, What a teacher to student? Come hear Rav Yitzḥak bar bar Ḥana said: I saw Ze’iri, who went to Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi, his student. Rav Ashi said: that Rav Ḥiyya bar Ashi who went to Ze’iri, his teacher.
llm_translation: He asked them: What is the status of a Rav in relation to his student? Come and hear, for Rav Yitzchak bar Bar Chanah said: I saw that he went to Rav Chiya bar Ashe's student. Rav Ashe said: That Rav Chiya bar Ashe is the one who went to his student.

hebrew_text: רָבָא שְׁרָא לִבְנֵי עֲבַר יַמִּינָא לְמֶעְבַּר בְּמַיָּא לְנַטּוֹרֵי פֵּירֵי. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי לְרָבָא, תַּנְיָא דִּמְסַיַּיע לָךְ: שׁוֹמְרֵי פֵּׂירוֹת עוֹבְרִין עַד צַוָּארָן בְּמַיִם וְאֵין חוֹשְׁשִׁין.
human_translation: Rava permitted those right side to pass through the water to guard the fruit Abaye said to Rava: was taught that supports your Guards of fruit cross until their necks are in the water, and they not be concerned
llm_translation: Rava permitted the residents of the other side of the river to cross over in water up to their necks to guard the fruit. Abaye said to Rava, a supporting teaching for you: Those guarding fruit may wade in water up to their necks and there is no concern.

hebrew_text: רַב יוֹסֵף שְׁרָא לְהוּ לִבְנֵי בֵּי תַרְבּוּ לְמִיעְבַּר בְּמַיָּא לְמֵיתֵי לְפִירְקָא, לְמֵיזַל לָא שְׁרָא לְהוּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: אִם כֵּן אַתָּה מַכְשִׁילָן לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי: שְׁרָא לְהוּ לְמֵיתֵי וּשְׁרָא לְהוּ לְמֵיזַל, אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: בִּשְׁלָמָא לְמֵיתֵי — לְחַיֵּי, אֶלָּא לְמֵיזַל מַאי טַעְמָא? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תְּהֵא מַכְשִׁילָן לֶעָתִיד לָבֹא.
human_translation: Rav Yosef permitted people Bei Tarbu to cross in the water to come to the lecture on He did not, permit them to go Abaye said to him: If so, you are obstructing them in the future. Some say permitted them to come and permitted them to go Abaye said to him: Granted, to come, that is well. But what is the reason to go So as not to obstruct them in the future.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef permitted the sons of the house of Tarbu to cross through the water to reach the ferry, but he did not permit them to go. Abaye said to him: If so, you are causing them to stumble in the future. Some say: He permitted them to go and he permitted them to cross. Abaye said to him: It is understandable to permit them to go - for their lives. But why permit them to cross? So that you do not cause them to stumble in the future.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה וְרַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יְהוּדָה הֲווֹ קָיְימִי אַגּוּדָּא דִּנְהַר (פָּפָּא) אַמַּבָּרָא דְחַצְדַּד, וַהֲוָה קָאֵי רָמֵי בַּר פָּפָּא מֵהָךְ גִּיסָא. רְמָא לְהוּ קָלָא: מַהוּ לְמִיעְבַּר לְמֵיתֵי לְגַבַּיְיכוּ לְמִשְׁאַל שְׁמַעְתָּא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב יְהוּדָה: רַב וּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּאָמְרִי תַּרְוַיְיהוּ — עוֹבֵר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא יָדוֹ מִתַּחַת חֵפֶת חֲלוּקוֹ. אִיכָּא דְּאָמְרִי, אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר רַב יְהוּדָה, תְּנֵינָא: עוֹבֵר, וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יוֹצִיא יָדוֹ מִתַּחַת חֵפֶת חֲלוּקוֹ.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda and Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yehuda were standing on the bank of the Pappa River next to the Ḥatzdad crossing, and Rami bar Pappa was standing on the other side He raised his voice to them What is crossing over to come to you to ask a halakha ? Rav Yehuda said to him: Rav and Shmuel who both say: One cross provided that he does not remove his hand from under the hem of his cloak. Some say Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yehuda said to him: We learned cross over, provided he does not remove his hand from the hem of his cloak.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah and Rav Shmuel, son of Rav Yehudah, were standing on the bank of the Nehar (Papa) River, at the entrance of Chatzdad, and Ramai, son of Papa, was standing on the other side. He called out to them loudly: "What is the law regarding crossing to the other side to fulfill a request that you have heard?" Rav Yehudah said to him: Rav and Shmuel both agree - one may cross, as long as he does not remove his hand from beneath his cloak. Some say that Rav Shmuel, son of Rav Yehudah, said to him: We have learned in a Mishnah: one may cross, as long as he does not remove his hand from beneath his cloak.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב יוֹסֵף: וּבְחוֹל כִּי הַאי גַּוְנָא מִי שְׁרֵי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וַיָּמׇד אֶלֶף בָּאַמָּה וַיַּעֲבִירֵנִי בַמַּיִם מֵי אׇפְסָיִם״ — מִכָּאן שֶׁמּוּתָּר לַעֲבוֹר עַד אׇפְסַיִים.
human_translation: Rav Yosef strongly objects to this: And on a weekday is it permitted in such But isn’t it written “He measured a thousand cubits, and he led me through the water; the water was ankle deep” here is permitted to pass through up to the ankles.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to her: And on a weekday, when is this prohibition of carrying released? And it is written: "And He measured a thousand cubits, and He caused me to pass through the waters, waters that were up to the ankles" — from here we learn that it is permitted to pass through up to the ankles.

hebrew_text: ״וַיָּמׇד אֶלֶף וַיַּעֲבִירֵנִי בַמַּיִם מַיִם בִּרְכָּיִם״ — מִכָּאן שֶׁמּוּתָּר לַעֲבוֹר עַד בִּרְכַּיִם. ״וַיָּמׇד אֶלֶף וַיַּעֲבִירֵנִי מֵי מׇתְנָיִם״ — מִכָּאן שֶׁמּוּתָּר לַעֲבוֹר עַד מׇתְנַיִם. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ: ״וַיָּמׇד אֶלֶף נַחַל אֲשֶׁר לֹא אוּכַל לַעֲבוֹר״!
human_translation: “Again he measured a thousand and he led me through the water, the water was knee deep” here is permitted to pass through up the knees. “He measured a thousand and led me through the water up to the waist” here is permitted to pass through up to the waist. From this forward: “And he measured a thousand, a river that I could not pass through”
llm_translation: "And he measured a thousand and he caused me to pass through the water, water to the knees" — from here it is permitted to pass until the knees. "And he measured a thousand and he caused me to pass through the water, water to the loins" — from here it is permitted to pass until the loins. From here and onwards: "And he measured a thousand, a river that could not be crossed!"

hebrew_text: אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: שָׁאנֵי נַחַל דִּרְדִיפִי מַיָּא.
human_translation: Abaye said: a river flowing water is different.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: The waters of the river Dirdephi differ.

hebrew_text: יָכוֹל יַעֲבִירֶנּוּ בְּסִיחוּי — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״כִּי גָאוּ הַמַּיִם מֵי שָׂחוּ״. מַאי ״מֵי שָׂחוּ״ — שִׁיּוּטָא, שֶׁכֵּן קוֹרִין לְשַׁיָּיטָא סַיָּיחָא. יָכוֹל יַעֲבִירֶנּוּ בְּבוּרְנִי קְטַנָּה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״בַּל תֵּלֶךְ בּוֹ אֳנִי שַׁיִט״. יָכוֹל יַעֲבִירֶנּוּ בְּבוּרְנִי גְּדוֹלָה — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״וְצִי אַדִּיר לֹא יַעַבְרֶנּוּ״. מַאי מַשְׁמַע? כְּדִמְתַרְגֵּם רַב יוֹסֵף: לָא תֵּזִיל בֵּיהּ בִּסְפִינַת צַיָּידִין וּבוּרְנִי רַבְּתִי לֹא תְּגוּזִינֵּהּ.
human_translation: One might think could cross by swimming. The verse states: “For the water had swollen into saḥu waters” What “ saḥu waters” a boat shiyuta ], as sailing [ shayta ] is called swimming [ sayḥa ]. I might have thought could pass across in a small boat [ burni ]. the verse states: “No galley with oars shall go” might have thought he could pass through in a large boat. the verse states: “Neither shall a fishing boat [ tzi adir ] be able to cross it” From where be inferred Rav Yosef translated A fishing boat [ sfinat tzayyadin ] will not travel on it and a large ship will not cross it.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Yachol ya'avirenu b'sichuy - Talmud lomar: 'Ki gau hamayim mei sachu.' Mai 'mei sachu' - shiyuta, sheken korin le'shayita sayacha. Yachol ya'avirenu b'burni ketana - Talmud lomar: 'Bal telech bo oni shayit.' Yachol ya'avirenu b'burni gedola - Talmud lomar: 'Ve'tzi adir lo ya'avrenu.' Mai mashma? Kedim'targem Rav Yosef: 'La tizil beih b'sfinat zayadin u'burni rabbati lo teguzineih.'" English translation: "He may pass it through a pipe - the Talmud teaches: 'For the waters have risen, waters of the ditch.' What is 'waters of the ditch'? - irrigation, for so they call irrigation water. He may pass it through a small pit - the Talmud teaches: 'Do not go into it, lest you be ensnared.' He may pass it through a large pit - the Talmud teaches: 'And a mighty one shall not pass through it.' What is implied? As Rav Yosef interpreted: 'Do not let it flow in a boat of hunters, and a large pit shall not swallow it.'"

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן פַּזִּי: אַף מַלְאַךְ הַמָּוֶת אֵין לוֹ רְשׁוּת לַעֲבוֹר בְּתוֹכוֹ, כְּתִיב הָכָא: ״בַּל תֵּלֶךְ בּוֹ אֳנִי שַׁיִט״, וּכְתִיב הָתָם: ״מִשּׁוּט בָּאָרֶץ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Pazi said: Even the Angel of Death does not have permission to pass through it as it is written here: “No galley with oars [ ani shayt ] can travel” and it was written there: From going to and fro [ mishut ] the earth
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Pazi said: Even the Angel of Death does not have permission to pass through him, as it is written here: "Do not go through him, I will strike," and it is written there: "From the whip on the ground."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי פִּנְחָס מִשּׁוּם רַב הוּנָא צִפּוֹרָאָה: מַעְיָן הַיּוֹצֵא מִבֵּית קׇדְשֵׁי הַקֳּדָשִׁים, בַּתְּחִילָּה דּוֹמֶה לְקַרְנֵי חֲגָבִים, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לְפֶתַח הֵיכָל — נַעֲשֶׂה כְּחוּט שֶׁל שֶׁתִי, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ לָאוּלָם — נַעֲשֶׂה כְּחוּט שֶׁל עֵרֶב, כֵּיוָן שֶׁהִגִּיעַ אֶל פֶּתַח עֲזָרָה — נַעֲשֶׂה כְּפִי פַּךְ קָטָן, וְהַיְינוּ דִּתְנַן, רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: מַיִם
human_translation: Rabbi Pineḥas said in the name of Rav Huna of Tzippori: The spring that comes forth from inside the Holy of Holies at first and resembles grasshoppers’ antennae Once it reaches the opening of the Sanctuary it becomes as thread of warp; once it reaches the Entrance Hall it becomes as thread of woof, Once it reaches the opening of courtyard it becomes like the mouth of a small jug. This is as we learned Rav Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Water,
llm_translation: Rabbi Pinchas said in the name of Rav Huna the Birdwatcher: The spring that emerges from the Holy of Holies, at first resembles the horns of grasshoppers. Once it reaches the entrance of the Sanctuary, it becomes like a thread of silk. When it reaches the hall, it becomes like a hair thread. When it reaches the entrance of the Azarah, it becomes like a small jug. This is what we learned: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Water.

hebrew_text: מְפַכִּין עֲתִידִין לִהְיוֹת יוֹצְאִין מִתַּחַת מִפְתַּן הַבַּיִת. מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ הָיָה מִתְגַּבֵּר וְעוֹלֶה עַד שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְפֶתַח בֵּית דָּוִד, כֵּיוָן שֶׁמַּגִּיעַ לְפֶתַח בֵּית דָּוִד נַעֲשֶׂה כְּנַחַל שׁוֹטֵף שֶׁבּוֹ רוֹחֲצִין זָבִין וְזָבוֹת נִדּוֹת וְיוֹלְדוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא יִהְיֶה מָקוֹר נִפְתָּח לְבֵית דָּוִד וּלְיוֹשְׁבֵי יְרוּשָׁלִָם לְחַטַּאת וּלְנִדָּה״.
human_translation: in the future, will bubble from under the threshold of the Temple. From this forward, will grow in strength and rise until it reaches the opening of David’s house, When it reaches the opening of David’s house, it will become a flowing river in which zavim and zavot , menstruating women, and women after childbirth will bathe As it is stated: “On that day there shall be a fountain opened for the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem for purification and for sprinkling”
llm_translation: We prepare the mikveh waters that are destined to emerge from beneath the threshold of the house. From here and onwards, it becomes stronger and rises until it reaches the entrance of the house of David. Once it reaches the entrance of the house of David, it becomes like a flowing stream in which men and women immerse, menstruating women, and women who have given birth, as it is stated: "On that day, a fountain shall be opened for the house of David and for the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for sin and for impurity."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף: מִכָּאן רֶמֶז לְנִדָּה שֶׁצְּרִיכָה לֵישֵׁב עַד צַוָּארָהּ בַּמַּיִם. וְלֵית הִילְכְתָא כְּווֹתֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From here, there is an allusion that a menstruating woman must sit up to her neck in water, But the halakha is not in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From here there is an allusion to the menstruating woman who needs to immerse herself up to her neck in water. And the halacha is not in accordance with his opinion.

hebrew_text: (תִּינַח יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים דְּלֵיכָּא מִנְעָל,) שַׁבָּת דְּאִיכָּא מִנְעָל, מַאי? אֲמַר נְחֶמְיָה חַתְנֵיהּ דְּבֵי נְשִׂיאָה: אֲנָא חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי דִּמְטוֹ עוּרְקוּמָא דְמַיָּא, וְעַבְרוּהּ דֶּרֶךְ מַלְבּוּשׁ.
human_translation: well Yom Kippur there are no shoes, Shabbat, when there are shoes, what Neḥemya, the son-in-law of the Nasi , said: I saw Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Asi come to a pool of water and they crossed it while wearing
llm_translation: The day of Yom Kippur that falls on a weekday, the Shabbat that falls on a weekday, what is the reason? Nehemiah, the son-in-law of the house of the prince, said: I saw it with Rabbi Ammi and Rabbi Assi when they passed by the opening of the water, and they went on the way of clothing.

hebrew_text: תִּינַח מִנְעָל, סַנְדָּל מַאי אִיכָּא לְמֵימַר? אָמַר רַב רִיחוּמִי: אֲנָא חֲזֵיתֵיהּ לְרָבִינָא דְּעָבַר דֶּרֶךְ מַלְבּוּשׁ. רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: סַנְדָּל לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא.
human_translation: well shoes what is there to say sandals? Rav Riḥumi said: I saw Ravina cross wearing Rav Ashi said: If he is sandals, not ab initio ,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tinach min'al, sandal mai ikka lemeimar? Amar Rav Richumi: Ana chaziteih leRabina de'avra derech malbush. Rav Ashei amar: Sandal lekatchilah la." English translation: "A shoe from a sandal, what is there to say? Rav Richumi said: I saw it on Rabina who passed by the way of clothing. Rav Ashei said: A sandal is not initially."

hebrew_text: רֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא אִיקְּלַע לְהַגְרוֹנְיָא לְבֵי רַב נָתָן, רַפְרָם וְכוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן אֲתוֹ לְפִירְקָא, רָבִינָא לָא אֲתָא. לִמְחַר, בָּעֵי רַפְרָם לְאַפּוֹקֵי לְרָבִינָא מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ דְּרֵישׁ גָּלוּתָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ מַאי טַעְמָא לָא אֲתָא מָר לְפִירְקָא? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הֲוָה כָּאֵיב לִי כַּרְעַאי. אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמֵיסַם מְסָאנֵי. גַּבָּא דְכַרְעָא הֲוָה.
human_translation: The Exilarch came to Rav Natan’s study hall in Hagronya. Rafram and all the Sages came to the lecture, Ravina did not come. The next day, Rafram wanted to remove Ravina from the mind the Exilarch, What is the reason the Master did not come to the lecture? He said to him: My foot hurt. You should have put shoes on. It was the back of the foot
llm_translation: Head of exile entered to the throat of the house of Rav Natan, Refram and all the Rabbis came to the inn, Rabina did not come. The next day, Refram wanted to go to Rabina from his knowledge of the head of exile, he said to him, "Why did the master not come to the inn?" He said to him: "My legs were hurting me." He asked him to show him his legs. The back of his legs was hurting.

hebrew_text: אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמִרְמֵא סַנְדָּלָא. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: עוּרְקְמָא דְמַיָּא הֲוָה בְּאוֹרְחָא. אִיבְּעִי לָךְ לְמֶעְבְּרֵיהּ דֶּרֶךְ מַלְבּוּשׁ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא סָבַר לַהּ מָר לְהָא דְּאָמַר רַב אָשֵׁי: סַנְדָּל לְכַתְּחִלָּה לָא?!
human_translation: You should have worn sandals, He said to him: There was a pool of water on the way He said to him: You should have crossed it wearing He said to him: Does the Master not hold Rav Ashi said: not sandals ab initio ?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: He asked you to tie the sandal. He said to him: the strap of the sandal was on the road. He asked you to pass him the garment. He said to him: the Master did not think of that which Rav Ashe said: A sandal, initially, is not a garment?!

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי יְהוּדָה בַּר גְּרוֹגְרוֹת: אָסוּר לֵישֵׁב עַל גַּבֵּי טִינָא בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: וּבְטִינָא מְטַפַּחַת. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: וּבְטוֹפֵחַ עַל מְנָת לְהַטְפִּיחַ. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: מוּתָּר לְהִצְטַנֵּן בְּפֵירוֹת. רַב יְהוּדָה מִצְטַנֵּן בְּקָרָא.
human_translation: Yehuda bar Gerogarot taught: It is prohibited to sit on clay on Yom Kippur. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: clay dripping wet, Abaye said dripping wet enough to make something else wet. Rav Yehuda said: permitted to cool off with fruit Rav Yehuda cooled off a squash
llm_translation: Tanna Yehudah bar Gergorot taught: It is forbidden to sit on a millstone on Yom Kippur. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: And on a millstone one may clap. Abaye said: And on a millstone in order to clap. Rav Yehudah said: It is permitted to cool oneself with fruits. Rav Yehudah cools himself with a pumpkin.

hebrew_text: רַבָּה מִצְטַנֵּן בְּיָנוֹקָא, רָבָא מִצְטַנֵּן בְּכָסָא דְכַסְפָּא. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: כָּסָא דְכַסְפָּא, מָלֵא — אָסוּר, חָסֵר — שְׁרֵי. דְּפַחְרָא — אִידֵּי וְאִידֵּי אָסוּר, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִישְׁחָל שָׁחֵיל. רַב אָמַר: כָּסָא דְכַסְפָּא, חָסֵר — נָמֵי אָסוּר, מִשּׁוּם דְּמִזְדָרֵיב.
human_translation: Rabba cooled off by a baby [ yanuka ] Rava cooled off with a silver cup. Rav Pappa said: silver cup full, it is prohibited; not full, it is permitted. a ceramic this and that are prohibited, since seeps through Rav said: A silver cup that is not full is also prohibited because it can slip [ mizderiv ]
llm_translation: Rabah is particular about a baby's bottle, Rava is particular about a silver cup. Rav Pappa said: A full silver cup - forbidden, lacking - permissible. Because of the danger of witchcraft. Rav said: A silver cup lacking - also forbidden, because of the danger of danger.

hebrew_text: זְעֵירָא בַּר חָמָא אוּשְׁפִּיזְכָנֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי אַמֵּי וְרַבִּי אַסִּי וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי וּדְכוּלְּהוּ רַבָּנַן דְּקֵיסָרִי הֲוָה. אֲמַר לֵיהּ לְרַב יוֹסֵף בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי: בַּר אַרְיָא! תָּא אֵימָא לָךְ מִילְּתָא מְעַלַּיְתָא דַּהֲוָה עָבֵיד אֲבוּךְ: מִטְפַּחַת הָיָה לוֹ בְּעֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, וְשׁוֹרֶה אוֹתָהּ בְּמַיִם, וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָהּ כְּמִין כֵּלִים נְגוּבִין, וּלְמָחָר מְקַנֵּחַ בָּהּ פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. עֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב, שׁוֹרֶה אוֹתָהּ בְּמַיִם, וּלְמָחָר מַעֲבִירָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי עֵינָיו.
human_translation: Ze’eira bar Ḥama, host Rabbi Ami, and Rabbi Asi, and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and all the Sages of Caesarea said to Rav Yosef, son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: Son of a lion, come, I will tell you a wonderful custom that your father used to perform. He had a cloth that on the day before Yom Kippur by soaking it in water and making it like a dried cloth. And the next day he wiped his face, hands, and feet with it. the day before the Ninth of Av, soak the in water and the next day pass it over his eyes.
llm_translation: Zei'ra bar Ḥama, the tanner of Rabbi Ammi, Rabbi Assi, and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, and their colleagues, the Sages of Caesarea, said to Rav Yosef, the son of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: "Son of a lion! Come, I will say to you a matter of excellence that your father used to do: He had a handful of incense on the eve of Yom Kippur, and he would soak it in water, and he would make it like hollow vessels, and the next day he would anoint with it his face, hands, and feet. On the eve of the Ninth of Av, he would soak it in water, and the next day he would pass it over his eyes."

hebrew_text: וְכֵן כִּי אֲתָא רַבָּה בַּר מָרִי, אָמַר: בְּעֶרֶב תִּשְׁעָה בְּאָב מְבִיאִין לוֹ מִטְפַּחַת וְשׁוֹרֶה אוֹתָהּ בְּמַיִם וּמַנִּיחָהּ תַּחַת מְרַאֲשׁוֹתָיו, וּלְמָחָר, מְקַנֵּחַ פָּנָיו יָדָיו וְרַגְלָיו. בְּעֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְבִיאִין לוֹ מִטְפַּחַת וְשׁוֹרֶה אוֹתָהּ בְּמַיִם, וְעוֹשֶׂה אוֹתָהּ כְּמִין כֵּלִים נְגוּבִין, וּלְמָחָר מַעֲבִירָהּ עַל גַּבֵּי עֵינָיו. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי יַעֲקֹב לְרַבִּי יִרְמְיָה בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא: אִיפְּכָא אֲמַרְתְּ לַן, וְאוֹתֵיבְנָךְ סְחִיטָה.
human_translation: Similarly, when Rabba bar Mari came he said: The day before the Ninth of Av they bring one a cloth, and he soak it in water and place it under his head. The next day, he wipe his face, hands, and feet On the day before Yom Kippur, they bring one a cloth, and he soak it in water and make it like a dried cloth. The next day, he pass it over his eyes. Rabbi Ya’akov said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Taḥlifa: You told us the opposite. and we objected to you wringing,
llm_translation: And so, when Rabba bar Mari came, he said: On the eve of the ninth of Av, they bring him a basin, wash his hands and feet, and place it beneath his head. And the next day, he washes his face, hands, and feet. On the eve of Yom Kippur, they bring him a basin, wash his hands and feet, and he performs it like vessels that are rinsed, and the next day he passes it over his eyes. Rabbi Yaakov said to Rabbi Yirmeya bar Tachlifa: You have reversed it for us, and I will prove it to you with a logical argument.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב מְנַשְּׁיָא בַּר תַּחְלִיפָא אָמַר רַב עַמְרָם אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: שָׁאֲלוּ אֶת רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: זָקֵן וְיוֹשֵׁב בִּישִׁיבָה, צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת לְהַתִּיר בְּכוֹרוֹת, אוֹ אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ?
human_translation: Rav Menashya bar Taḥalifa said Rav Amram said Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: They asked Rabbi Elazar an Elder who sits in a yeshiva receive permission to permit firstborn animals permitted, to firstborn animals permitted, or not?
llm_translation: Rav Menashya bar Tahalifa said, Rav Amram said, Rabba bar Bar Chana said: They asked Rabbi Elazar: An elder who sits in the yeshiva, does he need to take permission to permit firstborn animals, or not?

hebrew_text: מַאי קָא מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ? הָכִי קָא מִיבְּעֵי לְהוּ, כִּי הָא דְּאָמַר רַב אִידִי בַּר אָבִין: דָּבָר זֶה הִנִּיחוּ לָהֶם לְבֵי נְשִׂיאָה כְּדֵי לְהִתְגַּדֵּר בּוֹ: צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת; אוֹ דִילְמָא, כֵּיוָן דְּזָקֵן וְיוֹשֵׁב בִּישִׁיבָה, אֵין צָרִיךְ. עָמַד רַבִּי צָדוֹק בֶּן חָקוֹלָא עַל רַגְלָיו, וְאָמַר: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִימְרָא, שֶׁזָּקֵן וְיוֹשֵׁב בִּישִׁיבָה הָיָה, וְעָמַד בְּמַעֲלָה מִזְּקֵנוֹ שֶׁל זֶה, וְנָטַל רְשׁוּת לְהַתִּיר בְּכוֹרוֹת.
human_translation: What are they asking? This is what they are asking, like this Rav Idi bar Avin, said: This matter, was given to the house of the Nasi to raise its stature. must permission be received, Or, perhaps because is an Elder who sits in a yeshiva, there is no need. Rav Tzadok ben Ḥaluka rose to his feet and said: I saw Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra, who was an Elder who sat in the yeshiva and who stood before the grandfather of this ask permission to permit firstborn animals.
llm_translation: What is he asking them? This is what he is asking them, as Rav Idi bar Avin said: This matter they left to the leaders of the community in order to define it: He needs to take permission; or perhaps, since he is old and sits in the yeshiva, he does not need to. Rabbi Tzadok ben Chakola stood on his feet and said: I saw Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra, who was old and sat in the yeshiva, stand above the elder of this one, and he took permission to permit firstborns.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַבִּי אַבָּא: לֹא כָּךְ הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה, אֶלָּא כָּךְ הָיָה מַעֲשֶׂה: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בֶּן זִימְרָא כֹּהֵן הָיָה, וְהָכִי קָא מִיבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבִּי מֵאִיר, דְּאָמַר: הֶחָשׁוּד בְּדָבָר — לֹא דָּנוֹ, וְלֹא מְעִידוֹ. אוֹ דִילְמָא הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, דְּאָמַר: נֶאֱמָן הוּא עַל שֶׁל חֲבֵירוֹ וְאֵינוֹ נֶאֱמָן עַל שֶׁל עַצְמוֹ. וּפְשַׁט לֵיהּ: הֲלָכָה כְּרַבָּן שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to him: was not how the incident was. Rather this was the incident: Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra was a priest, and he raised the following dilemma: Is the halakha in accordance with Rabbi Meir, said: One who is suspect in area not judge it and not testify it? Or perhaps the halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, said: is believed about his fellow but is not believed about himself. He resolved him: halakha is in accordance with Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba: Not so was the incident, but so was the incident: Rabbi Yosei ben Zimra was a priest, and thus he would ask him: Is the halakha according to Rabbi Meir, who said: If one is suspected in a matter - do not judge him, and do not testify against him. Or perhaps the halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel, who said: One is believed regarding the property of his fellow, but is not believed regarding his own property. And it was resolved for him: The halakha is according to Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: וְתוּ קָא מִבַּעְיָא לְהוּ: מַהוּ לָצֵאת בְּסַנְדָּל שֶׁל
human_translation: They raised dilemma them, What is going out in sandals made of
llm_translation: And there, he was asking them: What is the ruling regarding going out with a sandal of...

hebrew_text: שַׁעַם בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים? עָמַד רַבִּי יִצְחָק בַּר נַחְמָנִי עַל רַגְלָיו, וְאָמַר: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ בֶּן לֵוִי שֶׁיָּצָא בְּסַנְדָּל שֶׁל שַׁעַם בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. וְאָמֵינָא לֵיהּ: בְּתַעֲנִית צִבּוּר מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁנָא. אָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה: אֲנִי רָאִיתִי אֶת רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר דְּמִן נִנְוֵה שֶׁיָּצָא בְּסַנְדָּל שֶׁל שַׁעַם בְּתַעֲנִית צִבּוּר, וְאָמֵינָא לֵיהּ: בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מַאי? אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לָא שְׁנָא. רַב יְהוּדָה נָפֵיק בִּדְהִיטָנֵי. אַבָּיֵי נָפֵיק בִּדְהוּצֵי. רָבָא נָפֵיק (בִּדְיַבְלֵי). רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא כָּרֵיךְ סוּדָרָא אַכַּרְעֵיהּ וְנָפֵיק.
human_translation: cork on Yom Kippur? Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Naḥmani stood on his feet and said: I saw that Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi went out on Yom Kippur in cork sandals, and I said to him: What on a communal fast He said to me: no different, Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: I saw Rabbi Elazar from Nineveh go out in cork sandals on a communal fast day, and I said to him: What on Yom Kippur? He said to me: no different, Rav Yehuda went out in reed sandals. Abaye went out in palm fiber. Rava went out in reeds. Rabba bar Rav Huna wrapped a scarf around his feet and went out.
llm_translation: On Yom Kippur? Rabbi Yitzchak bar Nachmani stood on his feet, and said: I saw Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi who went out wearing a sandal of Sha'am on Yom Kippur. And I thought to him: What about a communal fast? He said to me: It is not different. Rabba bar bar Chana said: I saw Rabbi Elazar from Ninveh who went out wearing a sandal of Sha'am on a communal fast, and I thought to him: What about Yom Kippur? He said to me: It is not different. Rav Yehuda went out with bandages. Abbaye went out with shoes. Rava went out with (sandals). Rabba bar Rav Huna tied a scarf on his head and went out.

hebrew_text: מֵתִיב רָמֵי בַּר חָמָא: הַקִּיטֵּעַ יוֹצֵא בְּקַב שֶׁלּוֹ, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וְרַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹסֵר. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: וְשָׁוִין שֶׁאָסוּר לָצֵאת בּוֹ בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: הָתָם דְּאִית בֵּיהּ כְּתִיתִין, וּמִשּׁוּם תַּעֲנוּג.
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised an objection: an amputee go out with his prosthetic leg these are the words of Rabbi Meir. But Rabbi Yosei prohibits it. And was taught in that regard And they agree that it is prohibited to go out wearing it on Yom Kippur. Abaye said: There, there are rags due pleasure
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Ramei bar Ḥama poses a dilemma: One who cuts off his limb, he goes out with his own cubit, the words of Rabbi Meir. And Rabbi Yosei prohibits. And it was taught in a Baraita: And they are equal in that it is prohibited to go out with it on Yom Kippur. Abaye said: There, where there are bandages on it, and due to pleasure.

hebrew_text: אֲמַר לֵיהּ רָבָא: וְאִי לָאו מָנָא הוּא — כְּתִיתִין מְשַׁוֵּי לֵיהּ מָנָא? וְעוֹד: כׇּל תַּעֲנוּג דְּלָאו מִנְעָל הוּא, בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מִי אָסוּר? וְהָא רַבָּה בַּר רַב הוּנָא הֲוָה כָּרֵיךְ סוּדָרָא אַכַּרְעֵיהּ וְנָפֵיק! וְעוֹד, מִדְּקָתָנֵי סֵיפָא: אִם יֵשׁ לוֹ בֵּית קִבּוּל כְּתִיתִין — טָמֵא, מִכְּלָל דְּרֵישָׁא לָאו בִּדְאִית לֵיהּ כְּתִיתִין עָסְקִינַן.
human_translation: Rava said to him: And if is not a garment, rags make it into a garment? And furthermore, any pleasure that is not shoes, is it prohibited on Yom Kippur? And Rabba bar Rav Huna would wrap a scarf on his feet and go out, Furthermore, From that it teaches in the latter clause: If has a receptacle for rags it ritual impurity it may be inferred that in the first clause we are not dealing with has rags.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rava: And if it is not mana - do I write mana for him? And furthermore: Any pleasure that is not prohibited, on Yom Kippur, who forbids it? And Rabba bar Rav Huna was wrapping a scarf around his head and leaving! And furthermore, from what is taught in the latter part: If he has a fixed place - he is impure, from the fact that in the beginning we are not specifically dealing with a fixed place.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא אָמַר רָבָא: לְעוֹלָם דְּכוּלֵּי עָלְמָא מִנְעָל הוּא, וּבְשַׁבָּת בְּהָא פְּלִיגִי: מָר סָבַר גָּזְרִינַן דִּילְמָא מִשְׁתְּמִיט וְאָתֵי לְאֵתוֹיֵי אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת, וּמַר סָבַר לָא גָּזְרִינַן.
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: Actually, according to everyone, is a shoe, and with regard to Shabbat this is what they disagree about: One Sage, holds that we decree lest slip off and one come to carry it four cubits and one Sage, holds that we do not decree
llm_translation: Rava said: Always the entire world is considered a sandal, and on Shabbat they argue about this: one Master holds that we decree lest one remove it and come to carry it four cubits, and the other Master holds that we do not decree.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: תִּינוֹקוֹת מוּתָּרִין בְּכוּלָּן, חוּץ מִנְּעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל. מַאי שְׁנָא נְעִילַת הַסַּנְדָּל, דְּאָמְרִי: אִינָשֵׁי עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ, הָנָךְ נָמֵי אָמְרִי: אִינָשֵׁי עֲבַדוּ לֵיהּ! רְחִיצָה וְסִיכָה, אֵימַר מֵאֶתְמוֹל עָבְדִי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: The Sages taught: Young children are permitted all of except for wearing shoes. What is different wearing shoes? because will say adults did this for him, those also, they will say adults did this for him, they say that they did this for him yesterday,
llm_translation: The sages taught: Infants are permitted in all areas, except for wearing a sandal. What is different about wearing a sandal? Because they say: People have served him, meaning you too should serve him! Washing and anointing, one may say that they have been done for him since yesterday.

hebrew_text: סַנְדָּל נָמֵי, אֵימַר מֵאֶתְמוֹל עָבְדִי לֵיהּ! סַנְדָּל לָא אֶפְשָׁר דְּמֵאֶתְמוֹל עָבְדִי לֵיהּ. דַּאֲמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: הַאי מַאן דְּבָעֵי לְמִיטְעַם טַעְמָא דְמִיתוּתָא — לִיסְיַים מְסָאנֵי וְלִיגְנֵי.
human_translation: say shoes as well. They say that they did this for him yesterday. shoes, it is impossible did it for him yesterday, As Shmuel said: He who desires a taste of death should put on shoes and go to sleep.
llm_translation: Sandals are pleasant, he said, "From yesterday I have served him!" Sandals cannot be, for from yesterday I have served him. For Shmuel said: Whoever wants to taste the taste of death - let him wear sandals and walk.

hebrew_text: וְהָא מוּתָּרִין לְכַתְּחִלָּה קָתָנֵי! אֶלָּא: הָנָךְ דְּלָאו רְבִיתַיְיהוּ — גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן, הָנָךְ דִּרְבִיתַיְיהוּ הוּא — לָא גְּזַרוּ בְּהוּ רַבָּנַן. דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי, אֲמַרָה לִי אֵם: רְבִיתֵיהּ דְּיָנוֹקָא — מַיָּא חַמִּימֵי וּמִשְׁחָא. גְּדַל פּוּרְתָּא — בֵּיעֲתָא בְּכוּתָּחָא. גְּדַל פּוּרְתָּא — תַּבּוֹרֵי מָאנֵי. כִּי הָא דְּרַבָּה זָבֵין לְהוּ מָאנֵי גְּזִיזֵי דְּפַחְרָא לִבְנֵיהּ, וּמְתַבְּרִי לְהוּ.
human_translation: But is teaching they are permitted ab initio . Rather, The Sages decreed those that are not for growth, the Sages did not decree those that are for growth. Abaye said: mother told me: A child’s growth hot water and oil he grows a little, egg with kutaḥa , When he grows a little vessels to break, Rabba bought cracked ceramic vessels for his children, and they broke them
llm_translation: The Gemara: And it is permitted to begin with them! Rather, here where they did not increase the amount of interest — the Rabbis decreed against it, but there where they did increase the amount of interest — the Rabbis did not decree against it. As Abaye said, his mother told him: The interest of a suckling infant — warm water and oil. When the baby grows — barley in its husk. When the baby grows — grains of cooked food. For this is what they would give to them: grains of barley to their sons, and they would feed them.

hebrew_text: הַמֶּלֶךְ וְהַכַּלָּה יִרְחֲצוּ אֶת פְּנֵיהֶם. מַתְנִיתִין מַנִּי? רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן תְּרַדְיוֹן הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: הַמֶּלֶךְ וְהַכִּלָּה לֹא יִרְחֲצוּ אֶת פְּנֵיהֶם. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן תְּרַדְיוֹן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הַמֶּלֶךְ וְהַכַּלָּה יִרְחֲצוּ אֶת פְּנֵיהֶם. הַחַיָּה לֹא תִּנְעוֹל אֶת הַסַּנְדָּל. רַבִּי חֲנַנְיָא בֶּן תְּרַדְיוֹן אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: הַחַיָּה תִּנְעוֹל אֶת הַסַּנְדָּל.
human_translation: the king and the bride wash their faces Who is the mishna? Rabbi Ḥananya ben Teradyon, as it was taught The king and the bride not wash their faces Rabbi Ḥananya ben Teradyon says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: A king and a bride wash their faces. A new mother not wear shoes Rabbi Ḥananya ben Teradyon says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: A new mother wear shoes.
llm_translation: The king and the bride shall wash their faces. Mishnah: Who is the Tanna? Rabbi Chananya ben Tradion, as it was taught: The king and the bride shall not wash their faces. Rabbi Chananya ben Tradion says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: The king and the bride shall wash their faces. The living creature shall not lock the sandal. Rabbi Chananya ben Tradion says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: The living creature shall lock the sandal.

hebrew_text: מַאי טַעְמָא? מֶלֶךְ, מִשּׁוּם דִּכְתִיב: ״מֶלֶךְ בְּיׇפְיוֹ תֶּחֱזֶינָה עֵינֶיךָ״. כַּלָּה מַאי טַעְמָא — כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא תִּתְגַּנֶּה עַל בַּעְלָהּ. אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב לְרַבִּי חִיָּיא: כַּלָּה עַד כַּמָּה? אֲמַר לֵיהּ, כִּדְתַנְיָא: אֵין מוֹנְעִין תַּכְשִׁיטִין מִן הַכַּלָּה כׇּל שְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם.
human_translation: what is the reason the king Because it is written: “Your eyes shall see the king in his beauty” What is the reason a bride So that she should not repulsive to her husband. Rav said to Rabbi Ḥiyya: For how long a bride? He said to him: As it was taught we do not prevent the bride from wearing perfumes the entire thirty days
llm_translation: What is the reason? A king, as it is written: "The king is enthralled by your beauty." And what is the reason for the bride? In order that she not be disgraced before her husband. Rav said to Rabbi Chiya: Until when is the bride exempt? He said to him, as it was taught: They do not withhold adornments from the bride for thirty days.

hebrew_text: הַחַיָּה תִּנְעוֹל אֶת הַסַּנְדָּל — מִשּׁוּם צִינָּה.
human_translation: A new mother wear shoes. Due to the cold
llm_translation: The animal should lock the sandal - due to a weasel.

hebrew_text: אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִם מֵחֲמַת סַכָּנַת עַקְרָב — מוּתָּר.
human_translation: Shmuel said: If due to the danger of scorpions, he is permitted
llm_translation: Said Shmuel: If due to the danger of a scorpion — it is permitted.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹכֵל כְּכוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה. בָּעֵי רַב פָּפָּא:
human_translation: one who eats volume of a large date Rav Pappa asked:
llm_translation: The one who eats like a writing reed. Rav Papa inquires:

hebrew_text: כְּכוֹתֶבֶת שֶׁאָמְרוּ, בְּגַרְעִינָתָהּ: אוֹ בְּלֹא גַּרְעִינָתָהּ? בָּעֵי רַב אָשֵׁי: עֶצֶם כִּשְׂעוֹרָה, בִּקְלִיפָּתָהּ אוֹ בְּלֹא קְלִיפָּתָהּ, בְּלַחָה אוֹ בִּיבֵשָׁה? רַב אָשֵׁי לָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ הָא דְּרַב פָּפָּא, ״גַּסָּה״ אִיתְּמַר — כֹּל כַּמָּה דְּגַסָּה. רַב פָּפָּא לָא מִבַּעְיָא לֵיהּ הָא דְּרַב אָשֵׁי: לַחָה — שִׁבּוֹלֶת מִיקְּרֵי, שֶׁלֹּא בִּקְלִיפָּתָהּ — אוּשְׁלָא מִיקְּרֵי.
human_translation: The large date-bulk that they said with its pit or without its pit? Rav Ashi asked a bone a barley-grain-bulk with its husk or without its husk? a wet or a dry Rav Ashi did not ask that Rav Pappa it is stated Large, as large as possible, Rav Pappa did not ask that Rav Ashi Wet is called shibbolet without its shell is called ushla .
llm_translation: As it is written, as they said, in its shell: or without its shell? Rav Ashei asked: the bone like its hair, with its peel or without its peel, moist or dry? Rav Ashei does not ask about that which Rav Papa said, "thick" is stated - however thick it may be. Rav Papa does not ask about that which Rav Ashei said: moist - it is called a grain, without its peel - it is not called a grain.

hebrew_text: אָמַר (רָבָא) אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה שֶׁאָמְרוּ, יְתֵירָה מִכְּבֵיצָה. וְקִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דִּבְהָכִי מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, בְּצִיר מֵהֲכִי — לָא מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ. מֵיתִיבִי: מַעֲשֶׂה וְהֵבִיאוּ לְרַבָּן יוֹחָנָן בֶּן זַכַּאי לִטְעוֹם אֶת הַתַּבְשִׁיל, וּלְרַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל שְׁתֵּי כוֹתָבוֹת וּדְלִי שֶׁל מַיִם. וְאָמְרוּ: הַעֲלוּם לַסּוּכָּה. וְתָנֵי עֲלַהּ: לָא מִפְּנֵי שֶׁהֲלָכָה כָּךְ, אֶלָּא שֶׁרָצוּ לְהַחֲמִיר עַל עַצְמָן.
human_translation: Rava said Rav Yehuda said: The volume of a large date that they said larger than an egg-bulk. The Sages have an tradition that with this mind is settled, Less than this the mind is not settled. raises an objection An incident They brought a cooked dish to Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai to taste, and to Rabban Gamliel two dates and a tankard of water. said Bring them up to the sukka , And was taught in that regard: did not because that is the halakha , Rather, they wished to be stringent upon themselves
llm_translation: Rava said in the name of Rav Yehudah: A thick one writes that they said, it is more lenient than a thin one. And it stands for the Rabbis that if his mind is not settled in this way - his mind is not settled. They raised an objection: An incident occurred, and they brought it before Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai to taste the dish, and before Rabban Gamliel two scribes and a jug of water. And they said: Bring it into the sukkah. And it was taught about this: Not because the halacha is like this, but because they wanted to be stringent upon themselves.

hebrew_text: וּכְשֶׁנָּתְנוּ לוֹ לְרַבִּי צָדוֹק אוֹכֶל פָּחוֹת מִכְּבֵיצָה — נְטָלוֹ בְּמַפָּה וַאֲכָלוֹ חוּץ לַסּוּכָּה, וְלֹא בֵּירַךְ אַחֲרָיו.
human_translation: And when they gave Rabbi Tzadok food less than an egg-bulk he held it in a cloth And he ate it outside of the sukka and did not recite afterward.
llm_translation: And when they gave to Rabbi Tzadok less than the size of an egg to eat - he took it in a cloth and ate it outside the sukkah, and did not recite a blessing afterwards.

hebrew_text: הָא כְּבֵיצָה — בָּעֵי סוּכָּה. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה שֶׁאָמְרוּ יְתֵירָה מִכְּבֵיצָה, הַשְׁתָּא שְׁתֵּי כוֹתָבוֹת בְּלֹא גַּרְעִינָן לָא הָווּ כְּבֵיצָה, כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה וְגַרְעִינָתָהּ מִי הָוֵי יְתֵירָה מִכְּבֵיצָה?! אֲמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה: אִין, שְׁתֵּי כוֹתָבוֹת בְּלֹא גַּרְעִינָתָן לָא הָווּ כְּבֵיצָה, כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה וְגַרְעִינָתָהּ הָוֵי יְתֵירָה מִכְּבֵיצָה. אֲמַר רַב פָּפָּא, הַיְינוּ דְּאָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: תְּרֵי קַבֵּי דְּתַמְרֵי חַד קַבָּא דְּקַשְׁיָיתָא וּסְרִיחַ.
human_translation: an egg-bulk is required a sukka . If it should enter your mind volume of the large date that they spoke of is larger than an egg-bulk, Now, two dates without their pits are not an egg. can the volume of a large date and its pit greater than that of an egg-bulk? Rav Yirmeya said: Yes, two dates without their pits are not equal an egg-bulk, the volume of a large date and its pit are larger than an egg-bulk, Rav Pappa said: This that people say: two kav of dates one kav and more of pits,
llm_translation: The egg - requires a sukkah. And if it enters your mind to write "a large one" that they said is more than an egg, now, two writings without their pits are not considered like an egg. If you write "a large one" and its pit, would it be more than an egg?! Rabbi Yirmeya said: No, two writings without their pits are not considered like an egg. If you write "a large one" and its pit, it is more than an egg. Rav Papa said, this is what people say: Two measures of dates, one measure of a hard one and it stinks.

hebrew_text: רָבָא אָמַר: הָתָם הַיְינוּ טַעְמָא מִשּׁוּם דְּהָווּ לְהוּ פֵּירֵי, וּפֵירֵי לָא בָּעוּ סוּכָּה. מֵיתִיבִי, אָמַר רַבִּי: כְּשֶׁהָיִינוּ לוֹמְדִים תּוֹרָה אֵצֶל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן שַׁמּוּעַ הֵבִיאוּ לְפָנֵינוּ תְּאֵנִים וַעֲנָבִים וַאֲכַלְנוּם אֲכִילַת עֲרַאי חוּץ לְסוּכָּה. אֲכִילַת עֲרַאי — אִין, אֲכִילַת קֶבַע — לָא! אֵימָא: אֲכַלְנוּם כַּאֲכִילַת עֲרַאי חוּץ לַסּוּכָּה.
human_translation: Rava said: There, this is the reasoning due to are fruit, and fruit need not a sukka raises an objection. Rabbi said: When we would learn Torah with Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, they brought before us figs and grapes, and we ate them as a casual meal outside of the sukka . a casual meal, yes, a fixed meal not say we ate them as if a casual meal, outside of the sukka ,
llm_translation: Rava said: There, the reason is because they were intended for the fruit, and fruit is not needed for the sukkah. It was raised: Rabbi said: When we were learning Torah with Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, they brought before us figs and grapes, and we ate them as a temporary meal outside the sukkah. A temporary meal - yes, a permanent meal - no! Say: We ate them like a temporary meal outside the sukkah.

hebrew_text: אִי בָּעֵית אֵימָא: אֲכַלְנוּם אֲכִילַת קֶבַע, וְאָכַלְנוּ פַּת אֲכִילַת עֲרַאי בַּהֲדַיְיהוּ חוּץ לַסּוּכָּה.
human_translation: If you wish, say We ate as a fixed meal, and we ate bread as a casual meal with outside of the sukka .
llm_translation: If you wish, I will say: We ate a permanent meal, and we ate bread as a temporary meal with them outside the sukkah.

hebrew_text: לֵימָא מְסַיַּיע לֵיהּ: לְפִיכָךְ, אִם הִשְׁלִים בְּמִינֵי תַרְגִּימָא — יָצָא. וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ פֵּירֵי בָּעוּ סוּכָּה, לִיתְנֵי פֵּירוֹת! מַאי מִינֵי תַרְגִּימָא — פֵּירוֹת. וְאִיבָּעֵית אֵימָא: בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא שְׁכִיחִי פֵּירֵי.
human_translation: Let us say that supports Therefore, if one completed with types of sweets, he has fulfilled If it should enter your mind fruit required a sukka , let it teach fruit. What types of sweets fruit. And if you wish, say a place where fruits are uncommon,
llm_translation: Let it be said that he assists him: Therefore, if he completed with types of translation - he has fulfilled his obligation. And if it enters your mind, the fruits of a booth are not mentioned, let him mention fruits! What are types of translation - fruits. And if you wish, say: in a place where fruits are not common.

hebrew_text: רַב זְבִיד אָמַר: כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה שֶׁאָמְרוּ — חֲסֵרָה מִכְּבֵיצָה. דִּתְנַן, בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: שְׂאוֹר — בְּכַזַּיִת, חָמֵץ — בְּכַכּוֹתֶבֶת.
human_translation: Rav Zevid said: the volume of a large date that they spoke is less than an egg-bulk, as we learned Beit Shammai say: leaven, the volume of an olive-bulk leavened bread is the volume of a large date.
llm_translation: Rav Zebid said: A thick one who said - she lacks from her egg. As we learned, Beit Shammai say: leaven - in olive oil, sourdough - in thick one.

hebrew_text: וְהָוֵינַן בָּהּ: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּבֵית שַׁמַּאי? נִכְתּוֹב רַחֲמָנָא ״חָמֵץ״, וְלָא בָּעֵי ״שְׂאוֹר״, וַאֲנָא אָמֵינָא: וּמָה חָמֵץ שֶׁאֵין חִמּוּצוֹ קָשֶׁה — אָסוּר בִּכְזַיִת, שְׂאוֹר שֶׁחִמּוּצוֹ קָשֶׁה — לֹא כָּל שֶׁכֵּן? מִדְּפַלְגִינְהוּ רַחֲמָנָא, לִימְּדָה לְךָ שִׁיעוּרוֹ שֶׁל זֶה לֹא כְּשִׁיעוּרוֹ שֶׁל זֶה. שְׂאוֹר בְּכַזַּיִת, וְחָמֵץ בְּכַכּוֹתֶבֶת.
human_translation: And we discussed it: What is the reason of Beit Shammai? let the Merciful One write “Leavened bread,” and not need “Leaven.” I would say, If leavened bread, whose leavening ability is strong, is prohibited an olive-bulk, all the more so not leaven, whose leavening ability is strong the Merciful One distinguishes them taught you the measure for one is not the measure for the other. leaven an olive-bulk, leavened bread, volume of a large date.
llm_translation: We ask in it: What is the reason of Beit Shammai? It is written "leaven" by the Merciful One, and it does not require "sour dough," and I say: And what leaven that its fermentation is not severe - is prohibited in the size of an olive, sour dough that its fermentation is severe - all the more so? The Merciful One made a distinction for you, learn from it that the measure of this is not like the measure of that. Sour dough in the size of an olive, and leaven in the size of a barley grain.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה שֶׁאָמְרוּ יְתֵירָה מִכְּבֵיצָה, מִכְּדִי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אַשִּׁיעוּרָא דִּנְפִישׁ מִכְּזַיִת קָא מְהַדְּרִי, לִיתְנֵי כְּבֵיצָה. וְאִי נָמֵי כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, נִיתְנֵי כְּבֵיצָה! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כּוֹתֶבֶת פְּחוּתָה מִכְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: And if it should enter your mind The volume of the large date that they spoke is greater than an egg-bulk, since Beit Shammai are searching for the measure larger than an olive-bulk, let them teach an egg-bulk Alternatively, if they are the same they should have taught an egg-bulk, Rather, not conclude from here that the volume of a large date is less than an egg-bulk?
llm_translation: And if it should enter your mind, you write "haGasah" that they said is more stringent than "Kevitzah," since the House of Shammai established a larger measure than a "kazayit," they should establish "Kevitzah." And if indeed they are equivalent, they should establish "Kevitzah"! Rather, no, infer from it: you write less than "Kevitzah."

hebrew_text: מִמַּאי? דִּילְמָא לְעוֹלָם אֵימָא לְךָ כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה שֶׁאָמְרוּ — יְתֵירָה מִכְּבֵיצָה, הָא סְתָמָא — כְּבֵיצָה. וְאִי נָמֵי כִּי הֲדָדֵי נִינְהוּ, וַחֲדָא מִינַּיְיהוּ נְקַט.
human_translation: From where Perhaps I could actually say to you the volume of a large date that they said is larger than an egg-bulk; normal an egg-bulk, Alternatively, that are equal, and chose one of them.
llm_translation: From where? Perhaps, forever I will say to you, write the bold that they said - more than the egg, this is the egg. And if not, for they are identical, and one of them is taken.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא מֵהָכָא: עַד כַּמָּה מְזַמְּנִין? עַד כְּזַיִת, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: עַד כְּבֵיצָה. בְּמַאי קָא מִיפַּלְגִי — רַבִּי מֵאִיר סָבַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ״, זוֹ אֲכִילָה, ״וְשָׂבָעְתָּ״, זוֹ שְׁתִיָּה — וַאֲכִילָה בִּכְזַיִת. וְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה סָבַר: ״וְאָכַלְתָּ וְשָׂבָעְתָּ״, אֲכִילָה שֶׁיֵּשׁ בָּהּ שְׂבִיעָה, וְאֵי זֶה — זֶה כְּבֵיצָה.
human_translation: Rather, from here: How much to obligate an invitation zimmun ] An olive-bulk the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: An egg-bulk With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds “And you shall eat”; this eating. “And be satisfied”; this drinking. eating an olive-bulk. Rabbi Yehuda holds: “And you shall eat and be satisfied” eating that causes satisfaction, and what is that? an egg-bulk.
llm_translation: Rather from here: Until how much do we invite? Until an olive, the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Until an egg. With what do they disagree? Rabbi Meir holds: "And you shall eat," this is eating, "and you shall be satisfied," this is drinking - and eating is with an olive. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: "And you shall eat and be satisfied," eating that includes satisfaction, and what is this? This is an egg.

hebrew_text: וְאִי סָלְקָא דַעְתָּךְ כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה שֶׁאָמְרוּ יְתֵירָה מִכְּבֵיצָה, הַשְׁתָּא כְּבֵיצָה שַׂבּוֹעֵי מְשַׂבְּעָא, דַּעְתָּא לָא מִיַּתְּבָא?! אֶלָּא לָאו, שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ: כּוֹתֶבֶת הַגַּסָּה שֶׁאָמְרוּ פָּחוֹת מִכְּבֵיצָה. כְּבֵיצָה — מְשַׂבְּעָא, כְּכוֹתֶבֶת — מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And if it should enter your mind the volume of the large date that they spoke is larger than an egg-bulk, Now an egg-bulk satisfies, it does not settle the mind, Rather, not conclude from the volume of a large date that they said is less than the size of an egg-bulk? of an egg-bulk satisfies the volume of a large date settles his mind.
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind, you write "the greater than the egg," as they said, more than the egg, now the egg is satiated, is the mind not satisfied?! Rather, no, infer from it: you write "the greater than the egg," as they said, less than the egg. The egg - is satiated, as you write - is his mind not satisfied.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר:
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi says:
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita, Rabbi says:

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַשִּׁיעוּרִין כּוּלָּן בִּכְזַיִת, חוּץ מִטּוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין, שֶׁשִּׁינָּה הַכָּתוּב בְּמַשְׁמָעָן, וְשִׁינּוּ חֲכָמִים בְּשִׁיעוּרָן. וּרְאָיָה לַדָּבָר — יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. מַאי שִׁינָּה הַכָּתוּב בְּמַשְׁמָעוֹ — מִ״לֹּא תְעוּנֶּה״, וּמַאי שִׁינּוּ חֲכָמִים בְּשִׁיעוּרֵיהּ — כְּכוֹתֶבֶת.
human_translation: All the measures an olive-bulk, except for food impure, because the verse changed its expression and the Sages altered the measure The proof of this, Yom Kippur. How did the verse changed its expression? from: shall not be afflicted” How did the Sages change its measure? the volume of a large date-bulk,
llm_translation: All the measurements are according to the olive, except for the impurity of foods, as the Scripture stated explicitly, and the Sages interpreted in their measurements. And a proof to this matter is Yom Kippur. What is the meaning of the Scripture stating explicitly? "Do not oppress." And what is the interpretation of the Sages in their measurements? Like a scribe writes.

hebrew_text: וּמַאי רְאָיָה לַדָּבָר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים? דְּאִי מֵהָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא: אוֹרְחָא דִקְרָא הוּא.
human_translation: And what A proof for this Yom Kippur? If there, I would have said that that is the style of the verse,
llm_translation: And what is the proof for the matter of Yom Kippur? For if from there, I would say: it is a way of the verse.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאַת אוֹכָלִין כְּבֵיצָה מְנָלַן? אָמַר רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: דְּאָמַר קְרָא: ״מִכׇּל הָאוֹכֶל אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל״, אוֹכֶל הַבָּא מֵחֲמַת אוֹכֶל, וְאֵיזֶה — זֶה בֵּיצַת תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת. וְאֵימָא גְּדִי! מְחוּסָּר שְׁחִיטָה. וְאֵימָא בֶּן פְּקוּעָה! טָעוּן קְרִיעָה.
human_translation: From where do we impure foods the volume of an egg-bulk? Rabbi Abbahu said that Rabbi Elazar said that the verse states: “Of all food [ okhel ] which may be eaten [ ye’akhel ], food that comes on account of food, And which is that? A chicken egg. And say a kid, It lacks ritual slaughter. And say a ben pekua . requires cutting,
llm_translation: Impurity of foods like an egg, from where do we derive it? Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Elazar: As the verse states: "Of all the food which may be eaten," food that comes due to food, and what is that? That is the egg of a hen. And why not a kid? It requires ritual slaughter. And why not a calf that was torn? It requires tearing.

hebrew_text: וְאֵימָא בֵּיצַת בַּר יוֹכָנִי! תָּפַסְתָּ מְרוּבֶּה לֹא תָּפַסְתָּ, תָּפַסְתָּ מוּעָט תָּפַסְתָּ. וְאֵימָא בֵּיעֲתָא דְּצִיפַּורְתָּא דְּזוּטַר טוּבָא!
human_translation: say egg bulk bar yokhani . If you grasped many, you did not grasp anything; if you grasped few, you grasped something. say a very small bird’s egg.
llm_translation: And why not the egg of Bar Yochnai! If you took the majority, you did not take it; if you took the minority, you took it. And why not the egg of the bird of Zutar Tuba!

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֲבָהוּ דִּידֵיהּ, אָמַר: ״מִכׇּל הָאוֹכֶל אֲשֶׁר יֵאָכֵל״, אוֹכֶל שֶׁאַתָּה אוֹכְלוֹ בְּבַת אַחַת. וְשִׁיעֲרוּ חֲכָמִים: אֵין בֵּית הַבְּלִיעָה מַחֲזִיק יוֹתֵר מִבֵּיצַת תַּרְנְגוֹלֶת.
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu himself said: “Of all food which may be eaten.” food that you eat at one time. The Sages estimated: The esophagus cannot hold more a chicken’s egg,
llm_translation: Rabbi Avahu his opinion said: "From all the food that shall be eaten," food that you eat in one swallow. And the Sages estimated: The stomach does not hold more than the egg of a hen.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר: הָאוֹכֵל חֵלֶב בִּזְמַן הַזֶּה צָרִיךְ שֶׁיִּכְתּוֹב לוֹ שִׁיעוּר, שֶׁמָּא יָבֹא בֵּית דִּין אַחֵר וְיַרְבֶּה בְּשִׁיעוּרִין.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who eats fat today must write down the measure lest another court come and increase the measure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar said: One who eats forbidden fat in this time must have a measure written for him, lest another court come and increase the measures.

hebrew_text: מַאי יַרְבֶּה בְּשִׁיעוּרִין? אִי נֵימָא דִּמְחַיְּיבִי קׇרְבָּן אַכַּזַּיִת קָטָן, וְהָתַנְיָא: ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא תֵעָשֶׂינָה בִּשְׁגָגָה וְאָשֵׁם״, הַשָּׁב מִידִיעָתוֹ — מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ.
human_translation: What does increase the measure? If we say will obligate an offering bulk a small olive, - Wasn’t it taught not to be done, and be guilty” one who repents due to his awareness, brings an offering for his unwitting
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "increasing in measures"? If you say it refers to those who are obligated to bring a small guilt-offering, but it was taught: "Which they did not do unintentionally, and he is guilty," one who repents immediately brings an offering for his unintentional sin.

hebrew_text: לֹא שָׁב מִידִיעָתוֹ — אֵין מֵבִיא קׇרְבָּן עַל שִׁגְגָתוֹ.
human_translation: one who does not repent due to his awareness does not bring an offering for his unwitting
llm_translation: He did not return from his knowledge - one does not bring an offering for his unintentional transgression.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: דְּלָא מְחַיְּיבִי קׇרְבָּן עַד דְּאִיכָּא כְּזַיִת גָּדוֹל.
human_translation: Rather, will not obligate an offering until he has of a large olive,
llm_translation: Rather: that not obligated offering until there is like an olive large.

hebrew_text: וּלְמַאי דִּסְלֵיק אַדַּעְתִּין מֵעִיקָּרָא דִּמְחַיְּיבִי קׇרְבָּן אַכַּזַּיִת קָטָן, מַאי ״יַרְבֶּה בְּשִׁיעוּרִין״? שֶׁמָּא יַרְבֶּה בְּקׇרְבָּנוֹת מֵחֲמַת שִׁיעוּרִין.
human_translation: According to what entered his mind initially, obligate an offering small olive, what increase the measure? perhaps there will be an increase in offerings due to measure
llm_translation: And for what reason does the knowledge come out from the beginning that obligates a small olive-sized offering, what is "it will increase in measures"? Perhaps it will increase in its offerings because of the measures.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: שִׁיעוּרִין וָעוֹנָשִׁין הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי. עוֹנָשִׁין מִכְתָּב כְּתִיבִי! אֶלָּא הָכִי קָאָמַר: (אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן:) שִׁיעוּרִים שֶׁל עוֹנָשִׁין — הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Measures and punishments are halakha to Moses from Sinai. The punishments are written Rather, this is said: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Measures for punishments are halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Measurements and punishments are laws given to Moses at Sinai. Punishments are written in the Torah! Rather, this is what he is saying: (Rabbi Yochanan said:) The measurements of punishments are laws given to Moses at Sinai.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: שִׁיעוּרִין שֶׁל עוֹנָשִׁין הֲלָכָה לְמֹשֶׁה מִסִּינַי. אֲחֵרִים אוֹמְרִים: בֵּית דִּינוֹ שֶׁל יַעְבֵּץ תִּיקְּנוּם. וְהָכְתִיב: ״אֵלֶּה הַמִּצְוֹת״, שֶׁאֵין נָבִיא רַשַּׁאי לְחַדֵּשׁ דָּבָר מֵעַתָּה! אֶלָּא, שְׁכָחוּם וְחָזְרוּ וְיִסְּדוּם.
human_translation: This was also taught Measures of punishments are halakha to Moses from Sinai. Others say: were instituted by the court of Jabez. Isn’t it written: “These are the mitzvot which the Lord commanded Moses for the children of Israel at Mount Sinai” that a prophet is not permitted to introduce element from here on. Rather, forgot reestablished
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: Nami the Elder said: The measurements of punishments are halakha from Moses at Sinai. Others say: The court of Ya'avetz established them. And it is written: "These are the commandments," indicating that no prophet has the authority to innovate anything from now on! Rather, they were forgotten, then rediscovered and established.

hebrew_text: הַשּׁוֹתֶה מְלֹא לוּגְמָיו. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא מְלֹא לוּגְמָיו מַמָּשׁ, אֶלָּא כׇּל שֶׁאִילּוּ יְסַלְּקֶנּוּ לְצַד אֶחָד וְיֵרָאֶה כִּמְלֹא לוּגְמָיו. וְהָא אֲנַן תְּנַן ״מְלֹא לוּגְמָיו״! אֵימָא: ״כִּמְלֹא לוּגְמָיו״.
human_translation: one who drinks a cheekful Rabbi Yehuda said Shmuel said: This does not cheeks actually full. Rather, if one pushes to one side and it appears as though his cheek were full. Didn’t we learn A cheekful, Say: Like cheeks full
llm_translation: The one who drinks his cup full. Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Not literally full, rather, anything that if one were to remove it to one side, it would appear as though it were full. But didn't we learn "his cup full"?! Say: "as though it were full."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: כַּמָּה יִשְׁתֶּה וִיהֵא חַיָּיב? בֵּית שַׁמַּאי אוֹמְרִים: רְבִיעִית, וּבֵית הִלֵּל אוֹמְרִים: מְלֹא לוּגְמָיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר מִשּׁוּם רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר: כִּמְלֹא לוּגְמָיו. רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בְּתֵירָא אוֹמֵר: כְּדֵי גְמִיעָה.
human_translation: raises an objection How much drink to be liable? Beit Shammai say: A quarter- and Beit Hillel say: cheeks full. Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: Like cheeks full Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: amount swallow
llm_translation: Challenger: How much should one drink to be liable? Beit Shammai says: a quarter-log, and Beit Hillel says: the fullness of his cheeks. Rabbi Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: like the fullness of his cheeks. Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: enough for swallowing.

hebrew_text: מִי עֲדִיפָא מִמַּתְנִיתִין דְּאוֹקֵימְנָא כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּרָאֶה, הָכִי נָמֵי כְּדֵי שֶׁיֵּרָאֶה! אִי הָכִי, הַיְינוּ רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר! אִיכָּא בֵּינַיְיהוּ מְלֹא לוּגְמָיו דָּחוּק.
human_translation: Is preferable to the mishna? Since it was established so that it appears so too, that looks like If so, this is Rabbi Eliezer, between them a paltry cheekful,
llm_translation: Who is greater than the Mishnaic scholars who we establish in order that they should be seen, so too it is necessary that they should be seen! If so, this is Rabbi Eliezer! There is a difference between them, the measure of a lug of pressed figs.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַב הוֹשַׁעְיָא: אִם כֵּן, הָוֵה לֵיהּ מִקּוּלֵּי בֵּית שַׁמַּאי וּמֵחוּמְרֵי בֵּית הִלֵּל! אֲמַר לֵיהּ:
human_translation: Rav Hoshaya strongly objects to this If so, this is Beit Shammai’s leniencies and Beit Hillel’s stringencies, He said to him:
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rav Hoshaya objected to her: If so, he would have the leniencies of Beit Shammai and the stringencies of Beit Hillel! He said to her:

hebrew_text: כִּי אִתְּשִׁיל, בְּעוֹג מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן אִתְּשִׁיל, דְּהָווּ לְהוּ בֵּית שַׁמַּאי לְחוּמְרָא.
human_translation: When was asked, the question was asked about Og, king of Bashan, it is Beit Shammai stringent,
llm_translation: When I will weigh, with the cake of Og, king of Bashan I will weigh, for they were of the opinion of Beit Shammai to be stringent.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: מַאי שְׁנָא אֲכִילָה, דְּכׇל חַד וְחַד — בִּכְכוֹתֶבֶת, וּמַאי שְׁנָא שְׁתִיָּה, דְּכׇל חַד וְחַד בְּדִידֵיהּ? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: קִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן בִּכְכוֹתֶבֶת, דִּבְהָכִי מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, בְּצִיר מֵהָכִי — לָא מִיַּתְּבָא. בִּשְׁתִיָּה, בְּדִידֵיהּ מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, בִּדְחַבְרֵיהּ — לָא מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this What is different eating, that all people volume of a large date; and what is different drinking, where each and every according to his own measure, Abaye said to him: The Sages have tradition the volume of the large date, that this settles his mind, less than this does not settle drinking, his mind is settled with his own but his mind is not settled of his fellow
llm_translation: Rebbe Zeira raised an objection: What is different about eating, that each person eats separately, and what is different about drinking, that each person drinks separately? Abaye said to him: When it comes to eating, the Rabbis are particular about writing, so that his mind will be focused on it, but when it comes to drinking, his mind is not focused. When it comes to drinking, his mind is focused on it, but when it comes to his companions, his mind is not focused.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא: וְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ בִּכְכוֹתֶבֶת וְעוֹג מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן בִּכְכוֹתֶבֶת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: קִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דִּבְהָכִי מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, בְּצִיר מֵהָכִי לָא מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, מִיהוּ, כּוּלֵּי עָלְמָא — טוּבָא, וְעוֹג מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן — פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this Is everyone with the volume of a large date, and Og, king of Bashan, with the volume of a large date? Abaye said to him: The Sages have tradition that this settles his mind, less than this does not settle his mind. However, everyone greatly Og, king of Bashan, a little
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rabbi Zeira raised an objection against him: Is the entire world written in the Torah, and Og the King of Bashan is also written in the Torah? Abaye said to him: For the Rabbis who engage in the study of Scripture, their knowledge is established. But for a woodcutter, their knowledge is not established. Nevertheless, the entire world is good, and Og the King of Bashan is a pearl.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רַבִּי זֵירָא בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן בִּכְכוֹתֶבֶת, וְלוּלְבֵי גְפָנִים בִּכְכוֹתֶבֶת? אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: קִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דִּבְהָכִי מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, בְּצִיר מֵהָכִי — לָא מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ. מִיהוּ בָּשָׂר שָׁמֵן — טוּבָא, לוּלְבֵי גְפָנִים — פּוּרְתָּא.
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira strongly objects to this fatty meat, volume of a large date, grapevine shoots, with the volume of a large date? Abaye said to him: The Sages have tradition that with this one’s mind is settled, with less than this his mind is not settled. However, fatty meat, greatly grapevine shoots, a little
llm_translation: Rebbe Zeira raised an objection to her: "Is animal fat written in the Torah, and grape clusters written in the Torah?" Abaye said to her: "For the Rabbis, who are meticulous in their thoughts, if it is missing from here, their thoughts are not settled. However, animal fat is good, and grape clusters are essential."

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: כְּזַיִת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס, וְכוֹתֶבֶת בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ אַבָּיֵי: קִים לְהוּ לְרַבָּנַן דִּבְהָכִי מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ, בִּטְפֵי מֵהָכִי — לָא מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this: of an olive-bulk within to eat a half-loaf of bread. volume of a large date, within to eat a half-loaf of bread. Abaye said to him: The Sages have tradition that this his mind is settled; but a longer his mind is not settled,
llm_translation: Rava objects to her: Like an olive in the time it takes to eat a Persian meal, and she writes in the time it takes to eat a Persian meal?! Abaye said to her: The Rabbis are established in such a way that their minds are not distracted, but in this case - their minds are distracted.

hebrew_text: מַתְקֵיף לַהּ רָבָא: (בְּכוֹתֶבֶת) בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס, חֲצִי פְרָס — בִּכְדֵי אֲכִילַת פְּרָס?! אֲמַר לֵיהּ רַב פָּפָּא: הַנַּח לְטוּמְאַת גְּוִויָּה דְּלָאו דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא הִיא.
human_translation: Rava strongly objects to this: volume of a large date within to eat a half-loaf of bread; half of a half-loaf, within to eat a half-loaf of bread. Rav Pappa said to him: Leave ritual impurity of the body because that is not by Torah law
llm_translation: Rava objects to her: "In the amount of a half of a Persa for eating, a half of a Persa for eating?! Rav Papa said to her: Leave the impurity of the body, for it is not from the Torah."

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא הָכִי? וְהָכְתִיב: ״וְלֹא תִטַּמְּאוּ בָּהֶם וְנִטְמֵתֶם בָּם״, וְאָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מִכָּאן שֶׁטּוּמְאַת גְּוִויָּה דְּאוֹרָיְיתָא! מִדְּרַבָּנַן, וּקְרָא — אַסְמַכְתָּא בְּעָלְמָא.
human_translation: But did Rav Pappa say that But Isn’t it written: neither shall you make yourselves impure with them, that you should be impure thereby” And Rav Pappa said: From here, ritual impurity of the body is by Torah law. rabbinic and the verse is a mere support.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said thus, Rav Papa? And it is written: "And you shall not defile yourselves with them, and you shall be defiled by them." And Rav Papa said: From here is the impurity of marital relations from the Torah! From the Rabbis, and the verse is merely a support.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הָאוֹכָלִין. אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: אֲכַל אוּמְצָא וּמִילְחָא — מִצְטָרֵף. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּלָאו אֲכִילָה הִיא, כֵּיוָן דְּאָכְלִי אִינָשֵׁי — מִצְטָרְפִין. אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: צִיר שֶׁעַל גַּבֵּי יָרָק מִצְטָרֵף לִכְכוֹתֶבֶת בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. פְּשִׁיטָא! מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא מַשְׁקֶה הוּא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן: כׇּל אַכְשׁוֹרֵי אוּכְלָא — אוּכְלָא הוּא.
human_translation: All foods Rav Pappa said: ate meat and salt combine Although is not eating, since people do eat they combine Reish Lakish said: Brine on a vegetable combines volume of a large date on Yom Kippur. It obvious. Lest you say a beverage, it teaches us any item that prepares food is a food.
llm_translation: All the foods. Rav Papa said: If one ate garlic and salt - they combine. Even though it is not considered a proper meal, since people eat it - they combine. Reish Lakish said: The juice on top of vegetables combines with the writing on Yom Kippur. It is obvious! Lest you say it is a beverage, it teaches us: all valid foods are considered food.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: הָאוֹכֵל אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — פָּטוּר. מַאי טַעְמָא? ״אֲשֶׁר לֹא תְעוּנֶּה״ כְּתִיב, פְּרָט לְמַזִּיק.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: One who eats an excessive manner on Yom Kippur, is exempt, What is the reason was written shall not be afflicted excluding one who harms
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: One who eats a large meal on Yom Kippur is exempt. What is the reason? It is written, "Which you shall afflict," excluding one who causes harm.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: זָר שֶׁאָכַל תְּרוּמָה אֲכִילָה גַּסָּה — מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַחוֹמֶשׁ. ״כִּי יֹאכַל״ — פְּרָט לְמַזִּיק. אָמַר רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זָר
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said Reish Lakish said: A non-priest who ate teruma in an excessive manner pays the principal, and does not pay the fifth, if eat excludes harming Rabbi Yirmeya said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: A non-priest
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said Reish Lakish said: A non-priest who ate Terumah intentionally - he pays the principal but does not pay the additional fifth. "When he eats" - this excludes one who causes damage. Rabbi Yirmiyah said Rabbi Yochanan: A non-priest

hebrew_text: שֶׁכּוֹסֵס שְׂעוֹרִים שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה — מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַקֶּרֶן וְאֵינוֹ מְשַׁלֵּם אֶת הַחוֹמֶשׁ. ״כִּי יֹאכַל״ — פְּרָט לְמַזִּיק.
human_translation: who chews on barley of teruma pays the principal and not fifth. “eats” which excludes one who harms
llm_translation: A cup of barley of terumah - he pays the principal but does not pay the fifth. "When he eats" - excludes one who causes damage.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב שֵׁיזְבִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: זָר שֶׁבָּלַע שִׁזְפִין שֶׁל תְּרוּמָה וֶהֱקִיאָן וַאֲכָלָן אַחֵר, רִאשׁוֹן — מְשַׁלֵּם (אֶת) קֶרֶן וָחוֹמֶשׁ. שֵׁנִי — אֵין מְשַׁלֵּם אֶלָּא דְּמֵי עֵצִים לָרִאשׁוֹן בִּלְבַד.
human_translation: Rav Sheizvi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a non-priest who swallowed plums of teruma and vomited them out, another ate them, the first pays the principal plus a fifth. the second pays only the price of wood, to the first
llm_translation: Rav Sheizbi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A non-priest who swallowed Terumah crumbs and then vomited them and another person ate them afterwards, the first one pays the principal amount and an additional fifth. The second one only pays the value of the wood to the first one alone.

hebrew_text: הָאוֹכֵל וְהַשּׁוֹתֶה אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין. מַאן תַּנָּא? אָמַר רַב חִסְדָּא: בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא. דִּתְנַן, כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ: כֹּל שֶׁטּוּמְאָתוֹ וְשִׁיעוּרוֹ שָׁוֶה — מִצְטָרֵף.
human_translation: food and drink do not combine. Who taught Rav Ḥisda said: is taught as a dispute, and is Rabbi Yehoshua. As we learned Rabbi Yehoshua stated a general principle: Any that identical its ritual impurity, and its measure combines
llm_translation: The one who eats and the one who drinks do not combine. Who is the Tanna? Rav Ḥisdah said: In a case of interchangeable dispute, and it is Rabbi Yehoshua. As we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yehoshua said: Anything whose impurity and measurement are equal - combines.

hebrew_text: טוּמְאָתוֹ וְלֹא שִׁיעוּרוֹ, שִׁיעוּרוֹ וְלֹא טוּמְאָתוֹ, לֹא טוּמְאָתוֹ וְלֹא שִׁיעוּרוֹ — אֵין מִצְטָרְפִין.
human_translation: its ritual impurity but not its measure, or if its measure but not its ritual impurity, neither its ritual impurity nor its measure do not combine.
llm_translation: His impurity and not his measure, his measure and not his impurity, not his impurity and not his measure - they do not combine.

hebrew_text: רַב נַחְמָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא קָא אָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם, אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה, דְּשֵׁם טוּמְאָה חַד הִיא. אֲבָל הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם יַתּוֹבֵי דַּעְתָּא הוּא, וְהַאי לָא מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: Even you say the Rabbis, until now we have the Rabbis say there only with respect to ritual impurity. Since the of ritual impurity is one concept, But here, due to settling the mind, and this does not settle the mind.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Even if you say it is the Rabbis, until here they did not say the Rabbis there, but rather regarding the matter of impurity, for the name of impurity is one. But here, it is because of the clarity of the mind, and this does not clarify his mind.

hebrew_text: וְכֵן אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: בְּמַחְלוֹקֶת שְׁנוּיָה, וְרַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ הִיא, דִּתְנַן: כְּלָל אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוֹשֻׁעַ כּוּ׳. וְרַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבָּנַן, עַד כָּאן לָא קָאָמְרִי רַבָּנַן הָתָם אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן טוּמְאָה, אֲבָל הָכָא, מִשּׁוּם יַתּוֹבֵי דַּעְתֵּיהּ הוּא, וְהַאי לָא קָא מִיַּתְּבָא דַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: And similarly, Reish Lakish said: is taught as a dispute. Rabbi Yehoshua, as we learned Rabbi Yehoshua stated a general principle And Rabbi Yoḥanan said Even you say the the Rabbis, until now we have the Rabbis say there only with regard to ritual impurity. But here, due to settling the mind, and this does not
llm_translation: And so said Reish Lakish: In a dispute that is repeated, and it is Rabbi Yehoshua, as we learned: Rabbi Yehoshua said in general.
