And the Rabbis say: In this case and no other. To which this one If we say a pregnant woman, it obvious; is there anyone who says not a pregnant woman Rather, is it not medicine Learn from this
llm_translation: Come and hear, for Rabba bar Shmuel teaches: If a pregnant woman smells food, we feed her until her soul returns, and one who is bitten by a mad dog, we feed him from the liver of the dog, and one who is concerned about his mouth, we place a spice in his mouth on Shabbat, the words of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei, who said in the name of Rabbi Matya ben Charash. And the sages say: In disgrace and not in another way. "In disgrace" - what is it? If you say a pregnant woman, it is obvious! Is there a pregnant woman for someone to say no? Rather, it is referring to a spice. Learn from it.

hebrew_text: רַב אָשֵׁי אָמַר: מַתְנִיתִין נָמֵי דַּיְקָא — וְעוֹד אָמַר רַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶּן חָרָשׁ: הַחוֹשֵׁשׁ בְּפִיו מְטִילִין לוֹ סַם בְּשַׁבָּת, וְלָא פְּלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ. וְאִם אִיתָא דִּפְלִיגִי רַבָּנַן עֲלֵיהּ, לִיעָרְבִינְהוּ וְלִיתְנִינְהוּ, וְלִיפַּלְגוּ רַבָּנַן בְּסֵיפָא. שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ.
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: the mishna is also precise And furthermore, Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash said: one who suffers pain in his mouth, one places medicine in his on Shabbat, and the Rabbis do not disagree And if it is so that the Rabbis disagree with him, let combine and teach them and let the Rabbis disagree in the latter clause. learn from here
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: The Mishna is precise - and furthermore, Rabbi Matya ben Charash said: One who is concerned about his mouth, they may place spice for him on Shabbat, and the Rabbis did not disagree with him. And if it is said that the Rabbis did disagree with him, they should mix it and give it to him, and the Rabbis should disagree with him in the end. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּפֵק נְפָשׁוֹת הוּא וְכוּ׳. לְמָה לִי תּוּ לְמֵימַר: ״וְכׇל סְפֵק נְפָשׁוֹת דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת״? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר רַב: לֹא סָפֵק שַׁבָּת זוֹ בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ סָפֵק שַׁבָּת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: because uncertainty life-threatening Why do I furthermore: And any uncertainty life-threatening overrides Shabbat? Rav Yehuda said Rav said: They stated not only uncertainty this Shabbat, but even uncertainty a different Shabbat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Because it is a doubtful case of life, etc." Why do I need to say: "And any doubtful case of life overrides the Sabbath"? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: They did not only say this regarding this particular Sabbath, but even in the case of a doubtful other Sabbath.

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? כְּגוֹן דְּאַמְדוּהּ לִתְמָנְיָא יוֹמֵי, וְיוֹמָא קַמָּא שַׁבְּתָא. מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: לִיעַכַּב עַד לְאוּרְתָּא כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלָא נֵיחוּל עֲלֵיהּ תְּרֵי שַׁבָּתָא, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן.
human_translation: What are the circumstances where assess for eight days, and the first day is Shabbat. Lest you say: He should wait until evening so they will not need to desecrate two Shabbatot for his sake, it teaches us
llm_translation: "How are the circumstances? For example, if one designated it for eight days, and the first day is a Sabbath. Lest you say: Let it be delayed until nightfall so that two Sabbaths do not occur consecutively, it is evident to us."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא נָמֵי הָכִי: מְחַמִּין חַמִּין לַחוֹלֶה בְּשַׁבָּת, בֵּין לְהַשְׁקוֹתוֹ בֵּין לְהַבְרוֹתוֹ. וְלֹא שַׁבָּת זוֹ בִּלְבַד אָמְרוּ, אֶלָּא לְשַׁבָּת אַחֶרֶת. וְאֵין אוֹמְרִים: נַמְתִּין לוֹ שֶׁמָּא יַבְרִיא, אֶלָּא מְחַמִּין לוֹ מִיָּד, מִפְּנֵי שֶׁסְּפֵק נְפָשׁוֹת דּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. וְלֹא סָפֵק שַׁבָּת זוֹ, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ סָפֵק שַׁבָּת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: That was also taught One heats water for an ill person on Shabbat, whether to give him to drink or to wash him, And they did not say only current Shabbat but even a different, Shabbat. And one must not say: Let us wait for him perhaps he will get well Rather, one heats it for him immediately because any uncertainty life-threatening overrides Shabbat. And not uncertainty on the current Shabbat, but even uncertainty on a different Shabbat.
llm_translation: It was taught in a baraita: One may heat water for a sick person on Shabbat, whether to give him to drink or to wash him. And they did not say this only for this Shabbat, but for another Shabbat as well. And one does not say, "Let us wait for him, perhaps he will recover," but rather one heats it for him immediately, because the doubt regarding life takes precedence over Shabbat. And it is not a doubt about this Shabbat, but even a doubt about another Shabbat.

hebrew_text: וְאֵין עוֹשִׂין דְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ, לֹא עַל יְדֵי גּוֹיִם, וְלֹא עַל יְדֵי כּוּתִיִּים, אֶלָּא עַל יְדֵי גְּדוֹלֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְאֵין אוֹמְרִין יֵעָשׂוּ דְּבָרִים הַלָּלוּ, לֹא עַל פִּי נָשִׁים, וְלֹא עַל פִּי כּוּתִיִּים, אֲבָל מִצְטָרְפִין לְדַעַת אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: And these acts should not be performed by gentiles or Samaritans but by the greatest of the Jewish people, And one does not say: These actions be performed of women or Samaritans, However, these do combine with an additional opinion,
llm_translation: And they do not do these things, neither through the hands of Gentiles, nor through the hands of Kutim, but through the hands of the great ones of Israel. And one does not say, "Let these things be done," neither by the mouth of women, nor by the mouth of Kutim, but they join with another opinion.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מְפַקְּחִין פִּקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ בְּשַׁבָּת, וְהַזָּרִיז הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת מִבֵּית דִּין. הָא כֵּיצַד? רָאָה תִּינוֹק שֶׁנָּפַל לַיָּם — פּוֹרֵשׂ מְצוּדָה וּמַעֲלֵהוּ, וְהַזָּרִיז הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת מִבֵּית דִּין. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא צָיֵיד כְּווֹרֵי. רָאָה תִּינוֹק שֶׁנָּפַל לְבוֹר — עוֹקֵר חוּלְיָא וּמַעֲלֵהוּ, וְהַזָּרִיז הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת מִבֵּית דִּין. אַף עַל גַּב דִּמְתַקֵּן דַּרְגָּא.
human_translation: The Sages taught One engages saving a life on Shabbat, and one who is vigilant is praiseworthy. And one need not take permission from a court How so? one sees a child who fell into the sea, he spreads net and raises him And one who is vigilant is praiseworthy, and one need not seek permission from a court, although he catches fish one sees a child fall into a pit he digs part of the ground out and raises him out. And one who is vigilant is praiseworthy, and one need not seek permission from a court, although in doing so he fashions a step.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One may perform a life-saving procedure on Shabbat, and one who acts swiftly is praiseworthy, and there is no need to seek permission from the court. How so? If one sees a child who fell into the sea - he spreads a net and pulls him out, and one who acts swiftly is praiseworthy, and there is no need to seek permission from the court. Even though he is trapping fish. If one sees a child who fell into a pit - he removes a ladder and pulls him out, and one who acts swiftly is praiseworthy, and there is no need to seek permission from the court. Even though he is fixing a rung.

hebrew_text: רָאָה שֶׁנִּנְעֲלָה דֶּלֶת בִּפְנֵי תִּינוֹק — שׁוֹבְרָהּ וּמוֹצִיאוֹ, וְהַזָּרִיז הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת מִבֵּית דִּין. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא מִיכַּוֵּין לְמִיתְבַּר בְּשִׁיפֵי. מְכַבִּין וּמַפְסִיקִין מִפְּנֵי הַדְּלֵיקָה בְּשַׁבָּת, וְהַזָּרִיז הֲרֵי זֶה מְשׁוּבָּח, וְאֵין צָרִיךְ לִיטּוֹל רְשׁוּת מִבֵּית דִּין. וְאַף עַל גַּב דְּקָא מְמַכֵּיךְ מַכּוֹכֵי.
human_translation: one sees that a door is locked before a child he breaks the door and takes the child out. And one who is vigilant is praiseworthy, and one need not seek permission from a court, although he intends to break into boards one extinguish a fire placing a barrier in front of on Shabbat And one who is vigilant is praiseworthy, and one need not seek permission from a court, although he leaves the coals,
llm_translation: He saw that a door was locked in front of a child - he may break it and remove it, and one who is diligent, behold, he is praiseworthy, and there is no need to seek permission from the court. And even though he is intending to improve it. They extinguish and interrupt because of the lamp on Shabbat, and one who is diligent, behold, he is praiseworthy, and there is no need to seek permission from the court. And even though he is striking with a hammer.

hebrew_text: וּצְרִיכָא: דְּאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן יָם — מִשּׁוּם דְּאַדְּהָכִי וְהָכִי אָזֵל לֵיהּ, אֲבָל בּוֹר, דְּקָא יָתֵיב — אֵימָא לָא, צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And necessary As, had it taught us the sea, because in the meantime, will be swept away but a pit, who remains say No, necessary
llm_translation: The matter requires: for if we were to hear "sea" - because thus and thus it goes to it, but a pit, where one sits - I might say no, it is necessary.

hebrew_text: וְאִי אַשְׁמְעִינַן בּוֹר — מִשּׁוּם דְּקָא מִיבְּעִית, אֲבָל נִנְעֲלָה דֶּלֶת, אֶפְשָׁר דְּיָתֵיב בְּהַאי גִּיסָא וּמְשַׁבֵּישׁ לֵיהּ בְּאַמְגּוֹזֵי. צְרִיכָא.
human_translation: And if it had taught us the pit, because the child is scared but when a door is locked it is possible to sit on the other side with nuts necessary
llm_translation: And if we hear that there is a pit - because it is causing damage, but if the door is locked, it is possible that he is sitting in that pit and covering it with nuts. This is necessary.

hebrew_text: מְכַבִּין וּמַפְסִיקִין. לְמָה לִי? דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְחָצֵר אַחֶרֶת.
human_translation: one extinguish a fire placing a barrier Why do I this? even toward another courtyard.
llm_translation: They extinguish and they separate. Why do I need this? For even to another courtyard.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יוֹסֵף אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: לֹא הָלְכוּ בְּפִקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ אַחַר הָרוֹב. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי נֵימָא דְּאִיכָּא תִּשְׁעָה יִשְׂרָאֵל וְגוֹי אֶחָד בֵּינַיְיהוּ — רוּבָּא יִשְׂרָאֵל נִינְהוּ, (אֶלָּא) פַּלְגָא וּפַלְגָא, סְפֵק נְפָשׁוֹת לְהָקֵל.
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: saving a life, did not follow the majority What are the circumstances? If we say there are nine Jews and one gentile among them the majority Jews half Jews and half gentiles, lenient uncertainty life-threatening
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said in the name of Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Shmuel: They did not rule in a case of saving a life after the majority. How so? If it is said that there are nine Israelites and one non-Jew among them — the majority are Israelites, rather, half and half, we are uncertain about whose life to prioritize.

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא דְּאִיכָּא תִּשְׁעָה גּוֹיִם וְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֶחָד. הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא — דְּהָוֵה לֵיהּ קָבוּעַ, וְכׇל קָבוּעַ כְּמֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה דָּמֵי!
human_translation: Rather, there are nine gentiles and one Jew. this too obvious. fixed and whenever a fixed it is considered half half
llm_translation: Rather, there are nine non-Jews and one Israelite. This is indeed obvious - for he is considered established, and all that is established is like half and half.

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דִּפְרוּשׁ לְחָצֵר אַחֶרֶת, מַהוּ דְּתֵימָא: כׇּל דְּפָרֵישׁ — מֵרוּבָּא פָּרֵישׁ, קָא מַשְׁמַע לַן דְּלָא הָלְכוּ בְּפִקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ אַחַר הָרוֹב.
human_translation: No, necessary separated to another courtyard, Lest you say: whatever is separated is considered to have left from the majority, it teaches us that with regard to saving a life, one does not follow the majority.
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he explained for another courtyard, what if you say: anyone who explains — he explained from the majority, it implies to us that they did not go by the principle of saving a life after the majority.

hebrew_text: אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי אַסִּי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: תִּשְׁעָה גּוֹיִם וְיִשְׂרָאֵל אֶחָד בְּאוֹתָהּ חָצֵר — מְפַקְּחִין, בְּחָצֵר אַחֶרֶת — אֵין מְפַקְּחִין! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דִּפְרוּשׁ כּוּלְּהוּ, הָא דִּפְרוּשׁ מִקְצָתַיְיהוּ.
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Asi say Rabbi Yoḥanan said: nine gentiles and one Jew in that same courtyard one removes the debris, in another courtyard one does not remove the debris? not difficult; This when they all left That when a minority of them left
llm_translation: I?! And didn't Rabbi Assi say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: If there are nine non-Jews and one Jew in a certain courtyard - they may open carry on Shabbat, but in another courtyard - they may not open carry on Shabbat! It is not difficult: this ruling applies when they all separated from each other, that ruling applies when some of them separated from each other.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל הָכִי? וְהָתְנַן: מָצָא בָהּ תִּינוֹק מוּשְׁלָךְ, אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — גּוֹי, וְאִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — יִשְׂרָאֵל, מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה — יִשְׂרָאֵל. וְאָמַר רַב: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְהַחְיוֹתוֹ, אֲבָל לְיַיחֲסוֹ לֹא.
human_translation: Did Shmuel say this, Didn’t we learn one finds an abandoned child if the majority are gentiles a gentile; and if the majority are Jews Jew; half and half Jew? And Rav said: They taught this, only to sustaining him but not to attributing a lineage to him.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And who said so, Samuel thus? And it was taught: If a child is found in it, a city whose nationality is in doubt, if the majority are Gentiles — the child is considered a Gentile, and if the majority are Israelites — the child is considered an Israelite; if the population is half and half — the child is considered an Israelite. And Rav said: They only taught this law to keep him alive, but not to establish his lineage.

hebrew_text: וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר לְפַקֵּחַ עָלָיו אֶת הַגַּל. כִּי אִיתְּמַר דִּשְׁמוּאֵל — אַרֵישָׁא אִיתְּמַר: אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — גּוֹי, אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: וּלְעִנְיַן פִּקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ אֵינוֹ כֵּן.
human_translation: And Shmuel said: removing debris from on top of him, When of Shmuel was stated, it was stated with regard to the first If the majority are gentiles, he is a gentile. Shmuel said: But with regard to the matter of saving a life it is not so.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And Samuel said to Pakeach, "Roll the stone off him, for it was said that Samuel said - initially it was said: if the majority are non-Jews, he is considered a non-Jew." Samuel said: "But regarding the matter of saving a life, it is not so."

hebrew_text: אִם רוֹב גּוֹיִם — גּוֹי, לְמַאי הִילְכְתָא? אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: לְהַאֲכִילוֹ נְבֵלוֹת. אִם רוֹב יִשְׂרָאֵל — יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְמַאי הִילְכְתָא? לְהַחְזִיר לוֹ אֲבֵידָתוֹ.
human_translation: if a majority of gentiles a gentile. To what halakha Rav Pappa said: to feeding him non-kosher If a majority of Jews, he is a Jew. To what halakha to returning a lost object to him.
llm_translation: If the majority of the nations are non-Jews - a non-Jew, for what purpose? Rav Papa said: to feed him carrion. If the majority are Israelites - an Israelite, for what purpose? To return his lost object to him.

hebrew_text: מֶחֱצָה עַל מֶחֱצָה — יִשְׂרָאֵל, לְמַאי הִילְכְתָא? אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: לִנְזָקִין. הֵיכִי דָּמֵי? אִי נֵימָא דְּנַגְחֵיהּ תּוֹרָא דִּידַן לְתוֹרָא דִּידֵיהּ — נַיְיתֵי רְאָיָה וְנִשְׁקוֹל!
human_translation: half and half a Jew. To what halakha Reish Lakish said: to damages. What are the circumstances? If we say that our ox, gored his ox, Let him bring proof and take
llm_translation: Half on half - Israel, for what purpose? Reish Lakish said: for damages. How so? If it is said that our ox gores his ox - bring proof and payment!

hebrew_text: לָא צְרִיכָא, דְּנַגְחֵיהּ תּוֹרָא דִּידֵיהּ לְתוֹרָא דִּידַן, פַּלְגָא — יָהֵיב לֵיהּ, אִידַּךְ פַּלְגָא — נֵימָא לֵיהּ: אַיְיתִי רְאָיָה דְּלָאו יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲנָא וּשְׁקוֹל.
human_translation: No, necessary when his ox, gored our ox, he gives him half, the other half, Let me say to Bring proof that I am not a Jew and take
llm_translation: Not necessary, for he pushes his ox against our ox, half - he gives it to him, the other half - he says to him: "I am a non-Jew and take it."

hebrew_text: מִי שֶׁנָּפְלָה עָלָיו מַפּוֹלֶת וְכוּ׳. מַאי קָאָמַר?
human_translation: one upon whom a rockslide fell, What is saying?
llm_translation: One who was struck by leprosy, etc. What is it saying?

hebrew_text: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא קָאָמַר: לָא מִיבַּעְיָא סָפֵק הוּא שָׁם סָפֵק אֵינוֹ שָׁם, דְּאִי אִיתֵיהּ חַי — הוּא דִּמְפַקְּחִין, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ סָפֵק חַי סָפֵק מֵת — מְפַקְּחִין. וְלָא מִיבַּעְיָא סָפֵק חַי סָפֵק מֵת, דְּיִשְׂרָאֵל, אֶלָּא אֲפִילּוּ סָפֵק גּוֹי סָפֵק יִשְׂרָאֵל — מְפַקְּחִין.
human_translation: It is speaking Needless to say, Needless to say, uncertain he is there or not there, if he is alive, one clear But even uncertain alive or dead, one clear And needless to say, uncertainty alive or dead, a Jew, Rather, clear even if uncertainty he is a gentile or a Jew.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Lo mivaya ka'amar: lo mivaya safeik hu sham safeik einu sham, de'ei itei chay — hu dimfakchin, ela afilu safeik chay safeik met — mifakchin. Ve'lo mivaya safeik chay safeik met, de'Yisrael, ela afilu safeik goy safeik Yisrael — mifakchin." English translation: "He does not come to ask: it is not a case of doubt there is doubt not there, for if there is a live one — it is evident, but even if there is a doubt whether it is alive or dead — it is evident. And he does not come to ask a doubt whether it is alive or dead, for regarding Israel, but even if there is a doubt whether it is a gentile or an Israelite — it is evident."

hebrew_text: מְצָאוּהוּ חַי — מְפַקְּחִין. מְצָאוּהוּ חַי, פְּשִׁיטָא! לָא צְרִיכָא, דַּאֲפִילּוּ לְחַיֵּי שָׁעָה.
human_translation: they found him alive, they remove If they find him alive, obvious No, necessary even live a short while
llm_translation: Found him alive - we open. Found him alive, it is obvious! Not necessary, for even for a moment of life.

hebrew_text: וְאִם מֵת יַנִּיחוּהוּ. הָא נָמֵי פְּשִׁיטָא? לָא צְרִיכָא, לְרַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן לָקִישׁ. דְּתַנְיָא: אֵין מַצִּילִין אֶת הַמֵּת מִפְּנֵי הַדְּלֵיקָה, אָמַר רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן לָקִישׁ: שָׁמַעְתִּי שֶׁמַּצִּילִין אֶת הַמֵּת מִפְּנֵי הַדְּלֵיקָה. וַאֲפִילּוּ רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן לָקִישׁ לָא קָאָמַר אֶלָּא מִתּוֹךְ שֶׁאָדָם בָּהוּל עַל מֵתוֹ, אִי לָא שָׁרֵית לֵיהּ — אָתֵי לְכַבּוֹיֵי. אֲבָל הָכָא, אִי לָא שָׁרֵית לֵיהּ — מַאי אִית לֵיהּ לְמֶעְבַּד?
human_translation: If dead, they leave him. this also obvious? No, necessary according to Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish, as it was taught One not save a corpse from a fire, Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish said: I heard that one save a corpse from a fire. Even Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish said this only because a person is agitated over his dead If you do not permit him he come to extinguish However, here, if you do not permit him what might he do?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And if he dies, they leave him. Is this not obvious? It is necessary, according to Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish. As it was taught: One does not rescue a dead body from a fire. Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish said: I heard that one does rescue a dead body from a fire. And even Rabbi Yehuda ben Lakish did not say this, except that when a person is in distress over his deceased, if you do not allow him to rescue the body, he will come to extinguish the fire. But here, if you do not allow him to rescue the body, what can he do with it?

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עַד הֵיכָן הוּא בּוֹדֵק? עַד חוֹטְמוֹ. וְיֵשׁ אוֹמְרִים: עַד לִבּוֹ. בָּדַק וּמָצָא עֶלְיוֹנִים מֵתִים, לֹא יֹאמַר: כְּבָר מֵתוּ הַתַּחְתּוֹנִים. מַעֲשֶׂה הָיָה וּמָצְאוּ עֶלְיוֹנִים מֵתִים וְתַחְתּוֹנִים חַיִּים.
human_translation: The Rabbis taught: until what point does one check until nose. And some say: until heart one checked and found the upper ones dead, he should not say: The lower ones are already dead, There was an incident where they found the upper ones dead and the lower ones alive.
llm_translation: The sages taught: Until where does one inspect? Until his navel. And some say: Until his heart. If one inspected and found the upper ones dead, he should not say: The lower ones have already died. There was an incident where they found the upper ones dead and the lower ones alive.

hebrew_text: נֵימָא הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי כִּי הָנֵי תַּנָּאֵי. דְּתַנְיָא: מֵהֵיכָן הַוָּלָד נוֹצָר — מֵרֹאשׁוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״מִמְּעֵי אִמִּי אַתָּה גוֹזִי״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״גׇּזִּי נִזְרֵךְ וְהַשְׁלִיכִי״. אַבָּא שָׁאוּל אוֹמֵר: מִטִּיבּוּרוֹ, וּמְשַׁלֵּחַ שׇׁרָשָׁיו אֵילָךְ וְאֵילָךְ.
human_translation: Let us say that these tanna’im is like these tanna’im As it was taught From what point is the fetus created? from its head, as it is stated: “You are He Who took me [ gozi ] out of my mother’s womb” and it says: “Cut off [ gozi ] your hair, and cast it away” Abba Shaul says: from his navel, and he sends his roots in every direction
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Neima, these scholars, like these scholars. For it was taught: From where is the embryo formed? From its head, as it is said, 'From my mother's womb You are my God,' and it also says, 'Cut off your hair and throw it away.' Abba Saul says: From his navel, and sends his roots this way and that way."

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא אַבָּא שָׁאוּל, עַד כָּאן לָא קָא אָמַר אַבָּא שָׁאוּל הָתָם אֶלָּא לְעִנְיַן יְצִירָה, דְּכֹל מִידֵּי מִמְּצִיעֲתֵיהּ מִיתְּצַר, אֲבָל לְעִנְיַן פִּקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ — אֲפִילּוּ אַבָּא שָׁאוּל מוֹדֵי דְּעִיקַּר חַיּוּתָא בְּאַפֵּיהּ הוּא, דִּכְתִיב: ״כׇּל אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁמַת רוּחַ חַיִּים בְּאַפָּיו״.
human_translation: Even you say Abba Shaul, Until now, Abba Shaul spoke there only about formation, that everything is created from its middle; however, as for saving a life, even Abba Shaul admits that the main life is in the nose, as it is written: “All in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Even if you say Abba Saul, until here not said Abba Saul there except for the matter of formation, for everything from its formation is formed, but for the matter of saving a life — even Abba Saul agrees that the main essence of life is in its nostrils, as it is written: "All in whose nostrils was the breath of life." English translation:

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב פָּפָּא: מַחְלוֹקֶת מִמַּטָּה לְמַעְלָה, אֲבָל מִמַּעְלָה לְמַטָּה, כֵּיוָן דִּבְדַק לֵיהּ עַד חוֹטְמוֹ — שׁוּב אֵינוֹ צָרִיךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״כֹּל אֲשֶׁר נִשְׁמַת רוּחַ חַיִּים בְּאַפָּיו״.
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: The dispute from below, to above. But from above to below, once he checked as far as nose he is not required as it is written: “All in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life”
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: A dispute from below to above, but from above to below, once he examined it up to his nostrils - he no longer needs it, as it is written: "All that had the breath of the spirit of life in its nostrils."

hebrew_text: וּכְבָר הָיָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְרַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מְהַלְּכִין בַּדֶּרֶךְ, וְלֵוִי הַסַּדָּר וְרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל בְּנוֹ שֶׁל רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה מְהַלְּכִין אַחֲרֵיהֶן. נִשְׁאֲלָה שְׁאֵלָה זוֹ בִּפְנֵיהֶם: מִנַּיִין לְפִקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת?
human_translation: It once happened that Rabbi Yishmael, and Rabbi Akiva, and Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya walking on the road, and Levi HaSadar and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya, walking behind them, This question was asked before them: From where that saving a life overrides Shabbat?
llm_translation: And already was Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah walking on the road, and Levi the scribe and Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah were walking after them. This question was asked before them: From where for the saving of a life that overrides the Sabbath?

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל וְאָמַר: ״אִם בַּמַּחְתֶּרֶת יִמָּצֵא הַגַּנָּב״ — וּמָה זֶה, שֶׁסָּפֵק עַל מָמוֹן בָּא סָפֵק עַל נְפָשׁוֹת בָּא, וּשְׁפִיכוּת דָּמִים מְטַמֵּא אֶת הָאָרֶץ, וְגוֹרֵם לַשְּׁכִינָה שֶׁתִּסְתַּלֵּק מִיִּשְׂרָאֵל, נִיתָּן לְהַצִּילוֹ בְּנַפְשׁוֹ — קַל וָחוֹמֶר לְפִקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael answered and said “If a thief be found breaking in Now, if this where there is uncertainty whether he comes money lives, bloodshed renders the land impure, and it causes the Divine Presence to depart from the Jewish people, is permitted to save himself at the cost of life, a fortiori saving a life overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael answered and said: "If the thief is found in the tunnel" — And what is this? That if there is doubt regarding money, he comes; if there is doubt regarding lives, he comes; and bloodshed defiles the land, and causes the Divine Presence to depart from Israel, it is permitted to save him with his life — a fortiori to save a life, which overrides the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: נַעֲנָה רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא וְאָמַר: ״וְכִי יָזִיד אִישׁ עַל רֵעֵהוּ וְגוֹ׳ מֵעִם מִזְבְּחִי תִּקָּחֶנּוּ לָמוּת״. ״מֵעִם מִזְבְּחִי״ — וְלֹא מֵעַל מִזְבְּחִי. וְאָמַר רַבָּה בַּר בַּר חָנָה אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא לְהָמִית,
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva answered and said “And if a man comes purposefully upon his neighbor you shall take him from My altar, that he may die” from My altar” But not from on top of My altar. And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught only in order to execute
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva answered and said: "And if a man intentionally kills his neighbor, etc., 'from My altar you shall take him to die.'" 'From My altar' - and not from above My altar. And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said that Rabbi Yoḥanan said: They taught this only to kill him.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל לְהַחֲיוֹת — אֲפִילּוּ מֵעַל מִזְבְּחִי. וּמָה זֶה, שֶׁסָּפֵק יֵשׁ מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו סָפֵק אֵין מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו, וַעֲבוֹדָה דּוֹחָה שַׁבָּת — קַל וָחוֹמֶר לְפִקּוּחַ נֶפֶשׁ שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת. נַעֲנָה רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר וְאָמַר: וּמָה מִילָה שֶׁהִיא אֶחָד מִמָּאתַיִם וְאַרְבָּעִים וּשְׁמוֹנָה אֵיבָרִים שֶׁבָּאָדָם דּוֹחָה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת — קַל וָחוֹמֶר לְכׇל גּוּפוֹ שֶׁדּוֹחֶה אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת.
human_translation: but to preserve a life, even from on top of My altar, Just as this there is uncertainty whether there is substance to his words or whether there is no substance to his words, and service overrides Shabbat, a fortiori , saving a life overrides Shabbat. Rabbi Elazar answered and said: Just as of circumcision, which one of the 248 limbs of the body, overrides Shabbat, a fortiori , one’s whole body, overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But to save - even from upon my altars. And what is this? That there is a doubt whether there is substance in his words or there is no substance in his words, and the service overrides the Sabbath - a fortiori for saving a life that overrides the Sabbath. Rabbi Elazar answered and said: And what is circumcision, which is one of the two hundred and forty-eight limbs of a person, that it overrides the Sabbath - a fortiori for the entire body that overrides the Sabbath. English translation:

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בְּרַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: ״אֶת שַׁבְּתוֹתַי תִּשְׁמוֹרוּ״, יָכוֹל לַכֹּל — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אַךְ״ חָלַק. רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן בֶּן יוֹסֵף אוֹמֵר: ״כִּי קוֹדֶשׁ הִיא לָכֶם״, הִיא מְסוּרָה בְּיֶדְכֶם וְלֹא אַתֶּם מְסוּרִים בְּיָדָהּ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says it keep my Shabbatot ” might to everyone the verse states “but,” qualifies. Rabbi Yonatan ben Yosef says it “For it is sacred to you” is given into your hands, and you are not given to it
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda says: "You shall observe My Sabbaths," could have been said to everyone - the Torah teaches: "However" is divided. Rabbi Yonatan son of Yosef says: "For it is holy to you," it is entrusted in your hands and not you entrusted in its hands.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בֶּן מְנַסְיָא אוֹמֵר: ״וְשָׁמְרוּ בְנֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת הַשַּׁבָּת״, אָמְרָה תּוֹרָה: חַלֵּל עָלָיו שַׁבָּת אַחַת כְּדֵי שֶׁיִּשְׁמוֹר שַׁבָּתוֹת הַרְבֵּה. אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה אָמַר שְׁמוּאֵל: אִי הֲוַאי הָתָם, הֲוָה אָמֵינָא דִּידִי עֲדִיפָא מִדִּידְהוּ: ״וְחַי בָּהֶם״ — וְלֹא שֶׁיָּמוּת בָּהֶם.
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya said: “And the children of Israel shall keep Shabbat,  The Torah said: Desecrate one Shabbat on his behalf so he will observe many Shabbatot . Rav Yehuda said Shmuel said: If I would there I would have said my proof is preferable to theirs, and live by them” and not that he die by them.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Menasya says: "And the children of Israel shall keep the Sabbath." The Torah said: Desecrate one Sabbath upon him so that many Sabbaths will be observed. Rav Yehuda said in the name of Shmuel: If it were there, I would say that my opinion is preferable to theirs: "And you shall live by them" — and not die by them.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבָא: לְכוּלְּהוּ אִית לְהוּ פִּירְכָא, בַּר מִדִּשְׁמוּאֵל דְּלֵית לֵיהּ פִּירְכָא. דְּרַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל — דִּילְמָא כִּדְרָבָא. דְּאָמַר רָבָא: מַאי טַעְמָא דְּמַחְתֶּרֶת? חֲזָקָה, אֵין אָדָם מַעֲמִיד עַצְמוֹ עַל מָמוֹנוֹ. וְהַאי מִידָּע יָדַע דְּקָאֵי לְאַפֵּיהּ, וְאָמַר אִי קָאֵי לְאַפַּאי — קָטֵילְנָא לֵיהּ, וְהַתּוֹרָה אָמְרָה: בָּא לְהׇרְגְּךָ — הַשְׁכֵּם לְהׇרְגוֹ. וְאַשְׁכְּחַן וַדַּאי, סָפֵק מְנָלַן?
human_translation: Rava All of these have refutations except for of Shmuel, which has no refutation. by Rabbi Yishmael perhaps of Rava, Rava said: What is the reason about breaks in? a presumption a person does not restrain himself with respect to his money. And this knows that will rise to oppose him said If he rises against me, I will kill him. And the Torah states: comes to kill you, rise to kill him first. We found certain from where do we uncertainty
llm_translation: Rava said: For all of them there is a way out, except for the son of Shmuel who has no way out. Because of Rabbi Yishmael - perhaps like Rava. For Rava said: What is the reason for a search warrant? It is a presumption, that a person does not establish himself on his wealth. And this knowledgeable one knows that he is standing in his own way, and he said if he is standing in his own way - we will kill him, and the Torah said: If someone comes to kill you, rise early to kill him. And we found it, is it a doubt from where we derive it?

hebrew_text: דְּרַבִּי עֲקִיבָא נָמֵי — דִּילְמָא כִּדְאַבָּיֵי. דְּאָמַר אַבָּיֵי: מָסְרִינַן לֵיהּ זוּגָא דְרַבָּנַן לֵידַע אִם מַמָּשׁ בִּדְבָרָיו. וְאַשְׁכְּחַן וַדַּאי, סָפֵק מְנָא לַן?
human_translation: of Rabbi Akiva also perhaps in accordance with of Abaye, as Abaye said: we send a pair of rabbis his to determine if his words substance. we found certain from where do we uncertain?
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, also known as Dilkimah, perhaps as Abaye said: We deliver to him a pair of sages to know if he is really serious in his words. And we find, for sure, is this a sufficient doubt for us?

hebrew_text: וְכוּלְּהוּ אַשְׁכְּחַן וַדַּאי, סָפֵק מְנָא לַן? וְדִשְׁמוּאֵל, וַדַּאי לֵית לֵיהּ פִּירְכָא. אָמַר רָבִינָא וְאִיתֵּימָא רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: טָבָא חֲדָא פִּלְפַּלְתָּא חֲרִיפָא מִמְּלָא צַנָּא דְקָרֵי.
human_translation: And for all we found certain from where do we that Shmuel there is certainly no refutation. Ravina said, and some say it was Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak One spicy pepper is better than a whole basket of squash,
llm_translation: And all of them we find, and certainly, a doubt from where do we derive it? And Shmuel, certainly he does not have a resolution. Ravina said, and it was stated by Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak: A certain spice is sharper than a full basket of carobs.

hebrew_text: מַתְנִי׳ חַטָּאת וְאָשָׁם וַדַּאי — מְכַפְּרִין. מִיתָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — מְכַפְּרִין עִם הַתְּשׁוּבָה. תְּשׁוּבָה — מְכַפֶּרֶת עַל עֲבֵירוֹת קַלּוֹת: עַל עֲשֵׂה, וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. וְעַל הַחֲמוּרוֹת הוּא תּוֹלֶה, עַד שֶׁיָּבֹא יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וִיכַפֵּר. הָאוֹמֵר: אֶחֱטָא וְאָשׁוּב, אֶחֱטָא וְאָשׁוּב — אֵין מַסְפִּיקִין בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּשׁוּבָה. אֶחֱטָא וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר — אֵין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר. עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַמָּקוֹם — יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ — אֵין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, עַד שֶׁיְּרַצֶּה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ.
human_translation: A sin-offering, a definite guilt-offering, atone Death and Yom Kippur atone by repentance. Repentance atones for minor transgressions, for positive and negative And for severe in abeyance until Yom Kippur comes and atones one who says: I will sin and I will repent, I will sin and I will repent, does not provide him the opportunity to repent, I will sin and Yom Kippur atone Yom Kippur does not atone transgressions between a person and God, Yom Kippur atones; transgressions between a person and another, Yom Kippur does not atone until he appeases other
llm_translation: It was taught: A sin-offering and a guilt-offering — definitely atone. Death and Yom Kippur — atone with repentance. Repentance — atones for light transgressions: for positive commandments, and for negative commandments. But for severe transgressions, one is suspended until Yom Kippur arrives and atones. One who says, "I will sin and repent, I will sin and repent" — does not have the ability to repent. If one sins and Yom Kippur arrives, it atones — but Yom Kippur itself does not atone. Transgressions between a person and the Almighty — Yom Kippur atones, transgressions between a person and their fellow — Yom Kippur does not atone, until one appeases their fellow.

hebrew_text: דָּרַשׁ רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה: ״מִכֹּל חַטֹּאתֵיכֶם לִפְנֵי ה׳ תִּטְהָרוּ״. עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַמָּקוֹם — יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר. עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ — אֵין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר עַד שֶׁיְּרַצֶּה אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ. אָמַר רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא: אַשְׁרֵיכֶם יִשְׂרָאֵל! לִפְנֵי מִי אַתֶּם מִטַּהֲרִין, מִי מְטַהֵר אֶתְכֶם? אֲבִיכֶם שֶׁבַּשָּׁמַיִם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְזָרַקְתִּי עֲלֵיכֶם מַיִם טְהוֹרִים וּטְהַרְתֶּם״, וְאוֹמֵר: ״מִקְוֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל (ה׳)״, מָה מִקְוֶה מְטַהֵר אֶת הַטְּמֵאִים — אַף הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מְטַהֵר אֶת יִשְׂרָאֵל.
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya taught “From all your sins you shall be cleansed before the Lord” transgressions between a person and God, Yom Kippur atones; transgressions between a person and another, Yom Kippur does not atone until he appeases other Rabbi Akiva said: How fortunate are you, Israel; before Whom are you purified, and Who purifies you? your Father in Heaven, as it is stated: “And I will sprinkle purifying water upon you, and you shall be purified” And it says: “The ritual bath of Israel is God” Just as a ritual bath purifies the impure, so too, the Holy One, Blessed be He, purifies Israel.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah expounded: "From all your sins before the Lord you shall be purified." Sins between a person and the Omnipresent - Yom Kippur atones. Sins between a person and their fellow - Yom Kippur does not atone until one appeases their fellow. Rabbi Akiva said: "Fortunate are you, Israel! Before whom do you purify yourselves, who purifies you? Your Father in Heaven, as it is said: 'And I will sprinkle clean water upon you, and you shall be clean,' and it says: 'The hope of Israel, the Lord,' just as a mikveh purifies the impure, so too the Holy One, blessed be He, purifies Israel."

hebrew_text: גְּמָ׳ אָשָׁם וַדַּאי — אִין, אָשָׁם תָּלוּי — לָא. וְהָא כַּפָּרָה כְּתִיבָא בֵּיהּ? הָנָךְ מְכַפְּרִי כַּפָּרָה גְּמוּרָה, אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אֵינוֹ מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָה גְּמוּרָה.
human_translation: a definite guilt-offering, yes, an uncertain guilt-offering not. But isn’t atonement written with regard to it? Those, facilitate complete atonement, an uncertain guilt-offering does not facilitate complete atonement.
llm_translation: Guemara: An Asham that is definite - no, an Asham that is dependent - no. But isn't atonement written in it? That is for complete atonement, whereas a dependent Asham does not achieve complete atonement.

hebrew_text: אִי נָמֵי: הָנָךְ אֵין אַחֵר מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָתָן, אָשָׁם תָּלוּי אַחֵר מְכַפֵּר כַּפָּרָתָן, דִּתְנַן: חַיָּיבֵי חַטָּאוֹת וַאֲשָׁמוֹת וַדָּאִין שֶׁעָבַר עֲלֵיהֶן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — חַיָּיבִין, אֲשָׁמוֹת תְּלוּיִן — פְּטוּרִין.
human_translation: Alternatively, Nothing else facilitates the atonement of those else does facilitate the atonement of the uncertain guilt-offering, as we learned Yom Kippur passed, those who are obligated to bring sin-offerings and definite guilt-offerings are obligated uncertain guilt-offerings are exempt
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Iy nama: hanach ein acher mekhafer kapparatan, asham talui acher mekhafer kapparatan, ditnan: hayyavei chatatot va'ashamot va'da'in she'avar aleihen yom hakippurim — hayyavin, ashamot teluyin — peturin." English translation: "If so: there is no other atonement that atones for their atonement, a guilt offering dependent on another atones for their atonement, as we learned: those liable for sin offerings and guilt offerings, and it is certain that Yom Kippur has passed over them — they are liable, guilt offerings dependent — they are exempt."

hebrew_text: מִיתָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפְּרִין עִם הַתְּשׁוּבָה. עִם הַתְּשׁוּבָה — אִין, בִּפְנֵי עַצְמָן — לָא. נֵימָא דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עַל כׇּל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, בֵּין עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה בֵּין לֹא עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה — יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, חוּץ (מִפּוֹרֵק עוֹל), וּמְגַלֶּה פָּנִים בַּתּוֹרָה, וּמֵיפֵר בְּרִית בָּשָׂר, שֶׁאִם עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה — יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר, וְאִם לֹא עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה — אֵין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר.
human_translation: death and Yom Kippur atone by repentance. With repentance, yes, but by themselves, they do not. Let us say not in accordance with Rabbi as it was taught Rabbi says for all transgressions in the Torah, whether one repented or did not repent, Yom Kippur atones, exception rejecting the yoke and interpreting the Torah falsely; and violating the covenant of the flesh, if one repents Yom Kippur atones and if one does not repent Yom Kippur does not atone
llm_translation: Death and Yom Kippur atone with repentance. With repentance - yes, by themselves - no. Say it is not like Rabbi. For it was taught, Rabbi says: For all transgressions in the Torah, whether one did repent or did not repent - Yom Kippur atones, except for one who separates himself from the community, and one who publicly flouts the Torah, and one who violates the covenant of circumcision, for if he did repent - Yom Kippur atones, but if he did not repent - Yom Kippur does not atone.

hebrew_text: אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי: תְּשׁוּבָה בָּעֲיָא יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לָא בָּעֲיָא תְּשׁוּבָה.
human_translation: even you say Rabbi Repentance requires Yom Kippur Yom Kippur does not require repentance
llm_translation: Even if you say Rabbi: Repentance is required on Yom Kippur, Yom Kippur does not require repentance.

hebrew_text: תְּשׁוּבָה מְכַפֶּרֶת עַל עֲבֵירוֹת קַלּוֹת: עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה. הַשְׁתָּא עַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה מְכַפֶּרֶת, עַל עֲשֵׂה מִיבַּעְיָא? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, הָכִי קָאָמַר: עַל עֲשֵׂה, וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁנִּיתַּק לַעֲשֵׂה.
human_translation: Repentance atones for minor transgressions, for a positive and for a negative Now atones for a negative necessary for a positive Rav Yehuda said: This is it said, for a positive and for a negative can be rectified by a positive
llm_translation: Repentance atones for light transgressions: for positive commandments and for negative commandments. Now, for negative commandments it atones, but for positive commandments, is it necessary? Rav Yehudah said, thus he said: It atones for positive commandments, and for negative commandments that were detached from the positive commandment.

hebrew_text: וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גָּמוּר לָא? וּרְמִינְהוּ, אֵלּוּ הֵן קַלּוֹת: עֲשֵׂה וְלֹא תַעֲשֶׂה,
human_translation: But not for a full-fledged negative raises a contradiction these are minor A positive and a negative
llm_translation: And on "do not do" is it not complete? And raise a contradiction: These are light prohibitions: Do and do not do.

hebrew_text: חוּץ מִ״לֹּא תִשָּׂא״! ״לֹא תִשָּׂא״ וְכֹל דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: except for: “You shall not take “You shall not take and any similar to it,
llm_translation: Outside of "Do not bear"! "Do not bear" and all of its blood.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע, רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: כֹּל שֶׁהוּא מִ״לֹּא תִשָּׂא״ וּלְמַטָּה — תְּשׁוּבָה מְכַפֶּרֶת, מִ״לֹּא תִשָּׂא״ וּלְמַעְלָה — תְּשׁוּבָה תּוֹלָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר. ״לֹא תִשָּׂא״ וְכׇל דְּדָמֵי לֵיהּ.
human_translation: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says: any from “You shall not take and below, repentance atones. from “You shall not take and above, repentance suspends and Yom Kippur atones. “You shall not take and anything similar to it.
llm_translation: Come and hear, Rabbi Yehuda says: Anything that is from "below" and downwards - repentance atones for it. Anything that is from "above" and upwards - repentance suspends it, and Yom Kippur atones for it. "Below" and all its blood.

hebrew_text: תָּא שְׁמַע: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּחוֹרֵב תְּשׁוּבָה ״וְנַקֵּה״, יָכוֹל אַף ״לֹא תִשָּׂא״ עִמָּהֶן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״לֹא יְנַקֶּה״. יָכוֹל אַף שְׁאָר חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין כֵּן — תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶת שְׁמוֹ״, שְׁמוֹ הוּא דְּאֵינוֹ מְנַקֶּה, אֲבָל מְנַקֶּה שְׁאָר חַיָּיבֵי לָאוִין.
human_translation: Come hear Since it was stated at Horeb repentance: “Absolve,” might even “You shall not take among them; the verses states: “Will not absolve” might also for those who are liable all other prohibitions; the verse states: “His name.” does not absolve the one His name, but He absolves those who are liable all other prohibitions
llm_translation: Come and hear: Since it is stated regarding the sin of the Golden Calf, "In Horeb you shall return, 'and be cleansed,'" one might think that one should also not bear the sin with them - the teaching states: "He shall not be cleansed." One might think that the same applies to other transgressors of prohibitions - the teaching states: "His name," his name is such that he is not cleansed, but he does cleanse other transgressors of prohibitions.

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: עַל מָה תְּשׁוּבָה מְכַפֶּרֶת — עַל עֲשֵׂה וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁנִּיתַּק לַעֲשֵׂה, וְעַל מָה תְּשׁוּבָה תּוֹלָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר — עַל כָּרֵיתוֹת וְעַל מִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין, וְעַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה גָּמוּר.
human_translation: This is tanna’im , as it was taught For what does repentance atone? for a positive and for a negative through a positive mitzva. And for what does repentance suspend and Yom Kippur atone? for karet , and for death court, and for full-fledged negative
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: For what does repentance atone? — For positive commandments and for negative commandments that were uprooted to become positive, and for what does repentance depend and Yom Kippur atone? — For excisions and for death penalties imposed by the court, and for complete negative commandments.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר: לְפִי שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר בְּחוֹרֵב ״וְנַקֵּה״. מְנָא לַן? דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר אוֹמֵר: אִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר ״נַקֵּה״, שֶׁכְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״לֹא יְנַקֶּה״, וְאִי אֶפְשָׁר לוֹמַר ״לֹא יְנַקֶּה״, שֶׁכְּבָר נֶאֱמַר ״נַקֵּה״. הָא כֵּיצַד? מְנַקֶּה הוּא לְשָׁבִין, וְאֵינוֹ מְנַקֶּה לְשֶׁאֵינָן שָׁבִין.
human_translation: The Master said: Since it was stated at Horeb “Absolve.” From where do we As it was taught Rabbi Elazar says: It is not possible to say “absolve” “will not absolve” is already stated And it is not possible to say “will not absolve,” “absolve” is already stated. How so? absolves those who repent and does not absolve those who do not repent.
llm_translation: Master said: Since it is stated at Horeb "and he will acquit." How do we know? As it was taught, Rabbi Elazar says: It is impossible to say "acquit" because it already says "he shall not be acquitted," and it is impossible to say "he shall not be acquitted" because it already says "acquit." How so? He acquits the worthy and does not acquit the unworthy.

hebrew_text: שָׁאַל רַבִּי מַתְיָא בֶּן חָרָשׁ אֶת רַבִּי אֶלְעָזָר בֶּן עֲזַרְיָה בְּרוֹמִי: שָׁמַעְתָּ אַרְבָּעָה חִלּוּקֵי כַפָּרָה שֶׁהָיָה רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל דּוֹרֵשׁ? אָמַר: שְׁלֹשָׁה הֵן, וּתְשׁוּבָה עִם כׇּל אֶחָד וְאֶחָד.
human_translation: Rabbi Matya ben Ḥarash asked Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya in Rome: Have you heard four distinctions of atonement that Rabbi Yishmael would derive? He said to him: They are three and repentance with each one.
llm_translation: Rabbi Matya ben Charash asked Rabbi Elazar ben Azariah in Rome: Have you heard the four interpretations of the red heifer that Rabbi Yishmael expounded? He said: There are three, and repentance accompanies each and every one.

hebrew_text: עָבַר עַל עֲשֵׂה וְשָׁב — אֵינוֹ זָז מִשָּׁם עַד שֶׁמּוֹחֲלִין לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים״. עָבַר עַל לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה וְעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה — תְּשׁוּבָה תּוֹלָה, וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי בַיּוֹם הַזֶּה יְכַפֵּר עֲלֵיכֶם מִכֹּל חַטֹּאתֵיכֶם״. עָבַר עַל כָּרֵיתוֹת וּמִיתוֹת בֵּית דִּין וְעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה — תְּשׁוּבָה וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים תּוֹלִין, וְיִסּוּרִין מְמָרְקִין. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּפָקַדְתִּי בְשֵׁבֶט פִּשְׁעָם וּבִנְגָעִים עֲוֹנָם״.
human_translation: one violates a positive and repents, he is forgiven even before he moves as it is stated: “Return, you backsliding children, one violates a prohibition and repents, repentance suspends and Yom Kippur atones as it is stated: “For on this day shall atonement be made for you, from all your sins” one commits karet or death court and repents, repentance and Yom Kippur suspend and suffering absolves as it is stated: “Then will I visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with strokes”
llm_translation: He transgressed a positive commandment and repented - he does not move from there until they forgive him, as it is stated: "Return, O backsliding children." He transgressed a negative commandment and repented - repentance suspends punishment, and Yom Kippur atones, as it is stated: "For on this day He shall atone for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins." He transgressed laws punishable by excision and death penalties by the court and repented - repentance and Yom Kippur suspend punishment, and afflictions cleanse, as it is stated: "And I will visit their transgression with the rod, and their iniquity with stripes."

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִי שֶׁיֵּשׁ חִילּוּל הַשֵּׁם בְּיָדוֹ — אֵין לוֹ כֹּחַ בִּתְשׁוּבָה לִתְלוֹת וְלֹא בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים לְכַפֵּר וְלֹא בְּיִסּוּרִין לְמָרֵק, אֶלָּא כּוּלָּן תּוֹלִין, וּמִיתָה מְמָרֶקֶת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְנִגְלָה בְאׇזְנָי ה׳ צְבָאוֹת אִם יְכוּפַּר הֶעָוֹן הַזֶּה לָכֶם עַד תְּמוּתוּן״.
human_translation: But one who has desecration of name, his repentance has no power to suspend nor does Yom Kippur to atone nor does suffering to absolve Rather, all these suspend and death absolves as it is stated: “And the Lord of Hosts revealed Himself to my ears: This iniquity shall not be atoned for until you die”
llm_translation: But one who has desecrated the Name in his possession - he has no strength to repent, neither on Yom Kippur to atone, nor through suffering to cleanse, rather all of them depend, and death cleanses, as it is said: "And it shall be revealed in the ears of the Lord of hosts, if this iniquity shall be atoned for you until you die."

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי חִילּוּל הַשֵּׁם? אָמַר רַב: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא, אִי שָׁקֵילְנָא בִּישְׂרָא מִטַּבָּחָא וְלָא יָהֵיבְנָא דְּמֵי לְאַלְתַּר. אָמַר אַבָּיֵי: לֹא שָׁנוּ אֶלָּא בְּאַתְרָא דְּלָא תָּבְעִי, אֲבָל בְּאַתְרָא דְּתָבְעִי — לֵית לַן בַּהּ.
human_translation: What are the circumstances desecration of name? Rav said: For example, me, if I take meat from a butcher and do not give him money immediately, Abaye said: They taught this only in a place where they do not ask But in a place where they ask we have no with
llm_translation: Talmudic text: How are the laws of desecrating the Name of God similar? Rav said: For example, if I take meat from the butcher and do not pay immediately. Abaye said: They only taught this in a case where you do not need the meat immediately, but in a case where you need it immediately - we have no issue with it.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רָבִינָא: וּמָתָא מַחְסֵיָא אַתְרָא דְּתָבְעִי הוּא. אַבָּיֵי כִּדְשָׁקֵיל בִּישְׂרָא מִתְּרֵי שׁוּתָּפֵי, יָהֵיב זוּזָא לְהַאי וְזוּזָא לְהַאי, וַהֲדַר מְקָרֵב לְהוּ גַּבֵּי הֲדָדֵי וְעָבֵיד חוּשְׁבָּנָא.
human_translation: Ravina said: city Meḥasya is a place where they ask when Abaye bought meat from two partners, he would give the money to this one and the money to this one, And afterward he would bring them together and perform the calculation
llm_translation: Ravina said: And Mata Mechesya is the place where he demanded. Abbaye, as he was weighing in Israel, from two partners, gave a coin to this one and a coin to that one, and then brought them close to each other and made a calculation.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: כְּגוֹן אֲנָא דִּמְסַגֵּינָא אַרְבַּע אַמּוֹת בְּלָא תּוֹרָה וּבְלָא תְּפִילִּין. יִצְחָק דְּבֵי רַבִּי יַנַּאי אָמַר: כׇּל שֶׁחֲבֵירָיו מִתְבַּיְּישִׁין מֵחֲמַת שְׁמוּעָתוֹ (הַיְינוּ חִילּוּל הַשֵּׁם). אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: כְּגוֹן דְּקָא אָמְרִי אִינָשֵׁי: שְׁרָא לֵיהּ מָרֵיהּ לִפְלָנְיָא.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: For example, me, if walk four cubits without Torah and without phylacteries, Yitzḥak from the school of Rabbi Yannai said: Any one’s friends are embarrassed on account of his reputation, this is a desecration of name. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: for example, when people say May his Master forgive so-and-so
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: For example, I who walk four cubits without Torah and without Tefillin. Yitzchak of the house of Rabbi Yannai said: Anyone whose friends are embarrassed because of his reputation (meaning desecration of the Name). Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: For example, when people say, "So-and-so's master permitted him."

hebrew_text: אַבָּיֵי אָמַר, כִּדְתַנְיָא: ״וְאָהַבְתָּ אֵת ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״, שֶׁיְּהֵא שֵׁם שָׁמַיִם מִתְאַהֵב עַל יָדְךָ. שֶׁיְּהֵא קוֹרֵא וְשׁוֹנֶה וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, וִיהֵא מַשָּׂאוֹ וּמַתָּנוֹ בְּנַחַת עִם הַבְּרִיּוֹת, מָה הַבְּרִיּוֹת אוֹמְרוֹת עָלָיו — אַשְׁרֵי אָבִיו שֶׁלִּמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה, אַשְׁרֵי רַבּוֹ שֶׁלִּמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה. אוֹי לָהֶם לַבְּרִיּוֹת שֶׁלֹּא לָמְדוּ תּוֹרָה, פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁלִּמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה — רְאוּ כַּמָּה נָאִים דְּרָכָיו, כַּמָּה מְתוּקָּנִים מַעֲשָׂיו. עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״וַיֹּאמֶר לִי עַבְדִּי אָתָּה יִשְׂרָאֵל אֲשֶׁר בְּךָ אֶתְפָּאָר״.
human_translation: Abaye said: As it was taught “And you shall love the Lord your God” that you shall make the name of Heaven beloved. in that he read and learn and serve Torah scholars, and he should be pleasant with people in his business transactions. What do people say about Fortunate is his father who taught him Torah, fortunate is his teacher who taught him Torah, woe to the people who have not studied Torah. So-and-so, who taught him Torah, see how pleasant are his ways, how proper are his deeds. The verse states about him “You are My servant, Israel, in whom I will be glorified”
llm_translation: Abaye said, as it was taught: "And you shall love the Lord your God," that the Name of Heaven should be beloved through you. That one should read, repeat, and serve Torah scholars, and conduct oneself with humility towards all creatures. What do creatures say about him? "Fortunate is his father who taught him Torah, fortunate is his teacher who taught him Torah." Woe to the creatures who did not learn Torah. So-and-so who learned Torah—see how pleasant are his ways, how refined are his deeds. Concerning him the Scripture says: "And He said to me, 'You are My servant, Israel, in whom I will be glorified.'"

hebrew_text: אֲבָל מִי שֶׁקּוֹרֵא וְשׁוֹנֶה וּמְשַׁמֵּשׁ תַּלְמִידֵי חֲכָמִים, וְאֵין מַשָּׂאוֹ וּמַתָּנוֹ בֶּאֱמוּנָה, וְאֵין דִּבּוּרוֹ בְּנַחַת עִם הַבְּרִיּוֹת, מָה הַבְּרִיּוֹת אוֹמְרוֹת עָלָיו — אוֹי לוֹ לִפְלוֹנִי שֶׁלָּמַד תּוֹרָה. אוֹי לוֹ לְאָבִיו שֶׁלִּמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה, אוֹי לוֹ לְרַבּוֹ שֶׁלִּמְּדוֹ תּוֹרָה. פְּלוֹנִי שֶׁלָּמַד תּוֹרָה — רְאוּ כַּמָּה מְקוּלְקָלִין מַעֲשָׂיו וְכַמָּה מְכוֹעָרִין דְּרָכָיו, וְעָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״בֶּאֱמוֹר לָהֶם עַם ה׳ אֵלֶּה וּמֵאַרְצוֹ יָצָאוּ״.
human_translation: But one who reads and learns and serves Torah scholars, but his business practices are not faithfully, and he does not speak pleasantly with other people, what do people say about him? Woe to so-and-so who studied Torah, woe to his father who taught him Torah, woe to his teacher who taught him Torah. So-and-so who studied Torah, see how destructive are his deeds, and how ugly are his ways. About him the verse states “Men said of them: These are the people of the Lord, yet they had to leave His land”
llm_translation: But one who reads, repeats, and serves Torah scholars, and does not conduct himself faithfully, and does not speak gently with people, what do people say about him? Woe to so-and-so who studied Torah. Woe to his father who taught him Torah. Woe to his teacher who taught him Torah. So-and-so who studied Torah—see how corrupted are his actions and how ugly are his ways, and concerning him the verse says: "For from My people they are estranged, sons who are not faithful."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי חָמָא (בַּר) חֲנִינָא: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁמְּבִיאָה רִפְאוּת לְעוֹלָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶרְפָּא מְשׁוּבָתָם אוֹהֲבֵם נְדָבָה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina said: Great is repentance, as it brings healing to the world, as it is stated: “I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ḥama (bar) Ḥanina: Great is repentance, for it brings healing to the world, as it is stated: "I will heal their waywardness, I will love them freely."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי חָמָא (בַּר) חֲנִינָא רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים״, דְּמֵעִיקָּרָא שׁוֹבָבִים אַתֶּם, וּכְתִיב: ״אֶרְפָּא מְשׁוּבוֹתֵיכֶם״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן מֵאַהֲבָה, כָּאן מִיִּרְאָה.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ḥanina raised a contradiction It is written “Return, you backsliding children” initially you were backsliding, But it is written: “I will heal your backsliding” not difficult: Here, out of love; there, out of fear.
llm_translation: Rabbi Ḥama (bar) Ḥanina raised a contradiction: It is written, "Return, O backsliding children," indicating that initially you are backsliding children, and it is also written, "I will heal your backslidings"! This is not difficult: here it is from love, here it is from fear.

hebrew_text: רַב יְהוּדָה רָמֵי, כְּתִיב: ״שׁוּבוּ בָּנִים שׁוֹבָבִים אֶרְפָּא מְשׁוּבוֹתֵיכֶם״, וּכְתִיב: ״(הִנֵּה) אָנֹכִי בָּעַלְתִּי בָכֶם וְלָקַחְתִּי אֶתְכֶם אֶחָד מֵעִיר וּשְׁנַיִם מִמִּשְׁפָּחָה״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן מֵאַהֲבָה אוֹ מִיִּרְאָה, כָּאן עַל יְדֵי יִסּוּרִין. אָמַר רַבִּי לֵוִי: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁמַּגַּעַת עַד כִּסֵּא הַכָּבוֹד, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוּבָה יִשְׂרָאֵל עַד ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda raised a contradiction It is written: “Return, you backsliding children I will heal your backsliding” for I am a lord to you, and I will take you one from a city, and two from a family” not difficult: Here, out of love or fear, there, through suffering, Rabbi Levi said: Great is repentance, as it reaches the heavenly throne, as it is stated: “Return, Israel, to the Lord your God”
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, as it is written: "Return, O backsliding children, I will heal your backslidings," and it is written: "(Behold) I am married to you, and I will take you one from a city and two from a family"! There is no contradiction: here it is out of love or fear, here it is through afflictions. Rabbi Levi said: Great is repentance that reaches the Throne of Glory, as it is said: "Return, O Israel, unto the Lord your God."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁדּוֹחָה אֶת לֹא תַעֲשֶׂה שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״לֵאמֹר הֵן יְשַׁלַּח אִישׁ אֶת אִשְׁתּוֹ וְהָלְכָה מֵאִתּוֹ וְהָיְתָה לְאִישׁ אַחֵר הֲיָשׁוּב אֵלֶיהָ עוֹד הֲלֹא חָנוֹף תֶּחֱנַף הָאָרֶץ הַהִיא וְאַתְּ זָנִית רֵעִים רַבִּים וְשׁוֹב אֵלַי נְאֻם ה׳״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Great is repentance, as overrides a prohibition of the Torah. As it is stated “…Saying: If a man sends away his wife and she goes from him and becomes another man’s, may he return to her again? Will not that land be greatly polluted? But you have committed adultery with many lovers; and would you yet return to Me, said the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Great is repentance for it overrides a negative commandment in the Torah, as it is stated: "If a man divorces his wife, and she goes from him and becomes another man's, will he return to her again? Would not that land be greatly defiled? But you have played the harlot with many lovers; yet return to Me," says the Lord.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה (שֶׁמְּקָרֶבֶת) אֶת הַגְּאוּלָּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבָא לְצִיּוֹן גּוֹאֵל וּלְשָׁבֵי פֶשַׁע בְּיַעֲקֹב״, מָה טַעַם ״וּבָא לְצִיּוֹן גּוֹאֵל״ — מִשּׁוּם דְּ״שָׁבֵי פֶשַׁע בְּיַעֲקֹב״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan said: Great is repentance, which hastens the redemption, as it is stated: “And a redeemer will come to Zion, and to those who repent from transgression in Jacob” What is the reason a redeemer will come to Zion? because those who repent from transgression in Jacob.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yonatan: Great is repentance (for it brings near) redemption, as it is stated: "And a redeemer shall come to Zion, and unto them that turn from transgression in Jacob." What is the reason for "And a redeemer shall come to Zion" - because of "unto them that turn from transgression in Jacob."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹת נַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ כִּשְׁגָגוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״שׁוּבָה יִשְׂרָאֵל עַד ה׳ אֱלֹהֶיךָ כִּי כָשַׁלְתָּ בַּעֲוֹנֶךָ״, הָא ״עָוֹן״ — מֵזִיד הוּא, וְקָא קָרֵי לֵיהּ מִכְשׁוֹל. אִינִי?! וְהָאָמַר רֵישׁ לָקִישׁ: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁזְּדוֹנוֹת נַעֲשׂוֹת לוֹ כִּזְכִיּוֹת, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְשׁוּב רָשָׁע מֵרִשְׁעָתוֹ וְעָשָׂה מִשְׁפָּט וּצְדָקָה עֲלֵיהֶם (חָיֹה) יִחְיֶה״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: כָּאן מֵאַהֲבָה, כָּאן מִיִּרְאָה.
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: Great is repentance, as intentional sins are counted for him as unwitting transgressions, as it is stated: “Return, Israel, to the Lord your God, for you have stumbled in your iniquity” Doesn’t “iniquity” an intentional sin? Yet calls it stumbling, Is that so? Didn’t Reish Lakish say: Great is repentance, as one’s intentional sins are counted for him as merits, as it is stated: “And when the wicked turns from his wickedness, and does that which is lawful and right, he shall live thereby” not difficult: Here, out of love, there, out of fear,
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: Great is repentance, for intentional sins are turned into inadvertent ones, as it is stated: "Return, O Israel, to the Lord your God, for you have stumbled in your iniquity." Now, "iniquity" refers to intentional sin, and it is called a stumbling block. Is it not so?! But Reish Lakish also said: Great is repentance, for intentional sins are turned into merits, as it is stated: "But if a wicked man turns away from all his sins which he has committed and observes all My statutes and practices justice and righteousness, he shall surely live; he shall not die." There is no contradiction: here it is out of love, and here it is out of fear.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי שְׁמוּאֵל בַּר נַחְמָנִי אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹנָתָן: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה שֶׁמַּאֲרֶכֶת שְׁנוֹתָיו שֶׁל אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְשׁוּב רָשָׁע מֵרִשְׁעָתוֹ (חָיוֹ) יִחְיֶה״.
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani said Rabbi Yonatan said: Great is repentance, which lengthens years of a person’s as it is stated: “When the wicked man turns from his wickedness he will preserve his life”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: Great is repentance for it prolongs the years of a person, as it is stated: "And when a wicked man turns away from his wickedness, and does what is just and right, he shall live by them."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: אָמְרִי בְּמַעְרְבָא מִשְּׁמֵיהּ דְּרַבָּה בַּר מָרִי: בֹּא וּרְאֵה שֶׁלֹּא כְּמִדַּת הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם: מִדַּת בָּשָׂר וָדָם, מַקְנִיט אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ בִּדְבָרִים — סָפֵק מִתְפַּיֵּיס הֵימֶנּוּ, סָפֵק אֵין מִתְפַּיֵּיס הֵימֶנּוּ. וְאִם תֹּאמַר מִתְפַּיֵּיס הֵימֶנּוּ — סָפֵק מִתְפַּיֵּיס בִּדְבָרִים, סָפֵק אֵין מִתְפַּיֵּיס בִּדְבָרִים,
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: They say in the West, in the name of Rabba bar Mari: Come and see that the attribute of flesh and blood is unlike the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He. flesh and blood insults his friend with words, it is uncertain whether be appeased by him or not be appeased by him. And if you say he will be appeased, it is uncertain whether he be appeased by words or not be appeased by words
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: They say in the West in the name of Rabba bar Mari: Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood, one provokes his fellow with words - sometimes he appeases him, sometimes he does not appease him. And if you say he appeases him - sometimes he appeases with words, sometimes he does not appease with words.

hebrew_text: אֲבָל הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא, אָדָם עוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה בַּסֵּתֶר — מִתְפַּיֵּיס מִמֶּנּוּ בִּדְבָרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״קְחוּ עִמָּכֶם דְּבָרִים וְשׁוּבוּ אֶל ה׳״. וְלֹא עוֹד, אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּחְזִיק לוֹ טוֹבָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וְקַח טוֹב״. וְלֹא עוֹד אֶלָּא שֶׁמַּעֲלֶה עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב כְּאִילּוּ הִקְרִיב פָּרִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּנְשַׁלְּמָה פָּרִים שְׂפָתֵינוּ״. שֶׁמָּא תֹּאמַר פָּרֵי חוֹבָה, תַּלְמוּד לוֹמַר: ״אֶרְפָּא מְשׁוּבָתָם אוֹהֲבֵם נְדָבָה״.
human_translation: But the Holy One, Blessed be He, a person commits a transgression in private, is appeased by words, as it is stated: “Take with you words and return to God” And not only that, but considers it a favor as it is stated: “Accept that which is good” And not only that, but the verse ascribes him as though he had sacrificed bulls, as it is stated: “So we will render for bulls the offering of our lips” Lest you say obligatory bulls, the verse states: “I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But the Holy One, blessed be He, when a person commits a transgression in secret - He appeases him with words, as it is said: "Take words with you and return to the Lord." And not only that, but He holds good for him, as it is said: "And take good." And not only that, but the Scripture considers it as if he offered calves, as it is said: "And let us render for bulls the offering of our lips." Lest you say it is obligatory, the Scripture teaches: "I will heal their waywardness, I will love them freely."

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, הָיָה רַבִּי מֵאִיר אוֹמֵר: גְּדוֹלָה תְּשׁוּבָה, שֶׁבִּשְׁבִיל יָחִיד שֶׁעָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה — מוֹחֲלִין לְכׇל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אֶרְפָּא מְשׁוּבָתָם אוֹהֲבֵם נְדָבָה כִּי שָׁב אַפִּי מִמֶּנּוּ״. ״מֵהֶם״ לֹא נֶאֱמַר, אֶלָּא ״מִמֶּנּוּ״.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Meir would say: Great is repentance because the entire world is forgiven on account of individual who repents, as it is stated: “I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely; for My anger has turned away from him” It does not say: From them, but “from him,”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, "Great is repentance, for because of one individual who repents, forgiveness is granted to the entire world, as it is stated: 'I will heal their waywardness, I will love them freely, for My anger has turned away from them.' It does not say 'from them,' but rather 'from him.'"

hebrew_text: הֵיכִי דָּמֵי בַּעַל תְּשׁוּבָה? אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה: כְּגוֹן שֶׁבָּאת לְיָדוֹ דְּבַר עֲבֵירָה פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה וּשְׁנִיָּה וְנִיצַּל הֵימֶנָּה. מַחְוֵי רַב יְהוּדָה: בְּאוֹתָהּ אִשָּׁה, בְּאוֹתוֹ פֶּרֶק, בְּאוֹתוֹ מָקוֹם.
human_translation: What are the circumstances has repented? Rav Yehuda said: For example, the prohibited matter came to his hand a first time and a second time, and he was saved from it, Rav Yehuda demonstrated with the same woman at the same time the same place,
llm_translation: "How are the actions of a Baal Teshuvah considered? Rav Yehudah said: For example, when a matter of transgression came into his hand once, twice, and he was saved from it. It was taught in accordance with Rav Yehudah: with that woman, in that chapter, in that place."

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב יְהוּדָה, רַב רָמֵי — כְּתִיב: ״אַשְׁרֵי נְשׂוּי פֶּשַׁע כְּסוּי חֲטָאָה״, וּכְתִיב: ״מְכַסֶּה פְשָׁעָיו לֹא יַצְלִיחַ״! לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא בְּחֵטְא מְפוּרְסָם, הָא בְּחֵטְא שֶׁאֵינוֹ מְפוּרְסָם. רַב זוּטְרָא בַּר טוֹבִיָּה אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן: כָּאן בַּעֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ, כָּאן בַּעֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַמָּקוֹם.
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said Rav raised a contradiction: It is written: “Fortunate is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is hidden” and it is written: “He who hides his transgressions shall not prosper” not difficult. Here a publicized sin; There, to a sin that is not publicized, Rav Zutra bar Toviya Rav Naḥman said: Here, to sins a person commits against another; There, to sins a person commits against God,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, Rav Ramei said — it is written: "Happy is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered," and it is written: "He who conceals his transgressions will not succeed"! There is no contradiction: here it refers to a sin that is public, there it refers to a sin that is not public. Rav Zutra bar Toviyya said in the name of Rav Nachman: here it is regarding sins between man and his fellow, there it is regarding sins between man and the Omnipresent.

hebrew_text: תַּנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: אָדָם עוֹבֵר עֲבֵירָה פַּעַם רִאשׁוֹנָה — מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ, שְׁנִיָּה — מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ, שְׁלִישִׁית — מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ, רְבִיעִית — אֵין מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כֹּה אָמַר ה׳ עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה פִּשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְעַל אַרְבָּעָה לֹא אֲשִׁיבֶנּוּ״, (וְנֶאֱמַר:) ״הֵן כׇּל אֵלֶּה יִפְעַל אֵל פַּעֲמַיִם שָׁלֹשׁ עִם גָּבֶר״.
human_translation: It was taught Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: a person commits a transgression first time, he is forgiven; a second he is forgiven; a third he is forgiven; fourth he is not forgiven, as it is stated: “Thus said the Lord: For three transgressions of Israel, but for four I will not reverse it” And it says: “All these things does God do twice or three times with a man”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: If a person commits a transgression once - we forgive him; a second time - we forgive him; a third time - we forgive him; a fourth time - we do not forgive him, as it is stated: "Thus said the Lord: For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not revoke it" (Amos 2:6), and it is also stated: "Behold, all these things does God do twice, three times, with a man" (Job 33:29).

hebrew_text: מַאי ״וְאוֹמֵר״? וְכִי תֵּימָא: הָנֵי מִילֵּי בְּצִיבּוּר, אֲבָל בְּיָחִיד — לָא, תָּא שְׁמַע: ״הֶן כׇּל אֵלֶּה יִפְעַל אֵל פַּעֲמַיִם שָׁלֹשׁ עִם גָּבֶר״. (מִכָּאן וְאֵילָךְ אֵין מוֹחֲלִין לוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״עַל שְׁלֹשָׁה פִּשְׁעֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְעַל אַרְבָּעָה לֹא אֲשִׁיבֶנּוּ״.)
human_translation: What is: And it says? Lest you say this applies to a community but not to an individual, come hear “All these things does God do twice or three times with a man,” From this onward, he is not forgiven, as it is stated: “For three transgressions of Israel, but for four I will not reverse it.”
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and he shall say"? And if you say: these matters apply in a public domain, but not in a private domain — no, come and hear: "Behold, all these things God does twice, three times, with a man." (From here and onwards, we do not forgive him, as it is stated: "For three transgressions of Israel, and for four, I will not revoke it.")

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁהִתְוַדָּה עֲלֵיהֶן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים זֶה, לֹא יִתְוַדֶּה עֲלֵיהֶן יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אַחֵר. וְאִם שָׁנָה בָּהֶן — צָרִיךְ לְהִתְוַדּוֹת יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים אַחֵר. וְאִם לֹא שָׁנָה בָּהֶן, וְחָזַר וְהִתְוַדָּה — עֲלֵיהֶן עָלָיו הַכָּתוּב אוֹמֵר: ״כְּכֶלֶב שָׁב עַל קִיאוֹ כְּסִיל שׁוֹנֶה בְּאִוַּלְתּוֹ״.
human_translation: The Sages taught transgressions that one confessed on this Yom Kippur, he should not confess them on another Yom Kippur, But if he repeated those he must confess on another Yom Kippur. And if he did not repeat them but did confess them again, about him the verse states: “As a dog that returns to its vomit, so is a fool who repeats his folly”
llm_translation: The sages taught: Regarding sins for which one has confessed on Yom Kippur of this year, one should not confess on them on a different Yom Kippur. But if one repeated them, he must confess on them on a different Yom Kippur. And if he did not repeat them, and then returned and confessed, the verse applies to him: "As a dog returns to its vomit, so a fool repeats his folly."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי אֱלִיעֶזֶר בֶּן יַעֲקֹב אוֹמֵר: כׇּל שֶׁכֵּן שֶׁהוּא מְשׁוּבָּח, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי פְשָׁעַי אֲנִי אֵדָע וְחַטָּאתִי נֶגְדִּי תָמִיד״. אֶלָּא מָה אֲנִי מְקַיֵּים ״כְּכֶלֶב שָׁב עַל קִיאוֹ וְגוֹ׳״ — כִּדְרַב הוּנָא. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא, כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ. הוּתְּרָה לוֹ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא אֵימָא: נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ כְּהֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: all the more so is he praiseworthy, as it is stated: “For I know my transgressions; and my sin is ever before me” But how do I establish the “Like a dog that returns to its vomit”? in accordance with the opinion of Rav Huna, as Rav Huna said: When a person commits a transgression and repeats it, it is permitted to him. Can it enter your mind that it is permitted to him Rather, say it becomes to him as if permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: All the more so if he is praiseworthy, as it is stated: "For I acknowledge my transgressions, and my sin is ever before me." But how do I fulfill "like a dog that returns to its vomit" — as Rav Huna said: For Rav Huna said, once a person commits a transgression and repeats it, it becomes permitted for him. Becomes permitted for him? Is it your opinion that it becomes permitted for him?! Rather say: It becomes to him as if it were permitted.

hebrew_text: וְצָרִיךְ לִפְרוֹט אֶת הַחֵטְא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָנָּא חָטָא הָעָם הַזֶּה חֲטָאָה גְדוֹלָה וַיַּעֲשׂוּ לָהֶם אֱלֹהֵי זָהָב״, דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי יְהוּדָה בֶּן בָּבָא. רַבִּי עֲקִיבָא אוֹמֵר: ״אַשְׁרֵי נְשׂוּי פֶּשַׁע כְּסוּי חֲטָאָה״. אֶלָּא מַהוּ שֶׁאָמַר מֹשֶׁה: ״וַיַּעֲשׂוּ לָהֶם אֱלֹהֵי זָהָב״? כִּדְרַבִּי יַנַּאי. דְּאָמַר רַבִּי יַנַּאי: אָמַר מֹשֶׁה לִפְנֵי הַקָּדוֹשׁ בָּרוּךְ הוּא: רִבּוֹנוֹ שֶׁל עוֹלָם! כֶּסֶף וְזָהָב שֶׁהִרְבֵּיתָ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל עַד שֶׁאָמְרוּ דַּי — גָּרַם לָהֶם שֶׁיַּעֲשׂוּ אֱלֹהֵי זָהָב.
human_translation: one must detail the sin as it is stated: Please, this people have sinned a great sin, and have made themselves a god of gold” the statement of Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava. Rabbi Akiva says “Fortunate is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is hidden” But what is which Moses said: “And have made themselves a god of gold” in accordance with of Rabbi Yannai, as Rabbi Yannai said: Moses said before the Holy One, Blessed be He: Master of the universe, silver and gold that you gave to the Jewish people in abundance, until they said: Enough, caused them to make a god of gold.
llm_translation: And it is necessary to detail the sin, as it is stated: "Please, this nation has committed a great sin, and they made for themselves a god of gold," the words of Rabbi Yehuda ben Bava. Rabbi Akiva says: "Fortunate are those who are forgiven for sin, covered for transgression." Rather, what did Moses mean when he said: "And they made for themselves a god of gold"? Like Rabbi Yannai, for Rabbi Yannai said: Moses said before the Holy One, blessed be He: Master of the Universe! The silver and gold that You have increased for Israel until they said 'enough' caused them to make a god of gold.

hebrew_text: שְׁנֵי פַּרְנָסִים טוֹבִים עָמְדוּ לָהֶם לְיִשְׂרָאֵל: מֹשֶׁה וְדָוִד. מֹשֶׁה אָמַר: יִכָּתֵב סוּרְחָנִי, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יַעַן לֹא הֶאֱמַנְתֶּם בִּי לְהַקְדִּישֵׁנִי״, דָּוִד אָמַר: אַל יִכָּתֵב סוּרְחָנִי. שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אַשְׁרֵי נְשׂוּי פֶּשַׁע כְּסוּי חֲטָאָה״.
human_translation: two good leaders arose for the Jewish people: Moses and David. Moses said: Let my disgrace be written, as it is stated: “Because you did not believe in Me, to sanctify Me” David said: Let my disgrace not be written, as it is stated: “Fortunate is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is hidden”
llm_translation: Two good leaders stood up for the Israelites: Moses and David. Moses said: "Let the rebellious be written down, as it is said: 'Because you did not believe in Me, to sanctify Me.'" David said: "Let not the rebellious be written down, as it is said: 'Happy is he whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered.'"

hebrew_text: מָשָׁל דְּמֹשֶׁה וְדָוִד לְמָה הַדָּבָר דּוֹמֶה? לִשְׁתֵּי נָשִׁים שֶׁלָּקוּ בְּבֵית דִּין, אַחַת קִלְקְלָה, וְאַחַת אָכְלָה פַּגֵּי שְׁבִיעִית. אָמְרָה לָהֶן אוֹתָהּ שֶׁאָכְלָה פַּגֵּי שְׁבִיעִית: בְּבַקָּשָׁה מִכֶּם, הוֹדִיעוּ עַל מָה הִיא לוֹקָה, שֶׁלֹּא יֹאמְרוּ: עַל מַה שֶּׁזּוֹ לוֹקָה — זוֹ לוֹקָה. הֵבִיאוּ פַּגֵּי שְׁבִיעִית וְתָלוּ בְּצַוָּארָהּ, וְהָיוּ מַכְרִיזִין לְפָנֶיהָ וְאוֹמְרִין: עַל עִסְקֵי שְׁבִיעִית הִיא לוֹקָה.
human_translation: A parable Moses and David to what this may be compared. to two women who were flogged in court One sinned and one ate unripe figs of the Sabbatical Year The woman who ate the unripe figs of the Sabbatical Year said to Please publicize for which flogged, so that will not say what that is being flogged for is what this is being flogged for. They brought unripe figs of the Sabbatical Year, and hung them around her neck, and announced before her, saying: She is receiving lashes on account of the Sabbatical Year.
llm_translation: Parable of Moses and David, what is the matter similar to? To two women who came before the court, one spoiled and one ate seventh-year produce. She said to them, the one who ate seventh-year produce: I request of you, inform on what she is being punished, so they will not say: because of what this one is being punished - this one is being punished. They brought seventh-year produce and hung it on her neck, and they would proclaim before her and say: she is being punished for dealings with seventh-year produce.

hebrew_text: מְפַרְסְמִין אֶת הַחֲנֵפִין מִפְּנֵי חִילּוּל הַשֵּׁם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״וּבְשׁוּב צַדִּיק מִצִּדְקוֹ וְעָשָׂה עָוֶל וְנָתַתִּי מִכְשׁוֹל לְפָנָיו״. תְּשׁוּבַת הַמּוּחְלָטִין מְעַכֶּבֶת הַפּוּרְעָנוּת, וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁנֶּחְתַּם עָלָיו גְּזַר דִּין שֶׁל פּוּרְעָנוּת.
human_translation: One exposes the hypocrites due to desecration of name, as it is stated: “When a righteous man turns from his righteousness and commits iniquity, I will lay a stumbling block before him” The repentance of utterly people prevents suffering And although the sentence of judgment has been signed for suffering,
llm_translation: They publicize the disgraceful individuals because of desecration of the Name, as it is stated: "And when the righteous turns from his righteousness and commits iniquity, I will put a stumbling block before him." The repentance of those who are resolved delays the punishment, even though the decree of punishment has been sealed upon them.

hebrew_text: שַׁלְוַת רְשָׁעִים סוֹפָהּ תַּקָּלָה, וְהָרְשׁוּת מְקַבֶּרֶת אֶת בְּעָלֶיהָ, עָרוֹם נִכְנָס לָהּ וְעָרוֹם יֵצֵא מִמֶּנָּה, וּלְוַאי שֶׁתְּהֵא יְצִיאָה כְּבִיאָה. רַב כִּי הֲוָה נָפֵיק לְמֵידַן דִּינָא אָמַר הָכִי: בִּצְבוּ נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִקְטָלָא נָפֵיק, וּצְבוּ בֵּיתֵיהּ לֵית הוּא עָבֵיד, וְרֵיקָן לְבֵיתֵיהּ אָזֵיל, וּלְוַאי שֶׁתְּהֵא בִּיאָה כִּיצִיאָה.
human_translation: The tranquility of the wicked is ultimately their destruction, And authority buries one who owns it. He was naked when he entered and he will be naked when he leaves it, and if only his exit would be like his entrance, When Rav would leave to judge cases, he say this Of his own will, he goes to die, and he does not fulfill the will of his household and he goes empty-handed to his household, and if only his entrance would be like his exit,
llm_translation: The tranquility of the wicked, its end is calamity, and authority buries its owners. A naked person enters it, and a naked person exits from it, and may it be that the exit is like the entrance. Rav, when he would go out to the study hall, would say thus: "With a twisted soul he went out to kill, and twisted are his household affairs, and empty he goes back to his house, and may it be that the entrance is like the exit."

hebrew_text: רָבָא כִּי הֲוָה נָפֵיק לְדִינָא אָמַר הָכִי:
human_translation: When Rava would go to judge, he would say this
llm_translation: Rava, when he would go out to the court, would say as follows:

hebrew_text: בִּצְבוּ נַפְשֵׁיהּ לִקְטָלָא נָפֵיק, וּצְבוּ בֵּיתֵיהּ לֵית הוּא עָבֵיד, וְרֵיקָן לְבֵיתֵיהּ אָזֵיל, וּלְוַאי שֶׁתְּהֵא בִּיאָה כִּיצִיאָה. וְכִי הָוֵי חָזֵי אַמְבּוּהָא אַבָּתְרֵיהּ, אָמַר: ״אִם יַעֲלֶה לַשָּׁמַיִם שִׂיאוֹ וְרֹאשׁוֹ לָעָב יַגִּיעַ. כְּגֶלֲלוֹ לָנֶצַח יֹאבֵד רוֹאָיו יֹאמְרוּ אַיּוֹ״. רַב זוּטְרָא, כִּי הֲווֹ מְכַתְּפִי לֵיהּ בְּשַׁבְּתָא דְרִיגְלָא, הֲוָה אָמַר: ״כִּי לֹא לְעוֹלָם חֹסֶן וְאִם נֵזֶר לְדוֹר וָדוֹר״.
human_translation: Of his own will, he goes to die; and he does not fulfill the will of his household, and he goes empty-handed to his household; and if only his entrance would be like his exit. And when he saw a line of people [ ambuha ] after him he said: “Though his excellency ascends to the heavens, and his head reaches to the clouds, yet he shall perish forever like his own dung; they who have seen him will say: Where is he?” When they would carry Rav Zutra on their shoulders during the Shabbat of the Festival he would recite “For power is not forever, and does the crown endure for all generations?”
llm_translation: In his desire to kill, he went out, but his household did not do so, and an empty house he entered, and would that his coming be like his going. And when they saw his father's chamber, he said: "If his height reaches the heavens, and his head touches the clouds, he will perish forever, his observers will say, 'Where is he?'" Rav Zutra, when they would support him on the Sabbath with a stool for his feet, he would say: "For wealth is not forever, and the crown is for generation and generation."

hebrew_text: ״שְׂאֵת פְּנֵי רָשָׁע לֹא טוֹב״ — לֹא טוֹב לָהֶם לָרְשָׁעִים שֶׁנּוֹשְׂאִין לָהֶם פָּנִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה. לֹא טוֹב לוֹ לְאַחְאָב שֶׁנָּשְׂאוּ לוֹ פָּנִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יַעַן כִּי נִכְנַע (אַחְאָב מִלְּפָנָי) לֹא אָבִיא הָרָעָה בְּיָמָיו״.
human_translation: “It is not good to respect the person of the wicked” it is not good for wicked people when they are respected in this world it not good for Ahab to be respected in this world, as it is stated: “Because he humbled himself before Me, I will not bring the evil in his days”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Se'et pnei rasha lo tov" — lo tov lahem lar'sha'im she'nose'in lahem panim ba'olam hazeh. Lo tov lo l'Achav she'nasu lo panim ba'olam hazeh, she'ne'emar: "Ya'an ki nichna (Achav mil'fanai) lo avi ha'ra'ah b'yamav." English translation: "Do not look favorably upon the face of a wicked person" — it is not good for the wicked who are shown favor in this world.
