It was not good for Achav when they showed him favor in this world, as it is said: "Because he has humbled himself (Achav before Me), I will not bring the evil in his days."

hebrew_text: ״לְהַטּוֹת צַדִּיק בַּמִּשְׁפָּט״ — טוֹב לָהֶם לַצַּדִּיקִים שֶׁאֵין נוֹשְׂאִין לָהֶם פָּנִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה. טוֹב לוֹ לְמֹשֶׁה שֶׁלֹּא נָשְׂאוּ לוֹ פָּנִים בָּעוֹלָם הַזֶּה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יַעַן לֹא הֶאֱמַנְתֶּם בִּי לְהַקְדִּישֵׁנִי״, הָא אִילּוּ הֶאֱמַנְתֶּם בִּי — עֲדַיִין לֹא הִגִּיעַ זְמַנָּם לִיפָּטֵר מִן הָעוֹלָם.
human_translation: to turn aside the righteous in judgment” It is good for the righteous when they are not respected in this world it good for Moses that he was not respected in this world, as it is stated: “Because you did not believe in Me, to sanctify Me” Had you believed in Me, your time still would not have come to depart the world.
llm_translation: "To pervert the judgment of the righteous" — it is good for the righteous that they are not shown favor in this world. It is good for Moses that they did not show him favor in this world, as it is stated: "Because you did not believe in Me, to sanctify Me." If you had believed in Me, their time to depart from the world would not yet have arrived.

hebrew_text: אַשְׁרֵיהֶם לַצַּדִּיקִים, לֹא דַּיָּין שֶׁהֵן זוֹכִין, אֶלָּא שֶׁמְּזַכִּין לִבְנֵיהֶם וְלִבְנֵי בְנֵיהֶם עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת. שֶׁכַּמָּה בָּנִים הָיוּ לוֹ לְאַהֲרֹן שֶׁרְאוּיִין לִישָּׂרֵף כְּנָדָב וַאֲבִיהוּא, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״הַנּוֹתָרִים״, אֶלָּא שֶׁעָמַד לָהֶם זְכוּת אֲבִיהֶם.
human_translation: Fortunate are the righteous not only do they merit but they merit for their children and their children’s children until the end of all generations; as there were several sons of Aaron who deserved to be burned like Nadav and Avihu, as it is stated: who were left” But the merit of their father protected them,
llm_translation: Fortunate are the righteous, not through wine that they merit, but through the merit they acquire for their children and their children's children until the end of all generations. For how many sons did Aaron have who were fitting to be consumed like Nadab and Abihu, as it is stated: "The survivors," but the merit of their father stood by them.

hebrew_text: אוֹי לָהֶם לָרְשָׁעִים, לֹא דַּיָּין שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִין עַצְמָן, אֶלָּא שֶׁמְּחַיְּיבִין לִבְנֵיהֶם וְלִבְנֵי בְנֵיהֶם עַד סוֹף כׇּל הַדּוֹרוֹת. הַרְבֵּה בָּנִים הָיוּ לוֹ לִכְנַעַן שֶׁרְאוּיִין לִיסָּמֵךְ כְּטָבִי עַבְדּוֹ שֶׁל רַבָּן גַּמְלִיאֵל, אֶלָּא שֶׁחוֹבַת אֲבִיהֶם גָּרְמָה לָהֶן.
human_translation: Woe to the wicked, not only do they render themselves liable, but they also render their children and children’s children liable until the end of all generations. Canaan had many children deserved to be ordained like Tavi, the servant of Rabban Gamliel, but their father’s liability caused them
llm_translation: Woe to the wicked, not for the judgment they bring upon themselves, but for the judgment they bring upon their children and their children's children until the end of all generations. There were many children for Canaan who were fitting to be supported like Tabi, the servant of Rabban Gamliel, but the obligation of their father caused it for them.

hebrew_text: כׇּל הַמְזַכֶּה אֶת הָרַבִּים — אֵין חֵטְא בָּא עַל יָדוֹ, וְכׇל הַמַּחְטִיא אֶת הָרַבִּים — כִּמְעַט אֵין מַסְפִּיקִין בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּשׁוּבָה. כׇּל הַמְזַכֶּה אֶת הָרַבִּים — אֵין חֵטְא בָּא עַל יָדוֹ, מַאי טַעְמָא? כְּדֵי שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא הוּא בְּגֵיהִנָּם וְתַלְמִידָיו בְּגַן עֵדֶן, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״כִּי לֹא תַעֲזוֹב נַפְשִׁי לִשְׁאוֹל לֹא תִתֵּן חֲסִידְךָ לִרְאוֹת שָׁחַת״. וְכׇל הַמַּחְטִיא אֶת הָרַבִּים — אֵין מַסְפִּיקִין בְּיָדוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת תְּשׁוּבָה, שֶׁלֹּא יְהֵא הוּא בְּגַן עֵדֶן וְתַלְמִידָיו בְּגֵיהִנָּם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָדָם עָשׁוּק בְּדַם נָפֶשׁ עַד בּוֹר יָנוּס אַל יִתְמְכוּ בוֹ״.
human_translation: Whoever merit for the public will not have sin come to his hand, but whoever causes the public to sin has almost no ability to repent. What is the reason whoever merit for the public will not have sin come to his hand? so that he will not be in Gehenna while his students are in the Garden of Eden, as it is stated: “For You will not abandon my soul to the nether-world; neither will You suffer Your godly one to see the pit” whoever causes the public to sin has almost no ability to repent, he will not be in the Garden of Eden while his students are in Gehenna, as it is stated: “A man who is laden with the blood of any person shall hasten his steps to the pit; none will support him”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "kol hamzakeh et harabim — ein chet ba al yado, ve'kol hamachti et harabim — k'm'at ein maspikin beyado la'asot teshuvah. Kol hamzakeh et harabim — ein chet ba al yado, mai ta'ama? Kedei shelo yehi hu beghehinam ve'talmidav began eden, shene'emar: 'ki lo ta'azov nafshi lishol lo titen chasidekha lir'ot shachat.' Ve'kol hamachti et harabim — ein maspikin beyado la'asot teshuvah, shelo yehi hu began eden ve'talmidav beghehinam, shene'emar: 'adam ashuq bedam nefesh ad bor yanuz al yitmekhu bo.'" English translation: "Anyone who merits the public — no sin comes through him, and anyone who causes the public to sin — there are almost not enough in his hand to do repentance. Anyone who merits the public — no sin comes through him, what is the reason? So that he will not be in Gehenna and his disciples in Gan Eden, as it is said: 'For You will not abandon my soul to the grave, You will not allow Your pious one to see decay.' And anyone who causes the public to sin — there are almost not enough in his hand to do repentance, so that he will not be in Gan Eden and his disciples in Gehenna, as it is said: 'A man pursued by blood, until the pit, let them not support him.'"

hebrew_text: הָאוֹמֵר אֶחֱטָא וְאָשׁוּב אֶחֱטָא וְאָשׁוּב. לְמָה לִי לְמֵימַר ״אֶחֱטָא וְאָשׁוּב, אֶחֱטָא וְאָשׁוּב״ תְּרֵי זִימְנֵי? כִּדְרַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב. דְּאָמַר רַב הוּנָא אָמַר רַב: כֵּיוָן שֶׁעָבַר אָדָם עֲבֵירָה וְשָׁנָה בָּהּ — הוּתְּרָה לוֹ. הוּתְּרָה לוֹ סָלְקָא דַּעְתָּךְ?! אֶלָּא: נַעֲשֵׂית לוֹ כְּהֶיתֵּר.
human_translation: one who says: I will sin and I will repent, I will sin and I will repent, Why do I to say twice: I will sin and I will repent, I will sin and repent? in accordance with which Rav Huna Rav said, Rav Huna said Rav said: Once a person commits a transgression and repeats it, it becomes permitted to him. Can it enter your mind that it becomes permitted to him? Rather, it becomes to him as permitted.
llm_translation: The one who says, "I will sin and repent, I will sin and repent." Why should I say, "I will sin and repent, I will sin and repent" twice? As Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: For Rav Huna said in the name of Rav: Once a person commits a transgression and repeats it, it becomes permitted for him. It becomes permitted for him? Is this your true opinion? Rather, it becomes for him as if it is permitted.

hebrew_text: אֶחֱטָא וְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר — אֵין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר. לֵימָא מַתְנִיתִין דְּלָא כְּרַבִּי. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי אוֹמֵר: עַל כׇּל עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, בֵּין עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה בֵּין לֹא עָשָׂה תְּשׁוּבָה — יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר! אֲפִילּוּ תֵּימָא רַבִּי, אַגַּב שָׁאנֵי.
human_translation: I will sin and Yom Kippur atone Yom Kippur does not atone Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi as it was taught Rabbi says: Yom Kippur atones for all transgressions of the Torah, whether one repented or did not repent. Even you say Rabbi it is different on the basis
llm_translation: Sin and Yom Kippur atones - Yom Kippur does not atone. Let us say the Mishnah that does not follow Rabbi. As it was taught: Rabbi says: For all sins in the Torah, whether one repented or did not repent - Yom Kippur atones! Even if you say Rabbi, it is different.

hebrew_text: עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַמָּקוֹם וְכוּ׳. רָמֵי לֵיהּ רַב יוֹסֵף בַּר חָבוּ לְרַבִּי אֲבָהוּ: עֲבֵירוֹת שֶׁבֵּין אָדָם לַחֲבֵירוֹ אֵין יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מְכַפֵּר? וְהָא כְּתִיב: ״אִם יֶחֱטָא אִישׁ לְאִישׁ וּפִלְלוֹ אֱלֹהִים״! מַאן אֱלֹהִים — דַּיָּינָא.
human_translation: sins committed against God Rav Yosef bar Ḥavu raised a contradiction before Rabbi Abbahu: Yom Kippur does not atone for sins committed against a fellow person, but isn’t it written: “If one man sin against another, God [ Elohim ] shall judge him [ ufilelo ]” Who is Elohim a judge [ elohim ]
llm_translation: Translating the Talmudic text into English: Transgressions between a person and the Omnipresent, etc. Rav Yosef bar Chavu raises an objection to Rabbi Abahu: Transgressions between a person and their fellow, is Yom Kippur not effective for atonement? But isn't it written: "If a man sins against another, God will judge him"? Who is the God? The Judge.

hebrew_text: אִי הָכִי, אֵימָא סֵיפָא: ״וְאִם לַה׳ יֶחֱטָא אִישׁ מִי יִתְפַּלֶּל לוֹ״! הָכִי קָאָמַר: ״אִם יֶחֱטָא אִישׁ לְאִישׁ וּפִלְלוֹ אֱלֹהִים״ — יִמְחוֹל לוֹ. ״וְאִם לַה׳ יֶחֱטָא אִישׁ מִי יִתְפַּלֶּל בַּעֲדוֹ״ — תְּשׁוּבָה וּמַעֲשִׂים טוֹבִים.
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause “But if a man sin against the Lord, who shall entreat [ yitpallel ] for him?” This is is saying: If one man sins against another, God [ Elohim ] shall forgive him [ ufilelo ]; But if a man sin against the Lord, who shall entreat [ yitpallel ] for him? Repentance and good deeds.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If so, say the latter part: "And if a man sins against the Lord, who shall pray for him?" This is what it means to say: "If a man sins against another man, and God forgives him" — he should forgive him. "And if a man sins against the Lord, who shall pray for him?" — Repentance and good deeds.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַבִּי יִצְחָק: כׇּל הַמַּקְנִיט אֶת חֲבֵירוֹ, אֲפִילּוּ בִּדְבָרִים — צָרִיךְ לְפַיְּיסוֹ, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״בְּנִי אִם עָרַבְתָּ לְרֵעֶךָ תָּקַעְתָּ לַזָּר כַּפֶּיךָ נוֹקַשְׁתָּ בְאִמְרֵי פִיךָ עֲשֵׂה זֹאת אֵפוֹא בְּנִי וְהִנָּצֵל כִּי בָאתָ בְכַף רֵעֶךָ לֵךְ הִתְרַפֵּס וּרְהַב רֵעֶיךָ״. אִם מָמוֹן יֵשׁ בְּיָדְךָ — הַתֵּר לוֹ פִּסַּת יָד, וְאִם לָאו — הַרְבֵּה עָלָיו רֵיעִים.
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: One who angers his friend, even verbally, must appease him, as it is stated: “My son, if you have become a guarantor for your neighbor, if you have struck your hands for a stranger, you are snared by the words of your mouth… Do this now, my son, and deliver yourself, seeing you have come into the hand of your neighbor. Go, humble yourself [ hitrapes ] and urge [ rehav ] your neighbor” If you have money open the palm of [ hater pisat ] hand to and if not, increase [ harbe ] friends for him,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: Anyone who provokes his fellow, even with words, must appease him, as it is stated: "My son, if you have become surety for your friend, if you have struck your palm with a stranger, you have been snared by the words of your mouth, caught by the words of your mouth. Do this now, my son, and save yourself, for you have come into the palm of your friend: Go, humble yourself, and urge your plea with your friend." If you have money in your hand, release him with a coin, and if not, gather many friends against him.

hebrew_text: (וְאָמַר) רַב חִסְדָּא: וְצָרִיךְ לְפַיְּיסוֹ בְּשָׁלֹשׁ שׁוּרוֹת שֶׁל שְׁלֹשָׁה בְּנֵי אָדָם, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״יָשׁוֹר עַל אֲנָשִׁים וַיֹּאמֶר חָטָאתִי וְיָשָׁר הֶעֱוֵיתִי וְלֹא שָׁוָה לִי״.
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: And one must appease the with three rows of three people, as it is stated: “He comes [ yashor ] before men, and says: I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not”
llm_translation: (And) said Rav Ḥisdah: And (one) needs to appease him with three lines of three people, as it is stated: "He will pray to God, and He will be favorable to him, and he will see His face with joy, for He will render to man His righteousness."

hebrew_text: (וְאָמַר) רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הַמְבַקֵּשׁ מָטוּ מֵחֲבֵירוֹ, אַל יְבַקֵּשׁ מִמֶּנּוּ יוֹתֵר מִשָּׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: ״אָנָּא שָׂא נָא וְעַתָּה שָׂא נָא״. וְאִם מֵת — מֵבִיא עֲשָׂרָה בְּנֵי אָדָם וּמַעֲמִידָן עַל קִבְרוֹ, וְאוֹמֵר: חָטָאתִי לַה׳ אֱלֹהֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל וְלִפְלוֹנִי שֶׁחָבַלְתִּי בּוֹ.
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina said: Anyone who asks forgiveness of his friend should not ask more than three times, as it is stated: “Please, please forgive And now, please And if dies one brings ten people, and stands them at the grave and says I have sinned against the Lord, the God of Israel, and against so-and-so whom I wounded.
llm_translation: (And) said Rabbi Yosei bar Chanina: Anyone who requests a gift from his fellow, should not request from him more than three times, as it is stated: "Please take, and now take." And if he dies - one brings ten men and stands them on his grave, and says: I have sinned to the Lord, God of Israel, and to so-and-so, whom I have wronged.

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יִרְמְיָה הֲוָה לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא לְרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּהֲדֵיהּ, אֲזַל אִיתִּיב אַדַּשָּׁא דְּרַבִּי אַבָּא בַּהֲדֵי דְּשָׁדְיָא אַמְּתֵיהּ מַיָּא, מְטָא זַרְזִיפֵי דְמַיָּא אַרֵישָׁא. אָמַר: עֲשָׂאוּנִי כְּאַשְׁפָּה. קְרָא אַנַּפְשֵׁיהּ: ״מֵאַשְׁפּוֹת יָרִים אֶבְיוֹן״. שְׁמַע רַבִּי אַבָּא וּנְפֵיק לְאַפֵּיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: הַשְׁתָּא צְרִיכְנָא לְמִיפַּק אַדַּעְתָּךְ, דִּכְתִיב: ״לֵךְ הִתְרַפֵּס וּרְהַב רֵעֶיךָ״.
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya Rabbi Abba, have a complaint against him. went and sat at the threshold Rabbi Abba’s When maid poured out the water the stream of water landed on head. He said They have made me into a trash heap, He recited about himself: “Who lifts up the needy out of the trash heap” Rabbi Abba heard and went out to greet him. said to him: Now I must go out to appease you as it is written: “Go, humble yourself [ hitrapes ] and urge your neighbor”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya had a matter to Rabbi Abba in his hand, he went and raised an objection before Rabbi Abba: "The fire of Rabbi Abba's field extinguishes water, the drops of water come first." He said: "They made me like dust." He quoted: "From the ashes he raises the poor." Rabbi Abba heard and went out to meet him, he said to him: "Now you need to come out with your knowledge, as it is written: 'Go, prostrate yourself and trample your enemies.'"

hebrew_text: רַבִּי זֵירָא כִּי הֲוָה לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא בַּהֲדֵי אִינִישׁ, הֲוָה חָלֵיף וְתָנֵי לְקַמֵּיהּ וּמַמְצֵי לֵיהּ, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּנֵיתֵי וְנִיפּוֹק לֵיהּ מִדַּעְתֵּיהּ.
human_translation: when Rabbi Zeira had a complaint against a person he would back and forth before him and present himself, so that could come and appease him.
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira, when he had a matter in the hands of a person, he would change and teach it before him and find favor in his eyes, so that he would judge favorably and withdraw from his opinion.

hebrew_text: רַב הֲוָה לֵיהּ מִילְּתָא בַּהֲדֵי הָהוּא טַבָּחָא, לָא אֲתָא לְקַמֵּיהּ. בְּמַעֲלֵי יוֹמָא דְכִפּוּרֵי אֲמַר אִיהוּ: אֵיזִיל אֲנָא לְפַיּוֹסֵי לֵיהּ. פְּגַע בֵּיהּ רַב הוּנָא, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְהֵיכָא קָא אָזֵיל מָר, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: לְפַיּוֹסֵי לִפְלָנְיָא. אָמַר: אָזֵיל אַבָּא לְמִיקְטַל נַפְשָׁא. אֲזַל וְקָם עִילָּוֵיהּ. הֲוָה יָתֵיב וְקָא פָלֵי רֵישָׁא, דַּלִּי עֵינֵיהּ וְחַזְיֵיהּ, אֲמַר לֵיהּ: אַבָּא אַתְּ? זִיל, לֵית לִי מִילְּתָא בַּהֲדָךְ. בַּהֲדֵי דְּקָא פָלֵי רֵישָׁא, אִישְׁתְּמִיט גַּרְמָא וּמַחְיֵיהּ בְּקוֹעֵיהּ וְקַטְלֵיהּ.
human_translation: Rav had a complaint against a certain butcher The butcher did not come before him On Yom Kippur eve, said: I will go appease him. He met Rav Huna, said to him: Where is my Master going? He said to him: to appease so-and-so. said: Abba is going to kill a person, went and stood by him. sitting and splitting the head raised his eyes and saw him. He said Are you Abba? Go, I have nothing to you. While he was splitting the head, one of the bones flew out and struck him in the throat and killed him,
llm_translation: Rav had a matter with that butcher, he did not come before him. On the eve of Yom Kippur, he said: I will go to appease him. Rav Huna met him, and said to him: Where are you going, sir? He said to him: To appease so-and-so. He said: I am going to kill myself. He went and stood in his doorway. He was sitting and nodding his head, his eyes were drooping, and he saw him, he said to him: Are you sir? Go, I have no matter with you. While he was nodding his head, he let out a groan and killed him with a knife and killed him.

hebrew_text: רַב הֲוָה פָּסֵיק סִידְרָא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַבִּי. עֲיַיל
human_translation: Rav was reciting the portion before Rabbi
llm_translation: Rav was expounding a discourse before Rabbi. He said:

hebrew_text: אֲתָא רַבִּי חִיָּיא — הֲדַר לְרֵישָׁא. עֲיַיל בַּר קַפָּרָא — הֲדַר לְרֵישָׁא. אֲתָא רַבִּי שִׁמְעוֹן בְּרַבִּי — הֲדַר לְרֵישָׁא. אֲתָא רַבִּי חֲנִינָא (בַּר) חָמָא, אָמַר: כּוּלֵּי הַאי נֶהְדַּר וְנֵיזִיל? לָא הֲדַר. אִיקְּפִיד רַבִּי חֲנִינָא, אֲזַל רַב לְגַבֵּיהּ תְּלֵיסַר מַעֲלֵי יוֹמֵי דְּכִפּוּרֵי וְלָא אִיפַּיַּיס.
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya, came in, returned to the beginning bar Kappara came in, returned to the beginning Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi came in, he returned to the beginning Rabbi Ḥanina bar Ḥama came in, said Shall I go back so many times? He did not return Rabbi Ḥanina was offended Rav went before on Yom Kippur eve thirteen but he would not be appeased.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya came - returned to the beginning. Bar Kappara came - returned to the beginning. Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi, came - returned to the beginning. Rabbi Chanina, son of Chama, said: Should we honor all these and go out? He did not return. Rabbi Chanina was meticulous, Rabbi went to meet him thirteen days before Yom Kippur, and did not appease him.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר חֲנִינָא: כׇּל הַמְבַקֵּשׁ מָטוּ מֵחֲבֵירוֹ אַל יְבַקֵּשׁ מִמֶּנּוּ יוֹתֵר מִשָּׁלֹשׁ פְּעָמִים! רַב שָׁאנֵי. וְרַבִּי חֲנִינָא, הֵיכִי עָבֵיד הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רָבָא: כׇּל הַמַּעֲבִיר עַל מִדּוֹתָיו — מַעֲבִירִין לוֹ עַל כׇּל פְּשָׁעָיו!
human_translation: How could act this way? Didn’t Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina say: Anyone who requests forgiveness from another should not ask more than three times? Rav is different, And how could Rabbi Ḥanina act this way Didn’t Rava say: anyone who suppresses his honor pardons all his sins?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And how does he do this? And Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina said: Anyone who asks for a gift from his fellow, should not ask from him more than three times! Rav Sha'anei. And Rabbi Hanina, how does he do this? And Rava said: Anyone who overlooks his own faults, they overlook all his sins!

hebrew_text: אֶלָּא: רַבִּי חֲנִינָא חֶלְמָא חָזֵי לֵיהּ לְרַב דְּזַקְפוּהוּ בְּדִיקְלָא, וּגְמִירִי דְּכֹל דְּזַקְפוּהוּ בְּדִיקְלָא — רֵישָׁא הָוֵי. אָמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ בָּעֵי לְמֶעְבַּד רְשׁוּתָא וְלָא אִיפַּיַּיס, כִּי הֵיכִי דְּלֵיזִיל וְלִגְמַר אוֹרָיְיתָא בְּבָבֶל.
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Ḥanina saw in a dream Rav was being hung on a palm tree, and learned anyone which he was being hung on a palm tree will become the head He said: Learn from this that  he must eventually become the head I will not be appeased, so that he will have to go and study Torah in Babylonia.
llm_translation: Rather: Rabbi Chanina saw a dream for Rav that they were climbing a palm tree, and it is learned that anyone who climbs a palm tree - the beginning is difficult. He said: Learn from this that one should seek permission and not be brazen, so that he may go and complete the Torah in Babylonia.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: מִצְוַת וִידּוּי עֶרֶב יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים עִם חֲשֵׁכָה. אֲבָל אָמְרוּ חֲכָמִים: יִתְוַדֶּה קוֹדֶם שֶׁיֹּאכַל וְיִשְׁתֶּה, שֶׁמָּא תִּטָּרֵף דַּעְתּוֹ בִּסְעוּדָה. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִתְוַדָּה קוֹדֶם שֶׁאָכַל וְשָׁתָה — מִתְוַדֶּה לְאַחַר שֶׁיֹּאכַל וְיִשְׁתֶּה, שֶׁמָּא אֵירַע דְּבַר קַלְקָלָה בַּסְּעוּדָה. וְאַף עַל פִּי שֶׁהִתְוַדָּה עַרְבִית — יִתְוַדֶּה שַׁחֲרִית. שַׁחֲרִית — יִתְוַדֶּה בְּמוּסָף, בְּמוּסָף — יִתְוַדֶּה בְּמִנְחָה, בְּמִנְחָה — יִתְוַדֶּה בִּנְעִילָה.
human_translation: The Sages taught: mitzva of confession Yom Kippur eve when darkness But the Sages said: confess before he eats and drinks lest he become confused at the meal, And although one confessed before he ate and drank, he confesses after he eats and drinks, perhaps he committed some sin during the meal And although one confessed the evening prayer he confess the morning prayer. morning prayer, he confess during additional prayer. during additional prayer, he confess during afternoon prayer; during afternoon prayer, he confess during closing prayer [ ne’ila ].
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: The obligation of confession is on the eve of Yom Kippur with darkness. However, the Sages said: One should confess before eating and drinking, lest his mind be preoccupied during the meal. And even though he confessed before eating and drinking, he should confess again after eating and drinking, lest something disruptive occur during the meal. And even though he confessed in the evening, he should confess in the morning. In the morning, he should confess during the additional prayer service, during the additional prayer service, he should confess during the afternoon prayer service, during the afternoon prayer service, he should confess during the closing prayer service.

hebrew_text: וְהֵיכָן אוֹמְרוֹ? יָחִיד אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ, וּשְׁלִיחַ צִבּוּר אוֹמְרוֹ בָּאֶמְצַע. מַאי אָמַר? אָמַר רַב: ״אַתָּה יוֹדֵעַ רָזֵי עוֹלָם״. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״מִמַּעֲמַקֵּי הַלֵּב״. וְלֵוִי אָמַר: ״וּבְתוֹרָתְךָ כָּתוּב לֵאמֹר״. רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן אָמַר: ״רִבּוֹן הָעוֹלָמִים״.
human_translation: And where does one say An individual after his prayer, and the prayer leader says it in the middle What does one say; Rav said: You know the mysteries of the universe, And Shmuel said From the depths of the heart. And Levi said And in your Torah it is written, saying, Rabbi Yoḥanan said Master of the Universe.
llm_translation: And where do they say it? An individual after his prayer, and the leader of the congregation says it in the middle. What did he say? Rav said: "You know the secrets of the world." And Shmuel said: "From the depths of the heart." And Levi said: "And in Your Torah it is written saying." Rabbi Yochanan said: "Master of the worlds."

hebrew_text: רַבִּי יְהוּדָה אָמַר: ״כִּי עֲוֹנוֹתֵינוּ רַבּוּ מִלִּמְנוֹת וְחַטֹּאתֵינוּ עָצְמוּ מִסַּפֵּר״. רַב הַמְנוּנָא אָמַר: ״אֱלֹהַי, עַד שֶׁלֹּא נוֹצַרְתִּי אֵינִי כְּדַאי. עַכְשָׁיו שֶׁנּוֹצַרְתִּי, כְּאִילּוּ לֹא נוֹצַרְתִּי. עָפָר אֲנִי בְּחַיַּי, קַל וָחוֹמֶר בְּמִיתָתִי. הֲרֵי אֲנִי לְפָנֶיךָ כִּכְלִי מָלֵא בּוּשָׁה וּכְלִימָּה. יְהִי רָצוֹן מִלְּפָנֶיךָ שֶׁלֹּא אֶחֱטָא, וּמַה שֶׁחָטָאתִי — מְרוֹק בְּרַחֲמֶיךָ, אֲבָל לֹא עַל יְדֵי יִסּוּרִין״. וְהַיְינוּ וִידּוּיָא דְרָבָא כּוּלַּהּ שַׁתָּא, וּדְרַב הַמְנוּנָא זוּטָא בְּיוֹמָא דְכִפּוּרֵי.
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said For our iniquities are too many to count and our sins are too great to number. Rav Hamnuna said: My God, before I was formed I was unworthy. Now that I have been formed, it is as if I had not been formed. I am dust while alive, how much more so when I am dead. See, I am before You like a vessel filled with shame and disgrace. May it be Your will that I may sin no more, and as for I have committed before You, erase in Your compassion, but not by suffering. This is the confession that Rava all year and that Rav Hamnuna Zuta on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: "For our sins are increased beyond count, and our iniquities have grown beyond measure." Rav Hamnuna said: "My God, before I was created, I was not worthy. Now that I am created, it is as if I was not created. I am dust in my life, all the more so in my death. Behold, I am before You like a vessel filled with shame and embarrassment. May it be Your will that I do not sin, and for what I have sinned - may it be rinsed away by Your mercy, but not through afflictions." And this is the entirety of Rava's confession throughout the entire year, and of Rav Hamnuna's confession on the Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: אָמַר מָר זוּטְרָא: לָא אֲמַרַן, אֶלָּא דְּלָא אָמַר: ״אֲבָל אֲנַחְנוּ חָטָאנוּ״, אֲבָל אָמַר: ״אֲבָל אֲנַחְנוּ חָטָאנוּ״ — תּוּ לָא צְרִיךְ. דְּאָמַר בַּר הַמְדּוּדֵי: הֲוָה קָאֵימְנָא קַמֵּיהּ דִּשְׁמוּאֵל, וַהֲוָה יָתֵיב, וְכִי מְטָא שְׁלִיחָא דְצִבּוּרָא וְאָמַר: ״אֲבָל אֲנַחְנוּ חָטָאנוּ״, קָם מֵיקָם, אֲמַר: שְׁמַע מִינַּהּ עִיקַּר וִידּוּי הַאי הוּא.
human_translation: Mar Zutra said: We said only when he did not say But we have sinned. However, he said But we have sinned, he need not anything further As bar Hamdudei said: I was standing before Shmuel and he was sitting; and when the prayer leader reached But we have sinned, stood. said: Learn from here that this is the main the confession,
llm_translation: Master Zutra said: We did not say, but rather that he did not say, "But we have sinned." But if he were to say, "But we have sinned," it is not necessary. For Bar Hamdudei said: I was standing before Samuel, and he was sitting, and when the messenger of the congregation came and said, "But we have sinned," he stood up from his place and said: Learn from this that confession is essential.

hebrew_text: תְּנַן הָתָם: בִּשְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים בַּשָּׁנָה כֹּהֲנִים נוֹשְׂאִין אֶת כַּפֵּיהֶן אַרְבָּעָה פְּעָמִים בַּיּוֹם: בְּשַׁחֲרִית, בְּמוּסָף, בְּמִנְחָה, וּבִנְעִילַת שְׁעָרִים. וְאֵלּוּ הֵן שְׁלֹשָׁה פְּרָקִים: בְּתַעֲנִיּוֹת, וּבְמַעֲמָדוֹת, וּבְיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: We learned there, At three times in the year, priests raise their hands four times in day: In morning prayer, in additional prayer, in afternoon prayer, and at closing [ ne’ila ] of the gates. And these are three times During fasts and during watches [ ma’amadot ], and on Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: We learned there: In three chapters in the year, the priests lift their hands four times a day: in the morning, in the additional offering, in the afternoon offering, and in the closing of the gates. And these are the three chapters: in fasts, in standing, and on the Day of Atonement.

hebrew_text: מַאי נְעִילַת שְׁעָרִים? רַב אָמַר: צְלוֹתָא יַתִּירְתָּא. וּשְׁמוּאֵל אָמַר: ״מָה אָנוּ מֶה חַיֵּינוּ״. מֵיתִיבִי: אוֹר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, בְּשַׁחֲרִית מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, בְּמוּסָף מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, בְּמִנְחָה מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, בִּנְעִילָה מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה!
human_translation: What is the closing of the gates, Rav said: an added prayer And Shmuel said: What are we, what are our lives? raises an objection the night of Yom Kippur, one prays seven and confesses; during morning prayer, one prays seven and confesses; during additional prayer, one prays seven and confesses; during afternoon prayer, one prays seven and confesses; during ne’ila prayer, one prays seven and confesses.
llm_translation: What is the locking of gates? Rav said: Extra prayer. And Shmuel said: "What are we, what is our life." It was taught: On Yom Kippur eve, one prays seven and confesses, in the morning one prays seven and confesses, in the additional service one prays seven and confesses, in the afternoon one prays seven and confesses, in the closing prayer one prays seven and confesses!

hebrew_text: תַּנָּאֵי הִיא, דְּתַנְיָא: יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים עִם חֲשֵׁיכָה מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, וְחוֹתֵם בְּוִידּוּי — דִּבְרֵי רַבִּי מֵאִיר. וַחֲכָמִים אוֹמְרִים: מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע, וְאִם רָצָה לַחְתּוֹם בְּוִידּוּי — חוֹתֵם. תְּיוּבְתָּא דִשְׁמוּאֵל תְּיוּבְתָּא.
human_translation: This is tanna’im as it was taught Yom Kippur, as darkness one prays seven and confesses and ends with the confession; the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: He prays seven and if he wishes to end with a confession, he ends this is a refutation of Shmuel, a refutation.
llm_translation: It is taught in a Baraita: On Yom Kippur with darkness one prays seven and confesses, and seals with confession - the words of Rabbi Meir. And the Sages say: one prays seven, and if he wishes to seal with confession - he seals. The excellence of Shmuel is excellence.

hebrew_text: עוּלָּא בַּר רַב נְחֵית קַמֵּיהּ דְּרָבָא. פְּתַח בְּ״אַתָּה בְּחַרְתָּנוּ״ וְסַיֵּים בְּ״מָה אָנוּ מֶה חַיֵּינוּ״, וְשַׁבְּחֵיהּ. רַב הוּנָא בְּרֵיהּ דְּרַב נָתָן אָמַר: וְיָחִיד אוֹמְרָהּ אַחַר תְּפִלָּתוֹ.
human_translation: Ulla bar Rav went down before Rava, He opened with: You have chosen us, and he concluded with: What are we, what are our lives? And praised him. Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said: And an individual says it after his prayer.
llm_translation: Ulla son of Rav Nachit stood before Rava. He began with "You have chosen us" and concluded with "What are we, what are our lives," and praised Him. Rav Huna son of Rav Natan said: And an individual says it after his prayer.

hebrew_text: אָמַר רַב: תְּפִלַּת נְעִילָה פּוֹטֶרֶת אֶת שֶׁל עַרְבִית. רַב לְטַעְמֵיהּ, דַּאֲמַר: צְלוֹתָא יַתִּירָה הִיא, וְכֵיוָן דְּצַלִּי לֵיהּ — תּוּ לָא צְרִיךְ.
human_translation: Rav said: The ne’ila prayer exempts the evening prayer. Rav to his reasoning as he said: It is an added prayer, and since he has prayed it he needs no further
llm_translation: Rav said: The prayer of Ne'ilah exempts the evening prayer. Rav according to his reasoning, for he said: It is a concluding prayer, and once one has concluded it, there is no longer a need.

hebrew_text: וּמִי אָמַר רַב הָכִי? וְהָאָמַר רַב: הֲלָכָה כְּדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר תְּפִלַּת עַרְבִית רְשׁוּת! לְדִבְרֵי הָאוֹמֵר חוֹבָה קָאָמַר.
human_translation: And did Rav say this? Didn’t Rav say: halakha is in accordance with the statement of the one who says evening prayer is optional? He said this in accordance with the statement of the one who says is mandatory.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And who said so, Rav Haki? But didn't Rav say: The halakha follows the opinion of one who says the evening prayer is optional! He meant to say the obligation."

hebrew_text: מֵיתִיבִי: אוֹר יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, שַׁחֲרִית שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, מוּסָף שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, בִּנְעִילָה מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע וּמִתְוַדֶּה, עַרְבִית מִתְפַּלֵּל שֶׁבַע מֵעֵין שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה. רַבִּי חֲנִינָא בֶּן גַּמְלִיאֵל מִשּׁוּם אֲבוֹתָיו: מִתְפַּלֵּל שְׁמוֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה שְׁלֵימוֹת,
human_translation: raises an objection evening Yom Kippur, one prays seven and confesses; morning prayer, seven and confesses; additional prayer, seven and confesses; during ne’ila one prays seven and confesses; the evening prayer, seven in abridged eighteen Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel in the name of his ancestors: One prays full eighteen
llm_translation: Challenger: The light of Yom Kippur, one prays seven and confesses, morning seven and confesses, additional offering seven and confesses, during the closing of the gates one prays seven and confesses, evening one prays seven, totaling eighteen. Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel in the name of his ancestors: one prays eighteen complete prayers.

hebrew_text: מִפְּנֵי שֶׁצָּרִיךְ לוֹמַר הַבְדָּלָה בְּחוֹנֵן הַדָּעַת! תַּנָּאֵי הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא: כׇּל חַיָּיבֵי טְבִילוֹת — טוֹבְלִין כְּדַרְכָּן בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. נִדָּה וְיוֹלֶדֶת — טוֹבְלוֹת כְּדַרְכָּן בְּלֵילֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים.
human_translation: because he must recite havdala in Who graciously grants knowledge, It is tanna’im , as it was taught Anyone who requires immersion immerses in his manner on Yom Kippur, washing. A menstruating woman and a new mother, immerse in their manner on the night of Yom Kippur.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Because it is necessary to say a distinction in the understanding! It is taught in a Baraita: As it was taught: All those obligated in immersion — they immerse in their usual manner on Yom Kippur. A menstruating woman and a woman who has given birth — they immerse in their usual manner on the nights of Yom Kippur."

hebrew_text: בַּעַל קֶרִי — טוֹבֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ עַד הַמִּנְחָה. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ.
human_translation: One who had a seminal emission immerse at any point until the afternoon prayer, Rabbi Yosei says: at any point in the day.
llm_translation: Ba'al keri - tovel veholech ad hamincha. Rabbi Yosei omer: kol hayom kulo.

hebrew_text: וּרְמִינְהוּ: הַזָּב וְהַזָּבָה הַמְצוֹרָע וְהַמְצוֹרַעַת וּבוֹעֵל נִדָּה וּטְמֵא מֵת — טוֹבְלִין כְּדַרְכָּן בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים, נִדָּה וְיוֹלֶדֶת — טוֹבְלוֹת כְּדַרְכָּן בְּלֵילֵי יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים. בַּעַל קֶרִי — טוֹבֵל וְהוֹלֵךְ כׇּל הַיּוֹם כּוּלּוֹ, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: מִן הַמִּנְחָה וּלְמַעְלָה אֵין יָכוֹל לִטְבּוֹל.
human_translation: raises a contradiction the zav , and the zava , the male and female leper, and one who had relations with a menstruating woman, and one who is ritually impure a corpse, immerse in their manner on Yom Kippur. A menstruating woman and a woman after childbirth immerse in their manner on the night of Yom Kippur. One who had a seminal emission immerses at any point in the day. Rabbi Yosei says: From the afternoon prayer onward he is not able to immerse.
llm_translation: And they asked: A man with a discharge, and a woman with a discharge, a leper and a female leper, one who had relations with a menstruating woman, and one who is impure due to contact with a dead body - they immerse as usual on Yom Kippur. A menstruating woman and a woman who gave birth - they immerse as usual on the eve of Yom Kippur. A man with a seminal emission - he immerses and may go about his entire day. Rabbi Yosei says: From the time of the afternoon offering and onwards, he cannot immerse.

hebrew_text: לָא קַשְׁיָא: הָא דְּצַלִּי תְּפִלַּת נְעִילָה, הָא דְּלָא צַלִּי.
human_translation: not difficult. This where he prayed the ne’ila prayer That where he had not prayed
llm_translation: Not difficult: this one who prayed the silent prayer, this one who did not pray.

hebrew_text: אִי דְּצַלִּי, מַאי טַעְמַיְיהוּ דְּרַבָּנַן? קָא סָבְרִי רַבָּנַן: טְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ מִצְוָה.
human_translation: If he had already prayed what is the reasoning of the Rabbis, The Rabbis hold that immersion at its proper time a mitzva,
llm_translation: If one's intention is to shade, what is the reason of the Rabbis? The Rabbis hold: Immersion at its proper time is a commandment.

hebrew_text: מִכְּלָל דְּרַבִּי יוֹסֵי סָבַר לָאו מִצְוָה. וְהָתַנְיָא: הֲרֵי שֶׁהָיָה שֵׁם כָּתוּב עַל בְּשָׂרוֹ — הֲרֵי זֶה לֹא יִרְחַץ וְלֹא יָסוּךְ וְלֹא יַעֲמוֹד בִּמְקוֹם הַטִּנּוֹפֶת. נִזְדַּמְּנָה לוֹ טְבִילַת מִצְוָה — כּוֹרֵךְ עָלָיו גֶּמִי וְיוֹרֵד וְטוֹבֵל. רַבִּי יוֹסֵי אוֹמֵר: יוֹרֵד וְטוֹבֵל כְּדַרְכּוֹ וּבִלְבַד שֶׁלֹּא יְשַׁפְשֵׁף.
human_translation: By inference, Rabbi Yosei holds not a mitzva. But wasn’t it taught If name is written flesh, he not wash and he not smear and he not stand in a filthy place If his time came for an immersion a mitzva, wraps a reed around it and descends and immerses. Rabbi Yosei says: He descends and immerses in his manner provided he does not rub
llm_translation: From the principle of Rabbi Yosei, he holds it is not a commandment. And it was taught: If one had a name written on his flesh - this one shall not wash, nor anoint, nor stand in a place of disgrace. If an opportunity for a mitzvah immersion presents itself to him - he wraps a cloth around himself, descends, and immerses. Rabbi Yosei says: He descends and immerses in his usual manner, only he should not rub.

hebrew_text: וְקַיְימָא לַן דְּבִטְבִילָה בִּזְמַנָּהּ, מִצְוָה פְּלִיגִי.
human_translation: And we maintain they disagree as to immersion at its time is a mitzva.
llm_translation: And it is established for us that regarding immersion in its proper time, there is a dispute about the commandment.

hebrew_text: הָהִיא רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה הִיא. דְּתַנְיָא, רַבִּי יוֹסֵי בַּר יְהוּדָה אוֹמֵר: דַּיָּהּ לִטְבִילָה שֶׁתְּהֵא בָּאַחֲרוֹנָה.
human_translation: This is Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, as it was taught Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: It is sufficient for the immersion to be at the end.
llm_translation: That one, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda, she is. As it was taught: Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: It is sufficient for immersion to be in the last.

hebrew_text: תָּנוּ רַבָּנַן: הָרוֹאֶה קֶרִי בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — יוֹרֵד וְטוֹבֵל, וְלָעֶרֶב יְשַׁפְשֵׁף. לְעֶרֶב? מַאי דַּהֲוָה הֲוָה? אֶלָּא אֵימָא: מִבָּעֶרֶב יְשַׁפְשֵׁף. (קָא סָבַר מִצְוָה לְשַׁפְשֵׁף.)
human_translation: The Sages taught: One who sees semen on Yom Kippur descends and immerses. And in the evening, he should rub in the evening? What was, was. Rather, say he should rub from the evening This holds it is a mitzva to rub.
llm_translation: The rabbis taught: One who experiences a seminal emission on Yom Kippur - he should descend and immerse, and towards evening he should scrub. Towards evening? What is the reason? Rather say: From the evening he should scrub. (He holds that it is a mitzvah to scrub.)

hebrew_text: תָּנֵי תַּנָּא קַמֵּיהּ דְּרַב נַחְמָן: הָרוֹאֶה קֶרִי בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — עֲוֹנוֹתָיו מְחוּלִין לוֹ. וְהָתַנְיָא: עֲוֹנוֹתָיו סְדוּרִין! מַאי סְדוּרִין — סְדוּרִין לִימָּחֵל.
human_translation: A tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: one who sees semen on Yom Kippur, his sins are forgiven. But wasn’t it taught His sins are arranged What arranged? They are arranged forgiven.
llm_translation: The Tanna taught before Rav Nachman: One who experiences a seminal emission on Yom Kippur - his sins are forgiven for him. And it was taught: His sins are arranged! What is meant by "arranged" - arranged to be forgiven.

hebrew_text: תָּנָא דְּבֵי רַבִּי יִשְׁמָעֵאל: הָרוֹאֶה קֶרִי בְּיוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים — יִדְאַג כׇּל הַשָּׁנָה כּוּלָּהּ, וְאִם עָלְתָה לוֹ שָׁנָה — מוּבְטָח לוֹ שֶׁהוּא בֶּן הָעוֹלָם הַבָּא. אָמַר רַב נַחְמָן בַּר יִצְחָק: תֵּדַע, שֶׁכׇּל הָעוֹלָם כּוּלּוֹ רָעֵב וְהוּא שָׂבֵעַ. כִּי אֲתָא רַב דִּימִי אָמַר: מַפֵּישׁ חַיֵּי סָגֵי וּמַסְגֵּי.
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: One who sees semen on Yom Kippur should worry the whole year But if he survives the year, he can be assured a share the World-to-Come. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Know as the whole world is hungry and he is satiated When Rav Dimi came from Eretz Yisrael one will live a long life, grow, and raise others.
llm_translation: Tana of the school of Rabbi Yishmael: One who experiences a seminal emission on Yom Kippur - he should worry the entire year, and if a year has passed for him - he can be assured that he is a child of the World to Come. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Know that the entire world is hungry and he is satiated. When Rav Dimi came, he said: He distributes sustenance to the ends and the middle.

hebrew_text: הֲדַרַן עֲלָךְ יוֹם הַכִּפּוּרִים וּסְלִיקָא לַהּ מַסֶּכֶת יוֹמָא
llm_translation: We will see you on Yom Kippur, and we will go up to her, tractate Yoma.
